reviews.review:
very nice cathedral. it is very big and beautiful, I really enjoyed the visit
it offers nice views of the city because it is on a hill

Awesome in the original sense of the word..... Domineering architecture to the point of getting a horrible feeling of doom when entering. I cannot imagine the horrors of building it or what has happened there since. Not my cup of tea but if you love stained glass and gargoyles......

Awesome inside. One of the best places in the city. Coupled with the Palace, the cathedral will draw your breath away. Early visits will avoid most of the crowds, but being very popular, there will be a lot of people there.

this church ooozes history. take the subway from Wenceslas Square under the river and a short walk to St Vitus Cathedral - this really is the heart of Prague. a wonderful building with fascinating history - I will not spoil it for you, as you really need to find it yourself - look out for the solid silver coffin !and when you finish, the walk is all downhill back to the old town and Charles Bridge. !
Beautiful. We enjoyed this cathedral very much. It's architecture is unique. We skipped the tour and just wandered on our own.
Must See!!!. If you appreciate architecture,religion,art,and just being blown away by massive and unbelievable buildings with a rich history, you must go.

The large church in the Prague Castle. The cathedral is impressive. Note the sarcophagus of the Hapsburg's in the center. Note also the amazing and complex silver sarcophagus to the right of the alter.
Wow. Awe inspiring, we were lucky that on the day we visited we had organ music playing, such a beautiful structure which takes your breath away.
Cathedral in Prague Castle. Amazing architecture, Baroque style with so much history. Located inside the walls of Prague Castle. Terrific views of Prague.

Amazing Views. Great church with amazing stained glass windows and heaps of history, no wonder it gets so busy. Make the effort to drag yourself up the 287 steps in the tower. Once at the top, pause for breath, pat yourself on the back for making it and then go marvel at the incredible views of Prague - you deserve it!

Breath Taking. Situated within the grounds of Prague castle this cathedral is breathtaking. Visiting as part of a tour does not do it justice. You need to spend a lot of time here to see all the sights within. Saint Wenceslas Chapel is within the cathedral.

Sublime inside and out. What a beautiful cathedral both internal and external. We didn't take the inside paid tour but could enter for free and admire the beautiful stained glass windows and the canaverous internal space and the peace.
The exterior is just as spectacular with many towers and spires.
Make sure you visit when in the castle.

Impressive external facade. And interesting interior.
Climb (difficult!) up the narrow spiralling stairs to the top of the tower for excellent views.

Spectacular . We were very excited to visit this Cathedral in the Prague Castle district.There are security checks entering Prague Castle which can cause queues/delays and then there is a fee for the various tourist attractions within the Prague Castle district. Tickets can be purchased in the tourist centre directly opposite the Cathedral.As regards getting here; take the metro and the tram as Prague Castle is at the top of a big hill which wouldnt be for all.Really enjoyed the Cathedral which realy dominates the skyline in Prague. It was amazing to wander around not only the interior but also the exterior and admire the architecture.I would say that the Cathedral is a must see when in Prague.
Beautiful church. You could spend days exploring this church. There is so much inside between the stained glass, alters, and statues. I'm not even a big church person but was fascinated by this.

Stunning example of late Gothic. Even after seeing several impressive gothic churches of Europe, St. Vitus still astounds. It is so full of beautiful architecture with every smallest detail asking for closer look; of art treasures like sculptures of various styles and ages, stained glass and mosaic. Baroque style monument to St. John Nepomuk is overwhelming though seems a little bit out of place in otherwise rather austere interior. It takes time to have a good walk inside and outside of the building to have a full picture of this magnificent church. When outside, especially pay attention to the former main (royal) entrance (Golden Gate) with golden mosaic and artfully decorated metal gates.

Overwhelming and stunning!. You will need a few hours to explore the cathedral and surrounding palaces, etc. A true medieval masterpiece of architecture, one of the very best churches in Europe! It is huge, and probably extends at least a few city blocks on each side. Surrounded by pedestrian streets only.
High on a hill. Overwhelming cathedral with the most beautiful in stained glass windows. Such amazing beautiful colours.
Prague . Nice city to visit. Full of history. Lots of architectural marvel. Romantic for couples. Shopping, sightseeing, boating and lots of other activities pack in one place.
It's unbelievable you can't leave Prague without visiting it. a definitely must visit landmark a beautifully majestically made master piece which is breathtakingly beautiful to see such craftsmanship

Beautiful Cathedral. This Cathedral can be viewed without buying a ticket but if you buy the combination ticket, you can go further inside and get some great photos. With the combination ticket you get all the buildings in the Castle area.

Beautiful historic building. Visited on a Sunday and realised there was a service taking place so decided to look around at the other attractions and we returned and were able to look around at St. Wenceslas' tomb, St. Vitus' tomb and many other beautiful windows.

A must see in Prague. Although most European cities have some outstanding cathedrals and churches, this one has to rank with the best we have seen (but also probably one of the more expensive to visit, although well worth the price). Stunning exterior and interior architecture, photography allowed throughout. A walk through history. Allow at least two hours with audio guide.

Amazing structure, both inside and out!. Worth seeing this Cathedral even if one is on overload with church structures. The size and intricacy of this structure is amazing. Seeing it in sunlight or rain is equally inspiring.

Awesome . A true gem of the city. Take a stroll around and check out the amazing design. We climbed the 300 stairs in a circle all the way up to the top. If you can make the spiral all the way up you get one of the best views of the city. But it takes a little work:)

500 years to build, 1 day to see. A must see in Prague, the St. Vitus Cathedral took over 500 years to build, but you're only allowed in the main entrance, and you should take off your hat due to local customs. I saw it as part of a guided tour, which I recommend, as you'll get a lot of information while being able to see all that is on offer.

Amazing a must to see.. This was part of the combined tour..Castle, Cathedral, Golden Walk, Basilica of St George. St Vitus is huge with a lot to see. It gets very busy and the line can be long to get in,so we went early in the morning when it first opened to miss the big tour groups. Lots of things to take pictures of. They do have an audio for a fee. We did not use the audio. There are explanations in English for some things. You will spend more time here than the other attractions. We spend 2hrs.

The most AMAZING church I've ever seen. This place is massive. It's beautiful, it's gothic, it's crazy! You could easily spend some time here to learn about it's history and culture. Be sure to have small change for the bathroom though. Even with hundreds of people, you're bound to get a really great shot anywhere. The architecture is a must see and they had very interesting stories about how they protected the castle from invaders. It's a good walk though but they have lots of places to stop and rest. At the very back there's a small outdoor café where the scenic views are gorgeous. I have very fond memories getting lost finding this place, but it was right off one of the stops off the tube, we just made a wrong turn and kept going the wrong way. But it's very close to the Charles Bridge so you could see both in one day.

Beautiful Gothic architecture. . This is a very remarkable church. It is about 300 meters long by my estimate and was began in the 14th century. The ceilings are probably near 100 meters high. The structure is all self supported by a hundred or so arches and flying buttresses. It is an amazing architectural feat and the interior contains many small chapels decorated by period art, statues and carvings.

It was overwhelming. Prague without its Castle is not Prague.And The Castle without St Vitus ... Well you have guessed ... St Vitus is absolutely an astounding Cathedral ...I does not matter if it was completed in the 20th Century it still is one of the most beautiful and massive Cathedral in Europe.Note Dame de Paris, the Duomo in Milano, St Peters in Roma ...St Vitus might not be in their league but it is close enough and I believe it might just be the most interesting and spectacular attraction in Prague ...Just look at some of the many pictures I have attached to see what I mean ...Yes, like the Charles Bridge it might probably be overcrowded between June and September ...But I am sure you will not miss the Castle when you're in Prague ...So since you are there ...Don't miss it and maybe you'll be overwhelmed as I was ...

Magnificent does not go far enough.. Make the long climb up to the Prague castle and be rewarded with a scenic trip in and around St. Vitus Cathdera, with its flying buttresses is a delight for those who appreciate fine old architecture. It faces the royal palace( which are now government offices) directly across the square. Take time to wander inside and out and admire this fabulous Cathedral.

A truly magnificent cathedral within the confines of Prague Castle. Really beautiful stained glass windows and the interior of the building is majestic. There are tour guides in various languages but we just admired the splendour of the building and so were in and out in 20 minutes.

Probably the best cathedral . It was the main attraction of Prague tour. We spent good two hours there with a local guide explaining each n every part of it in details. There is entry fee too and a great rush. I think people from all parts of world are there. It's a very good scenery n reports of contemporary history as well.
best stained glass i;ve seen. weirdly placed in the castle area so difficult to get a long view, but from the inside the stained glass windows are superb to see.

Stunning. A really awe inspiring building of architecture and stunning stained glass. Well worth a visit despite being extremely busy. Loved the domed ceilings and statues, although using a feather duster wouldn't do any harm as everything was very dusty and lost there vibrancy in colour!!

St. Vitus. The Cathedral of St. Vitus is beautiful. It is free to enter the first part of the cathedral but it really is worth paying to see the rest. When purchasing a ticket to see the castle entrance to St. Vitus is included. Even during October it is extremely busy so it'll be worth it getting there early in the day.
Stunning!. Would recommend a visit it's absolutely beautiful, wonderful architecture and stunning old church pieces not to mention the gold door in the outside stonework.
First cathedral i visited in prague. Tourist popular cathedral as it is usually covered in one day tour of Prague. Though it is crowded, it is still worth visiting.

Not to be missed. Although there can be queues for both Secutity and Entry Tickets it was pleasant enough waiting as there are numerous street entertainers and folk music but do dress for the weather,
Amazing. This was our favorite thing to see around Prague Castle. The architecture was glorious and the art beautiful.
fabulous. lovely, amazing décor, amazing structure and architecture, very busy with tourists certainly worth a visit if you are in Prague

Impressive exterior and interior. Very impressive cathedral in the Prague Castle Complex on the hill overlooking Prague. You need to buy a ticket to get into part of the cathedral, but you can walk through much of it and enjoy the atmosphere and stained glass windows. I would recommend buying the Castle ticket since not only does it include more of the cathedral, but also other activities and sites in the castle. There are some beautiful stained glass windows and although the large rose window doesn't compare to Notre Dame, the cathedral is breathtaking and you will not want to stop taking photos. Try to go early if possible as the crowds can be overwhelming in the whole castle complex.

Go Early!. Awesome Cathedral but be there at 9 am or the crowds are totally overwhelming. The views of the Cathedral from all sides are worth seeing, even the back as there are a few interesting things to see there also. The inside is rich and beautiful, get some kind of a guidebook or walking tour to understand everything you will be looking at.
a surprise gem. We wouldn't have found this if we hadn't been doing the conducted tour of the castle. It was a delight and in complete contrast to the baroque church which we had previously visited

St. Vitus. Beautiful cathedral with gorgeous stained glass. Buy tickets for access to the cathedral or you will be limited to the entry. Amazing colors of stained glass. Really beautiful display of architecture.

spectacular building.. ST Vitus Cathedral is a spectacular building in the Gothic style of architecture.Both inside and out the Cathedral has plenty to offer. There are three beautifully crafted wooden doors inside on the left. A huge pipe organ can be found inside which is under renovation. From the back entrance the building looks nothing special, but when you walk around the outside it is quite huge. The front of the Cathedral is very imposing with spectacular spires and lead light windows. To see the building from here was worth the visit. I understand you can climb to the top, but we didn't do that and I would think that you would need a reasonable level of fitness to manage the climb.

Hradcani cherry on the cake. This monumental Gothic Cathedral dominates the Castle palace hill (Hradcani) and the city landscape also. It is visible from all parts of the city.Once there, you can visit it for free (limited areas) or you can buy one of many combined tickets which include visiting the Crypt, climbing the Baroque belfry, or other parts of the Prague Castle.It is very ornament inside, with fantastic marble work and stained glass.The views from the belfry are magnificent, the best in town.Mind that lines for entering can be huge.
Stunning!. A beautiful Cathedral; the outside areas are as beautiful and the inside... and the view from that top is great... people can walk from there down to the town... a nice walk on stairs.....

Fantastic mosaics and windows. You can expect it to be very crowded and to walk in a queue around the high altar. The church is grand and the building a typical Gothic cathedral. There are however a few really stunning stained glass windows that stands out, as well as a lovely mosaic inside - and an even bigger outside which is amazing.
One of those places where you have a look and go.... Pretty, big church, but not much to it, saw it, looked at it for a minute or two, then just left...if you like churches this is your thing.

Dominates the skyline of Prague. St. Vitus Cathedral is the largest and the most important temple in Prague. Apart from religious services, coronations of Czech kings and queens also took place here. The cathedral is a place of burial of several patron saints, sovereigns, noblemen and archbishops.
Pretty exteriors. Absolutely beautiful cathedral. The insides are pretty but normal. It's the outside I thought that was worth the visit.
Do not miss going inside!. Beautiful cathedral located at Prague Castle. Amazing stained glass inside. One of the prettiest Cathedrals I've seen.
Beautifull. Really nice to visit. Inside is really nice. Just be aware for some times it can be very busy. We just put a candle for owe families and friends

Ornate beauty. Stood in line for security but it was worth the wait. Stood in line for a ticket to see the cathedral, but it was worth the wait. The cathedral was beautiful but extremely crowded with tourists who paid no attention to anyone's personal space including their own.

Amazing cathedral, attention to detail. Came by here on August 19/16, when I seen Prague Casle. You can not miss it due to it's size. I walked around the grounds and around the cathedral and took lots of pictures, this cathedral is amazing not just due to the fact that it is huge, but also that the attention to detail in the arcitecture, which is grand and spectacular.If you wanted to go into the cathedral there was a wait of several hours in August. Top time for people to go there is around May thru August I believe, so going there would probably be easier in the September thru April months.Looking at my pictures will show what I mean by a lot of details in the building's look, If you are a cathedral, arcitecture buff you should enjoy this building. .I can not really say much more about this place, so I advise you to see this amazing place/building before the lord strikes you down.....LOL.

Wow, wow, wow !!! But with a tinge of sadness. This Gothic church , in the castle grounds, is huge, really huge. I just cannot fathom how people several hundred years ago could have built something this size and this height without cranes. Then look at the construction - many hundred times more detailed than anything that is built these days. Wow. Then go inside and get gobsmacked again. Finishes, ornamentation, statues, glass windows completely over the top. While I marvel at this cathedral and many other cathedrals and churches throughout Europe, I also get really mad at the waste of resources. How much better if these resources were put to use in sorting out poverty and other problems, back then and now. I will shut up now!
St Vitus Cathedral. Now this is one building that I believe is comparable in beauty and grandeur to the Basilica of St Mary of the Flower in Florence, Italy.

Beautiful church. Saw this on a tour including the castle. The church is beautiful and a fine specimen of gothic architecture. Very tall and grand, it sits on one of the 7 hills and is surrounded by lush grounds. Definitely a highlight. Negative =crowded.
Beautiful. We saw many churches and cathedrals on our tour through Europe and this rates among the most beautiful. One of the top things to see while in Prague.

Great cathedral. It s very impressive inside and out.there are so many interesting aspects of the archetecture, design, and decorations. The stained glass is gorgeous the massive crypt in silver near the back of the alter is very unique. A ticket is required for a detailed look inside, although free entrance is there for just a look from the inside front entrance.

Another epic European cathedral. To see this place is one of the main reasons one would buy a ticket to see various parts of the Prague Castle. It is another one of the epic cathedrals that cover Europe. Our travel book advised to be at the doors with ticket in hand when it opened. We are very glad we took that advice because, about 10-15 minutes later, busloads of tourists following their guides were lining up to get in.
Gorgeous . St. Vitus Cathedral is a must see while in Prague! The exquisite gothic architecture will steal your breath away!

Stunning Cathedral. Unfortunately, I arrived too late to go inside, but I sat and admired the beautiful cathedral dominating a large square inside the castle for quite some time. Looking forward to going back to see the inside!

It on took 600 years or so to build but it was worth it. This was the second time I have visited and it's still great. The lines are long and the kids are rude by cutting the lines but it's still an amazing place. We Americans would have lost our attention span before this church was finished. The windows are great.
Beautiful Cathedral. The interior as well as the exterior are beautiful and accessible. The history of the cathedral was interesting and we appreciated it.

Stunning. Be sure to allow yourself enough time. This is a very large castle and lots to see. The gardens are also worth a visit and do not forget to catch the birds of prey in the garden. We ran out of time and we were there all day but your ticket is valid for 2 days
Architectural Wonder. Fabulous, just fabulous you most definitely have to see this wonder if visiting Prague. If you can join a guided tour that way you will learn lots of interesting facts.
must see!. An amazing cathedral with plenty of other attractions near it.The cathedral is presenting sculptures and paintings from different centuries.the painted glass is absolutely stunning!
St. Vitus is a must. Spectacular, massive Gothic exterior. Unique features not found in other Gothic churches. Mucha painted window, solid silver tomb of John Nepomuk. Don't miss this.

St Vitus Cathedral. Go early as the queues were ridiculous! You can only see half the cathedral for free. It's visually stunning but crowded. If you want to see anything in the palace area you have to join just the one queue and go through security.But once in you'll see the whole complex. Allow loads of time as it's huge area. Over rated in some ways. We found loads of great things to do in Prague that were not on the 'top 10' list of things visitors should do, that were better.
Wow. A symbol of Czech statehood. If you want to learn something from Czech history, this is the point where you should start. Gothic lovers will find their soft spot.

Wonderful cathedral. First the tip- there are more entrances! Do not go to the main entrance to the castle complex and stand in line. There are two other entrances, one taking you through the park area and the other right off the 22 tram line. Now, the cathedral is a work of art. I recommend an early morning visit as the stain glass windows, which look black from the exterior, are a colorful play of light on the interior. That coupled with the way that light interacts with the interior makes for a beautiful display.After you finish the interior, take a slow walk around the exterior and marvel at how the buttresses are concealed and the quality of the carving of the stone.Could have spent a day just looking at the exterior.

Cathedral-. stunning interiors- the stained glass windows are ethereal- the cathedral took very long to build. The Gothic structure can be seen from anywhere in the city. Started in the 14th century, the cathedral was finally completed in the 19th century.

The Rosetta inside is lovely.. Very interesting knowing how long it has taken to complete this Cathedral, especially to see the last 4 architects in their tuxedoes sculpted at the entrance......indicating the most recent addition to the Cathedral.

Beautiful Building. The Cathedral is a huge building in the typical style of the period. It is huge. The stained glass windows are magnificent. Entry to the cathedral is free, but this only gets you to the back of the church. For full entry down to the altar, etc - there is a fee. Be warned - the tickets must be bought at the ticket kiosk at the entrance to the Castle complex, which is a bit of a pain if you have got that far before deciding that you want them. Consequently, a lot of people (and tourist groups) only stay around the crowded entrance. The cathedral is well worth the visit.

Nice Exterior - Must for Architecture Detail Lovers. Very very nice gothic exterior. You are close to gothic architecture because the plaza is small. If you are unable to be close to see Notre Dame Paris, this is very good to observe such architecture. However if you have seen Notre Dame Paris this would not be as amazing, but still a very good place to go and chill and walk around the Cathedral to see they detailwork of the spires and just the skyline views of the spires up close. with less buttress to get in the way. can see the intricacies.
Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. What a beautiful old cathedral inside and out. Be sure to plan for at least 2 hours visiting this place. One of the great old style cathedrals.
Loved it!. Beautiful and gorgeous.. Such amazing architecture. Take the time to explore it, and walk around. It was crowded the day we went - bit it was also a national holiday.

Stunning exterior. The entire castle area is a 'must visit' and the Cathedral is central to it. The exterior is spectacular and most photos do not do it justice.However, I have to agree with other reviewers who have been underwhelmed with its interior compared with many other more spectacular Cathedrals. Worth a visit but gets very crowded both inside and outside by the entrance.
Graet. Beautiful Buildings with lot of great sculptures, paintings and painted glass windows. Feel yourself connected to almighty.
Amazing building. Stunning looking from outside and glorious stain glass windows. We visited on a Sunday and it was extremely busy. Very crowded at the bottom of cathedral
incredible . this church is a must to be in prague. full interesting Religion arcitectures and altares and a marvellos thomb of St. Johannes of Nepomuk.

Interesting, but nothing spectacular. Unfortunately, having seen a few other cathedrals and religious sites over the years this place did not really grab me as I suppose it should have.Once again we were faced with a number of chapels, tombs and ecclesiastical paintings as well as the standard stained glass windows.I may be doing the place an injustice, and others may find it more interesting.

Another amazing Gothic cathedral. Truly one of the amazing Gothic cathedrals in the world and one that was built over 1000 years so has the uniqueness from this fact. Take enough time to see this cathedral properly and buy the ticket to let you into all the key areas. The castle area tours offered by the local tour groups will only give you a short window to see some of the cathedral, you would have to go back on your own time to see it properly.

Beyond amazing!. St. Vitus Cathedral was probably the most impressive object I've visited during my visit in Prague. Definitely worth to see, if you're in Prague! It's so huge, yet is decorated with comparatively small sculptures, structures and details! The interior is as impressive as the exterior! All the chapels and stained-glass windows are beyond amazing!Definitely worth a visit, especially if you're a fan of gothic architecture!
Amazing cathedral.. We did this as part of the B circuit on the castle tour and it was amazing to see. Beautiful from both the outside and the inside. Must see while in Prague.

Beautiful. Make sure to take the tower tour, its a long walk but the view over Prague makes it worth the many stairs. The inside of the cathedral is very beautiful, with the stained glass windows making coulors dancing on the walls. Truly a great place!

A Must See. If you are going to the castle you must stop and see St. Vitus Cathedral. It took over 600 years to build this master piece. If you have a castle ticket you can get in to see the chapels and ambulatory in the chancel. This too is worth a visit.

St. Vitus Cathedral visit with our guide Alena. It was an amazing tour to see St. Vitus Cathedral with our private guide Alena (alenaguide.com). I'm so thankful to have met Alena and for the wonderful tour she provided of "Old Town" Prague
Do you believe ? . I don't have a religious bone in my body but this is an amazing building in the castle grounds. Entry is free and hence it can get very busy.

Saintly visit. The Cathedral is as magnificent as Notre Dame or many of the others that are famous throughout Europe. It certainly has more than its share of saints buried within which may have some appeal for the religiously inclined. Otherwise, another dark, cavernous example of excessive homage to the divine.

A must see. St. Virus Cathedral is a must see. One of the most impressive buildings in the country. Go early to avoid the crowds and take tram #22 to the front of the Prague Castle complex and walk in from there. You will be walking through a series of working Government Buildings.
Absolutely gorgeous. This cathedral is absolutely gorgeous. I loved all the stained glass windows and sunlight shining through .

'Gothic'. Huge vaulted ceilings dominate this Cathedral along with the stained glass windows.
Feels cavernous when you walk in which is good as I think they should only let a a few number of people in at one time.
Didn't stay long due to the crowds..
Beautiful. If you love Gothic architecture, you're in for a treat with this one. I especially loved the stained glass windows!
Amazing. The beauty of this place never fails. Hard to imagine how they built this huge cathedral hundreds of yes ago.
Amazing. Huge Catedral! Amazing, very impressive. On everyones list it should be as "must see in Prague"!You wont be sorry!

Beautiful cathedral. It's a beautiful example of a gothic cathedral, magnificent stained glass. It's let down by the fact that the Czech people show its history no reverence and just crowd in as many as possible.
Prague Castle. Complete and authentic. Brilliant architecture. Must see for all Prague visitor especially when visiting the castle
Magnificent !. Huge Gothic Cathedral within the Castle ! Needs to be seen. Try to avoid the week ends - too crowded. You WILL be moved along by the attendants (annoying !). Lots to see.

Amazing building, towering over all others.. Such an interesting building - inside & out. Free to go into the entrance of the cathedral, but to have a good look around the interior, you need to buy a ticket in the 1st courtyard. Sometimes long queues outside, but these can appear/disappear in a matter of minutes,
Stunning!. I've seen this cathedral many times and every time I am in awe of it's beauty. It is well worth the visit to see it.

Visited as part of the Prague castle visit. We bought the B tour for the palace and this also gave us entrance to the this great cathedral. The inside is truly spectacular and well worth the visit. I like the overall physical appearance of these places so did not have the audio guide, which, if the detail is what you are after, would be worthwhile.
Impressive gothic cathedral. You shall not miss the visit of the cathedral when up in the prague castle. Stunning gothic piece of art.

Pay the Price. Buy your tickets as a group of sites and see this beauty. Great stained glass and also see the carving of Prague from the 1630s. There is also the tomb of St Vitus and St John of Nepomek and of st Wenceslas There is the royaloratory where the king came to mass in his PJs.

Stunning. Gothic architecture at its best This is the one cathedral you MUST see to appreciate Loved it inside and out The lines move fast Take 10k for the washroom and the view from behind the cathedral is lovely
Cannot miss it in Prague!!. You have to visit this place if you are in Prague. Great architecture, great cathedral and awesome museums.
Fantastic church. Slap bang in the middle of Prague attracts thousands of tourists every day summer and winter, a real part of the old Czech culture and well worth a visit.

Beautiful cathedral . Well worth the money to get inside and study the impressive architecture, statues and stained glass windows.
Started in 1344 and only completed in 1929!
Go and see it!
Great cathedral . This is a great cathedral with amazing architecture and is definitely worth visiting whilst in Prague.

Best Thing in Prague Castle. While the inside of many attractions Prague Castle in quite skippable, the one attraction that should be spent money on is this cathedral. If you are impressed by the exterior architecture, wait till you get inside. Drop dead beautiful. It's much Iarger inside than one would estimate. A must visit.

Absolutely beautiful. Be sure to use a guide on this tour. The church has too much to offer and see without someone knowledgeable explaining the place. We did see it on a private tour and went back a few days later to further explore and marvel. It is spectacular a can't miss while in Prague.

Amazing cathedral.. Go there as soon as you get a ticket at 9am in order to beat the tour crowds. Beautiful interior from glass to wood carvings to religious artefacts. Highlight of Prague castle visit !

Amazing architectural wonder!. The entrance is free, but they charge a fee (included with Prague card) to go further into the building. Go as early in the morning as you can, the lineup to enter builds up quickly and becomes worse as the day goes by because of the bottleneck at the security check points.

St Vitus Cathedral. Located within the Prague Castle walls, this is an absolutely stunning church. A must see,
Definitely take the walk up to the observation deck (287 steps) for amazing panoramic views of Prague and also spring for the tour ticket that includes walking around the inside of the church.
Line is crazy. Get there early or buy tickets in advance. We bought tickets on site and didn't even go in the Cathedral because we had already waited in too many lines.
Pretty cathedral. Love the exterior of this church. Very pretty, the details are so wonderful. It can be seen from Charles Bridge but looking at it closely gives you different feeling

Truly magnificent!. Visited during the day with the hoards of other tourists, then came back at night for a concert. Breathtaking place. One of my favorite Gothic Cathedrals in all of Europe. Not to be missed. Don't let the crowds put you off, just enjoy in wonder of what this building would have meant in its day.
Prague - a city with a picture at every turn. A must to see - the stain glass windows and history are great. You can take a 1000 photos just in the cathedral.

A Patchy Church.... The most interesting part of the church is the fact it's being built over long period of time, thus incorporating different style of architectural style, with a twist. See it for yourself :)
an amazing building!. Well worth a visit, and much else to see in the Prague Castle environs - you can spend a whole day here. Good transport access but worth the walk up to enjoy the views.

beautiful!. This church sits on the hill overlooking the Prague valley and is spectacular. It was crowded on a weekend so go there during the week if possible. The Palace and grounds were interesting and we ate at a vineyard just below the church, a block or so that had a wonderful view and good food.

Fascinating cathedral. A splendid place ti visit. Best features - well, there are lots, but I particularly liked the stained glass, and the tomb of St Wenceslas (No he wasn't a king - that song got it wrong!)

Beautifull. Beautiful ghotic cathedral, we went in for a few minutes, it's not big and as I understood there is no tours that really talk about it, so don't plan to be there for long. It's beautiful and it's recommended to get in.

Centerpiece of the Castle. The cathedral is among the most impressive cathedrals anywhere in the world and is a must see in Prague. Amazing stained glass windows throughout and numerous attached chapels. Great associated history as well. You can view from the entry for free but worth it to pay. The audio guide is great, especially with YOUR earphones. It is hard to hear without earbuds. Two can share one audioguide.
windows. the most amazing thing and what remains in my memory most is the stained glass windows bar far the most impressive i have seen ,breathtaking.The rest of the cathedral is great too

St. Vitus Cathedral. Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful. Although you may have to wait for a while to enter, it is well worth the wait. I must say that his is probably the must stunning cathedral I have ever been in. I would visit again if I ever return to Prague.

A Gothic masterpiece. It is a big beauty, a great, significant symbol of faith. Gives Prague castle a significant character and serve as a major landmark. This cathedral will never fail to inspire awe. The roof top is embellished with pinnacles, figures and gargoyles. The inside is also just as awesome.
Must Visit. This is a really cool gothic cathedral that is a must visit while in Prague. Lots of people though! Expect to wait a while in line and be prepared to go through a thorough security check.
Stunning windows. The windows in this cathedral just took my breath away, especially the one designed by Mucha! The sunshine outside just made the glass glow and my photos were fantastic.
Gothic Style!. Beautiful gothic architecture takes to back down the Bohemian era. The christianity and pagan influence makes the place more wondering.

Beautifully kept. I love to visit churches. This one is well preserved and worth a visit for the history it has been witness to. The decorations were a little depressing but the stained glass are gorgeous. We really enjoyed a trek up the clock tower with amazing views, at 200 steps it's not for the front of heart. At the top there is a large clock in glass that is fascinating to watch. Ticket sold separately

Stained Glass Heaven. Visited St. Vitus Cathedral early and the place is most beautiful. The sun coming through the stained glass windows projected brilliance on the walls. Been to churches in Paris and they are wonderful but St. Vitus Cathedral is still my best.

To pay, or not to pay? That is the question.. My Wife and I visited here twice during our 4 day stay in Prague. Our first stop was a fleeting visit to give us an idea of both the cathedral and castle,when we didn't pay, however we decided it was well worth a more detailed exploration, and came back a second day when we paid to see more of the cathedral, castle and surrounds.It is certainly subjective whether you need to pay to see the cathedral itself. You can get perfectly good views from all sides and the first 20 yards or so inside, without paying. However, if you want to see the various tombs, including St Wenceslas, you will need a ticket.If when you purchased a ticket you were doing so just to see the rest of the cathedral, I personally would consider it not worth it, however your ticket gives you access to many other parts of the castle and therefore is certainly worthwhile.Expect to be in and around the cathedral itself for 45mins-1hour, and if you are wanting to see everything in and around the castle itself, probably allow 5 hours.

Very beautiful old cathedral in the inner part of Prague. Definitely a must if you stay in Prague. It is a very beautiful cathedral. Both from outside and from inside. Very crowded, which is a another evidence of its popularity.
Wondeful!. Do not miss this beautiful cathedral. Well worth a visit as inside and outside it is spectacular, we loved it !

Beautiful Gothic Church. This is a Gothic church, is really big and one of the places you have to see if you are in Prague. This church is inside the Prague Castle you can pay the tickets that includes the Church so you can see it inside, if you don't have the ticket you can get in but not go to the altar
A charm inside and out. One of the most visited places in Praha. The only inconvenient thing is that the President lives nearby so you have to expect a long wait to be inspected by security.

Glorious stained glass, but oh the crowds.... A storehouse of treasures, this is a fantastic building, with wonderful frescos, stained glass and silver. It's a must see, but the crowds were horrible, almost overwhelming, and every lovely view was interrupted by someone with a camera. Glorious, but very frustrating - I can see why they recommend visiting at quiet times.

Pay the money to get passed the ropes. You can go in to the building and stand at the back and get a glimpse of the building. But for approximately £8 you can see this, the castle, the golden lane and a small basilica. It's well worth the money for the cathedral alone. The statues, the ceiling, the tombs all add to a setting that even today is awe inspiring . We just don't built like this anymore.
Impressive. As cathedrals goes this is impressive and worth a visit especially if you have made the effort to go up to the old town

As beautiful up close as it is from afar. Let's face it. This landmark is kind of hard to miss, day or night. We were stunned at its beauty, arriving in Prague at dusk and it got more magnificent as the sky darkened. The next morning we ventured out as part of a Sandeman tour, taking the tram up the hill and being guided up the hill to where the Cathedral stands. The grounds and the area around the castle have their own history (quaint little streets in the castle area, changing of the guards, etc). The cathedral itself is an architectural wonder. Really worth the trek up the hill. It's a lot easier on the way down

Big Climb- take the tram instead!. We had heard of all the stairs to see the castle/Cathedral complex, and that ain't our style! We took Tram #22 which drops you off right next to it, on the same level- near bathrooms and the guards, which we got to see change-- Beautiful Cathedral and stained glass, the first area is free, and how did they haul all that stone up there?

Was a great experience!. Watched the film anthropoid and the trip to the Cathedral was well worth the short walk. Highly recommended to anyone in prague to call in to the Cathedral and the museum very respectfully done to those who it commemorates.

Great Cathedral?. The number of cathedral visited in Europe are unaccountable. Therefore the St. Vitus Cathedral with all its height and beauty it is simply another cathedral. We appreciate the sight and beauty of the St. Vitus but after so many we simply give our 'average' for this great cathedral.
overpowering. You should take a local tour, it costs just pennies, also includes the church, and several other attractions.

Average. Nothing comparing to St. Peter's Basilica in Vatican, but still worth of seeking. Nice paintings and dead popes in sarcophagus.Over priced. And to inform everyone, there is no such thing as over 26 year old student in Check Republic.
Cathedral . Very beautiful cathedral! I can't say enough how beautiful it was. Definitely worth seeing. We paid to get to walk around it. Our ticket got other parts of the castle area as well
Really Cool. The cathedral dominates the skyline near the river and is well worth a visit. Do keep an eye out for the carvings of men in suits and tie!
Beautiful cathedral. St. Vitus is a lovely cathedral. Beautiful stained glass throughout. Ornate altar, and carvings, and a special St. Wenceslas chapel. A must see when visiting the castle.
Stunning church. Stunningly beautiful. So much history. There were no more audio guides when we arrived - I think having those would have enhanced our visit
Worthy to pay tour ticket. Very beautiful church. Amazing colorful stained glass on the entire church. It impressed me a lot and I would go another time on it.

So beautiful!. Just loved walking around the cathedral. It is just gorgeous! We went there later in the day and did not go inside. I'm pretty sure there are times to go inside, but I don't know for sure. Even just seeing the outside was wonderful!

Beautiful. This is a must see whilst in Prague, my favourite aspect was the amazing stained glass windows.
If you are a keen photographer there a many beautiful shots to be had both inside and outside of this wonderful cathedral!

excellent gothic architecture, be prepared to queue. This looks amazing from afar and close up. There was a big queue to get in and unfortunately our tour (ironically called 'Best tour') did not include any entry into any sights, even though this one was free. I would have loved to seen inside although the queue was large I'm sure it would have been worth it. There is a strange obelisk outside the cathedral. You can climb to the top and take in the atmosphere of the busy square. Enjoy.

Yea its pretty. It is huge and pretty but it's very crowded and you can't go around and look again, only with the line, amazing place sad result of money making, feels "not real" as most of the castle places of visit.

Beautiful cathedral. This is a wonderful cathedral. It loses a start because it was so extremely busy.The stained glass windows are absolutely wonderful, especial the Mucha one.Well worth a visit just to see that!

Add this to your list if you are visiting Prague Castle. I've seen many European cathedrals, so I really can't rate this one a great deal higher than all the others. If you enjoy architecture, I think you will enjoy this.

Breathtaking.. A great sight and a must see for anyone going to Prague, you can easily spend 3 to 4 hours here, just checking the great detail and appreciating the effort put into building this huge catherdral. Whether you visit at night or at day, you will enjoy the vibe this building spreads. IT IS HUGE AND LOOKS PERFECT.
Simply Divine. Seeing the sunlight reflect through the stained glass windows was a sight to behold. This is an experience not to be missed. Go early when it first opens to avoid the large crowds.

A'Must See'. Amazing fete of architecture and building dating back and a stained glass window designed by the great Czechloslovakian artist Alfonso Mucha. Very crowded when we visited in early September, but you can look upwards and marvel at the brilliance of this magnificent Cathedral.

Gothic wonder. You will need a ticket to take in the full majesty of the cathedral. However, it is possible to enter the cathedral for free, you are just restricted to an area inside the main door. If you do not have much time, and just want a quick look, save your money.
The most impressive temple of the country. Huge cathedral, the chef-d'oevre of the Gothic art. Nice stained-glass windows and majestic wall paintings create unforgettable souvenirs.
amazing building and surrounding views. We had to wait as security was high but it was well worth it,The building is amazing and the grounds surrounds and views breathtaking. Photographers dream
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful, whole area was well worth a visit ..Gothic interiors and externally fascinating

Blown away. This cathedral is simply stunning, but can get crowded in the afternoons with all the tour groups. Stained glass windows of various styles, as well as a mosaic panel on the outside, show how different eras tried to add to the church over time.

Beautiful...love the stained glass!. We visited this cathedral today as part of a Prague Castle tour. Our tour surprisingly did not include the 'paid' option of being able to walk up to the altar of the church and to see the graves of some famous royal figures, however nonetheless it was stunning with a wide array of stained glass and some beautiful architecture!
Spectacular!!. We have toured Cathedrals all over Europe and this one stacks up extremely well. The gothic stone work is exquisite and the stained glass is spectacular.

Beautiful Cathedral, a Must See. Absolutely stunning architecture both inside and out. As you exit the church, be sure to turn around, as the back exterior, in my opinion, is the prettiest part of the church. Interesting that the church was built in various stages, and you can tell the new from the old by the slope in the middle of the floor. Be sure not to miss the stain glass window designed by Alphonse Mucha.

Cathedral. This castle is absolutely beautiful it really is a must see,we also watched changing of the guard while we were there which is well worth the wait ( 12 o'clock )The castle has some beautiful glass windows inside but the whole place is just outstanding

a must-see. This is definitely a must-see. Pay the ticket to be able to go into the entire cathedral. If you are cheap, you can get in free to the very back, but will miss a lot of the architectures and things at the front. Try to see the 'story of Prague Castle' first to get an idea of the entire complex.
Absolutely stunning. This cathedral was breathtaking. I loved how the sunlight filtered through the stained glass. I enjoyed walking through and reading the dates on the sarcophagi.
Magical Church. Most of the architecture of Prague is made of black stone, and each has its history and unique details that make each sculpture is particularly detailed.
St. Vitus Cathedral. What a beautiful church. It is so amazing. Words cant really describe. They do not let you take pictures, but you can buy a postcard which has a great picture of the inside.

Fabulous. Lots of tours just enter the front section of this magnificent cathedral. Do yourself a favor and come back and buy a b pass and see all around this magnificent church, full of treasures and history. The modern stained glass windows are a delight even though they carry some tasteful advertising. The pass allows you into another simple church St george,the golden lane and the Royal palace.

Absolutely amazing. Beautiful cathedral and this is definitely one of must sees. There were too many tourists and it certainly needed a better crowd management and I would have enjoyed it more. I have bought B type ticket which included old royal palace, Basilica of St. George and Golden Lane. Personally I could have been happy with the cathedral only.
On the square... I was disappointed we did not get to go inside but the architecture is amazing. So intricate and stately. Disappointed another building stands in close.

A slice of gothic hustory. The cathedral offers very awe inspiring architecture which could be said is one of a kind. Perfectly preserved wall paintings and small details give it a really noble feel, the exterior looks quite contrarily rather scary and imposing due to the well executed gothic style. With such a brilliant place it can be tough to find downsides but it has lost its peaceful, religious, feel thanks to the hoards of tourists that come here.
Amazing!. A must see. If you visit Prague this is a must on your to do list . Stunning! Do not miss this it is amazing.
Amazing Architecture!. Certainly one of the most beautiful cathedral I have seen. Close to Paris' Notre Dame on the inside with Beautiful painted glasses!

Beautiful cathedral . This is a copy of Notre Dame in Paris but slightly bigger. The stained glass windows are amazing especially when the sun shines through it. The chapels inside are beautiful. Inside, you'll see the tomb of St. Vitus. It is made of silver and really magnificent. This is one of the best Cathedral I've ever seen.

Outstanding. After two weeks of traveling we were getting a little tired and were having our fill of churches but the St. Vitus Cathedral was amazing. I would love to see it during a church service. An amazing building with a wonderful history.
Gigantic catherdal. Legendary cathedral, bigger than the Cologne Dom. HUGE. Magnificent. Full of history. Rent the audio guide for lots of grat stories.

A must see if you are visiting Prague. Make sure you get to the Castle early, and still be prepared to wait...our tickets lasted us 2 days, with 1 admission to each place...this was worth the long wait, even though we got there at 9.30 am on the second day ...truely magnificent....reasonably priced as well...

Magnificent Jewel of Gothic Art. The cathedral has everything you want in a cathedral: Soaring towers and vaulted Gothic architecture, magnificent tombs and stained glass windows, watch for teh one done by famous Czech artist Mucha as you walk in on the left, this alone is worth the visit. Another attraction is the St Wencesleas chapel, where the walls are covered with semi-precious stones, it gives the impression of a medieval jewel casket

The Crown Jewel of the Castle Complex. First, like all important tourist areas in Prague St. Vitus Cathedral is crowded hence it is important to arrive early especially if you want to obtain the audio guide to the Cathedral. I have never seen this done before but you need to leave a rather hefty refundable deposit before they will issue one. This involves the writing of receipts and wasting precious time in line. There is no easy dropping off either as once again you stand in line and wait your turn to get your deposit back. The narrative on the audio is informative but a little too long for each site, it would have been better to have buttons to push for niche interests like it is done in many other churches especially if you buy the package that includes the rest of the Castle Complex. There is a time constraint on the audio so sometimes it is a little hard to plan on how much time to devote to each site. You do however learn a lot.The Cathedral itself is magnificent albeit a little too crowded with many structures inside, personally I prefer clean sweeps and less "clutter" even if the "clutter" consists of beautiful sculptures, tombs and monuments. The Cathedral was started by the venerated (King and Saint) Wenceslas who is buried here in the holiest of the nearly two dozen side chapels in the Church. Another imposing tomb is that of St Nepomuk 1 1/2 tons of silver was used to construct that one. As in Shakespearian tragedies where family members were prone to murder one another St Wenceslas was killed by his brother while his mother St Ludmilla was strangled on her daughter in law's request. This is why she is most often portrayed with a scarf around her neck. People close to the Royal Family did not fare that well either. St Nepomuk with the splendid silver tomb and the Queen's confessor was thrown off the Charles Bridge into the river Vltava below.From King Wenceslas's chapel you could if it was open to the public which it is not enter the Royal Treasury where the crown jewels are kept. Seven important people have to come together each with a different key to open the door. I have no idea why this is so as many crown jewels including the British ones are much more accessible. There are so many amazing features to this Cathedral from the Golden Gate's sparkling mosaics, the gorgeous stain glass windows to the carvings showing Prague and the Castle in the seventeenth century it would need a far bigger space to do justice to them all.St Vitus Cathedral along with the entire Castle district is not to be missed.

Interesting inside and out. St. Vitus Cathedral took 700 years to complete. It's patron saint is St. Wenceslas, and all of the coronations happened here. The stained glass windows were gorgeous, as is the tomb of St John Nepomocene. Make sure you look at the royal entrance from the outside. Very interesting.

You're in the Castle area? St.Vitus is a must. A breath taking building and church interior. Beautiful stained glass. Lots of people, but queues move on quickly. Do not miss it. Look up at the exterior. The gargoyles are magnificent and awesome. Their mouths are open as they act as rain spouts for gutter draining pipes so the stone won't get too much erosion. Very interesting.
Grand. One of the grandest Cathedrals I have ever seen. Definitely worth taking the entry ticket and go around thoroughly.

Must See, but very busy . This is a must see attraction in Prague, unfortunately that goes for everyone and they all know it too. This means that it is very crowded inside a lot of the time. Still, it is worth persevering and when you do manage to get out of the midst of the guided tour groups you will enjoy this amazing space inside the colossal cathedral. The exterior, particularly the golden gate on the south side are worth spending some time on too.

You should see it. When you come to the Grad and steps inside you see gow it big and monumental. It's so high so you even can't make photo of this, No photo will give you this feeling. It's a God building. It goes right there/ Anazing place/ I've made some photo to remember my feelings.

Lost the sanctity of a grand cathedral. I guess when you have a thousand people in one place taking pictures and selfies, the solemnity of the cathedral will be lost. Shame, it was such a grand cathedral. Say a little prayer for mankind.

This is another Prague stop that is a must.. St. Vitus is on a hill, therefore my recommendation is to take either the Metro or the tram to get there, so you can save your energy for later. In regards to which transportation is better: although the metro is faster, the tram will give you the flavor of Prague and let you enjoy the architectural wonders around you before arriving to your destination. The design of this architectural gem deserves ample time to explore it in and around it...

Beyond Beautiful and Classically Gothic. Simply stunning. Every Chapel offers new detail and craftsmanship beyond comprehension. The paintings, stained glass, and sculptures come together to create a masterpiece that should not be missed.

Stunning stanied glass interior. The Prague Castle tour is a must but get there early (10.00am) to avoid the crowds. The interior of the cathedral and its internal stained glass is as impressive as you'll see anywhere in Europe. Look also had the solid silver side altarpieces

Worth the uphill walk. It's a long uphill walk but the cathedral is amazing and should be seen. Fantastic stained glass. Truly a marvel. Past visit there was no line but now there is a security check.
Stunning. Worth a trek up to, suggest early morning to miss the crowds and take a leisurely hike uphill. Fabulous views on a clear day. Beautiful architecture.

Spectacular church. This church is a must visit. Church has a rich history and is one of the great churches in Europe. We used the audio tour and it worked well. Get there early (like 9 am) before all the tour groups hit. Or do a guided tour.
Beautiful. the Cathedral is awesome with excellent paintings and stained glass. It is worth visiting and it is part of the Prague castle complex.
Best building I have ever seen. Incredibly beautiful cathedral inside the Prague Castle. Visited in the evening and it was a mindblowingly wonderful experinece.

One of the highlights of Prague. One of the beautiful cathedrals of Prague! Work began on the cathedral in 1344 and was finally completed in 1929, nearly 600 years! We gazed up at the beautiful rose window and high ceilings and pondered generation upon generation pouring their time and talent into completing this work of art and architecture.
Stunning. Crowded, but worth the visit. The square around the Cathedral is fun to stroll and people watch. The outside of the Cathedral is as lovely and interesting as the inside.

A beautiful gothic cathedral. The cathedral is located on the grounds of the Prague castle but well worth seeing. There are lots of interesting sites in the church including a number of significant tombs and historical artifacts. There are also beautiful stained windows.

Beautiful!. Definitely worth a visit. Tip:we went to get our tickets at the first ticket booth we saw, with a long line. Just around the corner was another ticket booth with no line at all. Look around! The cathedral was amazing. Very intricate architecture with fabulous stained glass windows. Makes me a bit sad, though, that most of Prague's citizens are atheists with all the beautiful churches in the city.

Must see. Definitely worth visiting when you are in Prague even if you are not a Catholic. Admire the beautiful stained glasses of the Cathedral, one of the best example of Gothic architecture. The Cathedral is in the center of the Prague Castle so be sure to use your most comfortable walking shoes coz it's a long way up going to the castle.
The cathedral was stunning inside. Breathtaking architecture, beautiful stain glass windows. It was just amazing, you can see this attraction from the Charles Bridge itself.

Ann. PRAUGE size of seven football fields, Prague Castle is the largest ancient castle in the world. Built and renovated during 13 centuries, the complex includes churches, gardens, alleyways and royal residences that would take days to appreciate. Don't miss the St. Vitus Cathedral. In addition to Art Nouveau stained-glass windows and a wooden depiction of the crucifixion, it houses treasures like the tomb of St. John of Nepomuk — a blinding two-metric-ton vault that is held up by an army of silver angels.

Amazing. This cathedral is amazing. It has beautiful vibrant stained glass windows and the sheer size of it takes you aback. Only downside is I had previously visited Rome and it didn't have a touch on the Vatican.

The most beautiful stained glass windows I've ever seen. The most beautiful stained glass windows I've ever seen, and I've visited a lot of cathedrals. Definitely take the audio guide tour, and bring your own headphones to plug into the device. You'll be more comfortable.

Impressive. Very impressive cathedral in the castle complex, on a hill that overlooks the old town. Great architecture and the interior is just as remarkable. Fantastic stained glass windows. Only accessible with a ticket.

Beautiful gothic cathedral. During our visit in mid-September the whole castle area was full of tourists, big groups also filling the cathedral. Despite the crowd the building is grand and probably woukd have tons of interesting historical facts which we missed due our hasty visit.

Fantastic building. This is a beautiful building that one should not miss when in Prague. Entry to the main area is free but to really appreciate the building one needs to buy a ticket to gain entry to the major attractions. The building is very crowded around 11.00 to 15.00 so avoid this if you can. Having access to the audio tour (350F) will greatly enhance the visit. A must see when in Prague.

Impressive, even for a European Church. Beautiful building. MAke sure you understand that the two steeples side by side are the new part. The entrance on the side is the older part (14th century?) and is gorgeous. Look at the gold trim. Also, near the old part (to the left when looking straight on) you'll see a low small structure that is enclosed. Go look at it. It is the foundation of the original church from the 11th century (?). Most people just walk by it. On the inside the stained glass windows (done in the 20th century) are beautiful, especially if you are there on a sunny day.

Best View in town!. For the best view in town climb up one of the towers of St. Vitus Cathedral. It is worth the nearly 300 steps to make it to the top. Since the cathedral is already on a hill, the 360 degree view from the top is incredible. You not only see the details of the Castle hill but all of prague and the nearlby surroundings.

A church that can be admired by all. I have toured many churches, including the Vatican, and this is a must see. Even is you are not religious you will have to admire this church. The architect is absolutely beautiful and the stained glass windows are amazing to watch as the sun comes through and changes the columns in the church to a kaleidoscope effect. The church was closed on Monday so check if you are going on a Monday. The tour can be quite long but if you have the time you should consider it. If you have the legs consider the bell tower. It is almost 300 narrow steps to reach the top. The steps will take your breath away and so will the view. There are many places to go in Prague to get an overview of the city. This was my favorite not only because of the spectacular view of Prague but also for the view of St. Vitus steeples. There is also an open case view showing how the bell tower clock works. Sit on the bench, catch your breath, and enjoy watching time happen. There are fees involved here including using the restroom. The tower entrance does not take charge cards but the information and ticket center does. This is a must see in my opinion.
St. Vitus Cathedral. Absolutely amazing place and for free if you are going in from the right door. Easy to go there by a tram number 22 and also easy to get out. Must see! +++++

Lots of Gold.... Worth the visit with its amazing widows and gold ,steeped in history .There are some translations in English which were informative and surprising .We visited it as part of a deal with the castle and Gold lane .Worth the money .

Beautiful Cathedral. This was one of the most beautiful churches we saw on our trip of the Danube River area. The stained glass windows are amazing. The only negative was the crowds inside the church making it hard to take the time to really enjoy the true beauty of the building.
Architectually stunning. Beautiful cathedral, reminiscent of Barcelona. Lovely grounds to walk around on a beautiful day too. Well preserved and looked after. Attention to detail is brilliant.

Visit at night. Go at night or sunset to get a picture under street lamps...very cool and eerie.
The square can be a little noisy with tourists during the day but late at night coming back from a venue it should be quiet.
Really beautiful building. One of the must see buildings in Prague. Did not get the chance to look inside but the exterior is truly impressive.
Lovely Church. We saw quite a few churches but this one is totally worth it and it's on the amazing grounds of the Castle District.

Jaw Dropping Gothic Cathedral. The architecture is absolutely stunning. The stained glass windows from the inside are some of the best in the world. You need a ticket to tour the inside of the cathedral but is absolutely worth it.

A gem!. We toured with a group and we were stunned to find this property nestled within the castle walls. The history of this place is something you need to hear from a guide if you can possibly do so.

Very beautiful cathedral. Next one of must have to visit in Prague.
Entrance to first part is for free. If you buy ticket for visiting castle, entrance to Vitus Cathedral is also included.
IF you have time, also visit Tower of Vitus Cathedral it cost 150CZK and you will have really nice view to the whole city.

9 am is the time to be there. I bought the less expensive ticket and spent 3 hrs wandering through the church, the Palace, the cathedral and The weapons museum. I spent over an hr in the Cathedral without realizing it. So much to see. the architecture is something.Crowds were large later in the day, although the ticket is good for 2 days I never got back after my 3 1/2 hours on day one. Top choice for things to do in my opinion.

Amazing... Unavoidable.... There is nothing to be said in advance. Just :- Unavoidable, Absolutely beautiful...- Take your time to visit the cathedral... plenty of time...- Do not forget the outside...- Audio-guide must be AVOIDED, expensive and foolish comments !PS. Take package B including cathedral, palace, basilica and Gold Lane

A must see when you visit the Prague Castle area. Reminds us of the Cologne Cathedral only smaller, but a wonderful Gothic Cathedral. The sculptures around the outside are amazing enough but the interior artwork takes some beating. Yes you will have a fee, the multi sight ticket is the best covers all, but it is well worth it. Not a place to rush around, take your time and just take in all that you can see...enjoy.

Mesmerizing Cathedral. This magnificent Cathedral is in the grounds of the castle overlooking Prague. The interior décor and history behind this building makes it a worthwhile place to visit. Haing guide was of great value.
Unreal. The sheer magnitude of this cathedral is inspiring and everything about it is simply wow! We loved it!
Amazing Gothic Cathedral. Breath taking. Allow yourself time to wonder around and don't be put off by the long queue to get into the castle.
Comparatively small but amazing architecture. See this as part of your visit to the castle. Reasonably priced tickets get you round most of the grounds.
like something from a Harry Potter movie. Twin medieval towers with dark Gothic ornamentation. The stuff you see in storybooks but REAL! SO impressive.
Magnificent Cathedral. Grand cathedral with magnificent architecture and design. Definitely worth a visit when visiting Prague.
Stained glass to feast on. Wonderful workmanship and colours to enjoy in a huge old cathedral with tombs of past rulers. Wish I knew my Bohemian from my Moravian.
Another must see. I wonder at the construction and art and how this church was built. It is a beautiful place see take a break and see the beauty and the peace.

Great Stain Glass windows. Part of the Prague Castle complex and accessible by tickets in various options depending on what parts of the Castle you want to see.
Architecture and stain glass windows very impressive and huge vaulted ceiling.
Well maintained and the inevitable queuing well managed.
Amazing!. So amazing! One of the most beautiful cathedrals I've ever been! St. George's at Prague Castle is also worth to be visited

St Vitus is a must see.. A charming Cathedral with lots to see, history- architecture and the views are fantastic. A morning or afternoon visit is needed to do it justice not a place to nip in or rush around.

Well preserved cathedral. This cathedral has benefitted by being located in the centre of Prague castle so the building has been well protected. Not too much access is allowed within the building itself but where one can walk around the sights are gorgeous.

Beautiful cathedral. Located within the Prague Castle complex, you can't miss it. tram No. 22 (stop called Pražský hrad) stops near the gardens and cathedral. Visitors without the tickets can see the church from the place below the gallery.

Beautiful. Very magnificent majestic building.
During the day thete are many people who are snapping pictures. Which can be annoying. But on my way back to my hotel in the evening is when this building came alive to all its glorious splendour.

A quick look at St vitus cathedral. This was a rushed visit. Perhaps one day I can return and run through the church which is a modern day historical monuments , documentinf Czech and eastern European history.
Worth the ticket. If you are a big fan of old churches you should most definitely see this one. The stained glass is particularly unique and it has an interesting history.

Beautiful architecture!. This is a newer church in Prague Castle as compared to St George's. It's also bigger in size and much more modern. Amazing architecture is all I can say! Also, a queue to enter as they limit a number of people entering the church.

St vitus cathedral in the Prague castle. Nice for wedding shoots and the interiors were very nice to photograph. Bit crowded when we visited.
Keep atleast an hour to enjoy the sight

Good but busy. The cathedral is worth a look inside which is free but for full access there is a charge. Its good but there are better churches to go inside in the city. Coach parties seem to arrive almost as soon as the Castle complex opens so get there at opening time and get past them to avoid the crowds

Amazing architecture.. Every time i looked at this building i saw something different and amazing. I just love gothic architecture and this building has everything gothic. It's so beautiful. Didn't go in side but i didn't need to, the outside is just wonderful.
Majestic part of the castle tour. St. Vitus Cathedral is absolutely amazing gothic architecture plus full of religious artefacts.Take the guided tour!

Beautiful cathedral, no need to buy the ticket . The cathedral is beautiful on the outside and on the inside. You can go inside for free to see a few of the stained glass windows and see the how huge the cathedral is, however this is just the small area around the entrance, to see the remainder of the cathedral you have to purchase one of the expensive Castle combo tickets, which isn't really worth it in my opinion, as the paid for areas are pretty much more of what you can see in the free area and nothing more special, and was really crowded when I went. You won't miss much if you don't buy the ticket.
Cool cathedal popular with tourists. This cathedral is pretty cool...but if you have seen one you have seen them all. I would not prioritise this as something to do.
OK as part of the Castle Tour. Compared to the other great cathedrals of Europe, the interior is not up to par. The exterior is magnificent and is worth walking around.

Breathtaking Cathedral - A Must See!. Going to Prague Castle is a must and this is the cherry on top. You will be mesmerized by the beauty inside and out of this historic cathedral. Outside is awe inspiring. Inside your head will be on a swivel. There is so much beauty to take in, you will think you are in Italy or France. This is right up there. Don't miss it!

Spectacular Cathedral with staggering stained glass. Raining while there. What a zoo, gazillions of people. The Cathedral and the Palace did not disappoint, however. Make sure you also see Lobkowitz palace, with a guide.

St. Vitus Cathedral. In the castle district is the St. Vitus cathedral situated around other castles and buildings where there are many photo opportunities. the area is well kept and very clean, it was a long walk up many stairs but there are some good photo spots on the way up well worth the walk.

awesome. Entry by ticket to see the whole of this magnificent structure, but one can just step inside without payment, but would be missing some of the history and collectables of the church. The stained glass windows some of which are quiet modern in comparison with the Cathedral are really something that has to be seen especially with the sun shining on them.

Very impressive building. Go on the guided tour.. Beautiful cathedral with a wealth of stories and history attached to it. I recommend going on one of the guided tours to fully appreciate the history of the building and the various stories associated with the numerous tombs and statues.

jaw dropping!. Walking up the steps into the courtyard where the cathedral is literally made my jaw drop! It is so awesome a site! the sheer size and scale of the place is so amazing! There is so much to see around this area of Prague-a must see.
Simply amazing.... I haven't visited too many Gothic cathedrals, but this easily stands out as one of the most amazing I've experienced so far. A must see!

Beautiful Cathederal. Quite one of the loveliest cathedrals I have ever seen The stained glass windows are particularly beautiful especially the one by Alphonse Musha The statues and Gothic décor is worth the visit. St Wenceslas chapel is richly decorated and set with precious stones Go by Tram 22 to Prazsky and walk downhill to the ticket office

Amazing, Beautiful, Must See!. We saw the spires of this cathedral from Charles Bridge and decided to walk and find it. Little did we know finding it meant going into the castle complex, which meant about 200 steps up hill! Despite that, walking up to St. Vitus is breathtaking. The history and architecture are so amazing. We especially loved the mosaic section. Truly beautiful.

Worth the entrance fee. You can get in for free and admire the sheer size and some of the stained glass windows. Time and budget allowing , do go in. We went around mid day and only queued about 10 mins for the ticket. Will take at least 30 - 45 mins .

A late Gothic cathedral. The close workings of the church with the ruling class are very evident in this cathedral. It was less influenced by devotion to God than by devotion to the ruling class. It is a fitting pair to the castle.
Speechlees. This Cathedral is speechless, amazing statue and glass decoration, and architecture. One of the best attraction of the city.

A must see. Great place. First you can visit the gardens for free (Orangerie 1€ ), then you get inside the fortress and if you can, take an audioguide (350 © for 3 hours) because there are few explanations inside. Don't get the permission for taking photos (50©) because they give you nothing to identify you can take photos and everyone do them.

The best cathedral I've ever seen. The morning light alone makes this place worthwhile. The level of work and detail needed to create this structure is unreal. I can't imagine how many lifetimes it took for people to build this, by hand. So many minute and extravagant parts go into this building. I'm not religious at all and this is just an exceptional piece of art, alone.

Don't miss the Mucha window!. Lovely Gothic cathedral built, amazingly, to house St. Vitus' bones. Built in the 14th century and finished in the 20th. Worth a visit, especially to see the Mucha window--breathtaking.

St. Vitus Cathedral. One of the most amazing churches i have ever seen. A gothic master piece with the most stunning stained glass windows by Alfons Mucha. The cathedral is very historic a it has witnessed coronation of kings and many Bohemian kings have been buried.

Beautiful gothic cathedral. We can see the wonderful gothic and neogothic architecture both outside and inside of the cathedral, which is the most important church in Prague and the Czech Republic. Near by the cathedral you can find the original famous statue of Saint George the dragon-killing (Kolozsvári Márton and Kolozsvári György, 1373).

Majestic. What a location! So elaborate. No wonder it took almost a thousand years to build. Well worth seeing and probably best to make the effort to get there as early as you can as it is busy, busy busy.

A Beautiful Gothic Church. Part of Prague Castle complex, this cathedral is a must in the visit itinerary. The facade is almost as identical as the am Dom in Cologne but the inside were far better with numerous beautiful and colourful stained-glass windows with a chapel especially for St Vitus himself
Amazing!. This building is amazing, there is so much to see, and the stained glass windows are unbelievable! It's like a combination of church and museum.
So striking. It does strike you the moment you see it for the first time! You'll be tempted to get inside but mind the opening hours - could be a bit disappointing when you fail to enter the place.

Simply Stunning. Takes you breath away when you walk inside. Huge building with beautiful architecture and stunning stain glassed windows. There is a bit of a queue to get in but moves pretty quickly.

Unforgettable . I still cannot believe the sheer beauty of the cathedral. This was my favourite attraction in Prague, hands down. You need a ticket to access all areas of the cathedral but it's absolutely worth it. Words don't do the place justice-no trip to Prague is complete without a visit to the cathedral.
Beautiful. Amazing. There's so much to see in there. We spent a good while learning about the history of the cathedral. Really is beautiful
Absolutely beautiful.. It's a must do in Prague. Also there's no entry charges which is great so it is perfect for budget travellers

Beautiful piece of architecture. Realizing that building this cathedral almost took 600 years it's definitely one of the highlight of Prague. You can take beautiful pictures both from the in- and outside!
Top of the hill.. A stunning building from the outside but unfortunately, the queue for entry was too much to endure on a baking hot day.

Beautiful cathedral in the castle. Prague's castle is one of the main highlights of the city and St Vitus cathedral is located in the castle itself.
Its a very very old building but beautiful architecture

pure culture and history. one of the greatest cathedrals of europe. Full of history.
A very impressive building. But further information like audio-guide or personal guide recommended.
Perfect architecture . You must see this building. Inside and outside is both impressive. You can take photos from around the cathedral or inside.
