Beautiful Stained Glass. We had bought a 250kc ticket for Prague Castle so we got to walk round St Vitus Cathedral. The modern stained glass windows were beautiful, unfortunately in August the place was packed so it was a little hard to be able to take the time to fully appreciate it. Definitely worth seeing, but in peak season viewing for free maybe the way to go and paying for entry during quieter times.
a beautiful cathedral. when you're there buy a multiple ticket which can take you up the stairs for the view. Take your time to have a decent visit at the Cathedral
Excellent . Excellent! The most beautiful church in Europe! Huge and awesome! Очень красивый и впечатляющий собор!

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. The most beautiful church in Prague! This is an enormous ancient church that is located on the grounds of the Prague Castle. The stained glass frescoes are magnificent. We were lucky enough to arrive just as mass was starting so we stayed for the service. After mass we were able to walk around and see the inside without all the tourists as the church was closed to the tour groups during the religious service. The light coming in though the stained glass from all directions was beautiful
Wow!. We have been to many, many cathedrals, and this one is great. Better than some of the "well known". Great stained glass, massive Gothic architecture, great history.
Most impressive cathedral ever!. This cathedral is something else. It is just as beautiful inside as the outside. You must visit it when you come to Prague.

Must see when in the castle. If you make your way up to the castle you absolutely have to visit the Cathedral. It is very beautiful. If you just want to take a peak inside you can go there without having to pay anything. If you want to see more and walk around inside the cathedral you need to buy a ticket at the shop before hand.
Breathtaking. St. Vitus Cathedral is absolutely incredible - it was difficult to restrain myself from taking photos of every possible angle because it is just that beautiful.

Astounding & Magnificent. This very large,medieval cathedral is amazing in scale and height! It is situated within the castle complex which requires a fee to enter. It is a well preserved , historical landmark that is wonderful to photograph

Awe-Inspiring Cathedral with Beautiful Art. Even when vied from the outside, the grandeur of this majestic cathedral's old facade and its detailed decoration make you feel so small in front of it, while taking you back the old gothic times.From the inside it is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have yet to see. The brightly coloured stained glass works of Alphonse Mucha contrast really well with the interior. Be sure to stop at the Rose Window (by Frantisek Kysela in 1925-7), which tells the story of creation.While I did prepare myself by reading about the history of the St. Vitus Cathedral, in retrospect, I should have taken a guided tour through the cathedral in order to better understand the many works of art that decorate the cathedral. But still - even without the tour - it was great and well worth the visit.Note that it can get very crowded and the line to get in can be very long. I imagine that it would be best to visit the cathedral as soon as it opens (Hours are Mo - Sa: 9.00 – 17.00; Su: 12.00 - 17.00). I suggest to get the "Prague Castle – Circuit A" tickets, they include other places worth visit within the castle complex and they don't cost too much (full price is about $14).An obvious "Must-Visit", this is one of the best things that Prague has to offer.
Impressive. Very elegant & impressive, beautiful stained glass windows and fresco's. Contains the tomb og Good King Wenceslas.

Buy a ticket and visit the entire cathedral.. It worth it. First time I visited it I need buy a ticket and only visited the area that allowed for everyone. Second time I bought a ticket to visit the castle and the cathedra and the cathedral was rally worth the visit.

What an amazing place. Talking about visiting and amazing cathedral!?. Coming here is like a dream come true... you need to really feel the love for things like this to appreciate it to the fullest... The admiration for the architecture is to die for... It is impressive to say the least.

Make sure you have audio guide. Breathtaking cathedral in the Palace, but we made the mistake of not getting the audio guide. So much history to take in and 3 different architects lead to magnificent structures and truely a cathedral not to be missed while in Prague. Go early? Tours sell out, or better yet book your tour in advance with your Travel Advisor.
Gothic built six hundred years. Magnificent stained glass windows by artists like Alfons Mucha, silver cenotaph of saint John Nepomuk and tomb of saint Wenceslas.

Beautiful. Highlight of seeing prague castle. It was ornate, beautiful and historical. No entrance fees to get in, but to walk around there were. Very long line that went very fast. They were organized.

Sorry, but Czech tourism has exceeded the level of acceptable greed!. I first visited Prague in 1969 and came to love the place, however successive visits have made me like it less!Of course since the opening up of Eastern Europe it's inevitable that tourist numbers have steadily increased, but does Czech tourism really have to rip them off so shamefully? St Vitus it the Czech national shrine and a CHURCH ! Is it really necessary to restrict free access to a small area just inside the doors and literally shunt crowds through such a small area? It would not be untoward to charge a small fee to see the Crown Jewels, but not the whole of the rest of the building!Sadly , this is an insidious habit that seems to be increasing in Europe, but I for one will not pay to go into a national place of worship: surely the maintenance of the fabric of such buildings is rightly the duty of the respective states who should be proud to give access to them to foreign visitors.

A Must See in Prague. Beautiful building filled with history. This is a must see. We toured both in the day when it was very crowded and then again in the evening when the crowds were gone and the lighting was spectacular! One or twice, day or evening, it is not to be missed.
Amazing !. St. Vitus Cathedral is so amazing when you are looking at it. It's an excellent example of Gothic architecture and is the largest and most important church in Czech Republic.

Good old gothic church. The cathecral is inside Prague's Castle which by the way is a must go. As many great gothics cathedrals, it is very beautiful and worth a visit. The general admission ticket allows entrance to several buildings in Prague's Castle including the cathedral.

Take a walk up to the top. Besides the beauty of the church inside, buy a ticket and walk up the 287 steps to the top to get a great view of the city. As busy as the area is, it was surpsingly quiet at the top without a lot of crowds. The breezes were great and and the view of the city was great.

Very nice to see!. The cathedral is beautiful to see! from the outside and from the inside!
it is huge! and it has so many small details to look at! absolutely great!

Great place to spend a few hours outside. This is a large complex to wander, and is essentially a park, but with old fortification walls, a beautiful cathedral, benches and view points over the Vltava river and Prague, and pubs to relax at. Highly recommended as a day event with good weather. It's also nice in the fall-winter if you dress appropriately.

Extremely crowded but not to be missed.. The foundation stone for St Vitus cathedral was laid in 1344, but the building was not completed until 1929. The Gothic splendour of the choir and chapels, designed by Peter Parler and his sons between 1352 and 1399 was intended to demonstrate Charles IV's power as Holy Roman emperor. It was also intended to be a place of international pilgrimage. But building was halted by wars, lack of money and lack of will and only started again in the 1870s.The chapel housing the body of St Wenscelas is sumptuously decorated in gold, jewelled inlays and colourful wall paintings .In contrast, in the south choir aisle, there is the huge and ostentatious silver Baroque tomb of St John of Nepomuk, installed in 1736. A pair of splendid stained glass windows designed by Czech artist, Alfons Mucha, around 1900, light up the otherwise unremarkable late 19th century nave. Outside,,on the south wall of the cathedral is an elaborate mosaic over the Golden Gate,ceremonial entrance.Dating from 1370, it shows the Last Judgment and is made of Bohemian glass,a unique survival. An exhibition in the cathedral shows how the mosaic was painstakingly restored by the Getty Conservation Institute during the 1990s. A walk round the exterior also gives an opportunity to marvel at the daring and complex sytem of flying buttresses that support the mediecval choir.
Just amazing!. This will not cease to amaze you, even though there is an entry fee if you wish to see the whole cathedral, it's definitely worth it.
Great Cathedral that can rival the most of historic European places. Little bit too busy and the line up is way very long but by looking you can be mesmerized by the shear size of the outside.

Such a great place!. This is the second time I've been to St Vitus and it didn't disappoint! It's a lovely church with fabulous stained glass windows. The Mucha Window is my favorite. I definitely recommend getting here early (right before they open) because you'll have some amazing moments to yourself while everyone is parading in.
Awesome!. The whole tour of the area was amazing! So much culture and history behind those walls. Definitely recommended!

Mighty St Vitus. There is an entry fee if you want to see the whole cathedral, but it is definitely worthwhile to spend an hour enjoying the architecture and the glass windows. Over on the left side of the cathedral is Wenceslas chapel which has the doorway to the Crown Jewels and also the statue of the Virgin Mary that was hidden behind a wall and revealed to the Arabs that invaded and encouraged them to flee Prague.

Simply beautiful. Packed with history, the cathedral is amazing to look at and learn about! You certainly must see this, it's the highlight of the castle district! It's a little crowded, and you can't access as much of the cathedral as you might like to, but the most amazing part is certainly the detail of the building, which can be enjoyed without even going inside. The interior is also amazing, with some brilliant stain glass windows to enjoy.Don't miss out!
Well worth the stroll up the hill!. Another must visit place in Prague.Yes it's busy but on a sunny day it's more than worth your while.

An imposing structure with beautiful architecture. Just getting to this place is a bit of an adventure, with lots to see and do.When you finally get there you see just how massive this structure is, it is surrounded by a large courtyard and buildings. There are shops to get souvenirs and things.There is a charge to get in, I can't remember the cost, but it's not expensive. Be aware though, there are about 300 steps to walk up to get to the top, so you best stay outside if you are unable to traverse them.The weather was great before we got there, then as soon as we got there the wind picked up and a storm came, signs getting blown around, people blown all over the place, pouring rain, it was perfect atmosphere.It is definitely worth a visit, even if you don't go up the stairs, you can hang around downstairs and get an amazing view of the inside,

Simply stunning. This cathedral us so worth a visit. The art and architecture are amazing.The only thing I would say is some tourists are so disrespectful singing songs from the sound of music at the top of their voice.This is a church for goodness sake!!!It's s beautiful fascinating part of Pragues history that you must see.

Imposing. A structure of immense scale that dominates the castle complex. Gravity defying architecture but a less than holy atmosphere. Tour groups don't whisper here like they do in St Peters or Canterbury Cathedral.

Everything covered in dust. It is clear that the cathedral is beautiful with stunning artifacts and stained glass windows however what captured most of my attention was that everything is completely covered in dust. All the gold and beautiful wood carvings on alters etc is completely faded to look at. So sad to see what could have been magnificent was now just average experience
worth to see. It is architecture is wonderful, you have to walk to reach the cathedral so prefer afternoon or early in the morning to visit there.

One of "must see" in Prague. A beautiful gothic cathedral - the most important one in country. You should be ready for long queue, due to actual safety checks in Prague Castle area. Truly gothic architecture. Wonderful surrounding of Prague Castle Gardens and Old Town in the valley.
Beautiful . Went here and was extremely impressed. Such a beautiful site!! and inside is just awesome. Visiting all the castles and cathedrals in Prague is a must.
Worth seeing. Very interesting cathedral. Historical! Suggest you have a guide or audio to fully understand history. Link with castle visit to save time.
Fabulous . One you have to experience first hand to really appreciate. Number must if visiting Prague. Breathe taking experience.

Awe Inspiring. This is an imposing and awe inspiring structure that must rank with the top cathedrals in the world. Its exterior massiveness is accentuated by the fact that other building skirt the structure. Add this closeness with its footprint and height, and its is something to behold. Walk the circumference and enjoy the intricate architecture, highlighted by its flying buttresses. The interior is striking and ornate, as would be expected, and deserves a slow and deliberate tour in order to fully take it all in. If you visit one church in Prague, it should be St. Vitus.

Queues galore. My wife and I visited here last weekend. The site of the castle itself is interesting but there were lengthy queues which meant we were unable to actually enter the cathedral having paid for a ticket. I estimate the queue would have been well over an hour which was made worse by the numerous tourists who don't know the meaning of a queue and have not manners.

An Imposing Exterior. To get into St. Vitus Cathedral I bought ticket 'B' which was 125 Kč for students and 250 Kč for adults so about £8 and £4 respectively. This didn't just include the cathedral but 3 more attractions too. The outside was very imposing and gothic. Amazing detailing was used. However when I got inside it was just a bit lacking... although I feel this might have been the fault of my plan! I very much preferred St Nicholas' cathedral which although had a uninteresting exterior when you walked inside it was awe-inspiring and I had visited this first which left St. Vitus Cathedral a lot to live up to! So maybe if you have the option visit this first before St Nicholas' cathedral. There were some beautiful stain glass windows and also the tomb of Good King Wenceslas (a favourite carol of mine so I was very enthusiastic about seeing this).Definitely worth the money. I visited in August on a Saturday so you can only imagine how busy it was and the length of the queues however me and my SO both agreed that it was well worth it. (However I know some people that do hate queueing and lots of tourists so I'd suggest if that's you to not visit during the main holiday season!).
Stunning. I found this Cathedral absolutely stunning. From every angle I was awestruck. The colours of the structure, the intricacy of the tiles on the roof. Couldnt get enough.
Magnificent. We decided that we would only go in the free part, and it didn't disappoint. The colours in the windows are amazing, and we loved the gargoyles.

Beautiful Cathedral!. Visited the Cathedral with a private tour guide just for the four of us. Well worth it. Lots of interesting information that we probably wouldn't have gleaned on our own. Arrived just a bit after 9. No wait to get a ticket and virtually no wait to go into the Cathedral. When we returned later in the day to visit the royal gardens, HUGE lines.
Interesting. I really do like old catholic churches. This cathedral was beautiful on the outside and the inside. You are also allowed to take photos of the inside.
Incredible architecture. This cathedral is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I've seen in all the places I've visited in Europe. Another must see in Prague.

Beautiful Cathedral - (don't miss the Bell Tower!). Impressive architecture! The cathedral is neatly slotted in on the grounds of Prague Castle and is definitely worth visiting. The line for inside was long when we visited but moved very fast. Also I highly recommend visiting the top of the bell tower, it may be a lot of steps but the view is totally worth it!

Book tours online. It's worth iy. What an incredible experience. After seeing the Duomo in Milan, the kids were disappointed but the other monuments are amazing too. The lines are very long if you haven't bought tickets so buy these online. Don't miss it!

Inpressive!. Maybe one of the most impressive place i've seen in my holiday in Prague. The building is absolutely outstanding from the architecture to its size . It is a must if you are in Prague. Don't miss it!

Centre-piece of Prague Castle complex. The long queues to enter the Cathedral during the summer months are worth the wait, particularly of you pre-purchase a ticket which allows one to walk the entire circuit of the interior.nget there just before noon to get the best chance of short queues as many visitors are observing the changing of the guard ceromony at that time.While there are larger and more ornate Cathedrals throughout Europe, it would have to rate amongst the top twenty, and perhaps even amongst the top 10. Many of the exhibits have both Czech and English explanations which brings the history to life.

Magnifique . The facade is so marvelous and the cathedral itself from inside is amazing. Like any old European cathedral, St. Vitus has one of the most beautiful stained glass windows I have ever seen! Worth the visit.
The Cathedral of all Cathedrals. Oh my word, if you miss this place you are missing the focal point of this city. Pay to walk all the way around the interior to see the amazing stain glass windows.
Breathtaking!. A must-see! A ticket is needed to see beyond the inner entrance hall. Be prepared to line up if it's the tourist season.
A must see.... ...and get a guided tour to beat the queues! Don't forget to do the 'History of Prague Castle' tour section. Very worthwhile!
Stunning . Amazing place with so much history. Audio guide is particularly helpful here. The lines move very quick so don't be deterred by it.

Poor. Well although Cathedral outside is great, inside remains mistery to me. First of all I visited Rome and if there you have free entrance to St. Peter Basilica (at least when I went) I dont see why they charge entrance here. Never the less it big crows in front of ticket sale, at then also big crowd to enter. Also due the terrorist treath throughout Europe, security is at the entrance. Too much time to spent waiting.

Truly stunning. I could not wait to visit the cathedral having seen so many beautiful photos, to see it in person is absolutely astounding. Photos don't capture the true beauty of this place, it really is better in person. Although there is usually a very long queue, it does move fairly quickly and it's certainly worth it. The cathedral is huge and I felt tiny and insignificant stood next to it, the gothic style and the stained glass windows are truly stunning!I would definitely pay another visit the next time I'm in Prague. Please note, that you can get into the cathedral without a ticket although you won't be able to go any further than the first section as there are barriers in place. Only those with tickets can explore the rest of the cathedral. To be able to take photos in and around the cathedral and castle, you need to buy a photo permit which costs 50Czk which I did however no one actually checked to see if I had one while I was taking photos.

1200 years of history in an historic setting. This was the first of several old cathedrals we visited in Central Europe. The rich interiors are fascinating. I wish our tour had been a little earlier, rooms were being closed off before we finished. We toured with a French and three young people from Holland, so the tour was bilingual thus translation took a little longer.
Beautiful!. I was mesmerized from the moment I saw the cathedral. I love Gothic architecture, in general. So you can imagine my amusement when I saw it. Def worth visiting!
Splendid work of art!. Very beautifully crafted interiors, worth a visit. Is beautiful both outside and inside. Even if there is a queue, it is worth the wait.

Absolutely stunning gothic cathedral. You should not miss to enter in this cathedral. It's breath taking place. I can't decide is it more beautiful from inside or outside. From outside you can't stop watching towers, details and arcades and from inside you cant stop watching colorful windows, pillars, details... really breathtaking place. It's worth standing in the queue to enter in this cathedral no matter what is your religion.

Impressive!. When seeing the cathedral from Charles bridge and then standing in front of her you are just amazed by this fantastic building! It is huge, it is impressive and all the fine works that the stone carvers did - wow!!!

AMAZING CATHEDRAL. This is the biggest Cathedral in Prague The history and religion lovers shall not miss this classic architectural piece of Art. The access is very easy and you can have a bu or tram to reach easily. Inside decor and information are worth watching..This one can say an iconic part of Prah

Longest line and fee. Need to be here really early in the morning or other month! Longest line I ever seen and if you didn't pay for a ticket you only could walk 10 meter in to the cathedral! The breathtaking views outside of the cathedral is wort the "climbing"
NEAT!. Very neat to check out. Even if you just view the outside. Its great to see the design of the cathedral.

Don't miss this. St. Vitus is stunning on the outside and I was worried the inside could not compete. It did and surpassed my expectations. If you arrive and the line is long (past the ropes and around to the back of the cathedral), just move on to the other sights and come back later instead of wasting time in line. We did this and later in the afternoon the line moved very quickly with about a 5 to 10 minute wait as opposed to a 30 minute wait.

Stunning.. We bought a B-ticket, and the Cathedral was included in this set. It was worth every penny. Marvellous building. However, to really appreciate this amazing construction, you have to enter the paying-visitors only area.

Outstanding gothic architecture. This is the landmark of Prague, together with Charles bridge and the astronomical clock. You can enter for free only in a small place, but you must buy a ticket to visit it all.

Go up the tower! . Beautiful inside. The archetecture is lovely and huge. Love the stained glass windows. Not too big so you don't get lost. A must is walking up the tower. It's draining and no elevator but the views over Prague are great. Have a look up and it looks simply amazing. Not much money to do it either!!!
Great place to visit. Best time to go is early morning otherwise you will be amongst the thousands of tourists trying to take photos etc

Wonderful. It was part of the overall tour we took of the castle. The stained glass windows are wonderful. The church is almost overwhelming with the amount of detail it contains. They offered a narrative on tape but we declined to purchase that. There is a lot of descriptions with each monument in English.

St Vitus is a must. During our castle visit we were keen to go inside this Cathedral- didn't mind paying. The ornate features inside are breath taking. No flash photography but my iPhone pictures were fine. Still doesn't truly reflect the awesomeness !
Simply amazing..... Try and visit early to beat the crowd, great design and architecture. An awesome cathedral, but can get too crowded and busy.
Beautiful Cathedral. Very nice and monumental cathedral, the building inside and outside makes a great impression. Great example of perfect architecture.

Astonishing. If you like churches/cathedral's architecture, and its characteristics, this is a must see. Not to mention it's located where you can see Prague from the top. Amazing pictures can be taken from the castle complex, where you can find the Cathedral, and other attractions. Enjoy a whole afternoon there. You won't regret it!
Stunningly beautiful. Worth your time to slowly make your way through the building. Interesting combination of architectural styles over a number of years makes it different.

Amazing Prague - sensory overload. what part is not so amazing. St Vitus was as beautiful as the cathedral in Cologne. However what I did not like, typical European, is that you have to pay admission. I know it for upkeep but Washington DC is free.
The venue inside the Worlds largest castle. With fantastic stain glass and ceilings up to 35m high this is some church! Plenty of things to see and as long as you don't use a flash cameras are ok!

Amazing architecture. This is one of the sightseeings in Prague that you must visit. The architecture is just amazing! You can go inside for free without a ticket, but if you want to walk around the whole place, you will need a ticket. The ticket office does not sell individual tickets unfortunately so you will need to buy ticket package which allows you to go into a number of places nearby, and the best place where there is a tower that you can climb up to see the whole Prague, you need to buy a separate ticket. Therefore, if you don't want to pay a higher price for the ticket package, you can still see the inside of this Cathedral for free, then just pay the cheaper single ticket for the tower.

A must see when visiting the castle (need ticket to see ALL of it). This is a very old Cathedral and has everything you expect from such an old treasure. The many details both inside and outside are spectacular and you can't help try to imagine the life of everyone.Free entry - BUT if you want to see all of the inside you need to buy a ticket before you get in line and there is a long line to get in.

Stunning stained glass. Once inside the castle grounds, you must visit this cathedral to see the stained glass by Alphonse Mucha, the beautiful St. Winceslas Chapel, and take in the extraordinary grandeur of this amazing Gothic structure. It is truly one of the highlights of the castle tour.

Beautiful Cathedral. Huge lines to get in but moved relatively quickly considering. Absolutely worth the wait. Cathedral is free but there is another bit inside which you need a ticket for. We didn't realise tickets for the Cathedral were included in the ticket packs for the castle (which we went to get after we visited the cathedral-buggar) so if you are planning to actually buy tickets make sure you get them before you wait in line to get in the Cathedral as there is a ticketed section! In saying that- didn't seem to miss much just staying in the free area. Lots of people but absolutely stunning cathedral!
Pretty cathedral built recently.. It was a bit difficult to get into the church,another line to pay to view the Mucha Window. The inside is pretty, but what a crowd!
A must see. if you go to prague this is a must! go during the day and during the evening, the castle complex is mesmerizing and the cathedral just tops it

Mighty Cathedral. Both the exterior and interior of St.Vitus Cathedral are sights to behold. Set in the Prague Castle complex, it looks out onto the old town and city of Prague below. Inside. there are many beautiful glass-stained window and columns to observe as well as a stunning altar area.

A must in Prague for a divine experience. The beautiful Gothic architecture,the stunning stained glass windows and the spiral steps for even a much better view of the old city will be surpassed when you mix the sights and sound with the experience when attending the holy mass.visit the multiple chambers inside and take a walk through the history.The museum and the shop is full of information.The crowds will determine how much you can make of the visit so try an aim for hours that draw less tourists.
Stunning . Stunning looking and just as lovely inside. Well worth the money to get in.A really unique building with plenty of info on it about.
Later better than earlier!. Magnificent historical monument, impressive from the distance and when you are standing right by it. If you want to see when less crowded go after lunch or in the evening.

Amazing stained glass. So it's not the oldest or most famous but it is impressive. The history is an interesting one and the stained glass windows were the most beautiful I've seen.Lines weren't too long and moved quickly when we went. Enjoy but keep an eye on your stuff. Word is this is a popular pickpocket spot.

A Must See in Prague Castle district!. The St. Vitus Cathedral has glorious stained glass windows and some of the most stunning architectural lines I have ever seen. Go early to avoid long lines. It's part of the Prague castle compound and a short distance to some of the most stunning views of the city. It's an absolute must see for anyone traveling to Prague. Easy and inexpensive access using the tram. A 24 hr ticket 2.20 US$ purchased in a hotel gift shop gave me public transportation by way of tram, bus, subway. No need to use taxis to get around.
Beautiful !!. St. Vitus is one of the most beautiful churches in Eastern Europe! Crowded in August, but well worth the visit.

The most stunning stained glass windows I've ever seen. I'm not religious so don't really appreciate visiting churches, but this was included in the ticket for the castle.. it actually turned out to be the most impressive part of the castle area so I'm very glad we went in. The architecture is beautiful anyway, but I was blown away by the most stunning and largest stained glass windows I've ever seen. The colours are incredible, and each one is in a different style. There was some other bizarrely ornate stuff in there worth seeing but for me it was all about the windows, never taken so many pictures of windows anywhere. We visited on a Sunday afternoon in June and it was fairly busy but not unpleasantly so, we certainly didn't queue to get in.

Make sure you pay extra to see ALL the inside.. The stained-glass windows are worth the price of admission. If you are on a tour of Prague, make sure it includes the entire cathedral. Some tours only include the free part of the cathedral that doesn't get you close to most of the Windows. The private chapels on the sides also worth the admission price.

Beautiful and tiring!. Situated inside the castle complex is this architectural marvel. Stunning to look you can also climb the south tower for a panoramic view of old Prague. However be warned that the climb is not easy with 287 steep spiral steps which were designed for use by a single person at a time. Climbing them is not a matter of fitness but can also be a scary experience if you have tourists coming down and you are trying to climb up. There is hardly enough place to get a foothold. Once you reach the top the view is definitely worth it. All in all one of the many beautiful buildings in the castle complex.

Impressive but ridiculously busy. Having visited the Vatican, I can honestly say that this is one of the most impressive religious buildings I've seen outside of Italy.That being said, the sheer volume of tourists passing through, all constantly stopping to take pictures ruins the experience. There is a one system set up designed to guide tourists around the building but it feels more like a cattle market when your in the middle.Still worth a visit

Most fantastic cathedral I've seen!. Loved the architecture of the 3 distinct periods of building/ rebuilding of this cathedral. The stained glass windows (more modern than typically seen in churches), the history associated with it. Very striking outside as well as inside!
A must see...

Amagin. We didn't do the full tour of the cathedral but just seeing it inside and out was incredible. It's position inside the castle complex is perfect for the dramatic reveal when you enter the 3rd courtyard and the beauty of the cathedral cannot be overstated.

Beautiful cathedral. One of the most beautiful cathedrals around. Try to avoid going in after 10am since there would be quite a queue with everyone trying to get inside. Wonderful works of stained glass. Try to visit the place from the outside at night - it is a wonderful sight.

The Best of Prague.... When in Prague, everybody will eventually make it up the hill and visit the Cathedral. I have visited many times and hope to return. For the fabulous Mucha stained window. The ornate St. Wenceslas Chapel. The Catacombs. The Gargoyles. For the amazing architecture - 600 years in the making! I have attended a concert here - Beethoven's New World Symphony. On a beautiful summer night many years ago, in the Cathedral filled to capacity. I have attended a Sunday mass here on a freezing December morning with only a few people in attendance. A visit in the spring with my whole family traveling to Prague from the States. The youngest just 3 years old mesmerized with the massive, ornate, solid silver tomb of St. John of Nepomuk. Every visit is memorable, no matter how many times I visit. Time after time , no matter the season ...The St. Vitus Cathedral is one of my favorite places in Prague...
Beautiful Cathedral.... One of the most beautiful Cathedrals I have seen ( although didn't quite enjoy the long queues to get inside..)

Not my favorite cathedral, but very nice. I love cathedrals and churches and have seen many in the past ten years of visiting Europe. This one was very nice, but not at the top of my list. I think a tour would have greatly helped us appreciate the cathedral but there were none to be had when we visited. We thought the outside was spectacular!

It was beautiful. One of my favorite parts of the castle. It's worth to visit. The other part was the south garden. Which is beautiful and has a beautiful view over the city. The other parts wasn't that good. I didn't like the torture chamber and museum.

A must see!. St Vitus, the center piece of any city view is a must see. It is free, but if you want to see more of the Cathedral by the Castle District ticket and walk around more of the interior. There is a possibility of metal detectors and current security due to proximity to the presidential offices located across the square. Go early, 9am!!!
A snap of history . The kids just love that pice of history ... and the atumospher was just perfact so if it works for the kids it work for is as well
Beautiful Cathedral . A must see whilst at Prague Castle. The stained glass windows are magnificent. The building is very Gothic. A must see.

So beautifull must go inside. We bought tickets at the "i" tickets shop in front of the cathedral-much quick than at the main entrance. We bought the ticket to 4 places -and enjoy it . Dont be afraid of the long line waiting to get into the cathedral, if you come early befor 11 it will go fast.

Nice Cathedral, but long lines and it closes too early. We visited St. Vitus as part of our Prague Castle walking tour with Next City Tours (highly recommend). Unfortunately, St. Vitus closes at 5pm, which is kind of prime-time for tourists to still be out sightseeing, in my opinion, so I'd like to see it stay open later. On the day we visited, security was conducting bag checks of every person walking into the cathedral, which our guide said is unusual, so we had to queue for maybe 15-20 minutes and beg security to let us inside, as it was almost closing time. The stained glass inside the cathedral is AMAZING -- some of my favorite after having visited 15+ cathedrals across Europe. It's super interesting to me that the cathedral is part of the castle, but was built in various stages and wasn't even completed until the early 1900s.Don't make a special trip just for the cathedral, but if you're going up to the castle, make sure you allot enough time to go into the cathedral before 5pm and take in the amazing stained glass.
Amazing church. This church is a must see together with the rest of the castle. The glass mosaics are amazing if you think that the room itself is not impressive enough.

Incredible!. This place is absolutely amazing. You first see it as it sticks out over the castle way high up on the hill! Then you walk through the gate and are awestruck with the 2 towers on the front! As you walk around the outside, the gargoyles and flying buttresses are a smaller version of Notre Dame. When you enter, again you are awestruck! It is massive and everywhere you look are spectacular stained glass windows, sculptures, statues and chapels. You must buy the ticket so you can walk through - not just stand at the entrance, which is free. Also buy the audio guide - the signs with explanations are sparse. Definitely worth a visit and we would do it again!

The best cathedral ive seen. I've been to a few places of worship across vast Europe , most a beautiful but leave me feeling stifled. However whilst it is a little bit overbearing that's just me, it certainly has the best stained glass windows and ornate decorations I have seen.
History of Central Europe. example of Gothic cathedral in which it is worth observing the details, it goes around and see very interesting things about architecture

Huge, beautiful cathedral. It's huge and and the painted glass amazing. Take your time to visit, you can make the tour of the cathedral, castle, basilica and galleries in 2 days. Go see a part of them, enjoy them and the next day see what remained unseen.

What a beautiful Cathedral!. Located in the heart of Prague Castle there lies an excellent Cathedral. If you want to go inside the castle itself you need to purchase tours or tickets but the church is free.
Beautiful St. Vitus. There are amazing stained glass windows and the building it self took hundreds of years to build a must see!

Beautiful, just as expected, pay to go through to the back - worth it!. This place is beautiful, as you would expect of a cathedral from this time period. There is a large area that is free at the back that is swamped with tourists taking photos, but if you pay for the Castle ticket you can gain entry here. You can go around right up to the alter, see the beautiful organ, see all of the beautifully adorned tombs in the back. This stop was the best part of the Castle area by far!

A very beautiful Cathedral that you must visit when you are on vacation in Prague. This is a real must see if you are on vacation in Prague. You can have a very historically and interesting walk around in this part of the city with the castle and the cathedral.

very nice inside. The St. Vitus Cathedral is situated entirely within the Prague Castle complex, so you can see quite a few things whilst in the area.
The Cathedral is a Roman Catholic metropolitan cathedral and is the seat of the Archbishop of Prague.

Beautiful Architecture. Situated at Prague castle this is the largest church of the country.... It was constructed by King Wenceslas... Inside the church are numerous side chapels , tombstones and some amazing coloured stained glass windows created by famous Czech Art Nouveau artists... St. Wenceslas tomb is inside this church. It is possible to climb the 96 m high tower inside the church... Till certain point inside this church is free of charge...
Beautiful. The cathedral is very pretty and is large and grand. . Pay for the ticket to view more extensively and somewhat minimize the crowds. this is a must visit attraction.
They mean good. us as tourists we want to see it all but then you get in and you can't feel and enjoy the touch of history in the crowd of people. And yes I was one of them.
Just Wow. Look down as you enter the courtyard then look up ,Amazing building will just wow you ,the inside is just as spectacular .Gorgeous ceilings , stained glass and history

Truly stunning but you might not need to pay to go in. A very stunning and beautiful church, its probably part of the Prague castle that warrants paying for, that said if you're not massively into churches what you can see from the free viewing gallery is probably enough.

Amazing and beautiful. This is a must see when visiting Prague Castle. The accompanying optional audio tour (for rent) is worth taking. Take notice of the amazing gargoyles that house the rain gutters above.

exceptional cathedral. This impressive building lies in the middle of the Prague Castle. Inside and outside are very beautiful. it is so large that my camera couldn't take it in one picture. Stained glass-windows and ceilings are astonishing. You have to pay to visit the cathedral, but if you only stay in the entrance, you can get in for free and you have a good impression too. Consider: you're never alone on this site: it is overcrowded by tourists with selfie-sticks.
Magnificent Gothic Cathedral. The stained glass windows are probably the most outstanding feature of this building. Worth the entrance fee to be allowed to walk round

Just Beautiful.. Wow such a beautiful cathedral, so we'll build for its time, the goblins hanging from each corner, creepy, such detail. really enjoyed looking around it. Very popular for tourists. Highly recommend seeing it.

Magnificent . İts one of the most magnificent katedral i have ever seen. Feels you like an old age queen. You have to the take your proffessional camera with you otherwise your smartphone can't enough to take whole katedral. While you are looking it from its hall you feel suddenly the dragon will come and pick you up. Must see! Have to be there..
Magnifique. So historical this church. Majestic and beautiful. The statues and the stained glasses leave your breathless
Beautiful chruch. Beautiful Church in Prague Castle.Hugely impressive architecture. The price to go inside was quite steep and again just another church.
Beautiful cathedral. Beautiful cathedral. We rented an audio guide, and it was interesting to learn the history of this building, which needed many centuries to be finished

Breathtaking. We were absolutely stunned by the beauty of the cathedral -although Prague is full of beautiful churches and landmarks, my jaw actually dropped when we saw the cathedral! Full of beautiful windows and displays. Also got to see St Wenceslas' tomb in a room full of delicate paintings and semi-precious stones adorning the walls. Don't miss this!

A really wow expereince. Just to,stand in front of the cathedral is already an experience in itself. This is an enormous church and so beautiful. Just a pity it is so,close to the castle so no opportunity to,take pictures that can justify the beauty of this attraction. From everywhere in the city you can spot the cathedral but when you stand in front of it the real beauty struck you. Don't miss this attraction.

Nice church with great history and big crowds. It's a pleasantly proportioned church with deep historical significance. But that brings hordes of tourists, and it was difficult to get around the parts of the church that are free to visit. Still, this is another must-see site. You may have more luck outside, where there is more space and a better chance to see the building.

Imposing. When we first entered we didnt have a ticket as we had read reviews saying you could see everything from the front. Not true.We entered the second time with the ticket and saw so much more, getting a sense of history and appreciating the beauty. Recommend it!
Well worth a visit. This is a must visit. The architecture is amazing and is a truly stunning building both inside and out. I have no words to describe this other than must visit
quite the structure. this place is huge, we never had the opportunity to go inside, but it is very photogenic outside too

A must see when in Prague. Very interesting place to tour through. Make sure you buy a ticket before you go in or you will only be able to stand just inside the front door. Great historical site and entry comes along with a number of other visits including the palace.
Nice. Good place if you are into cathedrals or architecture. I was amazed about the size when I thought it would be smaller...

Gothic. This place is wonderfully gothic and it is quite dark inside when you visit but it is lovely all the same! There are also some nice cafe's outside too and some shops so you can incorporate a visit here with other things.

So impressive . I really love this place. It is very nice and cannot explain. Just come to see by your eye. Charmingly and very impress. I went by backpack because I don't like to go with tour. You are free to sightseeing upon you . No rush

Another Amazing Cathedral. Gothic outside, adorned with lots of intricate art inside. European churches and cathedrals are filled with history if you are into that sort of thing, and this one certainly seemed to have more stuff inside that most of them. I will admit that after seeing so many of these, I am a little bored of them (and even actually appalled at the human cost and injustice that they represent). But it is sure to please those looking for artwork and tombs of the affluent and privileged.

Great architecture. This is one of the most beautiful gothic cathedrals I have visited. For one inside it is lit up, not all dark and dreary like others. The stained glass windows are beautiful and so is the altar. It's a must visit if you go to Prague Castle.

Worth a visit...once. Prague cathedrals are generally over-the-top Baroque with a Gothic structure. St. Vitus is the standard. There is little warmth to the place, and perhaps the best part is when you emerge from the tunnel and see the vast expanse of the front doors and the outer structure reaching for the sky. The inside is dark and dismal...gothic in the adjectival meaning of the word.

inexplicable rudeness by guards of St. Vitus Cathedral. We took our parents to Europe and visited Prague in July. Comparing with other tourist cities, Barcelona, Naples, Rome, Florence, and Vienna, Prague old town is really charming and Czech people are really nice. We had a wonderful time until we experienced inexplicable rudeness by the guards of Vitus Cathedral. We went inside of the Church late afternoon. After touring the church, my wife and I came out church first to WC. Our parents who were 83 year old, were still inside. After WC, we want to go back to the church to get our parents out. But the guards stopped us, saying that the church was being closed. We explained that our parents were inside waiting for us, they refused to let us in. We then asked the guards to help to get our parents out, but they just pretended that they don't understand our English, rejected our request and closed the door. We started calling our parents to get out, the guards shouted at us as if we were playing a plank with them. We were getting angry, they were even more angrier at us. Finally, someone helped to get our parents out. When the guards saw my father was using a walker to get through the door, he did not say anything or help, and were very rude at us.

Magnificent Cathedral! . St Vitus Cathedral is one of the most intimidating and beautiful buildings I have ever visited. It's a must do when visiting Prague. The front of it was built relatively recently which adds to the charm. The stained glass windows are out of this world. I'm not one who usually appreciates these things but honestly, it's great (and mostly free!).

An impressive cathedral both inside and out. St Vitus Cathedral can be seen emerging from Prague castle from many places in Prague. Its stunning architecture is, in my opinion, somewhat diminished, by having had the castle built around it. That said from a distance and close too there are some very nice photo opportunities. On the day we visited it was very busy and noisy inside - feeling much more like a tourist attraction than a place of worship. There is some very nice stained glass.

Colors !. Very nice cathedral with beautiful stained glass windows! This is the must see inside the prague castle complex! You can also get in to the front for free,but it's worth buying a ticket and walk around the inside!
Just beautiful. Visited last weekend with my wife and friends . The place was really busy with tourists from everywhere . The whole place is stunning with great history throughout

Breathtaking. My jaw droped down when I saw it first. It's marvelous. And the narrow square it's in, show the hight of cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral sgould be in 'Must See' list. By the way, St. Stephen's Cathedral in Vienna was built after this ones beauty.

Cathedral 2016. What an awesome cathedral. We did one of those city tours and almost missed going inside due to the length of the line outside. Then it started to rain and most of the line left and we got right in. The Stained glass windows are gorgeous.

OMG!!!. We got into the cathedral when it first opened and the sun was just rising. The light coming through the windows is one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. The tour groups started to arrive around 9:30, so we had about 30 minutes where the crowds were small.

Must See of Castle Quarter. If you only have time for one building in the Castle Quarter, this is the one that you should see. Read about the building beforehand so that you know what you are seeing -- it will enrich your experience.

Beautiful building.. we visited as part of our tour of the castle. I advise going early - we went to the castle early but left our trip into the cathedral for later on; the foyer gets very crowded but fewer people buy the ticket to go in further. Larger tour groups tend to stay in the foyer for their guide to speak. We took a slow stroll around the cathedral and took in the amazing stained glass windows. It is another must see in Prague.

Gothic. We loved the church! We spent about an hour inside and even climbed the tower. It was a hard climb and was warm, but it was worth it! The views were amazing, and the breeze made us cool off enough to climb back down.
Spectacular . Walking tour of the Cathedral. Extremely well preserved, spectacular views inside and out. Significant historic building. You must visit.

St. Vitus Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral has so many intricate details in its walls. The Tile paintings are very detailed. St. Vitus Cathedral is right next door to the Prague Castle, so you see both, with one 22 Tram ride.

Must See. This is the "Prague Castle" that you see in pictures and from all around Prague! Go earlier in the day, if you go only 2 hours before closing ( as we did) they want to save your money and not give you an audioguide. However our lonely planet guide tidbits more than made up for it!
amazing architecture. The flying buttresses alone make the climb to this cathedral worth the trip. Don't miss the castle grounds, especially the old castle
Go up the towers!. Well worth a trip up the tower for the incredible views over the city but be prepared it's a steep climb, take a drink up with you!

Wonderful!!!. Just Beautiful from top to bottom! The architecture is breath taking, there is a peaceful feeling to it. The stained glalles are a work of art, You should most definitely take a time to visit this church.
Nice. Very nice place to visit if you are ready to walk atop the hills for one of the best views of Prague.

One of the best gothic cathedrals. This is a wonderful gothic cathedral, one of the most beautiful with its soaring columns. Be prepared for throngs of tourists but don't miss it when in Prague. It is within the castle complex which means you have to buy an entrance ticket. Ask for the discount if you are over 65.

Beautiful St Vitus church. Amazing...St Vitus church is beautiful. Worth the visit even though u r here for a day. So not sure what else to say. Good for photographers though the photos i submitted r iphone 7s photography. Did photoshop on iphone before submitting.
More iphone photography, follow me on instagram or facebook. Nicholaskhooimages

Beautiful Gothic Church. A very large Gothic Church which had beautiful stained glass. To take pictures you had to pay a small fee. The Castle area where the church is located is worth spending time to explore.

Nice to visit, but don't buy a ticket. Nice site to visit in Prague, but not worth buying a ticket - you can view enough from the free entrance area. Actually this cathedral is more impressive from the outside as the inside décor/monuments are rather scarce compared to other major cathedrals in Europe.The line up to enter the cathedral looks intimidatingly long, but moves pretty fast, so don't get discouraged.The overpriced audio guide available for rent offers long commentary of some sights within the cathedral, however many monuments and points of interest are missing audio commentary, which is a pity.We did not buy additional ticket to go up the tower (not included in the admission to the cathedral), so can't comment on that.

Fantastic. This cathedral is gorgeous! You can go into the cathedral without a ticket but can not fully explore without one. We purchased the "short" castle ticket that did include full entrance into the cathedral. The stained glass is amazing....light a candle and spend some time in prayer.

Mind-blowing. I love photographing Gothic cathedrals and have visited many, but I think this one beats the others. It took my breath away. Pay the admission fee to see the entire interior. Words fail to express the experience
Stunning!. This is the most impressive cathedral that I've seen. You can enter it even without a ticket at some extent and it is beautiful on the outside as well.

Breathtaking. Without doubt the highlight of all the monuments in the Prague castle. It it was so impressive so commanding and with so many great features. One of the most beautiful cathedrals I have ever seen
Bell tower. Beautiful gothic church. Highly recommendable to climb the bell tower for the amazing view. Make sure to bring a water bottle up with you, as you will be pretty thirsty after the climb.

One of My Favorite European Cathedrals. The title says it all - I've trekked throughout much of Eastern Europe, and none of the cathedrals I've seen can stand up to St. Vitus. The stain glass windows are breathtaking and you are able to go to the top for some even more ridiculous views (so long as you pay a price).

Wonderful building. I really enjoyed going around the cathederal. You could see how it has been added to as time went on. The flying buttresses helped to keep the interior cool. The cathederal is as fascinating outside as in. We were lucky we had been on a tour of the castle grounds as we got the history of the building; the information inside was limited. You do need to pay to explore most of the building, bur the ticket gets you into the other buildings in the castle complex. I didn't see a time limit on the ticket. Overall, well worth a visit.
Simply beautiful. Simply beautiful. The problem is that you have to buy ticket to enter this cathedral with three other locations there. The other places were not that stunning tho!

A must see in Prague. Of all the cathedrals I've seen in a month in Europe, this one stands out. The beautifully scrubbed exterior and brilliant roof tiles honor this house of worship.the teals and blues of the stain glass windows are like no others. Painted friezes and geometric patterns honor all faiths of the children of Abraham. Quite elaborate and graceful. Beautiful restorations.

Prague Castle Cathedral and the Holy Roman Emperor. On a Scenic River Cruise, Gems of the Danube, we did a pre-trip for 3 days in Prague. On our full first day, we went to Prague Castle District and came upon the St. Vitus Cathedral. We paid for a special group "jump the line" tour of the Cathedral. We learned about how the Emperors were crowned at the Cathedral, all the history about this beautiful, holy cathedral. It was very large and in the middle of the castle district. The outside and interior were amazing. I highly recommend d you spend time here and pay for the special tour. Amazing stain glass. Amazing place.

Beautiful church. Before entering the church, you will be stopped if carrying a backpack for it to be searched. Be prepared to wait for that completion.Upon entry to the church, you are met with a very large window of stained glass.....many more fill the entire church with beautiful colors of the glass. The vastness of the church will almost overwhelm you. To visit all of the side altars you will need a ticket.

Rude staff-pretty cathedral. We purchased tickets at the gate and went straight to the cathedral to arrive early and beat the crowds. The guard stopped us and said we didn't have the appropriate tickets. We had purchased them but the ticket agent was thinking about the cigarette break he was about to take and only issued 3/4 tickets correctly. It was solved when we went back to get them corrected. Interesting panels and other details.
beautiful Church. From the outside this is a wery beautiful curch. our guide told us the story of the making of the church. We didt not go inside the church.

An astonishing place but overrun with us tourists. As per the title really. The building itself is a sight to behold and definitely worth a visit even if you don't go inside. It's free to hang around but costs to enter. We decided we would go in as entrance was free with our Prague Card, and it was absolutely worth it for the beautiful windows and displays, even to a couple of atheists like ourselves. As is expected, it does attract an astonising number of tourists, even during the week when we were there. There were vast crowds both in and around the castle, with many being part of large tour groups that move around like enormous oil tankers amongst the crowds. All in all, definitely worth the visit.

Typical Cathedral. This cathedral is found inside the walls of Prague castle. It is a typical Gothic cathedral. The highlight was the different styles of stained glass as well as the massive amount of time it has taken to complete. The nice part was the entrance to view the cathedral was free, if you wanted to get up close and personal with the front there was a cost. To be honest, it was not necessary as there were amazing views from the back.
Intricately awesome!. This church is a gothic one and prolly one of the best ones in Europe. Such a picturesque, massive piece of architecture.

A must see. Highlights were the Mucha stained glass window (with the sun shining through it was a glorious thing) and the Wenceslas chapel. The authorities have wisely decided that the public can only view this from behind a barrier, which preserves both the fabric and the sanctity. Outside there is a wonderful doorway that is also not to be missed.

What a grand old place... but dark and.... The windows are a treat from the inside. As a photographer, I am always looking for light and the tragedy is that all the light seems to be outside this beautiful structure.
Very nice cathedral. St Vitus is nice, but the cathedrals in Vienna and Budapest are more beautiful. It's still is a good to see while you are there.

Rude staff. Don't bother.. Firstly when you enter the castle grounds it is very unclear which way you are meant to go and what you have to pay for. I should have known it was a bad sign when the man inticket office couldn't be bothered to serve us and ushered us to another member of staff. This was just the beginning of a horrible experience. We paid to visit the church and parts of the castle. When we entered the catherdral i started taking photos without my flash as advised. I was using my phone camera and the flash accidently went off. I'm still not sure how. I received a barrage of abuse by the elderly member of staff. I told him it was accident and i hadn't done it on purpose. I was shouted at and humiliated in front of everyone. To me this is completely unacceptable particularly in a place of worship. While i was being told that it wasn't an accident with his arms waving i could see and other tourist whose flash was on being told politely by another member of staff. We left as soon as possible. I was so upset. We didn't bother with the rest of the castle. They could really learn something from La Sagrada Familia in Barcelona.

Soaring. Wow, lots going on here! You're gonna see a lot of stuff, and it's gonna be impressively overstated. Just brace yourselves. Stained glass? Check. Marble? Check. Emotional statuary? Check. Mosaic? Check. Flying buttresses? Check.

Shouldn't Be Missed in Your Prague Trip. Standing in front of this cathedral made me feel so insignificant. This was absolutely stunning inside and out. Inside it contained religion artifacts, statues, stained glass windows, art noveau, St. Wenceslas chapel, etc.. Just don't miss this!

Absolutely brilliant beautiful cathedral . There was a massive queue when we arrived at the cathedral but it moved very quickly and it was so worthwhile to persevere. The stained glass windows and stunning. It is a huge Gothic cathedral and it is immense. The outside of the cathedral is quite ornate especially the golden gate area with painted frescoes. Quite a few famous people are buried there including King Wenceslas.

Beautiful architecture with lots of history. A must see cathedral. Well maintained, visit is free but you need a ticket to visit certain sections. The adoration room for quiet reflection is beautiful too.

Take time to see!. While you can enter the Cathedral for free, if you want to walk around the place, you must purchase a ticket. A great sense of peace comes when you walk through the beauty of this building.
Impressive. You have to see it to believe it. How 15th and 16th century craftsman and stoneworkers could create this defies our perception of how buildings are made.

Gorgeous inside. Worth a trip inside. Don't be discouraged if there are lots of people in line. They crowd control how many go in at a time. Tickets are sold at the information kiosks in the outside wall. There are circuit tickets that include multiple places. We got the circuit B tickets for free with the Prague Card which helped us skip all the crazy lines for individual tickets. The cathedral itself is impressive!!
Beautiful beyond words!. An absolute MUST SEE while in Prague. This cathedral is one of the most beautiful I've seen in Europe - and I have seen quite a few!

Stunning Cathedral. Both externally and internally, this massive twin-spired cathedral is absolutely stunning.The stained glass windows are very impressive as are the altars and statues.A must see place in Prague.

Magnificent. Well worth the admission charge. The Cathedral is richly decorated and is a good location to find on a hot or rainy day.St Vitus Cathedral or the Metropolitan Cathedral of Saints Vitus, Wenceslaus and Adalbert to give it its full title is an excellent example of Gothic architecture. It is part of the Prague Castle Area and will interest visitors as the final resting place of many Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors. Children would be interested to locate the tomb of "Good King Wenceslas".

Impressive, sure.. Nice looking, impressive with decor, kinda church. Free with Prague card.Use public transport to get to the top (or the free-with-Prague card-your to get to the top of the hill).Make sure to eat well before going as there are only overpriced cafes on top. Find your way back to the city (and even then get out if the central tourist area) for a proper restaurant.

my favorite site in Prague. The stained glass windows are breath taking. Be sure to buy a ticket to see the whole cathedral, not just the foyer; its worth it. The whole castle area was my favorite part of Prague.
Not to miss. One of the best Gothic style architectures there is. The Prague castle are wouldn't be much without it. The gargoyles are just amazing.
The longest "Building Project" in history.. Its origins began as a "Rotunda" in the 8th century, This Cathedral evolved over the centuries culminating in its present form in 1923!

Get the Audio Guide. This is a truly beautiful building, resplendent in the excesses of Catholicism (would've said indulgences, but since that is a whole thing, best not!)The gothic outside (love the gargoyles in particular) is awesome, especially taking into account the length of time between certain sections of the building and others.The inside is even better, and picking any specific highlight feels disingenuous, although the obvious one is St Wenceslas' tomb.Only thing that really needs said here, other than I insist you go if you are in Prague, is TAKE AN AUDIO GUIDE! There is very little in the way of information on specific areas to read, and while the splendour makes for a good experience alone, having the history at your disposal in a much better fashion can only add to the majesty.

Beautiful . What a beautiful beautiful place. The stain glass windows are a thing of beauty. The whole place is ore inspiring. I cannot put into words, all I can say is just go, you won't be disappointed. Buy a ticket and you can walk right around.

Amazing architecture!. This whole castle area was very impressive. You can get into see the cathedral from the back without a ticket, so that may be enough for some visitors, but worth the ticket price to wander around inside. One thing that I noted throughout the English signage in Prague was that they should hire some better copywriters! Signage gives very basic descriptions of when things were built and by whom with some other details, but all the signage lacked a storytelling quality that could bring the scene alive in terms of all the wonderful things that must have taken place over the hundreds of years. Climbing the tower - separate entrance and fee - was also a fun challenge with great views from the top!
Stunning!. Absolutely stunning, both inside and out. Can go inside as part of a ticket, depending on what price you pay. It's big inside with plenty to see In there. A must see whilst in Prague.

Very nice and amazing location. Beautiful, lots of tourists inside. Paid museum available for those interested, but it's a great place to visits even without going to a hotel. It's a bit windy and cold up there in colder weather, but still worth the walk. If you are religious or interested in history - this is a must visit. Visible from almost everywhere in Prague and one of it's top destinations.

Tresor in Prague Castle complex. Whlie coming to Prague, even for 3 days, it worth to visit this gothic masterpiece bulit with the help of foreign architects in 14th century. the site of kings, perfect location in the Castle and close to other possibilities for visit on the same place. Reserve 1 hour or half an hour at least and enjoy. Very well maintained, you do not need a guide, come and just watch. You will see all history. More over several metres behind the Cathedral there is another church, and beatiful view on the old town from the Castle complex. Fully recommended.

Magnificent!. It's absolutely breathtaking when you walk in! You can view the glass stained windows from afar as well as from the entrance. There is a small entrance fee to go all the way around the cathedral.

The highlight of the Prague Castle area, should not be missed. The most imposing church in Prague, the history of which dates back to 14th century, Admission is free of charge if you want just a quick look. For these who want to walk around 27 chapels of the whole Cathedral, tickets are necessary , but it is worth . Watch beautiful stain glassed windows, each done by a different artist. On Sundays opens only since 12 p.m., due to the morning services.

Best to see together with Zlatá ulička at Prague Castle. The Prague Castle district is composed of 10 attractions. I've posted a photo to see all of them. Different types of tickets depending on the number of attractions you prefer to see. When looking from outside and taking into account the interior the Cathedral and Golden Street are the ones worth buying tickets.All others can be seen from outside and probably that is enough.The cathedral architecture is amazing. When inside the glass paintings, the metal figures are worth to see. Expect a lot of people visiting, therefore may be better to go early.The cathedral is the core of the castle and almost all other attractions are around it
Beautiful Gothic Church. We bought the full ticket and spent 5 hours visiting all the sites. We paid the extra to climb the bell tower to view Prague from there.

Fascinating and an architectural marvel. Stunning church!! We got a guided tour of the place and some of the things in there are just incredible! The guide was really knowledgeable and passionate too!
Breathtaking . The most beautiful cathedral I have ever witnessed. Bigger than st Paul's NYC and the detail in the Windows are astonishing!

Top view made you think you could fly above the bright blue sky.. Top view made you think you could fly above the bright blue sky.Might a bit hard for some people to climb up to the top.Keep breathing, don't lose yourselves. Keep walking. There's something great waiting for you.Climb to the top, and you would understand.

Best stained glass windows in the world. I swear I saw Kylo Ren on one. One of the free parts of the castle to those with Prague Cards, definitely the most impressive and memorable parts of that area of the city. Both the interior and exterior are exceptionally beautiful, especially the stained glass windows, which both my girlfriend and I loved.

Outstanding architecture!. If you go to Prague you must make the 10ish minute hike up to the Cathedral from Charles Bridge. Once you've made it up to the cathedral you can also enjoy this beautiful spot which overlooks the city. We almost didn't go up to the cathedral but having found the time I'm so glad we did! Overall it was one of my highlights of my visit to Prague.

Free or part of the castle ticket for 250 CZK. Free area is great too to have a look around, visit if you have time and money, not a must if you are not interested that much. Part of Castle combined ticket too, so 250 CZK is a pretty good reason to walk around!Mucha window!!!! on the left side of the temple, fantastic!Can get pretty crowded!

Breathtaking. . In the 20 plus years I have been visiting this most beautiful of cities i still find the St Vitus Cathedral breathtaking. Taking into account it's sheer size it's certainly dominates the castle district. The cathedral looks awesome from the alter and the stunning stained glass windows to all the little details and frescoes. Built in the gothic style there has been a cathedral on this site for many hundreds of years. A major tourist destination,I enjoy taking tram numbers 22 or 91 up to stop Prazsky Hrad were you can take in St Vitus Cathedral ( Katedrala Sv Vita ) and the castle and streets making up the castle district.A must go destination on any holiday to Prague.
Beautifull Cathedral. Great architecture, realy amazin church with strange black color stone. Its realy beautifull for photos and interested for people who love art.

Beautiful Cathedral. I have seen many Cathedrals in Europe. This one is magnificent. I only had time to walk through it. Next time I would take the audio tour so that I could learn more about each of the individual chapels inside the cathedral.

Well worth the climb!. A truly magnificent sight! We stayed in Old Town and made the walk up to the top. It is not as cumbersome as you may think. You'll totally forget about the walk when you get to the top. A must see when in Prague.
Beautiful - a bit over the top. The building itself is beautiful. Architecture etc. the amount of good + jewels blows you away a bit, and goes back to the 1300s. Very interesting a worth a visit.

Still as beautiful as I remembered in 1991. Just a LOT more crowded now. I've seen a lot of the world's most beautiful cathedrals, and I put the St Vitus right up there with them. A truly must see if you're in Prague.One bit of advice, I highly recommend the audio tour. We tried to get the audio tour, but arrived too late in the day. It was a couple of hours before closing, so not sure why, but they wouldn't give us the headsets. I think they said the batteries were too low. We were told to read the signs or come back the next day if we wanted the headset.Another tourist told us that you could read the signs in lieu of the audio tour, so we bought the entry tickets. the few signs we found weren't very informative. And we saw dozens of numbers for the audio tour. We were very disappointed.So, I do recommend seeing the cathedral. If you want to learn about the history, then either do a guided tour or get the headset.
sightseeing. walked up the 287 steps here well worth it when I got to the top although it was very hard work the views were psectacular

Amazing architecture. It's funny, but the cathedral is something you can look at and see something different each time. The amazing work on the building makes it a must see. There still is no charge. Amazing just amazing
Gothic and beautiful. The Cathedral is situated inside the castle complex, and it is huge and imposing, with its Gothic style and gargoyles. It is definitely a must see if you stop by the castle.
Beautiful Cathedral. Not as nice as Notre Dom in Paris, but still with a visit. Best to have a guide, or detailed guidebook to help see all the best of it.
Impressive.. This large cathedral is a beautiful structure both inside and out and should not be missed on a visit to this great city.

A marvel to behold!!. St Vitus Cathedral is a huge building and one that is beautifully constructed. You could spend hours around it gazing at its details! Try to go and check it out if you're in Prague!

Beautiful cathedral. Absolute must see, and I am not in any way religious, but you don't have to be to be able to appreciate the beauty and craftsmanship that makes up the cathedral. The colours in the stained glass windows are phenomenal! Free entry, and they still have services. Must see!
Impressive cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral is in Prague Castle. It is free to enter but you must buy a ticket to see the alter. Beautiful stained glass in the cathedral.

An architectural marvel. This is the main attraction inside the Prague Castle. It is a huge cathedral with many paintings and sculptures inside. It makes me think of how people and royalties can be so inspired or motivated to do such a marvel of architecture.

My favourite architecture in the world!. After having been to 14 different countries other than home, this is by far my favourite building out of all that I've seen. Highly recommend arriving for sunset.
Amayzing. It is free for visitors to enter the first part of St. Vitus Cathedral. A ticket must be purchased to visit the whole cathedral.

Beautiful stained glass windows. Great architecture of this cathedral, wonderful shape and beautiful colours of stained glass inside. Free entry but possibility to buy a ticket for a closer look at the alter.

Amazing. I had just been to Notre Dame in Paris a few days earlier, which is magnificent, but St. Vitus Cathedral was more impressive in my opinion. You can still see a lot of the cathedral without having to pay the entrance fee which allows you to go deeper and see the side chapels.
Beautiful Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral is a beautiful site to see. This particular cathedral reminded me of the Sagrada in Barcelona, Spa. The architecture is beautiful.
If you like churches. there are many in Prague to see. This would be one of them I would say to stop by as well. It is not hard to find and it will only take a little while out of your time.

Lovely stained glass!. This delightful cathedral houses some magnificent stained glass, and its coll atmosphere makes a welcome relief from mid day sun. It is very busy, with every nationality under the sun represented, but few world heritage sites offer peace from the world, and it is wonderful that so many nations can enjoy what the cathedral has to offer.
Beautiful architecture and a Historical cathedral . St Vitus cathedral is 700 year old Gothic style Cathedral its a treat to watch it has lovely architecture and style

Highlight of Castle District. This is one church on our glad we waited to see list. The stained glass and mosaic windows were amazing. It is easy to spend a lot of time here with many of your closest tourists. Be kind and enjoy.

Take a tour of the Cathedral. There is so much to see at the Cathedral, including Prague's changing of the guards, that to really appreciate it, you need a tour with a good tour guide. Of course you'll want a bunch of time to explore on your own, but it's an amazing site.
Crowded. This is a fantastic cathedral, but I'm unable to enjoy a church with so many tourists inside. It feels more like rush hour at union station than a cathedral.

Amazing Stained Glass Windows!. What a beautiful place to see! This is a must see! The building has these amazing stained glass windows. Just captivating! Definitely recommending to family and friends. Although not free to public but its affordable!

Good Prague Tour Guide Kamil - brilliant tour!. As part of the castle tour, Kamil guided us through the interior and exterior of the St Vitus Cathedral. Fantastic level of detail and great storytelling throughout! Thank you so much!
INCREDIBLE!. This literally took my breath away when I first saw it up close and then when we stepped inside. One of my favorite parts of our visit to Prague!
beautiful inside out. similar to almost most of the EUs churches; this one is also unique and gothic. located in center of Prague, it is a must see but won't consider it
Wow.. This is a place you have to see during the day and during the night. Both have a different feel and aura. During the day the gardens around it are also a must watch.

Gothic Beauty. As part of a tour of the Cathedral and Prague Castle precinct, this was a most memorable Cathedral. We visited in mid December when the Cathedral was warmly and beautifully decorated with bright yellow flowers. I try not to make comparisons between churches and Cathedrals, because each is beautiful and magnificent in it's own way and for varying reasons, but St Vitus was stunning in it's proportions and history. We would have loved to cover more, but on a tour, time is limited. The stained glass windows and the impressive nave beneath the soaring roof are a magnificent sight to behold . Considering the architect was apparently very young (only in his 20's I believe) this is a stunningly beautiful example of Gothic architecture and reverence. A must see and a definite highlight!

Spectacular - both inside and out. Whether you cheat and go by tram - or work up a sweat walking up from Charles Bridge - you will be rewarded at the top when you visit St Vitus Cathedral. A place of worship for over 600 years. Marvel at the main tower - almost 100m high - fantastic to our 21 century eyes - how much more it must have 'awed' visitors 200 and more years ago.Spend time (and some money) visiting the interior - you will see a return on your investment. There are many spectacular cathedrals across Europe - St Vitus will make the top 10 on most lists. It did on mine!
