Magnificent . Absolutely breath taking and a glorious delight. Captivating and charming. History comes alive as you meander through this blessed place.

Worth seeing. We especially wanted to see the windows that Alfans Mucha made, and we were not disappointed. We only went in the center area, that is free to go in, you can pay an entrance fee and see more. We were on a walking tour and needed to keep up with the group, but we saw enough.

An impressive cathedral!. I took a tour of the castle grounds, which included a stop/visit to see the St. Vitus Cathedral. The architect was in his 20's and inspired by another famous cathedral in Paris ;)There are a few different styles since it took years to finish.You can take a quick walk inside that catherdal - which I recommend. They have beautiful stained-glass windoes and an impressive knave.It was free to get into the catherdal. If you're up on the Prague Castle grounds, its definitely a highlight!
Beautiful. Very beautiful Gothic cathedral, so glad I visited. Bit underwhelming after the cathedrals in Germany and France.
BEAUTIFUL.. One has to have time to explore this area. Beautifully preserved place. A must visit. Once inside, you seemd to have travel back in time.

Impressive church with extensive decorations. St Vitus is inside the Castle Grounds, needs a ticket to get in. It opens at 10am so be sure to get there early to beat the crowds of visitors and organized tours who come in great numbers. It is possible to just enter and take pictures from the entrance hall but full access requires a ticket. The cathedral is huge inside, very tall vaults, impressive tombs and shines, including Wenceslas chapel. Well worth a visit if you are on a tour, but if in a hurry, can see all in 20-25 min or so.
It's a big church. If you like big churches then you'll like this. Lots of ornate windows, pictures, carvings etc. Very busy with tourists, and a bit lacking on historical details.

Stunning cathedral. Huge cathedral built over a long period of time. Gorgeous Munch window just one of the highlights. King Wenceslas tomb/ante-chamber dramatic with sense of respect and age. Definitely worth paying admission and walking through cathedral. Get a guide - audio available. Go early am or mid-afternoon. Doors close at 4:40
Breathtaking Incredible Place. You must walk, taxi, Uber, Tram but go up here to see this magnificent structure inside and out. It will knock your socks off!

Gothic architecture . Learnt about this amazing Gothic architecture in our tour to the Prague castle district! Amazing to see how ancient people were so intelligent to build such enormous building!! Mush see in Prague!

Must visit. The cathedral, located in the grounds of the Prague Castle is a magnificent example of why Prague is very popular for gothic architecture. Recommend taking a very scenic route through Petrin Hill to get there.
Beautiful windows. I did not pay for a tour of the cathedral I just went into the free part of the building but it was stunning inside and out and made my trip to the castle worthwhile
Beautiful cathedral. Lovely to wander around.So peaceful to walk around taking in the beauty of the place. Glad we managed to go during our 4 day stay

Amazing Cathedral---Stained Glass is Gorgeous. There are several ticket types--get the one that includes the catehdral. The stained glass is amongst the most beautiful in Europe. Intricate and unique--bright colours and profoundly sacred. Take your time, take as many photos and realise that when you get towards to the exit you may find yourself rushed out. If I would have known I would lingered away from this area. I love this cathedral and think it is one of my most favourite anywhere in the world.

A Masterpiece. St. Virus should be on everyone's list who has any interest in traditional architecture, design, or religious art. I spent hours there gawking at this cathedral's beautiful art and architecture. It is truly a masterpiece.

One of the best - must see!. Absolutely stunning cathedral. The stain glass is so vibrant and detailed. The sun was shining brightly during our visit, which helped. Easily one of the nicest cathedrals I've ever had the pleasure of visiting!

Gorgeous Cathedral Church. It is probably one of the most beautiful Cathedral churches in Europe. Interior is stunning with many classic colorful glasses and some seriously decorated altars. Do go there and make a pilgrimage.
Grand Cathedral. This cathedral is well worth a visit. The architecture is very impressive and it is impressive both inside and out.

A must see. This cathedral is huge. The ceilings seem to go on forever. Lots of history. There is so much to see here, that I would highly recommend that you rent a audio device, to help explain things.
You cannot visit Prague without seeing this cathedral. It is a must see site.

The details in the facade, stained glass, and chapels make this church stand out.. Who knew you could find men in business suits on the facade? The church was crowded but still incredibly beautiful. We saw everything we wanted without feeling crowded out.
It beats Cologne. The building is one of the most spectacular cathedrals I have seen. More gilding on the building and more detail on the towers. Inside is even more ornate

Beautiful Gothic church!. This is a beautiful Gothic church situated in the Mala Strana (New Town) section of Prague. Our city guide tour also informed us that this is where a lot of the scenes for the movie Van Helsing were shot. The exterior and interior are just superb!However, there can be long queues to get into the church. Once inside, only a section of the church is open to visitors. If I remember correctly, you have to pay to visit the other sections of the interior.Must do: visit the church interior at noon or after for amazing reflections of the stained glass windows on the stone walls of the church.
Breathtaking!. You have to see it in order to believe the greatness of this religious monument...No words can describe it.Go and visit it in Prague's castle-definitely!

Worth a visit.. We had a guide which was extremely helpful. There is always more history and trivia in these type of places than you would be aware of without having someone there with local knowledge. The church is very interesting and the stained glass windows are quite spectacular.
Lovely. This cathedral is magical so Beauitful outside and in . The carving are lovely as is the stained glass windows
Stunning!. Can't really describe how magnificent this is. Go to the Castle and buy tickets to access all parts. You need at least half a day. It is just incredible.

Piece de resistance.... The place is icing on the cake. After seeing so many amazing sights in Prague, this one far superceded most. Words will not do justice to the grandeur of this Cathedral. This is the final resting place of most of the Czech royal family since the time it was built. The classic gothic architecture set it apart for most other places. The stained glass windows just add to the overall beauty.Do NOT miss..

Best stained glass I've seen :). The cathedral is free to enter for a limited area. With a valid ticket, one can get inside deeper into the cathedral and inspect on each altar pieces. If you're a student, make sure to ask for a student discounted ticket as this will lower the admission price by half. The cathedral is epic and breath-taking. The stained glasses are also excellent pieces of art. I must have spent a min. 40 minutes just looking at them. Many English guided tours also comes inside and so it's possible to just stand and listen to their explanation.

Must see, bring 10 crowns. This amazing church is on the must see list, but to fully appreciate it, you will need to pay 10 crowns admission to wander beyond the entry area. Take your time and buy a guide book first, so you can fully appreciate the unbelievable treasures of the stained glass windows to the paintings, etc.

what a beauty. A beautiful Gothic cathedral located inside the Prague Castle. Tours are offered daily and for a little extra you can get an English tour guide. Our guide was very informative and spoke excellent English. Too bad the catacombs are no longer available to the public. They stopped doing tours because the traffic was destroying them.

It's up to you. This was a disapointment in the way of how much one gets to see in the castle but the outside is beautiful! Remember that there is a fee to take pictures and in some places you cant take any photos!
Beautiful. This is a beautiful building both inside and out. A touring choir happened to be singing while we were in which made the visit a little more special.

Exceptional!. St Vitus Cathedral is part of a combined ticket which gives you access to a number of sites in the Castle area. We decided to take the guided tour which costs only another 5 euro but was definitely worth it - our guide was really knowledgeable and made the visit of this amazing site worth it even more!

Superb but be careful of pick pockets. Its normally crowded, hence the thieves strike. Leave passport, money in your locker and enjoy the view. Its more than worth a visit. The stained glasses are out of this world and is very well preserved.

Impressive cathedral. You can get in for free but it's worth paying a little bit more to see the extra stuff at the back. I'm not religious but I love exploring different churches. I really enjoy the visit to this cathedral with all those elegant interior design and painting.

Grand cathedral with towering views of the city. St. Vitus Cathedral is in the palace complex on a hill overlooking Prague. You have to pay to get in and really see the place (the free section is a small little area in the back), but it's worth the price of admission if nothing else than to stand outside the chapel with the tomb of good king Wenceslas.

Well worth the trip. As with many places in Prague, this is another great place to visit, the architecture both internal and external are wonderful, you get caught up in the place, it has so much history and so much to see in and around. We walked up the hill to get to this place, lots of places for a drink en route, and it's worth the walk, it's just a lovely place to see, you don't have to be into history or religion or architecture to get drawn in.

Very gorgeous and beautiful Cathedral!. This was definitely one of the handful most gorgeous and beautiful churches/cathedrals we have seen and visited in our entire Europe trip thus far standing in the heart of the city. It was huge and impressive and tall and adopted the gothic architectural theme. When we visited the cathedral, it was crowded and visitors would have to follow a queue to get in but it was worthwhile to do so. Upon entering, visitors would gather by groups taking pictures or listening to the introductions by their respective guides.The interior of the cathedral was grand and lovely too, with lots of statues, paintings, religious objects, besides the colourful tinted window panes. It was simply gorgeous! For Catholics, I will think they will like and enjoy this place as they can find "closeness" to the saints and God.Photography is allowed inside the church but with no flash and whispering is a must since it is opened to public for prayer as well. And when we were there, we saw a few couples in wedding gowns taking their portfolios with the cathedral as the backdrop!It's no doubt that this was a beautiful church and even if you are not a Catholic or Christian, it is still worthwhile to visit it to have a taste of its culture, history in the Prague!
Impressive. Overly impressive - the share height is fantastic. Total old world feeling. A must visit in the castle visit.

Very impressive!. It's a gothic cathedral but the side entrance facade is only 100 years old! Look for the representations of the architects who finished it in the 20th century - it's quite unique to see people represented in modern clothing on an old cathedral! The inside is VERY impressive and you can visit one part of it for free. To go up, you must purchase a ticket. Watch out for pickpockets outside!!

Most impressive cathedral. This is the most impressive cathedral that we saw in recent European travels. Definitely worth the time to walk around and explore. Try to get there before the crowds, but not bad even with the crowds.

First large European cathedral I've ever been to. So I don't have any sort of comparison points, but having seen the cathedral on the outside and the inside, it was absolutely beautiful. The price to get in was quite reasonable as well.
STUNNING!. There are no words to describe how beautiful this Gothic cathedral is. I highly recommend a visit- a site worth seeing.
Great!. The architecture and interior are really impressive. Definitely worth the effort exploring, once already at the castle. I suspect I have some good pictures!

Amazing!!. Certainly recomend this for a good visit. We spent a full day here together with the palace grounds. Recomend you go early as this is a very popular place for good reason! Lots of tourists and tours. We attended on our own. A number of options re ticket access. We opted for option 1 which included about 5 different locations including the Cathedral. Cost was about $40 for two people. Ticket is for two days which is good as so much to see in whole complex. We spent a Couple of hours in the Cathedral. Spurge for the audio guide for another $17.00 good for 4 hours ( plus $25 refundable deposit). Very detailed explanation and tons of history if you are so inclined. If you are planning to stay a bit, consider bringing your own water and perhaps a snack. Food and drink not cheap and service worst the slow.

Amazing. To think that this was not destroyed by war but internal strife and fires did slow things down but it is beautiful. The stained glass is spectacular and the colors at vibrant. The beginning part can be seen for free however if you want to go deeper into the church you will need to buy a pass. The history of mosaic, it's repair and maintenance are fascinating from a scientific point of view. What a wonderful place to see, not that many years ago I would not have been able to visit this place due to communism.

Looks great inside & out. We visited the cathedral as part of the Prague Castle tour option B. Even if you don't want to buy a ticket you can see the amazing nave at the entrance but you'll miss great views of the Mucha stained glass window, rose window, view of the old & new church.
Stunning. A definite must if you are visiting Prague. We would recommend a small group or private tour through this site.

A magnificent, iconic religious structure. As part of the Castle it cuts a striking contrast to some of the relatively modern buildings surrounding it. It is imposing and dominating from the outside, maybe more so due to the proximity of the surroundings, you can't stand far enough away to see it from afar, so it just lowers over you. Inside it is typically medieval gothic Christian ostentation and posture, beautiful and overpowering at the same time. Strangely enough on of the windows isn't medieval gothic, but Art Nouveau, designed by the wonderful Alfons Mucha. The doors which combine the Green Man and other pagan sybols with images of Christian Saints is a great historical detail. There is so much to see and marvel at, that you can't take it all in in one visit.

Well worth a visit. This is an impressive cathedral. The initial section is free admission, but you need a ticket to fully explore the church. Impressive architecture and stained glass windows. We appreciated the Mucha window especially.
Stunning. St. Vitus Cathedral is 100% worth seeing, Such a beautiful building, its breathtaking. Worth the hike to the top!

Scary church.... ...especially from outside. Countless demon figures on the churches roof, you could get a bit frightened ;)Inside you will find many relics (like a piece of Jesus' cross) and wonderful styled windows. It's a very dark church, so the many colorful windows stand out.You will find also many tourists inside. 365 days a year. Go there early.

Gorgeous Cathedral!. A beautiful Cathedral - inside and out.The stained glass windows are breathtaking. You can peek inside the cathedral (which is sufficient) or you can pay a bit extra to explore it more.
A beautiful church that was on the tour. This church is big and beautiful with many things to see inside. It was a religious experience to see all of the many statues and ornamentation.
Amazing architecture with a deep history. This is a must go to site in Prague. Amazing architecture located just beside the Prague castle. Its interior was spectacular too. Absolutely amazing.

St Vitus Cathedral . We went on Sunday and stayed for the mass, at 10:00. If you go on Sunday attend the mass. It's a hour I'll remember the rest of my life. St Vitus is super impressive. We went in on a "B" tour ticket. You can get in but have to stay in the gallery. With the tour ticket we were able to walk thru most areas of the cathedral. This is a must see on any Prague trip. It's inside the Prague castle walls so make time to visit the castle too. We spent 5 hours and saw only a portion of what is available.

Beautiful gothic cathedral inside the walls of the PRague Castle. This enormous edifice is beautiful outside as well as inside. Walk around the nave knowing that below your feet in the crypt are tombs of Bohemian kings and emperors of the Holly Roman Empire. Pay a few Euros extra to see the entire Cathedral because only the area just inside the main entrance is free. The stained glass is particularly beautiful. The silver tomb of the Bohemian archbishop and martyr St. John Nepomuk is awe inspiring.
Beautiful building but get there early. A stunning Cathedral with so much history and so much to take in, but get in early doors as it gets so very busy. Also visit the castle while there !

Beautiful Cathedral. From every vantage point in Prague you can not miss the stunning sight of St Vitus Cathedral on the skyline.We didn't pay to have the tour of the castle and Cathedral so just got to see the outside and the general sights inside which was enough for us. It really is such a spectacular sight and well worth a visit and some of the views on the walk back into town were spectacular!
Impressive!. The cathedral is impressive. It is breath taking. I recomend to take time also for a walk in the surrowndings of the cathedral.

Most beautiful cathedral in Prague. We walked all the way up from the Charles Bridge. It takes around 20 minutes to get there but the cathedral is really beautiful. Take into consideration that it will be very crowded during these days but the steep walk is worthy.

Must see!. Both times I was in Prague I went to see the St.Vitus Cathedral. I found the castle uninteresting, but this place was a beauty! My parents and I all agreed that this was prettier than the Cathedral in Cologne. I didn't even know it was possible to have such rich colors of stained glass before I saw these windows. Pay for the one day ticket to see Prague Castle attractions and head to St.Vitus first if there is heavy tourist traffic to make sure you enjoy this. Without the ticket you can go in the back section of the church for free, but totally worth it to walk all the way around the inside of the building.

Beautiful stained glass. Although the cathedral has many visitors, most only enter the entrance area which is free. As a result, the areas deeper inside feel almost quiet. The stained glass is beautiful, a lot of it looks very modern. As you enter on the left there is a corner for the Czech airmen of World War II, which brings the message much closer to home. I'd definitely recommend paying the entrance fee and getting a closer look at what the cathedral has to offer.

Beautiful outside, nice inside. This church was intricate and beautiful on the outside of the church. The inside was not as impressive as the outside or as some of the other cathedrals and churches I've seen. However the stained glass was amazing and some of the paintings and carvings were as well.

Amazing nave. St Vitus Cathedral is enormous and stunning.Not only is the nave stunning but it has numerous small chapels, including one with a stained-glass window designed by Mucha. Not to be missed on a trip to Prague.

Amazing Piece of Art. We visited the castle and this was one amazing piece of art we saw while walking through the castle. We did not go inside the cathedral but were amazed by watching this beautiful art from outside.
Very interesting place! . Would not recommend their builders though as the church took 600 years to complete!! Lots of interesting information and photo opportunities too.
Beautiful Old Church. What a pleasure and treat to visit St. Vitus Cathedral, one of the many sights of Prague that should not be missed. It is well worth the visit!!!

Beautiful and interesting. I toured this with my son. It was quite busy but not excessively crowded. We did not go with a tour guide or audio tour. I would recommend at least using the audio tour. It is a beautiful cathedral.

What an odd place to put a Gothic cathedral. You don't often see a cathedral set in the middle of a castle, but here it is. There is room to step back and see an entire side to the building and it is impressive inside and out. The stained glass was fantastic featuring modern artists including Mucha, who had an entire window. One of the highlights of Prague!!
wedid this with a tour guide. By doing this with a tour guide it was so much better to hear all the history and the passion in which it was being explained

Beautiful Cathedral. St Vitus is found on the site of Prague Castle and free entry will only get you in the door and restricted to the rear of the cathedral. Purchase an inclusive ticket for Prague Castle with access to VIII which is St Vitus Cathedral and you'll be able to enter and walk along the inside of the cathedral all the way to the front of the church. It also isn't as crowded in the area requiring a ticket so you can stroll and take pictures at your leisure. The stain glass windows are beautiful and the height of the ceiling is quite magnificent. I'm not religious and have visited many cathedrals in Russia and around Europe and still find them all very beautiful in their own way. This one is no exception.
A must see. Stunning church and excellent audio guide. I recommend a trip to the tower to get a stunning view. You need at least 3 hours to really see Prague Castle.
St. Vitus Cathedral. BEAUTIFUL! Words cannot do it justice! Must be seen by one's own eyes! BUT avoid Sundays as the cathedral is closed during mass.

Amazing. We were blown away by this Cathedral. The grandeur, the architecture, the age. The glass windows high in the cathedral draw light at sunrise and sunset filling the Cathedral with light. Beautiful.

Truly amazing. It was my favourite part of the city, Mala Strana and this cathedral with surrounding buildings, squares and streets. There´s even a park not far away with a tower. Take half a day and see it all, it´s really worth it.
A breathtaking place. Very beautiful and quite breathtaking cathedral. The colors of the beautiful Windows paintings were amazing.
Stunning. It is stunning inside and out. The stained glass is superb, the vaulted ceilings majestic, the sculptures captivating, gargoyles striking and the spires are breathtaking.

Beautiful . Prague itself is a city that is continuing to amaze me with its beauty and charm. The cathedral is really beautiful and we saw it as a part of a tour we took with Sandemans; so all the knowledge it came along with made the visit worthwhile..
Human beings are Capable of Anything. Sheer sight of St Vitus is mind blowing as soon as you sight it; its almost there with Petra and Pryamids
"Gothic". A perfect example of gothic churches. The colored glass in the windows are BEAUTIFUL. It is in the Castle complex so go with time to visit other places in the castle area.

Must visit if in Prague--beautiful Cathedral. If you go to the Castle District, the cathedral is a must. Try to get there early, but it does close sometimes and open later as happened when we were there. The line was long but moved quickly and the wait was worth it. Very ornate and beautiful place. Gorgeous architecture and stained glass windows.

One of the most beautiful cathedrals. This is a lovely cathedral, with beautiful stained glass windows and lots of decoration inside. For me, it was one of the most lovely I've seen, compared to others that are more austere or baroque ones with frills everywhere. It's somewhere in the middle of those extremes. We went early in the morning, and it was pretty crowded with a bit of a wait to get in. I noticed that later in the day it was actually less crowded, which surprised me. (Maybe that's not true every day, but it was on the day we were there.)

Beautiful and excessively extravagant . This cathedral is beautiful but there is almost too much to see in one place. At every turn there is another extravagant statue or alcove. It is definitely worth the visit just for the grandiose nature of it all.

a visit to Prague is incomplete without Prague castle and its magnificent St.Vitus cathedral. As one enters the main square inside Prague castle, for a minute one is mesmerized by the wonderful sight of St.Vitus Cathedral.No camera can do justice to this marvellous sight.I remember being equally awed by the Duomo in Florence.Each facade of the cathedral tells a story.It was a bit crowded so we couldnt go up , but I believe the view from the top is breathtaking.The entrance into the square is free,but there is a charge for going up the tower

Impressive. After a hike up the hill and many steps, was great to see the gardens that surrounded this impressive building. Unfortunately the weather wasn't very good and therefore we didn't hang around too long and also didn't pay to go into the museum etc... but the walk around the building was interesting - well worth a visit.
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful cathedral - we had paid to enter on our ticket for the castle but to be honest you can see what you need to see for free from back door!

Interesting tour. Beautiful windows. . We took the 1 hour guided tour. It was very worthwhile, as it provides access to otherwise closed areas of the cathedral. There are some over the top tombs, but the highlight is the windows. By far, the most beautiful stained glass window I have ever seen. The tour guide provided valuable and interesting information.

Majestic. Stunning cathedral made with black stone. The interior is really nice and really big. Entrance is free to see the main parts of it. An additional cost is paid if you wanna enter the hallways. Recommended!

Wonderful Cathederal. Not being religious in any way I can still appreciate the magnificent Cathedral and the works of art contained therein.
Some of the silver work memorials are simply stunning.... And cannot be appreciated in a five minute walk round.
The stained glass... New and old is worth studying at leisure..... Allow plenty of time!

On High. I cant say much about the inside of the Cathedral, because we went on a Friday, and since the church is still open to the people and those who worship during Mass it was closed at that time to tour. But the church on the outside was just enough to take my breath away and to realize the structure had been around for quite sometime.

HUGE CHURCH IN PRAGUE CASTLE COMPLEX. This 13th-14th century gothic cathedral dominates the Prague Castle complex and skyline of Prague and is a must see when visiting the castle. Huge spires and columns and stained glass windows (some quite modern looking) fill the church. You can enter the cathedral for free but must pay to go further into the cathedral and see the main altar and smaller chapels. This was part of the overall ticket package we had for the castle complex.

Beautiful architecture. Read the guide on the website before visiting. There are certain restrictions and times allowed for tourist to come in. Also, different types of tickets offer different access within the castle so make sure to buy one that includes the cathedral.

Mesmerizing. An imposing cathedral, absolutely a must see. Very impressive architectural wise and also free until a certain point. Was included in our free walking tour which was finished at the Prague Castle courtyards. If given the chance I would choose to take a self tour inside the Prague castle since it seemed a really impressive complex with so much history.

History galore. Pick your time to go here. Queues can be long. We walked around and kept checking finally got in with minimal wait. Marvellous interior full of glorious icons. Externally the gargoyles are varied , great building.

Beautiful gothic church. St Vitus is very beautiful, but also very busy with tour groups. Definitely go visit, but make sure you get there before it closes. We went up with tour group, did short visit and then returned, only to find out it closed at 4. We got there at 3:55. Also, you have to pay to see most of the cathedral.

Beautiful large, old cathedral, with an intruiging history. Situated in the Prague Castle area, it is a beautiful cathedral. First remnants are from before 1000, and the cathedral has been built and expanded for centuries.

Beautiful stain glass windows. This is a stunning building from both outside and within. The stain glass windows are incredible.
You can enter the cathedral free of charge to take pictures but have to pay to tour the whole building.
Very Nice, but costs to see most of it. Great Old Cathedral, but we were surprised that it cost more than a few euros) to walk around inside.

Well worth a visit. There are no words to describe how beautiful tit is. You just have to see it with your eyes. It is the most beautiful Cathedral I have ever seen. It is just breathtaking. Interesting thing to know (at least to some of you) wc in Prague is charged everywhere and it's between 10 and 20 Czech crown. It's not much but just in case always have some change with you. If you don't have enough Czech crown with you they will charge you 1 euro.

Great example of a gothic cathedral. A beautiful and interesting gothic cathedral with a very rich history. Look out for the stained glass windows sponsored by a family, a bank and an insurance company! Outside, above the main entrance, just below the rose window there are statues of the 4 architects. Also worth spending some time enjoying the gold mosaic outside the cathedral around the original entrance.

Very scenic. First of all, after a few minutes, understanding the city transportation system is easy. A transport ticket is good on any city bus, tram and the Metro. A 24 hour pass is a good deal for 110 ckz, and can be bought at Metro stations, bus stations and many hotels. Second, if at all possible, don't come to Prague in June, July or August. The crowds are unbelievable, and the trams are often packed with people. The church is on the grounds of Prague castle, easily accessed by the Green Tram line to "Malostranska", then a #22 tram to "Prazsky hrad". I strongly recommend the Rick Steves travel book, "Prague", as a guide to the city. The Royal Botanic gardens, to the left after you get off the tram, are nice but nothing impressive.
Very interesting cathedral . Amaze history in this place, particularly if you are in to religion and the history of he Czech rulers. Recommend a guided tour to fully appreciate what is on offer.

An amazing church and well worth a visit. The church is spectacular and well worth a visit to appreciate the architecture and the art inside. The detail and work in the church, gargoyles and gilded sculptures were incredibly impressive, making the church look like it was taken directly from a fairytale. Take Tram22 and you can walk downhill, rather than uphill when taking the metro.
Eva. Great place though full of people. Informative with guided tour eat phone. Statue, window with lots of historical stories

Absolutely beautiful!. We have 2 small kids so one adult waited at the hotel with them for this tour. Cathedral was absolutely beautiful and the guide we had from the ticket office was very informative. Stan made sure we knew the basics but was also filled with knowledge when we wanted to know more. Definitely recommend leaving kids at home since the 30 min tour might be boring for little ones. Guided tour was great for us also.

Loved the stained glass. The stained glass is beautiful as well as the architecture of the cathedral itself. Part of the reason churches like this were originally built was to evoke a sense of awe and wonder and it still has that ability in modern times. The attraction is "free" but admission to more of the cathedral can be purchased.
A sight to behold. Can we quite busy and packed with tourist groups but if you get good timing it's a wonderful and breathtaking piece of architecture worth seeing.

Best Stained glass!. This cathedral is stunning. It's gothic and intense on the outside and absolutely beautiful in the inside. The stained glass is amazing. It's a the top of a big hill, so take your time coming up! I went three times while in Prague. It's truly impressive. One of the most unique and amazing night cathedrals I've seen. Gothic and imposing.

Nice. Nice windows. Beautiful atmosphere. You have to pay if you want to see more. So if you need some spiritual guidance you have to pay for it. Well if they use the money to keep the church going....
Lovely St. Vitus Church. What can I say? You just have to visit it to see With Your own eyes this wonderful Church. But Your not alone! This is a very crowdy sight.
Simply beautiful!. Of all of the churches in Prague, I feel that this is the most beautiful. The exterior itself is a marvel. You keep saying, How did they build this?

Spectacular Gothic Cathedral. Teaming with history and beauty, St Vitus Cathedral is not to be missed! Impressive stained glass windows and vaulting. Be sure to visit early to try to beat the crowds. We did not pay for a guided tour - too crowded - and instead read our Rik Steves book at the various stops which worked out fine.

Lovely Building. St Vitis Cathedral is part of the complex of buildings making up Prague Castle. Situated on the hill above lesser town it is certainly worth a visit. As well as visiting the interior you can also climb the 287 steps of the Great South Tower to get a fantastic view over Prague or visit the exhibition of the Cathedral treasure

Jewel of Prague. Windows in many stained glass styles grace St Vitus which contains one by Alphonse Mucha the famous art nouveau period artist as well as both newer and older windows from times present and past. Be sure to get a ticket for entry into the castle hill buildings or you will not be able to go all the way into the cathedral.

beautiful cathedral. this cathedral is inside of the castle and is well worth going into, the stain glass windows really look great when the sun shines through them and the story of St Vitus makes for an interesting tale
beautifull. must see if in Prague lovely views of city and a magnificent interior and mind blowing architecture 10/10

Amazing cathedral!. It was an incredible cathedral! The gothic finishes are really amazing to see in combination with the vibrant stained glass windows and beautiful surrounding castle. I hadn't come for the cathedral, but I'm definitely glad I got to see it, even just briefly!

Get the ticket to go inside!. Buy the ticket to go inside this magnificent cathedral! It is worth it to see the Mucha stained glass windows, the Royal Mausoleum, the lovely wood carving of Prague and the tombs of St. Vitus and St. John of Nepomuk and the Wenceslas Chapel.

Grand Stop. located in the heart of Vienna surrounded by the shopping stores.
the place turned out to be a little nice escape spot :)
Beautiful cathedral. A beautiful cathedral and so close to the Castle. In high season there can be quite a queue, so I would get there early but so worth it

Spellboundingly beautiful!. As you walk around the Cathedral, you realise how wonderful the architecture is. The details on the outside as well as the inside of the cathedral are spellboundingly beautiful!
So pretty!. I'd definitely recommend visiting if you have time, the Cathedral is beautiful, and the surrounding areas are nice to wander around.

Need to get behind the enclosing building.. The church should be the highlight of the trip to Prague Castle. The lower part of the church is hidden behind the castle complex newer buildings so that the majesty of the church is not apparent initially.

Very impressive. The outstanding feature of this cathedral is undoubtedly the stained glass windows which are beautiful. The whole atmosphere of the nave of the building is impressive and it is a very good visit.

European architectural splendour. It's difficult to describe the beauty of this Cathedral - you simply have to see it for yourself. Take some time to wander around so that you can absorb the art and magnificent handiwork.

Competes with Notre Dame. Fantastic cathedral! A must see. However, all world travelers seem to have gotten that same message. Shoulder to shoulder crowded in June. Recommend not visiting in high season.
Absolutely beautiful!. You really should go even though you are not that religious person. St. Vitus is very beautiful and a breathtaking!

If you love arquitecture you gotta see it... if you don't you gotta see it as well!. Detail, detail, and more detail. Every single aspect of this cathedral is amazing! The stained glasses are beatiful. This mix of gothic with a bit of baroque, reflexes what we humans are capable of doing. Definetly a MUST see. You can pay to enter a bit farther inside this Cathedral which I think you should do! Just great

BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS!!!!!!!!!!. I was visiting the cathedral in June and had my wallet stolen from inside the cathedral. A guy came up to me and started talking to me, at the time I thought he was standing too close, 2 minutes later my wallet is gone. PLEASE make sure your bags are secured, I was wearing a cross shoulder bag and its wasn't closed, hence, I made a very easy target. Just as a follow up if you do have something stolen on the castle grounds then the lost and fund is located in the tourist info office. When I followed up there they had several wallets that had been turned in.

two words A-MAZING. I enjoyed observing the architecture all around it. The free entrance was enough for my 2h to see the castle and cathedral - with the free entrance you can see most of the interior too

Magnificent! . It is incredible to see the architectural wonders that this city has to offer. This cathedral is part of the Prague Castle complex, and one of the most important churches in Czech Republic due to the fact that it houses the tombs of Bohemian Kings and Holy Roman Emperors. The Gothic architecture is amazing. Must see!

Very atmospheric.... We liked this cathedral a lot and I found it to be the only really worthwhile attraction of the "castle" tour. The old street ha some interest but I guess it will be murder in high season with all the crowds and I could have done without seeing the other two attractions on the B tour. The Mucha window is of significant interest.
Amazing!. I myself am not catholic and can still marvel and be touched by the beauty of this cathedral. Must must must do! And make sure you walk all the way around inside and out!

Its sheer size and Gothic architecture is kinda intimidating.. Located inside the Prague Castle complex, this Church is quite a daunting but equally spectacular structure. We couldn't go in cause we had taken a guided tour and going inside wasn't part of the tour but I would have liked to. You could perhaps nip back to this place once your tour is over. A place to visit during the day to truly appreciate it.

Breath taking and SO interesting to see the architecture, stain-glass windows (unbelievable!!), and so much more!. Go early in the morning if you can as there are SO many people entering to see both the cathedral and the castle. There are a few places to sit and eat a sandwich, (if you pack one), and just rest if you need to. Don't miss it !! It is well worth it!!

Astounding Gothic architecture. This edifice is the epitome of Gothic architecture, located within the confines of Prague Castle. It is the Czech Republic’s largest and most important cathedral—and possibly in Central Europe. It actually is a collection of several houses of worship, including St. Vitus, St. Wenceslas Chapel, and Gothic Cathedral. Construction on the first building began in 960AD, and continued for centuries. Many significant religious and political figures are entombed here, such as King Charles IV.So much for construction history. In a word, this cathedral is astounding. The architecture is sheer art. Marble and gold overwhelm visual senses, and the feeling of spirituality permeates. The scope of the dimensions is unfathomable, but research reveals the height of the main tower is 97 meters—about 315 feet, comparable to a 30-story building. Plan for several hours to absorb all this complex collection of Gothic buildings has to offer.

Breath takings?. Even for those who are of no religious believe, you must visit every church you walk past. The bells that tolled last Sunday morning for what seems like and hour, were very moving. The churches are simply too hard to describe, please look for yourself!

Gothic, monumental, that you MUST to see.. Entrance to the Cathedral is free, but further interiors are paid. It's good to buy ticket for CURCUIT B (Cathedral, Golden Lane, Castle and St. Juri Church are included). Don't stand in long queue - buy them in Starý královský palác - queues are much shorter. Inside Cathedral you'll be enchented buy size of the thing. It's both gothic and noegothic, with lot of sculptures, triptics, chappels, graves etc. Main stained glass rosette on the front wall is particulary impressive. Decorated grave of St. Nepomucen is beautiful and rich in details. Amazing monument. Watch for waves of organized trips - it's better to wait around any chappels until they went away.

THE gem of Hradcany. Like most attractions and sites within the hradcany premises, it is quite the crowded place, especially right when it opens. And despite it all, it is definitely one of the most amazing and mouth-taking places to visit in Prague. Definitely a must-see, even if you have to come just for this!

MUST SEE. The history of this place is just stunning! Everywhere you look it was amazing, the details were incredible! Also, pictures don't do it justice. You have to experience it with your own eyes!
Part of the Castle area. Spectacular building and pretty inside with a lot of history but not the most spectacular of cathedrals you'll see.

The stained glass windows were the highlight.. This is a grand cathedral which is the centrepeice of the Prague Castle complex. The highlight for me was the many beautiful, colourful stained glass windows. Also the copious use of silver ornamentation was unusual; silver mining being an important activity in the Czech lands in the 1300's. Avoid on weekends, and try to get there early on a weekday morning.
St. Vitus Cathedral . Amongst the best seen till now..A beautiful Gothic Style Architecture which got my eyes glued to it..A visit inside the Cathedral is a must

Grandiose. Truly a spectacular church with lots of history. The do-it-yourself tour with headphones was perfect for us as it allowed us to skip parts we weren't interested in and stay longer in those parts that were of interest to us.

most interesting and important cathedral in Prague. This cathedral is a grave of the Czech kings and 2 Roman Emperors. The building of the Cathedral took long 5 centuries ( from 1344). The Czech regalia are there, Almost all cathedral was buil in Gothic style and new Gothic style.Very interesting is a south tower.

Must see. Whether you are religious or not, this cathedral should not be missed while in Praha. Having seen Notre Dame I would have to say St Vitus equals it at the very least if not surpasses it. There are so many different levels of detail on the inside and outside it just makes you wonder and awe at the effort that went into its construction and design.

This is a spectacular gothic cathedral.. I'm not an art history or architecture expert, but I've seen a fair number of cathedrals, and this one was truly beautiful. Many different parts to enjoy. Tombs and sarcophagi. There are audio things to listen to. You will not be disappointed by a visit here.
Breath taking. I was most struck by the incredible stained glass windows. They were made up of small mosaic pieces. A must see.

One of the best sites in Prague. The Prague Castle is amazing no doubt. But the St. Vitus Cathedral? Spectacular. It's such a huge cathedral, and so intricate. Definitely worth it to go inside and spend some time in there looking at the architecture, history, and tombs. It's also really cool to climb the tower of the cathedral - it's a hard climb but if you take it slow, the view from the top is breathtaking!!!

Imposing rather than beautiful.. There is some stunning artwork including ancient wall paintings. The stained glass windows are wonderful, but the overall impression is one of size and grandeur rather than beauty. The Last Judgement mosaic on the outside of the cathedral is worth seeing.

A Must see . The Cathedral is huge, and beautiful, so much so you won't want to miss it. We carried Rick Steve's travel book on Prague with a several pages on the Cathedral, so we didn't get a tour, and it worked out great. It is one of the brightest Cathedral I have ever been in. To think it was started in the 1400 and not finished until the 1900's. It was built by the same man who built the Charles bridge. We spent over an hour in the Cathedral, and with 90 degree weather that day, it was blessedly cool inside too.
Impressive. I recommned not only thein side but also to take a walk inside the castle walls around the cathedral after it gets dark.

The window by Mucha is the highlight of the visit. Make sure you buy a ticket for the Castle that includes entrance to the Cathedral. Although looking very ancient from the outside, it was started in the mid-14th century but not completed until 1929! Despite this, the exterior is a perfect example of High Gothic. although not the tower with a baroque dome. Inside the highlight for me was a beautiful stained glass window designed by Mucha in 1920, and its a shame one can only view the beautifully decorated chapel of St Wenceslaus through the doorway. Outside the South gable has a wonderful mosaic of the Last Judgement. As access to the area of the Cathedral by the doors is open to all, it gets very crowded, so do make sure you have a ticket so you can wonder around the building in peace.
Amazing architecture. The architecture is just majestic - from outside as well as from inside. Certain areas of the cathedral are accessible without tickets.
beautifull. Worth the trip out. we went by Metro, bought a 3 day pass roughly £10 for 3 days travel on trams buses and Metro.

Beautiful stained glass windows. We visited the Cathedral as part of our walking tour of Prague, worth a visit, especially on a sunny day with the sun shining through the beautiful stained glass windows.

Undisputedly Magnificient Cathedral. Have visited this cathedral several years and it was really amazing day and night. I liked its peaceful moment at night and that's why decided to revisit it in this summer. Walking up to the Prague castle is of no joke and tiring. However it is worth the effort when the cathederal and night city view was in front of me. The cathedral is yet as magnificient as before, and the night view of this heritage city is still as beautiful as before, seems that nothing really changed after several years from the last visit.
Nice spot. I consider this as one of the under rated places in prague, the aclrchitecture of the Building is amazing. Only there is not so much information about history
Impressive. take a walk to the hill and enjiy the histric place. Really an architecture master piece worth visiting.
Amazing. It is so majestic, outside and inside. You must see it. I was delighted to be there, there are so many things to see inside - stain glass, statues, everything actually.

Ornate resting place of good King Wenceslas. We stopped at the St Vitus Cathedral as we were passing through Prague with a few hours between the airport and the train. The Cathedral is very ornate in the Catholic style befitting a National Cathedral. Wenceslas, of the Christmas carol, is interred there but the crypt is not generally open and available to tour. We were there mid-week and it was very crowded, nevertheless. We particularly enjoyed the stained glass. As a special treat, we turned out to be there for the changing of the guard at noon.
Inspiring architecture.. Although a highlight and popular with tourists to Prague it is unspoilt and not affected by tourism. Cathedral is still used for services etc.

Impressive. Built in Gothic style, the outside is just a glimps of the inside! Go in during a sunny day and you have the wonderful light of the stained glass windows. Take 30 minutes and go in. You will see great architecture and impressive murals. It is well maintained and worth not only for believers.

Awesome cathedral. One if the most beautiful cathedrals I have seen.It was a guided tour and the guide made it very interesting.The stained glass windows are beautiful.The entrance is fantastic!I loved this place.Wish I had more time then I would have climbed to the top.

You absolutely must climb the tower. The tower climb was recommended to me by 2 other people and I'm not surprised why. I simply didn't want to leave and couldve stared at the view all week. Amazing 360 views and one of the prettiest I've seen yet.

Impressive cathedral, it should be a must on your itinerary. Imposing construction, in the palace court. You have to pay for the tickets at the entry, as the visit is not free. If you're not familiar with gothic cathedrals (never saw one before), I fully recommend to take the time and visit also the interior.

A Masterpiece. I joined a local tour to tour around the prague castle and have only spent 5 minutes inside the church, I'd recommend others to get a ticket and take some time to look at it, the architecture is incredible. It was good to know from the tour guide that the Czech president inspected the crown jewel there and he was drunk .... interesting to know...

Tourists delight. You get a great historical Cathedral, great Squares to admire the architecture and the cathedral is awesome. Its full of tourists and saw 2 weddings. The entrance to the gate of the Square is very beautiful too. The place is full of History. Saw some old time Castle walls too. Must see place.

City brake. Gorgeous! Very impressed about the architecture and stained glass, cathedral offer an incursion in old times. Highly recommended! Each people will understand the sensation only when will visit it.
Beautiful church. A must visit! We walked Prague a couple of days pre cruise. We went to every church and learned about history and architecture. Could have stayed longer
Beautiful church. Lovely church to visit. It is incredibly ornate with beautiful stained glass windows. Don't leave Prague without visiting it.
Prague . I travelled to Prague last week and I was very impressed. From the local transport to the hotel and all the sights to see. Total value for money and would definitely recommend going.

Just amazing. St. Vitus cathedral in Prague is a must see. This amazing building tell us rich history about Czech Republic and it should be interesting for art lovers. This cathedral is truly unique peace of art because it is a mixture of various architectural styles. For me it is example of true beauty - almost cried when saw it.

Another fabulous sight in Prague. St Vitus Cathedral is within Prague Castles walls - If you can climb the stairs take the additional charge to climb the Clock tower - magnificent views of the city from up there. The inside of the Cathedral can be visited free but too see it all there is a charge.

St Vitus Cathedral, Prague.. You can't help being over-awed by this wonderful cathedral. The position is superb, on high ground overlooking the river, the city and several of its bridges, including Charles' Bridge. The sheer size of St Vitus must make it one of the largest Gothic cathedrals anywhere. Inside is just magical. The stained glass windows are fantastic and we were lucky enough to hear the organ being played while filming was going on. Its also part of the Prague Castle complex. Definitely worth a visit.

absolutely a must see!. Stunning church and the surroundings of the church and the castle are also gorgeous! Is it better to have a guide, but if not, just make sure you know the time for services because they will not allow tourists inside when they have service. Also you can not get in when there are concerts in the square in front of the castle. Those who love impressive architectural designs must see this one! It is completely safe area and child friendly.

Awesome and so humbling. What a piece of history, I was blown away the minute I walked in there, not because I'm catholic but listening to the whole lowdown of its history and where it comes from. Its the third building on the site since the smaller one that were there before. Hats off to King Charles VI, much respect for what he did for the country. I found myself doing the sign of the cross without even realizing.

Amazing cathedral. A beautiful majestic cathedral but very crowded the day we were there. Visitors can access part of the inside free of charge but there is a fee to continue further into the church. Lovely stained glass windows but quite spectacular from the outside.
amazing. The view from the cathedral tower is amazing! Worth climbing 280 steps to go up! Suggest to go in the morning to avoid the crowd.

good viewing. we went on a quietist day of visitors but still had to queue to get around the cathedral, some grand monuments, the down side was not enough English written information, but still a nice place to visit
Limited View inside. The castle is very artistic and historical, Looks magnificent from outside, inside is busy with people and limited movement and they have made it chargeable which is sad

Beautiful cathedral. My wife and I enjoyed our visit to Prague Castle and St Vitus Cathedral. The cathedral has 21 chapels, many of which were worth spending time at. Price of admission also included the Golden Lane, site of artisans' dwellings.

One of biggest and archlitectural beautuful church of prague. Its inside prague castle. When you going to buy combined ticket to visit different spots inside castle this church would be included in it. Its big and beautiful you will have feeling of same architecture as Milan and Rome churches. Behind church ypou can use stairs and go on top to have panormic view. Inside church will take atleast 30 minutes to visit.

Beautiful but no seats. I love old cathedrals and this ranks up there as one of my top faves. I've waited years to see it! It was beautiful! However, they do not let you sit inside. After days of walking streets and museums, I really wanted to sit and contemplate the beauty and the history around me. My sore feet made me leave earlier than I wanted.
Spectacular . I loved this cathedral from the outside as well as the inside. So much intricate architecture and design! The one drawback were the CROWDS!! Hard to move through at my own pace.
Absolutely Breathtaking . Be prepared to spend plenty of time marveling at the stained glass windows, the beautiful sculptures and the incredible architecture! Amazing!
Gorgeous . The cathedral is amazing! The architecture is astounding and the stain glass windows are spectacular! Quite a long walk up a lot of steps and hills but we'll worth the climb
Eurpore 2016. This Catherdral is one in a million. The work that went into building this is just amazing and you could look at it all day

A well preserved Cathedral. This Cathedral has a history with all the royals who once ruled Prague and beyond. The inside contains smaller chapels, some glass in lead windows and even painted windows. Certainly worth a visit if you are in to history or religion.
very grand. This is part of the castle complex. We rented their audio guide, which I would recommend, so as to get the most out of what you are seeing.

Stunningly Beautiful. But so so crowded with people and that destroys the sanctity of the place as it makes it feel more like busy market that a Cathedral. Some parts free and jammed with people, but others you pay to get in which are less crowded.
Masterpiece. One of the best cathedral ever made. Its more like museum than church. You have to visit this cathedral.
Gorgeous cathedral. The history surrounding this buildings (and many others in Praque) is fascinating and well worth a visit and passing a few hours

Beautiful Inside and Out. The Architecture, Stained Glass, History.... The present-day St. Vitus Cathedral, founded in 1344, is a grand structure both inside and out. Outside, the dark stone and gargoyles make quite the impression. Inside the stained glass, Crown Jewels, murals, Royal Mausoleum of Czech Kings and I think it's worth going in even if it's crowded. If you're there, why not? Read the history first, as always.

St. Vitus's cathedral and Prague Castle. worthwhile vist to cathedral which is very interesting. Get ticket which includes castle and the Golden Lane, which itself is really interesting with a couple of good gift shops.

Impressive as always. You can spend hours just admiring the beautiful church. It draws you to it and it gives you the romantic feeling. Been here everyday every time I am in Prague and it never get boring
Very nice outside. Very nice outside of the cathedral, didn't get a chance to go inside but I think the best parts are available to view without buying a ticket, looks good at night also.

What a sight!. Not only is the beautiful it is great exercise getting here. I stayed at the Aria hotel nearby and would walk here early in the morning. I was so nice to see the and the castle without crowds.

Just go here, don't bother with the rest of the castle. You can't actually go into the majority of the castle complex, so this is definitely the best place to see. Huge, beautful shining example of Gothic architecture. Will be packed to the brim with tourists, but still worth the visit. The sheer size of it is breathtaking.
Exquisite!. Even if it is too crowded to get inside the Cathedral, it is perhaps worth spending about an hour just seeing it from outside.

Lots of lining up for not much reward. Lined up for ages! The queue basically kept going inside, up one side of the pews, round the front and out the other side. The stained glass was nice but we were basically hurried out by an usher shouting "You can go!" once we rounded the front of the church. Disappointing for the price and time wasted!
J & C. Very impressive, incredible building, you should visit this place anyway. Vitro windows are very nice and the atmosphere brings you back a lot years ago.

Not to be missed.. The important thing is to buy a ticket to go inside. The exterior is impressive in itself, and dominates the landscape. We loved the gargoyles. However, the interior is breathtaking in its proportions, with beautiful stained glass windows and several points of historical significance.
Must aee. Vitus Cathedral is part of the Prague castle complex and is a must see if you are in the city. In my opinion it is not worth it to by a ticket, as you can see all the best stuff for free

Part old part new. Interesting to see what you may initially think of as an old Cathedral with business men on the carvings out front.
One of the stained glass windows is an ad for insurance

Nice from the outside.. The cathedral is beautiful from the outside. I wish we were able to view the inside unfortunately the 2 days we tried it was closed. Such a shame but walking around the sight was still was fulfilling.
St Vitus Cathedral. No time to have complete tour but you can go into entrance and have a good view of beautiful stained glass windows and ceilings free.

Beautiful. It is one of the most beautiful church in the world. The pictures on window and statues are amazing.Route A ticket is suggested because it include tickets of other building if you want to visit church. However, the clock tower is not include so you have to buy another ticket. Also, it is not allowed to take picture in certain buildings unless you buy an extra ticket.
Jaw dropping. This cathedral was absolutely jaw dropping! My Tip: there is no toilet inside, and you can only enter once, dont get caught out like me.....
Very beautiful Cathedral. Well worth spending an hour there but unless you have a specific interest in religion or religious paraphernalia, it just a nice church. Sorry but I'm atheist.
very impresive place. in this location you have the beautiful and interesting cathedral and in the area you have very nice panorama of the city and the river and a statue garden.

Great Cathedral. We spent a lot of time in St. Vitus Cathedral. There is so much to see and much detail. The stained glass windows alone are incredible. I suggest having a tour guide of some sort that tells you what to look for. Just so incredibly inspiring and a beautiful Gothic cathedral.

Its next to the castle. If you buy a B ticket this allows you access to both the castle and the Cathedral next door.The cathedral is worth a visit but it gets very busy. There are two entrances,one at each end of the Cathedral which both only let you walk down one side of the isle so you cant walk right round the inside.You think you are going to see the other side of the cathedral but you get shown the exit door.
Very quaint amoung other churches visited. Like all churches very quiet and admirable especially that this city was not touched by Germany during world war II

Building history . This visit was a great opportunity to see different styles & time periods all connected in one building. The stain glass is beautiful! The arm of St. Vitus is NOT on display (as some of the other sites with relics do). A score of 4 out of 5 because getting closer to the main alter costs extra.

Incredible. This cathedral is one of the most amazing buildings I have ever seen. It's beauty is breathtaking and photos rarely do it justice. It towers over all it surveys and makes for a fantastic visit. Some of the interior is free to access and the rest requires a ticket. However even the free area is a sight to behold. The stained glass is exquisite and the cavernous hall is amazing.
A true masterpiece . A huge building which seems even bigger on the inside. Lots of beautiful windows with hundreds of pieces and as many colors. Only negative was the entry fee.

Interesting building, great stained glass. A fascinating building - very busy, long queues (but they move quickly). The stained glass is mostly modern, but is spectacular. A bit of grounding in Czech history helps you to understand a bit more about the building and the people buried there. Not free - you have to buy a ticket for the castle, but it's not really expensive.
Mind blowing architecture. Must visit place at Prague. Situated inside the castle premises and built on Gothic style, the experience is worth a lifetime!!

MUST GO CHECK IT!. It IS breathtaking! The glasses includes one designed by Mucha and many others are all art pieces. Also includes other religious sculptures. Totally worth a visit (even have to wait in a long line of crowd!)

stunning views. This was an amazing building to see. From the outside it was breathtaking, I could have sat an looked at it for hours. Unfortunately I didn't get to see the interior. However I did climb the 200+ steps to look out at the view from the top. It was tireing but I wouldn't have missed it, absoulutley stunning views of Prague that I will remember for a lifetime. Well worth it, only costing about £3.00.
Landmark. More beautiful outside than inside but it is great to visit to check it out. Location is good and public transportation is excelent.

Mostly a 20th century neo-gothic structure. When looking up at the spires and the rose window of this church one should know that they were designed in 1890's and built in the 20th century using 20th century methods and materials. The same goes for the main nave which was began in early 20th century and finished in 1929. Only the back of this church is actually old. Most of it is about as old as the Disneyland castle. Its pretty, but much of it is a fake trying to imitate a true gothic building. If I want to see a fake gothic cathedral I can go to Washington DC (which is about as old) and see it, no need to fly over the Atlantic.
Amazing Cathedral. St Vitus Cathedral is in Prague Tower. It is amazing. I like in better than Notre Dame in Paris. Much more impressive
stately building. very impressive, beautiful old Cathedral. You must see it by yourself. Peaceful and calm place. Good place for concerts.

Pictures and reviews cannot do it justice- a must see!. This place is one of the most impressive religious buildings I've ever seen, and I've been to many including Notre Dame. The stained glass, the ornament, and the chapels are fascinating and spectacular. You can enter the main portion free of charge, but you must be ticketed to see the outer chapels and most of the building. I STRONGLY recommend buying the ticket that includes admission to the whole cathedral. We brought along a guide book with information on the names and some details about each chapel, which was VERY helpful, as there is minimal or no signage with information anywhere. If I did it again, I would rent an audioguide or take an actual tour so I could learn more. Still, even with some minimal guidebook info we probably spent an hour just marveling at the beauty of the space. It was crowded, but if you take your time and space yourself between tour groups, there is plenty of room to see and take in all the sights.
Stunning!. An amazingly beautiful cathedral. From the newer completed sections to the old gothic section, it's just lovely!

The historical and spiritual center of Prague Castle. St. Vitus Cathedral is the most important Czech Catholic church and landmark of Prague Castle. The first church at this place has been built (just as a rotunda) at the beginning of the 10th Century by prince Wenceslas. When Wenceslas died his remains were stored here. In the end of 11th century the building has been changes by bigger and more representative Basilica. The foundation stone of the Cathedral was laid by Jan Lucembursky in 1344, the western part of the building with two 80m high towers were added in the years 1873-1929. When you come here you'll surely feel the rich historic age, deep spirituality, and you can see also approx. 20 chapels. There are 7 bells in the Cathedral, the biggest one = Bell Zikmund from 1549 (also the biggest bell in Czech Republic) weighs 13,5 tons and its diameter is 2,6 meters... Also you'll see the beautiful Stained Glasses, portraits, paintings and you'll receive many useful information - e.g. names of kings and emperors buried here in the Cathedral, etc.When you are in Prague you must to see the Prague Castle; when you are in Prague Castle, you must see the St.Vitus Cathedral. I wish you very nice day and good memory about this place.
A must see. Breath taking experience. I opted for the audio tour, and it was awesome. It allowed me to move slower and soak in the beauty while listening to all the history.

Worth buying a ticket. If you do not have money you may enter and see it form the entrance but I recommend to buy circuit A or B and visit it and some other museums. This is something to spend money on. Very impressive. Just think that it was built when most buildings were 3-store high. I would like to have a guided tour there as each corner and chapel has a story behind. There in the Hrad, visit also Royal gardens, it is free.
A stunning gothic cathedral. Very much worth visiting. Some people just take a peek without paying for the ticket but I think it was money well spent!

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral at Prague Castle. St. Vitus Cathedral is at Prague Castle on the hill. You can walk up many steps, take a taxi or the tram to get there. I arrived at the castle by way of Line A: Malostranska, tram 22 and got off at the Prazsky Hrad stop, right outside the castle entrance. I arrived just before opening time so I could get some good photos minus the tourists. There are two types of tickets available, both of which include entrance to St. Vitus. I purchased the more expensive ticket as I wanted to see as much of the castle area and other buildings as possible. I walked around the area for several hours looking at other buildings due to St. Vitus not opening until around noon that day. When I walked back to the cathedral about a half hour before it was due to open, I discovered a long line of people waiting to get in. If you just want to walk around the castle grounds without a ticket, you can only stand in the vestibule of the cathedral. If you purchase a ticket, you must show it at the entry in the left aisle and then continue at your own pace all around the cathedral. I went around twice. Be sure to note the third window on the left as you start your walk. It is a beautiful stained glass window designed by Alfons Mucha in 1931. There are chapels and tombs, some dating from the 1500s, all around. At the high altar are graves of bishops, including the tomb of St. Vitus. There was a large crowd at the front of the cathedral the day I was there making it difficult to move around due to a large display that everyone wanted to photograph. Once through the crowd, it was easy to see the rest. Continuing down the aisle, the right transept, is the chapel of St. Wenceslas with its precious and semiprecious stone encrusted walls. The chapel is roped off but you can see inside from here, or walk around the corner for another view which might be better. I like to take many photographs so spent most of the day exploring the castle grounds and other buildings.

what I would expect to have seen. Usual standard of a magnificent cathedral. Free entry into the front only, otherwise you need to pay for further access.Open seven days at week, but check times. Give yourself a few hours here if you want to pay to go in. Tickets are purchased from the information centre within the grounds, not in the cathedral. By public transport its metro line A Malostranska and tram 22.
St Vitus Cathedral. A cathedral not to be missed, the mosaic windows are impressive and the outside architecture is wonderful

Beautiful Cathedral. One of the must see sights in Prague. This is a very beautiful cathedral only finished in 1929!. It contains a lot of historical artefacts and a wealth of history spanning many years. Best to visit early in the morning or later in the afternoon as the crowds can get quite big during the day.

The best in Prague. St. vitus and the rest of the castle is a must I happen to be there late, arounf 8pm and it was empty, I was able to take as much pictures without people around and I was witness when the lights were on. AMAZING

Wow! Amsolutely amazing!. This is by far the most beautiful cathedral I have ever seen. I can't imagine seeing a more mind blowing building as this one! The cathedral is really huge, but the details inside and outside are amazing. The stained glasses are gorgeous and your jaw will just drop when you look around. Do not miss this building when you are in Prague!

One of the most impressive cathedrals in Europe. It is amazing how medieval sculptors and builders can build such a stately cathedral considering the fact they did not have any machines or technology as we have today. Also the interior in impressive in its Gothic style, with its colored glass windows, high arches and decorations is breathtaking. I think this is a must, when you visit Prague.

Gothic cathedral. This cathedral is actually inside the main Castle in Prague. Was very surprised to pass through an archway and see the Cathedral towering above. The beauty lies in its Goth spires and statues emerging from all corners

Amazing . Absolutely overwhelming site. If you're religious it will be even better. The architecture, history, and sheer size of the building are phenomenal. Try the whispering room. I came with a guide who knew the ins and outs of the site. Highly recommend.

Amazing Architecture, Beautiful Cathedral. We passed thorugh this cathedral on our walking tour of the city so we were a little limited time-wise on what we could see and do but it was nothing short of stunningly the same. You can visit this place in your own time and, no doubt, you would get an even greater appreciation of the amazing work that has gone in to making this cathedral as beautiful as it is.We stood there in complete awe at the high ceilings and the magnificent ornate coloured windows and wonder how they achieved such a result all those years agoWe were made aware that there was a lot more to see than what we did so, on the basis of what we saw, would really recommend this place as one that is worth the effort to visit. It is breathtaking, stunning so go and see it for yourself

Defies description. The intricately decorated fascade of this catherdral is spectacular. It's beauty rivals that of the Notre Dame Cathedral in London or any other Cathedral I've ever seen. It's simply stunning.

Amazing views over Prague. Best to catch the tram if you are not a confident walker as the walk from Charles Bridge took us about 15 minutes to the top. Amazing views of the City and the Cathedral alone is breathtaking!
A spectacular visit. This is part of visiting the castle grounds, and thus a cost and lines. Worth it though. You need to use a pay toilet before going in. Beautiful stained glass.

Inside the Castle. Cathedrals, just a big church, right? But this is a seriously big church! If you are religious and Catholic this has to be a visit on your itinerary; and if you're not... Well it still should be. You should all marvel at the architecture as it is stunning and more so when you think what equipment they had to hand. Even Steven Dawkins would love this beautiful building.

The Stained Glass windows are possibly the best I have ever seen.. Definatley worth sticking your head in the door to get a general feel for the inside and the stained glass windows are amazing. We didn't go around all the little nooks and crannies and separate chapels though I am sure they were interesting. You are able to just go inside the doors into the first part of the Knave which gives you a good feel for the place, its architecture, design and grandeur and you can see most if not all of the stained glass from there. It looks like you need to buy a ticket if you want to walk around the rest of the cathedral, assuming you do not object to paying to see the inside of a religious structure.
More detailed that Notre Dame. I only got to see the outside (crazy line and entry fee) but even that was enough to leave me in awe.

Beautiful building - way too many visitors. Visiting St Vitus Cathedral is a bit like an assault course - you have to get up a monumental hill, before getting a ticket and mounting an attack to get through the various gates, before joining a huge line to get inside. (we skipped this, after booking online beforehand - a big bonus or there would've been an international incident!).Stunning views inside, totally ruined by hordes of people taking selfies and generally forgetting this is a consecrated building. It's a shame that the general population of the world has forgotten this in its quest to pout at a mobile phone.

Magnificent Architecture. You can buy a ticket into this church as part of your visit to Prague Palace. The original church had a fire and was re built Over the ages. It is very big and has lots of small chapels inside they have uncovered the original mosaic paintings. There were a lot of school groups visiting at the time so difficult to read all the interesting facts.

Needs English descriptions. Without an audio guide, this place could be really baffling for the non-Czech tourists. The audio guide however is quite expensive. You'll need a ticket to access most of the areas in the cathedral.

Fascinating history. We loved our tour of the castle area including St Vitus Cathedral. We tipped our tour guide generously for a number of reasons but most of all because he made our visit to this amazing historical site all the more fascinating because he explained every little detail and artefact so comprehensively. But beyond that he answered any extra questions we had. The tour was very personal as it was just 4 of us + the guide. And his English was superb and he had a great sense of humour...a credit to this attraction.Very highly recommended.
Amazing Cathedral!. Our visit to the St.Vitus Cathedral was the highlight of our Prague Castle tour. It was huge and spectacular! Even the little ones appreciated it. Truly unforgettable!
A gem !. Very impressive building both in- and outside, Take your time admiring the huge stained glass windows.Listen to the organ playing.Great experience !
St Vitus Cathedral. Interesting history to be unfold within the walls of the church itself, reminded me a bit of Notre-Dame in Paris though :x

Beautiful Castle !. We got a taxi from our hotel as it was a long walk uphill. When you buy your ticket, you can choose which parts of the castle and cathedral you want to see and pay accordingly. We visited not all, but about five places within the castle and the cathedral which is outstandingly beautiful. We spent several hours here and many photos were taken although in certain parts you had to obtain permission to take photos and I think, payment for a license. There are several cafes within the castle but beware of the higher than average prices for baguettes and coffee! Overall, a definite must see. We chose to walk back to take in the sights. It did start to rain so take a brolly!
Beautiful cathedral. Massive building with impressive history, it is always beautiful to see and must see in Prague. But be ready for lines of tourists especially in summer.
Beautiful place. Very Beautiful place. I made the trip in the area with a tour guide I rented was worth it because it is not only a beautiful place also has a very interesting history :)

Worth the free visit. We pop in whenever we see the entry line is short or fast moving. It's free to enter but you are limited to how much you can explore.We have never paid the extra fee to gain additional access because we aren't really into touring churches after touring many others across Europe. However, I've spoken to many folks who feel the extra access is worth every penny.

Gorgeous stained glass. This was a very unique church, with beautiful stained glass windows, very gothic architecture. They allow you to take photos with no flash. Recommend getting the audio-guide as the explanations on stands in the church was more just about the architecture of the building.
Awesome . Very nice awe inspiring exterior as well as interior. Inside the stained glasses are fabulous and the cathedral is a replica of the notre dame of Paris. Definitely a must visit
