Beautful. Well worth a visit if your in Prague, close to the old town square an amazing old building spend about an hour looking round

Most memorable cathedral of our trip. My husband and I spent two weeks in Germany, Austria, and the Czech Republic, so we did see many beautiful churches and cathedrals. This one was by far the most impressive of our trip, though. The outdoor architecture and the interior were stunning. If you go to Prague castle, definitely stop in to see the cathedral. (We purchased a "Circuit B" ticket, I believe, which got us entry to the cathedral and two other sites at the castle.)

Absolutely overwhelming in grandeur. This castle cathedral was a definite highlight of our trip to Prague. Photos and accounts do not do it justice....this is a must see to experience. The free access to the lobby gives a great overview, the fee to see the detail up front is absolutely worth the tour admission. The hike up from Charles bridge is pretty significant, but well worth it to experience the sights along the journey. Absolutely amazing. Only reason it doesn't get a 5 star is due to the lack of toilet facilities. Simply be prepared for long lines and small fee, we were not prepared. A bit more signage for where the Waterclosets are located would be a definite help.

amazing. The Metropolitan Cathedral of Saint Vitus that is definetly an excellent example of Gothic architecture. It is the biggest and most important church in Prague. It is located within Prague Castle and containing the tombs of many Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Empreros. Inside of the cathedral is worth to see, too.

The magnificent St Vitus Cathedral!. The St Vitus Cathedral is magnificent! There is an old section and a newer section. Both are very beautiful! We enjoyed taking photos of the inside as well as the outside.

Breathtaking. When you go to Prague Castle, this is the building you will start with first. It is so huge that it doesn't fit in the camera frame! Everything about it is beautiful...the stained glass, the history, the religious background. When you see a picture of the Prague skyline, it most likely has this cathedral as the highlight. A visit to Prague would be incomplete without stepping inside. I recommend the Rick Steves Prague guide book because he writes about all the history you need to know regarding everything in Prague. A Prague Castle tour is included, so I read the book while walking around. No need to pay for audio guides!

Highlight of the Castle District. It is a stunning place with an architecture that leaves you with a major impact. Thoroughly enjoyed going through the many details. It is a Gothic Style with beautiful stained glass. It is the seat of the Archbishop of Prague. The cathedral is also famous as it contains the Tombs of many Roman emperors And Bohemian Kings. The St Wenceslas Chapel though unfortunately is not opened to the Public

So crowded!. A stunning position on a hill overlooking the river, surrounded by the castle. The stained glass was breathtaking and it was great to see the memorial to St. Wenceslas after singing about him all these years. However, it was VERY crowded. Most people there seemed to be in tour groups - I don't know why as it's a very tourist-friendly city - and they were all so desperate not to lose their guide that it became quite a scrum. At one point everyone going round the one way system had to go through a pinch point one person wide, resulting in total traffic jams. A lovely cathedral, but for a quiet experience you'd better go to a service when the tourist groups are banned.

Amazing, Old, Wonderfully Musty. This church is one of the oldest in Europe. The stain-glass windows are so intricate and gorgeous. Even looking at the carvings and iron work along the entirety of the building is amazing. There is a walking tour of the facility if you are interested, but not needed. It's wonderfully old, gorgeous, and musty!
Beautiful. Well worth time out of your day to go and have a look....This place makes you feel like a tiny princess!!! Loads to learn if you want to read everything!!!
Trip. It's nice. In Prague the history is everywhere. The people are funny and the price for the tickets is low. We love Prague, in specially the Old Town and the castel with St. Vitus Cathedral

Gorgeous architecture!. This cathedral, begun in 920, is a mix of Gothic and Neo-gothic architecture. It is beautiful, inside and out. The soaring spires contribute to the Castle Quarter skyline, and can be seen for miles. The stained glass windows are wonderful to look at, especially the Mucha window. Get your ticket at on of the TI offices, and you will be able to walk through the 400 foot nave. Otherwise, you can only view the interior from the back of the church.

Astonishing, it is worth to have a walk inside.. It is the main church leading the landscape of Prague’s castle. Entrance is free to get a good sight of the church’s interior, but if you want to walk inside and be close to where Wenceslas was buried, then you will got to pay the entrance ticket, which is sold in the information offices around the castle. Besides, when walking inside you will get a better view of the awesome painted mosaics (for me the best attraction in the church). It’s worth if you could read about the church’s history before going there, because there is a good explanation on why the façade is almost hidden by another building.In the church there is a sightseeing platform in one on the towers, to which you could access by paying another separate ticket.

Incredible!!. This whole area around the Castle and into the Cathedral is amazing!!We went on a tour and the information was so helpful. The paintings, sculptures and building itself is so ornate and big.Well worth the walk and tour.Beautiful day When we were there too.
Stunning. Do not miss this! Absolutely breathtaking! Nothing else I can say. It is the highlight of Prague Castle. Go!
Amazing!. We didn't go inside, but the view from outside is stunning! Took a while to walk up there from our hotel, but SO worth it!!!

Gorgeous. If you don't pick the option that includes the cathedral, you can still go in it at the front and see the inside. It is Gothic through and through with some baroque and modern elements. The audio guide gives a lot more details than the signage but it's references are off. The silver mausoleum of St John is remarkable as is the chapel of St Wenceslaus.

Beautiful Cathedral. The Cathedral has beautiful architecture but unfortunately it was closed when we went( Thursday 2pm) so we couldn't see the inside of it and I personally would love to have had the chance. There is a square outside the cathedral which has a few benches where you can rest after climbing all the steps from Staromeste Metro Station to the castle and the cathedral.
STUNNING. The catthedral is stunning. The ticket with the short tour is enough to admire the cathedral and the wonderful gold's alley, it is cheap and there are also reduction for students.

Beautiful cathedral. Saint Vitus Cathedral dominates the skyline along the river in Prague. It is pretty impressed him from the outside. As with all of these European cathedrals, they are really something to see. The main reason I wanted not to miss the cathedral was I wanted to see the stained window created by Alphons Mucha. We didn't spend that much time there because shortly after we arrived they were going to start Vespers. We did not take the audio tour.

Magnificent.. You can enter a small area inside the cathedral for free but if you want to have a proper look you need to pay an entrance ticket which is also valid for other places within the 'Castle'.The stained glass windows are magnificent and really worth looking at in detail.

The tower has the best view of Prague. This is the second time I'm in Prague and the second time I've climbed the 287 stairs of the cathedral tower. DON'T MISS THIS! If you can climb the stairs that is! It's a narrow climb, you have to use the same stairs up as down, but the reward is a stunning view of Prague that beats everything! As of june 2016 the cost was 150 kr to go up there.

Just see the narthex for free..... For free you can enter the narthex of the cathedral, take your photos, light a candle, and then exit. You only have to pay if you want to move towards the chancel and see more of the Windows close up. Now if you are really interested in cathedrals, go ahead and pay. It is beautiful!!!! But my teen was son was maxed out on "old buildings" when we got there and this quick in and out satisfied us both. The outside architecture of this particular cathedral is more interesting in my opinion than the inside, but we had just visited the cathedral in Cologne and might have been done with that particular type of experience.
Trippy architecture. Wow so medieval and gothic looking. In the Old Town Square, wish we could have gotten a finer day to photograph

A Cathedral of many surprises. When you get tickets for the Prague Castle, make sure you have one that lets you get right into the Cathedral. That way you will be able to move away from the crowds and explore the different chapels with in. The Mucha stained glass window is marvellous as is the chapel for St. Wenceslas.

A package deal. So, full access to the entire St. Vitus Cathedral has to be bought with a bigger package. We ended up buying that package because it was so unclear that you could enter partly for free. It was nonetheless a beautiful cathedral that was worth a proper tour.The cathedral is located inside the walls of the Prague Castle along with other interesting things to see and an entire day could probably be spent here if you like gardens and museums and castles.

Interesting Place, great stained glass windows. Very cool stained glass windows. Buy the ticket to see the whole church, the good stuff requires it. You can just walk in but you'll miss the real parts of the cathedral.

Beautiful . You can either go into the Dom and just have a look from the entrance, or you can buy a ticket and walk around. We bought the ticket which gave us passage to the old castle, and some other places. No surprises with the Dom, but if you like to walk around and enjoy the history of such a place I think you should go.

Have to see it for yourself!. I can spend a few minutes sat here writing this review, or you can simply book a flight to Prague and see it for yourself.I was thrown back, stupefied and astounded at seeing it with my own eyes. It is absolutely beautiful.The stone patterns that swirl around the stained glass of the Cathedral are mesmerizing, the towers are monumental and the statues on top of the gates are like something out of Ancient Greece, but most of all the view from the top will be stamped onto my mind for a very very long time.Will warn you about the slight walk, but when are things worth seeing ever easy?

Spectacular!!!. This is a truly stunning building with the most gorgeous stained glass windows - it took my breath away as we walked in. We visited as part of the 'all inclusive' Prague city tour which was brilliant.
Fascinating. We had a private tour and that was very helpful. The Cathedral took nearly 1000 years to construct starting from a small church. This is a not to be missed attraction.

STUNNING stained glass and architecture. We only went into the cathedral for a few minutes during the Castle Tour we were on but OMG the stained glass was absolutely stunning! Also, there are some specific bits of the architecture that are interesting and it's generally a beautiful building. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the Castle complex and the sun is shining!!

Wedding. Myself and my wife chose to get married in this fantastic cathedral on June the 2nd 2016. I could not have asked for a more stunning location to get wed the stained glass was out of this world the size of the cathedral was so overwhelming I thought I would pass out and we had the fortune of going to many unseen places by the public . It's an amazing walk from the castle gates and you cannot quiet prepare yourself for the monumental size of the building until you walk out from the archway that leads to it from the courtyard.This place with its views across the city and great places to shop and eat along the way is a definite must for travelers new and old in Prague.
Very pretty site!. We enjoyed our tour of the cathedral! Lots to see inside the cathedral! The stain glass windows were gorgeous! Very ornate!
Wow!. Magnificent cathedral next to the old Prague castle overlooking the entire city. A must- see on this trip.
Great Cathedral. This is a very beautiful cathedral--well worth a visit--and the nicest thing to see in the Prague castle complex. Loved the mosaics, the Windows, the ceiling...well, the whole thing

went on guided tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. went on a organised tour fortunately their was only 6 people on our tour so the guide was able to give us her total attention
the cathedral was excellent to visit with a lot of history .well worth a visir

Beautiful Church. We enjoyed our visit here while in Prague. The churches in Europe are so beautiful and we always enjoy visiting them. You could go into the back of the church without paying a fee but had to pay to go throughout the church.
Beautiful Church and Castle area. This is a must see for any traveler to Prague. Get there early to spend a few minutes in the Cathedral before all the other tourists get there.
Stunning. This is a stunning place to visit well worth the trip it is in the grounds of the castle and easy to get to

Awe inspiring Gothic Cathedral . St. Vitus Cathedral was the highlight of Prague Castle on our visit. The towering gothic arches inside the church are enhanced by some of the most beautiful stained glass windows I've ever seen. One was even done by the Art Nouveau master Alphonse Mucha! This is included in the entrance fee to the Castle. The cathedral is also very interesting when viewed from the exterior where you can see the different stages and styles of construction that took place over hundreds of years. Wander around the rest of the castle grounds but be sure to see this wonderful cathedral.

Spectacular!. The walk over the Charles Bridge and the steady climb up the hill to the Cathedral is well worth it as this is a spectacular cathedral. It is free to look inside and even though there was a queue, it moved quickly and didn't take long to get inside. A must see if you visit Prague.
Amazing architecture. This church has amazing architecture. If u love architecture u will surely love this church. One of the churches inside the prague castle

A must see! It's part of Prague Castle & I've never seen a cathedral so beautiful & ornate!. Anyone who visits Prague must visit this landmark. Everything that's a part of Prague Castle is beautiful & breathtaking. Would suggest taking a taxi or trolley up there (as it is on top of a hill). Be prepared for description signs not to be in English (something I wish the Czech tourist industry would address- only because English is a universal language & not everyone visiting can master the Czech language in a short period of time). Highly recommend going with a tour company the 1st time (to obtain the history) & later returning to stroll the gardens & seeing other missed artifacts. If it's a rainy & cold day- do not go!!! Wait for a sunny & warm day to enjoy the site. We had to learn the hard way.
Stunning. Really enjoyed the visit here. Located in the grounds of prague castle it's really worth a look beautiful stained glass windows took some great photos.

Worth the viait. This cathedral and its surrounding objects like the singing fountain, palace and gardens are very impressive and definitely worth the visit when you are in Prague and like cultural activities. If you do not know about the history of the different sites a guided tour (or the cassette guide) is definitely worth it's while. The site is easily reached by subway which in itself is a great way of transportation in Prague. If you are up to it you can walk from the st. Vitus cathedral to old town which is a nice walk with many nice views and Kodak moments.

Within the Beautiful Castle Area. The stained glass windows are stunning as is all the architecture outside and within the cathedral. The entrance is free but to view it all you do need to pay. There is the opportunity to light a candle for a small fee too.
Not to be missed.. A colossal structure with magnificent stonework. Admired from the outside but a visit to the interior is important.

Breathtaking . I was stunned at how beautiful this was. Pre book tickets if you can it's busy with a long wait for these.
Once inside its magical
Beautiful. Inside or outside this building is so beauitful. The glass in the Windows looked amazing with the sun shinning. We were here in December very busy, was there late morning.

Wow so beautiful. There are few words that can suitably describe this place. Take some time to just stand and ogle. The ceiling the alter and windows just breathtaking. You are not supposed to take photos of the inside which I didn't but no one else seemed to care. It's a good place to reflect and consider the silence, but be warned it gets very busy with noisy tourist groups and tour guides.
Besutiful. My favorite part of visiting the Castle. Just walking thru and looking at the stained glass is the best part. Lighting a candle for a special friend was the highlight at the end.
Lovely cathedral. Beautiful Windows loved seeing the Mucha window lots to see worth the walk up the hill .It was busy but not overcrowded when we went.
Stunning Cathedral. This cathedral in Prague castle is stunning for its carvings on the outer walls and for its architecture.
Beautiful cathedral. A lovely, old cathedral set in the castle grounds. Its free of charge to enter the main building but if you want to walk around or climb up for the view you have to pay a charge.

Put at top of list . Please do not skip this. This should be the highlight of any visit here. Words cannot describe the inside of this cathedral. There are many side shops and other areas of interest along the way, but the awe you will be in cannot be matched elsewhere.

Beautiful Gothic Church. Absolutely stunning gothic architecture, with beautiful stained glass. You can get in to the front for free, but going further in requires a ticket. I didn't feel the need to get the ticket, as you get a good view from the free area. The ticket probably would have been worth it, though, given that you can also get in other areas of the castle complex with it.

Wow - Amazing. The cathedral is beautiful inside and out. The stain glass windows are stunning. We did not pay for the tour so could not get close to the altar, however, still got to see the inside and take pictures. The lines to get in were not too bad but our tour guide said it can be quite long in the summer time.

Beautiful. Beautiful cathedral, full of tombs and art, Gothic architecture makes you feel in the past. To get the tickets there are more than one place, so don't go automatically to the first line just in the entrance of the palace complexMalostranka is the closest metro station to get into the palace complex where the Cathedral is.

Impressive. Impressive.When you are placed against this impressive building you stay silent. Every detail is worth to admire the beauty of this construction invites you to dream and transports you to the last century.
Amazing Cathedral. Nothing like this exists in the US. It is a stunning example of a Gothic Cathedral from the 1300's. The view from the top of the Bell Tower is unreal. A must see in Prague.
Don't miss this beautiful Cathedral. This goth ice Cathedral is stunning from the outside and absolutely stunning inside. You do need to purchase a guide book
Breathtaking. The Cathedral is fantastic inside and a must whilst in Prague. You approach it through the Palace and it is framed by Palace buildings.

Impressive, but still a regular cathedral.... Well, if you have visited a number of cities, this cathedral will maybe not impress you. It's big indeed, but it lacks of consistency, given that it was destroyed and rebuilt several times since the intial build in 1344.The stained glasses, for instance, are magnificent and full of colors, but don't expect to be impressed as you'd be in the Sagrada Familia, the result is clearly not the same.However, the castle in which is found the cathedral is much more interesting, so don't lose your time in the queue, and rather visit the castle and its surrounding gardens.

Great Gothic architecture. That's what I call nice architecture! The cathedral's outside is absolutely amazing. The interior is nice too, but there is too much noise and the atmosphere is ruined by the hundreds of tourists that cannot keep quiet and keep using the flash on their cameras.

St. Vitus. Go early to the castle. Be prepared for lines to get into the cathedral. One inside, you can see the cathedral from the back for free, but it is worth paying for the entry fee to see the details and the different altars up close. The stain-glass windows are treasures.
Amazing!. This is a must see in Prague! It's an extraordinary Cathedral with so much attention to detail. Definitely worth the time.

Culture Vulture Visit. This cathedral is beautiful externally and internally.
You may enter a small section for free or if you have purchased entry on a multi ticket you may tour the whole cathedral and see the treasures.
The architecture, frescoes, icons and particularly the organ are amazing.
Definately worth a visit.

A must see. With its gardens, more recent stained glass by MuchaPrague City's Vitus Cathedral is a Masterpiece of Gothic ArchitectureAnd the main attraction on your visit to PragueLine ups are a problem during tourist season St Vitus tomb is richly decorated and dedicated toBohemia as well as actors! Tall arches high up dwarf you and give a great sense ofGod
Prague's must see. Beautiful cathedral built in several architectural styles which can be clearly distinguished on facade and interior. Prague's must see site.

Gothic Elegance - Awe Inspiring !!. Located within the Prague Castle complex, at the upper entry point, the cathedral has long line to enter if you arrive before 10:30 AM; plan accordingly. Purchase a guide booklet or rent an audio-guide at the ticket office first unless you are fluent in Latin (few signs are translated into English or other languages). The statuary, multiple marble side altars, loft with magnificent organ pipes, and stained glass windows ascending the walls to the ever-rising ceilings immerse you in this gothic masterpiece of both architecture and worship. Though still beautiful on a rainy day, I would love to see sunshine cascading through the stained glass to the church within - the dark wood, and architectural features result in very low available light for non-flash photography. I do regret not having purchased the additional entry to the crypt.; if I return to Prague, I shall return to St Vitus, perhaps to attend a service there.

Stained-glass windows marvel. Considering the age of this cathedral, you can't and not ask you self was this the one which gave some inspiration to some of the greatest and most famous cathedrals in Europe...
Stunning. Stunning inside and outside, only open at certain times but worth waiting for. Small cost to enter, queues quite long, you can also go up the tower for extra cost.
Gorgeous church!. This Cathedral is amazing on the outside and inside. It's architecture is gorgeous and inside you'll find Saint John Nepomucen's tomb as well as Saint Victus' one.

The heart of Prague Castle. The cathedral is the heart of the Prague Castle area. It has enormous soaring spaces and side chapels filled with fascinating artifacts. Like a great deal of Prague, it has been very carefully restored.
Fantastic View From The Top. the cathedral is beautiful from outside, but the best part was climbing to the top of it.The best view of the old town you can get!

Lack of info. Stunning attraction, which even on a Friday was incredibly busy, but there was a terrible lack of information available, the few plaques explaining what was on show were exclusively in Czech.I can understand not crowding the church, but it's not a working facility so just tell us the history. It looks fascinating, but you go away wondering what many of the small alcoves which were ostentatiously appointed were in the name of. Could be much better

Beautiful cathedral at the Prague Castle. We visited the Vitus Cathedral as part of our visit to the Prague Castle district high above Prague. We did not purchase tickets for the complete tour but were allowed inside for the free visit. The cathedral was amazing. One of the stained glass windows was made by a different artist so it was unique. The cathedral is as beautiful on the outside as it is on the inside. Definitely as must see when in Prague.
The splendor or the wealth was breathtaking.. Gold Gold everywhere. It is amazing that a church would have the wealth to create such work of art. The pipe organ was fabulous.

Stunning. A truly stunning sight. Visited it as part of an all day walking tour in Prague. Was 36 Degrees Sun and a clear day so could really see all of its glory. I would suggest visiting as part of a tour as there is lots of history to learn about it

Beautiful Vitros!!!. Beautiful Cathedral! Wonderful, Gothic Style that Returns you centuries back to the middle ages! Such colourful, beautiful vitros are seldomely found in the world!!! ! Enjoyed every minute of the visit! Just speechless...............

Beautiful stained glass, go when sunny.. Unique and varied stained glass in this otherwise typical Gothic stone cathedral. Some other unique items include a large silver tomb and the beautiful hilltop setting. Try walking around in the evening as well.

Beautiful!. The St. Vitus Cathedral was a beautiful and impressive cathedral. We were on a private tour with Nina, and she had a wealth of informatin to give to us concerning the cathedral which made it even more meaningful to us. We went early in the day and didn't have to wait in any lines. The stained glass windows are gorgeous.

Gorgeous stain glass windows --you can take a free peek. There are two options for viewing the inside of St Vitus Cathedral, which is located on Castle Hill. With a paid ticket, you can walk throughout the nave of the cathedral and take a close look at the inside. Alternatively, you can line up and take a look for free from the small area inside the front door. You can see the windows from there, but not up close. We chose the second option and thought we actually saw more than we expected. The line to get in for free looked long and daunting, but don't be deterred, it actually moved really fast. The stain glass windows were most definitely worth seeing, especially the Mucha one, which is unique.
In the castle. The queues were long but understandable due to it's beauty and history, a magnificent building full of great art and artefacts.

The Cathedral!. A lovely Cathedral in the heart of Prague. If you have never been to Prague, what a joyus place to visit. From walking across the Charles Bridge to being able to explore the Cathedral, it is all glorious. I loved visiting Prague and can't recommend the city enough!

St. Vitus Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral is amazing. The massive, magnificent and imposing building, has an amazing atmosphere and history. To visit but must purchase a tour circuit A or B, otherwise not visit St. Vitus Cathedral. Waiting for input is about 30 minutes.

Surprise! St. Vitus Cathedral is beautiful!. I was very surprised at how beautiful St. Vitus Cathedral is. I don't know what I was expecting, but I was awed by this cathedral. We were also fortunate to have a brilliantly sunny day to see the stained glass.
Climb to the top. You can climb to the top, and the views are spectacular! Must be in good health, but if you can, take the steps all the way to top, it's worth it!

Amazing architecture. It's a beautiful cathedral. Make sure you visit it if you are in Pague. On the outside is a really beautiful glass mosaic. Inside is a beautiful painted glass window. Make sure you inside too.
Overwhelming. The Cathedral was built over centuries and as a few different architectural styles,as a result. The stained glasses windows are awesome. Be prepared for crowds and large groups.

" Interesting Place - Worth a Visit". A Beautiful Landmark near the Prague Castle and is always busy with tourist. You should definitely go inside this gorgeous place and view the glass window with beautiful designs. Its worth visiting.

Very nice day! Interesting Church! . If you are in town this is a must go. Very interesting church. Big and beautiful. Recommend to buy the tickets for 3 or 5 attractions. There is a audio guide available for 3 hours if you do not want to pay a guide tour. It is cheaper and work fine. The last attraction (gold street) is nice and you can actually go for free after 5 pm ( I think it is closing at 6 pm) there are a few bars and restaurants up there. You can plan to be a nice evening around. Enjoy it!

Soaring and Inspiring . The Cathedral required an admission fee to get access to the entire nave and it's absolutely worth the price! The gothic architecture provides a fitting background for huge and colorful stained and painted glass windows. The silver tomb of St. John Nepomuk dazzles and the St. Wenceslas Chapel is full of polished gemstones and gilding. Don't miss the Golden Portal on the right side of the Cathedral - a huge 14th century mosaic of the last judgement glitters. High on our top ten list.

Spectacular inside and out. The long queue to get inside and the ordered chaos inside the cathedral don't make for a particularly enjoyable experience but the interior decor is what we were there to see and it was beautiful. Yet I would argue that the exterior is the true highlight. Amazing architecture.

Majestic and impressive. there's little to say and describe, unless you've experienced it yourself walking from the inner yard and hurting your neck by trying to see to the very top of it. Really incredible building both outside and inside. Do not miss the silver angels on tomb of Jan Nepomutski. Totally amazing work.

Interesting to visit beware for the price and crowds. Nice hystorical cathdral in Mala Strana (Hrandchany) of Prague - worth a visit, yet there are always a lot of turists, so if you look for solitude this is not your place. Check the windows and read a bit in advance - the cathedral has a lot to offer!
Gorgeous Cathedral. Gorgeous structure; definitely go inside to view the beautiful stained glass windows especially the one designed by Mucha.
Gorgeous, and right by the castle. Don't miss this cathedral, it's a gorgeous landmark right near the castle. Staggering architecture, and incredible beauty. It's a must see!
History lovers , architecture admires!. Great cathedral from many different eras build on. Tour the church with a guide you will enjoy and learn much more than just view the place.
Beautiful. This is the cathedral among others that impressed me most. The height of the ceilings, the details are just incredible.

Breathtakingly Beautiful. We got to do the internal loop due to our tickets. It's an amazing church in which one can only feel like a dwarf not only due to the size but also the long history of this building. The stain glass windows are some of the most intricate and beautiful I've seen, best seen on a sunny day.

worth a day of your trip. If you are in prague you have to visit here no doubt. Transportation is not that hard. You can walk if you feel young but you can get a metro and tram after that. The church and the castle is a must see in your trip

Stained glass. The neo-gothic architecture and stained glass are amazing. The beautiful flower-shaped window in the front, seen from the inside, was my favorite part--pictures don't do it justice. Entering the cathedral is free, but a castle ticket will get you closer to the altar and you'll also get to see several of the chapels.

Really huge n beautiful. The cathedral building is huge and full with masterpiece sculptures in & around it.
you are really blown away with the size and the quality of sculptures put up on building
Beautiful. Beautiful architecture and brilliance. Highly recommendable must see. Can be very very busy so plan ahead
Great place to visit. Very nice baroque church, you should visit it for sure! You can still see it from the inside even if you don't pay the entrace to fully visit it.
grand outside. all the churches have their own beauty inside but I thought this to be grander walking round the outside
great cathedral. This is must see attraction in prague. There a lot of beatiful stained glass windows inside. So entry to this place is worth to buy.
Breathtaking!. I'm not religious but being inside this amazing cathedral was such an experience. Jaw dropping architecture & the stained windows are something else.

Wonderful cathedral. Located at/adjacent to the Prague Castle, St Vitus Cathedral should be on everyone's trip incinerate in Prague.
Fascinating architecturally, it's interior is stunning. With a guided tour, the history also becomes a worthwhile. Visit - you will be glad you did.
Beautiful Cathedral. Definitely get the audio guide. There is so much to see in this cathedral and you don't want to miss anything. Take your time, admire the architecture and enjoy the beauty.
astonishing opulence!. Read, read read as much as possible before visiting so you have a complete experience at this gorgeous place!

Nice looking cathedral. Nice looking cathedral within the walls of Prague Castle. It may have been the crowds of tourists which put me off but I didn't get the same kick I experienced in Italian cathedrals, for example.

splendour of colors on stainglass windows. yoo many churches in Europe... but this one is unique.
the stain glass work in this church is beautiful... lovely blend of colors.
enjoyed every minute there.
a must in prague.

A feast for the eyes. Atop Castle Hill, the Cathedral looms tall and proud. I loved the various types of architectural influences found on the structure. Some Gothic gargoyles, Baroque fancies, and mosaic tile transcepts more Venetian in nature...all summed up on one building. Not a disappointment! Inside, the stained glass windows are the attraction...Mucha's work on some. The rose windows are beautiful. The nave is long and the arches give it a nice majesty. The many details truly make it a delight to explore and enjoy!

Great place of religion and culture plus wonderful viewpoint. If you are a religious person you have to visit this place! But even if you are not you should too. Magnificent interior with a lot of detailed things: stained-glass windows, icons etc. There is a cathedral tower with a wonderful view (you need separate ticket for visiting it). Take a camera with you and you will not regret!

Loved it!. Like a few earlier reviews, sometimes a church is a church is a church. However, I really loved this one - it is a beautiful church and the outside is just as impressive. It dominates the hillside, but it isn't until you get up close and personal that it really wows. You can pay to go to the very front of the church but entrance is free and in my opinion you can see everything you need to from the "free zone".
you can't miss it. a lovely Gothic cathedral looking over he city. Centered in Prague Castle. both the interior and exterior of the cathedral is attracting

Impressive, don't go on Sunday mornings. We went on a Sunday morning and the inside of the cathedral was closed for church services, which was a pity. The outer architecture however was pretty impressive! We went to the Castle Guard exhibit as well, wasn't very interesting but may appeal to people who are interested in the militaries. Golden Lane was incredibly cute with tiny doors! There was a nice tiny market at the back entrance of the castle lined with souvenir stalls and food stalls.

Stained glass by Mucha. Third chapel on left as you enter has a beautiful painted glass window by Mucha. The tomb of John of Nepomuk is a Baroque monstrosity. The Wenceslas Chapel which I specifically wanted to see, was closed for restoration- but this was not mentioned at the ticket office.
Breathtaking. Rendered speechless yet again in Prague. Beautiful. They don't make them like this anymore. Well worth a visit.
Grandiose!. The architecture of the building and the colorful stained glasses with representations of holy figures make St. Vitus Cathedral a true masterpiece.

For the art and religious. . It's within the castle. Would be interesting if you are pious or lover of gothic art. It is worth visiting with a guide or lie part of guided tour to make sense of the structure, art and history. It's based within the castle. It has free entry and paid for inner sanctum. Have a look at the website before buying the tickets.
Really impressive . Impressive cathedral, really nice. Might not be worth it to pay to enter inside. You can see the most important stuff for free

If you seen one grand cathedral..... If you've seen one, you've seen them all. No doubt it's an example of centuries old baroque architecture but Europe is filled with them. Save your time for other Prague sites.
Stunning. We went later in the day so it was quieter. We almost had the place to ourselves. The stained glass is spectacular. Definitely worth the entrance fee.

What Architecture!. My husband and I love history, and we appreciate when the hosts are kind...allowing us to look around, and not be pushed in and out quickly. We were allowed to take our time (we weren't on a tour) and see what we want, and take a lot of photos. At prime time it can get busy, but people were nice and allowed us to stay, look, and take photos. The guards and guides didn't bother us--unlike some tourist spots. It's inside the castle, so you have a short walk here, and can hang around the castle for as long as you wish.

Tour group . When can you enter a church that took 1003 years to finish. Started in 926AD finished in 1929. It is in the baroque style and very beautiful. Nice having a tour guide to explain the history of the building.There is an entance fee.A must see.
Long wait but worth the visit. There were long lines to enter, but they kept the amount of people inside to a safe level. The Cathedral was beautiful and I'm glad we went.
amazing and beautiful. This is really a breathtaking monument and a must see attraction.... the whole area around this church is pretty spectacular ..ENJOY
Worth a visit. This is the only place in Prague I found was worth taking the trouble of standing in line and paying an entrance fees. It is simply spectacular. Must visit.

Beautiful stained glass windows and architecture. A visit to the Cathedral is a must when walking around the Castle district. Beautiful windows which look amazing on a sunny day.Interesting architecture adds to the beauty of the building

A Must!. One of the most beautiful churches I've seen, second only to Notre Dame. You can step inside for free but to walk the perimeter you must purchase a ticket at one of the ticket offices just inside the castle. If you are on a tight budget, just stepping inside would suffice but truly a must see if you are in Prague.

Must see, better to have an audio. The cathedral is awesome, as all the other have mentioned. I think it is necessary to buy a ticket and walk inside to 'feel' it. There will be tons of tourists around but that does not matter. The beauty of the gothic is above your head. We haven't bought an audio guide but I do think it is necessary if you want to know more about the background story instead of just "ahhhhh" or "awwww" and then leave. We saw plenty of audio guide spots within the cathedral.
A powerful building. Wonderful mosaic glass windows, a great place to visit, full of history. Saw two weddings - a great place.

Beautiful but not worth the money. The catedral is beautiful inside, no doubt about that. But I find it not worth the money to go all the way inside. Just the entrance space is enough to enjoy this enormous place and the architecture. There are just some relics, a tomb and a big crowd in the pay zone. If you are into religious stuff though, I guess it is kind of a must see. What I recommend- take a walk around the outside of the whole catedral and enjoy the paintings and sculptures and the craftsmenship. It is truly a masterpiece. :)

Must-visit cathedral in Prague. Impressive architecture from the outside and majestic from inside. Make sure to visit in the morning to see the light going through the beautifully coloured stained glass. A small part of the cathedral is free (at the entrance) but you have to buy a ticket to visit all of it. The ticket includes other parts of the castle complex (golden lane, museum..)

Beneath the surface . What is one cathedral fromAnother but the stories that lie behind it . To understand the history of such a place brings it to life. As a piece of architecture it is impressive , the Windows though not all ancient are beautiful and the colours amazing . As a place to meet God , well perhaps in the right time with fewer visitors but then I think I can meet Him everywhere
Magnificent. The stained glass windows are the most beautiful I have ever seen.Don't miss this! The architecture and history of this church are quite breathtaking. Go early before it gets crowded!

Majestic Cathedral!. Part of the Prague Castle, this cathedral has amazing architecture and a very imposing interior. The stained glass is a masterpiece. Long line to enter during the peak season but worth the wait once inside.
You need to see it. Just impressive. Beuty of the cathedral is amazing snd so big. Inside it is also really impressive. Just visit and see themselves.

Beautiful Cathedral. What a beautiful cathedral right inside the Prague castle. The stained glass windows are lovely and the ceilings are magnificent. We did not buy tickets but were able to appreciate the magnificence. But I'm sure the tickets would allow you to see a whole lot more.
The 'A' tour was good value.. We did the 'A' we believed was good value especially if you have time for an in depth visit. Definitely worth the value.

Impressive Church. Didn't have too much time there to look around since there were just too many people. However, it is a very impressive church with an amazing amount of glass and architecture details all around, inside and out. Would be a great place to visit and take some photos.

Definitely worth going inside. Amazing interior and historical story of the building and use of the cathedral over the centuries. It is definitely worth a visit to the interior and not just observed from outside.
It is a little crowded and it is not free. It actually costs $10 to go inside and it gets really crowded as people swarm around the silver tomb of St John of Nepomuk which is the biggest highlight.

Excellent but beware the crowds. Travel tip - try to time your visit for either first thing in the morning or later in the afternoon. There are large numbers of tour groups and if you want a more peaceful visit try avoiding the peak times of 10.30 -14.30The Cathedral is magnificent. Inside there are soaring columns, wonderful stained glass windows ( especially the one by Mucha) and a remarkable rose window. walking through the aisles you pass a variety of chapels but keeping looking up and see the plaques of royal families or see the statues of miners offering gifts. There are saints tombs and very good explanations. After that walk around the outside and see the stone gargoyles, the soaring butresses and spires. Poignant and beautiful

Mind blowing!. It is huge and worth a visit. The windows are very beautifully painted. There is a charge to go beyond a point and we did not buy the tickets but the cathedral is awesome from the outside and the ghouls look life like!
St. Vitus Cathedral. This is one of the most magnificent cathedrals you will ever see - in the heart of the largest Castle complex in the world - can see it from everywhere:)
Just beautiful. Just beautiful, when I first so it I was amazed and stand. It is just a breath taking Monument of history.

Beautiful Cathedral within a Castle. All the European Cathedrals from approximately the year 1000 and onwards for the next centuries, are very impressive as they meet us almost a thousand years later. St. Vitus being inside a large Castle on a hill is indeed like from a fairytale.
The cathedral. You may not be a religious person but do not miss this most wonderful of buildings. The size of it and the beauty of the architecture is stunning
Queue. This is a lovely cathedral that reminds about the Notre-Dame in Paris.By tickets in the inner square, opposite the entrance of the cathedral to avoid the line in the outer square.
Stunning Cathedral !. I was amazed by this beautiful, majestic, impressive cathedral ! This is pure art.. So many tiny decorative elements. The windows inside the cathedral are beautiful.
Part of the Prague Castle Complex. This is a very imposing Cathedral with magnificent stained glass windows and awe inspiring architecture.Part of the Prague Castle tour.

Gorgeous glass, but buy a ticket BEFORE you queue!. The Cathedral is situated in the middle of the castle, and there is often a long queue all round to get in. It is worth the wait, but BEFORE you join this queue, I strongly suggest you go across the courtyard to an entrance marked 'tickets' and buy a ticket. If you don't, you will still be able to get into the Cathedral, but you only get about a quarter of the way in before you reach a ticket barrier. This is enough to enjoy most of the spectacular stained glass, but there are two lovely windows partly obscured by the pillars, and the East End is very distant.
Feel the history. Once you visit Hradcany (Prague Castle) you should not skip to Cathedral of St. Vitus. It is amazing place. You feel history of entire Prague and Czech Royal court there.

Stunning! . I found this to be the star of the Prague Castle complex. Absolutely beautiful! We also paid an additional 150 czk each to climb the steps to the top of the cathedral for excellent scenery of Prague below. It's a tough climb, but worth it if you can manage 300 steps up a spiral stairway.
Wow . On my god !!!What a nice place. Is great just to look at !!I would go back to visit with my friends

Beautiful artwork, must visit!. If you haven't been there and you're in Prague, you're missing out. Such a beautiful piece of artwork! It's beautiful but then again it's only worth a one time off visit. Such a long queue!The only downside is they let too many people in at a go so the church is very noisy and crowded. Worth a quick view and that's about it.
Impressive cathedral. Very impressive creation, must see in Prague! But still very long queues and short visiting hours. And it's very cold inside.
amazing. An amazing cathedral in Barcelona. If you want to visit, make sure to get your tickets ahead of time

Very lovely. I visited Prague in August 2015 and had heard that I had to visit St Vitus Cathedral! I was not disappointed at all, it is a fantastic tourist destination, just make sure you bring your camera!You have to pay to look around it, but it's worth it!

Beautiful Cathedral and cemetary. We enjoyed the trip to St. Virus Cathedral. We were most interested in the reading the history of the cemetery. Very impressive. The view above the Church is one of the best spots to take pictures of Prague.
So gothic!. It must be one of the most beautiful Gothic cathedrals in Europe . I particularly liked the modern painted glass by Alfons Mucha.

Grand and majestic church. Well worth a few minutes of your time to walk around and view this massive church. The stained glass windows are amazing and if the organ is playing the church is filled with beautiful sound.

Astounding history. Learn all about the saints of Prague before visiting. The coffer containing St Vitus relics is fairly restrained, compared to the memorial to one of the kings - silver angels hold a canopy over a massive silver sculpture. The stained glass windows are gorgeous, as you'd hope from Bohemia.
And I thought St Stephens in Vienna was nice :D -St Vitus tops it!. I have only seen a few of Europe's majestic cathedrals but to date Saint Vitus is the most impressive!

Propably the greatest building i have seen so far. If you visit Prague this is something you can´t miss. When you walk under the bridge or tunnel leading to this building you can hear a wow from almost everyone that sees it for the first time. This building is huge and an architectular masterpiece full of intriguing details. I have seen a couple of great churches and cathedrals, but this one beats even Barcelonas Sagrada Familia. You can can also walk inside the building for free but beware the crowds if you go here in the evening or weekend.

Piet the full pass for 350 Czech kurona. We got the 250 ticket and you can only visit 3 places, the cathedral,golden lane and the Basilica, whereas the full ticket (for a further 100 kurona ..£3 ) give you access to many more places. That said the Cathedral s beautiful and worth a visit.Tip use the toilets to the side of the cathedral, 10 kurona but they were spotless!
Grnd view. Visited the place twice. Once with a walking tour and next day on our own. Intricate architecture which draws attention again and again.

A not to miss place. This place should not be missed by any chance. You have to take a tram or other public transport to reach there.The best way is Hop-on-Hop-off bus..The cathedral itself is so beautiful that it fascinates you..We visited this place on a rainy day but it was too good..
Most amazing cathedral in Prague. Most amazing cathedral in Prague. Explore all the way behind the alter and gaze on the different eras of stained glass and art. Grand Cathedral worth visiting.
No words. This place us unbelievable. It has real character and style. It is hard to capture in pictures. It's worth the climb. Lots of your groups and a small gift shop. Must pay to enter
Excellent both exterior and interior. The Gothic structure is magnificent. However better to do it with a guide who can give more insight to the place.

Better than Notre Dame. This is such a beautiful place, I particularly loved the stained glass windows but it is a graceful and inspiring place. Having said that , it is , of course, full of tourists!

St. Vitus Cathedral. One of the main highlights of the city of Prague located at the heart of Prague Castle area. You can visit for free the first third of the cathedral, for the rest you have to purchase a ticket. It is also worth to climb some 290 steps of the South Tower (there is an admission) as it offers great view of the city.

Breathtaking stained glass windows. Crowded but worth the view for the architecture and the Windows. Be aware of the gargoyles above and the structure of the church. According to our tour guide, this church did not sustain much damage in WWII
A must-visit of Prague. An interesting place to see) a must-visit of Prague))) need to walk up much to reach it but there are very nice views around)

Absolutely Stunning Cathedral at Prague Castle. I loved touring through St. Vitus it is a remarkable piece of architecture with an amazing history. The stained glass windows were remarkable. I think paying for the additional access is totally worthwhile

History lesson filled with beauty. We really enjoyed our time at the Cathedral - found on the Castle ground. You can see the Cathedral from such a distance, that to actually stand in front of it, and then to step inside of it, is awe-inspiring. Using the audio tour - we were able to learn so much of the history of the cathedral, the castle, the city and the country. There are some lovely artifacts, each that tells it's own story. It's entirely possible to spend several hours here, just taking it all in as you move through the Cathedral, watching the light cascading in through the stained glass windows. Enjoy and move slowly through this holy place....
Nice cathedral. Worth taking a trip here - very nice views & beautiful castle.a long walk but worth it when you reach the top.
Magnificent!. The size of the building, the complexity of the architecture and the interior with amazing stained glass windows make this one of the most magnificent cathedrals in the world!
Visiting St Vitus. Again, very crowded but the architecture and design is clearly stunning. Again the queue lines made it less possible to enjoy it well. But that can't be helped....can it?

Magnificent building. A great example of such a building with many outstanding features to see. When we went there were vast numbers of people queueing to get in. Once inside you have to pay to walk round the main areas, or you can go in for free if you remain close to the entrance.
very impressive cathedral worth seeing. This is something no tourist in Prague should skip. While still inside the castle, try visiting a Golden Street also.

Impressive cathedral. An impressive cathedral that deserves to be visited. Beautiful architecture and stained glasses. However try go go there at the opening in the morning, it becomes very crowded very fast.
Beautiful. Beautiful old cathedral with large stain glass windows and statues. Lovely musical organ and overall design

Beautiful cathedral filled with history. While the grounds of Prague Castle are free to walk around, giving great views of this magnificent cathedral, I strongly recommend paying the fee to enter (student discount available). Inside you have a chance to see the beautiful stained glass windows in all their glory. There's also the spectacular tomb of St John of Nepomuk, made from 2 tonnes of pure silver. The chapel of St. Wenceslas is remarkable, and is the home of the Czech crown jewels, which are displayed every 5 years.The Cathedral loses a star as you need to buy a photo permit (50 Crowns) if you want to take pictures. It would be nice if there were more signs explaining what you're looking at. I relied on my guidebook and listening in on a guided tour to find out a lot of the interesting history.

Saw it from outside. I didnt get the chance to visit the Cathedral from inside, though the architecture and design from outside is breathtaking, the walk up to the cathedral is interesting and fun, and the area of the Prague castle worth spending few hours there around 3-4 hours for the whole area, and having a meal there.
Great if you are into churches. Go early to avoid elbow to elbow crowds. In Ireland they say, "ABC, another bloody castle". On the continent you could say, "ABC, another blessed church".
Astonishing Gothic cathedral at Hradchany. This is amazing Gothic church surrounded by Hradchany buildings. Beautiful interiors and tombs of kings.

Best stop in the Castle. You can get into the Cathedral with the cheaper castle ticket. I believe you can even walk in the door withOUT a ticket and still catch amazing views. The cathedral is very old and has some amazing history. Get the audio guide. Like others have said expect hefty crowds, however it opens at 9am and thats the best time to go!
Too many people. We enjoyed visiting the Cathedral but were unable to get inside since there were so many people waiting to get inside.

a beautiful cathedral if not unspectacular by european standards. when in prague this one of 10-15 things one must see, even if it's not an unforgettable experience. probably the most beautiful cathedral in prague, though it's not particularly impressive compared to what one can see at winchester, cologne, chartres, saint denis or almost anywhere in rome and/or tuscany. manage your expectations and go with an open mind to be rewarded.

A must see in Prague Castle, but expect crowds. One of the main attractions in the Castle and close to the main entrance. Its very busy. There is an area you can enter for free, but the main areas require a ticket.

The best part of the castle!. The St. Vitus is an amazing Gothic cathedral. The castle in itself is a interesting structure full of courtyards and buildings that offer a interesting and educative time. I got impressed by the magnificence of the cathedral: the tall walls, the picturesque windows and the towers gave an idea of austerity that could leave without words.Do not miss the gargoyles... amazing stautes all around that protect the building

EXTRAORDINARY AND DISTURBING. There is nothing gently comforting in a spirtiual sense about this place. It is a starkly beautiful exterior and disturbing (for me) view of religion. Externally the spires and facade are detailed and wonderful and then the traceries on the side again for me are ruin and darkness - is this the Gothic statement? Inside is fabulous - we were there with sun shining outside and lighting up the most beautiful stained glass windows and producing light and shade atmosphere inside the Cathedral. It is stunning.
A Must See When You Visit Prague. A beautiful baroque cathedral possessing truly outstanding stained glass windows. Recommended access is via the Charles Bridge, then a gentle walk up the hill.

Another Wonderful Place To Visit Whilst In Prague. We visited here as part of the package that comes with "Prague Castle", starting off from the Intercontinental Prague and walking through the "Old Town Square" pass the "Astronomical Clock" and on towards and passing over "Charles Bridge" you can get to "Prague Castle and near the Cathedral in around 25 minutes, the terrain is steep in parts especially as you climb your way to the castle, but there are plenty of bars and gift shops on the way so you can stop-off on the way, don't forget also you can get the "EKOExpress Train" from Old Town Square that takes you up there together with other parts of the city Lesser Town, The Loreto etc (280Kc Adults, 250Kc Students).This being one of the reasons to visit Prague, it can get very crowded/busy as you would expect, but the queue's move quickly so don't let that put you off from going round the castle and the other areas of beauty.The full cost of seeing everything at the Castle is 350Kc for Adults and 175Kc for Seniors, the ticket you purchase has to be scanned at each of the 10 locations to gain entry - Old Royal Palace, The Story Of Prague, Basilica Of St George, Treasury Of St Vitus Cathedral, Golden Lane, Prague Picture Gallery, Powder Tower, St Vitus Cathedral, Rosenberg Palace and finally the South Tower Of St Vitus Cathedral.On the day that we went (Monday 2nd May) we couldn't enter the "Old Royal Palace", "Treasury Of St Vitus Cathedral", "Rosenberg Place and the "South Tower Of St Vitus Cathedral" but we still had a lovely time exploring what was open.Overall, a truly wonderful day was to be had and this is right up there as a most-see attraction to visit/see.

Awesome. A very beautiful cathedral with awesome stone carvings and the most amazing stained glass windows. The tickets to view are obtained from a separate building and this causes quite a bit of confusion

Beautiful castle. Most beautiful and bigger castle in the world, We got lucky on the day we been dont have to wait in line to go in , If you like about history and love in art you must go there you will have a lot of thing to make you feeling fall in love this Castle :)

Another iconic place to visit in Prague. We were lucky enough to visit here as part of a guided tour initially and although we did't have very long here we did get some good background information - so much so we went back for another look. The location of the cathedral is also very interesting with lots of interesting places to walk around.

A must see. Stained glass windows && vaulted interior takes your breath away. Don't be put off by queue to get in - it moves quickly - not everyone pays to go round (but it is worth the small cost) some just view free from the foyer

Cathedral worth to visit. We bought the B route ticket when visiting the castle (tip you can buy tickets in all ticket offices in the castle). The ticket included the cathedral, even without a ticket you can enter part of the castle. The most amazing were the windows of the cathedral and specially the once at the entrance , the colours are so bright and the glass pieces used so small.When you have a ticket to enter there is more to see at the alter of the cathedral were they spend a lot of money in the past. Really bombastic figures.

Go inside. Visited on day tour. Queue went half way round the side. Guide said it would take 20 minutes to get in and group decided to give it a miss. The queue moves quickly. It took 5 minutes max. Buy a ticket opposite entrance before you queue so you can go further than just the entrance. Definitely worth it.

Gorgeous day out . My partner and I spent about 3 hours walking the grounds. Fantastic views without having to buy a ticket. I suggest taking the steps up if you are able to, cheaper than getting the tram and there are plenty of places to stop up along the way for a beverage!

Interesting old church. Walked thru the castle complex including the church which is fascinating architecture. Too bad there were mobs of people including a bit rowdy teens to take away from the experience.

I-M-P-R-E-S-S-I-V-E. You can see the cathedral almost anywhere from the city. The closer you get the more impressive it gets :) You could visit a small part of it for free, but you had to pay to see the whole building.
A must. You haven't seen anything of Prague if ypou don't visit the Castle and St Vitus! It's one of the 4-5 best churches in Europe.

Loved the Architecture. There is so many interesting things to see inside the church and listening to the stories about the stained glass windows/works. While we were outside of the church in the front and sides there were so many fine details in the architecture...it was interesting.

Church, which you can see from a long distance from it )). This cathedral located at the top of hill and you can see it from "any" place in the Old Prague center.
It also little crowder from 10 a.m

A must..... The size and scope of this cathedral dominated the city. It is gothic architecture at its best. A blend of modern and ancient mixed with spirituality and history.... It has it all. Don't miss the Mucha window.
Beautiful cathedral,. Worthwhile going with a guide to learn the story of it, as only one part is old construction, the rest is 1800 and up to the 1920, but still it's impressive

Beautiful Cathedral, Gothic and imposing... The Cathedral stand outs from afar, in the Prague Castle skyline it is quite prominent. It has a gothic architecture and lovely stain glass work. Entering the cathedral is free upto the first section, so you can see the cathedral but to enter the interior sections you need a ticket.
Inspirationnal beauty!. We love visiting old cathedrals, and this is one of the most beautiful in the world. Beautiful stained glass, statuary and truly breathtaking architecture.

A knockout. Buy a ticket so you can go inside. Without a ticket you are left at the entrance and do not get the full experience of the Mucha window and the St. John Nepomuk tomb. A glorious cathedral.

St. Vitus Cathedral the Highlight of the Palace Tour. We found the St. Vitus Cathedral to be the highlight of our Palace Tour. Be sure to start your tour before 4:40 pm because the doors close for new visitors at that time to ensure everyone is finished by 5:00 pm. Anyway, the cathedral was very impressive both inside and out.
Busy. part of prague castle tour, very busy beutiful building, dissapointing that if you wanted information it was buy a guide or pay for a guided tour
Very busy attraction.. It was a mistake to go here during a weekday morning as it was gridlocked with tourists and school parties.

Nice one. It's a Cathedral so nothing so special you will find there , but you know the perfect architectural and the praying sounds was so nice and breathtaking .. spend there about an hour and it's definitely worth a visit ..Just a small tip even if there was a long que on it's entrance don't worry leave for anything else and come back you will find it empty after a while !!

Great atraction. St. Vitus is the Number one Gothic cathedral in Prague. Very nice to visit at the same time you visiting the Prague castle and golden street. No entrance needed for cathedral or castle, just the Golden street is slightly overcharged. Choose a nice dunny day for visit :)
Great Place to Visit. The Cathedral is a part of the Prague Castle. The paintings and statues inside are spectacular. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Prague.
Wow!. Brilliant! well worth the small charge to get in. Fabulous stained glass windows. Be sure also to get a permit to take photo's, although I didn't see anyone checking.

The real deal. Millennia-old history with medieval legends, kings, gold and silver and a huge gothic cathedral...doesn't get much better than this.This thing is the real deal and impresses as much as Notre-Dame. Must go. I highly recommend a guided tour for people who have a minimum of cognitive ability and can enjoy substance and not just the wow factor. The Czech tour guide was very knowledgeable and well beyond the confines of tour itself. We discussed history details, government bodies, historical economics and he was as sharp as he was interesting. Very pleased.People should spend a few hours in the area. Much to see.

Beautiful!. This cathedral can be seen from whole Prague, but once you're inside, it gets even better. You do have to buy a ticket to go inside (I recommend the B ticket) but it's worth it. We didn't do it, but a guided tour would be better if you really want to know what everything is, as there are a lot of monuments and things. Either way, I definitely recommend you go here when visiting Prague.

Very Beautiful Cathedral. The cathedral was one of my favourite I have seen and has some spectacular stained glass windows. The architecture and the stone was very beautiful and the ceilings were very tall. One of my favourite cathedrals I have see for sure. However you can see (I think) enough of it without paying to go in and see it.You can buy a ticket to see back 3/4 of it. The cheapest ticket (bought from the information centres around the Prague Castle) was 250 CZK or ~10 USD. This got you into the cathedral, St. George's Basilica the golden lane and some old part of the castle (not sure didn't go there). I think if you see all the four things on the ticket, it is probably worth it. I didn't want to see the other things so it was pricey for me but c'est la vie. I would say the cost of the ticket was not worth walking further into the cathedral. Without the ticket you can still enter the cathedral and see most of the windows that were impressive. The rest of the cathedral didn't really do it for me in terms of a ~$10 experience if that is all you see. If you want to see St. Georges Basilica and the other two places on the ticket, it may be more worth it for you. All and all it was a very beautiful cathedral that reminded me a lot of the Glasgow Cathedral with the architecture and colour of the stone.

Impresive. This is an impresive building and a masterpiece of architecture. Being erected over so many years, yet you are not able to see the different stages of the building. My advice is to make a tour arround, admire the exterior with all different gargui that are placed arround the cover and disimulate the rain water tubes, then go inside and spend time admiring the gorgeous stained windows and the sculptures. Remember, is a church, so your discretion in talking and taking pictures will be highly apreciate.

A must when you're in town. The cathedral is impressive and it's really a stunning place to visit, a must when you're in Prague. Make sure to also make your way to the top and the reward is a fablous view.

I can say nothing negative of Prague - simple! Everything is clean, nice and unforgetable. St Vitus Cathedral is also a MUST to see. You need your time and be sure you take the stairs up to the Tower. A visit to the St. Vitus Cathedral without visiting the Tower is like going into a cafe without drinking the real Czech beer.

Take a tour of this cathedral. We made the mistake of seeing it ourselves. We would of liked to have an audio guide we didn't find one not to say there isn't one.it would of made it more interesting. There is guide tours though. It is very beautiful inside and out. Worth a visit.
Fab, well worth a look. Stunning place and huge. Plenty to see, not too pricy. Very steep walk back into town.Friendly people.Changing of the guard.Fab views from the top.

Stunning architecture, could stay there for hours.... I'm not a history or architecture expert but that's definitely a place everyone should visit. And not just the entrance zone but whole building. The effect that sun cause through glass-coloured windows is something you won't forget for a long time.
It's so big!. This is a must visit in Prague. Climb the stairs and get your self over here. It's really worth it. Also entry is free, which is really a bonus.
Amazing architecture. We went to visit Prague Castle in Prague and visited this Cathedral. We have found this place amazing.

Second only to Sainte Chapelle for a great experience. Opulent and huge, Mucha stain glass window, other artists stain glass windows. Part of castle complex and a climb uphill to get there, but worth it. Yes, it's amazing.
Gorgeous. Stunning stained glass windows inside. Beautiful church. Be warned. It closes at a weird time 3:40pm.

Absolutely stunning church, inside & out, within the castle walls,. Amazing church, inside the castle walls of Prague castle, with so much to see & take in, inside and out. Take the time to have a good look around, it's spellbinding. And I'm an atheist!
Amazing. I visited the cathedral in April 2016. I felt small when I was looking at the stained glass and the amazing architecture!
Spectacular . Again the FREE - Discover Prague - guide gave enough background to appreciate the historic significance. Beautiful and worth a visit.

A most enjoyable visit. . Prague is a beautiful city to walk around and its nice to visit a cathedral for a quiet rest during your visit.
Enjoy your stay.
You have to see it. Amazing church outside and inside. And lovely for romantic walks by night or sunset. Visit everything on the castle hill!
Simply breathtaking. A MUST visit especially if you are in the Prague Castle complex. It is very beautiful inside and you get to see many old tombs.
The most beautiful in the world. Beautiful, stunning, breathtaking. There are not enough superlatives to describe this wonderful calthedral.

Veri nice stained glass. Despite it looks big, the visiting part is not very large. Specially the stained glass are very beautiful. I don't recommend to pay to go beyond the public part bc the rest of the Catedral has nothing apse special to see.

Spectacular church. This is a very beautiful old cathedral in the Prague Castle Complex. There are many stained glass windows that hopefully are well lit. It's worth a visit. You can enter for free but not walk all around the building unless you pay.
Magnificent Cathedral. This cathedral was part of the Prague Castle. Wonderful architecture and beautiful stain and painted glass windows. Very impressive.

Stunning. Gothic cathedral. Very special space - enjoy the baroque overtones and the gothic architecture. I really enjoyed this visit with my family. I think this is much more interesting then the modern castle it sits within.
duomo giganto. Very imposant monument, outside and inside. The post of this cathedrale is also very good, because it´s near the prague castle.

Stunning. The cathedral is in the Castle. Definitely go early and try to get there before it opens because there will be queues. The large groups seem to turn up from about 10.30am so try to avoid them. The stained glass is amazing and not to be missed, particularly the glass designed by Alphone Mucha.

A 600-year project. Finished in 1929, this cathedral dates back some 600 years, but its construction was interrupted by conflicts and lack of funds. You can get a guide from an office close to the entrance. Or you can just enter the first part of the church for free to admire the fantastic stained glass windows. Getting further into the cathedral requires a ticket.
breath taking. When visiting the castle we visited the St. Vitus Cathedral.The Catedral is breath taking, huge, beautiful
Lovely stained glass windows throughout. Lovely cathedral featuring many stained glass windows. When you seen so many of these cathedrals it is difficult to rate them.
Magnificent Cathedral!!. This monument could be more interesting for the architect lovers as well as Photographers. Just go there, have a look and enjoy it's architectural beauty!

Impressive. What an impressive piece of architecture. Built for centuries tarting in 1344 and finished in 1929. You can see gothic, reneissance, baroque and neo-gothic elements within this specific cathedral. Worth a visit not just for an architectural fans.

No need to buy ticket to enter. The public is allowed free into about first 1/3 of the Cathedral. You can see everything from there unless you are interested in detail. We found it quite sufficient. You can see both sides of the Cathedral windows, altar and more.
Stunning windows. Gets very busy here, had to queue to get in but we loved the beautiful windows and impressive architecture.

If you must only visit one church in Prague.... The history of this cathedral is the history of this country and this city. Got everything you want and expect in a Gothic masterpiece - gargoyles and all!

St Vitus Cathedral. This is a jewel of Europe and is amazing that it never got ravaged by WW1 or WW2. It is in great shape and is a must see when in Prague. Go early in the morning to avoid huge crowds.

Marvellous. We tried visiting the castle and Cathedral a day back but it was closed due to the Chinese prime ministers visit and we went again the next day. You can take a ticket and opt for the guided tour which can take a few hours as the whole area around the castle and cathedral is huge, but we did not have much, so we explored it on our own.The cathedral is huge, and very difficult to fit in one frame if you are trying to click a picture, but it had a strange attraction, the structure was beautifully crafted but also gave me an eerie feeling. Nevertheless, must visit as this is in the top 5 attractions of the city.
Magnifitient cathedral. Huge, beautiful, formidable. Just choose the epithet by yourself. I'm only sure you can't be disappointed after seing it.

Gothic spendor at its finest!. At first I thought the Cathedral was the Prague Castle. It's the biggest and most beautiful building in Prague as well as a spiritual symbol of the Czech nation and the resting place of Czech history’s greatest rulers. The cathedral is an excellent example of Gothic architecture and contains the tombs of many Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors. The Cathedral, consisting of the central nave, has narrow aisles with small chapels illuminated by the light going through colored windows showing many sacred motifs also depicting classic Art Noveau imagery. It is a beautiful site to behold and well worth the visit. You can go inside part of the cathedral for free and then another part requires a ticket. Don't miss the St. Vitus Cathedral while in Prague.

Stunning but get a tour guide. Definitely the highlight of the Prague Castle complex. Make sure you get a guided tour as you skip the queues and get a wonderful history of the building and the famous people from Czech and Bohemia.
Beautiful!. Amazing building, the architecture is amazing inside and out. It's free to go inside but you need a ticket to go around all of it (worth it). A must visit in Prague - just beautiful!
Stunning. One of the most beautiful churches I've been to. It may be better than Notre Dame. Lots of history inside.
Nice Cathedral. Quite old and beatifil place to visit. My recommendatio it's to visit with a tourist guide to know more about history.
Spirtual experiance. Areal spirtual Experiance, it's amazing how they build those moments those times, no one can build those even today
Cannot miss when in Prague. Most amazing, words cannot describe, the square and surrounding palace etc are slightly "touristy" but not the Cathedral! An absolute must see

Another church. Well as I'm bot this "church person" for me it was another high church in centre of another european capital.
Hey, and do not go there at Saturday as wedding photographers occupy all great photo spots :D
Nice Church. We walked around the cathedral and saw its magnificent exterior then viewed the inside from the entrance but didn't join the queues to see the 'pay to view' parts

Magnificent View. The Cathedral is one do those beautiful visits in Prague. Right close to the Prague Castle, I had the opportunity to go up the South Tower once. Unfortunately it was closed yesterday for repairs. The view is unique, magnificent specially during a sunny day. Don't miss the Catedral and be prepared to go up 400 steps to visit the tower. Check the opening first.

Massive, beautiful but a lot of said histories. Perhaps one of the most historic and impressive buildings in the city, at the heart of the Prague Castle. This has a long period of making,. Another must when you are in the city.

Worth a Visit. Huge building. Lots to see. When we were there in April it was wall to wall student and tourist tour groups. Getting through and around them made it difficult to enjoy the beauty. Best to go in the winter when it's quieter.

Beautiful building on a sunny day and amazing to walk around the castle!. Definitely add this on your list of 'must sees' when visiting Prague. You don't have to go inside to admire the architecture and design element of this cathedral. It was really busy when I went to skipped the inside but would try again on a quieter day.

Magnificent Cathedral. A place of such beauty, but like so many of it's kind throughout the world, it's difficult to embrace in such a crowed atmosphere. Many of the tour guides block the routes that you are obliged to take around the perimeter. This visit can be equally spiritual & frustrating as you go around. Try this one as first on your list at the earliest time of opening to avoid the obvious selfie takers & posers.

The greatest gothic cathedral I've ever seen!. It is tremendous, huge, beautiful, scary, impressive! When you look at such a powerful building like this, you cannot help feeling surprised at the fact how skilled and creative architects of the past were!
Wow.. A must to visit when in Prague. We was amazed by the size and beauty of this place. A hard walk up hill to get there but well worth it in the end

Stunning stained glass. The stained glass windows throughout the cathedral are stunning. You can go into the entrance and see the main building without buying a ticket but to enter the cathedral proper and explore you need to pay. When we visited a lot of the things we wanted to see (particular religious icons and statues, some items of historical relevance) were cordoned off and it looked like they were doing renovation work all over so we actually missed a lot of what we hoped to see, and for that reason it was not worth paying for entry.
