However, once the renovations are done and the areas are opened up again it would be worth it. You can get entry as part of a combined ticket to various castle attractions.

Castle is wonderful. Definately take the walking castle tour up to see the cathedral and the castle. It was worth it as as you cross the river you will be on the Charles bridge which as special sight of its own. We did not walk all the way up to the castle, the tour included a tram side which was great. Then walked down.

Another must see. You can get into the end of the nave for free, otherwise you need a combined entry ticket for here & other buildings.Unfortunately, it was not possible to enter St. Wenceslas Chapel - the most famous part of the whole building.
St. Vitus Cathedral. This Cathedral is fantastic. There are beautiful stained glass windows and also non-stained glass which allows a lot of light into the main section of the church.
Beautiful. A beautiful Cathedral in Prague. We loved looking high up on the outside to see the intricate designs. We also really appreciated out time inside as well. It took our breath away.

Quite an amazing Cathedral!. I would recommend getting a ticket that includes the Golden Lane area. The cathedral was great and very impressive on the outside and on the inside. But take some time to see the Golden Lane area. Between the torture museum, the quaint homes, the armor lining the halls and being able to shoot a cross bow there is plenty to see and do.

Part of a Package. The Cathedral is part of a package of several attractions around the palace. There are a number of choices of combinations of venues to visit and the prices are reasonable. Golden Lane can get very busy and crowded.

No idea; queue was massive. The outside is lovely, very gothic and well detailed, however the queue just to get in was so long that we did not have time in a weekend to join the end and to be honest, a 2-3 hour queue to see inside a Church??? I don't think so (not with kids).

Architectural.... It's one of the beautiful cathedral and best architecturally designed. With loads of history behind, you need to understand the history and walk around and look high with beautiful glass paintings...take your time and enjoy the history and architectural concept.

Seriously good looking Cathedral!. St Vitus Cathedral is gorgeous! So amazing inside and out. We spent a good hour looking through the inside and sat in on part of a service which was quite unique.
Definitely worth a look inside!

A place to see in the castle. This famous cathedral that you can see from everywhere in Prague is a place to visit. But a little deception inside, I thought that it would be more impressive. To see because its the monument of Prague and because its in the general entrance for the castle, but Prague gives more interesting place to the tourists.
St. Vitus Cathedral. Architectual real miracle. Be sure to go with a guide because of the many ancient legends. Otherwise you will watch and not see.
Awesome. You could spend days roaming around this amazing structure. The history it tells in the paintings and architecture is inspiring.
Gothic beauty. This was the most impressive sight in Prague for me. The Cathedral is beautiful and the area is nice as well.

Unbelievably great looking cathdral. You will need to crane your neck to catch the higher points of the building which is being constantly reworked upon. The interiors of the church are stunning especially the glass stained arches

Beautiful architecture and great historical value. We visited St Vitus Cathedral and thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our visit. It has magnificent architectural features and is a truly inspiring cathedral. Worth every bit of our time spent admiring and visiting.
Flying Butresses. Fabulous Gothic cathedral in the same league as the DOM in Cologne. Audio tour is well worth it. Must see in Prague. Pay the extra for ticketed entrance.

One of the landmarks of Prague!. Take your time to visit if you are here. The interior is impressive, entrance is free but there is an admission fee if you want to see more or take pictures of the interior and if you get to the higher point you can enjoy spectacular views of the Old Town Square.At first glance the cathedral's western facade, which looms above the entrance to the Third Courtyard, looks impressively Gothic, but in fact the triple doorway dates only from 1953, one of the last parts of the church to be completedInside, the nave is flooded with colour from stained-glass windows created by eminent Czech artists of the early 20th century. Massive marble pillars support the central dome under which are housed baroque altars and a 13th-century Gothic crucifix.
loved it!. this is probably one of the most beautiful churches i've ever seen; rivals notre dame and the hagia sophia. gorgeous gothic architecture, full of interesting history/artistic pieces.

A worthy visit; especially for free. During the first Sunday in April, the buildings of Prague Castle - including St. Vitus Cathedral - were free to enter and walk around.Given the immense queues on this day, from as early as half nine in the morning, the cathedral was my first and last port of call. The popularity of this key site came as no shock, but I was easily compensated for the 30 minute wait once inside. Elegant and striking are just a couple of adjectives I'd use to describe it.If I had time to kill and wanted to show someone around Prague, this would certainly be one of the places I'd take them.To some surprise most of what you see of St. Vitus Cathedral was in fact constructed as early as the last century in spite of its somewhat older looking facade.

Amazing internal and external. Absolutely breathtaking exterior and incredible interior complete with stained glass panels, all free to the public. There is a paid section but only further down from what can be seen for free. Incredible achievement of architecture. Well worth the walk up the hill!!!

Must see. The architect here is amazing and look out for the gargoyles outside this cathederal. The stain glass windows are impressive especially the purple ones. Not a spiritual place nor a holy feeling but very impressive and loved it!!
WOW!. What a grandiose cathedral. If you have visited other cathedrals in Europe this one can be seen in less than an hour.
Beautiful. Spectacular veiw of old town square from the top. Really interesting historical landmark. Probably the 2nd best view in prague beaten ony by the dancing house. "If you ask me"
Amazing. I have never seen more beautiful church. It is a must have. The amazing statues, the gold, the windows, mosaics are all marvellous.
Amazing architecture. So beautiful and so much to look at...go inside and take a look at the stained glass...breathtakingly beautiful.

Amazing! This is a great place to visit, no matter your religion.. This is an amazing Cathedral. I loved the inside as much as the outside. The best part is, its not very expensive to get inside and its free if you only want to enter it and take pictures, but to go around it you do have to purchase a ticket. Also you can purchase tickets that have more than one thing in them, so there is a whole tour of things to see inside other than the Cathedral.

Cathedral with Mucha's stained glass design!. A beautiful cathedral. I have visited twice, this last time at Christmas so there were decorations up. I love that Alphonse Mucha designed one of the windows in this cathedral- look for the one that is a bit different.
Stunning . Thus cathedral is on par with all the great gothic churches across Europe. The church has majestic stained glass windows.

very nice!. love it! the structure was excellent!
just that, still there were a lot of tourist! would be advisable to come early morning to enjoy it on your own!

This is a Don't Miss. Hubby and I walked up the hill to see this cathedral and we were not disappointed. It is beautiful, well worth the time and effort to visit. There were a lot of visitors. Take your camera.

Stunning cathedral. St Vitus is the Castle of Prague highlight and one of Prague's highlights. It's is definitely worth. It is a gothic catedral, with the typical features. But it's quite big and impressive. All the tombs, columns and arches and the colorful glass windows.... you can just stare at it and enjoy it.
Just another cathedral. They all look the same, could be anywhere. I guess impressive for a cathedral. restaurants around about are expensive. Good views over the city!
Beautiful building. In Prague Castle so if want an indept look you have to pay to see it. Superb architecture and a lovely atmosphere in the church. Take time to look at all the different altars
Don't miss it. We enjoyed our St. Vitus Cathedral visit. A wonderful piece of architecture not to be missed from anyone visiting Prague.

Beautiful Cathedtral. There's an admission fee to go all the way to the cathedral but you can go in for free to see alot. For me the free admission was enough but for enthusiasts I would recommend the paid admission.

Get inside. The Cathedral from outside is a very beautiful piece of architecture you have to see.
From the inside, it is even more beautiful. We visited the church and attended the christmas mass there. It is unbelievably awesome.

Overcrowded . We went on a Thursday morning around 9:30. You don't have to have a ticket to walk into the very back. To walk farther in, you scan your ticket and walk through turnstiles. There is no information to read. You only get descriptions if you paid extra for the audio guide. Once you get behind the alter, it bottlenecks. There were way too many people. It is massive and very pretty. Not the prettiest cathedral in Prague though.

A very nice place !. To reach St. Vitus Cathedral you have to cross the Carol Bridge and now you are at a 10 minutes walk distance from it.Before reach to it, you can enjoy The Changing Guard Ceremony from the Prague Castle. The Cathedral is free to enter, but if you want nice details, you have to pay in order to pass.The cathedral has a tower facility, from where you can enjoy a nice panorama of the city. For the moment, the tower-facility is closed due to its renovations.

Breathtaking! Most Stunning Cathedral I've Seen. This is, by far, the most stunning cathedral I have ever visited. The architecture is breathtaking. The history associated with this cathedral is intriguing. Take the time to visit. It is well worth it.

Beautiful but.... This cathedral really looks awesome from the outside, but we went on a Sunday, so we couldn't enter to see the inside of the building. I'm sure it's beautiful, so maybe we will have to try again one day.

Going to church is a delight. I'd seen pictures before, but actually being in the cathedral, looking at the stained glass, makes you feel pretty small.So impressive are the colors and the craftsmanship that created these windows. Just admire, with or without religious background

Long line moves fast!. Don't be worried about the length of the line. It stretched all the way to the back of the building but we were in in about 10 minutes. The best feature about the inside, I thought, was the stained glass. It's incredible. Worth a quick visit or longer.

Long way to go.... Going to this place requires effort and energy as it is located uphill. We went here with our son who was <1 year old at that time, pushing his stroller and I can still remember how hard it was. But reaching there felt like you have triumphed. Seeing the architectural details was worth it. It is considered as the biggest and most important church in the country.

Beautiful cathedral. Situated in the Prague Castle, this is free entry. There's a bit of a queue but it's only to maintain the crowds overflow. I've visited many churches, abbeys, cathedrals in Europe and this one is rather splendid and very peaceful.

Lots of interesting history to find. Very large and interesting cathedral with a long and storied past. Worth taking the audio tour as there are lots of details in the stained glass and carvings to discover

Stunning stained glass. We debated whether to go in but the queue wasn't too long and actually we were pleasantly surprised. The kids were fascinated by the stunning stained glass windows (as were we). Really glad we took the time to see it. Worth a look.

Beautiful architecture . Definitely a must see whilst in Prague. The architecture is phenomenal and to hear about the history behind these places makes them come alive. As a tourist attraction it will be busy but the guides are brilliant and will make sure you get to see everything.
A bit of culture. Attended a classical music event. Was beautiful surroundings to listen to live music. A bit chilly mind you, although they did offer blankets.

Beautiful cathedral. This is somewhere you have to visit. The architecture is stunning and the inside leaves you amazed at the beautiful stained glass windows. The cathedral is vast and does get very busy but again a memory to treasure.

Don't Miss It. This cathedral rises above Prague Castle and is a visual feast from afar. Don't miss the opportunity to visit the inside of this masterpiece that contains the opulent tombs of saints and kings. The stained glass windows alone make this visit worthwhile.

A beautiful creation. It is one of its kind. I am not a very religious kind of person, so I did not have a long list of must-visit-churches during the Europe tour. However, this one had to be a part of the itenary as I had read a lot about it. Am glad I explored it. It is beautiful.!!The stained glasses with beautiful carvings add to the charm of the church. As Indians, we are not used to clicking pictures in Churches and temples and other religious places (its not allowed). So we captured this church in as many photos as we could :)
Stunning Cathedral. Well worth paying to walk around St Vitus Cathedral, it is so beautiful and the architecture is stunning.

Great place to visit - A must really if you like your history. As Castles go Prague Castle and St Vitus' Cathedral are not the most breath taking places to visit but they are up there, and a must if visiting Prague. The outside is free to walk around and has some interesting souvenir stalls/ food kiosks in the yard beside the Cathedral. We paid to go into the Toy Museum which was cheap and a bit of fun. We also visited a midday concert in Loebowitz Palace inside the Castle grounds which was an hour long and excellent. The highlight though was a guided tour by a Lloyd Grossman sounding lovely Czech guy who filled in all the blanks on the Castle, the Cathedral and general Czech/Prague history. If you visit the Castle and pay to go into the Cathdral etc DO the guided tour as it brings the place to life.
Just WOW !. The Cathedral is just amazing to watch, a piece of ancient art like no other !Some cool pics could be taken here , so make sure you take it with you and not just use your phone camera !

Great stained glass windows . Worth the visit - stained glass windows are unlike anything I have seen. The cathedral is situated at a high vantage point so some stunning views of Prague. If you get thirsty there's a Starbucks up there too!

Impressive!. Maybe one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen, and I have seen quite a bit... Really gorgeous, both inside and outside. It's that kind of place you hardly believe exist till you see it. If you have time to only visit one place in Prague, this is the one. Don't you miss it!
Magnificent. A must see the work and detail is unbelievable. Magnificent stained glass windows it was a sunny day which made them all the more spectacular.

The Cathedral is beautiful if you like that sort of thing. We went to see the Cathedral tho it's not really something I'm interested in, its famous so I wanted a look lol. It's beautiful and large tho you only get to see the ground level, you cant climb towers etc. If it is something you want to know about, I would say get a guide as there wasn't much to learn from it in English without one, you could just look at stuff.

Amazing. Stained glass windows were beautiful. You can enter for free but venturing deeper requires a ticket which offers access to prague castle and various areas. The exterior of the cathedral is breathtaking as well. One of the most beautiful cathedrals I've seen in central Europe.

Must-see!. My girlfriend and I took a trip to the Prague Castle (home to St. Vitus Cathedral). We did not buy any ticket or anything, you can see all the main bits without needing to buy one! Was truly stunning and would suggest to everyone. Quaint little market in the square too, selling traditional Czech food!

The colours of the stained glass will blow your mind. You will need to queue for entry, but it will be worth it. The sun was coming through the glorious rose window, and the restored stained glass. The colours are incredible, this for me is the highlight, not the crowded areas around the tombs of the saints and kings
Stunning. Such a beautiful cathedral. Stunning inside and out. Lots to see but the queues are massive so you have to have a bit of patience.
Beautiful Gothic looking architecture. Most impressive building, beautiful stained glass, incredibly tall arches. Very awesome building. Look forward to going back
Beautiful. Stunning stain glass windows and beautiful cathedral, inside and out. Definitely worth a visit. Take your camera.

Great outside, cordoned off inside. I've visited a lot of churches in Europe and have always been able to access most areas for free - including famous cathedrals such as Notre Dame...the idea being that you donate to the various collection plates. This place charged visitors to visit the altar and more interesting parts of the church which totally put me off and I left after two minutes. The architecture was impressive though

Magnificent looking, touristy but important to visit :). It's a Roman Catholic church from 1300 with very intricate Gothic design. If you like church, you will enjoy the detailed design inside and take plenty of pictures from the outside as well.On certain days (not sure if it's everyday) - there's like a little bazaar outside that sells accessories and food. You will see plenty of local choices there, just try a little bit of everything and have a nice beer :)You can access it through entering the Prague Castle (on the way up from Mala Strana), which is a complex containing multiple huge sections and buildings.Cheers
Amazing stained glass. This is a gorgeous cathedral and a do not miss if you are in Prague. The stained glass is breathtaking.

Vitus Cathedral. You can enter in the begin of the cathedral for free, but gothic cathedral are most beautiful outside than inside in my opinion. Don't waste your Money, in my opinion the best cathedrals and churches of this world are free.

Beautiful. Only had a day to see things. Very beautiful church.
Be sure to see it in the evening lighted up. Would have
liked to see the inside, not enough time.
Beautiful interior.. The queue for the cathedral was very long in the morning so we walked by and came back later. No queues in afternoon. The stained glass windows are stunning.
Amazing architecture!. So much to see - you have to pay the 250 or 250 CZK to get into a few of the parts of Prague castle but it is soooo worth it!

One of a kind with unique finishing touches. The Cathedral really is an amazing building both inside and outside. Taking nearly two thirds of a century to compete the Cathedral has some really unique characteristics that make the building all the more special. From the south tower and its three different building styles, to the architects faces carved on the front, to the bank sponsored stained glass window, the Vitus Cathedral is truly special. On the inside the stained glass windows are worth a special mention as they really are a sight to behold. This place is simply a must if in Prague.

Visit to Cathedral. Great and unusual Cathedral in the middle of the palace. If you are religious and expect quite and privacy, then this won't be for you. The noise level inside was incredible and all tourists were speaking - not exactly respectful.

Worth the ticket! . What an amazing place full of beauty and history everything of interest is fully translated so you can really get a good feel of the artefacts . If you only visit one thing make sure it's this.

Stunning, especially at night!. This church is truly stunning on the inside and the outside! You really need to visit the church during the day to see the beauty of the windows but at night, when the church is closed and there aren't a lot of people in the area, the church is transformed into a true beauty! The lights on the outside make the church come alive and it is something you definitely have to experience up close.

Cathedral. Fabulous building with some stunning stain glass windows. Frescos on the ceiling. Houses the bohemian crowns jewels, crown, Spector etc but only a copy and I found rather crude the crown that is. Worth the visit.
Beautiful stained glass windows. This old church is impressive with high vaulted ceilings and alcoves with magnificent stained glass relief and paintings

Amazing structure, unesco protected. תרגםכבה תרגום מהיראנגליתעבריתערביתאתר שפהעבריתאנגליתערביתתרגםThe cathedral is just amazing! the history of it, and all the stories suronThe cathedral is just amazing! the history of it, and all the stories surrounding it just gives it more volume.I am there once a week, and the place is usually full with people, but still you can get in and out with no problem and to enjoy it.If you want to see all of it ( or at least the part you can) make sure to buy a ticket.*you can get a combined ticket to the castle area + the cathedral, or separated. up to you..
Absolutely stunning. One of the most impressive gothic cathedrals in the world, both inside and out. Simply breathtaking. A must-see in Prague.

Nice church with great stained-glasswindows. Beautiful church with different architectural styles. Don't miss out on the beautiful / colourful stained-glasswindows inside. Notably the third on the left side of the church by Mucha! Free entrance.
Imprrsive building . The is something one must visit at least once. Preferably with less tourists. This is not something that could be described; it must be experienced.

Worth The Ticket. First off, yes -you need a ticket to get in. Also, I would suggest the audio guide as they do not provide brochures outlining the stops in the church.The Gothic architecture is awe inspiring. The windows are breathtaking. Check (no pun intended) outthe Mucha window. It is art nouvaeu and painted.Also, it would be wise to learn a bit about St. Wenceslaus as he is important to Prague history (and he did more than look out at the Feast of Stephen). He is buried here.

Constant treats for the eye. What a place! Everywhere you look there is a surprise or a delight to be seen. It could take a day to look at it properly and even then you'd want to come back the day after and fill the eye again. It reminded me a little of the Stephansdom in Vienna, and it's certainly a gothic masterpiece. get a guide or a good guidebook to tell you the backstory as you gaze. It adds a huge amount to know what you're looking at!
Truly beautiful!. This cathedral is absolutely fantastic. If you are heading up to Prague Castle, do not miss going inside. It is free and gorgeous!

Get to the castle area early, as there are crowds of tour groups starting at 1030 daily.. Get to the castle early!!! After 1030 there are hoards of tour groups and crowds. After 3:00 is better as well to avoid crowds.
Lovely Cathedral. We enjoyed our visit here, the cathedral has stunning views, recommended. The architecture is very detailed.
Impressive !. This cathedral is as beautiful from the outside as it is from the inside! The best pictures there are taken in the evening...make sure to try that!

neogothic style. To me, the beauty of Prague also form the neo-Gothic buildings, especially churches. It is a tower on the facade of St. Vitus Cathedral, rebuilt Basilica of St. Peter and Paul at Vyšehrad, St. Ludmila Church in Vinohrady. Designer Josef Mocker.
Beautiful. No trip to Prague would be complete without exploring the Castle and Cathedral. It is a beautiful building, both inside and out. The stained glass has some of the most amazing colours.

Skyline cathedral. It dominates the sky line and doesn't disappoint close up. You can enter for free or pay and get a bit closer to the windows etc. we didn't use the audio guide but possibly worth it. It is very hilly to get there so be aware if unsteady on feet
Gorgeous cathedral . I highly recommend visiting this beautiful cathedral, the architecture and details in this building are breathtaking. This was one of the highlights of my trip in Prague.

Picturesque spires. Very busy even in February . Good tip to take a tram which goes around the back of the castle and you can save yourself a steep walk going from the front . Good views as you approach from the back . Can enter the castle site and go through to the entrance of the church where you can see the stained glass windows and alter without fully entering without a fee.
One of the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe!. You must walk around and through the cathedral for the full experience. There is also a lot to do nearby.
Really nice Cathedral. Enjoyed our visit to the cathedral, well worth the entry fee to admire the skill of the builders of old

Wowwwwwwwww!. This masterpiece is stunning inside, some parts are over the top, others quite plain, but it all works so well. This rates as one of my favourite gothic buildings and it's not something you expect when you walk through the archway inside the Castle precincts.
Nice, especially around Christmas. Very nice cathedral. Something you have to see while visiting Prague & Hradcany. I recommend coming to there through Zlata Ulicka...

Lovely cathedral . We visited the cathedral whilst in the castle. To enter further than the entrance you have to pay, the cathedral is well worth paying for, I'm not religious but it is humbling to be in such a place. Let the photos speak for this visit, they will do it more justice than me!
Make sure to see it at night!. Really wonderful..stunning at night~went twice..day and night..even in the rain..its extra special at night
What an incredible gothic masterpiece!. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever been! It can be seen from all over Prague, so huge this building is.

Dominating the Castle Area. The structure is just as beautiful from the outside as with in. St John of Nepomuk's Tomb is impressive. Make sure you want around the cathedral as the workmanship is exquisite.
Tip - There is a nice outdoor cafe off the back that is in the sun in the afternoon for a break,
Must see!. A must see inside and out! Recommend booking tours in advance so you don't have to wait in line to buy tickets once your there. It was absolutely a gorgeous piece of architecture.

Stunning windows. This massive cathedral has what looks like one of the highest and largest gothic style ceilings around. The stained glass windows are fantastic especially when the sun shines through them giving a glorious orange/red glow to the interior.

Beautiful Cathedral. The cathedral is very impressive, when you first see it, it actually takes your breath away. Is huge!! the queue to get inside and look around was really long so we didn't join the queue.
One more beuty of Prague. I love gothic architecture too much and can say this castle is one of the outstanding gothic buildings I have ever seen.

Beautiful church, full of rude guided tours.. Stunning church with stunning stain glass windows that are just gorgeous. Sadly its so over crowded with guided tours you can barely get a chance to see anything, they stop dead infront of you and dont really care, the guides will do anything they can to push you out of the way to get their group in.Beautiful place but be prepared to be squished and irritated. Really ruined the experience for me.

Beautiful!. A wonderful gothic cathedral next to Prague's castle the outside of the building is impressive, the gargoyles, scary as they come. The inside is breathtaking, the windows are each an impressive piece of artwork telling a story y a million colours, if you come to Prague, don't miss it!
Magnificent stories!. The Famous cathedral shapes this town in a most different way. Not to miss are the stories behind the cathedral...and the other building around it.

Very impressive.. Despite this being very busy with visitors you can still get a good impression of its size and grandeur by going inside for a look around.
Entrance to it is free although there is a charge if you want to go further in to explore the other end.

Not to miss. There are several parts you can see - for free ís just the first part but it gives you the idea what is it like. Then you can buy the ticket which enables you to visit the whole cathedral. Do not miss the St. Venceslaus chapel and the wooden sarved desks in the rear end. Also the tumb of St. John Nepomucenus is wonderfull. One of the stained glass was designed by Mucha. Do not miss the catacombs - you can see the remains of older churches and also the tumbs. On the southern side there is also beautifull Golden Gate mosaic. Also woth it is the visit of the tower - from there you can see the whole Prague.
Amazing history . Beautiful church overlooking the river and Prague old town. Definitely a must see on a trip to Prague. Stained glass windows are exceptional.

Brilliant architecture!. We were in awe of this cathedral's brilliant architecture!.. It is of the parts of the Prague Castle which is open to the public - so, its a must visit if you are at the castle.
Remarkable Architecture. A grand church of the period, withstanding the trials of time in remarkable beauty. Exterior and interior - beautiful - worth a visit.

Stunning building. Very well worth the uphill walk. Beautiful stained glass and chapels. Combined ticket with castle is very reasonable. Audio guide available. Aim for earlier in morning to avoid crowds.
Favorite. One of our favorite spots in Prague. A lovely view over the city and then the magnificient cathedral. Highly recommend a stop.

Pinacle of Castle District. For me St. Vitus Cathedral is icon of Prague. Wherever you stand in Prague you can always see the cathedral watching you from the Castle District hill. Moreover, view from the tower is astonishing.
Impressive structure. This is one of the largest cathedrals I've seen. It took nearly 500 years to build, and the architecture is amazing.

Stunning architectural achievement . Very impressive. I think it's much more impressive on the outside than on the somewhat modest inside, but you can definitely have look inside for free. A central landmark in town so don't miss it. There are food stands right near the place.

Magnificent structure. Started in 1344, it took 600 years to complete. Other that, just the grandeur of this suberb cathedral, and the jewel encrusted chapel of St Wenceslas is a real treat. Be prepared for large crowds who visit this church.

Majestic and beautiful. You can't miss St Vitus cathedral as it looms large over the city sky line. The exterior of the cathedral is imposing and comprises of beautiful architectural details. The interiors match up equally to the exterior and the first impression as you enter the cathedral is of the soaring ceilings. If possible, try to go on in a sunny day as the sunlight streaming through the windows and highlighting the stained glass windows lends a different dimension to the place.
Absolutely superb. The cathedral is something not to be missed . The stonework dating back centuries is incredible . The glass work is very impressive .

Beautiful!. We saw this cathedral twice...first a quick walk through, then second with a five attraction ticket for Prague Castle -- this ticket enabled us to see the church in greater detail and areas otherwise not available.
Magnificent church. Went there with my wife and some friends and we were amazed of the great church from the outside. Unfortunately we didn't have the time to see from the inside.

St. Vitus is just great. You can get inside the front part without paying, but to go into the tower or anything else, requires tickets. The area is sure nice, and make sure to shoot some nice pictures outside.

Sint-Vitus Cathedral. Amazing old church, which makes you back into the middle ages when closing your eyes. Look at all the details. It is best when it is sunny weather, cause of the coloured glass windows.

Huge Cathedral in the heart of the Castle. The Cathedral fills the courtyard of the huge castle complex, and is a stunning example of gothic architecture. Just to the inside are several stained glass windows that beautiful (and do not require an entrance ticket to see), while the rest of the church is also quite good, particularly the highly ornate tomb near the Nave and the immense organ system.

Breathtaking. I was absolutely amazed at this Cathedral. There was so much to see, from the beautiful stained glass windows to the sculptures and artwork. Be prepared for crowds of young girls and women with selfie sticks barging around and talking incessantly. Once you get past that this is worth the crowds. We visited the castle complex over the course of 2 days and came later on this day. Perhaps that is why it was so busy. The first day we came at opening and it was not so crowded.

An impressive structure. St Vitus Cathedral is definitely an impressive structure and worth a visit. I think it would have been better had we been able to climb to the top of the bell tower but this is closed during off-season I guess. I thought St Nicholas cathedral down in Lesser town, although not as grand, was much prettier. But definitely worth a visit and look around.

Take your time around this beautiful Cathedral. St Vitus Cathedral is the beautiful building you can see high up overlooking the city of Prague. It's part of the Prague Castle complex, and probably the main attraction people come for. The outside is absolutely breathtaking, from the back right the way around the front. The gargoyles looking down and stained glass windows are just amazing to stare at. Once inside it is just as, if not more beautiful. Take your time around here as there are so many details not to be missed

Breathless. Thank my Czech mother, I.ve visited this place many times, and each time I remain breathless. This cathedral in gothic style is amazing, extremely big with beautiful coloured cathedral glass. The best gothic cathedral in the world
Gorgeous Cathedral. One of the most wonderful landmark i saw in Prague was this cathedral. In terms of architecture it is one of the most beautiful churches i ever saw.

Best part of Prague Castle. St. Vitus is part of the Prague Castle. Entrance is part of the several different tickets for entrance to the castle. The Cathedral has beautiful stain glass and other artwork. The outside is also fantastic.
Beautiful Detail. The Cathedral has a great story with beautiful pictures. Its a must see while in Prague and so many important buildings surround it as well .

Beautiful, enchanting a must. We visited this castle during our tour and this cathedral was absolutely beautiful. It can get a bit crowded but it's definitely worth the visit. The stained glass was amazing and leaves you in awe. Free entry

Beautiful, but for unreasonable entrance fee. This cathedral is very astonishing architectural monument definitely worth visiting, mainly from the inside for its glass colored windows (vitrages). I was a bit disturbed that there is a fee charged for a simple entrance to the cathedral. Honestly I would expect Christian church to be accessible to public for free.
superb. yet another breath taking building to wonder at in the palace grounds stained glass windows threw amazing rainbow like reflections when we were there .

Magnificient. Even for a couple who is neither religious nor history lovers, we were amazed by the Cathedral. Its architecture and size earns everyone's respect! If you love history, don't miss the detailed tour.

Cathedral of Saints Vitus ... during your journey in Prague for sure you will go up of the Mountain to visit Saints Vitus , my advice for you .. you can go a little bit late , to catch a good pics for the cathedral and to enjoy the sunset form the top of prague ..Remember to take your camera with you when you go there...Have A nice and beautiful moments
Must visit. Beautiful Architecture must visit, beautiful in and outside should go there early cuz will be very crowed later

Awesome. A masterpiece of a building. The sunlight reflected through the stained glass windows left me breathless. Love the quirkiness; we were told that the cathedral is owned by both the church and the state. Entry is free but you have to pay to get to the alter.
The only thing that is worth of visiting the castle. The Cathedral is beautiful and is the only thing that worths in the castle. I recommend to visit it first because it can be very crowded.

Amazing. This is an absolutely stunning Cathederal. The exterior is matched only by the interior. Very busy though. You have to visit at the same time as the castle. They are almost side by side. Great to see the guard matching past. Easy to stop for a while and literally marvel at the archecture and style.

Amazing; how did it take so long?. As part of the castle (or, as I learned, hrad) district, the cathedral is definitely the centrepiece of this area. You can see why it took them so long to finish the thing!

Beautiful. Bought tickets for circuit A at castle and cathedral was included in the tour. It is a beautiful gothic building inside and out. You can access without paying but restricted to area near doors, to walk around you need to buy ticket, which we felt was well worth it.
Stunning Building. Absolutely stunning building.. we didn't actually go inside, we just walked around the outside and were amazed by the little details on the outside.. it's so pretty!

Mind Blowing. By far one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen!
I couldnt believe it took them so long to finish it, it all looks ancient!
When we went it, the light was coming through the rose window and bathing the whole aisle with this multitude of dancing light, absolutely stunning!

Impressive cathedral!. It was partially sunny on the day I entered this cathedral so the huge colored windows were really very impressive! A part of the cathedral can only be visited to pay separate entrance fee but the first part can be entered without paying. Very interesing "building". Recommendation!

Gorgeous Cathedral. The cathedral is truly a masterpiece and something that you should see if you visit Prague. I was in awe of the size and beauty of it, and I only saw the outside. Honestly, I wish I could tell you more about it, but I was only able to walk around the outside. The lines to get in, even just for a peak of the inside, were incredibly long. I am sure that it is stunning inside, and if I return to Prague I will plan on showing up when it opens in the morning to avoid the lines. You can buy passes to see several of the castles and cathedrals at the castle complex, but due to the lines and the time in the afternoon, we figured it was money left unspent.

Gorgeous Cathedral. The cathedral is truly a masterpiece and something that you should see if you visit Prague. I was in awe of the size and beauty of it, and I only saw the outside. Honestly, I wish I could tell you more about it, but I was only able to walk around the outside. The lines to get in, even just for a peak of the inside, were incredibly long. I am sure that it is stunning inside, and if I return to Prague I will plan on showing up when it opens in the morning to avoid the lines. You can buy passes to see several of the castles and cathedrals at the castle complex, but due to the lines and the time in the afternoon, we figured it was money left unspent.
Most beatiful church in Prague. Must see place in Pragues castle. Some parts are paid, but without paying you can see main parts. Lots of details: icons, statues etc.

Just fantastic. What an amazing Cathedral. So ornate but in an aesthetically beautiful way. The stained glass windows are awe inspiring. The wood carving of the Prague city is brilliant. There are beautifully sculpted statues and balconies and the canopied silver cask and statues is jaw dropping. Really amazing and would definitely recommend a visit!
Lovely.. Saint Stephen's hand in one of the side chapels, make sure you have small denomination coins with you to be able to see the hand in good light.
stunning cathedral. Stunning cathedral in the castle grounds. Very hard to get a picture far away enough to show its sheer size and do it justice.
Just wished it had been open. Just wish it had been open beautiful from the outside would have loved to see the inside the rest of the castle was beautiful and eating from the market stall was great

Amazing. I can say this is the most beautiful and impressive cathedral I have ever visited. It is huge and the Gothic style mixed with the black color from pollution makes it even cooler. We visited with a tour group at about 3:30 pm and it was packed with tourist. Even hard to enjoy the views from the inside. The inside was not as good as I thought because you don't have access to the whole place, in fact only a small area. This is certainly the high point of Prague Castle. Don't miss it!
WOW. Amazing architecture, stained glass windows, lots of information and history there. Beautiful historical building! Stunning

Beautiful building. This is a beautiful building situated in the Castle complex. You have to buy a ticket to get in (also includes the Castle) but it is worth it. Some excellent stained glass. The outside is equally beautiful too.

Magnificent Gothic cathedral. St Vitus cathedral can be seen from anywhere in Prague. It occupies a high position on Hradcany hill, and it is a must see for the sightseer.Outside it is enormous with many steeples and flying buttresses to capture the eye, but you must go inside and take in the magnificence of the interior with its open spaces and high vaulted ceilings. One can only marvel at how long it took to construct and how many skilled masons were employed in it's building. There is a magnificent stained glass window above and behind the altar.

Awesome. This is my partners favourite experience but you have to approach through the main castle entrance and through the central courtyard,to the left is a tunnel through the building,enter the tunnel and you can see the base of the Cathedral,look straight forward ,just before the end of the tunnel pause and slowly look Up,Up and Up the spires are awesome .The Cathedral took over 600 hundred years to complete, and moving to side of the building you can distinctly see the different Architectural time periods,Neo Gothic,English Gothic.If you are Religious or not you cannot help but marvel at this Architectural masterpiece.
Breathtaking. Gorgeous Cathedral, the sheer scale takes your breath away. Some sections are free but you're charged to enter the main bits which I suppose is good as it means it's less crowded

Great place to see. A fantastic gothic cathedral in the very heart of Prague Castle area. My American friend said: I wish I could get married here! There is always holy atmosphere inside and a lot to see.

A very beautiful place with a great view of the city . The cathedral itself is beautiful and is part of an amazing area of Prague. I would offer to go by tram/bus to the farther side of the cathedral from the city and walk down towards the city, instead of climbing the hill towards the cathedral.
Quick tour. We did the highlights of Prague tour with Gray line. Tatiana was excellent in the history and sights of Prague

Fascinating cathedral. I have already been in such kind of cathedrals in the Gothic style; they do not differ much from each other. Its huge size, qualified design of details and marvelous design are amazing. It’s very interesting too, to visit the town hall of the cathedral; there is an unforgettable view of the city.

Amazing Church. St Vitus Cathedral is within the Prague Castle area and it as an absolutely amazing peeve of Architecture. The outside is so old and gothic style and the inside is opulent and ornate. You can stand at the back of the cathedral for free to take photos but it's well worth buying a ticket to see all the detailed intricacies of the statues, glass windows and shrines.
What a monument. A huge place - beautifully decorated with a lot of gold. Nice to see a great part of the church without having to pay. A must see.
Amazing. Photographs don't do justice to the architecture of this. This is located in the castle grounds, didn't go inside but just to look from outside was sufficient.
Stunning architecture. Wow, worth the walk up even just to look around the outside (you cannot go inside on Sundays) its such a beautiful cathedral with so much to see

Stunning. Such a stunning building, you can walk in without paying and have a look around the front area which is beautiful. Stain glass windows are stunning. Also can pay a small fee to walk round which is fine if you are interested in that sort of thing but still lovely place to visit otherwise.
so huge and amazing. u must visit it , no one considered gone to Prague without see how amazing , colourful, classy historical place .

Absolutely amazing!. St. Vitus Cathedral is breathtaking. The architecture of the exterior is simply marvelous. The interior is surprisingly plain (in comparison to your approach to the entryway) but still absolutely beautiful. Large, elevated stained glass windows surround the altar and light the entire building. An absolute must see.
Stunning. Gets very busy. Try to go late in the afternoon when the frenzy has died down. Walk around the cathedral - there are the most wonderful gargoyles.

Beautiful but too busy. This was a gorgeous cathedral - my only issue is that there were so many people inside taking photos without an understanding of what they were stood in. Im a real lover of churches so maybe thats why I was a little annoyed with swarms of teenage school trips running in and out and not taking in the beauty of the church. I know this is normal as I was once that teenage girl running in and out of Churches all over Rome - but it wanted me to get out of the Cathedral and I didnt have the chance to take in the architecture and decor properly. Be aware of this if you are visiting for these reasons.
Breathtaking!. You will never be the same again once you have seen this magnificent cathedral! It is so unique to anything I have ever seen! I

Majestic stain glass windows!. St. Vitus Cathedral has beautiful stain glass windows to show stories from the bible. It's a Roman Catholic Cathedral dedicated to Saint Vitus. It's the biggest cathedral in the country with Gothic Architecture. The main tower is 96 meters high.

Very nice place.. The church looks amazing from outside, so many little details. But inside it was a little disappointment. For me the outside would have been quite enough, the inside was not worth of paying.
excellent. excellent well worthing giong in. Beautiful architecture You can just go into the front FOC but you have to pay to go further into the church.

Revisiting the Cathedral after 20 years. I couldn't believe how crowded the Cathedral was, and the charge levied whereas it used to be FOC. All the attractions in the vicinity were charging an entrance fee - no wonder there were so few visitors to the actual art galleries there. Whereas the cathedral and environs were teeming with people - even "Golden Lane" is subject to an entrance fee. We were very disappointed in this part of our visit.

Amazing architecture!. It's gothic revival architecture cathedral, really monumental building with amazing stained glass windows. Some of them were designed by Alfons Mucha! It's the most worth to see building at the Hradczany complex.
Totally need to see!

Beautiful from outside.. This cathedral is very beautiful and breathtaking from outside. But it was a little bit of a disappointment inside. We have seen churches in Russia (also very astonishing from outside), and I have to say that I expected more of this cathedral from inside. (For example churches in Russia are amazing from inside too). But still I would recommend going here.

Stunning - was completely awestruck. Most amazing Cathedral - we were completely awestruck by the alter and the gorgeous stain glass windows. It's quite a large Cathedral with particularly long aisle but this just adds to it's gothic beauty. This is a real must-see and can get "circuit" tickets which allow entry to multiple attractions in the Castle area at v affordable rate (350 CK)

プラハ城観光のメイン. Vita教会はプラハ城の観光のメイン。城内に入ると最初に見える。内部も公開されているが、日によっては見学時間が限定されておいます。ここの見学は行列ができていますので、ちょっと入るまでに時間がかかりますよ。内部は圧巻ですので、時間調整してみてください。Vita Church Prague Castle of tourism the main. The first to appear upon entering the castle.But inside has also been published, it is placed in a limited tour time by day. Because of this tour is made up is a matrix, it will take some time for them to enter a little. Since the internal is a masterpiece, please try to time adjustment
impressive. impressive cathedral and worth visiting. you can visit also the basement with treasures. it will cost you.
Toooo Busy. We bought all the tickets but cathedral was closed until 12. After that the queue was miles long and much too cold and windy to stand about, so weird not get inM

Interesting cathedral. This cathedral exists of 2 parts: the oldest part is build like 700 years ago, whereas the newest part (the larger part) was completed early 20th century. You can really see the difference.. The view on the cathedral is especially beautiful from the water side in the dark, when the cathedral is lit.

Impressive Cathedral . This cathedral is part of the castle district and is easy to reach. Entrance is free but you need to pay to visit all the interior areas.Architecture is impressive and is well worth the visit.
Don't miss it.. Built within the castle grounds. An amazing cathedral with a vast history (take one of the available walking tours to visit the area, you won't be disappointed)
Superb. One of many beautiful churches and synagogues to visit in Prague.Awesome interior, even if you are not into religious places.

Salute to the architects, artists and artisans. Sometimes when I visited these churches in Europe, I just cannot refrain from wondering how on earth could the architects in bygone years came up with such complicated structures and artistic decors with infinite details and how skilful were the artisans and artists who completed their task without the myriads of machineries and gadgets available to our contemporary builders. The even more amazing thing is I believe these mammoth structures would have been built over many many years and so there must be a succession of architects, artisans and artists who had to keep the consistency and quality through and through. It is thus really worth the time to appreciate these great works of our predecessors instead of just filing through and registering nothing other than a couple of photos and keeping with the "I have been there" mentality. My salute to those who have made it possible for us to appreciate lost skills, stamina and imaginations and those who have kept the place intact over the years. A must visit when you come to Prague.

Yawn. Pristine and bland!My legs were twitching, wanting to run to the nearest bar and wash away the taint of christianity.Don't get me wrong. I love a good cathedral with its visual grimy history but this one was like a brand new office space.Give me the filth of religion any day and I'll go down on my knees and pray... but not here!
Fabulous...... What a stunning and interesting place of worship. So much to see and photograph - it's simply magnificent!!

Worth the walk!. This Cathedral is beautiful! Set inside the Palace grounds it really is a spectacular testament to gothic architecture, the detailing inside and outside of St Vitus is impeccable. If you can it's worth walking right to the top of the tower as well for an amazing bird's-eye view of the surrounding city. Not for those who don't like stairs though!!

Impressive . This cathedral is in the other side of the city on the castle region. It is a huge and impressive building. It's architecture indoors and outdoors will let you speechless. Worths a visit and a walk all around it.

Amazing architecture. I fell in love with this cathedral right from the entrance. It’s a beautiful building with such an intricate design. It was awe inspiring just looking at it. The interior of the building is equally beautiful, with the entire façade covered with colourful stained-glass windows. I would have loved to spend more time taking in the beauty of this place, but it was way too cold. The building was not heated even during winter, which was odd.

Amazing! . I usually find myself visiting cathedrals around Europe because they're usually the most beautiful of all the buildings. This was no exception, it was a fair walk from the old town square to get to this place but it was a lovely walk. Plenty of shops, cafés and classic Prague cobbled roads on the way. We visited the cathedral during the day and at night. It was beautiful both times, however at night there weren't at many people and the whole place is lit up amazingly. I'd definitely recommend visiting after dark.
Impressive and imperial. This is the most beautiful cathedral I've ever seen. Huge and very grandiose consists the main part of Prague's Castle, the biggest castle in the world
impressive. an impressive and imposing building . the words are unnecessary for both the beauty along with the architecture of the building
Suits and Togas. Crazy to think that the fellas building it started in Togas and then finshed wearing suits, you can see them on the side of the cathedral

Worth the walk up the hill. After walking up a very long hill you're rewarded with the beautiful stained glass windows, statues & paintings. The place is huge, the architecture is stunning & everywhere is so clean. Well worth a visit.

weekend visit. Be prepared for a steep uphill walk to this spot and also be warned that entry is by ticket only. we were able to appreciate the great views from the top but not the inside of the cathedral as we did not have tickets and there seemed to be no way of purchasing them on the spot. In any event there were large queues to get in so this should be regarded as an early morning activity

Lovely cathedral - excellent stained glass windows. It was worth paying for the ticket to go through the turnstile as there were lots of crowds in the foyer or group tours. Very large inside and impressive windows which sent beautiful lights over the floors at the right time of day. Im not usually one for religious buildings but I thoroughly enjoyed visiting.
Magnificent!. This is really beautiful cathedral. Inside and out you can find lots of beautiful details. Be prepared for standing in the line for cathedral entrance (approx 10 minutes).

Worth a look . Nice but not a patch on st Nicholas. Free to go inside but if you want to go round the whole building you need to pay - we went in March and it was not too busy but would not want to visit in the summer
Worth visiting. One of the most amazing catherdral i ever been in, the first impression when you come inside is hard to get outside your head :)

Amazing stained glass windows. The long walk up the hill was certainly worth the effort. The inside of the cathedral is amazing and you are drawn immediately to the light as it pentrates through the amazing stained glass windows. The array of statues and paintings belong to an era long ago.
amazing. amazing building, very clean and lots of brilliant pictures to take,. Coffee shop and souvenier shop really expensive

Beautiful!. Just to walk around this cathedral was amazing! We spent longer than we thought here but it was well worth it. It was hard to get the whole cathedral in one picture it's so big! I could not get enough of this place! Very well kept!
Very imposing building. We found it so beautiful inside the stain glass windows were so wonderful especially for photographs. Outside you can see the original St Wenceslas foundations.

The Cathedral that dominates the sky line. Wonderful place to visit, stained glass windows just have to be seen. it dominates the Castle, such a lovely feeling inside and you can just feel 'history' all around you.
Stunning!. The history, architecture, art and stained glass is all amazing. I recommend touring the castles that surrounds the cathedral as well. A must when in Prague!

The Church That Dominates the Skyline. Amazing church built during centuries, huge one with amazing interior and façade. It worths waiting a while to enter it. The entrance to the front part of the church is free, while altar can be accessed only by purchasing a ticket for a combined access to several attractions including Golden lane and Old palace. Anyway, the magnificence can be felt even from the front part.Do not miss to admire the stained glass and painted windows, one of them made by famous Alphonse Mucha.

Stunning but best from the outside. Stunning mixed architecture from the outside but not so stunning form the inside. Interestingly the stained glass widows were completed using funds from private sources so the windows contain product placement panes .
Breathtaking!. Don't miss this, the stained glass windows are amazing, especially the more modern ones by Mucha and his contemporaries
Breathtaking. Free entry and I'd argue that this is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world. The stain glass windows are absolutely incredible - it is a must see.

An architectural legend. So much history about this cathedral, recommend to take a tour guide to appreciate the monuments and the history. A well preserved cathedral housing the Crown Jewels open to public every 5 yrs, this yr marks the 700 reign of King Charles .

Beautiful Gothic cathedral. Situated in the castle grounds this is a "must" if you're visiting Prague. It would be wise to visit with a guide who can inform you about the cathedral's history, the architecture, stained glass windows and the various tombs within it's walls.

Beautiful and spiritual. This glorious gothic cathedral will make you almost hold your breath while seeing one after another beautiful statue, window, and symbol of reverence. St John of Nepomuk has a beautiful shrine here, as does St Wenceslas. We took a guided tour, which was wonderful and interesting, and you'll learn quite a bit about the fascinating history of this beautiful place. Take the time to let the spirit and history envelop you and you will feel blessed by the experience. If you come to Prague you must visit. Combine it with a walk through Petrin Hill and park, overlooking the city and Vltava River. This is an experience you will never forget!

One of so many great gothic cathedrals in Europe. Visited this cathedral on our walking tour (discover prague walking tours) and was so blow away by the interior light, detailed stain glass windoes and peacefulness of the space despite being with 400 people I did not know. Entry to cathedral is free to view but you will need a paid ticket to walk around. Last entry is at 3:40 so take you photos after you visit the church.

Stunning windows. A pretty awe inspiring place - the windows are absolutely beautiful. I also especially liked the memorial with the velvet drapes. Definitely definitely worth a look. Very quiet and peaceful once you're in as well as lots of people seem to not bother paying to come on purposely - just come in the door then leave again as they don't have a ticket!

Entrance appreciation. For visitors who did not purchase castle tickets the cathedral allows you to view the interior from the back and still appreciate the beauty and workmanship of the stained glass windows etc.
Amazing gothic architect . Not even the daytime is amazing, can wait until 18:00 onwards for the lights to project making the building look golden for very nice pictures.

Gorgeous. GET THE AUDIO GUIDE.. This is a beautiful cathedral, full of art, architecture, and history. Unfortunately, there are no descriptions of anything and there is no way to know what any of it is unless you get the audioguide, which you need to get before you enter the cathedral. Your ticket is only good for one entrance, so we went back out to get the audioguide and then had difficulty getting back in. We did eventually manage to talk someone into letting us in, and then it was well worth the time of walking through again and listening to the audioguide.

At last!. On our fifth visit to Prague we finally got to enter the cathedral. I'm not religious and often worry about European RC churches being a little creepy [like the Tyn Church] and cathedrals celebrating only the rich and powerful. Here too this seemed to be the case but the stained glass windows were beautiful and the last one on the clockwise tour was a welcome acknowledgement of the work of ordinary workers - hooray!A word of warning: even on a cold March afternoon the whole area was packed and crowds can be a problem if you want peace in St Vitus!

Amazing!. Very impressive to see and visit. You are able to walk inside however there are parts you have to any for. Worth buying a bulk ticket which allows you entry to all charged parts of the castle

Spectacular. If you enjoy history and architecture then you should definitely make the journey up the hill to see the Cathedral. I am not a religious person but could appreciate the beauty of this place.

Beautiful architecture. What a mind-blowing building!The architecture is amazing, you can get some fantastic shots!A bit of a walk up some VERY long steps if you're coming from Old Town - took us about 20 minutes to walk there, maybe more but definitely worth the view and experience

Amazing work of art!. This excellent Cathedral with its ornate interior and exterior,was a breathtaking experience to behold!A must to visit whilst in Prague,along with its surrounding sites ,and awesome views of the surrounding city are really stunning,from the top of the hill on which the Cathedral stands. Dont miss the opportunity!

Beautiful cathedral well worth paying to see. Amazing cathedral, we paid the extra £9 to see this plus 3 other sites at the palace and it was worth it, you can go inside the cathedral for free but you get to see so much more if you pay.

Simply beautiful. Very ornate gothic style, perfectly maintained and extremely interesting. I am not religious but found the Cathedral to be a very peaceful place with a tranquil atmosphere, an enjoyable and informative visit. Recommended

Centuries of Religious History. St Vitus Cathedral took almost 600 years to build, and is a fine example of Gothic architecture. The Cathedral contains the crypts of Bohemian royalty, in addition to St Wenceslas and St John of Nepomak. Located within the grounds of Prague Castle, initial entry into the Cathedral is free, but to see the entire church, admission must be paid. However, a Prague Card covers admission to the Cathedral, The Golden Lane, and The Old Royal Palace.

Cathedral. We'll worth a visit it is beautiful inside. We bought a ticket which included a tour of the cathedral and you need this to appreciate the beauty. There are so many stained glass windows and statues and crypts it was well worth the money
Beautiful cathedral church!. If you visit the castle you will see the Cathedral Church of Saint Vitos. Every cathedral church is stunning and big. It is really impressive and you should visit it.

Castle trip. Visited the cathedral as part of route b on my castle ticket . Truly beautiful inside very similar to the sagrada familia in Barcelona , the detail on the stained glass windows is amazing and in great condition . Try and take the audio guide with your ticket purchase we didn't and wish we had! Also try to go for it opening to get ahead of the big tour groups .
Stunning Cathederal. What an impressive Gothic building, it is huge with amazing stained glass windows and arches, Lovely chapels and extravagant tombs. A must see.
Beautiful. Although this attraction is up a big hill, it's definitley worht a climb to the top to see this beautiful cathedral
Amazing cathedral. I think it's the largest church I've seen. Wonderful design and beautiful vitrages. The pointy roof is visible from every point in prague.
Amazing!!!. This, by far has the most amazing stain glass windows!!!! The architecture was a feast for the eyes.. This is a "must see" when traveling to Prague.

Stunning building. Definitely worth buying the ticket and doing the full tour of this amazing building. I would recommend getting a guide book of some sort to guide you through all of the chapels, etc (or latch onto a tour as I did - for free!)

Stunning architecture.. This cathedral is inside the grounds of the castle and is a real work of art. The gargoyles are incredible and wouldn't be out of place in a gothic horror movie.You have to buy a ticket to get in side (part of a package with the other attractions in the castle) but it's not to be missed. The artistry is unbelievable and I've not seen so much bling in a religious establishment before.

A visit that you won't forget in your life. This Cathedral is so fabulous that I will have it in my mind when I think about all the cathedral thatI have visited. It has its unique festures in the showing up of the different colorful characters when the clock strikes at each hour. I haven't seen this before and I won't forget it.

Worth The Admission To See Everything. This is certainly an impressive cathedral, perhaps one of the most impressive. Do yourself a big favor and buy a ticket to see everything, don't just peek in and run out. Admission is worth it just to see the massive tomb of St. John Nepomuk. Do walk the exterior as well; take time to admire the gilded tile mosaics on the outside facing the courtyard, and get a good look at the various gargoyles on the opposite side as well.

Spectacular surroundings - gem of a cathedral. Free entry to the Cathedral but if you want a full close up view you will need to buy a tour ticket but well worth it.The stained glass is modern but truly magnificent as are the various elements of the building including the organ loft. What a pulpit!The various statues and relics are breath taking. Linger and soak up the history.

Stunning. Amazing architecture - well worth viewing the paid for areas. Most people seemed to only go into the free area so it was very crowded in those areas - the paid for area starts on the left hand side as you go in and we had a hard time squeezing through all the sightseers to get to the gates to go through.There is always a huge queue outside but this goes down incredibly fast.

Gothic excellence. Situated right in the center of the Prague Castle, is this beauty. If it rains when you travel, you can see how the rain water drips from the gargoyle's mouths from this cathedral. The detail to the design of this cathedral is unique. Do not miss this, try tours for this place if you want to learn more about the history. :)
Must Visit!. Such a huge and peaceful place with architectural beauty. Please check the opening times prior to the visit.

tower shut!. Enjoyed the beautiful Gothic Cathedral but was hoping to climb the tower for the fantastic views but it was shut for maintenance. Check website on the day you visit as opening times can vary for the Cathedral. On our first day it was closed for much of the day.

Wonderful, dark and mysterious. this cathedral has something very dark and mysterious in its appearance, would look good in a computer game. Interiors are magnificent. Located in Prague Castle, this sight is well worth visiting.
Gorgeous church with great view of Prague. To get into the tour you do have to pay a fee, so we didn't go up into it. We did go inside the cathedral, and it was worth it to see the architecture.
Great architecture. Great architecture! It is beautiful in day and at night! You can go inside for free, but not in the whole cathedral. To enter further you need to pay.

Simply Stunning. Key highlights of Prague. Great Gothic construction and history of St. Vitus Cathedral and it is so beautiful inside out. The church has great history so make sure you have a guide or have the audio guide to understand the history and the saints, royal family buried in the cathedral. The cathedral also has a great organ, make sure to visit and look out for it.

So beautiful-- it brought tears to my eyes. I had no idea just how powerful and beautiful this architecture was, and the view of the city is just incredible. I would recommend going twice just so you can look down at the city at daytime and night. The cathedral itself is breathtaking and world class architecture-- of course it has its peers but it competes wth some of the most beautiful cathedrals of Vienna and Paris. It is absolutely amazing. You must see this when in Prague.
Loved it! . Just stunning to look at. Impressive architecture. You will not be disappointed. Great surroundings and easy to find. Can be crowded and lots to see so plan for around 4 hours.

The Cathedral & The Castle !. Talk about being spoiled ! World Class Architecture everywhere you look and this fantastic example of Gothic Excellence which started in 1344 and was the haunt of Saint Wencelas as well. The gargoyles , turrets and flying buttresses all catch your eye & imagination . I love a Good Cathedral & this is One !!

Absolutely Stunning. Definitely one of the most beautiful places to see in Prague, in a city that has many very special places. At night from our hotel we could see the castle lit up and is an amazing site to see.
Fantastic architecture! . Definitely worth a visit! Architecture of cathedral is amazing with all the gargoyles and demons. Very Gothic! One of the most beautiful building in Prague!

Marvelous St Vitus Cathedral with Rafa. The highlight of the visit to the Prague Castle... so beautiful glass mosaic windows (some of them made by Czech artist Alfons Mucha)... awesome cloister... Our splendid guide Rafa told us the history of building this Cathedral and also many interesting details attached to that.
Lovely. Lovely cathedral, amazing architecture, you just never end appreciating it's details, worth every step!

The prettiest site in Prague (&the lowdown to visit here). This cathedral was what I really wanted to see out of all the sites in Prague.It was closed for some of the day but we managed to get in for a look around later.You can come up & see the cathedral from the outside for free but will have to buy a ticket to enter. It really is so beautiful inside. There are lots of stained glass windows too.Practical info-Its uphill to get to the castle so it's recommended to wrap up warm, wear comfy shoes& get a tram. Get tram no. 22 from Narodni divadlo (in the direction of bila hora). This is a little further on from Charles bridge. The Castle stop is Pohorelec.Once you get off you wander down to the castle & can watch the changing of the guard each hour. The all inc ticket is 350 krowns for circuit A,or you can do circuit B for 250 which covers most of it. I mostly wanted to see the cathedral,the royal palace is underwhelming & the golden lane not very exciting either. Not sure how much it is to get into cathedral alone but that's probably the highlight of the castle. It closes by 4pm so get here earlier in the day & there's a toilet charge of 10krowns each.The cathedral gets a 5 star rating the rest is around 3.5!

St. Vitus Cathredal is the centre of many attractions... I didnt go inside the cathredral, coz it had a huge queue...We walked around the cathedral to the old town streets,
armoury museums and prison
Visit with friends. There was some construction work going on but it's a piece of art and lovly place for history and art lovers

A high-placed cathedral. This cathedral is what you can see from the main bridge in Prague very beautiful especially at night, it took about 45 minutes walk for me and my friend to reach it, you have to pass a lot of stairs and then at the highest part of the city you will find it. you can also enjoy very beautiful scene of the city. people told us that this cathedral which everyone calls it castle is the president's house now. we were also lucky to see parade of guards passing from the main yard. I guess it was one the most interesting places you may find in Prague.

Very beautiful!. My friend and I did not book any tour so we went to this place all by ourselves easily because of their efficient metro system. It is a very busy cathedral regardless of time and weather. Prior to going inside the cathedral, you have to purchase a tour ticket. I already forgot how much but it is already inclusive of the tour for St Vitus and Prague Castle. The ticket is valid for one day so if you get tired from all the walking, you may finish the other part of the tour on the next day.
Beautiful!. Worth the visit, amazing architecture! Like all the other places in Prague, this one has a long history as well. The way the color changed during time really makes it breathtaking.

They still sell you The tour even if The cathedral is closed for visit . We Walked 25 minutes up The Hill specifically to visit This. When you arrive at The information desk The staff is Nice And courteous. They speak decent english. The cathedral is set right In The Middle of The Castle so Its quite impressive. Too bad We couldnt visit it because it was close And They dont tell you This when you purchase The tickets so make sure you ask.

Stunning but busy . I went on a cold wintery day yet the crowds were noticeable so I imagine this area can be very busy. It's worth paying to see inside the church, you can stay at the entrance to see inside but I enjoyed walking around the entire cathedral as the tombs and monuments are stunning g

Must Visit. Visit the Castle and St Vitus Cathedral across the river - easy walking distance from Old Town Square although some hills to walk up. Various options at the castle to visit so you can select what you want to see. Separate option to climb the St. Vitus clock tower - must do, but beware, 290ish steps but worth it for the views across the river and to see Prague. You can get access to the cathedral for nothing but if you want to walk all the way around, a ticket is required. Places to eat and get a drink - a little pricey but saves carrying food around and was nice to get a seat and take the weight off your feet for half an hour.
Excellent church. This is an excellent church. Lots to see in terms of architecture and design. Well worth a visit as part of the castle area one of the top churches here in Prague.

Very impressive cathedral. We arrived at the cathedral on a cold wet day and were pleased to get inside. The cathedral is all part and parcel of the castle complex it's definitely worth a visit. It is all free unless you want to go further into the cathedral.

Lovely soaring gothic. It is a lovely cathedral to visit. Make sure to buy an entrance ticket that includes the cathedral to see an amazing baroque silver tomb and also the shrine of St Wenceslas with its splendid wall paintings.

Beautiful Cathedral. . Worth the price of either Route A or Route B tours. You can just walk in the front and have a look but it doesn't give you the whole story. Very impressive structure. You need to buy a photo pass to take pictures. Worth a look.
B a utiful!!!. An amazing cathedral inside the walls of a castle, colourful, beautiful view from up the hill, it's definitely a MUST if you visit Praha

Worth a visit. If you're going to tour the castle & its surrounds it is definitely worth a look inside the cathedral. But it's super-busy so don't expect any sort of calm atmosphere to prevail and you'll almost certainly have to queue to enter even after you've also queued to buy the tickets.
Stunning Cathedral. This is an incredibly beautiful, large cathedral situated inside the castle complex. Well worth paying a visit to see beautiful stained glass windows and a wonderful space.
Beautiful 💖. Well worth a visit. Beautiful gothic Cathedral. We were on a tour and only stopped briefly but so very glad we did
Interesting sight with beautiful landmarks. For anyone who loves history and impressive buildings. A great destination to go for a walk and admire the surroundings.

A Magnificent Medieval Cathedral !. The Cathedral is of course an architectural marvel but so are many old cathedrals in the Eastern Europe and Russia. I still loved the tall huge structure and the amount of work that gone to build it.
Big Scale Cathedral. If you're going to the palace, take the time to visit St. Vitus. It's very large for a cathedral with exceptional stained glass.

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. Beautiful well maintained interior. More art than you can possibly take in in one visit - paintings, carvings, statues, ornate tombs. Wenceslas room and somebody important's incredible tomb in the middle of the church. Separate fee to climb to the top of the clock tower - 287 medieval stairs, but unlike Notre Dame or York Minster, theirs have been redone and are not slippery and worn down. If you can physically do it, completely worth the breathtaking 360 view of the town.

The Cathedral that doninates the skyine of Prague!. St. Vitus Cathedral or Katedrála svatého Víta is the spiritual landmark of Prague. Most people believe that it is the Prague Castle because this is the most visible part of the Prague Castle complex. This Gothic masterpiece was commissioned by King Charles IV in 1344. It was completed in 1929 in 6 centuries. It has several beautifully adorned chapels like the Wenceslas Chapel which is adorned with real gems. It was an important part of the Czech Monarchs lives as this was where they were coroneted and buried. Thus the crypt and the royal mausoleum holds the remains of most of the Czech kings and queens and their patron saints. The most interesting thing is that King Charles is buried here with all four of bis wives. The Royal route of Prague started from the Powder Tower and ended at St.Vitus Cathedral. All coronation and funeral processions went up this route. The Coronation Jewels are also stored here in the Crown Chamber. The first part of the Cathedral is free for everyone but you have to purchase a ticket to see all the sections. Interesting legends go about this cathedral. One of these says that when the great Charles IV died, all the bells at the tower started to ring by themselves followed by all the bells of Prague.Tip: The Great South Tower, which hold the largest Czech bell called Zikmund, offers a stunning view of the city. You have to climb 287 steep steps to reach the top though.

Magnificent Cathedral Architecture. What strikes you first is the beauty of the colours of the stained glass windows in this enormous gothic styled building. The small entrance fee is well worth paying to see the the interior splendour of this building and its many statues. Be sure and go and see this place.

Fabulous and different. The building is beautiful and awe inspiring, but it is the glass that takes your breath away. The colours are superb. We went on a combi ticket A which covered all the castle attractions, and was excellent value.
