stunning church. The tallest ceilings we've ever seen. Beautiful interior. Wonderful architecture and stained glass windows. Worth paying the little bit of money to go and visit this catherdral.
Amazing. Sure a must see in beautiful Prague ! Sometimes the entrance is free but if not buy the ticket for 4 places for 11€ !!

A beautiful church with a lot of history. This is another of the "must see" places when visiting Prague. Plan to spend at least 1 to 2 hours here and take the time to explore both the inside and outside of this Cathedral.
Worth the walk. Visit this beautiful cathedral. Like so many in Europe, you'll be amazed by the architecture. No need to buy tickets to see the whole castle, the free areas are plenty in my opinion.
impressive. impressive gothic style architecture you have to get a ticket to go inside properly, if you do you can get a ticket that gets you in to other places like the Gold Lane etc
absolutely stunning!!!!. Words cannot express how spectacular and breath taking this cathedral is! You must see it with your own eyes!

Breathtaking glasswork. My main memory from visiting this Cathedral back in 2010 was the stained-glass windows, and that impression was borne out this time too. You can really tell that they are relatively modern creations: the colours are so much more vibrant than any ancient window I've seen can achieve. The Cathedral itself is fairly standard Gothic revival. You have to pay to go further in, but it's free to access the westernmost part, which is more than enough to take in the main attraction, i.e. the windows.

awesome a must see. I thoughts would be another boring cathedral but I was totally wrong , actually it was more interesting than the Prague castle , it is gorgeous inside and out just the outside is awesome , it had fantastic statues inside and very large satined glass windows and the best thing was it wasn't one of those long drawn out cathedrals but it was beautiful if you are in Prague this is a must see we took the tram 22 and changed to the tram 5 we stayed in the heart of Prague so the tram and the metro are very easily accessible so if your going this is well worth your time
Beautiful. You can go into the church entrance for free and see part of it, pay for a ticket to see more. You can see a lot from the entrance though.

A Gothic master piece, but check out closing times!. This has to be one of the 'must sees' of you visit to Prague. We were fortunate to get there just in time to get into the cathedral. We were told you can walk up, to the castle, but as it was snowing we opted for the no. 22 tram. The trams are cheap and regular. This is just one area of the castle and you will need a couple of hours to enjoy the site.

The persons working in St. Vitus must learn good manners!. We visited the temple of St. Vitus in December 2015 and we had to wait in line for at least 45 minutes before we manage to enter. We had already bought a ticket for St. Vitus and after we entered we started the tour to the several chapels. It was impressive but definitely not something that we had not seen before in other gothic churches. There were too many visitors inside St. Vitus and in some narrow passages it was so crowded that we had to stop walking for some minutes. Suddenly, while I was looking at the vitro glasses, one man of the security grabbed my jacket (so violently that I almost lost my balance!) and ordered me to remove my hood! I tried to explain to him that I was freezing cold but he insisted that I MUST remove my hood!!! Despite the expensive ticket, the administration of St. Vitus apparently considers it unnecessary to turn on the heating with temperatures below zero in December! The guard could not understand me and he started yelling at me in front of the other people! I had never experienced such a humiliation in my life! Ironically, though, the impolite man working in St. Vitus was also wearing a hood but that was obviously OK...Only my hood was bothering him... I immediately regretted paying a ticket in order to be treated like that! Needless to say that the lady at the cashier of the Castle was also impolite and completely ignorant of words like "Thank you" and "Please". Since I am used to having manners and being surrounded by polite people, it was quite a shock for me to experience such a lack of manners at one of the most popular attractions of Prague. Apparently I do not recommend it!

MUST be visited!. One of the most famous place in Prague and Czech Reoublic (or is the most famous!). One of the biggest Cathedral in Europe (the territory belonged to the Cathedral is the biggest in Europe). The style, the history, the power.. Everything make a great influence on you! There are so many small statues on the Cathedral, so many interesting stuff inside! Also, close to the Cathedral there is a real old town of Prague, where you can visit hous of Franz Kafka and see how people lived at this time.I would like to notice, that the best time to visit Cathedral is morning. There are so many tourists, so better come as earlier as possible... :)

Awe inspiring!. You really have to see this cathedral in order to appreciate it's size and beauty. The inside is elaborately decorated with many stain glass windows and the large window at the front casts a beautiful multi-coloured shadow through out the main space within.
ultimate of design. I spent the entire day in front in around this place it is a wonder of the world for sure. It was a great sunny day in the middle of February! Go here for sure!
Beautiful church. This is a beautiful piece of architecture and is built to resemble the Cologne Cathedral. Do the castle tour to learn about this church.

Hate to say it, but give it a miss. We love cathedrals and mediaeval churches, but this one is pretty ghastly. The facade is great, if you can see past the hordes of tourists but the inside is an awful hotchpotch of styles and decoration, with grumpy attendants and terrible crowds. The church of St Nicholas, quite close by, is much more attractive. St Vitus's has to be one of the least inspiring - and sacred - spaces we've ever been in. You''ll find more spirituality in Starbucks. Sorry.

Prettier than Sagrada. A monumental church with unique carvings and gothic arches. Sunday at 10 am can not enter the cathedral as priests celebrate the holy sacrament. The space around the cathedral, with smaller buildings, highlight the architecture of the grandiose church steeples.
The Most Beautiful Sight of my Life. Go. Just please go. Preferably with a tour guide (Sandemans does a lovely castle tour). It's breathtaking.
St, Vitus Cathedral. Beautiful building on the castle grounds. I thought this building was much more impressive than the actual castle.

Nice architecture... A nice place to visit with the family if your in Prague. It's properly maintained and the entrance fees are minimal. Well situated parking and good for kids. Make sure you visit in the mornings to avoid the crowds.

Stunning stained glass windows. We just stepped inside to glimpse the interior and were stunned by the beautiful Windows and roof architecture. We didn't have time to queue for a ticket but could get a good feel for the cathedral without a full circuit. Reminiscent of Notre Dame in Paris from the front.

Spectacular!. The St. Vitus Cathedral is not to be missed when in Prague. We purchased the shortest route combo ticket at Prague Castle just to see the Cathedral and were not disappointed. The details in the ceiling, as well as the altar really do take your breath away. If you like Cathedrals, and have an interest in sculpture, worth the time and money to visit St. Vitus. The exterior itself is beautiful and lovely to view even if you don't plan to visit inside.

Breathtaking. when you approach this cathedral and exit the small passage leading to it, it's quite an awesome sight to see it looming above. The inside is gorgeous. Beautiful stained glass windows that the sun pours through. You can enter the church for free and go to a certain point, but if you want to go further in and see the alter, you need a ticket. The free visit is well worth it and you still see a lot. On the outside be sure to check out the incredible collection of gargoyles. On the other side of the cathedral, it's decorated with golden mosaic tiles and when the sun is in the right position the church literally shines .Do not miss this if you're visting Prague!
Beautiful Catherdral. Paid to go here and was well worth the money.This building is amazing and will of history and character.Refreshing to see something pure and not touristy, unlike the old town!

famous, nice view, too crowded, long queue to get inside. Its famous to visit there while visiting Czech, but it is always crowded, need a long queue to get inside, you need to pay entrance fee if you want to get into the deepest part, if you don't want to pay entrance fee, you can only get in but not going to anywhere, just have a glance.

Sheer beauty. St. Vitus, for me, is second only to Notre Dame in Paris of any cathedral I've seen. The windows are astounding and the atmosphere is heartening on all levels. The silver crypt is incredible. Outside, it has fantastical gargoyles and so many architectural details for those inclined.

Amazing inside and outside. Amazing inside and outside it's fantastic you can explore the whole area for free , shame that in this days you have to pay to get in further more than the barriers,But will worth .

Interessante. There are a lot of nice places, I spent 2 inteires days over there and I think is to less, I believe at least 3 days are needed to pay a visit to all the great places.I met friendly and unfriendly people, like always.I fully recommend to visit prague, maybe for the next time I would make on spring time.

It made me cry!. What an admission to make, but it's true. Such a beautiful building, it took a while for the intricacies of the exterior to sink in. As I looked at it in amazement, I felt the tears trickle down my face- very emotional!
mesmerising. even if you are not religious this is unmissable as a beautiful space , master architecture and atmosphere

Worth a visit for the windows alone . This cathedral has the most incredible stained glass windows I have ever seen ( and I've seen a few!) You do not need to be in the slightest bit religious ( my husband is a committed athiest) to appreciate the architecture and the beauty of this cathedral. My husband also has a colour defect and even he could see how amazing the colours in the windows were. Definitely do not miss this!
Prazki grad cathedral. this cathedral left a nice memory in my heart...loved that! were walking there a bit long..but was nice trip to climb the hill....

Stunning building.. This cathedral offers some striking architecture, both inside and outside. The tower (if you can manage the 300 steps!) offers some incredible views over Prague for a little extra price, but this is entirely optional. There are areas of the cathedral that are free to enter and look around, and some areas require an extra fee (i don't know how much this is, as i only visited the free area inside, but it is not too expensive). The courtyard outside is expansive and offers great views of the cathedral too.
Unbelievable!. Another place in Prague which you have to vist no matter what. It's enormous and beautiful. Definitely worth visiting.

Stunning. . This Cathedral is within the castle grounds and you will need a ticket if you wish to wander around the entire building. However if you wish to just pop inside and admire its size and are not too worried about seeing every area, you can do this for free. Definitely worth the ticket though as their are some very impressive biblical sculptures.
Stunning. One of the most stunning pieces of architecture I've ever seen. Would recommend to anyone with an interest in the rich history this place has to offer. Fantastic.

Beautiful Cathedral!. It was beautiful during the Christmas Market time, though very busy. I'm sure this is typical throughout the rest of the year as well. Our family enjoyed our time walking around the castle grounds and going into St. Vitus.
Nice Cathedral. St Vitus cathedral was impressive, but not as impressive as other cathedrals in other cities in my opinion. Worth going to view whilst you are visiting the castle though.
Pity we could not visit the inside. The cathedral is simply fantastic, is the center of the view in prague. Simply you can not miss it...

Enjoy the Views. Take your time and stroll throughout the cathedral, you can purchase tickets to go throughout the cathedral or walk in the first portion for free. If you don't stroll through the cathedral on the purchase price buy the ticket and go to the top of the spire for some amazing views. It is a constant spiral staircase with 287 steps so be ready.

Impressive gothic cathedral. Visited in the morning and the morning light through the glass gave an extra touch to our visit.The cellar is closed for the moment but there are enough other parts to explore
Beautiful. Beautiful inside and out. You can walk in for free and see the inside of the Cathedral or take the tour for a small cost. The tour is worth the money.

Breathtaking. As you talk into the second courtyard of Prague Castle, St Vitus Cathedral just takes your breath away. From the intricate carvings surrounding the doorways on the exterior to the smallest details on the paintings and the stained glass are unbelievable. No words I put here can truly explain how magnificent this place is. It is something that everybody should see for themselves.

A very gothic cathedral . Impressive , gothic , chilling your spine when you enter inside. Is an art monument that let me speechless due to his size and carefully details . I stayed inside for about 30 min and it made me realize what a wonderful arhitectura life give the the chance to visit.

Mesmerizing. A huge cathedral, filled with paintings, sculptures,beautiful decorations and much more. Never seen anything like it before. It's part of Prague's castle, I reccomend a tour to all exhibitions in the castle, not only the cathedral. Its really the most beautiful place in prague, architecture wise.
250 steps to Prague's best view!. You can climb at the top of the cathedral to enjoy the best 360° Prague view, well worth the effort if you can stomach it.

Check out the Gargoyles. St Vitus Cathedral is an excellent example of Gothic architecture and per the materials I read is the largest and most important church in the Czech Republic. The Cathedral is part of the Prague Castle complex and is home to the tombs of many Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors. While I enjoyed the interior, I spent hours photographing and looking up at the gargoyles all around the building and took many photos of the brass work on the doors of the Golden Portal. All in I found it to be a beautiful experience and stopped several times on this visit and have made it a point to visit on every trip to Prague.
Impressive. One of the most amazing Cathedrals we have ever visited. Majestic, huge and the architecture is impressive.

An amazing Catholic Cathedral. It's so worth a visit, there is just small number of such wonderful cathedrals in the world, such as Barcelona's one. It's truly impressive and if you love architecture, you definitely must see it. There is not only a cathedral but multiple touristic places nearby. One of the best places we visited in Prague

King's private praying place. Be sure not to miss this place when crossing Charles bridge! This cathedral is a national treasure guarded by local police but don't be afraid they are friendly. You have to go through the guarded palace gate, pass the courtyard and the cathedral will be hidden there - like in a backyard.
good. lovely place to visit, saw the changing of the guards, beautiful architecture well worth a visit to see this
Astonishing architecture. Deceptively: apparently externally unmaintained, stained by years of smoke and pollution, a gem of a gothic building not to be missed

Have not seen another Cathedral like it. Having been in and out of many churches and cathedrals as a tourist I often admire the beauty, architecture and solace that one can find in these buildings. This Cathedral is no different but its stain glass windows are stunning like no others I have seen before it is simply a pleasure to go inside. There is also a tower to go up inside the church which is a must and the views over Prague from there are just amazing. Well worth the trek up the hill to see
Beautiful, historic cathedral near the palace.. Lovely historic church near the palace. Lots of beautiful ornamentation, carvings and stained glass.

Unique architecture. This Gothic and Neo-Gothic architecture will blow you away. Headquarter of Czech kings and place where many of them were also buried. Golden lane is a must to visit. Franc Kafka used to live there as well.
Very nice. The cathedral is very impressive and if you're interested in architecture even a tiny bit this is a great place to visit.

Very interesting architecture and history. We only had a brief look inside and around this cathedral as part of a tour but if i had another day in Prague I would've gone back. Very interesting to see and hear how this was constructed and its history.

Impressive!. One of the highlight during my visit there.
Amazing architecture with colorful sparkling windows and stunning views...
Historical Attraction. I have seen many Cathedral, but this is maybe the most Gothic looking and interesting interiors, it's a part of a big tour through the castle which is a must see

One of the most spectacular cathedrals I've been in. . Wow wow wow! Tremendous architecture and amazing statues. The architecture of the outside with take your breath away and the statues and mosaics on the inside with take you back in time. A MUST SEE on your visit to Prague.

Impressive cathedral. Nice gothic cathedral. Impressive silver tomb of st John Nepomuk. Beautiful glass windows, not only by Mucha. Pity there are nowhere some explanation cards, only references to the number of the audiophone, a trick to rent more of them out? ( this is in the whole castle complex)
Imposing cathedral. In the castle of prague the imposing cathedral of st vitus is a place you havevto visit. The north tower is worth visiting it due to the view of prague up there!

How did they do that?. Quite remarkable! This really is a must see if you visit Prague!
When you consider its age you start to question so much in modern life!

Absoultely Stunning. Stunning inside and out. Great in the morning when the sun shines on the stain glassed windows and makes the murials sparkle! Make sure you pay the extra to walk round the whole Cathedral and the extra to go up the clock tower the view is worth all the steps!

For the rich only ?. This review is not about the Cathedral itself since it was closed when we visited the castle. Nobody would tell us why but when we saw the professional photographs taking pre-wedding pictures, we figured out it had been rented by a rich family from abroad. This is unacceptable (and the ticket price for the castle was not even reduced).

Most valuable sight in Prague. This is the most valuable sight in Prague.It's been built over centuries. The entrance is free. You can see the crowning jewelry there however this part of seeing will cost you some fee. I can recommend a walkaround thru Prague castle surroundng, especially a place called "Jelení příkop" which means The Deer Moat. Or alternatively you can take a walk thru the oposite side and get to a tower called "Petřín" which is a smaller copy of the famous parisien Eiffel Tower. That sight is surrounded by a large park situated at a slope.

Worth the cost of admission . . .. Yes, to get to the "good stuff" in the cathedral costs, but it is well worth the admission. In addition to the gorgeous stained glass windows, do not miss the carved doors under the organ. The panels on the left door show four saints with their methods of martyrdom below -- especially that of St. Wenceslas. And, when you get to the St. Wenceslas chapel, note the door handle as well as the small door which leads to the Bohemian crown jewels.Being "good citizens," we did pay the additional 50 Kč for a permit to photograph -- however that is a real rip-off. Everyone was taking pictures and nobody was checking for "permits."Signage in the cathedral is minimal . . . so either download a "guide" online or purchase one for the most enjoyment.

Beautiful cathedral. Even if you are not religious or dont like churches it is a must see sight if you visit Prague. The inner place is enormous, the mirrors and stetues are very interesting and its location also contributes to the fantastic view. Little bit disapponting that only a little part of the church is visitable for free.
authoritative. It is huge unbelievably authoritative and really beautiful. It has amazing Stained Glass. You absolutely have to see it!

Not to be missed. This was one of the highlights of our trip. Absolutely amazing architecture, wonderful stained glass windows. Really wonderful. Allow plenty of time. We spent 4 hrs between St. Vitus and the castle.

Definitely must-see!. If you're in Prague, this is a place you HAVE to visit and if you're not afraid of heights - visit the South Tower so you can get the best pictures for the holiday album. We got confused with the tickets first - bought a ticket with entry possibility to cathedral and thought we could go to the tower with that one too, but you actually have to buy own ticket for the tower, costing 150 Czk extra..
VERY INTERESTING. wonderful design, beatiful localızatıon.. interetsting arcıtecht, impossible thinking.. a like novel
Wow. Beautiful Opulence is how I would describe this place. Amazing place to go and see and read a little of the history, inexpensive to get a ticket.

Beautiful building. When we visited there was some maintenance being done but this done very litte to take away from the presence of this building.The details in all the sculptures and arches are immense and the walk around is very relaxing,the sun shines through the steeples in an awe inspiring way on a nice day
stunning. this is a real stunning place to visit i would highly recommend going make a nice walk up lots of steps to get there

Jaw Dropping. Just wow. At first glance it does what it was designed to do: make you feel small. As you make your way in and around, you'll see all the incredible gothic features and hopefully someone can tell you about a few of the things that are missing as well as the stories on the door!
Amazing!. This church was built and improved over centuries, there is probably nothing else in the world to beat it, right in the middle of the old city of Prague and the castle.
Classic gothic cathedral. Must visit in Prague as part of the castle route. Love the gargoyles on the outside and chapel on the inside.
Magnificient. It was the most beautiful place I have ever seen.The decoration and the mosaics are magnificent.....
Awesome Place!. When I first saw this cathedral, I really doubt how people built this beautiful building. Do not miss to visit inside, you may feel like stay closed with god.

Most breathtaking cathedral I've ever seen. To be fair, I'm biased towards Gothic churches, but still, it is the best I've ever seen. It's almost transcendent in its beauty. Take a look at night, it's beautiful illuminated and there are way fewer tourists.

Imposing Cathedral looking down on Prague. This cathedral is accessible through the palace overlooking Prague and accessed by walking up hills and steps - for those able . It is a formidable and really awesome building and words cannot describe it - must be seen . It is looking down on Prague and theres a great view of it form the Powder Tower in Old Town Square

Beautiful evocative space. Wonderful building with an interesting melding of old and new. The stained glass windows are all of a high standard, but the Mucha window is stunning. Worth a visit for this feature alone

Go on stairs up to the dome!!!. This cathedral is an excellent example of Gothic architecture and is the biggest and most important church in the country. Located within Prague Castle and containing the tombs of many Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors, the cathedral is under the ownership of the Czech government as part of the Prague Castle complex. Marvelous view of the city, do not miss the dome! Interesting inside! Love it!
Truly beautiful. The stained glass windows with the sun pouring through them are a sight to behold. Pictures just can't do them justice...they are truly breath taking.
Fantastic architecture. Such a beautiful building and the light through the stained glass windows inside is wonderful. Definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful gothic architecture and fabulous views. The cathedral is located within the grounds of Prague Castle. There are various price options while you are there; with many other attractions/buildings on the same site, you can pay to see them all, or individual ones. We had a peek inside the cathedral but you had to pay to go all the way in. Instead we decided on paying to go up the south tower, to the very top of the cathedral. Having been in many cathedrals before, I'm a sucker more for the view from the top than I am from the inside, although the stained glass windows and architecture inside and out was absolutely stunning. The climb up the tower is around 270/280 steps, and it takes some leg stamina to get up there! Not recommended for the less able-bodied or elderly, or those who may get dizzy easy (spiral staircase all the way up). From the top you realise it was well worth the walk! 360 degree views from the top cover the whole Prague city and more besides. Fortunately the day we went was dry and clear, albeit it a little cloudy. We got some fab photos from the top and it was a great alternative to seeing Prague from above, compared to say Petrin Tower, which we didn't get chance to go to. I think we paid around 160 Koruna each to get admitted, which is just over £5. Well worth it if you get to go to the castle area.NOTE - use the ticket office in the main square opposite the entrance to St Vitus. There are smaller offices in other buildings but we found they were closed or manned by non-English speaking staff who we struggled to communicate with.

Simply Majestic,breathtaking details. When you look at it, you wonder how important the small details in finish was at the time, this building always takes me back in ancient history... A must see, the windows details are just as wonderful
Old historical church. Historical old church in the castle area ,you can go inside and there are some beautiful stained glass windows
Amazing!!!. Incredible, outstanding architecture. Huge cathedral that is the start to a mind blowing walk through Prague's most beautiful sites.
Beautiful Gothic Architecture. This cathedral is like a hidden gem in the Prague castle area.The gothic architecture is very detailed and beautiful.
The "free" visit just inside is enough. Historical, but no need to take a tour, IMHO, You see enough just inside the doors. You can see the significant stained glass just fine.

Beautiful Cathedral. This Cathedral is in the castle complex. It's very beautiful and is an interesting and dramatic example of gothic architecture. You can visit the first part for free, but not during mass. Be warned that in winter it's very cold at the castle complex as it high up and exposed, so wrap up warm. You also need to walk down the hill afterwards on a cobblestone path which can get very slippery, so wear appropriate footwear.I highly recommend going to visit the monastic pub while you're at the complex, and sampling their beers.

Just amazing . It's such a beautiful and impressive building.Just breathtaking. We liked it so much we went to see it 2 times....because with the tour we didn't get to stay there as much as we would like. Really a must see when you go to Prague. And if you climb in the tower....prepare yourself for lots and lots of spiral stairs that will get you dizy and really tired...but the wiew from above is breathtaking. You can see all Prague
Popular for a reason . Absolutely stunning and completely unmissable when visiting Prague. Expect to see crowds, but don't let that put you off - this truly is a must-see.
Amazing building . The cathedral is a marvellous peice of work standing in the city centre. When snow falls it looks even amazing. Had some good wine and pizza in a resturant in front of it
Amazing Architecture. Built in the same Gothic style as the Cologne Cathedral but not as large, St. Vitus similarly does not disappoint in it's artistic grandeur, both inside and out.
Truly amazing!. The architecture of this building is gorgeous!! Definitely worth a visit! You have to pay to get in to see the whole cathedral, but it's so worth the few bucks.

Enormous - Must Visit for Prague. It is the largest and the most important temple in Prague. It took 600 years to complete. The inside is packed with beautiful arts and furniture, and fascinating history. Check out the English audio tour guide in the visitor center. We didn't think we would need it for the full day, but ran out of time and had to make a mad dash to return it. I would recommend renting it for the whole day.

Beautiful Cathedral Gothic style. Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. Definately worth a visit and a suggestion is to go there during mas, then it's not crowded by tourists. Very beautiful even if you're an atheist like me.

Great architectural feat!. Some reviews have noted that this cathedral has lost it's reverence. Frankly, this makes absolutely no difference to me. But it may be for some. I loved it from an architecture point of view - gothic, art neuvau, rococo .... It a mish mash of so much and very impressive.

Genius loci. This gothic cathedral brings you to the Middle ages. It is amazing what human being is able to create. If you want realy enjoy this place go there in the morning or at the evening. There is lot of turists during the day....and be prepared for payments.It was a bit surprise for me. A few years ago was entrance free of charge.! But world is changing.

A must must see!!!. I read about it while doing my research of places to visit. It is inside the castle, but as you approach it, you are not quite ready for what you are about to see once you come face to face. I was at awe! It is truly a beautiful bilding, the quality of the detail and seeing it at sunset made the experience even better.

Outstanding . Absolutely breath taking. I didn't do the tour inside and I wish we did as I could probably of spent all day there. The building around are outstanding too. Wear comfortable shoes for this city trip. I made the mistake of wearing nice new boots and I suffered.
Amazing. It was amazing, I stayed in Prague 5 days and I went to St. Vitus 3 times. the whole Castle is like a fairytale
Beautiful stained glass windows. This is a stunning cathedral. The stained glass windows are truly stunning and it's worth visiting the cathedral just for them.
Amazing building!. Different sections of the cathedral built during different time periods. An amazing piece of architecture with a great story behind it.
Lovely. lovely cathedral, inside the castle, very lovely and big, really worth the visit, great for the architecture lovers

Absolutely beautiful . After purchasing the inclusive ticket for 350 czk it was one of the most beautiful things we saw in Prague. The cathedral definitely lives up to its name and reputation. Bring your best camera so you can capture the breathtaking beauty which it holds inside & out. The cathedral is an absolute must if you visit Prague.
Gorgeous cathedral. This is definitely one of the most beautiful cathedrals I've ever visited, and the stained glass windows are unique.

Breathtaking. First thing- it is SO COLD in here! Prague was around 7°C which was fine then we went in here and could see our breath it was so cold! Take a jumper! Beautiful stained glass windows and stonework! Free to get in to the back but you can pay to go to the front of the cathedral.
Spiritual. The best place for a deep prayer in the city. I miss the cathedral a lot. Highly recommend it to anyone visiting.
Post Card Worthy!!. Breath taking!! Some of our photos from here don't even look real!! There's so much to see, make sure you give yourself plenty of time to soak it all in!
AMAZING!!. No visit to Prague would be complete without a visit to this amazing Cathedral. Make sure you visit inside and out as both aspects are amazing.
Beautiful Cathedral. A must see for anyone on a trip to Prague. Make sure you get a guided trip as there is so much interesting information about this church.

Grand!. The structure itself is stunning! It boasts good artworks like the glass windows. Outside, one can see the exquisite adornments atop with creatures like gargoyles spitting water from rain! Nice sight to behold! On the side there is a huge clock that chimes every hour! Good to see in this place of Prague! There are treasures as well that one can see inside but one has to pay for the ticket entrance. Students have discounts.

Unbelievably Beautiful. Can't say enough great things about this city and the Beauty that surrounds it.I hate to sound repetitious, but the Architecture is the real treasure, and the food,,, Go at Christmas time,,,

Very impressive. After being in many Cathedrals all over the world, I must say that St. Vitus was still very impressive.
The shear size of it makes you feel small and the beautiful vitrage on the windows is magnificent.

What a fantastic place!. The Cathedral is imposing from the outside. The Gothic architecture is very evident from the outside. It is beyond stunning, and no pictures will do justice to how beautiful it looks (esp against a cloudless blue sky). But once inside, it will take your breath away (again). The stained glass paintings that adorn the wall are exquisite and the attention to detail is amazing. It is a HUGE church and there is plenty to see. For those looking for a quiet prayer, there is ample space away from the tourists taking pictures of every inch of the church.

Closed again!. Not having much luck getting in to see this very nice church.Each time I come it's closed! Looks beautiful inside but sadly off limits. Find the entrance via a small passage dead centre in front adjacent to the baroque building on the square.

Highlight of Prague Castle. Beautiful Gothic-styled church, with a vast interior that stretches for miles. The best feature of this church is the vast array of stained glass. A must-do in Prague. There will be a lengthy queue in peak season, so try and arrive early.

amazing! . went here with my girlfriend on our first trip together. this church is amazing, and the story behind it is really interesting! has to be experienced together with a guide to get all the funny details

Magnificent Cathedral. Well what can one say about this magnificent building that was started nearly 700 years ago but only completely finished in 1929To see it all then one must pay an admission fee which is definitely worth it if you have the time and the inclination, but you can see some of it from the front of the CathedralThe Stained Glass windows are a must see and show so many different stages of history both from Prague and Christianity Don't miss the huge doors showing the story of Wenceslaus which is a piece of art in itself Look for the gargoyles on the outside which are a sight to see, alongside the Flying Buttresses & the Rose Window (completely different inside and out!) RecommendedEnjoy

Most dominant structure in Prague. This is a Gothic Catholic Church and most dominant structure in Prague. As is written about Prague and to most Czech locals, St. Vitus is the Prague Castle. There is a local tour to take that takes an hour. Again. this is a must see in Prague.

A Beautiful Cathedral. Near the castle, this cathedral is worth visiting. There are many artifacts from the Habsburgs. It is a beautiful tour with many old doors and ornate hinges and hardware which I enjoyed viewing.

Stunning architecture. Definitely the highlight of our visit to Prague Castle. Amazing architecture outside (flying buttresses galore) and inside (stained glass and high vaulted ceilings). Photo opportunities in abundance.

You will not be disappointed. St. Vitus made me want to cry. It is a lot like Notre Dame, flying buttresses and stained glass windows. But it is SO breathtaking when you stand outside and look up. Inside the artistry in the architecture, the windows, the paintings, and the sculptures will lose you in time. You cannot miss this.
take your camera. I loved it wonderful for history buffs.....i went mad wtih my camera...make sure you have plenty of memory and battery!!! have fun1

Magnificent. We visited here ealry in the morining and it was not very busy. You are able to go inside the cathedral up to a certain point for free however if you want to view all of the inside of the cathedral you will need to purchase a ticket. these can be purchased in the ticket office just opposite the cathedral door outside in the castle complex, you can buy a ticket that allows access to the castle and other parts of the complex at the same time.

The most magnific cathedral i've seen. We were only outside because we came pretty late. Although it was dark they had good spotlights all over the Church. The way up was a bit to walk and for those who have disables I Think they had an elevator. I'm not sure but it was a lot of stairs to climb.The view was very impressing since you could see the city and it's Majesty. We were really happy with what we saw. They open up the doors so you can go inside and Watch 9 am - 16 pm I Think. Check it out Before you go because we regret not being able to see the inside. But google is your friend ;)The best buildning in Prague for sure!

WOW. This is a top tourist attraction Prague and as such gets very busy, managed to get into the cathedral on my second visit, make sure you buy a ticket, top tip- get one on the way into the area just outside, there are places offering tickets which I duly ignored, dont wait until your opposite the cathedral as the ques are huge, also make you way around the back of the cathedral and down the road to Golden Lane its well worth a wander.The catherdral is stunning as is the enitire area, they do a changing of the guard at around 11am which was interesting, plenty of places to eat/ drink all around the area, make sure you take a pair of comfortable shoes and your camera!
Definitely worth a visit. We saw this as part of our tour of the castle complex. Magnificent building, inside and out. The stained glass windows were incredible.

Amazing detail and great for photos. This is one of those must visit places in Prague and you won't be disappointed you took the time to see it. Even if you're not a fan of Cathedrals you will be amazed and the architecture and details that went into St. Vitus Cathedral (both inside and out). Located just through an archway by the Prague Castle, you'll be greeted by the stunning facade. The entrance is free and you're allowed to take photos inside so it's possible to come back with many memories.There's an additional section if you wish you see the front alter in greater detail which I do believe is a paid section. However you're able to have great photos without that section.

Beautiful Cathedral. We got to see part of this Cathedral at no cost as part of a tour that was included in our travel package, and we almost did not go back. When we went back to Castle Hill, we bought a ticket and were very happy we did. You can see the front section of the Cathedral at no cost, but the ticket gives you access to all the naves and art lining the walls. Definitely worth the price of the ticket. This is a beautiful cathedral, and my companion, who has seen many more cathedrals than I have, insists it is one of the most beautiful she has seen. The outside is lined with gargoyles, and there is a separate gargoyle tour, which we did not go on. You really can't avoid St. Vitus if you go to Castle Hill, but I certainly recommend seeing the full thing.

Beautiful cathedral. St Vitus Cathedral boasts ornate and beautifully crafted architecture, with its massive arches and stained glass windows. Try visit earlier in the morning before all the tour groups go.
Wedding anniversay week in Prague. This Cathedral is absolutely A Typical of eastern European architecture and enormous. This history just oozes from it's every stone. Very beautiful indeed.
Worth a visit. Beautiful gothic cathedral and the resting place of Good King Wenceslas the stained glass windows must be seen

St Vitus at Prague Castle. Very impressive and beautiful cathedral set within the castle grounds, This cathedral with its stained glass windows and size is comparable to Notre Dame in Paris. One of the highlights of our Prague visit.
great views. we walked up to the cathedral and the views were breathtaking. The cathedral and palace buildings are amazing.

Huge Gothic style Cathedral. If you're into European Architecture, you will be interested to know this is a Gothic Cathedral. Very interesting as compared to other (e.g. Baroque) styles. The Cathedral is huge and very crowded. You have to pay to enter - and there are timings for prayer sessions. Other times the door would be closed and security is quite tight.
Beautiful catherdral. This cathedral is beautiful and nice, in opposite of the Prague Castle. A very silent and Serene place

Beautiful. Its one of the most beautiful cathedrals I've seen, and I've seen a lot. Just like everywhere in the old soviet bloc, the amazing buildings that rival anything in 'western' Europe do no get the recognition they deserve as they are still being discovered by travellers heading East for the first time.Really worth a visit and can be viewed for free.
Must see for the historical travellers. The castle is huge and surrounded by a giant wall .eventhough it is a long way up to the castle , the castle i worth while for a visit.

Jaw-dropping beauty. Of my travels across Europe, this was one of the most beautiful cathedrals I've ever stepped inside. The stained glass windows throughout are amazingly beautiful & the gothic details on the outside are equally as impressive. Recommend paying the $4 or so to do a guided tour (the tour also includes a walk through of three other buildings in the castle complex) as you get to explore the full cathedral and historical relics which you miss if you do the free visit. Put this at the top of your must-do list in Prague.

My favourite building in Prague. If you head up to the castle for no other reason it should be to see St. Vitus! It is huge and such a beautiful building. You can pay to enter deeper into the cathedral or for free walk inside and admire the grandeur and beautiful stained glass. For all the sightseeing I have done on my visits to Prague St. Vitus remains my favourite and in my opinion the most beautiful building in Prague

Heart and Soul of Prague. If you only have a few hours in Prague--or if you have the opportunity to spend a few days in this intriguing city, you must visit the Castle and St.Vitus' Cathedral. It's at the core of the Czech national spirit and identity.Some of the grounds are free, but I'd suggest the 250 Kc ticket to enter the main areas of the splendid cathedral and other significant sites in the grounds. We visited in mid-winter and the Gothic splendour of the structures was only magnified by the snow and bareness of the gardens. I'd strongly suggest a guided tour-preferably by a Czech national--and the guides from City Sightseeing are excellent. It's a stiff walk from the river but trams and buses run right to the entrance. Probably not the best attraction for families with young children.

Beautiful . This is a must when visiting Prague castle, it is stunning inside even if like me your not religious or fussed by churches!! The entry ticket also covers other buildings around the castle complex, if you want to take photos you will need to purchase the photography ticket pass.... This is a slight rip off but I don't know how they enforce it so I guess it depends how generous and truthful you want to be.
Beautiful cathedral. This has a stunning location on top of the hill at the castle. Beautiful stained glass windows. After having climbed the hill to the castle this is a welcome piece of calm

Must see it in day and night. On our first night in Prague we walked up to Castle Hill and saw St. Vitus. It was a dark, damp night in mid Fall, and the church was lit up just enough to see its imposing structure and awesome detail. Inside, lights were on and the stained glass panels came to life, including the Mucha panel.Later in our trip, we came back in daylight and toured the inside. This is a must see - it was amazing. When you go to Europe, you see a lot of churches. This will be a Top 5 experience. We also walked up the tower - warning, this is a lot of steps - and the view of the church, Castle Hill, and the city of Prague was just awesome. So many colors, tile roofs, cobblestone streets, and church spires in the distance. Unreal, and this is a unique view you can only get being up on the hill, and then up the steps to the top of St. Vitus.

Spectacular!. When you visit the castle. I recommend that this is the first thing that anyone should visit. The level of detail of this gothic church is pretty amazing. We walked around outside of this church just looking at it from the outside before we went inside, its really impressive. The inside is also beautiful. Inside it's as beautiful as some of the churches that has been around since the medieval times but it's still amazing to see.
worth seeing. its located in the prague castle ..its style and architecture is worth seeing .. man can sit and enjoy the greatness of the ppl who built it
A must see!. This cathedral is beyond impressive! Beautiful from the outside and if possible even more impressive inside. The walk up from the old town is very nice as well.

Amazing architecture. I visited the Cathedral during the evening. The architecture is stunning. It is lit up beautifully, highlighting many features. There was a small Christmas market in the grounds of the cathedral where it was possible to get a warm drink and a snack.Do not miss!

awesome interior. the vitro windows were amazing,the silver statues magnificent,the atmosphere magical. The exterior was also spectacularwith great view of the city. It is worth walking down to the city center if the weather is good.
Gothic architecture for sure!. A perfect example of Gothic architecture. Be sure to pay the few crowns and take the stairs up to the bell tower. Amazing views! Worth a visit!

Impressive history. The history of this Cathedral, the tomb of 'Good King Wenceslas' and the surrounding buildings is fascinating. What a kingdom it once was and whilst many of the trappings of royalty have been removed it is still a marvel.
beautiful stunning architecture. It is so beautiful inside St. Vitus Cathedral, also have a great traffic/ instruction to let the audiences in and out. also good guide line too

A Must See!. This beautiful cathedral and surrounding buildings are a must see if you visit Prague. It is one of the most beautiful in Europe, and that is saying quite a lot. The masonry is an absolute marvel. The stained-glass windows and murals on the inside are just breathtaking.
first church we visited upon our arrival. So Beautiful and the stained glass was magnificent. Our Guide gave us so much history is was amazing.
Ok. This is a real beauty of a cathedral with its all gothic exterior however a miss on the inside as there isnt really anything to see.
Great architecture. I didn't go inside (lack of time), but I must say it really is a piece of wonderful architecture. Tip: look up the opening hours.
Absolutely stunning. The cathedral is simply magnificent and you won't believe how huge it is! I found it difficult even to put it in one frame on my camera! The interior is superb! It's a must see!
Will take your breath. This place has a special spirit to it. It is enormous and kind of mysterious. Better looking in the darkness with all the lights around.

Wonderful. It's a must in the city of Prague. I think it's the msot important place to visit in the city. If you want to go inside you have to pay. There are special prizes for students, retired people and groups. Anyway I would recomend you to visit the place from outside, it's enough and it's so beautiful!
A beautiful site. The architecture and the sculpture of the Cathedral is more than amazing. Words cannot describe the grandiosity of this place. You feel the old times at our century.

Very notable cathedral. Must see when in Prague. A Very special cathedral, awesome architecture and not overly adorned. The front is difficult to see/photograph due to surrounding buildings, but the flying buttresses at the rear are fantastic. As with everywhere in Prague you have to pay to get and wander around... it's probably worth it because the free viewing at the rear of the building is a dogfight.
Prosaic. Majestic! The stain glass is unusual and stunning, especially the Mucha Art Nouveau window. Wenceslas Chapel holds such a sacred presence tucked away, quietly radiating.
A beautiful cathedral overlooking Prague. We attended Mass here on a rather warm Sunday in DEcember. The massive structure holds the chill since we were colder inside than out.
Breathtaking. This was amazing to see in person. The inside is just as amazing as the outside. You just stand there in awe of the beauty.

Simply beautiful. Went with my girlfriend to the Castle of Prague and found out it was actually a cathedral at its core. Impressive and beautiful to behold. It's recommended to take a look inside it as well.

Beautiful Stained Glass. I went to the ST Vitus Cathedral as part of my ticket to Prague Castle.The cathedral is massive and is just as gorgeous on the outside as the inside. There are a tons of stories associated with the multiple statues, tombs, relics, and windows so I recommend a guide book or a tour if you are interested in the history of the church and the various people involved with it.

Stunning. Wow....this catherdaral is stunning....just a joy to see....it is up there with many of europes best and most interesting....the high baroque architecture is truly inspiring ...this place is busy so try and get there early....there is a tower to climb at a cost but it was too much for my elderly friend
Such a beautiful cathedral!. A must-see in Prague is definitely St. Vitus Cathedral! I was amazed at the detail of the facade and the beautiful works of art on the inside.

Awesome!. St. Vitas Cathedral dominates the skyline of Prague and is well worthy of a visit. The climb up to the Castle and Cathedral is relatively easy and it is essential to pause a while on the way up to admire the spectacular view over old Prague and the river. The Cathedral itself is an awesome sight. Its soaring towers are majestic and its Gothic architecture is magnificent! Allow a full day to explore the Cathedral and Castle area of Prague and make sure to take advantage of the combined entry ticket to save on cost. We discovered later that the tickets are valid for two or three days so a return visit can be made if time runs out - and it inevitably will, before you complete your visit.

Amazing Cathedral. One of our priorities while visiting Prague was to see St. Vitus Cathedral. We climbed the back of the hill using the stairway. If you ar walking this is an easy way to climb the hill. It is hard to describe the gradure of St. Vitus. LIke other cathedrals in Europe it was built over centuries. Each section has a unique character. The stain glass windows alone are worth the climb. The main altar as well as side altars are stunning. We had the good fortune to arrive just as a Sunday service was about to begin. We had the wonderful experience of attending the service, hearing the organ and choir which is not usually part of any tour. The different styles over the centuries bend to make this a very interesting space.
Mesmerizing Cathedral. It is mesmerizing how beautiful this cathedral is, I would say it's my fave during my Eurotrip in December, its a must!

Very cold, Worth none the less. The cathedral is awesome. Totally a must go to for art history Fans and people who admire european barock. The stone ground almost killed us in winter, it chills you to your core

Breathtaking. This was one of the highlights of my visit to Prague. Stunning Gothic cathedral comparable to Notre Dame. Unfortunately, although the foyer of the church was so crowded with tour groups we weren't really able to explore any history, the view from inside is awe-inspiring. I did buy a ticket to climb the tower (warning -- 287 steps up a stone spiral staircase, not for the faint-hearted) and was rewarded with stunning views of the city. Sadly, the sun we had the day before was not here this day, so the photos were not quite so crisp, but compared to the town square tower the crowds were virtually non-existent, so taking my time was not a problem. Definitely a must-see.

History built through the ages. Amazing cathedral, if one take into account that the building looks very much one unit but has different components spanning almost 600 years. The history is well laid out and ons is filled with awe at what people have accomplished here. Very impressive!

Simply Amazing!. The St.Vitus Cathedral is a great example of an impressive architecture. It stands, in the middle of the Hradcane district and can be seen from far away. The building from the outside, is really informative about st. Vitus life (for example, his life is showed on the main door) and from the inside you can learn a lot more, not only about st. Vitus but about the city and the whole coutry as well. Also, when you are inside pay attention to the beautiful stained glass windows. You can buy tickets to the st.Vitus separately, but there are also tickets where you can combine visiting the old palace, the st.George basilica, the st. Vitus cathedral and the golden lane. I think 125 czk for students (reduced). (of course there is an even bigger combination where you can visit pretty much everything in the district). Generally the st. Vitus cathedral is a must if you visit Prague!
Stunning. What a stunning cathedral. The castle is disappointing but then you stumble across this and it makes it all worthwhile.
Beautiful!. Didn't went inside but the outside is also stunning. You have to have a ticket otherwise you can't enter.

Fantastic Cathedral and worth a trip up the tower.. Visited the Cathedral during a trip to the Prague Castle. We obtained a Circuit B pass when at the castle which allows entry to the Cathedral and we would highly recommend it. It's exterior is stunning from all angles and the inside is also beautiful, with excquisite architecture on display, lovely chapels and some beautiful windows.We had to pay extra to climb the tower but I believe some of the passes include entry to the tower. Be warned, the tower contains 287 steps with no breaks at any point. My partner and I are quite fit individuals and even we had to catch our breathe at the top but it is definitely worth it if you think you're up for it. As one of the highest points in Prague, the views are phenomenal.If you happen to be around when the clock strikes the hour, you can also witness the mechanism at work but don't go out of your way for it.

Crowded even in the winter, but still incredible. The stained glass was out of this world and the neo-gothic architecture of the interior (the ceiling in particular) was impressive. It was quite crowded and so difficult to get around with all the tours, but the site is worth it none the less. You can't get in without a ticket and the line to get in can be quite long, but it was worth the wait.

Unique. An amazing gotic cathedral, full of history and worth the entrance fee (the ticket allows you to visit the the whole caste, which the cathedral is part of). It was built in two periods and and as you come in could will easily see the differences in architecture (the old narrow arcs combined with the wider ones). The stained glass artworks on each window are just breathtaking, and similar to other gotic cathedrals has the stained glass rose window- BEAUTIFUL

Beautiful but insanely crowded. I don't recommend going in the morning. We first tried to visit on a Friday morning, but not only was it very crowded outside the cathedral, they weren't allowing visitors in that day. We returned a few days later, again, in the morning (because that's what worked for our schedule). It was crowded outside; we stood in line to enter the cathedral for about 5 minutes. It was crowded inside; we stood in line to get passed the free viewing area. Many tour guides take their groups through the cathedral en masse so it gets congested in areas. There was one area under restoration that added to the congestion. We followed the Rick Steves self-guided tour, which hit the highlights of the beautiful interior. The Mucha window is particularly lovely.

Great attraction. We were lucky enough to enter with basically no line, and if you are just stopping by the castle from the bus tour, just pop in and be amazed by the cathedral. Be prepare though, as it is very populated.

Grand architecture. Its exterior architecture is beautiful to behold, as its interior. Though you'd have to pay additional to see the entire sanctuary. To me, just visit for free and take in what you can.
Superb!!. Amazingly bright - so many stained glass windows ... It really is a breathtaking monument. Well worth entrance fee

What an incredible cathedral. Stark Gothic structure on the outside towers before your eyes. When you enter, the same gothic features bedazzle you, including the unique stained glass artworks on each window. Mind you, each piece is different on every window. For Mucha lovers, make sure you spot the stained glass window he was commissioned to create himself!Accessing the cathedral itself is free, however, it only gets you far enough to see its main interior. but in order to access the rest of the space and have a closer look at the altar and array of stained glass windows, you would need to purchase a ticket from the ticket box on the entrance to the Prague castle premises (inside the gates). make sure to take closeup looks at the gargoyles on the exterior of the structure!

Tremendous . A phenomenal cathedral that is as big as any. It is a great spot to take nice pictures and for any one who likes to explore different cultures and architectural master pieces. It is a bit cold thought if you visit in fall or winter so make sure to dress warm enough to enjoy your time there

287 steps!. The view is great - once you reach the top. The staircase is 287 steps up - and narrow - so with the volume of people coming up and down its a bit tricky. If you're in any way unfit, I'd probably avoid. I'd like to think that I'm not unfit at all, but I was feeling a bit breathless half way up and my legs were jelly once I'd got back down! Th view was worth it though.
Must See. Can't miss this cathedral when you visit Prague, it is next to the castle, a lot of status, sculptures, stories, one of the most beautiful cathedrals you have to see.

Breath taking structure. We traveled to Prague to see the Christmas Markets. I had no idea how much history is here to see. One amazing building after another. This beautiful Cathedral is too much to appreciate in one quick pass through it. It is mind bending to be able to walk through this and actually touch the columns inside, just knowing they have stood there for so many hundreds of years.
Beautiful Gothic Cathedral!. You have to see St Vitus! It is located within the Castle complex. This church is just so stunning and worth a visit!

Do your homework ahead of time and get there early!. Lovely large old church. DEFINITELY get there before 9 AM and be the first one into St Vitus (good advice from another TripAdvisor review). I got there at 9:15 and there were a zillion large groups with sign-toting guides inside the church. Be sure to have your own information handy, though. The customer service is deplorable. I asked a guide/docent where the Wenceslas Tomb was, I pointed to the word (in Czech) on the map and my response was only a shrug and a “grumph” sound, not even a smile. There are signs EVERYWHERE that say “no photos without license”, but scads of tour groups were taking photos with hand held cameras, tripods and cell phones. I highly doubt everyone had a license. The place was crawling with “guides/docents”, but no one stopped these renegade photographers. I felt it was very disrespectful for these people to be taking flash photography while others obeyed the sign.

Stained Glass!. A very impressive cathedral and a must see if you are interested in European churches. But even if that's not your thing the stained glass is really gorgeous. Definitely worth the trek up to the castle.
beautiful attraction. have czechs they do not take euros to walk in is free however, to tour the church has a fee. We did not pay to see the church.

Magical.. I describe St. Vitus' to people as "a church from a Disney movie." There's something so mystically stunning about the stained glass work and its reflection off the walls. Just gorgeous. Go and enjoy.

Exquisite Architecture, Impressive in Height and Detail. The St. Vitus Cathedral was a grandiose Gothic cathedral with soaring exquisite towers located within close proximity to the Prague Castle. St. Vitus was a patron saint of actors, dancers, comedians and epileptics. The original church structure was constructed over a thousand years prior to our trip, while the current structure was completed in the recent 20th century. For those only interested in peeking inside, entry into the St. Vitus Cathedral was free for this limited purpose. Access to walk around and explore the cathedral was an additional fee, and was included with the purchase of our tickets to tour the Prague Castle. The inside of the cathedral was spectacular. The architecture was exquisite. It was grand and impressive in height and detail with incredible stained glass windows.
spectacular. Must see spot in Prague with low price ticket- don't remember exactly because of the cz crows- but ticket combines palace, golden lane and other sites.
Grandiose. One of the most beautiful cathedrals ever visited. Needs between 1,30-2hrs to enjoy its treasures and architecture.
A great cathedral. There is so much to see within this cathedral, and it is busy. The stained glass windows are fabulous, but plenty of room to take photos despite the crowds.

GORGEOUS!. Amazing architecture. Beautiful building, tons of history. Castle tour is not worth it. Definitely check out St. Vitus, go all the way in look at all the windows. If you can go back when the crypt exhibition occurs, do so!
Pretty cool place to visit. It was a cheap site to see in Prauge and they even have changing of the guards close by. Totally worth checking out if your on a budget.

wonderful bones and classic structure. we were lucky enough to be there first thing one sunny morning in December and were able to enjoy the light pouring though the stained glass windows (most of which are replacements). classic structure - check out the stone carvings around the windows on the outside of the building.

Feel the history. Much of the feel of St Vitus Cathedral can be gained from the entrance without paying for full access. However, armed with a decent travel guide which tells the history, you can immerse yourself in a great deal of history within these walls.

Amazing Gothic Church. It is worth the hike uphill. We went during Christmas so it was surrounded by Christmas Market Stalls selling all sorts of tempting fares plus nice Czech chocolate and souvenirs. The church is impressive and delicate with the many tall stained glass windows. A must see.
A must to see!. The architecture is BEAUTIFUL! You will enjoy seeing both the inside and the outside of this Cathedral!

Amazing. Located in the complex of the Prague Castle, this neogothic church is a must see. Part of the church is free of charge. Pay attentions on the amazing vitrage windows, made by popular artists, one of them by Alfons Mucha.

Fantastic Cathedral. I visited Saint Vitus Cathedral twice during my December 2015 visit to Prague. It is a very rich cathedral and you should look in your guide book for all the details (I bought the Rick Steves guide book). There are spectacular stained glass windows, various sculptures and statues, a fantastic altar, and many other things. It is very crowded. You can buy Ticket B at 250 Czech crown for the entrance. I am glad that I made two visits here. It was worth it.

Incredible views of Prague and of the cathedral from the bell tower. I thought the view from the bell tower was one of the best city views I have ever seen. Not only do you see all of Prague spread below you but you get a closer look at all of the gothic architecture of St. Vitus. The gothic spires and flying buttresses are magnificent when seen from above. There are 297 steps to get up to the top but as long as you are in moderately good shape it isn't too difficult. Visit early in the day to avoid lines or, even better, visit off season. I went in late September/early October and had good weather with no crowds.

Amazing 14th Century Architecture. Visited St Vitus as part of the Prague Castle visit and it was a highlight.The amazing stained glass windows flooded the Cathedral with coloured light display.Definitely worth a visit and also the old cathedral built in the 900s.

Gothic Beauty. It's well worth booking a guided tour of this magnificent cathedral. Such a 'wow' moment as you walk through the castle archway and look up to this stunning place. So much history to soak up. You can take photos inside, but without flash - however, lots of people seemed to ignore this.

Beautiful Cathedral - Worth the walk!. St. Vitus Cathedral is located on site of the Prague Castle. It's a bit of a walk to get up to the Cathedral, but it is well worth it. You can enter the cathedral by purchasing tickets.
History! Wow!. We went as part of a group tour. The guide was knowledgeable and helpful for getting good photos. If you love history, this is a must-see!

Loved the history. We've seen Cathedrals all over Europe. This one was special with all of the history, the age of the building, the stained glass windows, etc. It was a very pleasant tour with our guide. Well worth the time to visit.
Gorgeous!!! . Well worth the crowds!! Exquisite details in every direction. A stunning display of artisan mastery in every nook.

Cathedral in the middle of the Castle. It's a very impotent cathedral, located in the heart of the Castle of Prague. Amazing church, full of details.
Great history behind.

Prague highlight. This is an amazing place that you absolutely must visit! If there is a queue outside it moves quickly. Definitely buy tickets so you can see the whole church as the stained glass windows are spectaculour!

An absolut must. An absolut must for any first time traveller to Prague. Impressive under daylight, but breathtaking once it starts to darken. Check operating hours before going, because the day we visited it, it closed earlier than scheduled.

This is the gem of the Prague Castle!. No visit to the Prague Castle is complete if you don't visit this beautiful Cathedral! It is amazing and the attention to detail in the interiors with the arches and the windows is superb! If you have enough time and money climb on to the tower! It offers a beautiful background.
Fantastic. This church has everything. Great stained glass, beautiful sculptures and impressive architecture. It's one of the castle highlights.

Great place . Simply magnificent! The view inside its so amazing the bad thing it's buy the tickets and audio guide could be a traumatic situation you should give a deposit of 20€ for the audio guide and I don't have more €€€ so I need use my cc/debit and they can't accept it so I had to have 100$ bill as deposit, ignoring this, San Vito it's an amazing place and really beautiful please don't miss it!

Amazing Church!!. I visited St. Vitus Cathedral during Christmas period . It was a beautiful suprise for us. It is a majestic Gothic building which inspires respect for the all the people (architects - artists ) who worked many years to accomplish it . the huge windows with stained glass are more than beautiful !!!! dont loose the oppurtunity to visit it .

Utterly beautiful, solemn and quietly daunting. You will miss out if you don't visit this outstanding building.. The building is just magnificent. It's so beautiful, the architecture amazing and the history completely mind blowing. There's nothing more to say. You need to visit this Cathedral and truly experience how magnificent it is in person.You don't expect it, and then it is just there. Wow.
Travel dairies Prague. My visit to a castle . Amazing and beautiful experience which I can ask for . So many people visiting this castle all across the world .
Part of Prag's culture. A guide can make it or break it and our guide made it the tour super interesting. He was engaging, answered our questions and made our visit to the church very impressive.

Amazing! But the crypt is closed to the public.. This place is incredible! There is heaps to see and lots of interesting effigy graves and the epic baroque grave of St John of Nepomuk. There is also a beautiful Art Deco window by Alphonse Mucha and many more artworks and architectural features of interest.However, I was devastated to learn that the royal crypt is NOT open to tourists. If you love crypts as much as me it is good to prepare yourself for disappointment! I was incredibly fortunate to have help from wonderful staff at the information desk and to be able to find a tour guide willing to take is down there. It was only under very specific circumstances however and I don't think this is something that happens often. I was so happy to go down there though and feel incredibly lucky and grateful to the staff and tour guide that made it possible.
Beautiful ! . Nice walk up here, we went into the cathedral for free. Afterwards we armrest some local specialities at the square outside :)

Stunning Architecture. My husband and I visited Prague recently and walked up to visit St. Vitus Cathedral. It was absolutely gorgeous from the outside but the queues were so large to go inside that we did not have the time for it which is such a shame.I would advise going as early as possible to avoid the queues.
This took only 600 years to Build!. St. Vitus is amazing from the outside with the flying buttresses but it is worth the price of admission to go inside! It is stunning!

Beautiful Neo Gothic Cathedral. Sits near Prague Castle and has that unique European burnt coal look to it. The detail in it is amazing as it always blows my mind what people could do back then. Reminds of some of the other Euro Cathedrals I've seen and am always drawn to this type of architecture. Gorgeous inside and a must see if you enjoy this type of setting.

Incredible. Just standing inside and getting surrounded by the scent of medieval atmosphere is incredible. The whole place is majestic.Go there early (as everywhere in mala Strana and old town) and enjoy it with less crowd and limes.
just amazing. a must stop.. a beautiful place to reflect sit and quite your mind and enjoy the beauty and hard work that made this peaceful spot no matter what your religion.
Liked this!. Definitely go and see this! It was centuries in the making and the "gothic" architecture is awesome!!

World Class. The cathedral was world class, the architecture, windows, and overall building was stunningly beautiful. The raw new-gothic feel of the church is truly breathtaking. It really stood out against the "basic" surrounding castle.

Very impressive place. It is the one of the biggest Gothic churches I saw in my life and I saw quite a lot. There are relics of at least two saints of the Bohemia and also of some kings that makes this place really sacred. Also art lovers can observe a window done by Mucha artist and in general it is very beautiful.

You can feel the power of middle age. Amazing architecture, beautiful windows and breathtaking scale. You can enter the church free of charge and can take short walk, but it worths to pay for seeing the rest of the temple indeed.

Amazing both outside and inside, worth paying to see more. The cathedral is stunning from the outside, but it is worth it to go inside. You can enter without a ticket, but only really stand just inside the door. We bought the circuit B ticket which included the cathedral and allowed us to walk all around the main section. We would say it is well worth it as the inside of the cathedral really is amazing.

Magnificent. Breathtakingly beautiful cathedral in the Prague castle complex, the stained glass windows are so colourful, no chance of peaceful contemplation in this church though as when we visited it was incredibly busy!
Wonderful History. I recommend visiting the Castle and going through the "Story of Prague Castle" museum. There is so much fabulous history here.

Breathtaking. I hadn't seen such a huge, detailed and beautiful cathedral in my life (I come from South America). We weren't able to enter but just the outside is amazing enough. Knowing all the history that place encloses is magical.

Awe inspiring. A must such a magnificent historical building with numerous adjacent historical buildings museums churches You can spend 4-5 days visting everything up near the castle and cathedral The architecture and religious art is breathtaking.
Amazing church. Very impressive church suited on top of a hill overlooking Prague. The church has most spectacular vitrage windows. We were lucky and visited the church during Christmas services.

Incredible!. One of the most beautiful cathedrals I've ever seen. Amazing stained glass windows that creat beautiful light in the sanctuary. Go right at opening to beat the crowds. Easily accessible with the #22 tram for a euro to avoid a pricey taxi ride or an exhausting hike up the hill. Wish you could buy a ticket just for the cathedral, it's the best part of the complex. Don't overlook the exteriors! Incredible detail!
Amazing . Easily one of the best Cathedrals in Europe, rivals many of the more famous! Especially the stained glass windows. Well worth the visit!
A must visit, a stunning building. Beautiful architecture and Czech heritage site within the castle grounds. Cafes and shops are plentiful to rest the feet!
Amazing Cathedral. Absolutely beautiful inside and out. The architecture itself is breathtaking. It is certainly worth the visit if in Prague!

Huge and nice to walk through. A huge cathedral and nice to walk through. Fascinating to see how this cathedral evolved throughout the hundreds of years during which it was built. We bought the circuit A ticket which let us in seven places.

Admittedly a typical cathedral, but still breathtaking. After a while you're forced to come to the conclusion that all churches, cathedrals etc start to seem the same and are just getting old. Still, this is definitely a massive one and still takes your breath for a minute. And if you in fact aren't sick of them yet in general, go and I'm sure you'll appreciate it!
Nice Cathedral. With a ticket from the Castle tour you can visit it. Nice cathedral, a must see in Praha. Impressionant !

A delightful surprise. Unlike many cathedrals this one is filled with light. It was begun by Charles IV but only finished in 1923, yet the whole gives a wonderful impression of unity. From the outside it is a lovely Gothic building. Inside the stained glass windows are awesome, especially the one by Mucha, the leading Art Nouveau proponent of Prague. This is a place well worth spending time in, and paying to visit the whole building, instead of just having a look from the entrance, which is free.
Beautiful. Visit the cathedral. Nice walk to it from the center. A great cathedral that survived lots of crises!
Christmas 2015. Amazing to walk around well worth a long walk up the hill had to be done. You could ale light a candle for a small fee.

Prague has taken all my words. I have run out of desciptive words for Prague and all it haa to offer. This is a place you can spend I whole day just taking in every detail and every bit of history that your eyes and brain can handle. You have not been to Prague if you have net seen this (and the Monastary). So if you did not visit it while in Prague well then I am sorry then you have not been to Prague...

Great place - amazing stained glass. I've seen many cathedral buildings and this one is right up there on architecture. Actually, its anyway right up there, since its on a hill! The stained glass windows inside are fascinating and there is the option to trudge up to a tower as well
Beautiful!!! Don't miss it!!. This is one of the places that you can't miss in Prague. Really beautiful. A gothic cathedral form XV century. You can't miss it!

Beautiful church. A wonderful church next after Peters Church in Rome. A lot of decorations and details, handcrafted in a time where beauty was focused. Expect a lot of people, however worth to visit.

Beautiful!. The outside of the building is breath taking on it's own! Definitely worth the visit. You can go inside a section of it for free, which has impressive stained glass windows and murals throughout. It can get very crowded, so early morning or late afternoon is best to go. They will charge you to see the entire cathedral, which frankly isn't worth it just because the free section is an incredible sight to see. Don't miss this place!If you want to have an amazing view of the city, there is also a "birds-eye view" option where you can climb into one of the towers for views of the whole city. Costs 150 ck and you have to climb about 300 stairs but you won't forget the experience :)

One of the must do activities. . Unless your sole reason to visit Prague is cheap booze and brothels as part of a stag do (you know who you are) then he cathedral can't be missed. Nauseatingly beautiful and breathtaking to the extend that it's almost a cliche. Do take the time to properly appreciate the level of detail in the stonework and stain glass, they are truly stunning examples of the best that era had to offer.
Beautiful. Tips;Dont que to get in early...there was no que later in the afternoon.Give yourself an hour for the cathedral.Take your camera as it is absolutely lovely.Enjoy!

Incredibly beautiful. This Cathedral is just unbelievably beautiful. The stained glass, the gothic architecture, the arches, even the gargoyles. Everything is so great. A small thing that I didn't realize while planning my days in Prague is that this cathedral is in the castle so it must be done in the same days that you plan to visit the castle.

Great place to see some of the amazing history, art and culture in Prague. Our visit to the castle area of the city started with a tour of St. Vitus. If the gardens outside are open, start there, and time your visit to watch the changing of the guard. Once inside the Cathedral, take time to look at the stunning stain glass windows and learn some history of how the church, public and government have supported the church.
