Make sure you tour both inside and the exterior of the church, including the mosaics outside.
Big and beautiful cathedral. Big and beautiful cathedral, situated in the castle district. Free entrance. Painted windwos inside. Must see.

Excellent place to visit. I had one-day trip in Praque. The cathedral is a must for tourists. Wonderful architecture with the great scenery of the old city. This place is one of the destination that you have to visit once in a lifetime!!!

Amazing. the entire area (Castle and cathedral) is superb. the Cathedral is split into two parts, one with free entry and another paid (Euro 10). beautiful structure inside out with amazing stained glass. a must visit for sure.

This is pure awesomness. It's just awesome! Amazing! Beautiful! The most beautiful building in Prague!
Note: you can go inside for free and see almost everything or buy a ticket and see it in details.
The Cathedral is fantastic. The Cathedral is fantastic, especially at dusk/night, when the lights bring it even more to life. Better than Barcelona.

So majestetic. On can really understand this place has been for emperor and noblemen. Huge, beautiful glass windows. Was surprise it is built and reconstructed during many periods. Note the zodiac symboli and monthly labours outsider the church, on the right side of church.

A must see during a short break. I loved this Cathedral, the stain glass windows, the gargoyles and characters on the edges of the outside and spires - it was just beautiful.Inside you can walk round at your leisure and take in the surroundings, and see the sun shining through to light up the stained glass. You must have a good look round the outside as well though and take in all the gothic architecture. A magnificent Cathedral.
A marwellous cathedral.. The building is beautiful inside as well as outside. The rose-windows is quite a sight! A "holy" place.

Magnificent castle. I always envied people who visited this cathedral. It is in the same category with the Notre Dame de Paris, St. Paul's cathedral in London or Westminster cathedral there too. A real masterpiece!

South bell tower. St Vitus Cathedral is one of the most impressive buildings I have seen! We paid 150 Kc each to go up the South Bell Tower. The walk up the many steps is well worth it to see the view of Prague from the top!
Beautiful. we didn't pay for the extra entry beyond the main chapel.. without admission we enough access and it was stunning
Beautiful place to visit.. Full of history, this Cathedral is a must to see. Its right by the Palace and is well worth the visit.
Awesome. A must see on you visit to Prague . Loads of history, buy a ticket to see all parts of the castle well worth it

Get in early. If your going to see this, don't wait till mid day or you will one of the 1000's in the place and a lot of them don't care about standing in your way when your trying to get a photo. Get a taxi or the tram (no 22 goes up that way), and get in before the rush. You can walk down the hill to get out which takes you to the river quite quickly. The little shop at the wall on the way down has the best hot wine we tried in Prague.
Magnificent!!!. The cathedral is within the Prague Castle complex. Impressive!!! You actually see its towers from many parts of the city, as they are pretty tall!!!

Stunning..... Just wonderful. Pay the ticket price for the castle to be able to wander around the outer chapels and see the stained glass windows! Beautiful art and sculptures. We also climbed to the top of the bell tower, also worth the extra money, and an unbeatable view over Prague. Tough climb for those not very fit, but definitely manageable! Not for the claustrophobic though!

Time carefully. Unfortunately we took a Sunday morning city tour, and although the tour was good, the Cathedral is closed to the public on Sundays while Masses are going on. There is no "sneaking" in. It may also close early afternoon some days. Check their website. Be sure, unless you are a hiker or very, very fit , and have no small children to access the Palace by the main entrance via either taxi or public transportation.
Worth the walk. . Imposing on the outside but lacking the conspicuous affluence that makes the great Southern European cathedrals so stunning.
Gothic on the hill. Worth the walk up the hill to walk around inside and out , we just sat on the steps and watched the world go by on a lazy Sunday afternoon
Stunning!. Such a lovely piece of history. The walk up to the castle is a long one but very well worth it to see this beautiful cathedral. I was in awe at this massive structure and all its history.

Really, It's hard to believe this structure exists.. I would visit in the morning hours to avoid huge crowds. Tickets can be bought online to avoid waiting in line. The most incredible part of this cathedral is the catacombs underneath which are not open to the general public now although there could be private tours available. Make sure you visit the tower attached to the cathedral with a separate entrance. A ticket is needed here too. The climb is 287 steps and the view at the top is incredible.

Top of Prague. I begin the adventure in train station Malostranska. and a little bit "hiking" to reach the cathedral wit a beautiful city sightseeing . visited this on 20th December 2015, fortunately there was a christmas market, enjoy the architecture of the cathedral while drinking a hot apple was an amazing experience!! and it is just the beginning :)

Mesmerizing. The grandest of all the churches in Prague. Try to go early in the afternoon before dusk to view the Cathedral without the lights and wait until all the lights are up. The sight is just breathtaking. Enjoy the Christmas market at the back before going down to Old Town.

Impressive. Visited and totally impressed with arquitecture and beauty of location, totally worth the prepared explanation of tour guide expert, enjoyed greatly and learned a lot of missing fragments of this fine country.

Windows. The stained glass windows are breathtaking, the colours vibrant and could have spent ages just looking at them, the cathedral is stunning with a majestic grandeur, there is an area at the entrance for an amazing photo opportunity, but for a fee you can get further into the cathedral, we did not bother but got some fantastic photos from the large area at the entrance, worth a visit. Be sure to have some coins for the loos, as there is no change available, and the information centre were less than helpful, we eventually managed to get change from a lovely girl in the gift shop, after the hike up the hill and a wander around it was not unreasonable we would need to use the facilities, pity there was no consideration for anyone without change.

Stunning Cathedral, the stand out feature of the castle from the old city. This Cathedral was almost certainly the most impressive building that we saw during our visit to the Prague Castle complex. Stunning architecture, it really makes you stop and think about how our forefathers were able to construct such beautiful buildings with the limited technology that they had at their disposal. I'm sure that modern man no longer has the knowledge and hands on skills that our ancestors were equipped with.
Gorgeous cathedral! . This is a truly gorgeous place, amazing architecture. There are beautiful statues and mosaics that tell the story of Christian saints.
Recent Visit. Absolutely gorgeous. Breath taking, both the interior and exterior, well worth the very reasonable cost of the ticket,
Interesting monument. A beautiful old and new cathedral inside Prague Castle. A long time history is attached to this monument

Stunning stained glass. Aside from the height of the vaulted roof of the nave (one of the highest in Europe), the stained glass windows are easily the most spectacular aspect of cathedral, situated in the middle of the castle courtyards. The spires too are stunning, and can be seen from all over Prague. The architectural detail, including statues and gargoyles, rival some of Europe's finest cathedrals. If you're a keen photographer, there see some lovely angles to capture, especially if you get there in the late afternoon when the sun casts a rosy glow over the stonework.

Nice glass windows. Very impressive outside. Inside the coloured glas windows are amazing. Do pay attention the one window designed by Alphonse Mucha. Not worth to pay the entrance fee. Just go inside and take a look in the free area. If you do not speak Czeck you are not allowed to join the holy service.

Phenomenal Stain Glass!. We got the Prague Castle tickets that included St. Vitus. You can enter the church without one, but you're limited to a tiny roped in space and can't fully enjoy the stained glass windows and architecture. St. Vitus has some of the most beautiful stained glass and we loved getting to walk around. The tomb of John of Nepomuk was beautiful, but a bit hard to get a picture of the whole tomb. I highly recommend getting the tickets that allow you to walk around the whole church.
Beautiful. This cathedral was one of the highlights of my trip- so so pretty outside but then you go inside and its WOW!The stained glass is beautiful I have never seen anything like it before!!!
Historically beautiful. A great place to visit, beautiful centuries old church. visit the palace also and attend a private concert
Beautiful Cathederal. Very calming and peaceful place to visit. worth a walk around and take in the beautiful stain glass windows. Remember to light a candle for a loved one.

Beautiful. Situated inside the Prague Castle. You can get in see the Cathedral from the main entrance, but to visit the whole Cathedral you have to pay more. Amazing stained glass windows and architecture.

Gorgeous stained glass. This cathedral was part of the "Castle Tour" ticket that we bought. The soaring spires and stained glass are breath-taking. Unfortunately all of the pews were roped off, and I could have enjoyed sitting for a few minutes in all that grandeur!

Must see but beware of pick pockets. This area is much larger than you think even has a Christmas market with great views over the city.For those who don't want to climb the many steps you can take a tram to main entrance. Its the No 22 but beware I had a small purse taken from my rucksack whilst on the tram fortunately nothing of great value was in it. So they must have been disappointed with the haul.

A definite must-see!. An amazing and beautiful cathedral absolutely full of interesting architecture and objects. Definitely take the time to visit, I'd recommend a full day of exploring this and the rest of the palace.
Fabulous monument. Up Old Town Prague stays the most nicest monument. So old, so high and so gorgeous Cathedral! You feel yourself so small ...and peacefull.

Very Gothic. Imposing, dark, Gothic....this piece of architecture is extremely impressive. On the lines of the cathedrals in Western Europe, this has very good wood work inside. Take a walk from the Old town and cross Charles' bridge to get to this place. Worth the visit

Beautiful and memorable place. My boyfriend proposed to me at the top of st.vitus tower cathedral Prague in the Castle on monday 14.12.15. The place is so magical and beautiful. You can see the main buildings and everything from the top of the tower. But you need to prepare to climb 289 steps.
A masterpiece. This place is amazing! It is truly an architectural feat and provides a great photo opportunity. Quite a climb to get up there but worth it.
Fascinating and interesting. St.Vitus Cathedral is simply beautiful. The Gothic architecture is fascinating and unbelievably wonderful. The stained glass windows and the art work are impressive.
Simply, the best part of the castle. This is by far the best area of the castle and the admission fee is well worth just to enter the cathedral. One of the most interesting cathedrals anywhere
Great to see. Great place to visit, but can work out expensive as there are different levels of charges to access different areas

Beautiful cathedral. Loved it - went back again the next day to enjoy it just before it closed when it was quiet and peaceful. The entry ticket into the castle and cathedral is valid for 2 days which is great!
Highlight of the Castle grounds. After you've seen the Cathedral, the Castle is slightly disappointing. Save the Cathedral for last and take the audio tour.

A must-see Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral is a must see! If you re in the castle, you cannot miss the Cathedral. In fact. from across the city, it is visible! The stained glass alone is worth the visit. Each of the panels is beautiful, and tells a story.
Magical. A truly beautiful building, it's like something out of a fairy tale! Well worth a visit, the stained glass windows still looked impressive on a rainy day!

Beautiful stained glass. You can see the entrance of this cathedral without paying the admission fee and a lot of people do this, but to really appreciate it's beauty you need to go further inside and marvel at the golden altar and the sheer size of the stained glass windows. Also King Wenceslas chapel is tucked away in an alcove so it's worth the effort.
Gorgeous!. We enjoyed all of it totally especially the stained glass windows, very beautiful design in e every aspect. This is a must see!

Simply stunning. Prague is chock full of amazing churches. This one is part of the Prague Castle complex and is still used as a religious site.Yes, there can be a sense of being herded about, but then the visitor numbers require some organisation.Go up the church tower if you can - the views are great.

Fabulous. This is worth the climb ( not very steep). The surrounding areas is lovely and the cathedral itself is just stunning. You are able to go inside and it is so beautiful. There is no ban on photography, so there is a wonderful opportunity to photograph the beautiful windows.

Gorgeous Interior. St. Vitus is one of the more impressive cathedrals I've ever seen (and I've seen a lot). It's full of Czech history, including tombs and chapels dedicated to famous kings and saints. The highlights for me were the St. Wenceslas Chapel, which is covered in rich paintings and marble, and the stained glass window designed by the famous Czech artist Alphonse Mucha. The cathedral makes a visit to the castle worth it (otherwise the sights there are just ok).
Worth a visit. Really worth seeing the vaulted ceiling and stained glassed windows were really lovely. The architecture outside with the stone masonary carvings were very good as well.
Big but not Fantadtic. I think it's more fantastic on the outside, but still far short of the great cathedrals of Florence, Siena, Rome, London, etc.

Magnificent Cathedral. This is one of the well maintained cathedrals of Europe. Sunday masses are also held. There is a lot of richness in the architecture and decor; with stained glass windows and silver.
Just stunning. We loved this beautiful Cathedral. It Is in the heart of the castle and is so beautiful. You can actually walk inside and take a few pictures. An absolute gem in the heart of Prague!

Beautiful church , Amazing architecture !. one of the best attractions, you need to cross Karlov Bride (Charles Bridge) in order to reach it, you walk up the hill, (little bit long and tiring walk) but then you will see this amazing church, it is very similar to the one in Budapest and Vienna, but it is a MUST See attraction

Best cathedral in Prague. This is a fantastic cathedral to tour while in Prague - and if you love stained glass windows, this place is incredible! It is worth spending a hour or so in this lovely church while in Prague.

One of the great cathedrals of Europe. The cathedral is included in all route options at the Prague castle and was definitely a highlight of our visit to the city. It is an awe-inspiring construction and a perfect example of a gothic cathedral not to be missed for its flying buttresses, soaring windows, rose window and the silver tomb of St John of Nepomuk. An experience without the audio guide, but if gothic cathedrals excite you and you have the time, I would say get the audio guide or even smartphone app to maximise your experience. The cheapest ticket that includes the cathedral is 250 czk which is a bargain at less than £7. However, it seemed to be possible to enter the back of the cathedral and look down the nave without a ticket. If you would like to walk the length of the cathedral, look back at the rose window and see the silver tomb, you will need a ticket to go through the turn-style.

Don't miss out!. The first time I came to Prague I saw the cathedral but didn't go inside. The second time, I went inside and I instantly regretted not going inside on my first trip. The stained glass is beautiful. The audio guide was also very informative and gave enough history of what you see around you. We didn't have to queue to get inside but there were several tour groups inside that made it rather crowded.

When visiting Prague Castle, you must enter the St Vitus Cathedral. Wonderful Cathedral, soooo big, how could they manage to build such buildings so long ago ... Impressive. A "must see" when in Prague.

stunning architecture. Well worth having a look inside as the architecture is beautiful, incredible stained glass windows and again if visiting Prague you will undoubtedly end up here at some time so go inside

Beautiful Cathedral. This was a gorgeous Cathedral. At the time that we went in there was a choir singing seasonal songs. That made the feel of the church even better. My family thoroughly enjoyed getting to see the area. We had a tour guide. I would suggest that, as there are lots of little historical details that the tour guides can explain.

Superb architectural experience. St. Vitus Cathedral is located in the Castle area. This Cathedral is a must see. The design is unique with stained glass windows which you will marvel at viewing. Entrance is free but you have to pay a fee to access some areas.

Gorgeous!. We loved every aspect of this beautiful Cathedral. It sticks out right there in the heart of the castle and is so stunning! You can actually walk inside and take a few pictures as well. It is free of charge and totally worth the detour. An absolute gem in the heart of Prague!
Beautiful monumental cathedral. The beautiful monumental gothic cathedral on the Prague castle. Beautiful stained glass in every daylight.

Wow!. The stained glass within this cathedral was amazing. It was nice to share with my children the amazing architecture that was a show case in Catholic Churches. Brilliant colors amazing designs and awe inspiring location. Also it was very beautifully decorated at Christmas time. Everyone enjoyed visiting.

A peaceful sanctuary away from the tourist hoards. The best way to visit St. Vitus Cathedral is to attend a Mass. My wife and I did just that on a cool but sunny Sunday morning. While thousands of tourists milled about the Castle grounds we were treated to a very moving ritual complete with delightful choir music and a feeling of peace and calm that would surely be missing during tourist hours. And our visit cost us nothing but what we put into the collection basket.
Gorgeous windows. Definitely worth a visit, despite the crowds, even in Winter. The windows were a highlight. We listened in on a couple of tours, and gleaned a little of the history.

Very Gothic with fantastic stained Glass. Fantastic Stained glass makes this Cathedral well worth a visit being part of the Castle area, The Treasures of the Cathedral are housed in a different part, but well worth a visit too

Best Preserved European Castles after WWII. This is a MUST for all visiting Prague. We went there using the hop on hop off bus and it stopped right in front of the castle. Stunning and breathtaking! Could spend hours there enjoying the Gothic architecture. Fun Christmas Market ongoing at the moment as well.

Magnificent. This cathedral is in the castle and the approach is through narrow passageways. But once you are there you get a magnificent view. The architecture is superb and stained glass is excellent

Definitely worth seeing. St Vitus cathedral on the Prague castle fortress hill about 2-3 kilometres from Stare Mesto is worth seeing with great stained glass windows. It also is lit at night so you can get good photos of the outside, although you need a really wide angle lens to get it all in as the surrounding buildings tend to cram in.

Beautiful Catherdral. Place you must see when you are going to visit Prague Castle. Excellent example of Gothic architecture. We had to wait 10 minutes at the entrance to the cathedral, but it was worth it.
Cathedral. Stunning building both outside and in. Worth the climb up the steps from Charles Bridge. The view of this cathedral from the bridge is a truly iconic picture of Prague.

Amazing to see. You cant fully appreciate this thing until you get up to it. This is amazing is design and architecture. Had to believe what could be done back then. So glad it wasn't destroyed in the war. The rest of the city is amazing to walk. So much to see and experience. I could spend several days there and not run out of new things. One of the best cities in eastern Europe and very reasonable on the wallet.

One of the Coolest Looking Cathedrals on Earth. No matter where you are in Prague, you can almost always see the spires of St. Vitus in the distance. I'd recommend getting a close-up view however, to really get a sense of the artisanship in the detail of construction. If nothing else, go for the gargoyles. All different forms (some a little creepy) surround the upper perimeter of the place.

Catherdral. With Prague being such a historic area to visit, it wouldn't be right without a visit to see St Vitus Cathedral. Amazing to see and it's been pretty much undamaged even though the wars of the last century. Make it a point to visit and you wont be disappointed.

Beautiful . This was a lovely place. You don't have to pay to see most of it. There was Christmas markets all around in December. It is right next to the old palace and golden mile. All of it was unique and beautiful!

Resoundingly gothic. Nowadays Czeck Republic is the more atheist Country in Europe. Despite this, St.Vitus Chatedral is one of the most beautiful european churches. Resoundingly gothic.Plan the visit in the early morning.
Lovely stained glass windows. We did not pay to go round the whole cathedral as we were short of time but you could go just so far in.....
Long history. If you visit Prague you cannot miss St. Vitus Cathedral which has very deep sense for Czech nation. Cathedral is huge and you can stay inside and feel the history.

Great Church, Lots of History. They church itself is beautiful and worth a visit, but I found the history of the church and the stories of the city encapsulated in this cathedral are wonderful. Make sure to take in the beautiful Mucha stained glass window in the cathedral. It is truly spectacular.

Gotic treasure. I went there after a looong time to show this beautiful and one of the most important sights in Prague to my American friend who has never been in Prague before and we both were amazed and it didnt matter either it was a first time in her case or not the first time at all in my case!
Stunning windows. We visited the Cathedral as part of a 3 in 1 Castle tour. The windows were absolutely stunning - rich vibrant colours. The height of the Cathedral is also dizzying.
Gothic splendour. Beautiful stained glass windows and interesting artefacts especially book of rememberance for wartime airmen.
Lovely cathedral . Enclosed within Prague castle and entrance as part of your ticket price. A beautiful cathedral. Peaceful and majestic.

Stunning - this is not to be missed. St Vitus Cathedral left me awestruck. Its enormous size and intricate detail took my breath away. There was a big queue to get inside, but the queue moved quickly and the cathedral is so big that there was no sense of crowding. The stained glass was magnificent, with the coloured light dancing on the walls. If you only visit one historical building while in Prague, make it this one, you won't be disappointed.

An unexpected walk! . We visited the cathedral last SaturdayBut found it was closed . Friends decided to do the walk up to the balcony tower . We paid in the information shop and we received a lovely coin with the cathedral picture on it . They should have paid me ! 287 steps later I fell out on the balcony of the tower . The views were spectacular and were well worth the struggle ..not for the infirm or elderly or anyone with heart or breathing difficulties ... But well worth the challenge for the views !

St. Vitus Cathedral. Not to be missed St. Vitus Cathedral.....went here December 2015 when there was a Christmas market selling food, drink and gifts in the square at the rear of the Cathedral......lovely
St Vitus Cathedral. Although not the grandest cathedral in terms of scale its setting within the Prague Castle complex makes it unique...certainly worth a visit if you go the castle.

Beautiful Architecture. This Cathedral is located within Prague Castle and I had no more interest in going inside but we had some time before our bus was leaving so we followed a crowd in and I am glad we did. Extremely impressive inside, stunning stain glass windows, steeped in history I was blown away and got some amazing photographs without the flash of course!
Magnificent. It´s also a must while in Prague - It´s so absolutely beatiful - Make sure you visited the toilets first!

Simply Incredible, no words will describe it.... I saw this from my home ever day for over a year, but the first time I visited I was stunned. The cathedral is a beautiful, majestic place. I've no doubt anyone would love the experience of being in this place at this time in history.
Amazing, reminded me of the Notre Dame De Paris. Very beautiful stained glass windows. Definitely worth paying for the entrance and the audio-guide. Reminded me of the Notre Dame De Paris.
Just Beautiful. Well worth paying the small charge to go in. It was great to be in a well visited Cathedral where the tourists were behaving with respect to where they are and each other.

Impressive interior and exterior!. This cathedral was breathtaking from the outside and once we went inside as well. A spectacular site that is 100% worth visiting. We made the mistake of going in the morning. We were herded like cattle inside and there were way too many tour groups. My parents waited until after lunch to go and they said it was much less crowded, so you might try that.

Grossly overcrowded. The queue to get in stretched the whole length of the cathedral- and this is one of the biggest such buildings in the world. Sadly this level of overcrowding limited viewing inside hence loss of star.Externally stunning be this from up close or from a distance- there are some of the best views with from the Charles bridge or the quay on the opposite side of the Vlatava river.
Beautiful. Went at sunset one day ans sunrise the next. Absolutely gorgeous. Great views of the city from the surrounding area. Try out the beer at the near by monastery.

Must see Cathedral . Don't miss this cathedral if you're traveling through Prague. I walked all the way up there from Old Town. Easiest way to get up there by bus is the 22. You can come here for service at 7 AM I believe if you like.
wonderful. We had a guide Jana, who added a lot of Czech history to the visit. The stained glass, statuary and symbolism were just overwhelming. Beautiful

Gorgeous Cathedral. Located within Prague Castle, this grand cathedral is a must see. Invariably packed with tourists with fantastic stained glass windows and alter. This Gothic Cathedral contains the tombs of many Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors. It is a triple-naved basilica with flying buttresses, short transept, five-bayed choir and decagon apse with ambulatory and radiating chapels.
woow. The beautiful cathedral , which should see inside . The most beautiful part ar stained-glass windows , which are in the twilight just magic . Must to see.
Large and beautiful. The cathedral is beautiful both from the outside and from the inside and it is also large. Expect quite a lot of people too as it is one of the must-see items in Prague.

Amazing views from the tower. Cathedral is beautiful inside, but the best attraction is the tower, you need to pay for it separately but its worth, the views are stunning! There are over 200 steps to clime and its very narrow, so be prepared and it can be windy on the top.

The Mucha murals are amazing!. A crowded but rewarding experience. This was the first of many cathedrals we visited in Europe on this trip, and it was easily one of the most impressive. The murals (especially Mucha's) are fabulous. You can feel the history all around you while you are here. Get there early for easier access and fewer people.
Grand. This is a huge intimidating cathedral. Gorgeous architecture with intricate details. It's beautiful on the inside as well. Worth the visit.

Worth it. The visit to the cathedral and the castle is a must when visiting Prague, take a walk from the old town square and cross the Charles bridge and up the hill to the castle, well worth the walk.
A Must. Definitively a must-see during every Prague stay! This typical gothic Dom is something special with its light stone walls in the inside.

Absolutely must-see. St Vitus Cathedral is almost as amazing on the outside as it is on the inside. I recommend getting the audio guide which gives you a much better insight to this amazing building. Don't forget to have a long hard look at the gargoyles on the outside - they are incredible.

A gothic jewel. This cathedral is one of the many attractions, visible once you get the castel's area.
It is rich of history and art and it surely worth a visit.
The things that above all fascinated me are the huge coloured glass windows and the beautiful facade.
Amazing views. We paid to go to the top of the Cathedral for the amazing views over Prague. The tower is not wheelchair friendly.

Wonderful Cathedral. This is a must visit, the beautiful building has exquisite stained glass windows and architecture. The outside of the building is excellent but when you enter and see the windows it is truly jaw dropping

Wonderful cathedral. . Beautiful cathedral with a wonderful Mucha stained glass window. It should be noted, although in my opinion, it does not distract from the beauty or the continuity of the church knowing that half the church was built starting in 1344 and the other half was completed in 1929. It is well worth buying a ticket so you can view the entire church, as there's much beauty to behold.
Architectural excellence. You will go blank once you are in front of the Cathedral. its a piece of architecture. Its stands tall a proud in the castle
Amazed by the magestic view!. No long waiting, as soon we arrived we got in the cathedral. Impressive building! Worth visiting when in Prague.

Beautiful. Wow what a beautiful place. Windows and stone work are simply amazing. We went on a cold day but with the warmth of the sun shine through the colours and light were fabulous. You can enter free but worth paying to get the full tour.
Amazing. Such a beautiful church! So much detail in the architecture. It was cold and raining so we didn't spend as much time outside admiring it. We will be back.
grand cathedral. amazing stain glass windows and all the other religious things, they certainly knew how to do it. its free for one bit, but tickets are needed for other parts

Beautiful Architecture, but Random Closings. The architecture of the cathedral is beautiful when viewing the outside of the building but it was supposed to be open while we were there but it just closed before we walked to the door. A staff member told another guy that it closes twice a day, not sure what that means, so we didn't get to see the inside and there were many others confused as well. So glad we didn't pay to see the paid part!
lovely visit. Very beautiful stained glass. Worth a visit to the paying bit although you can just go into the entrance area for free.
AMAZING . I loved it! It was so big and impressive. The gold detailing on the castle was magnificent. The roof was very nice and the stain glass windows weren't like anything I had seen before.

Inside Castle complex, resting place of King Wenseslas and crown. Although it appears to be fine gothic, only the first part is. The rest was built in the 19th century, but in the gothic manor. The stained glass windows are amazing, its so high inside and there is a tomb in front of the alter containing some of the kings and queens of the country.
Must see the Cathedral!. The Cathedral is a wonder! It should be seen to be appreciated! It is not as old as it looks and the guides are great in filling you in on the details.
Standard nice Cathedral. We bought the circuit A ticket, that lets you visit the whole prague castle, palace and cathedral. The cathedral was nice as all cathedrals, but didn't have anything unique.

Fantastic Gothic Cathedral, a must see in Prague. Commanding a great view on top of the hill overlooking Prague, the church and the castle it can be seen from most of the city.The building's foundations date back to the 1300's so it has lots of history but the stonework and stained glass windows are all great.Tickets are commonly sold to include a trip round some of the other buildings on the hill which makes for an interesting trip, well worth the walk up the hill.

Stunning with so much history . If you like history and amazing architecture a visit to st.vitus cathedral within the castle will blow your mind. The visit is part of your entry to the castle. Was an amazing experience and you can really sense the history of the building when inside
Impressive. Unfortunately almost all of the attractions in Prague charge an entrance fee, but usually it is worth paying. This is worth the fee.
Simply beautiful. Lovely place and just simply beautiful. Can get busy during the day. Best way to get to it is by the local tram system.

Must Go. If you are visiting the Prague Castle, you must stop by the Cathedral. You don't have to pay to go in (just the front part and very crowded), but I would recommend getting the tour ticket to go further in the Cathedral. Just the St. John of Nepomuk's Tomb itself is worth the price.

Get there early. We started our castle area tour at the cathedral and were glad we did, as it's very popular and gets crowded. Don't miss the Mucha distinctive stained glass window, quite a departure in style from the traditional ones. The cathedral is beautiful, has lovely chapels along the edges of the main area. There are ancient saints relics and tombs worth seeking out. The magnificent Gothic cathedral that now stands there was started in 1344 but not completed until the 1900s, but yet still has a cohesive appearance.
Amazing architecture. Astounded by the amount of gold emblazoned statues and cherubs. Beautiful building with lots to see. Worth a visit.
Amazing stained glass windows. We visited after buying a multi ticket for all the buildings in the castle complex. As the title says, the windows were the highlight for us!
brilliant. Lovely Lovely Cathedral. Take the tram as walking up can be very tiring espeacilly if one is not able to walk far

Could look at its stained glass windows half a day easily. It is kind of sad that you cannot buy separate ticket to the church (at least I did not see such option), but have to buy it as part of wider and thus more expensive tour, because it might hold some people back from entering it and they will never know what they missed out on. I love medieval churches as architectural category, so I went in already positively biased towards what I was going to see, but already the first stained glass window smashed me with its bright and vivid colors and wonderful composition so much that I actually almost forgot to look at anything else than windows. The chapel of St. Wenceslas also is a gem in its own right, even you cannot go inside it (at least not as usual tourist) you still get the feeling of its grandness. Unfortunately, royal cripts were closed due to technical reasons. But even that could not take away the general awe I was into about this church.
Well worth a visit. Such a beautiful cathedral and really worth a visit. Striking building with the most impressive stained glass.
Amazing. Awesome display of architecture and glass artwork. Worth the walk for sure. Surprisingly there were not any lines or anything.

Stunning Gothic church, a must-visit. Lovely Gothic church located in the Prague castle compound. Both exteriors and interiors are impressive. Only church in Prague apparently that still runs full services and that's why most castle tours start in the afternoon. A must-visit.
Very very nice cathedral. One of the nicest cathedral I have visited. Gothic style cathedral. A must visit while you are in Prague.
Beautiful building. This is a beautiful building and worth the tiring walk up the hill if you choose. Worth going into also.

Stunning. So glad we went to the castle and saw this beautiful cathedral. The building left be in awe. The architecture and the elaborate interior are so worth seeing. We were lucky as there were few tourists.
Beautiful and amazing church. Beautiful and amazing church, the view from this part of the city is also very nice! Is one of the beautiful places in Prague.

Beautiful Cathedral. A must see when in Prague. Beautiful stained glass windows. Amazing church inside Prague Castle. Beautiful Gothic architecture. St. Wenceslas Chapel is in the church. It is where the remains of the saint are kept.
Beautiful building inside and out. The stain glass is very impressive and the silver work is a master peace. A must see when in Prague.

Water bottles in summer are a must!. Of all the places that my friend and I visited in Prague (and there were many), I'd have to say that St. Vitus Cathedral was the longest wait. That said, it was worth it! Just make sure that each person in your group has a bottle of water if you go here in the summer. The sun can be brutal as it is reflecting off the surrounding concrete courtyard. There was no shade. The interior of St. Vitus Cathedral is huge, ornate, and offers much to view. It is definitely a must-see regardless of your religious affiliation. We were here in 2009.We were here in 2009.

BEAUTIFUL ARCHITECTURE!!!!!!. This is an absolutely BEAUTIFUL cathedral!!! The interior is very ornate with extraordinary vaulting. It has Renaissance and Baroque elements in the Gothic building. Loved it!
Lovely windows!. We were pleasantly surprised to gain free access to the back portion of the cathedral with the sun streaming through the beautifully stained glass windows. Worth a visit.
breathtaking. St Vitus Cathedral is part of the Prague Castle complex and is beautiful. Take the self guided tour with headphones. Beautiful.
Beauty of art😍. Opened in year 1929, this Cathedral has alot of artistic details.It is very unique how it built, and well designed from outside and inside.Really I impressed
Incredible!. An awe inspiring piece of architecture. A must see! Take a tour if you can so you don't miss the crazy amount of history involved.

Beautifully breath taking :). We went in the entrance and space everyone's allowed in and thought it was breath taking, then went to tourist information brought a ticket to see different parts of the castle and saw we could gain excess deeper into the cathedral and honestly think you all should! There if so much more that you can't see from the basis entry part it was so beautiful and fasinating :) oh and go up to the top of the tower aswell! That was probably my favourite bit :)
Impressive Cathedral. Worth visiting it. Huge impressive construction. Based on a ticket, inside you can go round and enjoy the details of the building.
A day out!. St Vitus Cathedral and the castle are not to be missed, when visiting Prague. A very beautiful Cathedral.

Freezing in Febuary!. My husband I visited St.Vitus Cathedral in February when the temperature inside the Cathedral must of been below freezing as you your breath! Beautiful Cathedral but it was that cold we couldn't wait to get out of it and into a cafe to warm up. The signs to the Cathedral also need to be improved as it took ages to find it.
Stunning cathedral. Stunning cathedral. I would recommend you take a tour to the castle and you will find out lots more information than just turning up.

Excellent example of Gothic architecture, stunning stained glass.... Attractive architecture of the cathedral: the outside is impressive, but when you enter you will experience special beauty - play of light through stained glass. If you're a Mucha fan, he designed one of the windows. On a sunny day you will have the full effect of the beautiful stained glass :). Cathedral is one of the special impressions from Prague

A tower with a view, After a tough climb though (852 steps). St. Vitus cathedral is an old church with high ceiling. A church definately worth visiting.What is more impressive is its South tower.Once you are up, you have the best view of Praha all around.Be mindful there is no lift and you have to climb 852 winding steps. Not recommended for aged people.There is no food or water available upstairs so carry your own while climbing up.

St, Vitus Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral on the hill overseeing Prague is huge and very beautiful. There's some amazing stained glass windows and some great views of the city as well. You can walk from the old city to the Cathedral.
Beautiful Cathedral. This Cathedral has a beautiful front and is most interesting and exciting also inside . Incredible beautiful nave of the church .
Beautiful . The work on this church needs to be appreciated.. The work on the windows alone... Wow. Did not pay for the tour, if you only wish to see the church it's not really needed

Words cant begin to describe. This is the one place i had picked that i wanted to go and there aren't words to describe it.The Cathedral is just Amazing from the Sheer Size the architecture,Vaulted ceilings,artwork,stained glass windows it is safe to say I was in AWE!I cant wait to return to Prague as i have fallen in love with its Bohemian Charm.If you get the chance to visit and are physically able aim to climb the steps to watch the sun setting it is the most breathtaking,Romantic thing i have ever seen.
Amazing. There are no words to describe the beauty inside this building. The stained glass windows are so vibrant, depicting scenes of beauty.

Gorgeous. A very very large and beautiful cathedral with excellent stained glass and an interesting history. It's one of the highlights if a visit to Prague. The walk down the hill after your visit is very nice.
Great Architecture. The cathedral is awesome! Outside view is fantastic. Inside is also awesome. It is must to see in Prague.

Magnificent.. Stunning from the outside and breath taking once you step inside due to its immense size, wonderful stain glass windows and so much to see. You can enter and stand at the back of the Cathedral without a ticket but you need to purchase a ticket on your way in to the Castle to be allowed to wander around and really take it all in.

Great and wonderful place. The Cathedral is old, really interesting place to visit, you can buy a ticket to get into the inner space, witch contain a lot of famous people graves. I don`t think that the visit into the inner space will be interesting,

Well worth the walk to see this cathedral. This cathedral was a long up hill walk but absolutly well worth a visit ...it was amazing.... Very close to Prague Castle so with a visit there too. The building in front of Saint Peters Cathedral is where the President lives in the country.The building in front of Saint Vitus Cathedral is where the President lives of the country. The tram or the underground I think it goes there if you do not wish to walk .
Short break Prague. Pretty amazing building , but a bit of a walk up to it. The pictures you will get are worth it though.
Great architecture . Must see. A must see in prague. The architecture is fabulous. Make sure you climb the 284 steps up the tower. The view is worth it.
Inside is amazing too. If you visit this place do not miss the chance to go inside too. The ticket is worth it's price. You will feel so small inside this mighty place.

St Vitus Cathedral. Located inside Prague Castle, this Cathedral dates back to its beginnings in the 10th Century and was actually built over several centuries by different kings. Do take a guide with you to understand its complicated interiors, alters, and history. You would comfortably require a couple of hours to imbibe its fascinating history.
What a beautiful church!!!. This church is absolutely beautiful. Definitely get the pass to go past the lobby so that you can walk around the church and take in all it's beauty.

Beautiful Cathedral - worth the long walk!. Gorgeous Cathedral, well worth the trek to the top of the mountain. (You could take a tram, but we felt that was cheating ;-)) It was part of the Prague Castle tour; you had a choice of ticket packages, and I would highly recommend including this.

Make sure to climb the 284 steps up the tower. Although this will make you dizzy and wish you never started the climb, when you get to the top the views are incredible. Don't miss this opportunity. It's 1 50th which isn't bad. The building is stunning to look at inside and out.
Amazing cathedral. While in prague dont miss out this unique cathedral. Also worthed the view of prague from the top. Enjoy.
A must see. This really is a beautiful cathedral. There us a tower with a viewing platform 150 kronus Entrance feem..287 stone steps to climb

Totally amazing . Visited here last year also. The architecture is outstanding. You can pay to go further into the cathedral but standing at the back for free is enough for anyone to take in the high ceilings and amazing interior
Lovely interior. The entrance is stunning. The exterior is also interesting with its many gargoyles at the top of the pinnacles
NOT just for Hisotirians,,,,,,. I'm not usually blown away by 'old buildings' but the sheer size and detail on this amazing Cathderal did just that!
St Vitus Cathedral. Beautiful Church. While you can enter for free, it is worth the extra cks to be able to view the naves of the church and the stain glass windows etc..up close.

IMPRESSIVE. Lovely vitreaux. Great experience. Imnpressive ceilings and vitreaux.
The whole visit around the castle y walking down from the right of St Vitus is worth it even if raining
An Imposing structure. Beautiful architecture and very well lighted through the crystal glass ! A must visit for its historical value. Looks similar to The Cologne cathedral !
Breathtaking. .This is one of those attractions that has a public and a paid division. The public part is grand enough is you don't need detail

Impressive and One of a kind.. Enjoyed every minute of this visit of the Castle and the Cathedral. The St Vitus is beautiful and one of the nicest I have ever seen. Walking the area was enjoyable and like going back in time

Serious Architecture. It's well worthy paying the price for the extended ticket. You get a lot without the ticket but there is so much to this building you will be sure it was well worth delving into the full space.

287 steps to the top - the view is worth it!. If you're visiting Prague on a clear day, it's definitely worth climbing the hills (or taking a taxi) to the castle complex to look around the gothic St Vitus Cathedral, a real feat of architecture. If you're feeling athletic, the tower is 287 up a stone staircase and comes out onto a viewing tower with panoramic views of the City; on a clear day, you can literally see for miles!
Lovely cathedral near the castle. This beautiful cathedral with its imposing facade is really a site to behold. I recommend not going on Sunday, as mass with prevent your entrance.

Incredible Gothic Cathedral. This is as impressive as it looks.Wow, all the way. We did descretely follow a tour guide and gained a lot of fact from him. 1000yrs of history in this building and it was very impressive both inside and out.Definitely no pushing in here.
A very beautiful castle. A must stop place on your trip in Prague.. A beautiful castle with interesting architecture. You can go inside and it's just as breathtaking as it is on the outside.

Outstanding Catherderal. An amazing place to visit and just a stone throw from Prague castle. In fact a visit to one would coincide with a visit to the other. The cathederal is an impressive building of breath taking beauty and a building which the Czechs are quite rightly proud of. On entering the cathederal I think I was firstly struck by the size of it. It's both beautiful inside and out. It is very very busy so depending on when you intend to visit expect queues. If you are lucky to catch the changing of the guard at the castle you will see both the new and old guard pass through here. Impressive.

Go here. It is hard to miss the Cathedral when you go to Prague as it sits on the top of a hill, even from a distance it looks impressive. As you get closer and you see the detail on the building (especially the golden mosaic) it is hard not to be impressed by the buildings majesty.One of the most impressive buildings I have ever seen. It is free to go and see and walk round. Well recommended. Plenty of space without bumping into other people and there are no street vendors there either as they are band from the grounds, which is great.
Mid week break. Well worth a visit, the architecture is fantastic, it is the alleged burial place of two saints. The size of the silver statue to commemorate will blow you away
Amazing sight. Once through the castle courtyard you walk out of the arch and are met by the amazing sight of the Cathedral. It is huge and when lit up at night totally magical
imposing building. Free to view from the outside, take in the castle and cathedral for the price of a tram day ticket. Take number 22 tram and enjoy the ride.
St. Vitus. Beautiful cathedral on the exterior and the interior is even better. The stain glass windows are worth the trip. We did this as part of the Castle Tour.
impressing. Nice Cathedral, beautiful windows and sculptures.At the visit in november it was not crowed with people so you can see a lot.

Pražska Hrad's Cathedral of Exquisite Coloured Glass
. St Vitus Basilica is a grand Gothic structure, the Czech Republic's spiritual centre for its Catholicajprity

Stunning and Grandiose!. Another must visit in Prague. The stained glass work on the windows is magnificent. One can see plenty of cathedral interior without paying the fees. We got the tickets to see the extra bits and was totally worth it. Be prepared for a steep walk, but not too tiring. Audio guides are helpful to understand history and architectural styles.
St. Virus Cathedral. A Stunning classic Cathedral, but it is the breathtaking stained glass that is not to be missed. It is included in the Prague Castle tour packages and should not be missed.

Stunning architecture and stained glass. We were blown away when we entered the cathedral. The stained glass windows were magnificent and the whole interior was filled with beautiful lighting. The outside was also incredibly impressive.

Very nice cathedral . This cathedral has a small area that can be entered for free if you just want to get a general view. If you want to go in properly then you need to get a ticket. The Tourist information office sells tickets for various combinations of entry to the attractions in the area so choose which you want to see first.
Truly amazing. Its really impressive how men could build something that could last as long at it has and still be relevant and beuatiful.

One of the best attractions In Prague.. One of the most interesting attractions in Prague. Rich history and beautiful architecture. Better to take guided tour not to miss very interesting details. Very impressive site.

Beautifully placed cathedral. You can see churches like this all over the place, but this one sitting on the edge of the cities old town square is so impressively set, you just cannot help but take a couple of dozen snaps of it.Unlike most other people I didn't get a chance to go in, but just to see it from the outside was good enough for me, I will be back in Prague in the future and will make sure I am in this lovely place.

History and Beauty rolled into one stop. Beautiful cathedral. As noted by others the stained glass windows by Alfonso Mucha are amazing. The gargoyles surrounding the church are also worth a mention, and for us we found out more about the history of Wenceslaus and his role in history. It is worth a visit.
Truly amasing. Dunno how to describe this cathedral but it was just magnificent inside and outside. Something that was really worth to see. You wont regret paying for this!

Stunning!!!! worth paying for a tour. We paid for a tour in English - worth it. This is the most stunning and interesting cathedral in the goth style, just simply amazing. Do not miss out. It is on top of a huge hill, so you might find a way to get to the top other than your feet. The bus is good and cheap.

One of the landmarks of Castle Town. My favorite part of this gothic cathedral is the Art Nouveau stained glass windows by Alfons Mucha. You can't miss them, they are totally exquisite. Part of the church visit is free, just follow the lines.
Beautiful church. Worth visiting if you are at the castle. Exterior is magnificient. The interior is ornate. We just did a quick visit since we have seen many churches in Europe.

Look for the Mucha window!. Perhaps the most amazing thing about this beautiful cathedral is the amazing stained glass window created by Alfons Mucha. it is on the left side as you enter. It's composition and powerful color are nothing short of mesmerizing. Seeing it alone is worth the visit.
Grandious. It is really amazing cathedral, huge, imposing and interesting to see with so many rich details.....

Highlight of the Hradcany. Come early in the day, it is worth it. You will save a lot of time you will otherwise spend in the queue. The Cathedral is in my opinion the highlight of the district, as well from the inside as from the outside. Definitely worth visiting.
Exploring Prague. I enjoyed the tour of the cathedral and overall entire castle grounds. There is a rich history and culture here. If you don't have a guide get a tour book or audio guide.
Grandious. It is astonishing to look the richness of details and how big it is. The stained glass windows inside is lovely, specially in a sunny day.
Absolutely gorgeous. Take a walk around the building and admire the architecture and the beautiful details. This is the biggest cathedral that I have ever seen!

A 'must see' in Prague. The cathedral is within the grounds of Prague Castle so visiting both in one day is lovely. They can be reached on the 22 tram route. The cathedral is absolutely beautiful inside with some amazing stained glass windows. Very 'wow' factor. Definitely worth a visit.
A must-see!. 1000 years of history on a massive gothic building with excellent vitro glass work in the inside!!!!
Stained Glass Window is outstanding. A. Mucha's window is near the rear of the Cathedral of St. Vitus. This is the cathedral where coronations and royal burials have taken place over the years.

Prague Castle. Standing aloof over the town, the castle is another must see.Built mainly during the sixteen century it is the perfect skyline castle. Best way to visit this building and its surrounds is to take a local tour. Tremendous history not only of the main building but of streets leading up to it. Again, after dark either from the castle precincts or the surrounding area, it is a mind blowing opportunity for photographers.Take that camera with you.

Awesome Space. A visit to Prague Castle is a must on a trip to Prague and St. Vitus Cathedral is probably the best attraction within the grounds. Alongside the views of Prague from the castle this was one of the highlights of our trip. It's a hugely impressive space (the biggest church in the county) with some beautiful windows, some stained glass and some of the more recent additions painted glass. Externally you cannot fail to be impressed by the Gothic architecture.

My personal highlight. I can only speak for myself, but Sv. Vit's my personal must-do. If you've never been to a Gothic church, or even if you have, time it for the light. The stained glass is unbelievable. If you're a Mucha fan, he designed one of the windows. If not, it's simply a breathtaking place to be. Personally, I think the castle is nice and had immense significance, but Sv. Vit's is the reason to go.

Beautiful . Visited here along with the entire population of the world...soooo busy. Pretty impossible to get a pic without a body in it...but still...it's pretty amazing. .we bought a ticket but you can get to see everything when walking down the middle for free ticket gets you a little. Closer to the stained glass windows and so on...our ticket also got us up into the tower...nobody mentioned about all the winding steps...if your unfit give it a miss. The views from the top are wonderful though.and well worth the climb..just keep stopping like we did on the way up. But watch out for people coming back down as not much room to spare..

Beautiful Cathedral. My friend and I bought tickets to 4 sites and one of them was St. Vitus. The cathedral is superb and the architecture is simply amazing. The ceiling and stained glass are really beautiful and in a class of its own. You could still enter the cathedral without a ticket. However, you could only hang around the front portion of the cathedral. It would be sufficient for some people who do not want to wasted money to purchase tickets.
Beautiful Cathedral. Very nice from the outside and inside. Nice murals. Be aware that it can get very crowded as there are hoards of group toyrists pouring in but it is still well worth it.

Beautiful, Opulent, and a fun location. I would say the best part about the cathedral is it's location inside the old royal palace here in Prague. A very unique winding experience with guards on duty and high walls so you have to keep weaving through the beautiful streets to find your way out! The cathedral is very big, with a lot to look at on the outside. Very gothic feel to the architecture and the carvings are diverse. It would take hours to really look at all the details this cathedral has to offer. We went at night and were pleased to see it still open for visitors to take a look. Don't miss it, definitely one of the better sights to see in Prague.

Beautiful gothic cathedral. Beautiful gothic cathedral with a rich history. We had chosen for one of the tours and used the audio guide. We found the part of the tour inside the cathedral to be just the right length. It was not too long.

Favorite place in Prague. No words can fully describe this cathedral. It is magnificent, regal, majestic, and absolutely gorgeous. Go in the daytime hopefully a very sunny day to get the full effect of the stained glass windows

Lovely architecture but don't pay extra to visit. We joined the crowds visiting the Cathedral, you can enter and have a brief look around and take in the stained glass windows without paying. We then bought a ticket to visit the Castle which included a full tour of the Cathedral and a few other exhibits which was a waste of money.
Beautiful. I was amazed by all the details already outside. We didn't buy a ticket so we could only visit the back of the cathedral.
Beautiful . Beautiful cathedral in the heart of the castle grounds! Well worth a visit and easily accessible by tram.

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. This is clearly one of the most important sites to visit whilst in Prague. On the plus side it's pretty amazing and you can see a good part of it without having to pay an admission fee. On the negative side, there are far too many people. That said, it's a remarkable place with a real gothic elegance. I still remember it from my first visit in 1996, it's just that these days there are many more tourists.
Serene but beautiful building with amazing stained glass windows. Inside Prague castle - definitely worth paying the entrance fee for the windows alone.What more can I say ?

Average experience. Throngs of folks everywhere, can see some of the insides without buying ticket. OK find ticket booth, ah can't get an individual ticket have to have circuit A or Circuit B. Couldn't be bothered as nothing else on those tickets appealed to us. Forget noon as that's when the guard changes with a fanfare so attracts a lot of footfall to the area. Churchy bits we did see were okay.

Gothic church. Very beautiful church; looks a lot like other European Gothic churches. We paid admission as part of a package to get in and walk all the way through. There are quite a few things to read, all of them are translated to English. However, you can get in the entrance for free so if you aren't that into churches, you can still get a good view from the free entrance.

Gorgeous interior . We visited this cathedral on the first part of a walking tour around Prague. It is free to get in and is absolutely beautiful with a lot of interesting history. Definitely worth a visit as it is on the main square, where most people are likely to be anyway.

Stained glass Wonder. Well worth the time, if only to see the sun streaming through the stained glass windows. Very busy though so pick your time carefully. The outside facade is just as impressive as inside, the 100+ gargoyles are just stunning.

Beautiful. You can enter the cathedral without paying but cannot view the whole church.There was no queue when we visited and we just popped in for a quick look. It was very beautiful. The stained glass windows were exquisite.
Incredible Architecture. Didn't bother going inside, however the surrounding castle area and the cathedral itself was incredible! Amazing architecture, and well worth a walk around!

Beautiful Gothic Structure. The cathedral is beautiful. The stained glass windows are magnificent. The architecture is really awe inspiring. It was not that full inside when we were there which was great. We actually made use of 1 of the official Prague Castle guides to take us through the cathedral and she was full of very interesting information.

The best cathedral in prague. Was part of our walking tour in prague. The stained glass windows was the beat part. Located in the castle area of prague. Better to go with a tour as you will get some history information also.

I hate paying to visit cathedrals. Absolutely beautiful but you can only get so far in and its not very far at all. Then if you want to walk the whole way round it you need a ticket. Also there is a lady standing policing people lighting candles which I feel is a personal thing and you shouldn't have to be watched and rushed.

The best Cathedral in Prague. This cathedral is one of the historic place to visit in Prague. The minute details taken in care to build this church shoes from its structure & the interior. The priest who kept the secret is a great person on this earth. Really amazed by the tolerance the priest had while the cruel king tourtière him.

My favorite Cathedral in Prague. My family and I visited while we we're on a tour and were very impressed! The Gothic style architecture of St. Vitus Cathedral and the stained glass windows were absolutely beautiful.

A beautiful Cathedral full of history for this City.. A beautiful Cathedral full of history for this City.We were able to walk to the Cathedral over the Charles Bridge from the Mala Strana District. Most things to see or do are waking distance in Prague.
Beautiful. Lovely cathedral, not too many people, beautiful stained glass windows, well worth a visit. The exterior is awe inspiring

Veeeeery pretty!. We have visited only the "free for the public" part of the cathedral, because it was part of our guided tour and we were on schedule. For 250czk or 350czk you can see a bit more of the inside plus inside of Prague Castle and the copy of Bohemian Crown Jewels, but I am not sure if its worth it... we never took paid tour.

St Vitus Cathedral. Visited the historic "St Vitus Cathedral" and was right in time for the 0830 mass.The church had history written all over it and the pipe organ was being played at its best.The Mass was in Czech language and similar to a normal Catholic mass in my home city of Mumbai.The church mass congregation attendance was sparse. This cathedral is Gothic in architecture and is the seat of the archbishop of Prague.The Cathedral contains the tombs of many Bohemian Kings and Holy Roman Emperors and resembles a palace.St Wenceslas Chapel situated at the right hand corner mid-way to the church altar is the most important place in the entire cathedral where the mortal remains of the Saint are kept in a room.Entry to the inside of the chapel is closed for visitors who can only view the doorway leading to the chapel. A door at the South Western corner of this chapel having 7 locks leads to the "Czech Crown Jewels" kept in the crown vault. These crown jewels are displayed to the public once in every eight years.

Gorgeous . The cathedral is simply amazing, so ornate and a beautiful example of gothic architecture. We just wandered the area marveling at the intricate designs. We were there on a tour so we received information about the history of the area and stories about the people who influenced the cathedral.

Great Gothic Cathedral. St. Vitus was worth the climb! We were all churched out after 2 weeks in the Austria/Hungary/Czech region, but found this church to be worth the trip and the entry fee. The fact that it hasn't been sandblasted to death made it really interesting to me. We didn't take a tour, just wandered. If you're in the castle area, at least go in for the free view from the back.
Breathtaking site. This is the most amazing church of Central Europe... it is a must visit site and a place forf unique photos

Amazing!. This building is just amazing. I dont really know what can I say aboutthat. See this building is a bucket list thing. You absoulately have to visit this place. It closing at five so if you are visiting Prag on winter you can come here four and a half and can see insinde and also outside with lights. They do quite good work when it comes to the lights!
a must see. a must see, very ornate, beautiful stained glass windows. very busy with a long queue when we went. after lunch we went back and got in easily.

Beautiful Cathedral. This cathedral is at the castle and is stunning. We didn't see all of it because we hadn't paid for the castle tour. Seems a shame you have to buy a whole tour but there isn't the option to buy individual things. Can still see a lot of the beautiful stain glass without paying. Definitely worth a visit.

Massive and filled with Splendor. This Cathedral was a surprise when we walked in. It is massive (like many others) with beautiful windows (20th century) with great blues and other vibrant colors. The statuary struck me as very different from that in other cathedrals and portions of the cathedral seemed as though they could not contain all that the church leaders wanted to include. It was not cluttered; just filled with so much beautiful artwork.
Simply stunning. This cathedral is amazing. I think it's the best place in all of Prague. I took so many photos. Simply stunning both inside and out. Well worth the money :)

Amazing structure. The cathedral is located in the heart of prague castle. An absolutely incredible building that took around 600 years to complete constructions. Obviously a must see in prague. Take the time to walk around some small streets a bit outside the castle away from crowd simply fantastic. Without having the castle pass you can still enter part of the cathedral. Would recommend coming during day and night if possible to see the lighting (paid for by the rolling stones!). Enjoy!
Stunning Gothic beauty. A must for anyone visiting Prague. It is a part of the Prague castle. Visit for the amazing architecture both inside and outside.

Full of history. Often called "the castle" - do not expect canons, high walls and turret slips! The cathedral is lovely inside and we got a guided tour who was very informative and explained the history of not only the cathedral but the history of the czech people dating from the 7th century. well worth a visit.
Historical church. Historical huge church with a spectacular view and nice wither you need full day trip to complete it .
Old Kathedral privatized.. It was a kathedral but no more a place where we can pray, because it was privatized. To see it you need to pay. It is scandalous to pay to enter in the house of God !

windows everywhere. Sooo much colour inside the cathedral because of all the stained glass windows. The whole thing is beautiful. If you visit in late fall or winter, wear extra clothes as the interior is pretty chilly. Heaps of history.

Worth the trek. This impressive cathedral is at the centre of the castle complex in the hill above Prague. The windows are particularly beautiful. You can see plenty of the cathedral interior without paying the admission fee
A must see in Prague. Beautiful Stunning Building with the most amazing stained glass. Buy the tickets to get you into all the extra bits, so you can see Mucha's glass here.

Breathtaking exterior and interior. A beautiful building on the outside. I was just as impressed with the inside of the cathedral. There are tombs of kings in there. The St. Wenceslas Chapel inside is also a must see.

Nice arcitectur and a landmaket for the area. This church is a typical church for the period and the architecture very nice. Its nice decorating inside and the windows is very decorative. If you want to see the whole church you have to pay ticket for that.

Amazing Architecture. The cathedral is engulfed by the sorounding walls and is beautiful,where in the world is there a nicer cathedral? To look up at it from the city it is stunning and doesn't dissapoint when you go inside.
St. Vitus Castle. The cathedral top is seen from the outside and from the other side of the Charles Bridge. Need to buy ticket to enter the Cathedral

Impressive!. An architectural masterpiece, it holds centuries of history, but in the midst of its undeniable beauty and historical stand, in the Blessed Sacrament Chapel away from the noise of the tourists and locals, it still offers a place to rest your soul and reflect how great Thou art.
Beautiful structure, but very crowded. The Cathedral is located within the castle walls. It is beautiful, although somewhat similar to most other Cathedrals in Europe.
Free church. We nipped in for a gawp at the stained glass and this is still a free visit if you are content with a nip in/ nip out. The windows are magnificent.
St Vitus. Oh my what a site this cathedral is absolutely stunning. The walk is a steep one but my it is well worth it. The view is a also stunning . This cathedral is a must when you visit Prague

Gothic Wonder. This wonderful gothic cathedral is located with in the castle grounds and is well worth the walk. Stunning to look at from the outside and equally as impressive inside with its beautiful stained glass windows . Only downside is if you don't buy a ticket you can't look all the way around inside.

Exciting Architecture!. Where will you ever see anything like this Cathedral? This is beyond words, truly. Each historical place we went seemed even more decorative then the one before it. Prague is an exciting place and it takes time to see it. The tours are great, and to really take it all in a tour is the way to go. Make sure you have plenty of time to enjoy the Castle as everything you see makes you want to spend even more time.
Stunning. Well visited cathedral with much history. Best to get an audio guide. Very busy and lots of tourists, but worth visiting.

Tremendous building. The Cathedral is surrounded by the castle walls. Looks magnificent, but needs cleaning. Some walls are very dirty. The St. Stephen's Cathedral in Vienna, for example looks much better after such cleaning.Try walking up there, it brings more fun afterwards :)

Vitus Church. The only reason to pay a visit this cathedral is to see beautifully restored tomb and chapel of Prince Wenceslas. Otherwise not much different to other cathedral's around the world. You can enter the first part for free but to look around you pay for a castle ticket. Make sure you get one for the areas you want to see and if you want to take pictures there is an extra ticket payment for this too.
beautifull. This is one of the most beautifull cathedrals in Prague. Only disadvantage is that it's always so full.
Stunning Catherdral. Situated inside the castle walls this cathedral is in stunning condition and beautiful. Well worth a visit.

Magnificent. What an astonishing place this is, steeped in history and holding the bodies of ex arch bishops of prague, as you enter the cathedral it has the wow factor, with domed massive roof, huge stained glass windows and lots of other fantastic decor this is a must on any visit to prague, it would take too long to describe it fully, go see for yourself yoy wont be dissapointed.

fab. God the windows in this church are amazing,I was there and it was snowing ,breathtaking,inside amazing as a previous review states , take good walking shoes and enjoy this beautiful city or just sit in or outside a cafe with a hot drink or beer and watch the world go by.please watch those mini cab drivers ,they will do you!!! But enjoy this city charles bridge to die for .enjoy,English widely spoken remember the bohemian dumplings
View from the top!. While there are over 266 tightly spiraling stone steps, no handrails to the top, the view is outstanding, in all directions.
Amazing church!. This church is really beautiful, especially the stained glass. We enjoyed our little walk-around, and the walk there was completely worth it. I recommend it!

Lovely but no real gem here.. I think this Cathedral falls into my "just another cathedral" category. It is a beautiful structure, magnificently built on a wonderful spot. I always travel to important cathedrals and basilicas, however, this one left me flat. I found nothing of really great significance here.

Most beautiful stained glass windows I've ever seen!!. You can skip the Royal Castle in Prague, but don't miss the cathedral -- one gorgeous stained glass window after another! One of the best ones was done by Mucha, the brilliant Art Nouveau artist of the Czech Republic!
Beautiful Cathedral. One of the most impressive cathedrals, built in the Gothic style, decorated with stained glass windows.

Beautiful church. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited, and I have come across a few. But try to be there as early as possible, since it is a very popular tourist attraction. I was there between 8 and 9 am, and that was perfect. I only had to wait for a few minutes to get inside, and once inside there was silence, and not so many tourists. And as an extra bonus, the sun came in through one of the glass windows, making it shine like a jewel of many colours. And next to it, on the wall which was covered in mosaics, the sun also made an unforgettable image of light, dancing and sparkling. It was amazing. I'm so glad I came early in the morning. I visited once again in the afternoon with two of my friends, but it was not the same experience. Although still beautiful.

The windows to heaven!. With the sunlight shining through the magnificent windows, this church will take your breath away. I was further amazed at the craftsmanship of builders decades before we found it necessary for computers to run our lives.
Very impressive cathedral. A must see. Costs a bit to get in, but I think it's worth it to see such history up close. Wear good shoes, the castle area is so big and there's so much to see.
Unforgettable Glorious Glass-Stained Windows adorn this church. There are many churches in Prague, but this Church probably has the best collection of glass-stained windows.
Awesome. Feeling incredible getting inside. I recommend to go to the Castle on the first morning so there is less people.It is better to see this jewel as quite as possible.

Stunning. One of the most incredible religious structures I've ever seen. This looks like it's been designed by a thousand Michelangelos !! You have to see it to believe it, get plenty of photos but make sure your flash is off to avoid breaking rules.

Outstanding Stained Glass. This incredibly beautiful cathedral is worth flying to Europe for. The stained glass is out of control. The ambience is magic. It looks like a video game inside, at least the video games I play ;) I LOVED IT!

Get you ticket and line-up. This attraction is justly popular. Interesting to see the old part and how it is married up to the newer part. Also the plainer new part versus the more ornate older part.. Line can be long but moves reasonably fast. Get a ticket from the office across the courtyard and this covers multiple attractions and isn't expensive.
Beautiful windows!. Easily worth the trek up the hill. Very beautiful with stunning windows. A must place to visit when staying in Prague.

Absolutely beautiful building. The cathedral is impressive. The inside of the building has much more light than what I was expecting. I imagined it was going to be a dark gloomy place but it’s quite bright and full of light inside. The entrance to the cathedral is tricky. The door location is not evident at all. I walked all around it and finally discovered that the entrance is through an arch in between 2 restaurants. The cathedral closes at 1PM for about 2 hours and pictures are not allowed inside. No entrance fee.
Wait Until the Sun Sets . Then head on to the Cathedral. That is when there are less people, the lights are on and you can just bask in awe. Enjoy.

Really good but... We walked all the way up to the castle and the church but unfortunately it was closed, althought it was friday and just 18.00. So we did not have the chance to explore it. Moreover i found it a bit expensive to pay around 200 crowns, around 8 euros just to go inside

Unmissable. The Cathedral is an exceptional place to see (make sure you climb up indie too). Like a lot of Prague, timing is of the essence, with peak hour (around about the midday change of guard) a terrible time to visit.We arrived at the entrance to the Cathedral at a little after midday and the queues to get into the cathedral were enormous. We decided to head off and see some of the other attractions and come back later. This was a good call, as by about 2pm the queues had cleared and we got straight in.

Stunning!. I love to plan a day of site seeing and I didn't realise this was part of the castle tour until I got the ticket.Tickets can be purchased at Prague castle. St Vitus is included in the short tour - 250 crown (there is a long tour - 350 crown)Wow! doesn't cover it. The entrance is stunning, the stone work is amazing. The stained glass will blow you away and the interior art work is just breath taking. We spent a long time in here as there is so much to look at between plaques, statues, confession booths, pulpits, altars, columns....I could go on. It was busy with tourists and organised guides.
