They get in the way and their constant babble takes over sometimes, but it is worth a visit for the architecture alone. The cathedral is set in the grounds of Prague castle. It dominates the skyline and if you get a chance to see it go. If I had been able to attend a service, or concert their I would have. The organ was immense. Only snag....their is an upper gallery, but it's out of bounds.........but then I'm just nosey!
Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful Cathedral - fabulous stained glass windows - houses crown jewels. Great photo opportunity. Architecture was gothic - but look for the 4 men in suits.

Beautiful but crowded. Everywhere we went (Old Town Square, the Castle, Charles Bridge, St. Vitus Cathedral) there were hordes of tourists, often shoulder to shoulder. We were very uneasy since we had been cautioned about pick pockets in crowded places. Prague is a lovely and interesting city but we will never go back because of the crush of other tourists. The cathedral is majestic. We especially enjoyed seeing the beautiful Mucha window.
Stunning. There are many beautiful churches but this one is not to be missed. The soaring ceilings and colorful stained glass windows set it apart.
Busy, busy ,busy. Time out was needed after a visit here, the squash was just too much. Guide in was very pleasant, guide on the way out not so much

Beautiful. The cathedral has to be one of the highlights of our visit to Prague. The interior is also well worth a visit. The neo gothic, baroque structure is something you just want to keep looking at, very intricate and the history is also very interesting to know.
Beautiful. This was one of the most enchanting piece of history I have ever experienced. The stained glass is magnificent!
Church visits. Another one ticked off out of many to visit. You really get a feel of the past when you go into these places.

Stunning stain glass and St Wenceslas tomb. This cathedral is part of Prague castle and is entered by ticket only. The interior has some magnificent stain glass windows especially when the sun is shining through them. The cathedral also has the tomb of St Wenceslas.Take time to sit and enjoy beautiful surroundings.

An educational tour. At the information center, you buy a ticket around $10 for the surrounding five sites, the beautiful stained glass cathedral, original gothic architecture, medieval prison cell, village street residences, etc. Without the ticket, you can still go into the church to a fenced area and not beyond.

Impressive Cathedral. St. Vitus’ Cathedral towers regally over the other buildings of Prague Castle. This fairytale cathedral, the largest in the Czech Republic, was centuries in the building – as a matter of fact, ten centuries.
Very impressive!. Very impressive inside and out. Be sure to combine a visit to the castle with a visit to this beautiful church.

Majestic!!!. Is a part of Prague castle and lies almost at the centre of it. This place looks absolutely stunning and provides a great backdrop for pictures. The building is very elaborately designed and you can stay here for hours just looking at this marvellous structure. A must visit for everyone.
Classic cathedral. Very nicely done cathedral with fantastic statues, paintings and all the other attributes a cathedral should have.

Simply beautiful . Amazing from both inside and outside. The stained glass from the inside are beautiful and the architecture from the outside is my favourite kind. Not much crowded during this time of year
St. Vitus Cathedral. Amazing Gotic architecture decorated with frescoes and semi-precious stones. You can climb the tower- 287 steps, but the views are worth the effort.

Beautiful. This church is at the castle. We have been there on two different trips but have never gone inside. It is structurally beautiful and you need to make sure you walk around to the back for a totally different view. This is not to be missed.
Great historic place. You should visit and take the guided tour. You get to know the details and the cathedral is impressive.

dont be scared of the crowds.. A real must in Prague, an important part of the Prague castle and a wonderful example of gothic style. it has gone through a lot of wars and fires but the oldest part, six hundred years old still standing .The stainglass windows are different example of modern takes on the old themes
Gorgeous building worth visiting. Definitely one to buy a ticket for, and go inside. Enjoy the whole experience that the castle has to offer

colourful windows. The first time I went there, I did not get in to it, because maintainance. This time I got in to it, amazing.
Colourful windows, really beautiful. I am so bad at European history expecially the religion history, but it still impressed me.

Beautiful - go early. We went early so that we knew we could see this without a huge crowd since this was one of the highlights we wanted to see in the castle quarter. The line going in moved quickly. There is a section in the back you can stand in and see the entire church if you do not pay to get up close to the alter. If you pay additional money, you can go through the turnstiles to the left to get closer to the alter. You can take pictures in here but you cannot use a flash. Please remember that when it is all said and done, this is a church and that silence should be observed. Many seemed to forget this!Either before or after checking out the church, make sure to wander around the exterior of it. The gargoyles are interesting.

Amazing and gigantic cathedral that is a must see!. If you want to see one of the largest and possibly most beautify cathedrals on the grounds of the Prague Castle, I highly recommend you take this tour and experience this churches natural beauty and history for yourself.

Well worth the Tram Ride up the Hill. Took the tram up the hill to the castle and Cathedral and were not dissapointed. From the side it is difficult not to think "Hogwarts" but close up you realise the splendor of a cathedral that took 600 years to complete. The modern stained glass windows fit well with the gothic design.
Allow 2 hours to do this justice.

Absolutely breathtaking. A must see in Prague, although if you are touring Prague you'd have to try hard to miss this. The St. Vitus Cathedral is beautifully ornate. Quite awe-inspiring. A photographer's dream, and the devil's nightmare as there are many very viscous looking gargoyle/guardians carved at the top. Beautiful from every angle.

Splendid gothic castle. The castle is really splendid with its appearance during the evening and night. Perfect time to visit would be in the evening just before the sun sets as you have a chance to see the castle during evening and after sun set with the lights turned on. Also you have a nice view of the city and charles bridge from the castle view point.If you visit prague, the castle is a must see. !!!

Hard to see. The cathedral is in a confined area which makes it difficult to appreciate its structural qualities. Additionally, we were discouraged from going inside because it was so crowded with tourists.
Very impressive. One of the most beautiful and impressive cathedrals I've ever visited. Absolutely recommended, and a must see in Prague.

Beautiful Cathedral at Prague Castle. St. Vitus Cathedral is beautiful from the outside, a great example of gothic architecture with some unique elements. And the stained glass is beautiful from the inside.

Imposing Cathedral. I walked aimlessly about town until I found my way up to the castle and St Vitus Cathedral, it definitely evokes awe when you see it up close, a true gem of architecture in a city full of gems. Once inside you are spellbound at the grandeur. Not to be missed if you like Cathedrals.
Nice Cathedral. Really very interensting an a unique of rich details an architecture art handmade love to see the details! I being 2 times Prague and always go this place that is the best city view.
Stunning architecture. I would advise to purchase a ticket to go inside the cathedral as the part that is available to everyone is always busy as a lot of people want to take pictures.

Beautiful cathedral. We made our was to this cathedral on our Segway. Tour, we dismounted and had a wander around on foot. Beautiful example to architecture, so many stone statue and intricate wall carvings. Also a great view of the city don't forget to bring your camera for some amazing s photo opertunities

Too Crowded, but Mucha Window & Last Judgment Mosaic Worth It. There are just too many tourists and tour groups to make this a pleasant visit. It could be better with an earlier opening, say at 7 or 8 AM. But 9 AM it is, and long before then people are lined up waiting, so it isn't easy to get in ahead of the crowd. That said, a chance to see Alphonse Mucha's magnificent St. Wenceslas window shouldn't be passed up. In other words, when push comes to shove -- literally! -- it's worth a visit if only to see the justly-famous stained glass. And there are other rewarding sights, assuming you can get to them. The 14th century mosaic of the Last Judgment, recently conserved by the Getty Foundation, would probably be foremost among them. But such things to my mind are best seen in the more tranquil, more devotional atmosphere that you'd think would characterize a house of worship. While worth engaging in hand-to-hand (or camera-to-camera) tourist conflict to get a good view of precious works of art like these, the experience at St. Vitus Cathdral left a lot to be desired.I don't have an answer to the problem of "too much of a good thing." All I can say is that visiting any time during Prague's extended tourist season has challenges that you will need to overcome if you are to enjoy your visit and accomplish your purposes in visiting.

Unique Stained Glass. Wonderful stained glass windows. More modern than many cathedrals. The Mucha window is a marvel. Free to get in the back of the Cathedral but a ticket is needed to get into the front and really get up to the stained glass and other art. Also this is one of a few sites in the Prague Castle Complex that requires a fee to take pictures. This was the only place where they asked to see my receipt that I had paid the fee. It was worth the money just for the pictures I got here.
Cathedral and Castle. Fascinating history and architecture. Make sure you get the audio guide for any tour you take - make the entire experience so much better.

"Free" is misleading. Our visit this year was a third return-after a four year gap. The "new" series of pass ticket packages in quite complex and comprehensive. The cathedral is technically 'free' to enter. But, you are confined to the very rear and prevented from seeing more than a slice of the great Mucha Slavic theme stained glass window. I felt cheated since this is a change since our last visit. The cathedral is of course stunning and historic but definitely not 'free' to the tourist.

Beautiful Cathedral. This beautiful building overlooks the city of Prague on the hillside surrounded by the old walls of the castle compound. The intricacy of the architecture is really something to be admired and often when I look at these kind of buildings I get transported back to what a wonderment this must have been back in the day. It really makes a good focus point when looking at the view on the Charles Bridge.

Stunning & Somewhat Overwhelming!. When first encountering this immense Cathedral, it captivates you with its size and splendor. Photos can hardly do it justice either outside or in. Large groups of tours fill up the square and the vestibule by mid morning so it is best to try to be here by 9:00 before they arrive. This gives you a better opportunity to soak in the beauty of this grand church. If you aren't into the steep climb, take tram #22 and get off near the top of the hill.
Historical church. The church is worth taking a few moments out to see. The building is beautifully preserved and the detail is spectacular.
The Jitters. St Vitus, the original dancer is allegedly buried here. The huge cathedral is a place of tranquility and stands in the centre of the entertainment district
Impressive!!. Unfortunally it was closed, but the architecture and the setting itself is quite impressive... you can access to the tower however and have a good look at the massive castle!

A Church With Many Names. Officially named St. Vitus, St. Wenceslas, St Adalbert Cathedral, the Gothic St. Vitus Cathedral (Katedrála svatého Víta) was the site for Czech kings and queens and took six centuries to complete. While it is part of the Prague castle complex, its structure dominates the skyline of Prague. Charles IV began the construction of the cathedral in 1344. St. Vitus is the spiritual symbol of the Czech state but only about 2% of Czechs practice their religion. Inside the cathedral are the tomb of St. Wenceslas and the Crown Jewels. The Cathedral is the seat of the Archbishop. The cathedral’s main tower has a double lantern dome and bears the coat of arms of the Bohemian Kingdom. The clock tower, the tallest of the cathedral's towers, reaches a height of 317 feet. While most of the cathedral is in the Gothic style, the upper part of the tower is in Renaissance-style and topped by a Baroque dome. You will not be disappointed!
Beautiful cathedral. This cathedral is beautiful and certainly should not be missed on your trip. Unfortunately it was extremely busy when I visited and I would like to return when it is quieter.

Stunning Cathedral. The St. Vitus Cathedral is a must-see when in Prague. We paid the extra money to hike up the tower to get a spectacular view of the city. Be warned, the hike up the tower isn't for the faint of heart - there are nearly 300 steps that rotate in a tight circle. Be prepared to take breaks and hold onto the walls to avoid dizziness. But don't worry, when you hit the top it's completely worth it!
a must see. We happened by St. Vitus on a Sunday and mass was in progress. I am not Catholic but I walked in and was overwhelmed by the beauty.

Fantastic stained galss. Visited here with my wife during a short city break. The catherdaral is behind the Prague castle and we were blown away by the fantastic stained glass windows and architecture. Only negative is that it is very crowded, paerticularly by large crwods of walking tours that are present pretty mkuch everywhere in Prague. If you are in Prague this is a must see.
Beautiful!. This is a phenomenal building and anyone looking to visit sacred, historic places shouldn't miss this one.
Nice stained glass.. I think I've seen one too many cathedrals. Tha crowds inside were massive. Time would have been better spent elsewhere, but we were on a Viking tour.

Wonderful stained glass windows. Part of the Castle complex this wonderful old cathedral is a must to visit, Helpful to have a guide to give you the history and to stop at various points of interest. There are some wonderful stained glass windows but do not overlook the Mucha window and if you have not already done so then do visit the Mucha gallery which is very close to Wenceslas square.We joined a tour to visit and arrived here by coach but you can catch a 22 tram which takes you close. The tour combines with a visit to the castle and Golden lane which has shops and small museum shops.

I love cathedrals . Cathedrals are one of my favorite things to see when in a new city or old city and this one is no exception. I was quite enthralled with it and frankly it's not hard to impress me when it comes to old cathedrals that harken to days past. To me they are a testament to what man can accomplish and sometimes it feels good to be reminded of how exceptional mankind can be, through architecture
Nice church. A nice big church. It is located on the old city. Just near the square. U can explore othet touristic places along with it. Very easy to find.

The Most Impressive Building in Prague. Definately the St. Vitus Cathedral is the most imponent and beautiful building in Prague. The only flaw is that the Cathedral's fassade is too close to the Castle wall... so i'ts very difficult to take pictures of the whole building.

Stunning. I'm not religious but I love looking round churches/cathedrals and this has to be one of the most gorgeous cathedrals I've ever seen. Better than Notre Dame or the Duomo in Florence in my opinion. Fabulous stained glass everywhere and if you can overlook the hundreds of tourists (I'm looking at you Japanese!) it's a great start to the castle experience
A work of art both inside and out.. It is quite a trek to reach it but well worth the climb! The building's design is beautiful and the stained-glass windows are exceptional.
Wow!. Beautiful! A lovely church and a big part of the area's history. I am told theire is a great view from up top but I did not make the climb

The old cathedrals are always impressive to visit. A beautiful old Cathedral with its impressive architecture. Its of course one of the signature Prague sight seeing stops and of course worth the visit. If you happen to go out to Kutna Hora, kind of intersting to compare St Vitus to St Barbara Cathedral which was sort of competing with St Vitus for attention.

St. Vitus Cathedral Is Like A Twin To Notre Dame In Paris. If you have seen Notre Dame Church in Paris then it is like a twin sister to St Vitus Church that is across from the Prague Castle. It is a beautiful gothic church and well appointed in the Castle District. Try to take a look at the gargoyles that is trying to scare the evil spirits away. It has been well preserved and is a welcoming place to visit. We did take photos here. I say this because some of the places in Prague will not allow you to take pictures. Boo on them!

An interesting combination of ,medieval and 1880s. The church, for this interested in architecture, raises an interesting point — namely, is it gothic REVIVAL or just Gothic SURVIVAL, since the architects very carefully reproduced the original details on the 14C part of the building. St. Vitus is a very busy tourist site, and the authorities have handled it in a very weird way: one can enter the cathedral, see the altar, and some of the 19C stained glass but one cannot fully enter the building without paying, but the tickets is obtained outside the cathedral in the nearby tourist office and costs around $10. I was with a tour, and by the time I figured this out, I no longer had time to see the cathedral. The best sight of St. Vitus and the surrounding castle, however, is free and at night. The art museums in Prague, particularly the one for 19-20C art and design is worth more of one's time.

Breathtaking. This building is located at the very top end of Prague and is easily accessible by tram or bus, it is set amid the grounds of the palace and is definitely one I would recommend for the more cultured and the history buffs, it provides exceptional photos, to gain entry it is around 400Czk which is about £10.00 I didn't go in as I was pushed for time but I can surmise it would have been beautiful inside as out.

Beautiful Cathedral. This large and beautiful cathedral is located inside the Prague Castle complex and it is the dominating structure there. You cannot miss seeing it when inside the castle complex. Combine this visit with the visit to Castle. A must see.

Beautiful!. The windows are amazing, especially the one by the artist Alphonse Mucha. I believe you can only visit the Cathedral with a combined ticket for Prague Castle. The Castle, Cathedral and the Golden Lane are well worth the ticket price and the views of the city are beautiful from there. Easy walk from there down to Charles Bridge and the city center.

Amazing Cathedral, pitty it is now just a place for tourists. Upon stepping into this amazing church a man stopped us and said, sorry visiting hours are on hold because mass will be starting soon, being a Catholic I told the gentleman that it was ok with me because I would like to participate in the service. When my family walked in we were all over whelmed with the beauty of this magnificent Cathedral, the service was beautiful, and we were glad to have had the exp. The sad part was that there were only 20 people there for the service, I am not kidding, a place that could hold 1,000 Prague cathedral evening service, a beauty to behold and it was empty of actual practicing Catholics, as many as such in Europe churches are becoming places of tourist visits... nothing more
Gem on the hill. One of the most beautiful, if not the most beautiful church I´ve ever seen. A huge piece of history and hard work behind...Walk the stairs to the tower for an amazing view!!!!
An absolute must go!. When I saw how freaking huge this cathedral is I literally wowed... Inside it is full of insanely crafted old christian paintings, sculptures, chandeliers etc.
Beautiful Cathedral. This lovely Cathedral is a must see if visiting Prague. The stained glass windows are beautiful as is all the ornate statues. It can be very crowded so go early.

Beautiful Cathedral. Set amongst elegant surroundings and the most amazing scenery this cathedral is easily accessible. You can Enter free and admire some of the stunning stained glass windows. However to access all of the Cathedral there is a fee.

We Didn't get Inside, But.... We were there on a Sunday, during a Mass, so were not allowed inside. Could have waited an hour or more to get in after, but did not have the time. The cathedral itself is breathtaking, tho. Fantastic architecture, great upper gargoyles, golden mosaic front piece. A classic, very sorry we could not see the interior.

Takes your breath away. This cathedral is incredible. There are special features everywhere, from the gorgeous windows to all the beautiful altars. It is well worth taking a tour with a guide so that you can learn first-hand about all you are seeing. Without it, you will miss a lot and not fully appreciate all that is there. This cathedral is the true gem for this castle complex.
Take a complete tour. The entrance to this cathedral is free up to about 20-25 metres inside it, but it`s worth buying a ticket (combined with the castle) because every inch of it is amazing.

Nice. Yes it's nice, yes it's ancient, my advice, save your 20 quid, stay at the free top end and get some pictures from there. It's a bit of a money making venture, the ticket pricing is a bit confusing too.
Just beautiful!. Beautiful church and great view! You can't go to Prague without going here! So much history. The side entrance has beautiful mosaics as it used to be the main entrance.

Top cathedral I've seen!. St. Vitus is one of the most amazing cathedrals that I've ever seen!Although it is pricey, I do recommend the audio tour. You will understand so much more about what you're seeing! Budget around $15, I think it was. You can buy the pass to see multiple exhibits, and the audio tour works for all of them. The stained glass and sculptures are gorgeous. I went at around 2pm on a cloudy day, and the light was still just beautiful. Free entrance with the Prague card - it makes it more convenient to see a lot of sights and take trams, but it may not save a significant amount of money at the end of the day. They raised the price to around 1200 CZK ($60 or so).

Beautiful stained glass. This Cathedral can be visited as part of the Prague Castle ticket. The line was pretty long because it was only open for a limited time that day, but it moved pretty quick. It was very beautiful on the inside, the stained glass windows were amazing, definitely my favorite part.There was a bit too much selfie taking going on inside, which I find a little strange, but I understand that's what goes on at all tourist spots now. I wish they would ban selfie sticks though because it takes up too much space and makes it difficult to move around when you get so many people in small walkways.

Beautiful architecture. This Gothic cathedral is located within Prague Castle which is perched atop the hill overlooking the city.As a non-Christian, I can only comment on the aesthetics of this cathedral. The architecture is stunning. The exterior is extremely detailed & very impressive, especially the gargoyles. The stained-glass windows are fabulously beautiful.
Very beautiful. The Cathedral is very beautiful and remind us the Notre Dame.It's inside the Prague Castle and is one of the attractions to visit.

Pay to pray: there is a steep admission charge to enter this church. At the entrance to this Cathedral there are turn-styles similar to the NYC subway. You must have bought a ticket to be scanned by the turn-style to enter this Cathedral. I find this practice distasteful.

Cannot be missed with a visit to Prague. Definitely one of the most impressive cathedrals in the world. Make sure to come early and take in the whole experience of Prague castle as the walk up is particularly taxing and I had to come twice to see everything, which could have been avoided coming earlier.
Panoramic views from the top. Magnificent cathedral at the centre of Prague castle...Climb the 287 spiral steps to the top of the tower for 150czs and get he best views in Prague.
Beautiful gothic cathedral. Beautiful gothic cathedral situated on palace ground. I recomend going in the tower. The view is spectacular.
Beautiful!!. This magnificent cathedral is up there with the best in terms of the beauty and historical importance. Towers are almost 100 meters high!
St. Vitus visit. Beautiful old church on palace grounds. Part of a city tour taken and well worth the visit. Don't miss.

Magnficent. Gothic beauty from the outside and the inside is even more beautiful. Would recommend a tour. I also think it might be an interesting sight in the dark (not sure). Extra: There is a similar church in Kutna Hora, it is called St.Barbara's cathedral. Its designer was inspired by Peter Parler; designer of St.Vitus. You might want to check it out cause its a bit different, still beautiful and far less crowded (if a crowd is not your thing).

Great sense of history. Amazing place, took 600 years to finished though! Just don't visit on a Saturday around midday, everyone and his dog will be there to see the changing of the guard. Fantastic buildings, palaces from their monarchy days

Nothing special, not worth paying it.. Yet another cathedral and not much different than any other cathedrals you see in Europe. you need to pay if you want to see the whole place. The staff at entry and exit points are rude and if you dont realise that you should be a ticket holder to be able to go to different parts of the cathedral, the staff will whistle at you like a dog or even poke you.If they really want to charge for a cathedral, first of all, they need to make sure they clearly sing entry and exit points and train their staff properly.

Amazing cathedral, with great view from the clocktower. Very nice looking cathedral, with spectacular looking, both outside and inside. Also, even many, the steps to the top of the clock tower is absolutely worth a visit.
stunning. just stunning! An amazing place. The whole city is amazing and I know how Disney got their inspiration from!

GO really EARLY or LATE. It's loaded with tour groups so go early or late. You can spend loads of time there in and around grounds. We went in the late afternoon - evening which was fabulous due to decrease in crowds as it is a very popular tourist location. The Golden Lane is free after 5.
Great building. Amazing building. We did not go in as the lines to get a ticket were just too long but you can walk around with no problem.
Awe Inspiring. We weren't sure wether to pay the extra entrance to have a proper look around . It was an incredible cathedral , just stunning.
Beautiful. This cathedral is probably the most impressive I have visited, both for its architecture and also for its stunningly beautiful stained glass windows.

Great Architecture. I like to observe Architecture and this was a satisfying visit. This Cathedral is inside the Prague castle. The castle gives a good view of the city. Inside the Cathedral is some great coloured-glass work.
Castle and cathedral. Steepest walk to get to but absolutely stunning place to visit view of Prague was breathtaking. Stout pair of walking shoes required
A Must-See. A must-see, but overrun with tourists. Poor signage, so bring a really good guidebook unless you're part of a tour group. Tomb of St. John Nepomuk sums up the Counter-Reformation.
Impressive.. Impressive Cathedral.Very much I wanted to see the King Vaclav grave sites and finally saw it and all the rest. This catedral must to see!

Views. Hradcany Castle Palace and St Vitus Cathedral, huge and beautiful within the courtyard of the palace. The views from here of the city and the Charles Bridge are spectacular. Only downside was crowds but it is a must see.

Stunning!. One of the most beautiful, complete with tombs of St. Vitus,, St. John of Nepomuk, painted (not stained) glass window of St. Wenceslas by Czech artist Alfons Mucha and The Royal Mausoleum. An easy ride using tram 22.

St. vitus. Pretty spectacular, if you are there on a Sunday and Catholic consider going to Mass as you will be there with a few others and hear the organ. Later when the tourists are allowed in its packed with people and you won't get the true feeling the place
Beautiful Catedral in Prague. This catedral is in the Prague Castle area. It is beautiful and impressive. It is a another place we can not miss in Prague.

St. Vitus Cathedral. This is a beautiful cathedral, but you can only go up the North Tower, not into the main body of the cathedral which is rather dissapointing .The tower however (at a modest entrance fee) is good (287 steps !) with a great view and included is a memorial coin (good ,not tacky).

Nice. Beautiful Architecture. Looks amazing overlooking the city. Beautifully lit at night.
Queues to get in were very long so we didn't bother as there was no where to sit and having a problem with mobility this was an issue..
Stunning. Not to be missed this cathedral is absolutely stunning and well worth a visit . There is an entry charge we bought a short ticket which is ample to see the best four sights
Amazing church. Amazing church. It's free and worth the visit. You can walk pretty far into the church without paying. You can also take pictures.
Worth to see. Worth to see this great example of gothic architecture church & the most important cathedral in Czech Republic.

Prague Castle Tour. The Cathedral was part of the Prague castle tour. The history in the cathedral is awe inspiring. It can get very busy here with a number of organised tours but this is a "must do" if you are in Prague
very impressive . the bilding is very beautiful from outside, unfortunately we didn't get the chance to go in. it was supposed to be open until 6PM, we came at 5PM and it was closed.

Visit it at night!. We took a night tour up to the castle and cathedral. By doing this we were not able to go inside the cathedral but it was worth it since the lighting at night was spectacular. I would definitely recommend visiting the cathedral at night. There were maybe a handful of people up there at night and it seems that many of them were locals just taking a stroll. The grounds are open until midnight so you can just soak up the history on your own.

Do not miss this. This is the highlight you cannot miss in Prague. We took the tram #22 up to the monastery stop and then walked down to the castle and cathedral. The ticket options include various sites within the castle complex so you can buy your combo ticket at any of the sites. You do not have to stand in line at the main ticket booth. The cathedral will make much more sense if you study up a little on the history of the place.
Lovely building. beautiful by night..enjoyed it. Didn't pay to get in just looked at the building outside, was amazing both the day and night views..
The issue with limited opening hours. I think I wasted my money on this as there are only three hours opening time with so many people. I didn't even managed to get in.
Needs light. Wonderful place to visit, however the crowd and the lack of light inside for a better visibility are serious drawbacks of this important point of interest in Prague.

Fantastic, Imposing Cathedral. Had to queue for a little while but well worth the wait. Walked through small tunnel and as you come out the other side you are greetng by this wonderful imposing building.Beautiful inside, if your going to Prague this is a must see

good tactics for visit at busy times. We did the castle, Golden Lane and cathedral on a sunny Saturday, so everything was busy. It was a bit of a scrum when we went to the cathedral, so we did Golden Lane first and then went back - much better

A cathedral like so many others. If at the beginning of a trip and you haven't seen many cathedrals, this one would be in impressive. To me, it was nothing special and I don't think I'd pay the admission fee to go all the way in. Stick to the part you can visit for free. There are many more impressive and ornate cathedrals in Europe.

serenity and divine atmosphere swept off by hordes of visitors. Much as this cathedral is one of the most beautiful in Prague, its perpetual state of being crowded diminished the visitor experience for me. People lining up even in front of it, photographers surrounding it trying to get the best angle shot, and lots of visitors inside.Since my last visit couple of years ago, they even installed a "turniket" - a ramp marking the entrance to the paid area with guards around it.This takes away the sensation of religious peace and serenity, and turns St. Vitus Cathedral into another crowded, monetized landmark.The details on the walls and coluns on the inside and outside part of it are worth observing, so do take time to take a look to take it in and notice the beautiful gothic piece of art.

The tower is worth a visit.. Impressive cathedral with lots of old artifacts and painted glass windows. The tower gives an excellent view of the entire city. However, the stairs can be a bit strenuous - not for the feint. The cathedral itself is worth a visit, and there are two options. You can enter the main hall for free and just see the inside of the cathedral (recommended), or you can buy a ticket for several attraction in the castle area, which allows you to come inside and see all the details. For me personally, this was not really worth the money.
Worth seeing. Amazing stain glass windows to be seen here. As with all Cathedrals in Europe this is stunning. I loved the outside of this building

top site in Prague. on the top of my MUST SEE places in Prague! Be sure you read the history behind the cathedral or go with a guide. The tomb of St. wenseslas is wonderful - but you have to know what you are looking at! Go early in the day and miss the crowds - no air conditioning and it can get crowded.

Impressive and majestic. St. Vitus Cathedral is the "gate" to Prague Castle, and what an impressive gate it is. You will feel dwarfed not only by the dimensions of the building, but by the art and history it contains. Even non believers walk around the halls in sheer awe. Well worth the visit.

St Wenceslas's chapel is a real draw.... We visited as part of an Imperial City tour organised by Rail Discoveries of York. St. Vitus Cathedral is a Gothic masterpiece, and full of beautiful stained glass windows. The tomb of St Vitus and St. Wenceslas chapel are a real draw. Definitely worth a visit. It is free for visitors to enter the first part of St. Vitus Cathedral. A ticket must be purchased to visit the whole cathedral.

Uplifting Splendor. The morning views with the sun coming in the windows are hard to describe, the colors and rays on the columns are phenomenal. Very moving, the wonder and splendor of the cathedral are as great as it's size.

Astounding interior, frightlingly gothic ecterior, and then brandy and apple strudle in the castle cafe!. I don't like wandering round old piles of rock, but the cathedral of St Vitus in Prague Castle grounds is well worth a visit. You can walk right round and go up into the balcony to view the interior from above. Whist there did you know that in the adjacent Chapel of St George there are classical concerts, or that the "Golden Lane" in the same grounds has reconstructed artisan shops depicting live a couple of centuries ago, sort of walk-up-museum-behind glass ? Wrap up well if walking around or taking in a concert, it can be very cold in the off season and the Chapel is not heated, but the music superb, even the 1st violin arrived in leathers and a cap which he only took off to play, ok so he did wear a tux underneath lol! When you have done this lot, over to the castle cafe, as I said brandy and apple strudel finishes the morning off nicely. Trams run there and back from Prague, or just across Charles Bridge is where they pick up.
The clock with two parts. We only managed to see the exterior but have seen the interior on a dvd. It is visible from nearly anywhere in the centre of the city

The main attraction of Prague Castle. This is a roman Catholic cathedral and is the main attraction of Prague Castle. It is an example of the best Gothic architecture. Inside it has rich carvings and beautiful stained glass windows. The altar is richly decorated.
It is worth a visit.

Beautiful church. Having visited many of the churches in Italy and France we were pleasantly surprised by the internal ornamentation of churches in this part of the world (Prague and Budapest). The St. Vitus church like many other churches has a lot of history (best to learn on your walking tour of the Castle District). The most striking feature of this church which you probably won't see in many others is the advertisement of the firms that sponsored some of the internal construction and decoration when the state ran out of money. The church belongs to the state (rare situation) and has a free section and then a paid section (the state and the church went to war over possession and that led to empty coffers). A must do on your trip to Caslte Distric.

St. Vitus. St. Vitus is awesome, huge, wow!!! Go early, 9:00AM, because it gets very crowded, but make sure you go. We stood inside with our mouths open, imagining how this was ever built. Such detail, it's amazing.
The amazing St Vitus. By day a lot of tourists, but you get to see the light through the glass-paintings. By night - uplighted and amazing, and you wil also get a fantastic view of the city by night!

Pick your time to visit. Depending upon how much time you have in Prague you should try to put aside a full day to visit Prague castle which incorporates St. Vitus Cathedral. A four location pass available for one day includes the cathedral but a seven location pass covering two days is the better option.The Cathedral itself is magnificent and beautifully restored. However it always appears crowded so an early start is recommended.

Sunset rewards visitors with stained glass lighting. We didn't plan on arriving in late afternoon, but on a sunny day, the light streaming in through the west stained glass in the tower was amazing. Very crowded late in the day, but don't miss the excellent gargoyles and other creatures on the outside of the cathedral. Free to visit the main entrance, but there is a charge to go into the knaves and upstairs. We didn't do that this time...
Enchanting cathedral.. Very nice cathedral, huge and enchanting! It is a part of the Prague Castle. One of the landmarks of Prague.
Love the gargoyles!. Beautiful architecture, stained glass and quirky gargoyles. Very busy spot - touristy. Expensive spot for a snack. Nice gift shop.

Fabulous but pick your time when there are less people.. There is absolutely no doubt that this is an amazing cathedral. Enjoy the outside! The inside is amazing but on our visit there were just too many people. Cameras were everywhere. You could hardly see a thing and tour groups just stopped in the middle to give commentaries. We were pleased to get out, perhaps if there had been less people we could have appreciated it a lot more.

Fabulous but pick your time when there are less people.. There is absolutely no doubt that this is an amazing cathedral. Enjoy the outside! The inside is amazing but on our visit there were just too many people. Cameras were everywhere. You could hardly see a thing and tour groups just stopped in the middle to give commentaries. We were pleased to get out, perhaps if there had been less people we could have appreciated it a lot more.

The "don't miss" part of a visit to Prague Castle. Make sure you visit Prague Castle at a time and day when it's possible to enter the gorgeous St. Vitus Cathedral. Try to attend a concert here if you can.
Main attraction in the castle. I love the wow factor when entering the cathedrals of Europe and this one is no different. Try to visit in the afternoon when the tour groups are fewer.
So beautiful. Wasn't sure where to buy the tickets for it so we just ended up walking around it and got a little peak inside

A must to see. This place is great. You must see it if you are in Prague. Be prepared to walk as it is huge from inside. It overlooks the whole city as it is located almost in the highest spot of Prague. They have different levels for tickets which will allow you access certain places inside the Cathedral. You can see the main building which amazing and very architectural detailed. Then you can continue walking to see the rest of places. Make sure to be available in the main square at 12 midday to watch the show by the soldiers there.

beautiful. Beautiful, reminding you of Notre dame. Did not go inside of it. But from the outside it is Big and gorgeous, could be breathtaking if you haven´t seen big and decorated buildings before. After the first experience of building like this they all seems similar.

Beautiful , can get crowded. This is a beautiful church. But if you are like me and like to it on your own...not so good. You can get into the church hut you are corralled in on pretty small area...unless you purchase a ticket. It's just a me thing.....I should not have to go into a church. So if you want to really see it you need to purchase a ticket! :-(

Gorgeous details. better than photos to see the intricate details of this location; it was quite crowded and our tour had a time limit, but I definitely could have spent more time here as it is a feast for the eyes.

Free entry - but only so far....................... Get the the cathedral which is within Prague castle compound via the number 22 tram from Prague town (get off at Pradsky hrad stop). Note that you can enter the cathedral FREE although only for a few metres - to stand behind a barrier to view the nave. To go further you need to have purchased one of the entry tickets giving access to this and other parts of the castle. If you do buy the pass (and note that there are discounts available for seniors etc) then you can go further and get closer to some of the magnificent stained glass. St Vitus cathedral is by far the best "attraction" within the Prague Castle compound.

Heart of the Czech nation. A must-visit when in Prague. Wenceslas chapel is the central focus historically. Would benefit from some foreign language translation on some of the other features and artefacts. Otherwise you need a guide or audio tour to make sense of it. Allow a good hour or more.

St Vitus-A Grand Cathedral. So much history surrounds this castle it would be impossible to get your head around it in one visit,we decided to do the "B" tour that gets you into St Vitus,the old Royal Palace,the Basilica and Golden Lane as it was our last day and could only spend a few hours here.The cathedral is a magnificent beautiful wonder,and its no wonder it took so long to finish.Inside the stain glass windows and altar must be seen to be admired.Very ornate furnishings and plenty of photo opportunities if you are that way inclined,most people seemed to be doing this without actually appreciating the cathedral itself.I would advise taking a few photographs but generally just breath in the place and the history.Be early to avoid the crowds(9am) or later when the crowds are dwindling(2pm).
good choose. you will see what is reachable only in dream . a unique design and holly ambiance with beautiful surrounding . it is really a good choose for an exiting trip

A church hidden behind houses.. It's the only cathedral I have seen whose entrance is accessible via a passage between two buildings that had been previously built in Old Town Square. Very nice gothic interior.

Historic Cathedral. This is a historic cathedral with interesting architectural details. I took a tour so I would not miss information about the cathedral. It was worth it. It revealed a great deal about Czech history.

The key attraction in the castle. Joined the line as soon as the cathedral opened. Stayed in line for 30 min to get in. I had an audio guide. It was quite helpful (especially to pass the time in line), but the information is largely available repeated on the notes next to the attractions.
Beautiful. Had a great explore of this attractive Cathedral. The tower was narrow but worth the view at the top. The climb is not for the claustrophobic!
Beautiful church. One of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen. Stunning architecture inside and out. Such history here.

A Beautiful Mesmorising place.. This is an amazing Cathedral. The scale and splendour of this place takes your breath away. A must see when visiting the castle. Beautiful coloured glass windows and structure, I hope the sun is shining if you visit as the shadows it casts are mesmorising. Hope it is a little less busy for you as well.
High Baroque. Of course you will want to see the cathedral - it is an amazing example of the High Baroque. The only problem with all the sights now is that there are too many tour groups!
Beautiful. Gorgeous inside and out. Love the facades and the architecture was beautiful. Inside was very ornate with the pipe organ and a silver monument, not to mention the stained glass.

A Prague icon. This is the most dominant and interesting structure of the Prague castle. Inside there are two sections one with and one without a fee. Only the cathedral is worth while buying a ticket for access to the inside of the castle.

A Magnificent Cathedral. The line to get in might be the longest I have ever stood in but it moved quickly. With its soaring ceilings and spectacular stained glass windows, it is a site not to be missed. I loved the wood carving that depicted 17th century Prague and the glittery St. Wenceslaus Chapel. The oldest sections date back to the 10th and 11th centuries. Amazing!
Prague Castle. This is one of the worlds great cathedrals and castle complexes.The cathedral is unusually light but history still oozes from the walls.
A beautiful cathedral . A beautiful cathedral with lots of history to see. The stain glass windows are gorgeous and you find some great photo opportunities of the city.
Stained glass is beautiful . Remarkable stained glass windows. Took 600 years from start to complete the church. A must see in Prague. Golden lane nearby is very picturesque.

No Crowds at 4:00pm!. We went up to the castle late in the afternoon and most of the tour groups were gone.The Cathedral is one of the most beautiful we have seen. So much light, and the beautiful stained glass windows were amazing. Make sure you buy the ticket that allows you to go all the way into the cathedral. It is really worth it. We went in about 4 in the afternoon (it closes at 5) and only the back area where people who don't have tickets was crowded. Once we showed our ticket and continued in, there were very few people and no tour groups. It was great! We stayed until closing, and just before, the organ started playing! Really beautiful.

If you can only visit one place in Prague, go here!. Climb of 284 steps sounds bad, but once you get up there you will forget it. Astonishing panoramic view over entire Prague, especially beautiful in the early morning when you can see the sunrise over beautiful old Prague and the skyline against the morning sky.
Must See. The stained glass windows alone are worth a visit; especially the "Mucha's" window which is stunning. A very beautiful gothic Cathedral and as such draws huge crowds; but worth persevering.

A must if in Prague. Well don't really know what to say as Prague is just superb. Amazing architecture for this imposing building. The price of ticket is not even just for how much effort must these people put to maintain it to it's original state. My advice is to buy one of the tours for the castle. You won't regret it. As a bonus, spectacular views over old town. I went in April and it was crowded. Can't imagine how long is the queue during the summer season.
ST. VITUS CATHEDRAL. Cathedral of St Vitus is another beautiful place to visit, visited a while back. Beautiful outside and inside decorated doors, stained glass windows and a beautiful alter
Huge!!. Huge cathedral, a must visit if you are in Prague and Interesting architecture. Located near the castle and Golden lane.

The main attraction. Of course you must visit. Beautiful stained glass and stunning architecture. This church took a long time to build so the windows are from different times. Worth fighting through the tourists.
Gothic meets Gothic. The share scale of this place is daunting. Very impressive buttresses. It's quite a walk up a very steep hill although I believe you can get a taxi there.

St Vitus Stand at the top of a hill overlooking Prague,. St Vitus Stand at the top of a hill overlooking Prague, the cathedral itself is very interesting, and the views from the side overlooing Prague are breathtaking

"Stunningly Beautiful". From the mind boggling architecture to the gorgeous stained glass windows, the cathedral will leave you standing in awe and amazement. Words simply can not set before you picture of its beauty. THIS IS A MUST SEE!
Marvellous stained glass and architecture. Well worth visiting if you're seeing the castle. Lots of interesting architecture and some spectacular stained glass windows.

Do NOT miss the Mucha window!. This is a beautiful old cathedral worth a visit in any case as a Gothic cathedral with the extra attraction of the Chapel of St. Wenceslas but the high point isn't that old: the stained-glass window by the Art Nouveau artist Alphonse Mucha is a work of art worth a visit just by itself. We were lucky to be there on a sunny day when the colors were extra-bright and the details were sharp. It's a 'narrative' window about saints Cyril and Methodius.

Huge Eyeful of Delight!. This very large cathedral will delight you inside and out. Try to go early to miss the crowds. Loved the Mucha stained glass window. Art Nouveau is so likable. Try and take your time to soak it all in. I always like to take a description with me so I know what I am looking at and where to find things.

Beautiful, not to be missed!. A combination of gothic and neo-gothic, it is filled with beautiful stained glass. If you are a fan of the Czech artist, Alfons Mucha, it is a must see for his window alone. The tomb of St. Wenceslas is here, along with a Hapsburg mausoleum, and beautiful interiors.
St.Vitus. This church is interesting combination of styles, because it was built and rebuilt few times. Beautiful inside.

Stunning cathedral!. Beautiful cathedral. Free to go in, a queue form the left but it moves quickly, as people don't realise that its queue to go in, and then you must have purchased a ticket to actually go further into the church. For the freebies, we get to stand at the back of the cathedral - which is just as good to be honest. You can still admire the views, the windows, etc. Worth checking out for sure!
Huge. We should have taken the advise of the few tour books and gone early. Very, very crowded but able to see everything. The newer stained glass windows are amazing.
Amazing and must see. The cathedral is a piece of art, one of the must see locations in Praha You can enjoy it taking photos outside and going inside as well you won't regret itEnjoy

Don't Miss This Beautiful Cathedral. We visited this cathedral as part of our tour of the Prague Castle area. Look especially at the stained glass windows including one by Czech artist and illustrator Alphonse Mucha,

Go at night!. We went to the cathedral and surrounding area at night and pretty much had it to ourselves. It was closed but it was neat to get a unique view of the amazing buildings (which are lit up) and get all of the pictures we wanted without being shoulder to shoulder with others. Go with "The Naked Tour Guide" - ask for Stefan (history student - great guide). Don't worry - no one is actually naked!

Incredible stunning , will take your breath away!. Absolutely amazing, so old and so beautiful! If visiting Prague this is the one to visit, something you will never forget! It's located on the hill in Prague Castle which is absolutely stunning place and opening to gorgeous magical views of Prague city and Vltava river from the top of the hills. We would recommend to start from Petrin gardens , visit the tower and go down to Prague Castle from the Petrin Hills..

Spectacular, historically rich cathedral. There are so many spectacular cathedrals in Prague and Europe in general, but this one is awe inspiring. The detail is amazing and there is so much history inside. If you go to Prague this is another must!

Magnificent church, architecture.. At this time there are hordes of tourists, all with guides, takes some time to gain access to the cathedral, but it is verbeautiful. The day we went there had been a wedding, so access was restricted to the actual nave. I understand that it does cost a fortune to have a ceremony there. Living right in Prague is very expensive.
Shall we (St. Vitus) dance?. The stained glass windows and the antique wood carvings are amazing. The only problem is crowds, crowds, and more crowds. Go early or late!
Beauty. One of the most beautiful church I've seen, the architecture and design was amazing,a must see in Prague.
Not to be missed!. Amazing architecture! The outside is as beautiful as the inside. You can spend a good time admiring the beauty of the cathedral. A place to see when in Prague.

Simply Stunning . This is an absolute must during your visit. the architecture is amazing and you just stand in awe of this magnificent structure. If you can, get on a tour as the story behind the build is fascinating....
The most beautiful Cathedral. Its not just another church! Its the church- absolutely stunning and the best church in Europe. Quite the highlight of Prague. Do not miss.

Breath-taking. Was totally flabbergasted when I entered. Never knew such beauty existed. The stained glass windows alone are worth a visit. Try visit other than opening time. Hope the queue reduces gradually???

An absolute stunner. The best part of Prague Castle. Upon entering this church I was awed by its massive size and interiors. Go at a slow pace and observe every corner of this church which is meticulously designed. Definitely my favourite church in Prague. Impressive inside out.

Beautiful Cathedral, amazing stain glass windows. Beautiful Medieval Cathedral, stunning stain glass windows with beautiful masonry. Externally some wonderful Architectural detailing especially mosaic work completed by imported Italian labour.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful cathedral both inside and out. It is really easy to get to and very visable. Really adds to the city experience plus lots of photo ops!

One of the most impressive Gothic churches/cathedrals I've seen. I wanted to see the St Vitus Cathedral so badly, so it was the first thing to visit when we arrived in Prague. This church is so amazingly big and Gothic, it took my breath away.If you want to see the interior of the cathedral, you have to choose between a full ticket which includes approximately 12 objectives, or a basic ticket which assures you the entrance to 5 objectives (St. Vitus Cathedral, Zlatá ulička, St. George's Basilica,Old Royal Palace and the torture tower - Daliborka Tower )
Nice but overrated.. A very nice Cathedral with nice Designs. by the time we went the cathedral was closed, so not a lot to watch. a little bit overrated.

Interesting. St. Vitus Cathedral is situated entirely within the Prague Castle complex and this makes it interesting not only for the architecture fans, worth of visiting, even though there are many other visitors all the time.

Check out the Gargoyles, they are fabulous. Get a zoom on your csmera or binoculars.. Absolutely stunning archtecture werever you go inside or out, remember to stop and look back as you walk away, we descovered so many more diferent angles to this awesome piece of architectureal beauty.

It's All About the Timing !. Get there EARLY and you will beat the crowds. This venue is beautiful and interesting. Be sure to look up at the gargoyles on the top of the Cathedral. Makes me wonder how many folks miss them. There were three brides taking pictures - watch for them...
Beautiful. I had heard a lot about this cathedral during encounters with other travelers, and it didn't disappoint. The stonework is stunning, the longer you look at it, the more detail you notice.

Beautiful. Like many Prague buildings this is a medieval structure with a largely Baroque interior - you're either into Baroque or you're not. However, the glory of this one is its stained glass which has to be seen to be believed.

Spectacular. There was a line to enter the Cathedral when we arrived at 10am (after already inside the Castle complex), but it moved very quickly and we were inside within a few minutes. It’s a spectacular cathedral. The attention to detail is great and the stained glass windows are out of this world. Take the time to appreciate the glass, don’t just take a picture and walk away. The different glass windows were our favorite aspect of the cathedral.

So Beautiful!. This is a must see. Absolutely beautiful. One of the highlights of the trip. There was a little bit of a line to go in, but it moved pretty quickly and definitely worth the wait. Very impressive!
A must see on your visit to Prague. A must see in Prague - but buy the ticket and go through the whole church - not just the free look - there are a lot of great things to see.
A fast look. The crowds are here from all the tours and the line is long but moving. You only get a passing look at the church interior but we were frankly cathedraled out by this time in our trip.

A giant place full of history. St Vitus Cathedral is stop VIII on the palace complex tour. It is imposing from the outside and equally so from the inside. A simply over the top organ complex of decorated pipes way up high. Lots of people inside and there is a bottle next in the back of the church near the silver alter piece. Having seen the evolution of the Cathedral in other exhibits on the palace grounds it was interesting to see how it has come to be. It is the most imposing structure on the hill overlooking Prague and a must visit.
Great views. You had to pay extra to climb up the tower but it was worth it. There is no information around the cathedral and lots of groups in the way, so it way be worth getting a guide?

Photographers view of the cathedral. great for photography
make sure you buy a permit
you have to go around the cathedral in a clockwise direct
you will need a WIDE angle lens as its a big place
Nice place to visit and the best thing to see at this area

A Must for History Lovers. This is a very impressive monument at the heart of the Prague castle. Undoubtedly one of the finest examples of its kind in Europe, what made my second visit to it so special was an hour's tour with an outstanding guide, who spoke very good English, possessed tons of historical information as well as a good sense of humour, and managed to convey the relegious, artistic and historical significance of the cathedral in a fascinating way.
Impressive Cathedral. Part of the Prague Castle complex. Very interesting. Admission is inexpensive. There is very little signage so renting an audio guide ( we did not) might be helpful.

FREE and great stained glass windows. It is a beautiful cathedral, my favorite part was to see the stained glass made by the famous art nouveau artist Mucha, it's the green-ish one on the left side.Also the fact that it was free was a relief in Prague

Most impressive thing in Prague castle . The cathedral is very beautiful and worth a look.To me it's the most impressive thing in the castle as there really is no castle its a complex with a big wall.

Impressive More so from the outside!. You can see this from pretty much all over Prague and it was no less impressive up close. Inside was good but the outside was really incredible. We just walked around looking at all the detail, it was amazing.
Ought to see it from inside. amazing decor, interior, architecture. Even more though if you get a minimal knowledge about history behind the artefacts presented there.

lovely stained glass and lots of it but not a gorgeous cathedral. Modern stained glass is creatively designed and sends bands of light onto the columns at different times of day. The architecture soars but in my opinion thiscis not a spectacular cathedral either in design ir ornament. Worth a short visit since you are up at the castle anyway.

Beautiful Stained Glass. Protip: Go first thing in the morning. The day we went it opened at 9:00am. We arrived early - around 8:30 and walked through the gardens and looked around outside. We were in line for tickets at 8:50am. Got out tickets immediately and entered the cathedral when there were no crowds, no jostling, no pushing, etc.

Worth the steps up the tower. The cathedral is beautiful. If you plan your trip right and go up to the top before high noon, you can watch the ceremonial guards and band play from above. It's totally worth it, great photo ops too
Eternal architechture. This place is wonderful. Again, a must do thing when you are in Praha. The architecture is wonderful.

The most beautiful Cathedral in the world!!!. This building is just breath taking! From inside out its just beautiful historical cathedral with amazing colorfull glass windows! When visiting Prague and Prague castle, there is no way you will miss this!

Lovely . Huge cathedral with the gothic facade. Amazing inside out with lovely glass stained windows. A must see attraction when you are in prague. If you take the segway tour they will drop you next to it and be able to go inside to see it.
A great sight . The inside is beautiful and so big. A must see. It's also one of the cheapest things to see in Prague.

One of the most beautiful cathedrals I've ever visited. We bought the pass for Prague Castle which included the cathedral and it was probably my favourite attraction of the day. The stained glass windows inside are stunning, definitely worth a look.

Amazing cathedral. As beautiful as it is historical, large number of artefacts on display inside. Very crowded so try to go early. We used an audio guide, may have been better with a personal guide as we could have asked more questions when there is so much to know.

Beautiful but expensive.. Only use a Tour Guide if the Cathedral is specifically mentioned, otherwise they allow you to peek inside free and the rest you have to pay for. Shame really as it os quite beautiful inside, but Prague has become a bit of a rip off these days so either take plenty of money for each and every activity or go somewhere else until they reduce their prices.

One of the most beautiful churches I've seen. The church is absolutely gorgeous. shame that it is most parts are closed so you have to pay to get a tour in them. didn't pay, was a bit disappointed but definitely this is one of the things you need to see in Prague.
Disappointing. Crowds are ridiculous even in late September. When eventually inside, it was plain and disappointing.

Just Beautiful. The cathedral was stunning inside with the light through the glass windows playing on the walls. Best time for the light is in the morning. A really nice gothic church that was worth the visit.
Well worth a visit. This is a really beautiful cathedral, the stained glass windows are amazing. The colours are brilliant. Look for the window with the eye!

Worth a visit, can be crowded.. Worth a stop when visiting the castle. Be careful the steps are steep and narrow. There will be people coming down. They do not do a very good job of controlling the flow of people. I was waiting in line and they tried to stop tell people to stop going up but rude people just barged ahead of the guard and other people waiting in line. The guard just did nothing.

Gorgeous. This is the real deal when visiting the Prague Castle. It´s awesome inside and outside. I don´t even remember the castle.If you go walking to the castle, be ready to climb a lot of stairs. It worth the view, though.

Magnifiscent. Great, great experience. The war damages have been beautifully restaurated or renewed, e.g. the stunning glass paintings by Mucha. The cathedral, along with the rest of the castle area, is a must see in Prague.
Remarkable architecture. The building outside is amazing, with so many spires pointed toward sky. Inside is beautiful but simpler comparing with luxurious Decoration of Vatican or Siena.
Spectacular. There are churches and there are churches. This cathedral is stunning in it's sheer grandeur and history.It has to be on the must see list for anyone contemplating a visit to Prague.

Unique and mystically religious experience !. Very powerful experience of being inside this cathedral, with all those marvellous chapels inside it. One get that deep religious mystical feeling of being inside it. And its history of making itself is unparallelly unique!

Great Church look out for Mucha designed stained glass window.. There are two ways to visit this cathedral. You can enter for free and see a limited area of the church. Still worth doing. The other way is to buy a ticket , normally as part of a combination of tickets to see other areas of the Prague Palace. Whilst I havent seen all the attractions of the Prague Palace ( for instance I never saw the Treasury) this was the standout and only part worth seeing from my point of view.What was great about itThe Church itself which is massive and well lightedThe many types of stained glass windows including one designed by Mucha..The special area for King Wenceslas..you cant go in it but good views availableTombs of many Czeck kings buried hereThe many special altarsDefinitely the best church we saw in Prague although the Tyn Church just off the main town square is nice as well
Beautiful building. Its a beautiful, magnificant building, i was really surprised about it. If i will travel in Prague again, i'll check this again i'm sure.
You will enjoy the trip. Another amazing architectural site that's a must see. A spectacular site and it's free. After your walk through get some food or gelato in the area. well worth it..

Incredible. Pictures do not do this justice. The cathedral is amazing with its black and tan spires and amazing architecture. Inside the stained glass is a sight to behold and the sheer height of the building is impressive. A fantastic cathedral!

WOW!!!!!. This cathedral is towering and somewhat daunting from the outside, but step in and....WOW!!!! The stained glass windows don't look like much from the outside, but once inside the building, they truly pop!!! A-maxing and magnificent!!!!!!!
Beauty and history. This is one of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world. It is very well kept and organized. It is huge and gorgeous snd shoukd nit be missed.

A don't miss in Prague even if not a church fan. Unbelievable beauty in this Cathedral. It will make your jaw drop. I have seen so many duaomos that it takes alot to cause me to rate a church this high but this one is worth every minute you spend there.

Thank you Prague for a beautiful Cathedral.. What a Magnificent Architectural and Spiritual center, Cathedral will stay in your heart and mind with its impressive abilities to let all you guards down and feel priceless love by God. Take your time and perhaps take a walk from old town, an educational walk and introduction to Prague.

A must to Visit!!. This cathedral was really one of the most beautiful I have ever seen. The stained glass was fantastic. The ornamentation was beautiful. It is so hard to believe that it was so old...how could they have created such a beautiful place that many years ago?

well worth a visit - an art history gold mine. we walked over to St Vitus's Cathedral, which IS well worth a visit. It never ceases to amaze me, as a non religious person, how much these old cathedrals, churches, and basilicas amaze me. The art history held within each of these I have been able to visit is enough for a lifetime of study. I do not believe I will ever tire of making these visits. And St Vitus's is a wonderful example. Even before you walk inside you have to stand back and take in the Gothic Architecture from the 14th century. Then once you go inside you are forced to appreciate the sheer size. But there is still art in abundance. Especially in the St Wenceslas Chapel where the walls are adorned with "over 1300 semi-precious stones and paintings about the Passion of Christ dating from the original decoration of the chapel in 1372–1373 ". There is much more to take in and I could go on and on, but you truly have to see it for yourself.

Well worth a visit. All of the castle complex gets very busy, so I would advise going to the St Vitus Cathedral early to avoid the worst of the crowds. With its soaring roof it's a spectacular sight. Do go up the Bell Tower for the views.
Magnificent. The outside view of it is great, a piece of art. The interior the same and the good thing it was free the day I visited. You can not reach far to away from the entrace though.

Excellent details. The sheer size of this cathedral is magnificent enough, and this is still punctuated by the excellent architecture and intricate designs of its spires. The inside, though, is a little underwhelming, aside from stained glass. It looks like a little bare, in my opinion.

At Prague Castle. St. Vitus Cathedral is part of the Prague Castle complex. If you want to just go in and get a glimpse than it is free, but to be able to walk to the back of the church there is a fee. I would recommend paying the fee and going inside. I felt this was the best part of Prague Castle.

Tour of St. Vitus. After entering the palace grounds we took an English speaking tour of the cathedral. Our guide was very knowledgeable and the tour lasted about an hour. The church was amazing and the included parts of the palace. It wasn't expensive and very informative.

Amazing detail. This is worth every bit of effort to get to. What an amazing Cathedral. I would rank this as one of the best. The intricate detail put into building this church is amazing when you think of how long ago it was built. If you liked the Cathedral in Milan or Sagrada Familia in Barcelona then you must travel to see this.
Must Visit. A must visit for visitors to Prague. Very impressive cathedral, noteworthy for the stained glass windows.
Allow plenty of time there is a lot to see. We had a guide take us around the castle and cathedral, well worth the small cost for the information and knowledge we gained

Worth the trip!. Take bus 22 up to the top of hill but then walk down to the sites! A little confusing where to get off bus and then where to walk but follow the crowds and you will be fine. Gorgeous cathedral and you could spend hours touring. We bought the 1st level tour with recorders to listen to at each site...worth renting. Lots of photo ops but no flash inside...paid for photo permit but no one checked. This and walking back down hill to bridge is all day so relax and enjoy the day! Eat and drink your way back to your hotel...

Easily one of the world's most spectacular cathedrals - STRONGLY recommended. This place is incredible. It's part of the Prague Castle Complex. Strongly recommend going with a guide, if at all possible. Simply stunning stained glass, truly awesome architecture.Burial site of "Good king Wensenclas" (not spelled correctly) who apparently was a real, and for his time, enlightened ruler. The room where his coffin is displayed is quiet and dignified.We've seen many cathedrals in Europe. This one easily ranks in the top 5.

Free to walk inside, but there is a cost to wander around. Worth every Krona to visit, one of the most beautiful got his cathedrals in Europe. The windows alone are worth the visit. One of the windows is by A. Muncha, an outstanding Czech artist and illustrator. Visit his art museum while Prague.
Beautiful gothic cathedral. The cathedral is situated on the hill in the middle of Prague. It's tucked away in the courtyard of the parlament building.

amazing. We left from our hotel in the morning and began our ascent up the 192 strps from street level to get to praha castle the line up was sbout 20 minutrs for tickets but it was well worth the wait

Do not hesitate to go inside. My wife and I had been to Prague and the St. Vitus Cathedral previously but not done anything but look in the doors. That was a mistake. The Gothic exterior is imposing but the interior is amazingly beautiful. As is so typical of churches of that era it played a significant part in history; in this case Czech history and the Hapsburg dynasty. Unfortunately it is PACKED during tourist season but definitely worth the visit. And don't hesitate to spend the money on a guide: well worth the small expense.

A beautiful cathedral with a great view.. The cathedral is definitely worth a visit. The inside is beautiful. We were disappointed that we could not see certain areas - it appeared only specific tour groups could do so. We also climbed the South Tower- saw the bells, the unusual clock at the top. There are almost 300 steps but the steps are very even and the climb was really quite easy. The view of Prague from the top is stunning!!! Definitely something you should do.

Amazing. This cathedral is a sight to behold. It is truly amazing and to think it was constructed before the time of electricity is awe inspiring. We enjoyed taking the longer walk through the building and seeing all of the individual naves throughout.

Definitely worth a visit!. worth a visit but be ready for a very crowded place.if you get to the cathedral after noon there will be many people there and you will not be able to find a quite place inside this amazing cathedral.

Highlight of Prague castle. The cathedral alone is worth the trip up the hill to the castle. Excellent gothic architecture. It can get crowded so come right at opening time to best enjoy the atmosphere of the cathedral.

Soaring architecture above the city within castle walls. Worth a visit just to see the stained glass window by Alfons Mucha. Crowded and part of the larger castle complex. Ticket required for various sites at the castle. Gorgeous Gothic architecture with lovely stained glass windows.
nice to see. great view from up there. The cathedral is huge and it''s style is very beautiful. Unfortunately it costs quite a lot to go up the tower

Very Impressive and very beautiful. This was a wonderful surprise because I'd never heard of the Cathedral and it compares very favourably with much more famous ones. The stained glass was beautiful, the outside is impressive from all angles and the interior was stunning. Admission is free but for about £7.50 you can get a ticket to see more of the cathedral, the Royal Place and other sights in the castle area.
everything my husband taught about gothic cathedrals. Make sure you buy a ticket which includes the cathedral and treasury. Many tour groups were just stuck in the back, not able to walk around.

History alive here. Don't just enter this magnificent building without being prepared for surprises. Those who don't pay the entrance miss out on so much: frescoes on walls you can't see from the restricted entrance; the chapel of St Wenceslas; an archbishop holding what looks like a silver cricket bat, but is really a trenching spade; the surreal tomb of St.Vitus himself, almost impossible to photo in any light. Don't expect to speed round. There are just too many quirky images and sculptures. And the Cathedral is just a small part of the massive Castle complex.

Amazing . This cathedral was amazing. The stained glass windows are something else, they're beautiful when the sunlight shines through them. Especially the round window at the front of the church. For a building that was designed in the 1300s, its amazing!
Huge cathedral, some says the second biggest in Europe.. Different constructions in the Cathedral as well as in the buildings surrounding it. Great vitrals, interesting stories.
Satisfied visit. Really helpfull staff in the centre of this beautiful town where you find many interesting shops and places to go.

Take the Guided Tour!. This cathedral is amazing! The artwork and craftmenship which went into it is simply amazing. Do yourself a favor and take a guided tour, you will have a much better experience and get to know a lot more of the history. If you want to do the audio tours, get there early because they sell out around 11 a.m.

Very Majestic . The Cathedral is very old. I've seen several old world Cathedrals in different countries in different countries including Notre Dame a few days earlier. The stain glassed windows are simply gorgeous at St. Vitus.

beautiful from outside. inside is a no must. when you reach the top of the hill to view this its beautiful, but if you want to get in there is a long line and also the visit inside is inside the line and not freely.
One of the better European cathedrals to visit. We never miss a cathedral when we are visiting a European city. This one ranks as one of the best we have seen. The gothic architecture is outstanding.
The Imposing Cathedral on the Skyline. Great Cathedral with stunning stained glass windows. The crowds were very large when we visited, which was the only down side for our visit.

My love of Prague. This is a beautiful cathedral at the Prague Castle,which is accessible two ways ,there are many steps to get there,but the back is the castle has a back way by tram. I love the cathedral because the patron St Wenseslaus is buried there.

Amazing!!!. Truly amazing from spiritual and architectural point of view. Say a prayer, it is incredibly powerful, just imagine how many people prayed there before you!
Must visit...
St Vitus Cathedral. This cathedral is located inside the Castle area. Beautiful architecture and interior. While we were there, a bride was outside preparing for her wedding.

Beautiful. One of the most Beautiful Cathedrals i ever seen. The architecture of these place is just Beautiful. The details on the walls, the Gold plated work & THE MOSAIC WINDOWS. Simply a must Visit!

Beautiful. What a beautiful cathedral, spectacular inside, lots of people in there although we didn't queue to get in. There is an additional cost to get right up close to the altar, tickets can be bought at info desk. Well worth the visit when there, tram 22 stops nearby at top of the hill and is a 5 minute walk away.
Great place to see. The most beautiful Church in Prague and possibly in whole Czech Republic. Beautiful architecture and very interesting crypts.
