beautiful historical church. very beautiful historical church which is located inside the Prague palace. worth buying the day pass. A must visit in Prague.

Magical and Mysterious. First, ask your hotel desk or concierge to tell you what tram line to take up to the cathedral. Unless you're in great shape, trying to walk up to it could lead to a heart attack. Once up there, the views, buildings, and sites are really spectacular. (Bring head gear and appropriate attire for the weather, because it can get REALLY WINDY up there). The cathedral itself is very impressive. Be prepared for long lines to enter, especially in the first opening hour. Tickets are required if you want to walk thru the entire Cathedral. It's well worth it. Make sure you walk around the entire exterior of the cathedral grounds because the views of Prague below are breathtaking from every vantage point. Also - GO to the small cafe just outside the cathedral because their food is simply wonderful. I ordered a curried chicken that was the absolute best and most memorable meal I had on our entire trip thru Salzburg, Prague, and Vienna. And they even have soy milk options for all their hot drinks. I ordered a peppermint schnapps hot chocolate with soy milk that was simply heavenly. Overall, a great experience.

Dominating. In the most prominent part of the city, visible from any spot in Prague, it is a breathtaking sight. Especially at night when it's superbly well lighten.When you visit it (I recommend to walk towards it) you will see just how enormous it is, and also how beautifull view of Prague you have from there.Highly recommended.

Combine visit with Prague Card + more. This is a must-see during your Prague visist. Some recommendations:1. When you come through the tunnel from the castel, do NOT stop right at the exit to take pictures. You will block hundreds of other visitors. If you really need to take a photo from that angle, move to the side! Btw from the side are better photo spots (see my photo)...2. Only the entrance area is free3. If you like to see more than the entrance, you need to buy a ticket. This is a site that is free with the Prague card. If you visit many other attractions, you should consider buying this card.4. Climb the 287 steps up the tower. This ticket requires you to be somewhat physically fit. Together with the TV tower (not so easy to get to) and Petrin tower (tram currently closed), the cathedral tower has the best view in Prague. Highly recommended !
Greatest landmark in Prague. Well worth a visit for the stained glass alone. St Vitus dominates the Prague skyline and forms the heart of the castle district.

St Vitus Dance??. lacking signage and explanation, it was an overcrowded fight-for -all...and this was early morning. pushing shoving and ill-mannered tourists. A guide is essential if you want to know what you're looking at.

Prague Castle. Last time we visited Prague and the castle we didn't manage to visit the Cathedral. This year we made a point to visit and it was well worth while. The stained glass windows were some of the best ever.

Breathtaking views from atop the panoramic tower. This is truly a lovely cathedral, and please if you are fit enough, climb the 285 steps to the panoramic tower. The views of all Prague are breathtaking from the top.

Magnificent Cathedral. The cathedral is located within the grounds of Prague Castle. It is possible to see inside free of charge, but for a small fee (which also covers several other castle buildings) you can wander around the interior. This is well worthwhile, as the building is very impressive and there are a number of great stained glass windows.

Beautiful. Well worth the money (we bought castle tour b). Highlight of the castle area, the cathedral is spectacular both inside and out. You can look inside for free, but I'd recommend paying to walk round. Also the photo pass thing is not enforced!

Pictures don't do it justice. Pictures don't do this place justice. It's massive and beautiful. You have to purchase a ticket to walk around the church but if you just want to stand in the foyer that is free.
Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful cathedral. Definitely worth paying to enter and take photos. Nobody checked if we had a photo permit but we paid for one.
Nice Visit. Long queue to get in but just about worth it. Some of the stained glass windows are lovely and vibrant with the sun shining through.

Amazing cathedral. Try to arrive early as crowds build quickly, and the sun can be very hot in summer with not much shade. Rather than viewing the parts of the castle in order, start with St. Vitus as it can be packed later on, and the stained glass windows are unparalleled.

The cathedral at Prague. The Hradcany quarter of Prague is a complex of renaissance chateaux and churches. Absolutely bung full of tourists. You can buy a ticket for about £10 (250 Cz crowns) and go to numerous sites. St Vitus Cathedral has quite magnificent painted or stained glass windows. Really the best view of all is from the eastern side of the river Vltava from where the tall gothic spires are seen commanding the hill. At evening time when the church and much more are floodlit the scene is truly dramatic and romantic.
spectacular!. a miracle of architecture!a huge, impressive building, representative of gothic style!very worth visiting!
unless you have a deep intrest 30 mins. will do you.. after a long walk up the architecture was gothic and superb, stained glass from inside wonderful, atmosphere around was busy and buzzy
St Vitus tower view. Worth climbing the stairs for the surrounding views of Prague but do not attempt if not fit. The clock workings are on view up top.
Great Cathedral . It is a great Cathedral - it's a must see in Prague. I advice to visit it for taking pictures in the late evening time - no people and a great pictures in lights!

History two steps from the Czech President's office. A must see in Prague!! Breathtaking facades, not to mention the nearby view of the entire city. I didn't have much time here but even a quick look around was worth it to get a sense of the storied history of Prague.

Sterling Silver in its Glory. St. Vitus cathedral was the first cathedral we visited in our Imperial Cities tour with Collette. It is magnificent, with towering ceilings, frescos largely undamaged by WW II. There are many altars, one more ornate than the other. The crowning jewel so to speak is the tomb of the Confessor to Queen Maria-Theresa said to have been killed by her husband, the King because he wouldn't reveal her confessions. It is made of solid sterling silver held by winged angels. A must see - walk slowly and enjoy! Maria-Theresa built many gorgeous baroque buildings, castles and cathedrals. Oh to be Queen...

Incredibly beautiful old cathedral. This cathedral is absolutely beautiful. So old but so much detail in the building. It is an incredible work of art and we spent a good hour or more here. Certainly nothing you see in Australia! Worth the visit.........and photos to take back and show your family and friends!

No tickets just for the Cathedral. We could only visit free part of the cathedral, because they don't sell single tickets. We would have to buy a ticket for more places we didn't want to enter. Interior wasn't that impressive.

Beautiful. When you are in Prague, St. Vitus Chathedral seems to dominate the skyline and when you actually see it before you, it towers above larger than life. The outside is great to see but buy a ticket to go inside and you will not be disappointed. The space inside is immense and there the design and architecture will impress.

Wonderful example of the Gothic period!. The Mucha stained glass window is not to be missed! It was interesting to see all the flying buttresses needed to engineer this cathedral on the outside. If there are a lot of tour groups going through when you arrive, think about going to some of the other places in the castle and then returning. We did this and had no wait.
Beautiful view and Castle. I must really reccomend a trip up to this castle.It has so much history and all the decorations is amazing.The view is also really good.

an architectural gem. Beautiful architecture, and despite being quite crowded (as is whole Prague) it is a must see. Outstanding vitrailles / stained glass are complementing the Gothic architecture. It contains several tombs of Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors. To be able to see it all, remember to purchase the ticket or even better the Prague card that allows you free entry here.
A must see!. A magnificent example of Gothic architecture. We enjoyed every aspect of the building, art, and the amazing stained glass windows.

Breathtaking beauty. St. Vitus Cathedral is by far the most magnificent religious monument I have ever had the good fortune to experience. It's sheer size and detail takes your breath away. The stained glass windows are incredible. Any cathedral built today would pale in comparison, and yet one has to marvel at how such magnificence was constructed so long ago with the tools at hand during those times. A must see.

Wonderful cathedral to visit in Prague Castle precinct. Magnificent example of a gothic cathedral built to replicate Notre Dame in Paris. The stained glass windows were all spectacular and looking resplendent on a sunny Prague day.

Amazing well preserved architecture . I had been here in September 13, 2015. The architecture is breathtaking, it makes me think how this was built before. Every angle is beautiful. We even tried accessing the tower which cost 150 Kc each and comes with a gold coin souvenir. Beware, lots of steps to take but worthy. View from top was great!

Georgeous church. As you can tell from,the pictures this church is not to be missed. Very beautiful stained glass windows. Many sculptures and unique alter. The outside architecture is quite interesting also.

Dark Gothic Church. I wasn't impressed at all on the inside, very dark and you are only allowed to go a quarter of the way inside. Masses of people. You can walk around the sides for a fee but I don't think it is worth it. The outside is mch more impressive.

This Isn't Rome in case you were wondering. St. Vitus is one of the Prague highlights, but it doesn't compare to the cathedrals of Italy. It's nice, vast and has the proper sense of a gothic religious structure, but if you have been to Italy, you will be a bit, just a bit, disappointed.

Visit early to beat the crowds. A must, when visiting Prague, the Gothic architecture is spectacular! Arrive early to beat the crowds and with the morning sun beaming in through the stained glass windows the result is awe inspiring. We climbed the bell tower of St.Vitus Cathedral and it's a very unique way to view the gargoyles and other details that you can't see from the ground. Entry is inexpensive we purchased an integrated ticket for many attractions in the Prague Castle which is valid for two days if you don't like to rush things. We easily did them all in a day.

a cathedral with majestic architecture. The place reminds me of Florence as the magnificent architecture indulges with the long history of the placeIt is in the Prague castle and you visit both at the same timeIf you are on a walking tour beware it is a very long walk

Van impressive cathedral. Yes it is yet another cathedral bu it is the most important and impressive in Prague. It occupies a prominent location and is beautifully maintained in the Baroque style. It is easily visited as part of a tour of the Castle complex. If you visit any cathedrals in the city this is the one.

Gorgeous exterior and interior. Gorgeous and impressive. Packed of people all the time, it doesn't matter if you are on a tour or on your own, expect to find a crowded place. Worthy to see the tombs of St John of Nepomuk and tomb of St Wenceslas. Don't miss the golden gate (Zlata brana) on the exterior of the cathedral.

Spiritually moving. Don't miss a visit to this Church as it is so rich in history and the size of it awe inspiring! The stained glass windows are incredible along with all of the other details of the church. Enjoy your visit!
Excellent. Good view, very preserved, I enjoyed the whole building. I would definitely go again because I really was wonderful.

Stunning !. For those who are religious there are many icons, statues, artefacts and tombs of great interest. For those who love Gothic architecture, this must be one of the most beautiful examples. From the very high nave, stunning windows and the fabulously intricate external facades, this is a must see.
A Prayer in 'St. Vitus. We just saw the church proper and the side altars, but the church interior and exterior were impressive.

St Vitus - a must see!. One of the most historic and beautiful sites in Prague. Very rich in history and legends. Make sure you explore the whole cathedral including all the chapels. This place is a must!

Beautiful -- so many beautiful cathedrals!. By the time we arrived in we had seen many castles and cathedrals. This of course is beautiful but after a while the term abc was in use. Another blasted castle/cathedral! I loved them all!

Awesome. It is a great cathedral, although the mix of styles make it a bit awkward. For instance, it is funny how people gather in front of the west façade, which is quite modern, and not in front of the beautiful north façade. I would recommend to have print information about it (or to go with a guide) and please keep in mind that a good part of the cathedral can be seen for free (the exterior and 1/3 of the interior)

Intense Cathedral. It is the Roman Catholic cathedral of Prague.When a first church was erected on this spot in 929, nobody could imagine that later a gothic jewel would be finished on that place a 1000 years later (1929). It took a long time to build. Therefore you will find baroque and renaissance elements besides the beautiful gothic architecture. Have also a look at the St Wenceslas Chapel and at the mosaic of The Last Judgement (14th cent) at the outside.If you find the courage to climb the tower besides the cathedral you will give yourself a treat. Not only can you look down and wonder how all this was built, but you'll get at the same time a great view on the city. Check it out.

Imposing Gothic Structure. This spectacular specimen of gothic architecture is visible from most parts of Lesser Town and Old Town. It is located close to Prague Castle, and has played a significant role in many historically important events in the history of the country. It is simply awe inspiring to behold, and a visit is very highly recommended. There is an admission fee to see the inside of the church, but tickets can easily be purchased while on site, and it is well worth it, in my opinion.

Very interesting but buy a guide or take the tour. Amazing architecture, huge space and interesting history well worth it but not much information in English so take the tour or buy a guide book from one of the info shops.
Just beautiful. We went on a 6 hour walking tour to the castle, the cathedral was beautiful, we also go the chance to see the changing of the guards, the view was spectacular.. It's worth a visit

One of my favorite sights. It's a little difficult to find the entrance to the Cathedral which is now behind an Italian restaurant, but worth the effort. The opulence, history and architecture is quite spectacular. It is truly amazing when all lit up in the evening.

A magical experience. The ubiquitous St Vitus it’s the jewel of the Prague Castel complex. Sitting at the top of a hill it can be seen from almost every point in the city. The exterior design epitomises the best of the Gothic architecture. Its interior is awe-inspiring with massive stain glass windows and numerous sculptures, paintings and intricate woodwork. Brave souls can climb up nearly three hundred steps to top of the church to get a panoramic view of the beautiful Prague. If you have only two-hour to spend in Prague visit St Vitus! It’s a magical experience.
Beautiful Gothic Style Cathedral. The mural on the side of the building and the gothic gargoyles are impressive. The inside is grand and majestic.
Beautiful.. Stunning! One of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen in a gorgeous city. One of the highlights of my trip.

nice but could have been better. To be honest I expected to be wowed but its just ok. The church is very nice itself. There are long lines. We bought the ticket to go to several places inside the palace. It's worth it but don't expect it to be amazing.

Gorgeous stained glass, impressive cathedral. Take time to visit St. Vitus Cathedral while you are at Prague Castle. It's a beautiful building. In fact, when we first walked up to it, we started taking pictures and marveling at its beautiful before we realized we were on the back side...the front was even more impressive! We stepped inside to view the gorgeous stained glass windows.
Tourists Paradise. If you've ever been to Prague this is one of the highlights of this beautiful city.Goth architecture and the cobblestone, awesome
Stunning. Beautiful and grand. Each chapel and stained glass window a different artist and story. Don't miss the Mucha window!
Breathtaking!. Words are not enough to describe how majestic and beautifuk this church is! A must-visit even if you are staying in Prague just for a few hours!

Beautiful Cathedral. The cathedral alone would be worth the price of the Prague Castle entrance, but get the audio guide before you go in, since if you decide after you do the cathedral, you cannot go in again
A Perfect View!. The Cathedral surroundings are awe inspiring and it's definitely worth making the 287 trek to the top of the cathedral tower for the spectacular views of Prague!

Amazing stained glass windows. Did not pay to see all the cathedral as we were rushed for time but you can photo 4 of the windows and the isle tomwards the altar. Very busy s o be prepared to wait to get your pictures.

Amazing view. A very nice Cathedral. Lying, a beautiful Cathedral. If you go inside you will be amazed how big and enormous is it. You can go up to the top , however be prepared around 290 steps. But the view you will see worth it.

st. Vithus cathedral, awesome gothic church!. st. Vithus cathedral, awesome gothic church!
SItuated in the prajsky grad, on the top of the hill. Worth a visit!

Awesome gothic cathedral!. Awesome gothic cathedral!
We had not much time to go inside but outside it's really huge and beautiful. All these gargoyles, towers are really amazing!

Tickets now needed for the Cathedral. This magnificent cathedral is definitely worth a visit. Although tickets are now needed to walk around the whole cathedral - the front part is free and gives a real sense of the place and the stained glass windows.
Not Easy to Access. Line wraps around the enormous building and you may have to wait 1-2 hours to get it. Gorgeous, but.............

Spectacular. I didn't pay to get into the alter region, but what you can see for free is very nice.
I really enjoyed wandering around the whole castle complex later in the evening when most of the tourists were gone.

Lovely architecture! . Love the architecture and wonderful view of the interior and exterior of the building.
A wonderful sight and definitely must not be missed when u are in Prague

Stunning!. Prague is a city of treasures, and this is one of them. This cathedral has the most beautiful stained glass windows of any church or cathedral that I have ever seen. There is such a rich history, with fantastic sculptures, including one made of silver depicting cherubs.

Imposing Gothic Beauty. A marvel to behold, St. Vitus Cathedral perfectly encapsulates the gothic architectural style. It's surrounded by beautiful gardens. Worth the trip out of the main city and there are some great sights to see over that direction anyway.
Gargoyle paradise. This church is a gothic gem, with spiers, towers and gargoyles. A masterpiece. The tram is easy to find and takes you high up on the hill and back to town.

Amazing features. St, Vitus is an amazing Cathedral with beautiful stained glass windows. A huge sculpture made from silver with cherubs is a main feature. Full of paintings and monuments. The architecture with it's arches and figurines tower make this a most fascinating cathedral.

Worth a visit. I would suggest arriving as early as possible to avoid the huge queues, the cathedral is very large but a lot of the areas are restricted which is a shame. Definitely worth a visit if in Prague.

Beautiful during the day, and even more beautiful at night!. This cathedral is open during the day and is beautiful, but don't miss viewing it after dark. Although you can't get inside, the outside grounds are peaceful without all of the people. This is a stunning cathedral.

Worth the trip. We went here while we were at the castle. It was pretty spectacular. I would advise buying the ticket (you can get a combo that lets you into5 places in the complex) so you can go in and walk through the church. It is clearly marked NO PICTURES and many disrespectful people ignored it. What a shame. I am not religious at all but this was a sad thing to do in someone's church. There are signs around the church thatletyouknowwhat is what. I enjoyed it.

Wow. Very enjoyable visit despite the crowds. Massive queue when we first arrived but an hour late it had gone. Probably worth doing this early in the day and then you can at least go back later having enjoyed the rest of the castle area if it is busy when you arrive.
Grandiose. Grandiose and impressive. Worth a visit but there is a lot of people. Not my favorite one in Prague but while at the castle, its a must!

Star of the castle area, get in before 11am while the crowds are thin. Even if you are "all cathedralled out" from prior travel, this church is worth a close look in detail. You must purchase a ticket (A or B) from the information office opposite the cathedral in order to gain access to the altar region of the church. Star attraction here is the solid silver tomb of one of Czech's saints who refused to reveal under torture the queen's confessional secrets to her husband the king. The crypt is also a starcattraction if it is open.

See it with a Guide. We were on a tour with Viking Ships, excellent view of the lovely windows and wonderful settings. Would go back to see more. the scenes around the building is worth having a guide.
Beautiful!. This cathedral has such lovely architecture. It is definitely worth a trip if you're interested in beautiful historical buildings and we really enjoyed it.
Take a guided tour. More impressive outside than inside but it might be due to the fact that we didn't take a guided tour so we didn't know the history behind each section of the cathedral.

Awe-inspiring example of Czech architecture.. Although the queue was much too long for us to venture inside the Katedral itself, the building is absolutely incredible- very similar to the Sagrada Familia or Notre Dam.
St. Vitus Cathedral. An incredible experience, a great historical complex, a Romanesque-Gothic-Renaissance-Baroque architecture in one place. One of the most beautiful places I've seen ...

Stunning!. What a fabulous cathedral this is! As you walk through the arch from the main square it just hits you! Architecturally stunning both inside and out, despite the crowds it's very peaceful inside, fabulous place to spend some time.
Poor cathedral. Sorry to say but this is not a great trip, have been to many better cathedrals in capital city's all over Europe. Very unimpressive

Beautiful cathedral. This is the most famous building in Prague - and it should be! Its Gothic architecture will leave you speechless even if you are not an architecure fan. Inside check out the windows, which are truly spectacular. Tip: you can enter cathedral without paying entrance fee, the tickets are just if you want to see the whole church. The first half of the cathedral is open for public.

Stunning. We were coming to an end in our stay in Prague, and left this glorious building as our last thing to do. It is pretty much everything you want it to be. The castle in general is quite good, but this was what we made the visit for, this glorious and captivating Gothic cathedral that you strikes an amazing silhouette in the night sky.
beautiful. Beautiful if you are in Prague its a must the stained glass windows are spectacular it's difficult To put into words you have to see it yourself, do go

Beautiful Gothic church. The moment you are inside Prague castle, you are confronted by this enormous Gothic church . Very beautiful and massive . It was very crowded the day I visited, nit sure what could be the best time to visit to see less crowd.
Stunning Cathedral. A stunning site to visit and spend couple of hours wondering around and learning about this cathedral.
impressive. gotic style, very nice stained-glass windows, near the castle, a landmark place, have to pay to enter near the altar, can shop religion articles, beverages and snacks. Bathrooms

Church. This church was magical. The stained glass is some of the most beautiful I have seen. If you arrive in the afternoon, the sunlight comes in and reflects all of the beautiful colors throughout the church. One of many pictures I will cherish from this historical city. There is a beautiful walk down the back side of the church that passes an old vineyard and some beautiful restaurants with a view. Not sure what time they are open for service, we were there early in the day.

Gothic gorgeousness! . Saints Vitus is a Roman Catholic cathedral, of Gothic architectural style, set within the castle of Prague. It covers an area of 7,440 square meters, the main tower being over 96 meters high. It contains many tombs including those of various Bohemian Kings and Holy Roman Emperors.

Better than Notre Dame Cathedral. It's a steep walk up to the castle and if you don't already have a ticket I suggest you arrive before the 9am opening. St Vitus Cathedral is closed for services until 12 pm on Sundays and before it opens the line can be quite lengthy. Inside is magnificent. The stained glass windows and displays are gorgeous. Definitely a holiday highlight and better than Notre Dame Cathedral. Take the time to spend the rest of your day touring Prague Castle as well although the Rosenberg Palace is probably not worth your time.

Gothic splendor. The powers that be in Prague certainly knew how to choose architects! Absolutely beautiful cathedral with just so much detail.Visited as a part of a tour so only got half an hour - not long enough! I would allow two or more hours to wander around the cathedral and it's surrounds.
Amazing..... Amazing sites in and around the Cathedral. Lots of fantastic history. Must do if you are in Prague. Keep your camera handy.
Prague Lankmark. Whilst this was beautiful, I must say it is just another church. If you get a good guide, then the stories are worth hearing.
We some!. Very impressive and so much to see and learn about! It would be very easy to spend a complete day just in here!

Breathtaking!. In my opinion, this is one of the highlights of visiting Prague Castle. St. Vitus Cathedral is amazing. First, it is massive. Second, the history represented is beyond words. Prague was the center of the Holy Roman Empire for a period of time. So much of that history is represented in St. Vitus Cathedral. A MUST when visiting Prague!!
Gorgeous architecture. Stunning church with brilliant architecture. Be sure to walk around the entire church and take in the detailed designs and beauty.
Exquisite cathedral!. Stunning architecture; should rank at par with the best in the world viz., cathedrals in Milan, Paris and Vienna.
Windows 10. Amazing stained glass windows, modern but very intricate, testament to the local glass workers whose products clutter many of the souvenir shops

Cathedral like no other. This cathedral was nothing like I've ever seen before. The details of the bronze/metal facade were so rich and breathtaking; the entire building covered a large section of the castle and looked spectacular from all angles. The inside of the church did not disappoint. Glass stained windows were beautiful and I loved how all the pillars/sections merged to the curved ceiling. I visited Prague before Paris so imagine my disappointment when I got to Notre Dame - this made Notre Dame Cathedral look like a chapel.

Beautiful cathedral, but also a money spinner. Huge cathedral situated in the heart of the Castle area. We visited on a bright sunny day so the colours from the stained glass windows was lighting up the whole interior. There is so much to see inside the cathedral, but the crowds make it so uncomfortable you just need to keep moving. You need to buy a permit to take photographs, but I’m not sure why people bother when you can download images from the internet or view images on Tripadvisor.

Stinning. This cathedral is the enormous gothic structure on top of the hill behind Prague Palace. Huge gothic spires and numerous gargoyles adorn the outside. On the inside you can view the beautiful stained glass windows. The cathedral has been built over numerous centuries with the last bit completed about 100 years ago. Just inside the entrance when you go under the arch under the big stained glass window there is a groove that runs from one side of the arch to the other. If there are 2 of you try talking into the groove and amazingly the sound will travel to the other side - a marvel of acoustics. I think entry is free into the back of the cathedral but if you want to walk around the chapels and up to the alter you have to pay a fee.
Gothic Catholic Cathedral. Gorgeous gothic cathedral worth visiting, as well as the rest of the Prague Castle where it's located.

Not to be missed#. This church is much more than the free view you can catch of inside. Alfons Mucha's stained glass window, for ex., is NOT visible from that perspective & is wonderful.The ceiling, nave, chapels, tomb/Chapel of St. Wenceslas, silver statues, gold door to the crown jewels, flying buttresses...unreal. Line for entry moved quickly. Can linger as long as you like. We came back later in day as well for look #2. The stained glass work is just a marvel!
Do Visit. Do go in. It has some beautiful architecture. Having a local guide helped understand the history behind this lovely cathedral.

Lovely Church near Prague Castle. Incredibly gorgeous church on the Prague Castle grounds. The architecture was stunning. Be warned- you need to purchase a "photo pass" in order to take pictures. And they will ask to see it.
Beautiful!. The interior and the various stories are fascinating! Get a good guide book or a tour guide so that you understand better.

Beautiful architecture!. Absolutely stunning cathedral, I think we spent a good hour in here looking around at all the amazing architecture. The cathedral is split in to different sections - each one is meant to tell a story. Lots of tourists so watch your bags! I am not a religious person but I still enjoyed visiting :)

Worth the wait. spectacular cathedral. very ornate and amazing work in there. Very crowded and difficult to work your way through the crowds. They need to put more scanners for ticket reading to move the traffic through.But well worth it.
Beautiful and very impressive. Don't miss it, it's got a lot of history and it's the central point of the Castle District. Well worth paying for a tour of the area

Beautiful Cathedral. This was a beautiful cathedral, and worth the price of admission just to see all the wonderful artwork (stained glass windows, sculptures, paintings, etc.). Even the building itself is gorgeous. Probably one of the coolest parts of the Prague castle.

Day and Night. I'd never seen anything this stunning (man-made) in my life, it was that much stunning. It's huge and you can admire every little details all around, up and down. It's also beautiful inside. I recommend going in around the time the sun light comes in through the stained glass windows. こんなに素晴らしい人工のものを見たことは無い！というくらいキレイで、圧巻されました。とても大きい教会ですが、どこも小さなところまで素晴らしいです。中に入るのは太陽がステインドグラスに差し込む時間をおすすめします。本当に美しかった。

Prague Tours. This place is a little bit crowded but you will feel the happiness when you reach this place.It was beautiful and it was in the center of Prague.easy to find and theres a lot of nice attractions as well around the areas.
Stunning stain glass windows. We went on a tour which was bus, walking and boat and would have liked to spend a little bit longer here it was beautiful.
Amazing!. One of the greatest places I've seen. Jaw dropping, beautiful architecture and very well preserved..
Wonderful. Wha a wonderful Cathedral, steeped in history. Fabulous stain glass windows.. Very peaceful and calm.

Must see! . Just beautiful inside more than the outside!
Don't miss this place, you should read the history before, it's very interesting!
Praga Cathedarl. It was an amazing Cathedral. They have also the names of Cathedral of San Wenceslao and Cathedral of San Adalberto

Amazing architecture!. This one was the highlight of castle tour. Magnificent from outside and exquisite inside. The queue to enter was a deterrent though, but it moved fast.
Easily the most photographed monument in castle complex.

Awesome Cathedral Atop Prague Castle.. A visit to the Prague Castle is not complete without a visit to St. Vitus Cathedral. It looks and feels awesome inside this masterpiece, which took 585 years to build. No wonder it's considered Prague's Pride.

Beautiful!. Lovely architecture - the stained and painted glass windows are beautiful. Very busy with other visitors. Not really an opportunity to just sit down and enjoy the atmosphere or say a quick prayer as all the benches were roped off.

Very Interesting!. We walked here from the bottom of the hill and it was the most scenic trek, it was beautiful! But unfortunately we got there after close and couldn't see the inside. Just the architecture on the outside alone was worth visiting though!
Visit at night!!. This is an amazing building. I would also highly recommend visiting at night when it is lit up. The detail in the cathedral building is out of this world.

Stunning and Imposing. The architecture of this cathedral is amazing. The towering spires, the gothic gargoyles and the Cathedral interiors are all fabulous. The imposing size of this place and the high ceilings with fantastic Christian murals adorning the walls are all great sights to behold.
Please dont miss visiting this place.

Impressive cathedral. St.Vitus Cathedral is a part on B circuit in the Castle of Prague. A gothic and neogothic cathedral , impressive by arhitecture , stained glasses and atmosphere . It is not a place for meditation , because is crowded with tourists . The cathedral is a must see in the castle and in Prague.
beautiful!. Beautiful cathedral inside and outside. You should definitely go in if you are already at the castle. There was a queue to go in but it goes pretty fast.
Gothic Masterpiece. Beautiful Cathedral with stunning architecture a very impressive structure. Part have been rebuilt over many centuries but took 6 centuries to complete.

Stunning sight. You may have to queue to enter but it is well worth the wait. The outside is breathtaking but do not look until you have walked right across the courtyard with your back to the cathedral.
Gargoyles galore. Bbeautiful historic church even in the rain, or more so as I loved the gargoyles. Very crowded. Part of the castle visit

Glorious building!. What a beautiful building! What a place full of beauty, history and fabulous stained glass windows! Make sure you hire a guide so you find out everything there is to know about it!

Beautiful. When you visit Prague castle where St Vitus is, first go to the story of Prague building and the Mucha museum in the new town before you visit the cathedral. Mucha made some of the stained windows.It is a beautiful cathedral which was finished in the 20th century.

A hidden gem . Took us ages to find it but it was definitely worth it! You can pay a small amount to climb the 300 steps to the top of one of the towers and it's well worth it! Would highly recommend visiting!
Mucha. Keep a sharp eye out for the large Alfons Mucha created stained glass window. You'll know it when you see it. The church is visual overload if you love seeing stained glass church windows.
Very ornate. Very ornate with many very colourful stained glassed windows. Have to pay to wander round the Cathedral, but the main items can be seen from the entrence
Awe-inspring building. A very awe-inspiring cathedral, which tall gothic ceilings. We didn't buy a ticket, so had to stand in the nave area and admire the church from a distance.
Stunning. Stunning building. Can see most of the inside without paying so bare that in mind before choosing a package to pay inside the castle

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. The Cathedral is very nice and in Gothic architecture. The stained glass windows are beautiful, the mosaics are lovely and there are quite a few treasures if you want to pay for it. It is worth the trip overall.

Enormous gothic Cathedral within the Prague castle grounds . Beautiful and gig stick gothic church of St. Vitus cathedral. Entering the Prague castle grounds is free and so is St. Vitus. Beautiful from outside with great detail and complex design. Beautiful courtyard to admire for few minutes.

Breathtaking. While the entire Prague castle complex is a sight to behold, nothing quite prepares you for this cathedral. Its absolutely breathtaking, and no picture can possibly explain the exquisite work of art that this structure is. Strong advise is to go with a guide or you'll just get lost in the marvel
Amazing!. There are no words to describe its beauty, Amazing spires, architecture and beautiful interior. Enter and enjoy it!

More beautiful outside than inside. I may be worn out on Cathedrals after 20 days in Europe and 5 countries. The stain class windows were lovely, and one set was very unusual. I appreciate that the Czechs are very proud of it.

Not to be missed. One of the most amazing cathedral I have ever been to! Better than Notre Dame in Paris. Architecture is amazing, it is beautiful! Inside it is amazing as well, beautiful windows, high dome, nice statues. Essential stop in Prague castle!
Amazing.. Amazing cathedral. Beautiful architecture, even if this is not your thing you cannot fail to be impressed! Outside more fascinating than the inside.
Impressive gothic church. You will enjoy going to visit it. I would suggest if you have not enough time to go in in the first part. Could be enought

Historic gothic catgedral. Unbelievably beautiful. Very disappointing that people have no respect for the reverence of the cathedral and the use of cameras and especially flash cameras.
I believe that individual tourist guides should be held responsible for their group adhering to the request of no flash cameras

Very interesting example of gothic church architecture . This is one of the most extreme examples of gothic church architecture I can remember seeing. It fits perfectly in a city like Prague. I don't know much about it, other than it is located inside of Prague Castle. I did not pay the fees for more information when I was there, having been to so many church buildings, I am somewhat through paying to tour them. This particular church building, although interesting, seemed so "dark" that I cannot ever imagine worshipping there. Fascinating to look at, equally fascinating to consider what made anyone build it.
Stunning. Part of the Prague castle complex and you need time to make it part of your visit, excellent history by the guide whic hmakes it a better experience.
Must See Cathedral!. By the castle, the Cathedral is semi-free (You can get in for free buy must pay to see most of the treasures. Beautiful architecture and stunning windows. Enjoy!

A Prague staple. Its free to walk around the cathedral and even the front entrance, but you have to buy a ticket (single or part of a package) to see more. The audio guide isn't cheap but adds a lot to the experience. It will be crowded but it is a worthwhile visit.
Great Story. Listening to our local guide describe the effort that when into this structure and the reason for it made it all the more interesting. Great vaulted interior, interesting nooks.

Plano sending the day. As with nearly all such attrzctions, either join a tour or rent an audio tour. You will enjoy the experience and learn so much more. If you are a photo enthusiast, buy the license permitting photos. It is inexpensive and provides all the souvenirs of my trip.The castle, cathedral, Rosenberg palace, golden stretch all are beautrful. The historical context makes it all so interesting and the description of the architecture and artwork, make it even more beautiful. Walk slwly,take your time and remember to look up and not at your shoes or phone, you will miss a lot.
Worth the climb, for architecture lovers.. I didn't go inside due to the massive amounts of tourists, but the views outside were splendid enough. Definitely worth the climb.

Sooo cultural!!. A must 'see' on your to do list. Reasonable price to enter, and well worth the money. totally awesome! Big mistake though not to hire a guide. A guide, or audio is a must for most of the buildings in Prague.
Gorgeous. Gorgeous interior. You can get in for free but you can't walk around the whole place without a ticket. Worth it!!
Awe inspiring!. Beautiful inside and out. Luckily once tour groups get in and out the line to go inside moves quickly. No photos were allowed to be taken inside though.

Amazing architecture, terribly bland audio tour.. This building is absolutely stunning, a must-see. However, the audio tour is dreadfully factual and bland--near unbearable. It makes for a visit that ends up being a bit of a let-down. Unforgettable architectural achievement regardless.

WOW!. Well what an incredible building. We walked around the outside of this beautiful Cathedral in awe of it. The detail on all of it is really amazing. This is a must see building in the city. I could have walked around it for hours!
A must see in Praque. Cathedral reminded me Barcelona's Sagrada Familia, but it it would stand up on it own to any other cathedral in the world and is a must visit place when in Prague.
Beautiful Cathedral Overlooking Prague. Beautiful architecture and interesting exhibits inside. The views of the Cathedral are stunning from different angles.

Magnificent Stain Glass. This Cathedral is absolutely stunning. The sun shinning through the stain glass was truly amazing! I have not seen the colors nor how they were pieced before in other works of art. By paying extra to save the nave and other areas was well worth it. We truly have to say Thank You to the artisans that spent time and effort to create something so beautiful and have it last so long. Magnificent!

Beautiful Cathedral. Take time to admire the outside of it. This is a beautiful gothic cathedral that is still used as a church. We visited in July and it was very crowded. If you are visitng Prague Castle go straight to this Cathedral for 9am when it is opening.

Centre of castle district . A great central cathedral of an even bigger castle district, magnificent piece of gothic art on the hills of prague overlooking the city. To get in its no money, to get in the tower you have to pay though. Which isn't necessary since the castle district itself gives you an amazing view over the city already.
Stunning architecture. A must see if you are interested in gothic and medieval architecture. The outside as well as the inside is stunning. But as most of these places, it is overrun with tourists.
Beautiful Stained Glass Windows. Lovely old Cathedral, beautiful stained glass windows. I didn't like the fact you had to pay extra to see the alter and nave. It does get very busy with large crowds.

Amazing. The architecture is amazing, you can sit and stare for hours. A very unique cathedral. The way up is beautiful (though its steep) but the streets are full of tiny stores and restaurants to have a beer on your way up. It is not expensive to visit the cathedral.

Better things to see with less crowds...... Heavily crowded and not a lot to actually see apart from buildings.... the buildings are heavily empty (as in there is pretty much no furniture in most of the buildings you can actually look around). Unless you are prepared to pay the extortionate fee for the audio guide or tour guide then there is very little information as you walk around. It is a lovely cathedral to visit however it is a lot of effort and extremely claustrophobic for a view of a building.....
Nice windows . The different of here with other cathedral is the windows I feel. Extremely length window with painting is the most attractive part. And the gate of it worth care also

Gothic and Beautiful!!!. This is still a functioning Catholic Church. The Church was undergoing reconstruction as of August, 2015, when my wife and I were there. It is a medieval, Gothic Church--massive in size. From its nave, one can view magnificent stained glass windows, which revival any of those in western Europe.
The stunning cathedral. It is stunning cathedral in the centre of the castle. It was pretty crowded when we visited it, but it was worth to wait in the queue.

Busy, beautiful buildinbg. Beautiful building but there should be a ban on selfie sticks. Small area for the non paying visitors can make it very crowded. Get there just after opening for slightly less of a crowd. THe building itself is welll worth a visit
Amazing stained glass windowns. One of the main attractions in the center of Prague castle, St Vitus Cathedral is one which amazes with it's stained glass windows and wonderful decor.

Dominating Prague`s landmark. St Vitus Cathedral,a Gothic masterpiece standing with in the confines of Prague castle; is the largest & most important religious place for the Czech Christians & the city`s top tourist attraction .It also serves as the internment of the remains of the sovereigns,noblemen,archbishops & patron saints.I entered the Cathedral through the portal in the western facade between the 2nd & 3rd courtyards of the castle.The bronze door is decorated with reliefs from the history of the cathedral & the legends of St Wenseslas & St Adalbert.The chapel of St Wenceslas is the cult center of this cathedral & most important patron saint.The walls have precious stones & stained glass windows with magnificent decorations & wall paintings of the `Passion Cycle`in the Golden portal.The south-western corner of the chapel leads to the crown chamber with its Royal jewels.The nearby `Great south tower` holds the biggest bell dating to the 16th century.You can climb the over 90 meters height with about 300 steps to have a superb view of the castle & the city.For an entry to the first part of the cathedral you don`t require to purchase a ticket but you have to have one for the whole cathedral viewing.

A must do in Prague!. Absolutely gorgeous!Probably the most beautiful cathedral i have ever seen and the scale is epic. The stain glass windows are really something to see and each window is completely different in its shades and colours. Stunning!Only bad part was having to fight the crowds to see it and of course you can only walk in the door for free and then 10 feet in there is a barricade whee you have to pay to see more...Which was a bit annoying.
Amazing. It is magnificent take so many pics but hard to get best angle it is so impressive. Inside and out.. Try different times to avoid sun
Stunning. It was somehow not overwhelming despite its sheer size and the number of stained glass windows. Very easy to spend time staring up at everything in wonder.

Impressive and beautiful, though full of tourists. It's impressive and beautiful, particularly inside. Even with all the tourists, though I would've liked to go there with less people around me. I'm glad one is able to enter the building even without a ticket (though a ticket is needed to go further inside).

enjoyable, with or without a ticket. Be sure to purchase the license to take photos (50 kcs). The line to enter may seem long, but that line includes the people who want to just step inside and have not paid to tour the entire church. Try to get there early if you want a picture of the exterior of the church from the front. . there's not a lot of room between the courtyard gate and the church's entry. You can also get a good photo from the rear of the church; be patient and the crowds will clear.

£3.00 to see the Castle. its around 250czk (£6.50) to entry to castle but if your a student then just 125czk (£3.00) this being a standard ticket , there is 10 areas of the castle in which you can visit but with a standard you are only allowed in 6 areas, including the cathedral, golden lane. it does take all day so bring water, the staff are very helpful and all really good English.
Good Place. A must visit place in prague, Peace full atmosphere, holy feeling every where. Nice experience. Good Place
Amazing . It's another "must see" in Prague, a cathedral located on the castle square. Amazing craftsmanship make this place unique, just come and see.

Beautiful!. This church is gorgeous. Make sure you walk all the way around it and look at all the detail from the ground up. It was rather busy when we were there, but that was to be expected. there are some really good spots outside of the church that you can get pictures of Prague from above.
Jewel in Prague's crown. Probably the most impressive part of the Prague Castle tour, with its stunning exterior & interior, and stained glass windows. Worth the wait & the crowds.

You should visit...is amazing place...:-). Is one of the buildings you should definetelly visit in Prague, is such amazing building, whole Prague Castle area is amazing, but this is absolutely superb. :-) We have such amazing city :-) Enjoy everybody :-)

Awesome experience. Best about this church is getting there. You have to walk up to the castle and find a route to the actual church through alleys and gateways before you reach the actual church. We has a great journey setting St. Vitus as our destination for the day and exploring the Old Town and Prague Castle while getting there!It is free to walk around, we didn't pay a dime for anything else but food and coffee when we had our trip up. We really enjoyed the atmosphere around the church, it's largeness took us by surprise! We spent almost an hour just looking at all the small details of the building and reading about it's history.Wear comfortable shoes guys!
Best Cathedral. Must see if any one in Prague one of the best Cathedral i have ever seen.with a best example to how to keep safe our old architectures.

Better to be seen in the internet... or many years ago.... i loved it when I was there in 1992 and I hated it in 2015. here was a huge queue, and once inside we almost could not see anything (many works going on), and above all we could not sit and pray, which is really strange in a church. In 1992 it was a really lovely cathedral, a holy place. Now it is just an expensive tourist spot. I was really disappointed.
Monumental. We went inside ( into the payable area ) and saw the amazing painted windows , the monuments and piece of our history.

St. Vitus Cathedral was unexpectedly and utterly jaw dropping. You have to be kidding me, this place is breathtaking. Do not come to Prague and miss the castle, and especially St. Vitus Cathedral. It is totally on par with the finest cathedrals we've seen in the UK or Italy. In fact, plan to spend the better part of a full day exploring Prague Castle and Strahov Monastery, with a lunch break at one of many local restaurants located nearby.

C. Very nice place to visit , takes u back in time . The cathedral is grand and imposing , speaks volumes of the history associated with it . It's very well preserved and is a must see tourist attraction .
Beautiful gothic design. Beautiful interior, good gothic design; going to the washroom costs money, no flash on cameras allowed.

Tourist Hell Hotspot. Lovely Cathedral but too many tourists during the day. Go first thing to avoid a tourist nightmare, however, without people, it is a lovely building, more interesting on the outside for photos.

Grand and Impressive. This one of the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe we have seen so far. It is ancient and extremely beautiful. Unfortunately, we went in the late evening and could not get an entry. The view from the top of Prague is supposed to be very beautiful. So ensure you book ahead.

A must visit. This is part of the Prague Castle complex. It is a major Czech cathedral. It is worth reading your guide book or listening to a tour guide to appreciate the cathedral. I did schedule my visit to arrive at opening time and I did get a few minutes without crowding. Visiting in the summer, there was good daylight and I also came after inside visits closed and had an opportunity to get good pictures with less difficulty and fewer visitors in the view. Also it is worth learning about St Vitus and why the cathedral recognizes him.

Impressive landmark. This was so crowded inside when we visited that it was really hard to appreciate. However, the stained glass inside, including one panel by acclaimed Czech painter Mucha, is beautiful. The outside of the cathedral is impressive as well with it's tall towers that stand out all over Prague.
Gothic!. Incredibly well-preserved cathedral with exquisite attention to detail and excellent architectural examples.

Beautiful Cathedral. We got a pass and checked out a number of things in the palace area. This cathedral was one of the most magnificent that we saw during our trip through Europe. The cathedral is busy. You can get in for free, but you can only stand at the back. The pass allows you to walk all the way through and see throughout the church.

Take a camera!. Despite living near to a wonderful Cathedral in England, this one is definitely worth a visit and is easily just as impressive. It is a splendid building that comes to life at night when it's lit up. Don't miss it!
Enormous and fabulous. the cathedral towers over Prague wherever you are. Very impressive from inside and outside. Worth going up to the castle to visit.

The biggest castle complex. Along with the Charles Bridge and Prague Castle one of the most beautiful places in Prague. I can recommend to visit this castle complex (one of the biggest in Europe) in the night with less tourists. You can go there by tram No. 22. Should you wish to enter inside, than you have to go during the day.

Amazing cathedral , worthwhile visit. Lucie from Good Prague tours did a fantastic tour of the cathedral and the St Vitus cathedral. we were totally bowled over by this amazing piece of work. so much history on how this was erected. I strongly suggest a visit to this cathedral it is definitely worth a visit.

A Cathedral Not To Be Missed. We saw many cathedrals in Vienna, Salzburg, Budapest and Prague, but this was one of our two favorites. Take your time, there's a lot to see -beautiful stained glass, Saint Wenceslas (Good King Wenceslas) is buried here too. Make sure you also climb the 297 steps to the bell tower for wonderful views.
Beautiful.. St. Vitus Cathedral is one of the many great attractions in the castle area. We had a terrific guide who provided great insight into everything we saw.
Pristine Cathedral. Beautiful church, with amazing painted glass interiors that shine in sunlight. One of the highlights of our trip to Prague. Must visit.

Yes, Another Ccthedral but Oh What a Cathedral. You have been traveling around Europe and have seen dozens of cathedrals and here you are in Prague and up at the castle. Should you go in? Absolutely! We got up to the castle area early and found that the church did not open until 9am and a ticket was needed to see it all. There is restoration going on with the altar so it was not all visible but it is still spectacular.
Absolutely georgeous. Be sure to explore the individual chapels and examine the beautiful architecture throughout the structure. The shrines are of particular interest. Don't miss it.
Perfect. It is the most beautiful cathedral I have ever seen; interior architecture of this bulding is great and unique.
Amazing. awe inspiring beauty, Gothic architecture:Amazing craftsmanshipIf too crowded, go early next day; since ticket is good for two days (Prague card used)
Very fine monument. Splendid church with fine interior and plenty of history. Yet, Lorette has more charm and less visitors. Still, a must-see if you visit the castle.
Gothic. Gothic buildings and amazing architecture, I wondered how to make a building that is rich in art. Relax while look around and read the histories that exist in this place.
Amazing!! buy a ticket and go right inside. Amazing!! buy a ticket and go right inside not just the free access part. There is so much history and beautiful stain glass
Impressive. Impressive architecture over a 500 year build period - yes 500 year! They managed to keep the same thread across the years!

Wow!!. So so beautiful!! I'm not a huge lover of cathedrals but this one is wow! Well worth a visit!! I would recommend taking a tour of Prague with a guide to get a feel for the place. We took a tour our first day and then re-visited the places we wanted to look at more the following day!

The Castle's Spires in the "City of 100 Spires". Prague is known as the "City of 100 Spires." And when you enter the city you understand why. And there might not be any more prominent that the three at St Vitus Cathedral on top of the hill at Prague Castle.It is a massive Gothic Cathedral with quite a bit to look at both inside and outside. It may not be the most famous, or loveliest Gothic Cathedral in the world, but is definitely worth a stop to see if in Prague. And the fact that it has clear windows rather than traditional stained glass makes the heavy gothic cathedral feel relatively light and airy inside, and bright enough to see things in comparison to some of the other darker and more known Cathedrals.

Most amazing stained glass windows. Along with all the crowds off we went to visit St.Vitus. Sunday it doesn't open until 12 so keep that in mind. People jumping queues which is annoying...however worth the wait. Sheer size and the stained glass windows are just beautiful. A must visit in Prague

beautiful. one of the most beautiful churches/cathedrals I have seen in my travels and I generally always walk through one when I am nearby. huge and intimidating with so many little intricate details inside and out.

A beautiful and stunning cathedral. We went to the St. Vitus Cathedral in the night as part of a Walking Tour and it was just out of this world. There were no crowds and we were able to get a lovely uninterrupted view of the cathedral. It is beautifully lit up in the night. The difference in the architecture styles from when it was first started and by the time it was finished-- is remarkable. A must see. Very easy to reach -- by tram. Or if you prefer a good walk -- you can walk up to the castle area.

Check first and pay latter ;). Spectacular cathedral but everybody can enter till the churches hall. I advised to go there first and see if is really worth it to buy the ticket to see the rest. I had the tour A ticket, otherwise i wouldn't have paid.

Beautiful. I have visited some lovely cathedrals in my time and this is one of the best, so pretty. There is some major historical tombs and artefacts here and as for the windows WOW, such a lovely place, well worth a visit!
The gem of Prague Castle. This imposing building at the centre of Prague Castle is well worth a visit, it has amazing architecture and artworks
Perfect!. It is easy and fast to get there either waking or through transportation. This is the main attraction around the Castle area.

Stunning. We bought tickets for Circuit B for Prague Castle and it included the cathedral. We had only limited time in Prague but the cathedral was a priority. It filled all our expectations. This was one of the most beautiful cathedral we have so far visited. The architecture is just stunning. Pictures cannot completely capture the ambiance and beauty of the place. You can take the pictures without flash. I would have loved to sit for a moment and to soak the atmosphere, but the chairs are not available to sit on during the visiting hours. The cathedral s open only until 5 pm even in summer so allow enough time.
stunning setting. This is a stunning setting up on the hill well worth the crowds and the walk,Take a big memory card for your camera.
See Wenceslaus Tomb. Lovely Gothic church with a few stained glass windows and the tomb of King Wenceslaus and other royalty. Get the audio guide.

Splendid Gothic-design catherdral. I was mesmerised by this church. It is the dominant building within the Prague Castle complex. A Gothic masterpiece, it is a visual treat for every visitor, even if you don't visit the inside area. Highly recommended. Better to go with a tour guide to get all the information about it.
Great Rail Journeys - Beijing to London. This is stunning, worth buying a ticket to see all of it. Well worth a visit & very impressive inside & out.

Another Gothic splendour. Massive and magnificent interiors. Bound to exhilarate you as you walk in. From the outside itself, is a view to behold. What a hair-raising experience. There are various additions of the cathedral. Must visit for the whole family!

Must visit. Shouldnot miss this for anything.have been to some of the most beautiful churches in Europe and this is one of the best. We would have almost missed it. Take tram 22 to go to the cathedral + castle. Inside you can take photos without paying fees. But you have to have a ticket to go to the front,. The exteriors are also very beautiful. Using a fee you can go to the top of the south tower as well. But without a fee , you can have a view of the entire prague from just outside the cathedral.

What a Wonder. This was probably my favorite church on my 6 country vacation. The beautiful gothic architecture was breathtaking. Both outside and inside were wonders that are a must see. Tickets are required for entry, and can be bought just a few minutes away. The tickets are good for most of the Castle District and last for 2 days. Please please please go see this church.
Colored glass. It's beautiful from the outside, but prettier from the inside. Pictures can't catch this breathtaking view of colors hitting you.

One of the most beautiful works of art in Prague. This cathedral is magnificent. Althought it's huge, there are many details in every inch of it. I went there on a Saturday with a guide and she told many stories about it, then had to go there again on the next day to take more photos of it. You can go inside and see it for free, but also pay if you want to visit more places inside of it. The Sunday I've been there, while the guards were changing shifts outside, the cathedral bells started sounding and they went on for 15 minutes nonstop. That was a beautiful experience.
Amazing . If you think Notre Dame is good you are in for a surprise. This beats it hands down. Only thing missing is the hunch back! Beautiful cathedral.
Grand. Beautiful very intricate and stunning architecture fantastic inside too. We loved all the detail on it.
Amazing architecture. Amazing building at Prague Castle. This cultural heritage is one of the most beautiful what i saw. The castle is nice.

Overlooking. The cathedral is amazing -- inside and out. The stained glass windows are marvels. So so much history, as I have reviewed other places in Prague, here too, knowing some of the history will be a added bonus for your visit. I find myself now reading after my trip, to learn more.

One of pragues jewels. This place gets very busy, so go early to miss the queues. Having said that the queue does keep moving and the Cathedral is worth it when you get inside. One piece of advice, the tickets need to be purchased before entering the Cathedral or the Castle. Both are well worth a visit and good value.

Magnificent Cathedral. This cathedral is huge and is impossible to not spend some time looking to it and watchinf its beauty and details. It is one of the main places in Prague and deserves its reputation. Inside is also nice but was a pity that was so crowded with people talking so loud (you couldn't feel the athmosphere inside).

Well. The cathedral is wonderful, recommend it, it eas a hot day and we have walked a lot that particular day, the lines are just too big, but when you enter, it is all worth it. Even non-religious people should visit it.

Amazing stain glass windows!. We have visited several of the great European cathedrals, and we think the windows of this church were the most beautiful of all. The reds, greens, blues, and golds are absolutely heavenly and not to be missed. For us these were the highlight of the castle complex.
Nice church. This is a nice church with a lot of history. The amont of tourists visiting the church is a bit high for a maximum exprience but abselutely worth a visit.

A good segment of the palace tour.. Take tram #22 and get off at the palace. Buy a ticket for the combination of buildings you want to tour. We loved the Mucha window but others might prefer the more conventional religious stained glass windows which were also spectacular.

Beautiful. Inside is amazing with its high vaulted ceilings. Unfortunately it was simply packed with large tour groups that wouldn't move as they listened to their guide. Perhaps limit the number of individuals in at any time? Impressive, but we slipped out as soon as we could, but it was simply too difficult to move around.
Impressive Cathedral. It's the largest cathedral in the world and when you stand in the Prague Castle courtyard you are back inC9 when it was built.

Highpoint of Prague. The st. Vitas Cathedral is high above Prague's center and is one of the most bueatiful I have seen in Europe. The flying buttresses are magnificent, and the stained glass windows are wonderful....
Interesting Cathedral. Interesting Cathedral although very busy during my visit. Worth a visit but my view is that many Cathedral have a great similarity

Piece of Art. Every time i go there and look to this huge structure i wonder how people back there with no modern technology and tools could build such Piece of Art.
Must see in Prague
Spectacular. you have to enter the cathedral! Without paying for the ticket you can still enter but you get to see only part of it, which is enough for those who just want to have a look

Imposant building on the hill. The cathedral is a architectural jewel, a little dark inside but definitely worth a visit. Amazing stained glass windows, high pillars and arcades and rich history. Complete visit only with the ticket including Prague castle/Golden lane/Treasury but also without a ticket you can enter and enjoy the main part of St vitus.
Beautiful Church. One of the most ornate and decorated Cathedrals. The stained glass was beautiful. Look for the window that Mucha created. There is so much to see here.
Trip with my daughters. Such a beautiful Cathedral. Totally suggest paying the extra bit to walk the beautiful gardens down to the town area below.
Amazing architecture. Amazing architecture. Lots of details to explore, you can take amazing pictures. Beautiful spot !!!!

A staggering piece of gothic architecture. The Bohemians do Gothic like nobody else! The Cathedral is magnificent and combines mediaeval gothic with early 20th century images and stained glass elegantly and with a distinctly Czech flair. It holds mausolea for, among others, St. Wenceslas; well worth a visit!

Impressive piece of history. i could spend hours contemplating this monument, as it is impressive and hard to imagine how they could build something like this back in the days.
Its definitly something one must see in prague.
WOW. Beyond words. In our three days in Prague this is one of the very best sights. A must. Of the various sights of the Castle Hill, this is number one.
Just nice . Having visited many places in Europe I must say that I was a bit disappointed cause expected to be more magnificent. Many parts were closed to public due to restoration.

Beautiful Cathedral. First time we went (5 years ago), you could tour entire cathedral for free. Now you can just come in and see a bit of it, but have to pay to see everything. As I recall, it would have been worth it to see the alter area and the tombs; we just didn't have time. If at the Prague Castle, you must see this church!
Beautiful building. Have visited here at least three times now and will do so again if we take other family members or friends to Prague.

Worth the price of admission. This is a very large and beautiful church located within the palace grounds. The stained glass windows are so pretty and the church has many side chapels with artwork and sculptures that are lovely.

Impressive cathedral!. Tickets easily bought, while busy it didn't seem overcrowded. Huge, impressive architecture, beautiful stain-glassed windows. No sense of being rushed, photography no problem. Well worth a visit. Would have been rated five, except some restoration work was being done meaning we couldn't see certain areas.

Icon of Prague Castle. The most important church in Prague with its Gothic architecture, I felt speechless when i saw, and also speechless to describe don't miss it, and climb the 260 steps to reach the tower and to have a panoramic view of Prague
Impressive Cathedral!. This cathedral is for sure in line with other famous ones - Notre Dame, St Paul's etc! Certainly worth a visit for the architecture!

Not to miss in Prague. After seeing lots of cathedrals throughout Europe we thought this would be another nice one. Very surprised to see it was one of the best. Definitely buy the ticket and get beyond the crowds and definitely buy the audio guide. Better guide that our river cruise had.

Look out for all the bride and grooms taking wedding photos!. The cathedral dominants the skyline from any location in Prague and was well worth a visit. We bought a Prague Card that allowed free admission to many of the main attractions, including the cathedral. It is enormous!
church. .Just another church..You get over churches after awhile. We were on a tour so it was part of it. If you like old churches go for it.

Sensational. It's in the grounds of the palace and dominates the Prague skyline.
It's beautiful and worth taking the time to walk around inside it with an audio guide.
Lovely cathedral. We did 4 capital cities over a three week period and were cathedralled-out by the end, but this was our favourite from our trip.
Beautiful windows. Love the designs of the windows and the interior design. Its huge with lots of stories. Long queue to enter though.
Great view. One of the most favourite landmarks in Prague, it is fascinating, everyone should visit it! It is not far from Malostranska
One of many lovely cathedrals in the city. Interesting cathedral, but after a while they all tend to look the same. Visit if you're in the Prague Castle of course, but it wasn't spectacular.

Impressive Cathedral. We were on a trip to Budapest, Vienna and Prague and saw a lot of churches. This one was the most impressive. We bought a ticket that allowed us to go through away from all the tourists. It was well worth it.

Great Cathedral. Mighty and beautiful. One of the windows made by Mucha drawing. You can see the vaults by coming in, but for closer it's necessary to buy a ticket. Ticket is good for visiting several more places in the Royal Castle area.

Most beautiful church in Prague and in the Czech Republic. You can enter the cathedral without ticket, but you need a ticket to explore it. We recommend you to buy a combined ticket, also valid for the old royal palace, the St George's basilica, the golden lane, ... The stained glass windows are magnificent (don't miss the Mucha one). Located within Prague castle, the St. Vitus Cathedral contains the tombs of many Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors, The most outstanding place is the Chapel of St. Wenceslas, the patron saint of the Czech state. The tomb of John of Nepomuk is also very impressive.

A must see in Prague!. This is easily one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have ever seen, both outside and inside. Note that you don't have to pay the tour price to get a good look; there is a considerable area inside the cathedral that is free to access. If you pay the admission fee (combined with other Prague Castle sights) you can walk all the way up to the front altar. We just did the free version and thought it was worthwhile.

Was totally amazed. The amount of talent displayed its sometimes too much to capture in one visit. Totally amazingly beautiful! Every corner is decorated with a different form of art.Lots to see you must spend at least half day in the castle. The cathedral is right next to it. The views of the city from the castle are absolutely stunning !

Amazing Cathedral. I can easily say that its one of the symbols of Prague. it has amazing view. Definitely it is perfect place who likes taking a pictures. Every corner of the city has history and amazing views such as this Cathedral.

Visit on a weekday if you want to experience the true silent beauty of this place.. This is a beautiful building but on a Sunday, what should have been a reverent silence was broken by the large number of tour groups, with guides waving umbrellas, cruise ship signs and other devices to keep their herds intact while shouting their spiels in many languages.
Huge. To be seen from the botanical garden how huge it really is. From insight it is beautiful an majestic. It's impressive, and comparing to artistic Catholic Churches it seems pale and empty.
Beautiful cathedral, super view from the tower. The cathedral in beautiful inside and out, and if you don't have health issues, climb the 287 stairs up its tower, the view is wonderful.

A brilliant attraction.. A breath-taking cathedral that is beautiful both outside and inside. It has lots of wonderful stained glass windows. The only problem is you've got to hike up a steep hill to see it!

A street vibe I've never come across... Electric. Going in the evening in summer is electric! Thousands of people, a great feeling of revelry and entertainments, eat dinner, take it all in, watch street performers, watch town clock show and the magic as the sun sets, memories for ever.... Just wonderful
Very nice old cathedral. This big gothic cathedral has a lot yo offer: paintings, sculpture, religious statues, history, etc. it has a number of mini chapels inside so you can stop and pray.

Beautiful and certainly the best cathedral. This is absolutely stunning from outside and inside with amazing history and beautiful architecture. One must take an audio guide or authorised guide tours to dwell into centuries old history of this cathedral. This place is like the highlight of Prague Castle and they have two zones, although maximum part of of cathedral is free to access but their paid area is superb too. We certainly enjoyed every moment spent in that mesmerising cathedral which took us into a different world altogether.

Charming and absolutely notable. Absolutely stunning. It is worth to take your time /maybe even go for a Mass/ and go inside rather than just take superficial photos from the outside. The cathedral itself is absolutely huge and consists of many thoughout details. I would reccommend you to take the time and go inside when visiting Prague.

Important church and symbol to the people. This impressive facade of the church can be seen from everywhere in Prague. Inside, the church is rather dark and plain. But one can appreciate it for its importance to the people of PrGue who host our visit.
best part of castle tour. Absolutely stunning. This was well worth the castle ticket. What you see free is little compared to full entry. Well worth the visit.
Beautiful spires and very nice Cathedral. Beautiful and right at the square. To enter you go between two restaurants which doesn't make much sense but worth the effort.
Excelent view from the tower. The cathedral is beautiful and very big. From the tower you can see the whole city. But if you want to pray a bit, it's not that place, full of tourists and noisy.

Another grand Cathedral. You can get into the back half of the cathedral for free, which also gives you the full view to the front. We have always just taken visitors into the free part since we usually have many other Cathedrals included in our travels that are free to enter the entire place. If you have never been in a Cathedral and will not be going to another then paying to get into the entire thing may be worth it. Otherwise just take a peek inside and check out the stunning exterior.

Impressive and beautiful awe-inspiring architecture. The monument to visit in Prague, St. Vitus cathedral is full of history and amazing architecture spanning several centuries. Through a guide, I discovered quite a bit about why there are many different styles within the same building: From Baroque to Gothic to Art-Nouveau, etc... Different artists, different architects resulting in a beautiful and impressive cathedral. A must even if you're not into arts and history.

Choose a less popular time, it can be very crowded. The Gothic cathedral is located in the middle of the Prague castle, built in the 14th century. It is majestic, I particularly liked the elegant airy arches inside. In peak tourist hours the amount of people can take away some of part of this joy easily, I recommend to schedule this visit a little earlier or later during the day.
Beautiful but crowded. Very crowded with tourists! You can peek in from the back of the church for free but if you want to visit the altar, you'll need a ticket. Beautiful church!

A lovely place to see but once seen you can leave. We didn't do a tour. The place is a beautiful sight, but once I had taken a few pictures I was ready to leave!Worth going to see both at day and night but I personally don't feel it is worth paying for a tour guide to take you around!

One of the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe. I gave the cathedral a 5 because it is magnificent! We had a city guide who explained the beautiful windows and the architecture. The big disappointment was how rude and disrespectful many of the visitors were with their selfie sticks and loud voices! They didn't seem to even know that they were in a church. It ruined our visit.

Most beautiful cathedral around!. To me, this was the most beautiful interior cathedral that we saw on our European trip. Definitely the brightest cathedral that we saw. It’s very airy, bright, and beautiful. Even if the line is long…wait it out. It moves super fast. The stained glass windows were amazing. This was a hit.

Historic Cathedral inside Prague Castle on hilltop. As you enter the enchanting Prague castle on a hill top, the first place to visit is this famous St Vitus Cathedral. This huge cathedral of excellent architecture has lots of history within. Attracting lots of tourists, this cathedral is a must to visit while at Prague.the colourful glass panes with arts is a delight to watch.

Most interesting Catherdral in Prague. This is the most interesting building in Prague castle area.You can see Towers of St.Vitus from any place of Prague. Morethan 700years old Gothic architecture is listed on UNESCO world heritage list.
