Very nice both in side and out side.Entrance ticket for going in side catherdal is 250CZK.I recomended to go.Unfortunately some tourist have not been inside.
Amazing. Got to see this Cathedral it is amazing. It is so old & beautiful. The spirals are so unusual . Well worth a visit

Beautiful and Inspiring. An amazing piece of history is manifested in this beautiful Cathedral that has been built burned built again and reconstructed it is a most wonderful exhibition of the history of Prague and the kingdoms that have come and gone here make sure purchase the ticket that allows you to go beyond the entrance so that you may see the history of the bishops and the artwork the altars the sarcophagus is and the history associated with this wonderful piece of history at this UNESCO site

best Gothic cathedral. I have recently visited some gothic cathedral and I have to say that this is my favourite, I prefere it even to the most famous Notre-Dame in Paris. The Mucha window in this cathedral is one of the most beautiful thing.

Beautiful windows. It is worth visiting the cathedral just to see the beautiful stained glass windows. You can see some of them from the entrance to the cathedral, which is free, but to see them all a ticket is needed.

Stunning but.... Beautiful but full access is only available as part of a combined ticket for visiting other parts of the castle, costly if you just want to see the beautiful interior and stained glass windows.
Wow!!!. Wow!! Took us 3 hours to look around and the grounds in fact we walked from the hotel and back this took most of the day up but well worth it.
St. Vitus Cathedral. An amazing gothic building in amazing Czech city - Prague. Part of Prague Castle, part of Prague, part of us - Czech people :) Heart of our state!

Stunning Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral is absolutely gorgeous. The architecture is just breathtaking. There is so much to see inside the cathedral. You need a ticket to walk around the interior of the cathedral. I used the audioguide, which went into too much detail sometimes, but was helpful to have. I visited the cathedral at 9:00am in July and did not find it overly crowded. There were a few tour groups, which can be frustrating to be caught between. Most of the time, I had no trouble hearing my audioguide and had lots of space to myself. You do need to buy the photo permit to photograph the interior, but no one checked my permit at any point. I walked by St. Vitus Cathedral at around 12:00 and there was a huge line to get in. You should definitely visit early.
Get a guided tour round. A gorgeous building with much going on inside, get a guided tour round, a shame you can't go into St. Wencelaus's Chapel but they let you everywhere else. 5*
Don't make a special trip. Architecturally beautiful however internally inaccessible. Mosaic walls beautifully preserved but again, only really a photographic opportunity.

Impressive from outside. The cathedral is Impressive from the outside but inside it is quite meh. But still worth to go and visit. You can go inside also for free but need to pay if you want to go further in the cathedral.
Beautiful. We paid to go in here along with a couple of other buildings in the area and this was by far the best! Beautiful stained glass windows, intricate artwork and fantastic architecture.
Soaring Beauty. Gorgeous, soaring gothic cathedral with an interesting history. Be sure to check out the especially outstanding windows. These alone are worth the trip up the hill!
Beautiful sight. Beautiful, stunning architecture, vast and very atmospheric. worth the walk to it. would return again.

Must see in Prague . If you're going to see the Prague castle you will see this cathedral as well. It's inside the castle grounds, and in my opinion the most interesting thing to see at the grounds. You can go inside without buying a ticket, you'll be able too see the interior from the back of the cathedral. You'll see most of it from there but with the ticket you'll be able to walk around the place. Not as impressive as the Sagrada Familia at Barcelona but definitely worth a visit! Do visit earlier in the morning since it will get crowded.

Impressive cathedral. The church is really beautiful on architecture side, i'm atheist so i dont care about the religious side at all. During high season the place is extremelly crowded so just be ready for people pushing you!

Long climb up the hill. This is an interesting enough place however after a long tiring climb up the hill to visit it was a disappointment with so many people there, a continuous line of different nationals with their guides in a convoy, it was a hot day. A good idea would to go early in the morning by foot or taxi before the coaches arrive.

Beautiful exterior. From outside is a fantastic example of Gothic. Beautiful. Inside is not as rich as other Gothic cathedrals, like the ones in France or Spain. But, it's a must if you are in Prague.
Amazing structure. amazing location , not to miss anytime. It has so much history attached to it which is explained in the walking tours.

Very beautiful windows and doors. Beautiful. Beautiful windows, even doors. Each was unique and well maintained. Nicer than St. Stephen's in Vienna. Crowded with tour groups and no signs if you are interested in history or details of the church. You'll need audio tour for that. But it was beautiful and well worth visiting even without an audio guide.

Very impressive. The building is a sight to behold and well worth a walk to see, inside is also very beautiful although to see the entire inside you must buy a ticket otherwise you can only look from the very back of the church.
Great impression. At the end of a month there is a chance to attend mass in latin on Sunday. It is a great opportunity to be then at St. Vitus Cathedral and join the choir in beautiful songs.

Beat the crowds. Go at night. It's lit up beautifully.
You get to avoid the crowds and really appreciate the scale of it

Impressive. This building dominates the skyline and is full of stunning glass windows and artefacts. We visited early in the day and didn't have to queue. Personally I preferred thegargoyle on the outside of the cathedral, they were wonderfully repulsive.
Amazing. Stunning cathedral.. Be careful if u plans to visit it on Sunday. It's close from 11 till 13, due to church mass.
worth a peek. fantastic carvings on the outside and ceiling on the inside the rest is typical of most cathedrals anywhere but still i love cathedrals so enjoyed just being there.
Nothing much. If you've been to medieval cathedrals elsewhere you'll know it's not worth paying for. Yes! In Prague you have to pay to get into some of the churches!
Beautiful, imposing building. The jewel of old town square and Prague, this place is a sight to behold. The gothic architecture wil leav eyou speechless.

Massive cathedral. It is quite a stunning building, and fortunately well preserved through the world wars. I can't say, however, that I really found it to be as moving as some cathedrals. The whole castle complex, including St. Vitus, is an amazing place to spend time. If I were to visit again I would probably not bother to go inside Vitus Cathedral, but that's just me.

As excellent as everyone says. My son had told me he spent almost the whole day a few years ago and I was skeptical but almost did.The south tower was quite a climb (it's 287 steps on a single post spiral) but worth the view.Food and beverage very reasonable at the castle.
Beautiful Cathedral worth a visit. Stunning masterpiece of gothic era. The more time you spend inside, the more you won't want to go away.
Don't leave Prague without seeing this. The atmosphere, beauty and history of this cathedral which was built over many centuries is worth the visit, though early morning is best to miss the crowds.

Nice, but not really outstanding. People seem to really like this cathedral - but I found it quite boring - the stained glass windows did not really look that exceptional. It was actually the exterior that was more interesting - with the carved doors and the gargoyles. Maybe it would have been better with a guide.

Majestic Gothic Cathedral. This is one of the best Gothic cathedrals that I've been to. The stained glass is beautiful and the flying buttresses and gargoyles are extremely interesting for those interested in medieval architecture. Even with the many tourists clicking photos, the place seemed ever so sombre and majestic. It's certainly worth buying the ticket and taking a tour inside. At the entrance, the stained glass is beautiful but the older medieval glass is inside and its charm is unparalleled.

Seen better. Perhaps we have just been quite spoilt, but have seen nicer and more opulent churches and cathedrals. This is not to say it's not beautiful and certainly worth a visit while in Prague. Also you can see the main part for free!

Highlight of our visit to Prague Castle. The soaring ceilings and stained glass of this cathedral are tremendous. The highlight was seeing the 3700 lb silver coffin of St. John being displayed. Crowds were heavy but broke up after the entranceway.

One of the most beautiful cathedrals I have ever seen. The glass windows are amazing!. As this church has been build over many centuries, the glass windows are of the early 20th century. Don't miss the glass window on your left when you enter the cathedral : it is of Tsjechian Art Nouveau artist Mucha. The other windows are special as well. The most beautiful chapel in the cathedral is of St Wenceslas. It has a small door with 7 locks (the locks are hard to see) for 7 keys of important people and behind the door are the original crown jewels (so they say because you cannot see them). Also the grave of St John of Nepomuk is very beautiful.

Impressive . This building can be seen from the river and is probably the most imposing building of the Prague castle. I also thought it was the most impressive. To get in you need to buy a combined ticket that grants entry to a few other monuments in the castle grounds also. You can buy tickets on the day for CZK250 for an adult ticket. The church is really large and the architecture impressive.
sites to see. what an amazing cathedral the stain glass windows are huge and the colours when sun shining through light up the inside of the cathedral such a grand place to see

Don't stop on the outside. We visited the Prague Castle on a Sunday and there were services taking place while we were there. Some of our group went inside individually and as spectacular as it is on the outside, the inside is not to be missed based on their photos and description. If you are on a tour like we were, take time to go back to visit the inside of all the palaces, convents, etc. where you can take your time! Wish we had!

One of the most beautiful cathedral I have ever seen. Having travelled across Europe countries, I have seen my good share of cathedrals and stained glass. But upon entering St. Vitus Cathedral I found some of the most beautiful stained glass I had ever seen lodged in a grandiose cathedral. From the outside the cathedral is quite impressive and keeps that level of surprise upon entering it. The only thing I can regret is that due to time restraints and somewhat a certain level of non-interest from my friends, I didn't get to visit the other 2/3 of the cathedral which can only be entered by buying a ticket. In general I recommend to everyone to visit this beautiful landmark as it stands in a grand complex of beautiful architecture and ancient monuments.

Awesome Architecture. You must visit this cathedral and the castle, its well worth the long climb up the steps, and the view of the city is fantastic, really gives you a sense of the history of Prague

Visible from most parts of the city, worth the climb!!. Spectacular cathedral inside the walls of Prague castle. The stained glass windows are well worth the visit, as was the tombs and chapels. While the €10 entrance fee seems high, you do get to go inside 4 different attractions, including this one. A must see in Prague.

Beautiful. This is a beautiful church both on the exterior and interior. There are guided tours within the church which if time permited I would have done. But definitely worth a stop in to just be awed of all the intricate architecture details.
Gorgeous. GORGEOUS church with so much history! Get there early and it's not as packed with tourists! One of the best in Europe we have seen

Only part of Castle worth paying for. Huge in size with altars around the main altar. Sculptures and reliefs it is quite imposing. It has lines on the weekends but is less crowded during the week but lines move fast and there is a lot of room inside. You can get in without a ticket but must stay in the rear of the church as many people do.

Amazing views from the top!. I walked up the stairs in St Vitus and was really proud of myself! I believe its over 300, so make sure you're prepared for that before you embark! The view once you get to the top is second to none, and there are seats for you to catch your breath before taking it all in.Definitely worth visiting :)

Awesome. Awesome. Spend the extra money and go deeper into the cathedral. Well worth the euro to go in. Took lots of pics in here. Was probably the best place in Prague castle area. Though I am partial to the St. George Basilica.

Unique cathedral. St Vitus is a beautiful cathedral, many arquitectonic styles, as almost everything in Prague, lot of history, is part of the castle visit. Al lot of people, since the probably the best atraction within the compound for tourist. Not to be missed, better early in the morning when the crowds from busses are not there yet

Very pretty! A must visit. Prague got a lot of sights to see, this is one of our favourites!
It is even worth going in the evening time just to see the fantastic exteriour

Absolutely stunning!. St. Vitus Cathedral is one of the "must see" sights in Prague, and it is well deserving of this honour! The detail is awesome and you can spend hours there both outside and inside inspecting all that detail - in fact if you are not careful you might miss other sites you had wanted to see that day just because you are so enthralled with everything in this breathtakingly beautiful cathedral. Our seven year old daughter was also awestruck at St. Vitus, definitely put this into your tour calendar while you are visiting Prague! We highly recommend a visit.
Magnificent Cathedral. WOW! Great sight. Must see. So historic. Looks a bit like Notre Dame. Easy to get to. Right in historic Old Town.

Beautiful!!!. Absolutely beautiful!!! We bought the ticket combo that included the cathedral -- well worth it. You can see quite a lot of the cathedral without the special admission but if looking at European churches is something you especially enjoy, recommend getting the ticket for the more in depth tour.

Get a guide or audio tour for the best experience . I can't stress enough what a guide or audio tour will do to enhance the experience of this magnificent structure. A gothic colossal church with such intricate details both on the inside and outside. There is a small fee to enter but well worth it. The paintings and statues present the cities history like a movie. I have been to Many churches including notre damme and this is as or even more stunning.

Its alright, nothing special. Great views from in front of the castle grounds, its good to walk into, around without having to pay to go into certain attractions there. Entrance prices aren't too bad. You have a choice of what you want to see, but its mainly groped together. The main thing, St. Vitus Cathedral is worth a look at, lots of detail. Perhaps too much. Comparing it with other, less cluttered churches, its still very good.
Not to be missed (unless you do). Unfortunately we did not go inside at the start of our castle tour as queue too long, at the end they seemed to have closed earlier then they said.

worth seeing..not paying. This is a very impressive gothic cathedral with all the expected gargoyles, stained glass windows and statues. My issue was whether to pay the sum of a guide and I was so grateful that I didn't. The cathedral is as spectacular on the outside as it is on the inside. The queue to go in can be pretty long but always moving. As you enter the cathedral, as a non paying costumer, you are only able to enter the entrance which will lead into the main building. You are able to see the whole nave as well as the alter from afar and take as many photos as you can. If you have a good zoom on your camera, you won't be missing anything really. Now, I'm not saying that you shouldn't pay, but in comparison to other Cathedrals around Europe, it was 10mins in and out for me.

Go and take a look!. If in Prague, one must go and visit the Prague Castle. And right at Castle Hill you will see this magnificent Church. It is big and beautiful. But don't stop there. Go inside. Take a look and appreciate the interior and understand why and how the the early worshippers would want to build this church. They obviously have some religious experience. But in today context, you can still have the appreciation, be it the physical, spiritual or emotional experience.

Wow!!. When you walk into the cathedral you can't help but go Wow
It is a large cathedral and extremely beautiful
So much to see. It does take a while just to walk around the whole church
Out of this world. It was hot. We had young children and old parents. We had to climb the stairs. But.........it was OUT OF THIS WORLD. Mythical, magical, magnificent..........

An experience of peace and ancient ceremonies. As an enthusiast of all things to do with the religious life, this cathedral did not disappoint, there is an interesting contrast between the western and eastern examples of cathedrals and the atmosphere also feels different. I always great and thank the resident Angel who protects each religious building to ensure a unique connection with the holiness or otherwise of the building. You should try doing that.

Smokes Notre Dame. if you can avoid the crowds (this is the star attraction at the Castle), get the audio guide and take an hour to go through the sights of the Cathedral - piles of history, illustrating the often bloody hands of the local rulers.

Beautiful monument!. One of the most beautiful gothic churches I've ever seen! It is located right on top of the castle hill, so you must visit it if you go to the royal Palace. I suggest you go inside, as the interior is as beautiful as the outside!

Beautiful -- Must do!. This is a must see while visiting Prague. Make sure that you don't miss St. Wenceslas Chapel in inside. My advice is to get tickets before going inside. It is possible to enter the church without tickets, but you will only be able to see it from the back.Buying tickets can be a little confusing with the large number of people near and inside the church. You need to get tickets in the building opposite of the entrance to the church.

A nice, but average European cathedral. A large cathedral, but average for Europe. There is a price for entry which is not worth it if you have visited other cathedrals, such as Stephansdom in Vienna or Notre Dame in Paris.

Must see. Spectacular! Perfectly maintained and worth the hike. The views are wonderful and there are MANY things to see in this area. You can easily spend two days in this area to see everything. You will not be disappointed.

Worth visiting!. You have to visit it. It's located inside prague's castle. The ceilings are beautifully coloured and the statues are really interesting to see. It's a huge architectural building and it's really impressive.

WOW beauty to behold!. You will climb a serious flight of stairs to get up to St.Vitus but it is worth every step. The stained glass indoors is alone worth the visit. This architecture is simply amazing. It is located in the centre of Prague Castle and there is a line however, it is worth a trip in even if you do not have a ticket to access the back of the church.

Beautiful Cathedral in the center of the castle. A great Cathedral, the most beautiful attraction in the Prague castle. This cathedral can be compared with any of the big cathedrals of the catholic world. If you get to the castle in Prague, visit it.
Don't Miss It!. Incredible architecture and windows that create a true Holy place, as part of the Prague Castle complex. The Ste. Wineslas Chapel and tomb is especially beautiful.
Great tower. Be careful - 287 steps you should do before you reach the top of the St. Vitus cathedral tower. But it's the highest point where from Prague is like the toy

Crowning Jewel of Prague Castle. This Gothic Cathedral is stunning with several beautiful stained glass windows, including one designed by Alphonse Mucha. While it was crowded when we visited, the queue moved quickly and you were able to see everything. The Cathedral itself is reminiscent of Amiens Cathedral with its vaulted ceilings and long center aisle.

Truly a Place to Visit. We visited Prague during Christmas. This is a beautiful place, where you should visit. It does get very busy with big tour groups in the afternoon. Husband and I arrived at the Palace on a Tram, which we caught the tram at Malostranská number 22 and we got off at Pražský hrad.Once we arrived we purchased the full package tickets, which allows you to go into the St. Vitus, Wenceslas, Golden Lane and Adalbert Cathedral. We also purchased the photographer licence. Otherwise you would not be able to take pictures.Due to their winter time the place closed at 4pm. But when we went the Cathedral were closing at 12pm due to repair works. Also, most of the big tour group follows the route of castle, cathedral..etc. Therefore to avoid the tour group crowds we would recommend to visit the Cathedral first.Definitely recommend to visit and it shouldn't be missed out, especially the stained glass created by Alphonse Mucha father of Art Nouveau.We also recommend to get concert tickets once you arrived at the castle rather pre-book. As it was winter time, definitely wear thick clothing as there is no heater throughout the concert. Definitely take a blanket and cushions to sit on.

Pure medieval beauty. This cathedral is absolutely worth visiting. You can buy a combi ticket for Prazsky Hrad, this place is included into the cheapest version (250 CZK). Enjoy thousands of details, look high into the ceiling.

Beautiful building. We walked from Old Town Sq. to St. Vitus and Petrin Tower. St. Vitus is worth visiting. Beautiful gothic structure, rose window and the light in the interior is amazing. One of the highlights of our Visit to Prague.
Impressive. Beautiful cathedral. Definitely worth the visit. I hope they start cleaning the interior and exterior, because it's very dark inside and out.

Incredible amount of detail on this ominous cathedral. The detail and splendor of this cathedral was most definitely not lost on me. Tons of tourists surround it and the area it towers over, but it's still more than worth visiting; the style is gothic and haunting, which stands out very well from the rest of Prague. The interior of the cathedral is also splendidly decorated with beautiful stained glass windows. You can't miss this huge, magnificent structure, but I don't think you'd want to.

Stunning...the audio guide is helpful.. This was part of the full tour we did of Prague Castle. For most of the tour the audio guide was honestly a bit too extensive (and that's coming from a true history buff)...but I found the guide much more interesting here in St. Vitus Cathedral. Definitely a highlight of this area. Expect to spend 45 minutes to 1.5 hours depending on how much information you want. Also...the cathedral is someti,es closed for mass so best to check the schedule before you start out.
Worth Visiting. Excellent interiors and many stunning features. Take your time and try to grasp the peaceful visit. One to two hours are enough for this visit.

Gorgeous. Despite two very hot days in a row (around 97 degrees and humid), we visited this historic and beautiful palace and cathedral. That's how great it is. We took a guided tour and learned so much about the history of Czech Republic as well. I really recommend a guided tour. Be careful though: you can only enter each building once with you ticket (not including visit with a tour guide). I found most of the workers at the entrances don't speak English and they don't warn you about this fact.
Beautiful church. A magnificent church yet can be very crowded so looses the sense of spirituality. I think you have to look at it more like a museum than a church.

Impressive and photogenic place. St. Vitus Cathedral is a great place to visit. We were here in May of 2013 and December 2014 and we enjoyed both visits -- it's an impressive monument of architecture. If you visit Prague you MUST visit the old cathedral and take pictures of this beautiful landmark.

Gorgeous Towering Cathedral Above The Skyline of Prague. This gorgeous, gothic Cathedral is Prague's (and possibly Czech Republic's) most beautiful cathedral. One can see it towering over the city. Situated near the Palace, it is a remarkable structure with numerous and intricately stained vitrines. Lots of tourists flock to this sight in Prague, however I must say that this does not take away that breathtaking experience.

Beautiful Stained Glass Windows. If you have a combined ticket to the Castle area I suggest leaving the cathedral to last (nowhere else was crowded) or coming in the afternoon. Perhaps the administrators could institute timed entryI arrived here just after 10:00 am which was probably the wrong time & my visit was spoilt by the crowds. A real scrum to get in & so packed with people it was difficult to relax & enjoy a glorious gothic cathedral. I couldn't get near the Wenceslas Chapel. When I visited SE Asia I was advised on how to dress & behave respectfully in places of worship. Some tourists were taking the most inappropriately posed photos of themselves with crucifixes etc. - only a few I'm sure but it upset even an atheist like me - advice from their tour companies please ................

The stained glass... Wow.. I loved this cathedral. Its truly beautiful. The best part of it has to be the stained glass windows which are huge and when the sun strikes them so beautiful they take your breath away. Inside the cathedral its cool in the way of any of these places built with stone many centuries ago. Crowd wasn't too bad and it was quiet enough to be able to appreciate all I was seeing and feeling. Well worth a visit, a gem or should I say diamond in Prague.

Another beautiful European Cathedral. Beautifully designed, lots of bright stained glass and stunning architecture surround historic tombs and relics. A worthwhile visit regardless of how many other cathedrals you've visited.
mucha stainglasses. You must feel the spirit of this cathedral,I have been In Wstminster Abby and Notere Dame I am glad that I have been in this one.Every time when I am in Prague I go there.

Some of the most beautiful contemporary stained glass.. I'm a huge fan of cathedrals. This one is a beauty! The building took over 1000 years to complete, from its foundation stones to the final stained glass windows. The exterior is saintly and impressive, but the interior is something to behold. GO EARLY, and avoid the crowds. You'll want to spend some time at this place, and the crowds can be horrid during high tourist season. Don't miss the Mucha window in the north aisle. And plan on spending some time just gazing at the tomb of St. Jon Nepomuk.
beautiful gothic cathedral. If you enjoy seeing cathedrals, then this is a must see. The architecture is absolutely beautiful and the view from the castle is amazing.

Gorgeous gothic cathedral, but very crowded. Pros: beautiful building, lovely stained-glass windows, interesting history. Part of the castle complex.
Cons: the large group tours are really annoying. If you can figure out what time of day they are less likely to be busy, go then. Would be nice if there was a way to put a 15 person per tour guide limit or something like that.

its not the most fantastic church iv been to. But its in the bigger leage as churches go. Been there over 7 times the last few years. If you like churches you will like this one. But iv seen the one i Milan and was early this year to Hagia Sofia so...But its up there in the big league. You need to go inside. But the best experience is to go there maybe in september late in the evening alone. Sit along the side and really look at its outside. The change in style as the years have passed in building and so on. It really is unik on the outside.

The Best. St. Vitus is located within Prague Castle and you can spend an entire day there. The Churches are unbelievable. There are also shops and restaurants on the grounds. Wear comfortable walking shoes as there is a lot of ground to cover. Definitely worth the day.
A must to see. Yes, this of course is a must to see while in Prague. A historically beautiful church at the site of Prague castle.

Beauty in the Eye of The Beholder. A beautiful building, of which was included in our free castle tour of Prague with the Sandemann Walking Tours Company . Slightly diasppointed that you could not walk around the whole cathedral; you had to pay extra to get closer to the alter. Also there were nearly too many people inside so it was difficult to take good photos.
The windows though.... Magnificent. The Cathedral was the highlight of Prague Castle for me. It rivals any European church in elegance.
Amazing Cathedral and stained glass. An amazing cathedral with brilliant stained glass windows--a fine high Gothic building and well worth the walk over to it.
Beautiful church. It was a really beautiful church. Free to get in. Worth seeing inside and out! Tram 22 will get you there.
Lofty Cathedral. The cathedral is being renovated at this time, so you have to step around some curtains and things, but it is so gorgeous and well worth seeing.

Don't miss. Take your time here.. A don't miss location in Prague for tourists. Don't rush. Learn about the history and the various phases of the cathedral and castle Beautiful gargoyles and stained glass. Incredible architecture.
Must See. Must see the St. Vitus Cathedral....interesting mix of old and new....plan to spend three hours at the Castle area

Don't miss a visit to Prague's Castle and walk in the King Charles Bridge.. Loved it, especially the cathedral. The window are beautiful. The rest of the building have decorated rooms as well asinteresting displays and little specialities stores as well as The Toy Museum.
A must see in Prague. One of the oldest and biggest cathedrals in Europe if not the world with special artistic altars and lots of history.

Who was in Katerdale St. Vitus as not having been in Prague. Who was in Katerdale St. Vitus as not having been in Prague, so you can feel the history of the whole Czech kingdom, a moment when you sit in the pew and forget about selfies linger and leave yourself to be the grandeur understand that to have the same meaning as the cathedral Notre Dame in Paris.

Beautiful cathedral - stained glass windows amazing. Worth paying for the audio guide - really amazing cathedral, beautiful stained glass windows, architecture amazing - worth a visit - we bought ticket type B which allowed visits to 4 places within Prague Castle - wear good walking shoes!

Beautiful cathedral, but you are treated like cattle.. Little evidence of Christianity in the way the cathedral is administered - nowhere for private prayer. The pews were all roped off. My 76 year old husband had a bad back and needed to sit down, finally having to sit on a stone step at the back of the church. Some official came hustling over, telling him off as if he were an irreverent child.

Some of the best stained glass I've ever seen.. Buy a Prague Castle ticket and see the cathedral as well as other attractions in the complex. This is the most prominent building in Prague, and looks imposing from a distance, but only from inside do you get to appreciate the beauty of the stained glass.
wow. This cathedral is majestic it is worth to climb the hill to see it. You can see it for free the stained glass windows are beautiful
Amazing. Too much tourist so the experince minus one point. Go early in the morning or late in the evening. The hole castle area is nice.

Architectural gem. Even for a jaded cathedral-hunter like me, this cathedral was simply impressive, even though I have been there several times, and even worshipped there. The height, the light, the stained-glass windows, the art work, the space, need I say more? One complaint was too many tourists (like me!) And the staff could be a little more welcoming and friendlier. Tourists or not, this is foremost a house of God, for crying out loud! That said, one cannot skip this place when he/she is in Prague. My friend, a first-timer in Europe, was blown away the moment we walked in!! The best of Prague!
Very imposing Cathedral. Quite a busy tourist haunt but well worth going in to view. Not much different to the large Cathedrals in other European cities.
We love visiting these fantastic old cathedrals. Incredible architecture, not sure that modern artisans could replicate such style and grandeur. Not to be missed if your 'in town'.

Beautiful. Beautiful Cathedral and well worth a visit. I bought the ticket for full access to Castle and its grounds which included the access to the full Cathedral. Also paid extra 150 crown (approx 6 euro) to climb tower of cathedral. Views were absolutely amazing up there, although the 298 step spiral staircase is not for the faint hearted!
Amazing view. The Gothic architecture adds to the beauty of the cathedral. The oil paintings on the glass are beautiful. Its a touristy spot and always crowded.
Beautiful in the evening. Have visited the cathedral on daytime and evening and think it was on its best on evening lightning. Looked like it was made of pure gold.
A must see when up at the Prague Castle. Not a huge cathedral person, but this is the one to see in Prague. Amazing, inspiring and beautiful.
Large church. A very large church with many different architectural elements built over many years. The facades are different depending whether you look at the front or the back.
Enormous and peaceful when inside. Right at the start of your time at Prague Hrad, the St. Vitus Cathedral is so peaceful once you're in. The work inside is ornate and gives a rich feeling of calm.
Simply Beautiful. A place that you can tell was simply wonderful and gorgeous before the communists took the country. It's going thru the rebuilding process, and it's simply wonderful.
What a stunning cathedral. I could have spent all day just looking at the intricate stone carving and beautiful windows. This was one of the mist beautiful cathedrals I have ever visited.

has to be part of a visit to Prague. Walk up to the castle and enjoy the place where czech history was made. You can stroll around yourself or go on a guided tour here. The place is still guarded on the outside by two soldiers. From here it is walking distance to the 'golden alley'

The most impresive thing was the Jhon Nepomusky tumb. Most of it is from the 19th century. Its Nicer from outside and farther . It is part of the castle its included in the guided tour that you take when visiting the the Prague Castle. The sided gate is remarkable. And it hides the treasure pieces from the old crown of san Wenceslas

Fascinating. I visited the cathedral in the evening and it was absolutely stunning! Whilst staying in Prague you really do need to visit, it's such a beautiful place and we were fascinated. One of the most beautiful cathedrals I've ever seen.
Beautiful cathedral. Spectacular windows and architecture. Comparable to St. Stephen's in Vienna. Free walking tour access is adequate if pressed for time.
Schola Cantorum, Christs Hospital, Prague 2015. Stunning gothic masterpiece in the Castle complex, stunning acoustic for Schola performance. Another 'must see' Prague jewel.

Incredible Structure. This is one of those Structures that is so imposing in person...and even from a distance. Highly worth the walk up from the river to get there. It is very busy though so prepare to wait if you want to go inside.
Fascinating cathedral.. I'm glad we hired a guide to explain the history and architecture of the very old St. Vitus Cathedral; seem cathedrals all over the world, but this one has a unique history.
Beautiful and old. Very nice tainted windows and beautiful architecture - everything you'd expect for an old cathedral.

Go see the lovely window by Mucha. Very impressive. Beautiful stained glass. What's not to like? It's fabulous. The Rose window is particularly beautiful. The Alphonse Mucha windows are superb examples of the Czech style of art
Must see!. A must see in Prague. Impressive cathedral, full of history! Make sure you go on a guided tour or you rent an audio guide, otherwise you miss a lot.

Crowded with tour groups. Got here fairly early (9:30) but the cathedral was over-run with tour groups. It was a lot worse by the time we left the castle area for the day (noon). Stained glass is beautiful.
Worth The Queue. Look for the stained glass by Alphonse Mucha - it is exceptional. We were confronted with quite a queue but it was worth it.

Breathtaking. The most beautiful cathedral we visited in all of Europe. Every detail is incredible! The cathedral also looks incredible lit up at night, both from a distance (from the St. Charles Bridge) and up close on the Prague Castle grounds.
Amazing. (And crowded.). In my opinion, you really can't miss this cathedral. It is amazingly beautiful. Just be patient and be prepared to deal with crowds and selfie sticks.

Biggest Church in the Czech Republic.... Inside the Hrad Castle, its this massive Cathedral that its origins are way back to the 900, but this gothic structure was molded around the year 1344 to transform the old church into a coronation church. Now a days, the Cathedral its more a museum rather than a church and currently holds the tombs of old emperors and kings. A crowded attraction, you will probably need to queue for a few minutes before accessing it. In my opinion, the inside is not as impressive as the outside since its quite dark and with an old look but, if you have the time and the money, you might take a look or so.

A good walk uphill to the Castle. Excellent to see from the inside, when I was there the entrance was free. I suggest to visit the Prague castle on Sunday, so you can see the change of the guard (around midday).
Beautiful. Words say it all, in Prague Castle and amazing to see, We walked in and had to grasp how such a place is built. The Stained glass is beautiful,

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. This was a very interesting visit as part of the Prague Castle tour. Between the Romanesque and Gothic Architecture there was much to see and learn about the monarchical history of Prague, its saints and its religiosity. The stain glass windows are beautiful and some of the tombs date from the 10th and 11th century. Saint John of Nepomuk's silver tomb is very flamboyant and somewhat out of place amongst all the other pieces. Overall, it was a very interesting visit.
Allow plenty of time. Take a tour because you need to hear the history and then spend more time wandering around, taking it all in.

Impressive cathedral but not one of the greats of Europe. Is undergoing some restoration work at the moment, so only opened at 12 noon. In my opinion, exterior more impressive than exterior, with two large towers, gargoyles and ornately decorated flying buttresses. Inside dimensions impressive, with highlights being the unusual Art Deco stained glass windows and the richly decorated St Wencslelas chapel, to the left of the nave approaching the exit
Magnificent!. The size, decorations, atmosphere, colours and history. Just to wander about inside this magnificent construction is a joy and a great experience for all ones senses.

Beautiful gothic cathedral. Impressive for it's size (124 meters long and 60 m wide), and the time ( it took for it to be completed (6 centuries), this cathedral really dominates the view on the whole Hradcany district. It's the seat of the Archbishop of Prague and it's considered to be the most important church in the country. Do not miss the chance to go inside, and check out windows decorated by the famous CZ painter Alfons Mucha
Worth a visit. Impressive space, nice interior, a must visit for gothic architecture fans. Free of charge when entering he main hall. Also nice to look at from the outside, with all its gargoyles.

Another beautiful cathedral. Pretty cool church. If you travel a lot you see a lot of these and I thought St. Nicholas's was a lot more impressive - that one blew my mind. It's part of the castle tour, though, so worth a visit and obviously special in its own right.

St. Vitus Cathedral, Prague. It is a big old Catholic church that it has been converted by the city in a dull museum. The smell of mold makes the experience hard to appreciate its history and importance. Since there is lack of worship there; the place feels cold and dead inside -a Catholic faithful knows the difference!

Imposing Cathedral. Very impressive interior and possibly even mlre so from the exterior,be sure to check out the gargoyles.Be warned once you have entered once you must pay to buy another ticket should you want to revisit same day.

impressive. St. Vitus Cathedral was very big and ornate. Compared to St. Pauls in Rome, however, it would never compare. Nevertheless, it was well worth the visit. Given that it's right next to Prague Castle, it's must see in the area. If you're not into hiking up a tons of stairs, I'd suggest you take a taxi to the castle, then hike down into town. The other way can be real struggle, especially in the summer.

Spectacular Cathedral - a must-see.. In Prague? See this Cathedral. It's that simple. An astonishing architectural achievement that has take 600 years to build, housed in the largest castle complex in the world. Compared to my last visit 23 years ago, it was disapointing only because the crowds have grown to annoying sizes. It was absolutely rammed the day I went and I felt tlike I was on a production line. Having said that, you just can't miss this place, so just grin and bear it.
Awe inspiring. A magnificent gothic cathedral on the grounds of Prague Castle. This is a must see. The stained glass is beautiful and they have some of the best gargoyles I have seen.

This cathedral is fantastic!. This is one of the most amazing cathedrals we saw in Eastern Europe, and we saw a lot of them. The architecture is awe-inspiring, and well worth the visit. As an added bonus if it is a hot day, like most cathedrals it is relatively cool inside.

Stunning glass. Incredible cathedral. Bit of a queue to get in, but that soon moved and we decided not to pay to go in fully but got a very good idea of what it was all about without paying. Next time, we probably will, but on a short break we decided an overview was sufficient.

Seen better churches and cathedrals in Europe. Don't get me wrong, it is a great cathedral and has it's own rich and interesting history ... but if you have traveled extensively in Europe and have seen other cathedrals in Italy or some of the other places then this is a bit of a let down. Spend your time elsewhere when you are in the Castle district.

Do not miss it!. This cathedral is the most famous one in Prague, right inside the castle. You have to pay to see the full cathedral, but you should not miss it as it has an impressive architecture and stained glass windows

Iconic . This church is both beautiful and creepy looking at the same time. The gothic look gives it a very unique exterior.. Was really crowded but naturally it would be as with every other touristy site.... Beautiful inside but i was more fascinated with the exterior design...

Must see. Beautiful, huge, old, lovely cathedral! A must see, from inside and out. A bit too crowded but the place is HUGE! Can be very very cold during winter; wear comfortable but very warm clothes and shoes.
Gothic gem!. Go up to the tower. There is an amazing view of Prague. The construction took around 600 years! This beautiful gem is part of a castle complex.

Beautiful Gothic cathedral. You can see most of this for free, but if you want to go up to the altar, there is a fee. We have seen many of these types of cathedrals, so we didn't buy tickets. Really lovely area around the cathedral as well.
Beautiful church - worth the admission. Truly an amazing space. This church takes your breath away. It was the best part of the Prague Castle complex.
The icon. One of the icons of Stare mesto, be sure not to miss it. And do not be a typicall tourist to just take a photo outside of it, go inside and visit it properly.

Nice place to visit. I visited this place and found it must visit place in Prague city. It is located inside the Prague castle. I liked the design and beauty of the cathedral along with historical details inside the cathedral.

Beautiful church, too crowded!. Unfortunately, I didn't do enough research before going to know that the church didn't open until noon on Sunday, but I figured I'd just walk around the other castle areas until then. I ended up purposely waiting for noon to roll around so that I could see the inside of the church, but when I went back over there was a line probably about 1/3 of a mile long or more. I decided to forgo going inside because I absolutely hate being pushed around in a crowd (which had already been happening the entire day), but the outside is truly beautiful. The architecture is stunning and I'm sure the inside was as well. I'd recommend either (a) not going on a Sunday, or (b) preparing yourself for a mob of tourists - at least in summer.
Beautiful. Another beautiful cathedral. Very popular and crowded with lots of tour groups. Go early before the crowds.

Amazing Building. This attractive gothic cathedral is one of the most beautiful sides of the Prague.As soon as you enter the building ıt starts to amaze you.Even you pay for the ticket ıt worths for it.Also ypu can take amazing photos.
No visit is complete without it. AMAZING. That's all i have to say. Take the castle tour and visit the cathedral during the time and then you'll understand. Phenomenal.

Stunning Window!. Great place to visit, the stained glass window is wonderful. I love visiting churches/cathedrals around the world, and this is on a par with Notre Dam in Paris, and the window that is very similar might be better here in Prague. It was a bit of a climb to get to the top of the hill, and once there to go through the gates to get to their parliament square and then through the courtyard to the cathedral. It was well worth spending a few hours here.

Stunning. Absolutely stunning! Stunning views over Prague. Well worth doing. Has a place to eat and drink so we stopped for a drink as toy do! Lots to see up here! You do have to pay to get in some of the places up here. So we just walked around!
Wonderful Cathedral. The Cathedral is inside the Prague Castle and it is great and wonderful. It has very beautiful picture glasses. Some pictures were draw by the famous drawer Mocha.

Beautiful and full of history. The cathedral is beautiful and is the burial place of the Czech kings. The chapel where St. Wenceslas (the good king of the Xmas carol) is buried is amazing with gold and precious stones on the walls. The bell tower is not an easy climb, 287 steps on a narrow circular staircase with no landings. This is equivalent to about 17 stories, so you can be sure the views are terrific. I made it and noticed we were as high as the Petrin Tower, which we had used the funicular to get to.
Gorgeous. What a beautiful gothic cathedral. The stained glass windows are a must see. Stop to look at all the gargoyles outside!

Must Visit in Prague!. We visited St. Vitus Cathedral and the rest of Prague Castle Complex on a Sunday, starting at 9 AM. We were told that St. Vitus won't be open until 1 PM. We were glad that we waited! This Cathedral was amazing! Stained glass to the ceiling painting - must visit before leaving Prague!

Woderful glass windows. This cathedral is vast. The glass windows although not very old are stunningly beautiful. It is free to go in at the top end, however if you have a combine castle area ticket you can visit at lot more. It has some very ornate tombs.

Worth the hike up. Walked up the hill to the Cathedral on a sunny day and being up on the hill was our favourite part of the trip- the view is great, and the cathedral is beautiful. Lots of cafes and restaurants around.
Your Jaw will drop. A beautiful place to visit, we were lucky it was winter and the lines were not too long. Make sure you get a savvy tour guide.
Love it!. Well kept, amazing art, loved everithing in it.... Take the time to observe the vitrals, and scupltures
Not as nice as Vienna churches. After just coming from Vienna it can't compare with the beautiful paintings and ornate decorations of the Vienna Churches but the outside was very impressive.

OK. Need to walk lots of stair to go to the castle. The view is worth it, but not so surprise and beautiful compare to other church in Prague. If you want to see incredible interior design, i will recommend St. Barbara's church. However, it is free to access and easy to visit another hot tourist spots.

Definitely need to see. One of the most beautiful churches I've been to. It's gorgeous inside and out. The stained glass windows are incredible, and all of the history of the cathedral is amazing. You don't really need to do a guided tour, just take a picture of a guidebook and wander around yourself.
Impressive . Just one word: impressive. The stained glasses are astonishing, I would admire them for hours. The architecture is also impressive
Stunning place to sing. We traveled there with a choir of 50 singers and were able to sing for Mass and a concert after Mass in the rotunda. What a thrill.
Beyond description. The is on the "castle complex". The best description is that it takes your breath away. Pictures cannot do it justice. Don't leave Prague without visiting St. Virus!!

One of the Most Beautiful Cathedrals in Europe. Where to begin? If I only had a half a day in Prague, I would spend it here (saving time for a beer). It's hard to say with ease why we were so taken with this church. It's location overlooking Prague, beautiful stained glass windows (including one by Mucha), and history. It's extraordinary. So it's not quite on par with the Cathedrals of London, but don't miss this. Also, there is a Metro stop close by, with a five minute walk. Based on the can of sardines also known as Tram 22, take the Metro. It's quicker, very easy to learn and ride, and much less crowded.

Stunning. I loved this building. I walked into the cathedral and my jaw dropped. The stain glass is stunning (I liked it more than Notre Dame). Take your time looking at the details in the glass to truly appreciate this amazing structure.

Awesome stainless glass windows and an absolutely grand place. We went on a guided tour which was good because they told us about the history of the place. It was awesome inside the cathedral, very impressive. A must see in Prague.
beautifull. The hole castle is very very great. I love it!Can dink a beer, eat something, toilet, souvenir shop...so its great.

Just beautiful. Such a beautiful and stately Cathedral. We went early in the morning and the light that spilled into the Cathedral at certain angles were just breathtaking. If you want to avoid some of the crowds go early, it really gets busy later on in the day.
Beautiful. We came here on a walking tour very spectacular sits on a hill, inside is very busy but when you look around your eyes are drawn to the spectacular stain glass windows.

Spectacular!. Well-preserved overwhelming cathedral with incredible sculptures and art work. Both baroque and gothic features. We took the paid admission tour with audio explanation which was just perfect. The peaks of the cathedral are the what is seen in the distance. This is the best part of the Prague "Castle" grounds. Cathedral is listed as closing at 5 p.m. , however, in actuality, the last admission is at 4:40 p.m.--so beware!!!
Worth the trip. Lots of attractions nearby!. Very old Cathedral in Prague. Recommend spend some time here. It has a long history and a great place to sit and reflect after you walk around it.
Old but grand. Great place to visit, lots of history. The guide was very knowledgeable and the tour was not too long.

BEAUTIFUL CATHEDRAL IN PRAGUE. Beautiful cathedral in Prague Castle complex - amazing stained glass, including one window by Alphons Mucha. Lots to see here, with two parts - one very old, the other more recent. Worth a stop.

One of many beautiful cathedrals in Prague. I've seen several beautiful cathedrals across europe so far, this was my first high up on a hill in the middle of town. It's in the grounds of the Prague Castle.

287 Steps to the top. The cathedral is absolutely beautiful and worth going to go visit. You can also climb to the top of the tower. It is a narrow staircase and you do have to navigate around the people going in the other direction. Once you get to the top, you have a 360 degree view of the city as well as birds eye view of the square (we saw the changing of the guards). If you are in the area i would definitely go in the cathedral and make the trek to the top!

One of the World's Most Beautiful Cathedrals. This cathedral is stunning! The stained glass is beautiful,and they let much light in. The statues, gold, silver, jewels are mind boggling. It's a shame the Czech monarchy built so many buildings so close to it.
Cool Sight. This was definitely my favorite cathedral I saw while in Prague. It had distinctive features that set it apart from others in the city

Worth the tour up hill.. Beautiful cathedral on the castle premises. Details make you think you're in Barcelona (Sagrada Familia).You need to buy a ticket to see the whole cathedral. A glimpse at the entrance is for free.

Exceptional stained glass. This is a beautiful building with the finest stained glass windows I have ever seen. Entrance to the rear of the cathedral is free but, if you want to explore further, a small entrance fee is payable. Well worth a visit

Breathtaking. Firstly - it is the crown of the area. When one looks on the hill - it's what makes the castle look like a castle from a fairy tale. No matter where you are, the spires are your landmark. We took an evening e-bike tour and saw it when few were around - took some great outside pics. Then came back during the crowded day. Loved walking about - so much to see inside. Truly breathtaking.

One of Prague's Best . This is one of the must visit sites in Prague. It is a massive gothic cathedral with well preserved medieval details inside and out. It is definitely unique among famous European cathedrals because of its historical and cultural heritage.

Massive. So you are at St. Vitus Cathedral. That means that you have walked from the car park or bus all the way to Prague Castle, and through large courtyards to be confronted by this enormous church that is so closely surrounded by buildings that it is difficult to get a good photograph. Lovely Gothic building with beautiful stained glass windows, although we were not allowed to have free access to the whole interior. Frankly, by the time we arrived here I was worn out and needed a rest. The castle is very large. Take a bottle of water and wear comfortable shoes!

Prague 2013. There are gargoyles outside the main doors so be sure to watch for them. Inside is very quiet and dark, there are quite a few dead bodies buried in the church and a lot of Frescos. It's difficult to get a good photo from the outside because it's so large. Make sure to walk to the right of the front doors to see the side.

Must do. A must do in Prague. You can catch the 22 bus and miss the initial uphill climb, which I recommend as you'll do plenty of climbing on the hill exploring. They are doing some restoring and cleaning of the cathedral exterior - doesn't affect you tho and actually pretty cool to see the cleaned areas next to the not so clean. If you go late in the day, stick around until the sun goes down. Best view of the city (day or night), and meandering paths and little gems to see everywhere. Loved it!

Beautiful Cathedral. This cathedral is beautiful. Very old (can't remember how old) and has the beautiful stain glassed windows as per the time. A lot of tourists, but there is a reason for that. Worth the walk up the steps to the Prague Castle.
Moldy Smell Ruins the Opulence. My asthma couldn't handle the intense mold smells. I wish I had thought to bring an allergy mask. Hard to find the door. Don't be ashamed to ask.

Beautiful and inspirational.. Beautiful and inspirational. Try to attend a Mass, not just visiting as a tourist. Every last Sunday the Mass is in Latin, and it is a wonderful service. Arrive early to guarantee a good seat.

Favorite cathedral and favorite place in Prague. After living in Prague for a year, I can still say that this is my favorite place. I'm a fan of gothic style cathedrals and St. Vitus doesn't disappoint. The stained glass windows and phenomenal and I'm impressed every time! The front of the church is free to enter and you can buy a ticket to walk back through the church and behind around the altar. No trip to Prague would be complete without it.
A must!. What a glorious cathedral with outstanding stained glass windows! A gem! Truly a must for every visitor in Prague!
Wow the detail. Really impressed by this building, the architecture was amazing and the details on the windows are something else, as part of Prague castle this is a must do in my opinion.

My "first" cathedral. First time I visited, I experienced what it meant to see something "breathtaking." I have since visited a number of cathedrals, but St. Vitus was my "first" cathedral and will always have a special place in my heart as a result.
We finns call this "holy fittan". Nice place, full of history and very funny charasters on walls of cathedral. And very many other azttractions nearby.

Gothic Magnificence. The St Vitus Cathedral is Prague is without a doubt one of the most beautiful Gothic cathedrals I've ever seen. It's huge vaulted interior, beautiful stained glass windows, and ornate pulpit and sculptures simply take your breath away. It was the highlight of the Prague Castle tour for me.

Need to see in Prague. Saint Vitus, Václav and Voytekh's cathedral (чеш. Katedrála svatého Víta, Václava a Vojtěcha) — a Gothic Catholic cathedral in Prazhsky Grada, a residence of the archbishop Prazhsky.The cathedral is ranked as pearls of the European gothic style, is an art and national and historical shrine of the Czech Republic.In a cathedral the Czech kings and archbishops of Prague are buried, coronation regalia of the medieval Czech Republic are stored in the same place.

Gothic. Fabulous cathedral, that was erected at two very different times in history. The facade actually has people in modern dress depicted on it. The stained glass is glorious, especially the Mucha window. You cannot miss the tomb of St John Nepomuk, with it's elaborate silverwork, or the Wenceslas chapel. A must do when in Prague. Try to get here early to avoid the mid-day crush and to appreciate the sunlight streaming in the windows.
Three day stay in Prague. A must to visit it is truly beautiful with the best stain glass windows I have ever seen I would definitely recommend a visit to the Cathedral and take your camera
Worth a visit. You can go into part for free, quite impressive and constructed over many decades. Most attractions are ticket only.

part of Prague castle tour. beautiful church with so much history! would appreciate it more with an audio guide...we just came from Rome so although this church was beautiful it doesn't compare to the grandeur of St. Peter's basilica!
Got to go to Prague!. Prague is a beautiful city with so much to see - cultural plus beautiful zoo, great food and lots of choices for excellent beer!
early doors. very interesting would recommend going and get there early becasue it can get quite budy after 10 am

Gleaming tile roof and 1000 years of history. Take your time to study the gleaming tiles on the roof and the small statues. There is a Magpie on one of the steeples holding a gold ring in it's mouth. The kings and queens of Hungary have their coronations in the chapel and the royal jewels are stored in the church.

Magic exterior and beautiful mosaics!. I spent way more time looking at the exterior than on the interior with this church. So many carefully outlined details. The mosaics on the inside are amazing as well. Very much worth a visit!

Amazing architecture. amazing vitrals and architecture, a most if you visit the castle. We travel during spring and although there were tourists, it was not crowded so we take our time admiring the details.

Stunning!. A beautiful cathedral inside and out. Some amazing stained glass! There was a service going on inside so we had to wait in line for quite a while before they opened the door..but it was definitely worth it ,

An Eastern version of the Notre Dame. This really is an Eastern version of the Notre Dame, the architecture is just beautiful. It's built in the centre of the Prague castle precinct and so is worth visiting along with the castle and enjoying some of the most beautiful views of the valley which uses the city.

Magnificent . We visited the cathedral in June 2015.We were so glad that we took the decision to pay extra 100 CSZ per person for english speaking guide.Having taken this option we were part of a group of 33 and the guide was brilliant.With her commentary we really enjoyed our tour.It made more sense of the detail.This tour of the cathedral and the castle lasted 1 1/2 hours.Our full ticket allowed us entrance to various other places within the complex but these we had to do without the guide.This ticket was valid for two days.You are allowed entry into each attraction one time.However the entry with the guide does not count.So you can visit the Cathedral and Castle twice.We were informed that the cathedral is the holliest place in czech republic.A practicing cathedral where worshippers came at 7.30 am.

St Vitis is in the Prague castle. A large Gothic church situated in the Prague castle. Typical Gothic design. Free entry to the back of the church with a charge to enter into the body of the church. St Vitus. Patron saint of Prague who was supposedly dipped into boiling oil and thus was coined. St Vitus Dance.

A mixture of stiles. St Stephan's Cathedral from Wien was build in the same stile, but comparing to it, St Vitus is much more impressive. One may have the impression that they have traveled over the centuries in a walking tour of the church, passing through ages and history. As far as I remember, there is a box with the crown that can be opened only with the four keys at the same time (one key is at the bishop but I don't remember the other owners).

Nice cathedral in a cute area. It is a long climb to get up the hill, but the Cathedral was very pretty. The stained glass windows are beautiful and we enjoyed looking around. Like many Cathedrals now a days, you have to pay to see the whole church, which I'm opposed to paying for. We walked around the outside as well, which includes a nice square and several small cafes.
Favorite Cathedral Ever!. Beyond gorgeous. The architecture is amazing and the views are stunning. You must go! I'd recommend going on a group tour so your guide can show you the "must see's"

Check out the stained Glass. Much like the Notre Dame in paris, this cathedral has some stunning examples of stained glass windows. It can be very crowded in the peak season so try and go slightly off-peak and also on a sunny day as the sun brings out the best of the huge windows.

Its inside Prague Castel. dont miss out on the beautiful architecture of this building, eligant stone carvings and and gem filled interiors... one can swallow the calmness inside this place for house... make sure you visit on a sunny day or during day light..

Beautiful Gothic style Cathedral. The exterior of the Cathedral is beautiful with its Gothic style and beautiful details.It is well maintained and visited by many tourists.You can start your Prague city tour by visiting Prague Castle and this Cathedral and then walk to Golden Lane that is located behind the Cathedral and you can see the beautiful city view of Prague from the hill, later you walk down the street and walk to Charles Bridge and Astronomical Clock, all can be reached by walking thus it is not so near(maybe around 20 mins walk)..
Visit of St-Vitus Cathedral. Very nice church inside, very historical and I strongly recommend a visit for everyone visiting Prague.

Stunning - Worth the small fee. Really this was one of the most interesting and beautiful churches we saw. The small fee is worth touring it from the inside - while you can go in for free and gawk a bit - the entrance fee allows you to go all around and there are some very worthy sights. We did not pay extra for the audio guide because I had my handy dandy Rick Steves' book with me that explained what we were looking at. If you don't have anything like that, then I would get the audio guide as well. The view of the side of the church as you come up to it is a wonderful photo opportunity to get the entire church in your frame. The dark church against the greenery is stunning.

Very beautiful church. This church has stunning architecture with an unbeleviable amount of details on outside walls. It´s very impressive from outside and grandiose from inside. Definitely worth a visit, when in Prague.
Worth a trip!. Beautiful cathedral with a great history behind it. Well worth a trip with a good guide. Amazing glass windows and architecture.

Wonderful history and great architecture. The first visit to the Cathedral I was tired, wet and didn't want to fight the lines or buy the ticket so just did the free walk through. The next visit was earlier in the day, less crowded and I bought a ticket. Absolutely worth the cost. The windows are amazing! I was disappointed that the crypt are was closed for repairs. I would like to go there again just not in the height of tourist season.

Got to go to Cathedral, amazing. I have been in a lot off Cathedrals, and are all amazing, but this one is fantastic too, You pay to go into Cathedral and a audio guide is a separate price, so be aware of that, but well worth it.

Great Cathedral. The ionic spire towers of the Cathedral itself are well preserved and are a great example of this type of architecture. You can visit parts for free but you will need a ticket to see most of the highlights.

Lovely. We went to the cathedral while waiting for our room to be ready. It was a nice hike up the hill and a gorgeous view outside of the church. I think it would be even better with the guide, but the stained glass windows are fantastic!
Beautiful. All of the cathedrals in Prague are what you come for. Breathtaking. It is worth the time to see. Take an umbrella because it seems to rain everyday.

Lovely. Very well organized.
Great historical and touristic point.
A "must visit".
It offers a very interesting collection of christianity pieces. Inside are outside architecture is fascinating.

Trip with daughter. ST Vitus Cathedral was by far my favorite building in Prague. I love the Gothic style architecture. The stained glass murals. It is just a wonder to look at. My daughter and I must have at least 50 photos apiece. Amazing is all I can say. We loved to look at it in every perspective. You must visit if in Prague.

Iconic. If you come to Prague and have not visited St. Vitus Cathedral, you have to seriously ask yourself why. The iconic spire towers greet you as you make your way towards Prague castle. The Cathedral itself is well preserved and is a reminder of how great architecture was back in the day. Keep in mind that you will have to pay to see most of the displays/ attractions within the cathedral.

Magnificent. This is one of the best cathedrals i have ever seen,it is the one most people would have seen in photos of Prague high on a hill.Very photographic within the Prague castle compound.You can go inside for free but not all of it ,there is also a tower you can climb for a small fee.It will take you best part of five minutes and 385 steps to reach the top,for older people (like me) you are puffed out when you get there.The views you get are worth the climb and unlike some others I have been to you do have freedom of movement to take photos.Well worth a visit. Enjoy.
Beautiful. Beautiful cathedral definitely would put it with the top things to do in Prague. So much history not to mention a great view!

Worth the time.... This is a fascinating cathedral, built over the course of hundreds of years. While baroque in style, it was not over the top We had a guide who took us through so we probably a great visit because of his knowledge and willingness to share what he knew.It wasn't particularly crowded and, after visiting many other churches during our Danube trip, this fact made it very appealing.

Stunning church!. This has to be one of the most beautiful churches in Europe I have ever seen! The size is amazing, and it has the most beautiful interiors and exterior architecture I have ever seen! It was so beautiful, and had stunning baroque features, with the stained glass, and ceilings. It was absolutely beautiful! This is definitely a must see in my opinion for sights to see in Prague.
Impressive. I didn't get inside of it, but the outside is very impressive, a little dark like everything else in Prague but it's one of the must go in Prague.

Impressive!. The most impressive church in my opinion of the many you will find in prague. Situated in the middle of the Prague castle, the construction strikes awe in all visitors. Definitely worth the trip up the hill to get there!

Stunning and wonderfully history. A Must See!. The biggest Gothic Church in the country and dominates the city from its position on Hradcany hill. So much to see you must plan at least 4+ hours. Lots of tour groups which can be difficult to move around so go early (they open at 9:00am) but well worth the time. Building work started in 1344,but the church was not completed until 1929.The church is spacious with a very lofty nave and contains some wonderful stained glass windows.Outside the cathedral has many flying buttresses and a wonderful steeply sloping diamond patterned roof. There is an interesting exhibit that discusses and displays the gargoyles...many were able to be restored. The exterior dominates the entire city and can be seen from almost anywhere. We went to number II to see the interactive history of the castle and it is quite impressive. There are lots of cafes and restaurants on the grounds and most of them are quite good. We went to the Lobkowicz Palance cafe and had a delicious lunch.

Beautiful Windows. St. Vitus is located in the Royal Palace Grounds. It was included in the admission thanks to my Prague Card. The church itself has very large, beautiful windows. It was very crowded on my visit - a Saturday- with people standing almost elbow to elbow. You may want to visit on a non-weekend day to have a little bit more room. One thing to note is that you need a photography permit to take photos inside ANY building within the Palace grounds. There are still some buildings you cannot photograph, but the interiors are pretty incredible so I highly recommend spending the small amount of money to capture your visit.
Superb. Free to enter so quite busy (you can pay to have entry to all of the Cathedral but not really necessary). The stained glass windows were superb.

History lover's paradise. Take the time to read up about Prague's history and the people entombed in this beautiful Cathedral. We were very fortunate that while we were touring someone began playing the pipe organ. This instrument appears to be two or more stories tall!

Must see in Prague. You must see this massive church and understand some of the history. The building itself are great in scale and full with inspirational story's on the inside and outside of the church. I can see some of the regular people can understand some back ground of Christian spirit.

Best Church in Europe. Amazing, the exterior is in view way before you get there and that's just the outside.Free and I suggest the hop on hop off yellow bus tour. The girl who did our tour was above and beyond this extra from the hoho treat. This is definitely a don't miss.

Beautiful cathedral. The stained glass windows in this cathedral are amazing, very colourful. Lots of history and lots of people visiting here. The surrounding area is also good to visit and views over the City nearby are wonderful. A must if you visit Prague.
must see - stunning. must see the architecture , can take ages to browse around but worth a visit even if only have a short time, very very pretty
Best value in Prague. Beautiful cathedral - specially go to see the Muccha window. Later, take an hour to visit the Muccha Museum, just behind Wenceslas Square.
Visually Gothically Stunning!!. Sheer size, and majesty - a must on any visit to Prague, tucked alongside the Palace/Castle, nice little private church..!

Astonishingly spiritual. Feeling so spiritually strong, marvelous ornament inside and the grandeur felt inside the mine, The crypt of St John of Nepomunk is the must seen highlight of these cathedral.

Inside the Castle headquarters. The cathedral is inside the Castle headquarters. It is a beautifully built and decorated building. You get there by tramway 22. I also recommend visiting the gardens and grapevines.

Impressive . Great building fabulous from the inside. You need to see this to complete your Prague visit.
Be prepared for a steep walk to get there.

Part of the experience. Yeah visited St.Vitus Cathedral & it was very nice,took some nice pics for the album but to be fair we have seen many over the years & this was pretty much just like many others, but as the title suggests it all adds to the overall experience.

Beautiful church!. This huge church is beautiful and striking. I couldn't get over the sheer size! We didn't have time to do the whole church (the part that requires the extra ticket) but even if you only have time to duck in the door and look it will be well worth the effort!

Beautiful! A must see.. We saw this beautiful Cathedral on our tour. I would highly recommend doing a tour through the city. The area is crowded with people and you miss so much if you don't have someone with you pointing out everything.
Beautiful Stained Glass. What a beautiful place! Go and have a look just for the Stain glass. Really interesting Cathedral. There is a charge to go in.
Amazing building. Ambience and very pretty .Stained windows were worth viewing each one telling a story .Well worth a visit
The most know church in Prague. Magnificent building, its worth to pay the price to go inside (you could enter for free only to limited area).

A spectacular Gothic Cathedral. This is the biggest Gothic Church in the country and dominates the city from its position on Hradcany hill.Building work started in 1344,but the church was not completed until 1929.This was the 1,000th anniversary of the death of St Wenceslas,and today the cathedral houses the crown jewels and the tomb of St Wenceslas.The church is spacious with a very lofty nave and contains some wonderful stained glass windows.Outside the cathedral has many flying buttresses and a wonderful steeply sloping diamond patterned roof.

Definitely worth a visit!. We arrived in the late morning.This cathedral is definitely worth the visit. There is a free area, but ticket purchase is required if you wish to walk further into the church. Worth the ticket for us!Check out the attached pictures that I took.

St Vitus. the cathedral was lovely,some areas were free and some had a fee.The windows were fab especially with the sun shining through them. Quite a lot of work going on in the area but it did not spoil our time there.

Beautiful. The stained glass and architecture is a sight to behold. Take the time to read up on the history of e church before going as there is a lot to see but not much in terms of info on the walls. Even if there was, it was usually crowded and a little hard to take you time to finish reading the long passages.

See the Treasury Also!!!!. The cathedral is another example of a truly awe inspiring church..but the treasury is Magnificent!!! It is in another building around the corner from the church. Unbelievable..one of the most extensive in Europe. Please see for yourself!!!

Stunning and a must-see. Spending the day at the Prague Castle is extraordinary; the entire grounds are filled with wonderful sights and interesting facts. Give yourself some time to walk through the cathedral, the tombs are fascinating to look at!

Awesome old-school cathedral. There is a lot of construction going on in the Castle area, where the Cathedral is located, so it's a bit confusing at first. But once you're in the building itself, you'll forget all about THAT! Most of the windows are not stained, but the ones that are, are glorious, and the light shining through throws colors all over the floor and the people on it, making for a very cinematic visual experience. We didn't have time to explore much, but what we saw was superb, especially all those Gothic arches meeting each other in row after row of ribbed vaulting very, very far overhead. There is a tram that stops just across the street from the Castle complex entrance, which is a better way to go than the taxi we took; taxis can't get that close, and of course they cost more. Definitely worth a long afternoon, especially with all the other things to see, including the Castle.

Most beautiful cathedral in Europe. Walking into St. Vitus is nothing short of awe inspiring. Visit one of the many ticket offices in Prazsky Hrad to get a pass to all of the buildings - there are different tickets you can get but I believe all tickets include the cathedral. It can get very crowded with tourists around midday, so I recommend going early morning or late afternoon/early evening before closing. The stained glass and high ceilings are unbelievably beautiful, and St. Wenceslas Chapel is very special to Czech history.

Marvelous. Buying the circuit B ticket to enter the Cathedral only is already worth the value of the ticket (of course the ticket entitles you to other building - so, fret not!!).It's absolutely a stunning cathedral. Do come back later in the evening, when the crowds have left and lighting is on. It's the time then to immense yourself on the beautiful architecture of the Cathedral. Absolutely stunning.

A Must See. When you visit the castle you will have the opportunity to see this church. Don't miss it!You are limited to viewing from the back of the church unless you buy a ticket. It is not necessary to get a good view of the interior.Don't miss the beautiful modern looking stained glass windows.
Magnificent!. They say it's impossible to take a full picture of St. Vitus Cathedral, and they're right. It is huge! Beautiful example of Gothic architecture.
