Such an impressive piece of art!. This cathedral is among some of the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe. It is simply stunning. It is huge. The outside is amazing, but then when you go inside it is breathtaking. The colours of the stained glass windows really compliment each other.You can go inside the cathedral free of charge, but you can only go so far into it. We purchased a 'route' ticket that meant we could go all the way inside the Cathedral, it was very busy and full when we visited, which was slightly frustrating with people pushing past.A must see during any stay in Prague.
Beautiful. Stunning architecture! The whole castle area is lovely and the Cathedral is the jewel in the crown. Get here as early as you can to avoid the crowds and don't miss the views of the city.

Stunningly beautiful. This cathedral is inside the Prague Castle and is a must see attraction. One of the fascinating things about this cathedral is it took over 600 years from start to finish of construction, with several start and stops. Very beautiful.
Great example of Gothic architecture. Must see this marvelous example of gothic architecture on the place of Prague Castle with ancient histrory. Dont forget old founding underground the catherdal.
Beautiful but crowded. Pragueians have made a money-maker of their cathedral, which always seems in bad taste. But the cathedral is magnificent, although our enjoyment was much marred by the crowds.

Gothic Wonder. A classic example of gothic architecture, this cathedral is very well maintained. The interior is covered with rare and beautiful mosaic glasses and elaborate wooden and marble statues. Fabulous!
Fascinating. Very interesting cathedral with lots to see. There is a companion app which is a bit quirky to use but good when you get the hang of it

Castle with a view. A convenient stop on the hop-on hop-off, this castle area and cathedral towers over and commands a view of the entire city. Although majestic in itself, it is only a part of the huge complex that includes government buildings, another church, gardens and living quarters. There used to be a small 'changing of the guard' ceremony in front of the castle gate. Not sure what time they do it, we missed it but did see ceremonial guards march past us as were touring the area.
Beautiful and busy . This church is quite beautiful. The details of the stained glass is impressive. Beware that the crowds are overwhelming.

Get the audio guide and pay the extra ticket charge. You can go into this church for free and gaze about with the millions of other people who are thinking the same way OR buy the ticket to visit all that Prague Castle has to offer, and you will get special access to the much quieter side chapels with lots of hidden treasures. To understand these its best to get the Audio Guide which you purchase when you get the admission ticket. Definitely worth paying more and appreciating everything this Cathedral has to offer

Amazing! A must, especially if a follower of history.. Built over a 600 year period, ending 1929, however that does not in any way take away from the beauty of a largely Gothic piece of architectural brilliance. The exterior is covered in dozens of gargoyles, all of differing designs. The gothic spires add a feel to the Cathedral that makes it breathtaking to view, and for the photographer, a shot at every angle. The doors have amazingly detailed cooper engravings, and even more detailed stonework above and around.The interior is what you imagine a medieval church to be. Not sure if was incense, or just the church, but looking down the church it appeared it have a smoking presence drifting through the air. Stupidly high vaulted ceilings supported by pillars. Probably at least a dozen different chapels surrounding the main nave of the church. The crests of the Electors surround the top, under a beautiful ceiling similar to that in Prague Palace, Graz Catherdal and many others in the area. St Wenceslas's tomb is sadly roped off, so hard to get a good look but what you can see is worth the visit alone. Around the walls of his chapel are amazing medieval baroque paintings, with more references to the Electors of the HRE - that was my greatest dissappointment not fully being able to appreciate these paintings. There were gravestones of many of the early pre-Habsburg rulers on the walls, along with with their bodies in the royal crypt (unviewable), which added a feeling of age to the place. I could go on, but I know there are many of reviews and easy to look up in a guidebook. The thing you need to know is that if you only visit one building in Prague, St Vitus Catherdal is it. I am a big fan of gothic architecture, and more so history - i spent 1 1/4 hours inside (not including a couple outside), and i needed at least another hour. I was only starting to get the feeling of the place, but closing time arrived.I would upload photos but were i am has v bad wifi. A MUST SEE!

Marvellous!. Just have to go for this in the Prague castle. Tickets for quite a few of these attractions can be obtained together and this was amongst the standout attractions in Prague. Stunning architecture!
Just Beautiful !. Fabulous to see both inside and out. Amazing to know it took six hundred years to build with no power tools,
Gorgeous. The cathedral was build over 1000 years and has beautiful stained glass windows. st. vitas and St. Wenceslas are buried there.

Simply Amazing. This cathedral is a must to visit while in Prague. A moderate walk up the hill above the Charles Bridge and you find yourself exploring this wonderful Cathedral. We got there at 9 am for opening, to beat the crouds and were not disappointed. Make sure you add this to your visit list.

Gorgeous. A city of beauty, full of legend and loss.St Vitus is a symbol of all that is Prague.Started centuries ago by one of their own, that remained unfinished for centuries.It is nice to visit a cathederal where you can just enjoy it, without feeling like you were invading someones space. As an Atheist i can appreciate beauty, and this is beautiful. I just wish it was built for different reasons.

Impressive and somewhat Unusual. A wonder to the eye - regardless of abundance of grime on the outer structure (sure could use a cleaning). Inspect both in and out, you will be awed. It was started so long ago and was only recently completed in 1929 - you can see evidence in the "suited gentleman" carved into the facade above the doors in front. The stained glass is remarkable especially for their historical perspective and their colouration - striking to the eye. The architecture, with the flying buttresses, and stone carvings, gargoyles and mosaic on the one side are all worth seeing - and actually it is free - so do take it in.
Beautiful! . Absolutely beautiful building! A must see in prague. This building stands tall and can be seen from most places in prague.

Stunning interior.. We entered in the afternoon when the sun was streaming through the stained glass windows at an angle that cast a riot of rainbow colors on the walls and pillars. What a lucky coincidence of timing. If you can't get that timing right, the interior, as the title of the review says, is stunning and incredibly beautiful>

Very impressive from the outside, beautiful stained glass windows. I agree with others, no need to pay for an entrance in order to walk around the cathedral. It's impressive enough from the outside, and once you've seen the windows, there's not so much more to see anyway.

Breath-taking. The massive columns and vaulted ceiling of this massive cathedral are remarkably beautiful. The collection of new and old stained-glass windows fit together harmoniously. This was a highlight of our trip to Prague.

A cathedral not to miss. I know, I know: "You see one, you've seen them all." Not so with this one because of the gorgeous stained glass windows. They are among the most beautiful anywhere in the world.

Beautiful!. Amazing architecture! You don't pay to get in to the first part which was enough for us. You join a small line of people which moves very fast to get in, we went last week at around 12pm and we were in the cathedral within 2 minutes. Walk around inside, take photos and then when you are ready you leave through another door.
Amazing. Not anywhere the oldest cathedral in Europe but one of the most beautiful. Don't be satisfied just seeing the outside, go inside to see how beautiful this building is.
Don't miss the South Tower!. Impressive cathedral with untold history. Spend the extra to climb the 287 steps of the South Tower for an amazing birds eye view of the castle and Prague.
GREAT. beautiful exterior! i like that even if you didn't buy a ticket to see the cathedral, you can still go in and admire it! totally worth the climb to see it
Beautiful, worth the trip. Its just beautiful. My advice would be to go early morning so that you are not surrounded by tourists as this is an incredibly popular place. Just lovely inside and out.

Wonderful interior. To visit Prague Castle and not enter Saint Vitus cathedral would be a mistake. This is a wonderful example of Gothic architecture. Great stained glass windows towering above the floor.
Prestonman. Absolutely breathtaking and well worth a visit. The ticket you purchase does not get you into everything so be aware of this. The audio tour is money well spent.
Wonderful. Beautiful cathedral within the grounds of Orague Castle must not miss this if you are visiting Prague
Impressive glasses. Awesome glasswork on the windows and rose window too, great organ and statues decorating all the inside of the cathedral. Do not miss the gargoyles on the outside either.

Amazing. Overwhelming. Wow.. This almost felt like a visit to the Smithsonian. I think you could easily spend a day just in this Cathedral. Spring for the audio tour guide -- so many incredible pieces of artwork, so much history. Amazing!
Nice Church. You will love this church. Like most churches, they have a lot of history to study if you are into that sort of thing.

Impressive like most large Catholic cathedrals. St Vitus is impressive with its Gothic exterior and multiple flying buttresses reminiscent of my other cathedrals of Europe. But it is the glass that is particularly impressive which you can only appreciate once inside. The baroque edifice in silver at the far end which is the tomb of St John Nepomuk is also not to be missed.

Magical. As what many people have mentioned, St. Vitus is an amazing church. I got chills when I went inside. You can go in for free, but you can also purchase tickets for closer look. Please don't miss this church inside Prague Castle.

Some impressive features. Another Cathedral albeit very impressive from the outside. You can access the end bit with views of the length of the Cathedral free but the rest is accessed through turnstiles using the various Castle tour tickets. You can't sit in the pews they are roped off, so you tend to follow the crowd around. There can be a lot of tour groups , so its better to hang back and let them past. Was it worth the crowds and money ? Yes. There are some impressive stain glass windows and tomb decoration. The Cathedral had a strange feeling the light streaming in from the high windows contrasting with the dark stonework. It was good to see the tomb of St Wenceslas having sung about him for so many years.
Beautiful!. Beautiful cathedral. Wish it had been a bit more quiet like the churches in Italy, but the stained glass is worth the hustle and bustle.
It is a Nice visit. the cathedral is cool and beautiful. It is free and definetly a must see... If you want to get up to The top of The tower you should pay.

Incredible cathedral . Breathtaking piece of history. The castle is certainly worth a visit but the cathedral is the highlight. Fascinating to hear the history of it as shared by fantastic tour guide Tijo of Sandemans Prague castle tour. Highly recommended.

Avoid the gurads like the plague. I witnessed a guard twist a woman's arm for allegedly using a flash in the cathedral. This sort of violence is unwarranted, and completely detracted from the views inside. Probably stressed because the place is too crowded to be enjoyed anyway, and many people ignore the rules.

Vibrant stained glass. Abslolutely beautiful stained glass windows in this huge space. For those interested in architecture this is an impressive place to visit. Built over several centuries, the huge great spans supported by flying buttresses were most impressive.

Awesome exterior. we were in a group ,but couldn't go in. Coz the Que. Was so long that we didn't dare to stand . But the architecture from outside was simply mind blowing .part gothic ,renaissance,& baroque it has a mishmash of it all ,but the mosaic work on the side is very pretty .All in all not to be missed .
Excellent. Would have preferred to tour on our own in retrospect. The guide was good but you only see little bits. Think the audio tour would be better.

Huge Cathedral.. Many people were in line to see this beautiful church. There is a daily mass, which is not attended by many people. The stained glass windows are exceptionally beautiful. There are relics of several saints, and the silver crypt of St. John. We only had about 30 minutes to see it, but could have spent much more here. Well worth the price of admission.

Beautiful but Crowded. Absolutely beautiful cathedral filled with amazing history. I walked up from Charles Bridge. It was a lovely walk but steep incline and I would not recommend it if you are not used to strenuous walks.I got the complete palace tour ticket and opted for the audio tour. I would definitely recommend the audio tour. The volume goes high enough that you could probably share with another person. It provided the right amount of information and I could go at my own speed. You can rent them all day or for three hours. In addition to the rental fee, you have to leave a 500 CZK cash deposit. You can get the audio tours at all the info offices but you have to return the set to the same office you rent it from.The downside was the crowds. It was incredibly crowded with tour group after tour group within an hour of opening. Since I was alone, it was easy to slip between and around groups. It would have been challenging to do with children or more than two people.I would definitely go back again but I would try to get there right when it opened.

Very cool cathedral inside and out.. This is up in the Castle District, but within walking distance from Old Town Square. The Cathedral is free to see from the outside and is free from the inside as well if you stay in the front section of it. If you want to walk up and down the entire cathedral, then there is a fee.

Great Cathedral. Wonderful church, but it gets very crowded, so be prepared for a line. Fee charged to get into the main section of the church unless you go in as part of a tour. Definitely walk around the church outside to get the complete impact.
Mesmerising. Beautiful Cathedral in the Castle which is a must see in Prague alongwith the Prague Castle. It takes approx 1-2 hrs to visit the same & understand.
Breathtaking. One of the most majestic churches I've visited. The crowd can be quite insane so suggest to visit early and first thing when you are in Prague Castle. A must-see in Prague!

Medieval Church like all the others. This is a magnificent church that is part of the Prague Castle tour. You get to tour this church as part of the basic Prague Castle package. It's magnificent as expected and is a must if you visit Prague. The only other thing to say is that if you are touring European cities, you will see tons of similar churches. As the Brits say, "ABC - another bloody church!" While I have to agree, it is still a must see if you're in Prague. It's hard to believe that structures like this were constructed close to 1000 years ago.
Incredible. This place is enormous and you can spend hours finding special details in the interior of the cathedral. Difinitely worth a visit!

Good King Wenceslas. Take a look at the beautiful stained glass, and then make a beeline for the Wenceslas Chapel. You cannot enter (there are jewels embedded in the walls) but you can see it through two doorways and read all about its construction and paintings.
visit if you have spare time. not the best cathedral I have ever been too but worth a visit if you have time to spare - perhaps to get out of the sun

Powerful. Strong feeling of closeness to yourself and your creator...
The only bummer is a line you have to stand to enjoy 5 minutes inside....

Beautiful Old Cathedral. Its an ancient church inside the Prague Castle, the most beautiful part is the hand made glass paintings that adorn the walls of this church, and of course the entire structure is mesmerizing!
You cant skip this when in Prague!. Astonishing cathedral and at least when I was there, not as crowed as other cathedrals over Europe. Worth get the city tour ticket

Absolutely Beautiful. A definitive must when in Prague. We bought a ticket which allowed us access into 7 attractions within the castle area. They were however sold out of audio guides, they did have an app that I could download at a fee (About 2.5 Euro) but didn't find it to be that great. The one thing I disliked was the fact that you have to buy a permit in order to take pictures. We were also not allowed to go down into the tomb chamber and were told that it was only for special groups.

Vitus Cathedral is must see in prague. I have visited many different Cathedrals in Europe and I must say Vitus Cathedral is right on the top places to see. It is absolutely amazing Gothic Art piece. Very impressive outside and in. If you happen to go there when they have a service, you can't enter but I suggest to ask when service ends or come back next day. Inside is also very impressive. Walk around outside and take a road downhill with amazing view over the Prague. Last time I was there in June 7th 2015 and it was Sunday, not many tourists around, not crowded at all. Beautiful weather , very nice walk.

Gothic extravaganza. No visit to Prague should miss this. There are better and more traditional (and spiritual) Gothic cathedrals elsewhere in Europe, but this one is quite extraordinary in its fusion of styles.It's vast and impressive, and packed full of visitors taking selfies everywhere, but still manages to assert its personality.

Don't skip this truly awe-inspiring cathedral!. Architect envy abounded in this light drenched cathedral that soared into the heavens. Stained glass windows of exceptional sheer beauty. Whatever you do pay the ticket price to see it in its entirety - don't just stand at the end of the nave!

Interesting blend of old and new. Absolutely stunning cathedral inside and out. Interesting how the blend of old and new builds within this cathedral come together - the gothic and art nouveau together makes this cathedral unique. Some of the most mesmerising stained glass I have seen inside also!
Beautiful. The outside and inside are both beautiful. It can get busy so if you plan on really touring the cathedral, buy tickets beforehand.

Memorable Visit. This is a spectacular cathedral. You will be impressed by the size alone and the outside architecture before even walking inside. Going inside is part of the Prague Castle ticket. It is a must see if you are visiting.
A beautiful medieval looking in modern times built church. Inside the church there is not much surprising . It's like a church should be. The exterior , however, is beautiful to behold

Must see while in Prague! Be sure to buy tickets beforehand!. I made the mistake of waiting in the long line without buying tickets. You can still get in without a ticket, but you're restricted to only the frontal portion of the church. After realizing our mistake, we went and bought tickets across from the main entrance. BUYING TICKETS IS WELL WORTH IT! You can buy tickets that include multiple sites within the Castle District. I would suggest buying one that includes at least the palace and cathedral. While in the cathedral take note of Mucha's stained glass on the left, St. John of Nepomuk's silvery tomb in the back, and the auxiliary room to the right.
beautiful. Beautiful colours, we took great pictures, It was had too much crowd though. As far as I remembered the price was included in the ticket of the Prague castle. It was money well spent!

Impressive. Beautiful site -- take your time once inside to truly explore and look at the stained glass. It will be busy as the #1 site to see end ALL do so. If here on Sunday, recommend dressing a little nice and going to Sunday mass to see the church in all its glory with the choir and organ. On Sunday the church does not open till 12 noon for tourists but allows worshipers to come in.
Amazing. Wow, what a beautiful building - inside & out definitely worth seeing. The amount of work that has gone into the building is amazing.
a long queue. it 's a very big church and you can go for free but you have to pay if you want to be in the interior, admire the vitro

All that and more.... Walk over the St. Charles bridge, up the hill to the Castle, through the courtyard, through the entrance tunnel and then WOW... the angels will sing.. your breath will leave you.. because the vast beauty of St. Vitus Cathedral will cause those reactions... if you can please please come back up the hill at night and walk around St. Vitus... it is so peaceful and beautiful.. Please note that the tours stop early.. we went in the late afternoon two days and missed the tours both days... the first day we got there at 4 on the dot and the doors closed six feet in front of us.. we returned the next day at 3:35 only to find out that when they say they close at 4pm, they really close at 3:30 because that's when that stop letting people in.. just a word to the wise.

FABULOUS. All of the old areas of Prague are gorgeous but this cathedral in the Castle area is amazing. We have visited cathedrals all over Europe and usually they are beautiful but very, very dark. This one has tons of light coming in through spectacular stained glass windows (before noon on a sunny day, at least.) And it is not as dark as usual.The Castle district is a must to visit but BUY A TRAM TICKET (Tram 22) that covers the ride both ways. About 50 Krowns. It's tough to find a ticket machine in the Castle area; the return ticket precludes that problem. Note: The operators of the Castle District (including this church) should ask ALL Tour Guides for a favor: Don't let your 50 people block the entire aisle. Not everyone wants to wait five minutes to get by while you give a history lesson about the altar, for example, in Russian or Chinese. In truth this is a problem in the Old City as well; they walk down a street, filling it wall to wall (roadway and both sidewalks) .... not allowing anyone to pass. If you are going in the opposite direction, the people in the group are very surly that you are walking through their mob. (I guess you are expected to get into a store and wait five minutes until they have moved away from this area??)

Gothic spoilt by Baroque. For me, this lovely building is spoilt inside by too much baroque decoration. Another problem is the crowds: So many people want to go inside that there is only one driection you can go and you walk along in a huge crowd. Some of the stained glass is superb, notably the wonderful window designed by Mucha. A second problem, for elderly people, is that there is nowhere to sit down: the pews are blocked off. So even if you would like to sit and meditate on the beauty, you cannot do so. You are warned! The famous St. Wenceslas Chapel is difficult to see as you are not allowed inside, just to view from the doorways. The outside is lovely, especially the medieval golden decoration of the South gate.
Worth a visit. We just walked in and absorbed the atmosphere and beautiful windows. It is worth the walk and wait to get there.
Gorgeous windows. The setting is very impressive and I particularly liked the beautiful, richly coloured and varied stained glass windows.

WOW. I can't believe there is any other breathtaking sight on earth, it much bigger and higher than I expected it, its smell its Gothic style (although many parts of it is neo Gothic and some are in baroque style) but it is the finest example of Gothic architecture in Prague as I can see it
Excelent. this area of the cathedral and castle was brilliant. You can see part of the Cathedral free of charge Well worth the climb for the panoramic views.

Like nothing I've seen before. After walking up the castle walls and admiring the incredible view, I came across the cathedral. Physically, it's beautiful to look at. Every single inch has been planned so carefully. Each gargoyle has a different expression or pattern on it. A must see when in Prague!

Beautiful Cathedral. We visited on the hottest day of the year. You can only go into the main part of the cathedral by paying, but, as a Catholic, I asked to go to the chapel set aside for quiet prayer. It was beautiful, and so good to get away from the cacophony of noise from the tour guides. We were treated with great courtesy by the staff.

Amazing architecture. If you are able to join a tour, join one so you will understand the significance of the gargoyles at the sides of Cathedral (protection from evil) everything has meanings and history can unfold as you go inside and learn more about the unbelievable architecture of this Gothic building structure. Once inside you will see several stained glass adorning the sides of the cathedral (the guide will also explain the difference between a cathedral and a church). You will also see relics of saints (whatever bone remains that were saved). There are also chapels inside and one of them is for the grandmother of St Vitus.
Beautiful Cathedral. Absolutely beautiful to visit. We had an audioguide and it worked really well. We walked up the hill to the cathedral and had a great view of the city.

Modern stained-glass windows. When they had to rebuild parts of the church they decided to install contemporary (early to mid 20th-century) stained-glass windows. It was a great idea. The colors are so vivid and the images interesting for the modern eye.

looks great on the outside. The building looks astonishing, unfortunately, we didn't get to see the insides as it was closed for church service, so you might want to take a look at opening times before you go.
Wonderful Gothic Cathedral. A must if you are in Prague. Beautiful windows, statues, and art. Loved the stained glass windows. A little crowded when we were there but worth the bumping.
One of the best church I've ever seen. If you come to Prague you must viait this place as it is one of the most beautiful cathedral in Europe.
Stunning architecture. This beautiful Gothic cathedral is a highlight of the Prague castle district with it's towers, buttresses, stained glass windows and paintings.

A Must-visit in Prague!. Awesome Gothic architecture with gargoyles, many beautiful stained glasses (including Mucha's work) & sculptures. Having visited the cathedral for the first time after it was closed for the day and looked at the exterior only, we went back a couple of days later and bought our tickets for about $10 (CZK250) per person. This ticket was a package deal that allowed 3 other attractions in the Prague Castle (Royal Palace, St. George's Basilica & Golden Lane.) Well worth it!

A Gothic Masterpiece. St. Vitus's Cathedral is a majestic building. Tickets are required to visit the entire cathedral. The only free part is the western nave--from which you can only catch a glimpse of the Mucha window, for instance. Be aware that you will be required to buy a multi-entrance ticket for the Castle District in order to gain entrance to the entire cathedral nave. With these caveats, if you enjoy gothic cathedrals, then don't miss St. Vitus's Cathedral.

A Highlight of the Castle district. This stunning cathedral features stained glass from many centuries and historical artifacts in a building that still functions as a church. Lines can be long during peak tourist season, but it's worth a peek inside.
Sooooo beautiful. One of the most beautiful cathedrals I've ever seen. Very elegant. Gorgeous stained glass. The glass by Mucha was especially interesting to see.

So much history here. All very interesting and richly decorated, but why aren't there a few more English translations on the various monuments? To add that would enhance the experience of visitors from many countries

Worth the price of admission. One of the most prominent landmarks of Prague, the cathedral was built in two phases with the older medieval section the most impressive. The highlight for me was the Mucha stained glass window but there is lots of interest inside to justify the price of admission (you can also go in to a small part at one end for free if time is short). I would recommend you get one of the package tickets that give access to several of the attractions on Castle Hill.
Stunning Cathedral. I stumbled upon the Cathedral in the middle of a choral recital and it was magical! The interior is beautiful and impressive.

I'm not a cathedral person -but this one was worth the visit. It was interesting to see and read about all the different "pockets" in the church. I generally don't spend a ton of time in churches and admittedly our visit here was packed with tours - but you can't really miss it - and the outside of it was beautiful.
Always overcrowded. There's nothing really to mark St Vitus out as being special. It's like many other cathedrals, but probably more crowded than most
Fantastic stained glass windows. Brilliant, highly recommend giving this a look. It's so impressive, gothic looking and huge, the stained glass windows are amazing!
Wonderful visit. This is a great place to visit and is set in wonderful site the architecture is grand it's well worth a visit

Don't miss the Treasury of St. Vitus Cathedral. This was our second visit the St. Vitus Cathedral and we decided to visit the treasury. To get tickets you need to go to the chapel of the Holy Cross unless you combine with other tours. The Treasury was filled with beautiful artifacts and history. It takes about an hour or more to view, listen to the audio guide (which was excellent), and read the descriptions. Not very busy because most people miss this gem.

St. Vitus Cathedral: Dramatically beautiful. The church sits on a hill and is visible from miles away. Up close you'll see how well made it is - no wonder it's lasted so many centuries! But inside . . . ahh! THAT'S where the beauty is - it'll take your breath away. Spend some time there - just sit to rest your weary bones and feel the Lord's presence. You'll not regret it.

Another must see. This is a beautiful area, where you need a good hour or two to take it all in. The gothic architecture is amazing and the tours inside are very good. Sitting outside with a pint is a joy! Be prepared to walk up and around the cathedral.
very fascinating. a must see in Prague!it's huge and the architecture is unforgettable, both inside and outside!there is so much history inside.
A Little Bit of Religion on the Palace Grounds. Every European city has its church jewel and St. Vitas is that in Prague. It's located on the palace property and is a focal point of the city.
Beautiful Interior. The admission fee is worth it just to see the interior of this cathedral. Beautiful stain glass, interesting chapels, etc.
Wonderful architecture. This cathedral is magnificent with a lavish decoration including some great stained glass windows - one of them in the style of art nouveau!

Well organized. The ceiling is beautiful, and the progression of tourists along the periphery is one direction so you aren't jostling against others going the other way. Although sections are roped off, you get to certain areas with nice views to take photos.

Interesting would be an understatement. The outside is quite exquisite, the inside doesn't dissapoint. As befitting a Cathedral in a Royal Castle it is ornate to the rafters. A beautiful building with amazing craftmanship and wonderfull stained glass. My only critisism is the odd ticketing system they have, you can't buy a ticket for the Cathedral you have to buy a package that includes the Cathedral, however as everthing in Prague, tickets are inexpensive.

A must see experience .... The cathedral was closed for services when we arrived in the Castle precinct and the queue was quite long when time came to enter. Absolutely worthwhile with amazing sculpture important burials and amazing architecture. well worth the queue which may be less if not visiting on Sunday!
Amazing!. This place is amazing, the building, the stained glasses, everything! Wow! We included this in our circuit B trip

Excelent gothic style church. St. Vitus Cathedral is a must see on your visit to Prague.Not to busy when we visited and tickets for the church need to bought form ticket office which offers 2 types some get you in all places to see whereas some don't.Walk up to visit from Metro station Malostranská or get tram 22 from outside and then walk down steps with good views or tram back.Great architecture inside with large stained glass windows one designed by Mucha.The church itself is located within the Prague castle boundaries.

Go at night. I visited both in the early afternoon and late at night. In the afternoon it was very crowded but worth it to climb to the top of the tower (263 steps, 150 crowns) and see the view. But then I went back at 10:30 pm, when you can't go in any buildings but the grounds are still open (they stay open until midnight). It was wonderfully empty and the cathedral is even more beautiful when lit up at night. I highly recommend going at night; my friend and I just sat on the benches right by the cathedral and saw maybe only 30 people over the course of an hour (who all came and went fairly quickly, so sometimes there was no one else).

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral in Prague. The cathedral has an interesting history and the architecture is amazing for its time of construction. The stained glass windows are lovely and the most famous of them was designed by Mucha.  The only problem with the visit was the long line to get in as it was extremely crowded. I would recommend going as early as possible. It opens at 9 am.

A must see - but don't go by taxi. It's one of the most beautiful churches in Europe I have ever visited. Malostranská station of Metro. Don't forget that taxis in Prague are expensive, drivers choose longer ways so you have to pay more, and completely dispensable because all points of interest are within walking distance and metro and trams can take you everywhere for honest prices.

amazing art not to be missed. A must travel to see the gothic architecture of a such a fantastic work of art inside the cathedral. The view of the roof as well as the windows are mesmerising, in a word fabulous piece of sculptors, everyone should visit while at Prague. This is a spiritual symbol of Czech.The cathedral was commissioned by Charles IV, and construction began in 1344 on the site of an earlier 10th century. This is located within Prague Castle and containing the tombs of many Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors, the cathedral is under the ownership of the Czech government as part of the Prague Castle complex.
Wow!. Again the architecture is mind blowing and well worth the walk. Very gothic and dark. Also near other attractions

Stunning. Simply beautiful cathedral, stunning architecture. Lovely mosaics and an astonishing silver tomb. The stained glass windows on a sunny day are spectacular. Definitely one to put on your list of things to do in Prague. Range of tickets available to visit other attractions.

ASTONISHING. A good travel back in time to medieval times; architecture and history lovers will enjoy it. A great opportunity for contemplating a marvelous piece of sculptures as well as a glorious view of the roof

A lovely cathedral. We are touring Europe, so we go to a lot of churches and cathedrals. This one is spectacular. I wasn't familiar with the architects or artists, so it was entirely a new experience. It is amazing that the silver tomb remained there throughout the Nazi and Communist regimes. The mosaics are also impressive. Definitely a place to stop.

Marvel at he Workmanship. If you like Gothic architecture (I do) you'll love this cathedral. Go inside and you will be amazed at the stain glass windows. a truly awe inspiring visit.Bob&Lynne Adey (Malta)
Beautiful period church. I have been to many European great churches. I place this one in the upper tier. Beautiful stained glass windows.
Amazing. Huge cathedral in the Castle District. We could have spent more time there but so much to see and do.

An incredible feat of engineering. Dating back to the 14th century it's style was gothic. It was not completed and work stopped on it during various wars. After the Renaissance the style changed to baroque. The church still has both gothic and baroque features. The stained glass is actually painted. It best feature is the St. Wenceslas chapel where the relics of the saint are kept. Outside in the front the facade is incredible. This cathedral is to me the highlight of the visit to the Prague Castle.

Beautiful Cathedral. This is a must see when you visit Prague. You do not need to be religious to go to the cathedral. The architecture of the cathedral is amazing. The church had passed through many royal families so you can see how all the different influences came into the churches completion. The sculptures and stained glass are unreal. You have to see it to believe it. Can't wait to go back again.

Absolutely Mesmorizing. This is definitely a place to visit while in Prague. Whether one is religious or not the magnificence of this building is something to see. The stained glass and painted ceilings are breathtaking. To walk where royalty has walked was really neat. You can see the differences through the ages of the different families who contributed to the building of the cathedral.

Breathtaking mix of Architectural styles. I felt safe although there were so many tourists there. I can imagine there are many more during the summer months and that it gets quite crowded. The line to get in was long but moved quite quickly.
Awesome. Spectacular church, beautiful stained glass and sculptures. Liked the variety of monuments and chapels and explanatory materials
most beautiful church. The church is an element of the Prague castle " compound ".I should say that u. Can purchase upon entering the area a all event ticket which ge

Our visit to St. Vitus Cathedral. Gorgeous isn't the word for this super ornate cathedral. It is beautiful inside and out... extremely awe inspiring. One should not miss this extravagant cathedral. The workmanship will leave you breathless! I loved the many gargoyles and faces worked into the texture of the exterior! Just fabulous!

WOW.. This is now my NEW favourite cathedral in Europe. It is spectacular on the outside and the inside, which is decorated in art nuoveau stained glass and murals, interspersed with Renaissance and Baroque aspects. The Gothic spires, gargoyle and all the gilded parts of the building are fantastic. The Cathedral is part of the Prague Castle conglomeration of buildings and mini museums. Well worth a half day or more, depending on your time.

Fantastic! What a beautiful cathedral.. You can see this cathedral from miles around and it really is a must see in Prague. It is so impressive to look at on the inside and the outside especially up close when you can appreciate the smaller details. There is an area inside the cathedral which you have to purchase a ticket for however we didn't and were still extremely impressed. Definitely visit when in Prague.

Impressive architecture and stained glasses.. We didn't pay for the visit, only to get in. The view was impressive, though. The place is too crowded to enjoy calmly the cathedral. However, we climbed the stairs up the bell tower and that was really worth paying the ticket. Great views and much less people.

Stunning St Vitus. A walking tour is the only way to do justice to the fabulous old city of Prague.Above all sits St Vitus Cathedral, like a bejewelled tiara watching down upon all its loyal subjects.The imposing Gothic architecture (a la Notre Dame) is glorious in its gabled arches, crusted coronets and gargoyles.Next to the rear entrance is a wonderful example of mosaic frescos depicting the angels saving the souls of the dead.The interior knave is stunning in size and grandeur yet reflects an austere view about the worship of the Lord.A must see to any Prague visitor.
wow. Fantastic place everyone need to see if you are in Prague. From there just go around and enjoy the view
Stunningly Beautiful. The St Vitus Cathedral and the Prague Castle dominate the Prague skyline. It is a strikingly beautiful building inside and outside and well worth the visit.

Stunning!!. Its quite a walk up the cobbles and on an unusually warm sunny winters day we took our jackets off!!! You can enter the main hall to get a sneak pak of the inside. Its gorgeous. You then get to choose to pay for full access. Definitely work the walk up there as you then get fab views over Prague. Beautiful pictures to treasure forever.
church. I found it very simillar with Paris' Sacre Coeur, but it is very famous and you should not miss it. Including castle.

One of the prettiest churches I've ever visited. We loved our tour of St Vitus Cathedral. I'm a huge fan of beautiful stained glass windows and this cathedral has about the prettiest I've ever seen. The Mucha window was stunningly gorgeous. Make sure to take your time to view all of the windows and it's helpful to have a guide with you to explain what you're seeing. We had hired a guide for the day, so he took us in and walked us through explaining all of the many interesting and beautiful parts of St Vitus. A must see!
Beautiful!. The Cathedral is inside the Prague Castle, which was unexpected. The Cathedral is beautiful, very well decorated. It is really big!

Fabulous stained glass and incredible views from the Bell Tower. The stained glass in the cathedral is wonderful to see. we also climbed the steps up the Bell Tower and enjoyed amazing views of the city from the top. Well worth the climb if you are able..

Impressive Historical Architecture. This Cathedral is very impressive, both from the inside and the outside. The stained glass windows are especially beautiful. There's also an area only accessible if you buy a ticket (we didn't go there), but there's a lot to see in the free area.
amazing. it´s so beautiful, the high towers, the statues, the park around it, the interior, i was really impressed.

Crusted masterpiece. The Mucha glass designs are stunning - but so too are the rest of the windows; the interior a light filled and relatively austere space that swallows you up, in a skin that seems to burst through the cramped surrounding square. A great place for gargoyle watching.
Impressive. St. Vitus Cathedral is impressive. The stained glass windows are amazing. The altar, the artwork and other factors enhanced the beauty of the cathedral. We were very glad we visited it.

Forgotten Church. Stunning and breath-taking stained glass! St. Vitus is a must if you want to visit a historical Gothic church with buried Bohemian kings It is beautiful and takes time to tour. Morning adds a wonderful spectacular display of warm lights through the glass. It has the well known Art Nouveau artist Mucha's glass work. I thought St. Vitus was equal to beauty as Notre-Dame.

Most Impressive Cathedral I have Ever Seen. The Cathedral is magnificient, the stained glass windows and tombs stood out. There is so much history to take in. The walk through the garden to get to the Cathedral was very pleasant.
Huge and great. It seems like other European Cathedrals but steel so great and really inspired. Recommend to visit early morning when there are no tourist groups in.
Stunning stunning stunning. Absolutely beautiful cathedral. Set aside plenty of time as this place will have you forever taking photos. Gorgeous.

Breathtaking...give yourself a half to whole day to tour. There are many options of tickets to tour the grounds. You don't need to buy them all. Just get one that gets you the full access to the cathedral and one or two others at most. There is a great cafe just outside the gates by the vineyard!

One of the places in Prag that is not able to beat Paris. Its nice and clean but the size is not competable with Notra Dame , and there is simply not enough historic signs an explanation to compite what a shame because it could have been much better if the chuch had been better presented as The soroundings are very beutiful

Feels like I been before. Right this cathedral is beautiful to look at but I can't help the feeling I have seen something similar loads of times before. It's a beautiful church but for me it's hasn't got the wow factor of some of the cathedrals I have been in but still a decent place to visit when you in Prague of this is your sort of thing and since it's just about the only original thing in the castle so it's worth going. Work is still been carried out in some part of the cathedral.

Very nice. I have been to many ornate churches in my travels. This was not the fanciest but it was very nice. I think it suffered many year of not being maintained. They are working on it now though. There was a beautiful silver sculpture honoring the priest who refused to divulge the Queen's confessional secrets and had his tongue ripped out before being killed. The external showed the many architectural styles over the centuries.

An extremely beautiful Cathedral. Having seen most of the cathedrals in Europe, i cannot deny that my jaw dropped with the beauty of St. Vitus. To visit Prague, and not to visit St. Vitus Cathedral, is a mistake that will sooner or later, regret¡

Must see!. It's one of the main touristic place in Prague. St. Vitus Cathedral looks really amazing. If you want to go insaide and rise to top of tower, buy full ticket, it's about 350 kr. Visiting other museum is included. But I thing St.Vitus Cathedral,Tower and Gold Street are enough, other museums are boring.

Beautiful building. Great building in middle of old town. Very detailed architecture and a sight to see! Easy to find...gets very very crowded during the day, so if you want excellent photos, visit in the morning.

Beautiful Arcitecutre. This church was built over a very long period of time and has some unusual characteristics due to this fact. Unlike other churches I have been in, this appears not to be an active church or a place that is maintained with religious respect (I could barely hear myself think with all the tours and noise).
Beautiful cathedral. Architecture is amazing, and you just can't stop looking around for new things to see. I would stay for a good hour to take everything in.

If you've seen one..... Honestly, these cathedrals, if you've seen one, you've seen them all, and it is coming from someone who really likes art. I don't like it as much as I thought, I guess. My first thought was that this place looked so similar to the Köln Dom: the nave, the stained glass windows, the modern addition to the stained glass window, the important person's tomb, the various chapels and alcoves, good materials for a Dan Brown book, but exhausting and fatiguing for a tourist. Nonetheless, i was glad to see gargoyles doing what they were designed for because it was a rainy day.
Wow. what a place, how pretty how romantic, it's such a sight to see and in such an amazing city, will be returning
New and old. As part of our tour in the castle area,we visited the church,it's nice gothic architecture with a renewed parts ,difficult to to recognize it from the original old one
A decent visit. Located close to the Prague Castle. It gives a nice perspective on Prague's history and has some nice frescos.

An original beauty, wonderful glass.. Wonderful experience, I got so caught up in the place I lost my wife! The stained glass windows are brilliant like no other I've seen, typical Czech original beauty.
Only Cathedral I have liked.. I am more a eat and drinks guy when I travel. Leave the museums and churches to the wife. But this cathedral was pretty awesome.

What a wonderful sight!. This is a fascinating place to visit as part of your tour of the Castle District. We were there with a guide which is highly recommended because there are so many stories about this huge church. If you want to see the whole church, there is an entrance fee. The flying buttresses, the gargoyles, the various side altars are all great stories. Most of the windows were destroyed during the war and have been re-done by modern artists. A must see is the window by Alfons Mucha! There are cafes around when you get tired of walking and sightseeing though our cappuccino cost about $7!
Interesting. We walked around here as a part of the Prague Castle tour and loved it, a great church with lots of interesting things to look at

Magical but...you've to pay for..... The Prague cathedral is always a magical place, a gothic masterwork where you can have a good feeling...except for the actual tradition in Europe to pay to enter in a church....

Amazing stained glass work!. Wow! Didn't expect a Church inside the castle to be this big and so pretty! The stained glass work is beautiful and there are several huge ones around the Cathedral. Very beautiful!
amazing inside. beautiful and serene place even with all the tourists - you could only go to the Alter if you had a ticket so that was disappointing but the stain glass windows are beautiful
seen better. I think the one in Milan and the one in Venice is more impressive .Ok they and included on our castle ticket

Amazing Architecture.. We started our journey early in the morning and was there for the opening. Even when the cathedral opens there are already a lot of people waiting. This cathedral is huge and you can spend a lot of time outside as well as inside looking at the details of this building. Well worth the climb to get to see it. There is also an outdoor cafe hidden on one side of the buildings in the outdoor garden. Look for the signs directing to the cafe.

Stunning building with amazing architectural features. It is amazing to realise how long it took to build St. Vitus' Cathedral. Beautiful stained glass windows, gargoyles to scare the worst evil spirits away and amazing structural features to absorb. Note that the cathedral closes at 5pm and you can only enter the knave for free. To go further into the cathedral you need to purchase a ticket. As with everything in Prague you may find yourself queuing to enter unless you are on a guided tour who seem to get priority enter.

See Windows inside. Because it is surrounded outside by buildings, you must go inside to really appreciate it. The stain glass windows are amazing. Spend time on the Art Nouveau Mucha window and other modern ones in this church started in 14th C.

One of the finest examples of stained glass in the world.. St. Vitus Cathedral is one of the finest examples of excellent stained glass in the world. These ancient stained glass windows were preserved through the centuries and reflect the unique skills of the artists of a former time. One of the more recent windows is in the style of the Czech artist, Mucha. The area reserved for the former king is of beautiful semi precious stones and the catacombs below the cathedral house the remains of several former kings. A very impressive and moving experience.
Incredible . What brilliant work was done in the 14th Century. The addition blends in really well and doesn't look like an addition. Well worth a look
A must visit. Even though it was early May there were numerous tourists, of which we were also, but it is worth buying a 4 venue ticket to enable to get into the places within the Castle grounds.
Wonderful architeture. This imposing cathedral was one of the highlights of our visit to Prague. Its beautiful arching roof, stained glass and history make it a lasting memory.

Beautiful Gothic church inside Prague castle. This is the center piece of Prague castle. This Gothic church is easily one of the most recognisable churches in Europe for its imposing architecture and amazing interior. The stained glass windows add a beautiful colorplay.

Quaint. I come from a country which has 2 beautiful Cathedrals so I am no stranger to this kind of beauty. The St Vitrus Cathedral however is not as rich as the average Cathedral, but it's stanied glass ornaments are worth every minute. The top of the Cathedral Tower (256 steps) gives a bird's eye view of Prague and is a great spot for some photos. Beware that the winding staircase is not for the faint-hearted.

Magnificent Church. We got a chance to see the Cathedral on the way up to see the Prague Castle. The church is beautiful, and the interior is really impressive -- kind of reminded me of the Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris.
Wonderful Cathedral.. Amazing architecture and the interior is awe inspiring.The stain glass windows were magnificent.This must be one of the most spectacular Cathedrals in the whole of Europe.

Impressive, beautiful.... This was a beautiful cathedral. There was some renovation going on but you could still walk inside. Beautiful stained glass, altar, ceiling paintings. Looks like they had one mass scheduled on Sunday's. It was very surrean, quiet...and peaceful. I am glad I had a chance to see it.

Special Place. The stained glass was awesome. Suggest going early as it gets more difficult to enjoy when you are elbow to elbow. The queue moved quickly so do not be discouraged. It's well worth the wait and a feast for the eyes.

Awesome. Simply awesome.. Honestly, this is a must. Take yourself on a slow walk from the town square up the hill, notice the many photo opportunities en-route, and when you get to the top, prepare to be impressed. The only other place that's ever made me feel awestruck like this has been St.Pauls in London. If you only visit one large, ornate church in Prague (and there are a lot of them to choose from), please make it this one. You won't be disappointed. There are 2 types of entry : free (you can only access the rear part of the church) and paid (you get to walk all the way down to the altar area. And when I say "all the way..." I mean it. This place is huge). I took the free option, but next time, maybe I'll pay for the walk and the extra view. Breathtaking. At the rear area at least, cameras were not banned, as they are in some churches - just no flash allowed. And the attendants *will* reprimand you sharply if you do use a flash. I strongly urge you to take the time to visit this place.
St. Vitus cathedral. Amazing cathedral. Absolutely beautiful. Details are soooo delicate. You should go. ......Disliked thing was you paid entrance fee........
Beautiful Church. Another beautiful church to go in to and gaze at the stunning stained glass windows. Don't miss it - but don't spend too much time here - there's more to see in Prague!!

Stunning building. Not being religious I wasn't too sure about whether or not I wanted to visit this landmark but I'm extremely glad I did. The interior is stunning with its vaulted ceiling, frescos and stain glass windows. The light falls through the windows in golden shafts illuminating the the many tourists and admirers gazing open mouthed at the beauty of it. The exterior is imposing and equally a stunning work of art that speaks volumes about the dedication and skill of the artisans that created all those centuries ago.Do not miss this treasure. And be sure to bring your camera.

Stunning. It started with a great walk up the hill through the beautiful streets of prague. The cathedral needs to be visited as early in the day as possible as it will be busy. By the time we were leaving it was crowded. The cathedral is as beautiful as any you will ever see, the way the sun glows through the stained glass windows and casts its many colours across the building is stunning. Truly worth a few hours viewing time, there is just so much to see and then take a walk around the outside and see just how incredible the outer building is.
A must. Majestic experience. So much to see inside and the history. A good day's tour to see all of it. Panoramic view of Prague. Small side streets offer small shops.
Magnificent. A wonderful cathedral......even on a second visit. It really does show you something new every time you go. The sheer height takes your breath away.
Worth a visit. Beautiful.fabulous building although gets very crowded so go early before the crowds.stained glass windows are gorgeous but not a huge cathedral .

Attractive stained glass windows, shame about the crowds. The Cathedral is part of the Castle complex, and always full of tourists with a queue to get in and another to get through the ticket barrier inside the building. Once inside, the stained glass windows are beautiful and colourful, with a spectacular tomb of a local king/prince as something else worth seeing. But for me, the highlight was the relics of "Good King Wenceslas" in the side chapel. Externally, the building is impressive, but hard to get decent views of as it is within the castle complex so surrounded by other buildings on 3 sides. Sadly, no information in the church - just references to an audio guide number, so either rent an audio guide, or take a guide book with you.
Beautiful Windows. This church is well worth a visit. The stained glass windows are amazing, the Mucha window is beautiful.

Stunning. What a beautiful cathedral, well worth a visit. Go early, ie when it opens as the crowds are huge and the queues mostly consist of groups. We got in there early and didn't have to queue at all. Watch the changing of the guard in the main square at 12pm too.

One of the better cathedrals i saw. After you walk up on the stairs, and you hope that in the end will be a small leprecon with a pot of gold, you see this which is not a pot of gold but i am sure that no matter how much gold you will get it will not be worth not seeing the place because the stories cant give you the picture of the inside, I was in Krakow cathedral in the wawel and i was impressed by the beauty of this cathedral so if you are in Prague go and see the place!

Brought family memories to mind. My parents [Sicilians in Brooklyn] always had a small statue of the Infant of Prague [with a dime under her on their dresser]. I was surprised and delighted to see the statue. At home, I have a Buddha statuary on my dresser.......with a dime under it.

Gorgeous. A wonderful old cathedral with beautiful windows. So much history in Poland. It wasn't crowded and there is signage along the way inside to tell you what you are viewing if you don't take a purchased tour.

What a beautiful cathedral!. I've seen lots of churches and cathedrals throughout Europe and St. Vitus is as lovely as any. The stained glass was a highlight, especially the Mucha art nouveau window. In my opinion, should you find yourself in Prague, this would be the one must-see landmark.
Impressive. Impressive to visit, now for free unless you wanna tour the whole church, tht was the only thing we visited while in the castle district...

Stunning. We came here first as part of our castle complex ticket and were amazed. The architecture and history are incredible, and the tower also offers some incredible views of Prague. Do not miss it!
Stunning. What can I say it was utterly breathtaking, best part of our holiday we went back twice we loved it that much.

splendid. It is a marvelous cathedral. Well maintained. Must do to experience the culture and history of the city. It is a massive cathedral with stunning gothic style architecture and detailing. Overlooks the city from the hill right behind the palace.A treat to the eyes..you need to climb a lot of steps to get there. Having said that, it is worth every bit of the climb!
Beautiful stained glass. We visited on a cold clear day...was extremely busy but once inside it was worth the hustle and bustle just to gaze at the stained glass windows...wonderful visit.

Need ticket!. The windows are beautiful, especially when the light is pouring through. Unfortunately, seeing all of the interior is limited unless a special ticket is bought. Without it, visitors become part of a packed crowd , cordoned off at the rear.
Wonderful views. A beautiful and vast cathedral with superb views to enjoy as well. Such an amazing location and definitely worth visiting

My top tip.... ... is to wait until later in the afternoon to visit the Cathedral. It is part of your '7 attractions' within the Castle for which you need to buy a ticket. We went straight to the Cathedral and the queue to get in snaked all the way around. So, we visited all of the other attractions, had a couple of coffees in one of the several places to eat/drink within the amazing Castle complex and ended up back at the Cathedral at around 3.45. And.... no queue! Once you are in there, it simply takes your breath away. The most amazing stained glass windows I have ever seen. More opulent and splendid, I think, than any other Cathedral I have visited - including Notre Dame. Whether you choose to queue or not to queue - this is one attraction you must not miss if you visit Prague.
Beautiful. Nice cathedral on top of a hill, worth seeing when in Prague! No cues and great environment. Also you can have a walk around outside in a mediaeval surrounding.

Magnificent. OK, I'm a fan of Medieval cathedrals, but St. Vitus is simply breathtaking. The stained glass windows are wonderful, especially the later ones. One of these was done by Alfons Mucha, a proud son of Czechoslovakia, and European pioneer of Art Nouveau. Also within is the beautiful, if wildly Baroque, tomb of St. Nepomuk. St. Vitus' Cathedral is fun for all, but should not be missed by history, art or architecture buffs. Thumbs up!

Immense beyond imagination. The sheer size of the cathedral cannot be adequately described in words. The fact that it can be seen from any point in Prague gives you an idea, but once you walk into it your jaw drops in amazement.
Very interesting. Well worth a visit if you are thinking of doing the castle as well. A lot of restoration going on at the moment , but does not spoil your visit in any way.

Breathtaking. St. Vitus cathedral is a must see when in Prague. It's absolutely stunning both inside and out. We didn't pay to see the extra bits but you can go in and see the main part of the cathedral for free. The stained glass windows are breathtaking.

Lovely Cathedral, But didn't understand the ticket system. When you walk up the winding castle walkway, you suddenly come to face this strikingly beautiful building. It's rather large from the outside and inside it's even better. Me and my group paid for the extra ticket that lets you venture to the top of the tower, where we were graced with beautiful views. I would like to point out however that the stairs up the tower are unbelievably steep and due to the length of this and the claustrophobic atmosphere I almost had a panic attack. It's hard work to reach the top, but most probably worth it.

The oldest one. The cathedral is located in Hradcany and makes part of Pagues castle. Personnaly a saw many more cathedrals who are much more impressif. Inside it is quite dark,and the most imressif are the stained-glass windows.

Best attraction in Prague castle. It is the most impressive attraction in the castle. Of the cathedral’s numerous side chapels, the grand chapel of sv Vaclav is the main attraction. Highlight of the ambulatory is the tomb of St John of Nepomuk, sculptured in silver with free flying angels holding up the heavy drapery of the baldachin. The imperial mausoleum in the centre has royal crypt, resting place of Emperor Charles IV.

Beautiful - but not worth paying for . This is one of Europe's classic cathedrals, and it is as beautiful as any grand gothic cathedral. You should defenitly come here when in Prague, though paying to see most of the inside is a disappointment and not worth it. It is also possible to pay to go up the belltower. We didn't, since you get great views from beneath the cathedral, but I'm guessing it might be cool.

Must See!. The height of the interior ceiling is breath taking. The workmanship of the structure itself is a work of art, and the stained glass windows are priceless. Lots of history in here. I was disappointed that the stairs to the towers were closed the day I was there -- must be an amazing view of Prague.

Beautiful. Loved touring the cathedral. Paid extra to get behind the roped areas but not sure it was worth the added cost. You can see just as much staying in the general area. Beautiful cathedral and highlight of the castle area.

Nice place. Huge nice place. - is lot of tourists and tickets buy should be automated some how more simple. But, place is unique and very interesting place. Also, my eyes opened when we walk there from the center. I was keen to seen mythic signs of illuminati.
Magnificent . Absolutely awe-inspiring and amazing architecture. Beautifully built with so much to eyeball on its exterior. I was particularly taken back by the golden mosaic.
Beautiful church. I loved especially the wonderfull glass windows displaying so many colours. Very crowded, but it definitely worth visiting.

Absolutely stunning. The cathedral dominates the skyline of Prague, and it is certainly worth a walk up the hill to see it close up. The whole thing is an absolute work of art - even by European cathedral standards. A whole day could easily be spent exploring every nook and cranny of this place, and it would definitely be a day well spent. The walk up is a lot of steps, but easily worth it.

Great piece of gothic art. The Sint-Vitus Cathedral is a part of the Prague Castle. This cathedral is an excellent example of Gothic architecture and is the biggest and most important church in the country. The genius architect Peter Parler was the master builder in the 14th century. It took nearly 600 years to finish the cathedral. What makes the cathedral so special for me, is the excellent preservation. You can imagine the Czech Crown and gentry sitting here during mass.
Overwhelming Cathedral. The stained glass windows are outstanding. The old & new divide of the Cathedral was fascinating, & the history of the Crypt clearly displayed.

Tower of power. We visited the Tower first and those 289 steps were enough to beat me into humbleness and bliss.The view is well worth the effort. The actual cathedral is huge, a majestic structure, Yes, it's old, old and you can feel the history there.

Highlight of the Castle Complex. St. Vitus Cathedral is the centerpiece of the Prague Castle complex of buildings, and is the largest church in the Czech Republic. I believe the current church dates back to the early-mid 14th century and is stunning from both the inside and outside. Unfortunately, from what I was told, to tour the entire cathedral, you need to buy a ticket that also includes other buildings within the Castle complex. Would be nice to just be able to take a tour of the cathedral itself.

Magical light and colours. This beautiful cathedral was lit like a fairytale grotto by the multicoloured light sparkling through the most beautiful stained-glass windows (and one PAINTED by Mucha) that I have ever seen. Please don't miss it!!

This is a don't miss. Largest castle in the world, so they advertised. The entire complex is huge. Visited on a holiday weekend day and it was crowded. If you go, get a tour guide; very helpful and you get an explanation of not only the Cathedral but a visit to the older part of the castle.
Beautiful. Beautiful windows. It is necessary to have ticket to enter. Very crowded but worth the crowd to tour this magnificent building
Worth the stair climb :). The tower takes you up a flight of at least 600 stairs! But the when you reach on the top (panting!) you get the most amazing views of Prague.
Breathtaking Windows. The stained glass windows in this cathedral were worth walking for! Detail was incredible and it was the highlight of the afternoon spent here and at the castle.

Beautiful, but a little confusing. The best tip I can give for anything Prague Castle-related is to plan on spending tow half days there. I say this because it will be VERY crowded in the mornings, however, your tickets are good for two days. So, if you go in the mid to late-afternoon, you can still visit three or four locations before they close up, and you can return the following day to finish up your tour. That's the best way to visit this attraction.Over a week after visiting, I'm still a little confused as to the concept of "Prague Castle". I'm thinking it should be called "Prague Castle Compound", or "Collection of Buildings Near Prague Castle", because the jewel of the "compound" is St. Vitus Cathedral.Sure, the other buildings are equally impressive, but it's St. Vitus you see from the bridge, it's St. Vitus that greets you as you emerge from the tunnel, and it's St. Vitus that has the biggest impact, and the most wow factor.Yes, if it's crowded, you're going to run into a wall of people at the mouth of the tunnel, who will all be doing what you really want to be doing, too - standing there, staring up at and taking pictures of the magnificent exterior of St. Vitus.It's impossible not to be stopped in your tracks by this beautiful building. As I said, it's the first thing you see when you exit the tunnel, and it dominates your view. But please remember - there are other people who are trying to get around you, so try not to take root as you're taking pictures. Snap a few, then move off to the side so that others can either pass, or - more likely - also stop to get a few pictures taken.The interior is just as stunning as the exterior. It's cool and beautiful inside, and even if it gets crowded (and it WILL get crowded), you should still be able to move around freely.There are a ton of really beautiful displays and exhibits within St. Vitus, but most of them lack English translations. It would be easy to get lost in the little nooks, reading about the importance of a display, or how old a relic is, but it's not always possible.Still, it's a nice way to spend an hour or so, and the stained glass windows are fantastic.
Magical Stained Glass. Be ready to be awed with the stained glass that you will view in this Cathedral. Mucha has a set of stained glass that displays a beautiful arrangement of colors!!
Dusty. This cathedral would be beautiful if it was cleaned. Very very dusty. If cleaned the golds and colours would show through!!

Breathtaking. This cathedral is awe inspiring both inside and out. We visited right at 9 am before the crowds. Pay for a photo permit - 50czk - worth every penny. Remember to respect the whispering rule inside the cathedral.

Just amazing. The Cathedral is gorgeous and a definite must-see. We purchased the B ticket per our travel guide's recommendation and it included the tour of St. Vitus. We spent about 30 minutes here. I did feel the outside of the Cathedral was even more impressive than the inside, especially when compared to other interiors in Prague, but it's a gorgeous part of history that is not to be missed.

Beautiful stained glass windows. St. Vitus was the highlight of our trip. Definitely buy the ticket to walk through the whole church. Make sure you go in the morning, less crowds and a partly sunny day to get the full affect of the windows.

Must see in Prague. The St. Vitus Cathedral is located in the Prague castle and it's one of the main attractions there. The interior is amazing, with vividly colored stain glass. The tour is for free. It's a must see if you come to Prague.

You cannot imagine the beauty. This cathedral is a fantastic example of the beauty of buildings and history in this great city. The major expense is the flight or drive to get there. You will begin to understand the impact of the Hapsburg Empire. There is so much to learn.

Really good. We have seen the cathedral from external view and, then visited. Indeed, impressed too much... Belongings, interior with full of history and, things coming from very old times having full of Czech culture...

St. Vitus Cathedral. In the same area with Prague Castle, you can missed the cathedral. So beautiful from outside with all the architectures, and when you going inside its awesome with the interior and stunning glass windows. When i visit here, it is one week before Easther, there is a sunday mass at 11am. The security stop all the tourist include and told me that we cant go inside because there is Sunday mass at that time, but we can go inside if we want to join the Sunday mass. I take the change, its my first time join a Sunday Mass in Europe. And it was an great experience.

stained glass windows. This church has wonderful architecture and magnificent stained glass windows. Very popular attraction. There is a charge to view part of the interior. Outside the are unique views of the city.

Beware of pickpockets. Great windows and paintings but pickpockets very active between ticket bureau and castle/cathedral entrance. Also bad exchange rate at currency exchange. Different ticket location if you want a guided tour as opposed to self-guided.
If in Prague!. You can not miss the cathedral when visiting the Castle area-first impressions will take your breath away-this place is absolutely stunning.
Magnificent Cathedral. Limited area in which to move around inside, but the stained glass windows are fabtastic. Well worth a visit
surprised. I was expecting a beautifull cathedral and vitrals, but I got much more. Can't miss Mucha's vitral and the chapel in honor to the pilots of WWII.

Mucha stained glass window. The highlight here for me is the Alphos Mucha stained glass window. It was brilliant. Interesting note, this window has an advertisement on it, the sponsor who paid for the window. You can enter the cathedral for free or pay a fee for a tour.

Purchase Tickets to Go Fully In!. You can visit St. Vitus without a ticket, but it only gets you in so far. Buy the ticket that allows you to visit St. Vitus, the Palace, the Basilica and the Golden Row. It is well worth the time and money!

St Vitus Cathedral. This is a magnificent building well worth seeing. It gets very very busy. The best is to go there for 9 am. You have to pay to go into the Cathedral 500 krone for the Palace as well. There is a lovely little street called Golden Lane which I think is included in the price. If not you pat 250 krones or 125 krones for 65 and over. You can go into the house which is interesting as it contains lots of suites of armour etc.
Must see. Gorgeous and striking, it dominates the landscape. The architecture is stunning. Do not miss the visit to Vitus Cathedral and the castle.

Don't miss it!. We bought the full tour, but we regretted it in the end as we spent 5 hours for the tour. In the end, we were impressed by the St Vitus and the view from the Tower. There were no tour guides for Sunday.

ok. If this is the first time someone visits a church ,then please enter ,if not (if for example you have visited Sagrada famiglia or Agia Sophia ) then I wouldn't recommend it.Even though by buying a ticket in the castle you can enter more buildings there, I don't think it worths it , as the buildings are either empty or of small interest .

An impressive building. We were on a walking tour, and so only went into the part just within the doors. Even from there, it was clear that it was a beautiful building. And with some of the best stained glass windows I've ever seen.

Must see highlight of Prague. One of the landmark sights of this great city and not to be missed but worth planning a visit with care. Tickets have to be bought separately (and you can't see the cathedral alone without buying some other attractions too), but even so mid-morning and afternoon queues for entry are lengthy. Worth going early, over lunch, or late in the day.

Beautiful example of Gothic Architecture. The cathedral exterior is amazing in it's grandeur and Gothic architecture. You find yourself looking up quite a bit to see the variety of statues, flying buttresses, and amazing gargoyles. It does cost to go inside the cathedral but at a nominal cost from the local ticket office right across from the cathedral. Personally, I think it is worth getting the ticket to enter...you will be happy you did! The interior has so much to look at and the internal design is always willing to provide you with stunning photos! Overall, a trip to Prague would not be complete without a visit to St. Vitus Cathedral!
only the cathedral. The cathedral is awesome. Everything else is redundant. Skip the rest. You can get in the entrance for a quick glace and get a partial view without buying the tickets.

Amazing views. This again is something that you can not fail to visit when in Prague.
The detail of the work is simply amazing and you have to see it for yourself to believe it.
Worth a visit. Well worth a visit need to buy ticket to see various areas but not dear. Plenty to see and do around area.

Beautiful Church and Stained Glass Windows. This is a really pretty church. We used Rick Steve's self-guided tour and learned a lot. We had been to the Mucha Museum the previous day, so it was fun to see and relate to Mucha's stained glass window in the church.

Impressive. Absolutely beautiful cathedral. It's amazing and so big too. Very impressive, there is so much to it as well as you walk around the building. It's like a hidden gem in the middle of the castle.

So big!. I am not a big fan of sacral building but this one you have to see. It opens on Saturday at 1 pm - do not go - to crowded by opening, se another places and come back after 2-3 hours. breath-taking - bigger, higher the you expect.

Magnificent from outside and inside, from afar and up close. One of the most beautiful sites (inside and out) that you can see in Prague. An essential part of the Prague skyline, with great views from various other sites in Prague, you get a grandiose perspective when viewing it from afar. Up close it is just magnificent from outside, the Gothic architecture, the stonework, set within the Prague castle itself. Inside, it outdoes the outside features with stunning stained glass windows, wood and stone carvings. The tour of the crypts is also a nice experience, and when the crown jewels are on display, they are usually held here. The only issue is there are a lot of tourists, so the earlier the better if you want to . Plus, it is closed occasionally for service, etc.

Catholic Mass in an Amazing Cathedral. We were 2 of about only 50 people in this incredible awe inspiring building for 10:00am Mass - about 1 1/2 hrs. The cathedral is closed to non-worshippers during this time, so it is a great opportunity for a quiet reflective time in a magnificent building, even if you are not religious. I'm not. The organ pumps out majestic music as a bonus. Just remember to sit and be respectful - you're not there as a camera-wielding, wandering tourist. A hugely memorable experience to be had.

breathtaking. the outside is very decorative and elaborate as you would expect. The bell sounds great as it chimes out the time. You must go inside, as the main hall comes into view it has a real wow factor.
