Magnificent proportions, beautiful softness to the look and colour of the stonework, stunning ceilng and stained glass windows

Beautiful sight. If you like exploring a bit and seeing things in detail, it´s worth paying the entrance. If you just want to be impressed by it´s majestuosity, you will be fine just walking it, since you can just enter the main part, but won´t be allowed in the aisles

Impressive Gothic Structure inside the Castle Grounds!. I was there twice. The first time was on a Saturday afternoon and the "10 Minute" wait turned out to be almost 45 minutes to get inside!! It was an overcast day and I was only mildly impressed!! But on Sunday with the sun shining through the windows during a service, I was very impressed and glad I took the time to go back!! Definitely a must see in Prague!

Cathedral like non other. This place literally took my breath away. Its size and décor are something you want to visit.You will learn a lot about early life od Checz and there tradition just by visiting this place.And the best part,if you feel tired just go outside and relax on a beautiful grass with city view.
Gorgeous cathedral.. This church has stunning stained glass. The place is just beautiful. I would definitely recommend it.

Re: breath taking . The entrance of the cathedral will give you an idea of what's inside. We were fortunate to be there during Sunday service. It's simply awesome. The tower climb rendered me breathless bec it's a winding narrow staircase. But the view from the top is breathtaking. The view is worth the climb.

my favorite European Cathedral. This is my favourite Gothic Cathedral in Europe. Try to be there when the sun is shining into the windows from the side and you'll experience a whole light festival on the insight

magnificent facade and mosaic work. The St. Vitus cathedral has a beautiful facade and a very impressive view from the Charles bridge. The style is gothic and the stained glass work is quite spectacular. Dominating the skyline in the evening the castle and the church make a very impressive photographic experience. I will not rate the Prague castle experience very high and the only things worth seeing inside the premises are the Golden lane and St Vitus cathedral. Hence will advise travellers to buy their entrace tickets using caution.

Tremendous Gothic Cathedral. Well worth a visit. It is a really impressive Gothic structure with some beautiful modern stain glass windows. You could spend ages just wandering around. A must see if you got the caste.
great experience. You must visit it.You have two options to visit cathedral. Paid and free. You will get more access with a paid ticket. You will be able to see it from the entrance without ticket.

Beautiful Cathedral!. You don't have to go inside to appreciate the beauty of this architecture. It is seriously breath-taking inside, but you'll have to pay a small fee to enter. If you don't want to tour the inside, it is quite enough to sit outside on one of the many benches and admire the cathedral from the outside. It is extremely mesmerizing!

Awe inspiring Gothic Cathedral!. We gasped when we entered the cathedral since it is so awe inspiring.It is truly awesome in its height and gothic design.One senses the cathedral's importance as soon as one enters because of its height, design and decorations. It has been the place where the coronation of the Czech kings took place in the past.It is the largest church in Prague.At the centre of the cathedral is the tomb of the most important patron saint Wenceslas, where there is a beautiful chapel, adorned with original wall paintings. It is a truly beautiful cathedral, with a distinctive aura and a resplendent design.I recommend visiting it, if there's only one building in the Prague Castle complex, you can visit on your trip.One can also climb up the church tower for an awesome view of Prague, but we really didn't have the legs nor the time to do so.
Crowdy. Amazing crowds of people. You loose a bit the feeling of that nice place. City authorities need to do smth with this...
Full of light. Wonderful stained glass windows - especially the one that was created by Macha. But you cannot visit it without buying a ticket for the whole castle!

Amazingly Mind Blowing place !!. This place is amazingly mind blowing.The architecture , the art , the history ...everything is just amazing.Knowing the fact that it took them 600 years to build the cathedral is just mind blowing.I am a photographer and I would definitely describe this place as phenomenal piece of art for photographersI recommend wither buying a book that explains every single corner inside the cathedral or renting the english audio guide that explains major parts in the cathedral ( unless you are with a tour guide who knows the place quiet well ).This place was on my bucket list and I will sure visit it more than once .Tips:1.rent the audio guide or buy a book that explains every corner of the place .2.Go as early as possible to avoid long queues.3.You must buy the photography permission as this place is a heaven for photographers4.If you are a Pro photographer I would recommend taking a wide angle lens 10-20 mm with you ...you will need it :)

Easter Mass in Cathedral. The choir was really good during the Easter mass. The sound system was good. It was chilly inside and it was a really long 2 hour because of the cold temperature. It has a very a nice glass panes

Phenomenal!. This cathedral blew our minds! It is beyond amazing in it's beauty and the architecture is breathtaking! Everything about this place reeks of history to a time when the littlest details mattered. Every inch of this place is awesome. From the stairs to the paintings, to the carvings, to the stone work and even the plaques is done to a level of perfection that can only be achieved by someone who truly pured their heart into what they were doing. My wife and I felt such a sense of amazement and wonderment at how could someone have done this? How do you carve such detail in the marble and stone to imply a scenario and a face with age lines! Mind blowing!When in Prague see this for sure! The funny thing is that this is not even the best Cathedral in Prague!!

Mucha stained glass and the wooden relief not to be missed. Easter to probably as far as September is not necessarily the best time to go and visit this cathedral: the queues are terrible. You need to queue for a ticket (2 different places), then queue outside the cathedral to get in - same queue whether you have a ticket or not (without a ticket, you can't see much).Once inside my favorite parts are the Mucha stainless glass on the left hand side at the beginning and the wooden relief a bit further on the same side.

amazing cathedral !!. probebly one of the best cathedrals out there it's amazing ! the statues and lights are all just amazing!if your into cathedrals this is the best one out of all of them in prague

Impressive. Very busy with lots of people , but worth the walk and impressive .There are some good eating and drinking places as you walk up to the area , and a nice place to chill out and people watch

WOW I almost cried from the beauty…. This gothic cathedral church was not describable with words. Both my husband (who is hard to impress) and I were so overtaken with awe when we entered into this church that I had an overwhelming feeling of wanting to cry from so much beauty and detail. It is a MUST SEE on your trip to Prague and much better than the old palace or any of the other things at the castle.

Gorgeous Cathedral and Artifacts. We visited in early December when the crowds were manageable with no line ups. We took our time to wander throughout all the rooms and appreciate the uniqueness of St. Vitus from top to bottom. From the gorgeous stained glass windows throughout the Cathedral to the grand wooden "confessionals" this place was impressive. I was very intrigued with the collection of "thuribles" (catholic incense burners) that hung by one of the Altars... All in all a must to see.

Spoiled Visit . I visited this beautiful cathedral with my partner some years ago and my disappointment was not with the church but with the un-christian attitude of the staff. The weather outside the cathedral as it was closing was terrible (a rain and hail shower of biblical proportions was crashing down). Although it was obviously a shower that would pass quickly the staff and church ushers insisted, despite everyone's pleas, on forcing the visitors (some old people and families with young children) who were temporarily sheltering in the church entrance out into the terrible weather. I asked myself whether Jesus (their boss) would have taken this attitude! Outrageous behaviour, so much for Christian compassion and the humanity of the Church

Lovely Cathedral. Open in the day for mass and to walk in to see this beautiful cathedral. On Sunday evenings there are sometimes concerts performed with pipe organ. Definitely worth a stop to see it.

Nothing short of spectacular!. This Cathedral is amazing, it can be seen from Charles Bridge but after you climb the stairs and walk under the arch you will be blown away by this magnificent building. In my opinion the exterior was just out-standing! One of the many magnificent things to see in Prague!
Beautiful stained glas windows. Superb gothic architecture, beautiful stained glass windows. Disappointingly overcrowded. Best Perhaps to visit during late evening or during a mass.

Must get inside. As part of the Castle you will see it from outside and bit of inside even if you take the guided tours, but it is de paid area that hides most of the interior beauty. So don't be afraid to paid to go further you won't regret.

Awesome!. Well worth a visit....we didn't find it overcrowded...maybe just the time of day or year? The Chapel of St. Wenceslas' was discovered near the exit- beautiful paintings/murals and all in rich colours. Information is written in English too so you can disover the history as you go. Fantastic architecture and views from every angle.

A beautiful cathedral. We didn't enter the cathedral--the exterior is what I wanted to see. Beautiful, and it's difficult to stop taking photos! There is one area you can enter free of charge that allows you to view some of the beautiful stained glass windows. If you visit at Easter, there is a display of grazing farm animals (sheep, cows, goats, etc) made of straw in one area that's adorable--children will enjoy it. The Cathedral is very crowded with tour groups, so go early if possible. There's not a lot of room for maneuvering between the walls and the cathedral, and you'll want to be sure to walk all the way around it--where you enter is not the front of the cathedral (if you walk up the hill from the long stairway), it is the side, so be sure to go around to the front for a beautiful view.
Beautiful. A stunning cathedral,and well worth visiting.The stained glass windows were very ornate,and the whole place was huge.

Pretty Scary and Amazing!!!!. When you look at the castle from a long distance, the towers of St Vitus Cathedral Standout because of the structure. When we visited Castle, this particular Cathedral stood out for us. When you look at it, you will like Jesus has leased out all the the demons into the world. In a way, the Architect wanted people know that Church is something you can't tangle with. And the people visiting the church would have been scared. The building itself will tell you what was the mindset of Catholic priests back in the days. Nevertheless, I love the Architecture of the Cathedral. It is Humongous in structure and grandeur inside. Must See place of Prague!

Spectacular at night....it closes at 12am.. Incredible night views. I was there with a friend at 11pm and had one hour to walk around which was great because it was quiet and the lights illuminated the buildings beautifully.

Beautiful. A must see! The proportions and grandeur really make you feel like you are in what was once a very wealthy part of Europe. We went at about 11.00 in the morning and there was a line outside the church but it moved fairly quickly.

Great architecture, very crowded. Very nice architecture but we did not get in. At the entrance it was very crowded but this is the story everywhere in Prague.
Worth visiting

Beautiful Gothic Church. A true gothic church that stands wide and regal and luring its visitors. The church is very intricately built to perfection and every tiny corner of the façade is a beautiful artwork. It has all the traditional Gothic architecture elements and beauty to it and when you step inside the church, all the stained glass works add to the charm of the place. If you brave the climb then you can also catch a beautiful view of the city from the top of the tower
Big church. A very big, but beatyfull church. You feel a little small, when inside there. It is near the castle, so take a look at it at the same time.
wow. go visit! it's beautiful, and huge and so impressive. it left me in awe. very busy though, unsurprisingly, so expect to walk at the pace of the crowds, not your own

Quite similar to a lot of cathedrals around Europe. The interior was not quite ravishing. The exterior is extremely gothic and makes for a beautiful picture. It can be spotted from almost anywhere because it is so huge.
Grand cathedral. Full of tourists and is a must if you come to Prague. Sculptures are nice and beautiful. Golden Lane and the castle are also in the same area.
Nice, and (of course crowded). A nice building, but be prepared to walk in line, or try to squeeze through the hundreds of other visitors.
Beautiful. Very beautiful cathedral with amazing stained glass windows, very busy place to visit but well worth a look. We saw this as part of a tour

Beautiful church. We couldn't get in the cathedral until afternoon because of a church service but it was worth the wait. A beautiful church! I wanted to climb the tower but my companions were tired so we skipped it.

A rare inside. Once you get in the Cathedral, its height really is amazing, the stained glass windows superb, but I didn't think it was worth paying money to see the front in detail, so I gave that a swerve, but would definitely recommend seeing the inside.
Grand and beautiful. Everything you expect from a huge church in Europe's medieval cultural center. Come early (before 10 am) to avoid queues or the place will be crawling with tourists!

St Vitus Prague wonderful but. Breathtaking and comparable to the Duomo in Milan but after queuing to get in, we were barred to go beyond the external perimeter as we needed tkts.... So where are those available? Poorly sign-posted or explained and as we did not want to queue again... We missed-out on the rest of the cathedral and the city on out $

Breath taking. This Gothic church is simply amazing and a must see for anyone visiting Prague. The grotesques and gargoyles are plentiful and adorn this church on every corner. The inside of the church features gorgeous stain glass windows. Great history is found here.
Very beautiful. A very beautiful cathedral, large with beautiful windows and lots of interesting things to see. If you are interested in cathedrals, this is a must.

Awe Inspiring. I love large ornate churches and this one did not disappoint. Audio headsets were available which were a plus for really learning about the church and its inclusions. The stained glass windows are absolutely beautiful; but the roping off in the church detract from the experience inside.

the most amazing cathedral I have ever sen in Europe. considering that I am into visiting cathedrals, I can say this one is one of the best-if not the best- I have ever seen. it has a great view over the town, and the complex enjoys a one of the kind magnificence..

Gothic wonder. This magnificent Gothic Church is on the beautiful grounds of the Prague Castle. We were here on the day before Easter and it was very crowded. Line moved fast though. Several very brilliant stained glass windows. The exterior is dark Gothic with lots of interesting design feature. Be sure to see it.

Truly beautiful . The cathedral is fantastic both inside and out. Fantastic gothic exterior including great gargoyles. I thought the stained glass might have been the most beautiful and detailed I've ever seen. This cathedral also had many portions of clear glass which made the interior much lighter than most Gothic cathedrals. I really enjoyed it and recommend

Only went into the Knave. We were rather cold and hungry so didn't pay to go in, but the knave is worth a visit as the windows are beautiful. Walk around the outside as well as it is stunning. If we go back to Prague we will make sure we have time to do it properly.

Be ready to queue. Magnificent cathedral - particularly if you are at a distance.
If it rains or snows, please wear enough clothes, pretty cold inside. Be ready to queue. Stained-glass windows are well worth a visit.

gorgeous. St.Vitus´s Cathedral is considered to be an architectural and spiritual dominant of Czech lands. St.Wenceslas, the main Czech patron saint, is buried there. Today, this is now the seat of the Czech president.
Yo have to come. You cant miss the cathedral on your first viist to Prague, i asume once you ar here, include the visit to hradcany and Slata ulice

amazing. the catherdal is amazing. its sold old and the history it tells. inside it is massive but again very beautiful. the really old churches you see on the tv its just like that. the building and detail is breathtaking. its hard to imagine that a whole community once lived and visted the cathedral. must see
Unbelieveable!. This cathedral was built in stages and studying it inside and out is like taking an architecture course. Don't miss it.

This will take your breath away. The most wonderful cathedral in Prague, from the city you can only see the spires and roof it is not until you go through the castle that the whole cathedral is there to see. The stained glass windows are a real treat.

Impressive! Go in early morning to avoid crowd. The exterior is so impressive that made it a must see in Prague. The interior is equally beautiful with marvelous painted glass. We went around 9am and the tour groups started to flush in. There was a queue but we were able to got in within minutes. The cathedral is large but still getting a bit crowded with many people from different groups. We went on a windy and rainy day but it was especially beautiful when the sunlight lit up the wet facade after the shower.

Amazing stained glass. St Vitus Cathedral is part of the Prague Castle complex and requires a ticket to enter. However, the cost is well worthwhile. The sheer size of the vaulted building is impressive but the magnificent stained glass windows, statues and sude chapels all add to the experience. A must see attraction if you are visiting Prague.
Majestic Gothic Cathedral. Gorgeous cathedral steeped in history. Enjoy the stained glass and gothic beauty right in the middle of the Prague Castle grounds.
beautiful architecture. lovely place to visit, nothing to dislike. Get the tram up and walk back, fantastic views and photo opportunities

Resplendent Cathedral. This cathedral is impressive and awe-inspiring. I have visited it several times, and there is always something new that I notice. It can only be accessed with a castle ticket. Make sure to check out the Mucha stained glass.
Amazing and vast cathedral. Part of the overall Prague castle complex experience - such a huge vaulted building with beautiful windows
Magestic. The most beautiful cathedral in Prague! Exquisite altars, stained glass windows, noble people burials.
GORGEOUS. Great cathedral o visit. Plenty of gorgeous architecture, art and interesting history to learn. A must visit when at Prague Castle.

Beautiful place to visit. The cathedral is set close to the palace and other beautiful buildings.
Visiting this area is a must, it is extremely clean and shows the history of this beautiful city.
The cathedral is amazing, particularly the many stained glass windows.

Beautiful outside. Like a few of the churches you have to pay to see the whole of the cathedral. You are allowed inside where you can view the gorgeous stain glass (Ive never seen anything quite like it) but there are a lot more stunning churches in prague you can visit for free and each one different and more stunning that the last.
One of the best cathedrals i've been. The cathedral was magnificent! Especially from the outside! I truly loved it! There were a lot of tourists, making a lot of pictures.
Incredible!. The most beautiful cathedral I have ever seen. The architecture, the detail - inside and outside was definitely breathtaking.
Glorious!. Historic architecture at its finest. You can't go past St. Vitus Cathedral. Worth the visit inside, but make sure you plan ahead of time as you don't want to be waiting in the queue.

Beautiful, even for someone who doesn't like to tour churches. I've traveled enough to Europe to be pretty much done with seeing the cathedral in every city. But this one really does have rather remarkable stained glass and architectural details. It's great for creative photography inside.

Stunning cathedral, get there early to avoid the crowds. The cathedral is worth a visit as it's beautiful. The stained glass Mucha windows are vibrant in the sunshine and the silver tomb is incredibly ornate. Get there for 9am to enjoy the place. By 9.30 it was becoming busy with tour groups. Unfortunately you can't buy a ticket just for the cathedral as it's bundled with the castle entrance fee but the cathedral is worth it (though the castle itself isn't too impressive)

A feast of modern glass. As part of the Tour B at the Castle St Vitus is a must. Gracious architecture with the added bonus of modern stained glass windows. Third in on the left is by Alphonse Mucha. Amazing. An absolute feast. A very beautiful cathedral.

One of the most beautiful places in Prague. St. Vitus Cathedral is absolutely stunning. The colourful windows and gold ornaments give an amazing feeling of richness in this raw space of gothic. My dream is to go there one time and see it completely empty. Or listen to the choir singing in there. The big disadvantage of this place (Hradczany) is a fact that they close it at 16. And also the ticket price is not the lowest one and, what is even more unpleasant, you need to buy a ticket for few attractions. I am not a fan of Golden Street, but I can’t buy a ticket just to see Cathedral. And I don’t like this fact very much.

Beautiful!. A trip to Prague castle is not complete without a visit to St Vitus Cathedral. Breathtaking! There was some refurbishing going on in March so some statues and structures are blocked off. We were also able to walk right in but heard from other families that the wait on Saturday was out the door so plan accordingly.

Experience the middle ages. The entire location of St. Vitus the castle on the hill overlooking the river and this magnificent city should not be missed. It is unfortunately expensive to experience all this area has to offer.

Make sure to check out the stained glass window done by Moucha.. Research done before visiting this place (via online travel videos, blogs, websites, etc.) will help to educate the traveler on the historic importance of this cathedral to the city of Prague specifically and the Czech Republic in general. Go early morning to avoid the tour bus crowds.

A lot to soak in. This is a huge cathedral. We had benefit of a private guide to point out neat things like where the horses used to come into the grounds. The pure sterling tomb is incredible to see.

The Monument is amazing, but the place is crowded and chaotic. the dom is really stunnig and the artwork of the glass windows inside is fanastic. but he place is flooded by people. you shouldnt go into the tower if you are a claustrophobic person, because the stairway is very tight and it's not controlled by the staff how many people are allowed to go in there at once. with 150 ck entrence fee it is very expensive too. plus, if you want to visit the main hall of the dome, you have to pay again.

Neo Gothic cathedral. Finished in the 1920's it really does look gothic well worth a visit as part of the palace tour. Walk around the outside to admire the architecture and see if you can see the architects faces on the facade at the front!,

A must see.. The opulence of this church is breathtaking. It is easy to see who had all the money (and power). The vaulted ceilings, flying buttresses and alcoves are spectacular, as are the stained glass windows.
Beautiful. The view from the top of the clock tower is fantastic The stain glass windows are amazing.Well worth a visit
Very impressive. It is clearly impressive but, like many things in Prague, there is an entrance charge. The stained glass windows are beautiful.

When at the Castle, visit the cathedral. We always visit cathedrals. Seville, Toledo. Barcelona, London. New York, why not Prague? The answer is: St. Vitus Cathedral merits a visit. It is heavily Gothic and almost restrained in its grandeur. We visited on a sunny March afternoon and got to enjoy the sunlight through the stained glass. What a treat.

Loved the stained glass windows. Amazing cathedral enormous and ornate, loved the beautiful windows everyone different and so beautiful. Building I thought was more impressive from the outside, again crowded with tourists.
Magnificent Bohemian cathedral. Within the Castle walls stands this superb cathedral, the most important In the Czech republic - steeped in history with a hugely impressive nave.

Breath Taking. I don't think that I have ever been to a cathedral and just stood in amazement. The attention to detail and all the gold paint work is just stunning. It does say that you are not allowed to take pictures which is a shame but also in saying that it means that when you look round, I believe you look at the cathedral closer. It is free to enter but there is a collection tin by the door which I was happy to put in as to see something so beautiful and looked after with such care and attention when you see what is happening elsewhere in the world it has to be preserved for all to see. Take the time to visit and you will not be disappointed.

In a Continent Full of Churches, This One is Worth a Visit. I live in Italy, so I've seen a lot of beautiful churches. This one stands above many of them. While you can go in for free and look from the back, pay the (relatively) small fee and walk past the ropes to see the stained glass windows, tombs, and architecture from further into the interior. Take a good guidebook with you so you can understand what you're seeing. While I found the castle complex somewhat disappointing, this was one of the highlights. Figure about 30-45 minutes for your visit.
Where is the history. A strange Cathedral - there is no history here. Beauty yes but no grave markers etc, memorials etc. It appears to be more of a folly than a holly place.

Beautiful. Definitely worth a visit. Beautiful Gothic Cathedral on par with Notre Dame in Paris. Construction of both Cathedrals was completed within a year of each other and took about 400 years to complete....No lines, easy access.
Amazing!. This is amazing. As far as I can judge the only church what can compete with Sagrada Familia.You should take the time to see and enjoy this,

It is the seat of archbishop of Prague and my favorite Cathedral in the world.... Walk around and check the architecture, look up to see the gargoyles. Check out the Golden Portal (Zlata Brana) and the Clock tower. When you enter, the beauty of the large stained windows is striking.The famous St. Wenceslas Chapel is very ornate, studded with jewels, constructed over his tomb. It is always crowded with tourists trying to get a peek inside. Also unfortunately frequented by pickpockets blending into the preoccupied crowd. Speaking from the experience of a very close call.The ornate tomb of Jan Nepomuk is made of solid shining silver - tons of it. Incredibly detailed beautiful work of art. You can't help but wonder, if it could be duplicated in modern times.The Royal Crypt is located steps down, the remains of Bohemian Royals are buried there, Charles IV among them. It seems that everybody visiting Prague comes here, sometimes more than once. During an early mass on Sunday the doors close. If you want to enter, be prepared to stay a while.

A must. Iconic Cathedral for Prague, impressive by her greatness. A cradle of history who must be a part of your morning program in town ( it is less crowdy in that time of day).Near the cathedral is also ST George Church ,Golden Lane and the Palace -all in the same area.If you want to see all this you must buy a ticket (big or little tour) instead only for ST Vitus is free.

Beautiful. We did not enter because we didn't want to pay and still had a lot to see. But just walking around it is already impressive. And while you go here to visit you are at the same time in the Castl so why not pay a visit there too
In a rush. Did not have much time for this, but it was just part of the whole Prague experience. Does not disappoint.

It's as impressive as it seems on photos. It's really great and impressive. One should know that you can climb the bell tower (287 steps, beware!) to have a great view from the height. I'd recommend going here early in the morning since at around 10 a.m. lots of buses with tourists arrive, and you'd have to wait in line to get inside the cathedral.
Great Building. great to see building built with out the machinery we take for granted today.A tour guide is a must to get the best from the placeVery crowded,
Wow. The cathedral was an amazing building with stained glass windows showing scenes and skills of stunning work. So many amazing things to look at. A must.

Majestic. It is located inside the Prague Palace/Castle Complex. It is truly majestic - the gothic architecture was so nice. there are some very beautiful stained glass paintings, which make the visit memorable, especially if the sun shines on a bright and sunny day, making the paintings come alive. You can enter the Cathedral for free till a certain point inside, but will need to buy tickets to go till the altar. One can also buy tickets to climb the tower to get a glimpse of the palace grounds.

Unforgettably beautiful!. We went as a group of 7 students and we were all in total awe of this cathedral! We had gotten lost twice on the way but all that stress was forgotten when we saw the cathedral and the castle itself. The guards at the front gate really set the standard for what is a beautiful, official, well looked-after attraction. Like the rest of the city, it was bustling with tourists, but not in a crowded and annoying way. There was almost a hushed appreciation over the place. Some areas were closed however, and one gate was closed while we were admiring the view; forcing us to go back up a narrow set of stairs and a steep hill, which was a problem and we had 2 wheelchair users in our group. However, it is worth the visit for the view alone. Our visit certainly resulted in some beautiful photographs!

Named after a vague legend and 585 years to build, and why is it not built in among the city?. I like cathedrals that have a side entrance, especially with a clock tower. This cathedral contains the remains of many royals and especially Saint Wenceslaus and the arm of Saint Vitus - if you are into body parts.Every 8 years the Crown Jewels are displayed. The front contains the usual rose window and this one a tower on either side. The marble floor consists only of brown and white tiles. There are many stain glass windows, several contain much green glass, which is quite unusual. It is nice to have a terrific view of the city, but I though that the church was for the people, who usually ended up paying for it, this one is next to the Royal Castle and behind tall stone walls. However, most tripadvisors really love it - and that is most important thing.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.
Must see. There are many churches to see throughout Europe- but this one is a must. Beautiful!! Make sure you see it when you are in Prague.
Pragues dominant. Very nice place, gothic cathedral, must see when visiting Prague. Very impressive, located in middle of castle complex
This church is amazing.. This church is amazing and so close to the Ventana hotel where we stayed. The heighth of the church is breathtaking and it is so clean. Takes your breath away.

Paying to go into a church? Not very impressive, not normal.. It is a beautiful church even to just walk around the exterior and see all of the intricacies. You can go into the foyer of the church and have a limited view of the church, but you must pay to walk through the entire church. We have been to many churches in the world, and I have to say I think this is the first that charged a fee. Granted on some special occasions other churches had limited access, but never charged a fee. So for that reason alone, I give it Average as opposed to Excellent. There are plenty of other fees in the Caster Area, like Golden Lane, which should bring in enough money to keep this church free of charge for entry. On that note, though, the entire area around the Castle complex, was immaculate. And that says a lot with all of the people we saw smoking and just throwing their cigarette butts, among dropping other litter. It was a lot like Disney with people walking around sweeping up litter. I appreciated that.

Beautiful gothic architecture. This is a stunning building and definitely worth a visit. I would recommend the guided tour as you can then learn lots of interesting facts that you may otherwise never hear.

Breathtaking. Unreal & beautiful comes to mind walking into this cathedral , the history & ages of it blows yr mind it was first constructed back in 1344 lol most parts of very gothic , take a tour while in there, amazing
Stunning cathedral. St Vitus is absolutely stunning with fabulous architecture. The gargoyles are fantastic and are everywhere on the building, stunning.
Must see. We visited the Castle on our first full day and the Cathedral is amazing. Must see even if you only stay in Prague for a short time.

Epic. The views from the palace looking down on the city are stellar. St Vitus Cathedral represents Catholicism in Prague. The stained glass and gothic style reflects its beauty to all that enter. There is also an outdoor garden cafe for a snack and yes there is a Starbucks there too.
Amazing. Make sure you see this when you're in Prague. This is the iconic cathedral of the Prague castle. It is a must see, even if you only have a day.
Stunning views. Beautiful gothic cathedral but be aware it closes at 15:40 each day and it's extra to climb the tower. It is well worth climbing though, the views of the whole of prague are stunning.
Fascinating.. The cathedral was probably the most beautiful structure I have ever seen in my life. It is hauntingly magical. For an architecture buff, this is a must-see :)

Hundreds of years in St. Vitus Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral dominates over the city of Prague. You can see it from all of the hills, on which Prague is picturesquely situated. My guests who love taking photos came back home with unforgettable shots. Interior of the Cathedral is enhanced by Alfons Mucha stain glass works.
Great stained glass!. This is a beautiful Gothic cathedral with some great stained glass. Look out particularly for the Mucha design window.
Great place for a lunch snack. Brilliant sandwiches very reasonably priced especially in a tourist place. Highly recommend for a midday break.
Old church, beautiful art!. It´s a church close to Carlos Bridge. Old, as everything there. It´s a quick visit but worthless. It´s in middle way from ancient town and tha Castle.

Gothic(to me) church. if you love stained glass then this church is for you. Lots of it. It's very tall inside. the Tomb of St. Nepomuk, (the poor guy that was thrown off the Charles Bridge by King Wesceslas).
Really nice and free. If you are short on the budget, you can enter the cathedral for free. You won't be able to go everywhere inside but it's free!
Gothic. The inside chapels are very ornate with lots of gold and silver used. Have to pay 10 CZK to use the toilet.

marvelous architecture. one of the best church I have seen. Absolutely beautiful, a marvelous example of neo gothic architecture. It has many lovely cafes around it and a rich cultural trail of Bohemia. Also, the area around is a good place to buy cheap souvenirs.

Beautiful and impressive!. A truly magnificent cathedral and an absolutely marvelous piece of architecture. You can also enter the cathedral and see the astonishing detail from the gilded pillars to the painted roof, however, unfortunately if you want to see the entire cathedral, you will have to buy a ticket.
Sublime. It is an overwhelming place. Filled with peace and spiritual. Sit there and admire, meditate and wonder. Amazing window art and powerful vibes.

Gorgeous. Every visitor needs to see this place from the outside and the inside as well...its just gorgeous...the view of Prague from the top tower after climbing about 300stairs is more than wort of just about usd 7...

Fantastic glass.. Saw this as part of a guided tour and was rather disappointed that we were only allowed to view from the back of the cathedral, not walk around. There were so many people jammed into this small area that it was almost impossible to see the Alphonse Mucha stained glass window. Extremely imposing and beautiful exterior to the building.

Old and not so old. Beautiful cathedral with a mixture of building styles due to the centuries between the original building and the extra add on within the past 100 or so years (sorry, can't recall exactly how old). Some remarkable interior with sculptures, paintings and a myriad of antique objects.

Impressive Cathedral. The St. Vitus Cathedral is impressively big when you are standing in front of it and walking around it. We did this at night, which is recommendable. The day after, we went over to visit the Cathedral inside. We were allowed in the front half of the cathedral, but to visit the rear half, you had to pay.
Astonishing. A must do. It's huge on the outside, and looks even bigger on the inside. An impressive work of art. Watch out for the open times, as you might find it closed as soon as early as 3 pm.

Very beautiful Cathedral, well worth a visit. I purchased a pass which included the castle and other buildings in the complex. The cathedral is absolutely stunning inside. Quite breathtaking. I would recommend that everyone visit this place when in Prague.

Amazing. The cathedral is in the middle of the castle complex. An absolutely amazing building - inside and outside. You can see most of it's inside without buying a tour ticket and all of it's outside by just walking around it.
Georgeous. Beautiful artwork, so much history, always under construction. Stunning stained glass, worth the entrance price.
Beautiful church. Right after I went up the hill to see the castle I could see this church. I'm always fascinated for churches and the streets the houses definitely throw you back in time.

Go up the Tower!. For around £4 you can go up the Cathedral Tower (this includes a lovely coin souvenir too) - The views of the City are phenomenal from up there!
After checking out the stunning inside, head out and round the side of the Cathedral to get to the Tower.
spectacular. Magnificent gothic cathedral - stained glass windows spectacular. Climb the tower for a great view. The old palace opposite worth a visit.

The stained glass windows are stunning. The stained glass windows are beautiful and when we visited the sun was shining on them making the colours really stand out. Worth going in just for those alone. It is free to go into the back of the church but you need a ticket to go to the tomb and the altar area. The silver saint's tomb is unique, not seen anything similar. Looks stunning from the outside too a beautiful piece of architecture
Absolutely beautiful. Must see in Prague! Details of this Cathedral are incredible. Loved our visit to this Cathedral as part of our visit to the Prague Castle.
Amazing. Bring good walking shoes so you don't miss this amazing, stunning cathedral - make sure you go on whole tour - give yourself at least 5-6 hours to see everything!
Can not miss this!. this place is just amazing! The details of the bulding inside and outside it is just... It is something that you can not explain with words! You can not miss this place!

Beautiful catherdral. You must visit this cathedral! It is right on top of Prague castle it is beautiful with it's architecture, take your time and enjoy the various glass paintings and overall atmosphere inside as well as outside.

Incredibly beautiful cathedral . This cathedral is the main attraction of Prague Castle. It's dark exteriors, intricate marble carvings and stained glass windows are incredible.Spend at least an hour or two at St.Vitus Cathedral and soak in history & spirituality.

beautiful place. This is a gorgeous building but inside a bit lacking in interpretation unless you take a tour. Tours just aren't for me. I recommend getting the circuit A ticket from Prague castle which includes entry to the cathedral as well as other buildings in the complex. I wouldn't pay just to go in the cathedral unless you have a particular interest in it.

Do Not Miss This!. The sight of this Cathedral simply blew my mind away. The pictures taken simply did not do enough justice to portray the beauty of the architecture. Most of the free walking tour will include this sight as one of the itineraries, so do not miss it!
worth the visit. It is one of the places to see when visiting the castle. It is the largest gothic building in the country.

Breathtaking. This cathedral gives you the visions u need to see what the Catholic Church was really about back then. More focused on the church and less on the people. The handcrafted work is very detailed and just amazing

Really Pretty!. This Cathedral is not only huge but it is a beautiful exhibit of stained glass in all its true glory. The bright colours and stories depicted in the windows really are a sight to behold. Buy the short tour castle ticket (250 Krona) to get access to here and a few other of the castles key buildings.Obviously there will be tours of people around and it can get busy, but the cathedral is big enough to not feel crowded in the slightest.
beautiful stained glass. lovely cathedral to visit at the castle. beautiful stained glass and statues to see. worth seeing for sure.
Breathtaking!. Viewing this epic piece of architecture make you feel very humble. Talk about a reality check! I have seen many sights in many countries, this is very special.

Beautiful!. Such an amazing and impressive cathedral. Beautiful stained glass windows inside, made all the more pretty by the sunlight streaming through. Absolute must see views from the top of the tower - you need to get a separate ticket for the tower, but it is so cheap. The tower entrance is round the back of the cathedral, so not accessible through the actual cathedral. Lot of steps, but we took lots of breaks!

Stain glass windows. This is one of the most beautiful churches I have ever had the pleasure off going inside to. From the remarkable aisle to the fabulous stain glass windows definitely worth the visit.
Beautiful. In a lovely setting, absolutely stunning inside and out. Architecture amazing - well worth going to see.
Climb to the top. Lots of stairs but worth the climb. The view can't be spared from any where else. The cathedral itself is beautiful too

Amazing cathedral not to be missed. You can enter free of charge to the cathedral but only at a limited space allowed. If you want to walk around the full church then you have to pay for a ticket. OK this is a tourist attraction but access to church should always be free....
Stunning. You can't miss seeing this cathedral when in Prague. It took over 500 years to completely build and is just beautiful. It's massive and you can easily spend an hour just inside.
Colour and Light. Personally I think this is a must. Apart from the windows designed by Mucha the other windows are outstanding as well. It was just a shame the crypt was closed on my visit.
Wow!. Wow was the word I used when I walked through the outer gate and saw the cathedral - amazing outside & beautiful inside - enough said!!

Beautiful, rare statutes and good view. Go see this church if you are in Prague. We have been to many churches all over the world and this one is rare in some of the statutes. Many are very opulent and worth a visit. There are also bones buried in a statute, which was odd. Not sure who they belonged to. Then, if you are able, walk the stairs to the top of the tower. It is about 200 steps so make sure you are able to climb narrow stairs but the views are worth it. It costs about $5 pp to go up the tower but the best views in Prague.
Amazing. If possible see it after dark as well as tour during the day. Gorgeous windows and some painted that appear as stained glass. Great history
Beautiful architecture. Simply superb inside and out! Large cathedral, to be admired at from afar and up close, stained glass windows are not to be missed!
Amazing. We did not go inside the cathedral (for which you have to pay), but the building is beautiful! It makes you just stand and stare. One of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen.
Fantastic Building. Fantastic building-interesting blend of old and new, would recommend a tour to take in all the details-we went with discover Prague (castle tour) which was excellent value.

Incredible . As we walked around the cathedral we thought "whoa it's huge" but it's when you go inside, that's when it really hits you. Keep an eye out for the sponsorship on the amazing stain glass windows, brilliant.
Awesome. Really interesting audio tour that I would highly recommend purchasing at the ticket office. Wow, there are some truly incredible things to learn.
Beautiful glass windows. Building lasted 10 centuries. The frontage with the rose window is only 90 years old. Its very impressive though. Can see it from anywhere in the city

Amazing. If you love Gothic cathedrals, this is definitely one to visit. I really enjoyed seeing this on the tour of the Prague Castle with the Sandeman company and this is one of the absolute highlights of Prague if you are into gothic architecture. Hearing about the history of how long it took for the cathedral to be built, some of the parts that were unfinished, some of the 'interesting' architectural features of the cathedral e.g. the Southern tower which switches from Gothic to Baroque style was a real treat.

The Top of Prague's World.. St. Vitus Cathedral dominates the city of Prague. From almost anywhere that there is a break in the buildings you can see it tower over the city. In other words it is very high so if you suffer from any infirmity do not try to climb up to it. Depending on which way you go there are either steep hills or hundreds of steps. We chose the steps and it was hard going for an unfit middle aged Irishman! The Cathedral is a magnificent building set in the middle of the Castle.To be honest it was the best part of the castle experience for me and my advice is even if you are short of time don't miss St. Vitus Cathedral. As for the rest I cannot improve on the comments of other reviewers. Go and Enjoy!

Best Cathedral I've ever been to. The cathedral and grounds were stunning. We walked up from the Old Town, over St Charles bridge and up to the top. We paid to climb to the top of the Bell Tower which left me completly out of breath (288 spiral steps!) but the view from the top was amazing and so worth it. It's a must if you're visiting Prague!!!
Architecture at its best!. Almost took them 600 years to build it! It looks amazing from far or close up. Worth buy a pass to go inside the restricted area for better view of the arts and details.
Breathtaking!. The walk from Old Town is about 25 minutes but it was well worth it. The stained glass was unbelievably beautiful.
Thrilling. I loved the stained glass windows and the details at the back of the roof. Beautiful at night time! The cathedral was the best part of the castle.
Lovely. Worth a visit. next time I visit I think i would pay extra to get the audio tour. We bought tickets for entry to various part of the castle and was worth the money.
Amazing . Beautiful the outside mostly, inside so so, but a must see, pretty views from the Starbucks a little on the corner of it.

beautiful windows. You go into the first part of the cathedral for free but to walk all the way around you have to pay. The stained glass windows are stunning and the cathedral really is beautiful. We paid to go round and glad we did. There is very little in the way of information so you may feel you need to either do the audio tour or get a guidebook - depends how interested you are!!

Disappointing! But a must see. The cathedral is certainly a 'must see' site in Prague. However it was disappointing.
The crowds were enormous; the decor very gaudy and certainly not modest.
You have pay to enter...

Beautiful Cathedral. An absolutely stunning building, but very busy. We paid extra to visit the grand tower. Beware there is one spiral staircase operating both ways, there are no real stop off points all the way to the top. There are about 300 stairs to the top. You will be puffing by the time you get to the top, but the panoramic views offered are well worth the effort.
Spectacular. As cathedrals go it is really very very beautiful. Try to spot the four statues of the architects who finished it!
Breathtaking. This is a must see if you visit Prague 600 years to complete its hard to believe there is so much detail

Better from the outside. The cathedral looks lvoely from the outside but is a little disappointing inside. If you have paid for the ticket which includes entry you might as well have a look but don't get your hopes up!
amazing. Amazging arhitecture and views good price worth a visit in prague take time to lok around v busy beware

Favorite Part of Castle Complex. If you love architecture then this may be your favorite part of the castle complex as it offers a stunning altar in memorium of St. Vitus. The cathedral has beautiful rose windows, the stained glass is bright and vibrant and each of the relics are so nicely displayed. Walking around in this beautiful church, although busy with vistors, was very relaxing and peaceful. If you visit in the winter time it provides a nice warm resting place during your visit around the castle. Light a candle while you visit and soak in the beauty of this spiritual place!Definatlely something to visit! Do not pass up!

Amazing beauty. If you want a quick look you can enter for free and marvel at the sheer size and majesty of the building or the beauty of the stained glass windows and artefacts. If you pay for entry it's worth getting a tour or guide book to explain the rich history. The audio guide really enriched put visit (one between 2 was fine!)
Gorgeous. Put me in mind of Notre Dame on first viewing but far more spectacular from the southern aspect. Truly as beautiful place and the real spiritual centre of the Czech Republic. Go there!

In Awe. Just couldn't believe how amazing the architecture was here. Its hard to believe this was built before power tools were ever invented. You can just picture the coronations of Kings and Queens here. This makes you think of the book "the Pillars of the earth" by Ken Follett. (well worth reading)
Stunning. You could easily spend 2 hours in here, there is so much to see and its just beautiful but be warned it closes at 4pm. The windows alone are stunning!

Look for the Gargoyles! . This Cathedral will take your breath away. They have the most amazing gargoyles protecting the church. Just a note about Prague cathedrals and church's in general; they are typically colder inside than outside due to the stone construction and vaulted ceilings. Bring your gloves if you are going during a colder month.

The Highlight. It dominates the skyline from a distance and is even more impressive up close. If you're on a budget you can go inside the first 80 ft or so for free but you have to pay to walk deeper into the cathedral. We paid but I'm not sure it was worth it as the free parts are the best.

Over the centuries the wise forefathers of the Czech Republik. ..... capitulated to invaders over the centuries and by doing so have enabled their country to retain its magnificent medieval buildings. Prague is simply a gorgeous city and this cathedral is only one of several to be enjoyed.
Biggest ever Cathedral. amazing modern stained-glass, and ancient silver sacred statuary. nice clean toilets, photos allowed, good English interpretation panels

Beautiful stained glass windows. We paid to go into Cathedral but you can enter and see the beautiful stained glass windows without going round the cathedral. Entrance was through a ticket barrier but you can still see most of it from the main entrance that you don't have to pay for.
Dominates the castle complex. Very impressive. Take a guided tour, it's worth it. See the tomb of St Wenceslas and many more interesting artefacts. The architecture is amazing.
Stunning stained glass. A beautiful cathedral, on par with Notre Dame but not as impressive as the Vatican. Amazing architecture inside and out.
Great history. Well worth a visit to the castle/palace and this cathedral, which was only completed last century. Gives its names to the condition 'St Vitus Dance'.

Great stained glass!!!!. It is amazing from the moment you step in a tiny square from the castle and the cathedral rises in front of you. The stained glasses in the interior are amazing. I suggest you to come from the castle side and then continue down through the vineyards back to the city across Vltava.
Do not miss it when in Prague!!!!

The Prague's Catheddral. The Cathedral is great, both inside and out. Gigantic stained windows. It worth visiting at least once.
The area have no good place to eat, so better to bring food with you.

Awesome ..... Love the structure of this Cathedral, it very grand, beautiful work of art and feel very serene. Take your time and explore inside and outside as well. Need to pay a fee to enter but if you have the Prague Card...much better option. Very Gothic feel and history. Do not miss

While at the castle. We have been inside the cathedral three times now. With each visit, we learn something else that is interesting about Prague and her people. It was cleaned a few years ago to get ready for the Pope's visit. Now, you have to pay to have walk around. Most tours stop just inside.

WOW!. This was only our second city in our first trip to Europe and St. Vitus Cathedral was our fist site to visit in Prague. Words can't even begin to describe the grandness of this place. It sits on the castle grounds and story itself is pretty impressive. According to the tour guide, it took 800 yrs to finish the cathedral and you can see why. I can't recall the price to view the cathedral but I know it wasn't that expensive. This is a site to really take your time and enjoy. You can easily take most of the day between the cathedral and the castle grounds. There are plenty of things to do and several places to eat. Also they have some pretty amazing spots for pictures. One in particular is when you pay to climb up the stairs to where the church bell sits, take your time because it's 200 plus stairs, I think. Once you reach the top you get a 360 degree view from the city, so don't forget your tennis shoes and camera!

St. Vitus Dance. The church was beautiful, full of statues. I found out the Cathedral was named after a doctor who discovered St Vitus Dance (neurological illness that sometimes occurs after a course of Rheumatic Fever). In order to take a full picture of the church, you have to lay on the pavement and shoot from this position. Well worth seeing.

Prague Castle. The Cathedral was magnificent; both inside and out. Gorgeous stained windows. Tourists really needed a guided tour to better understand some of the sites outside of the Cathedral in the "Castle" area.

No one should is the stained glass. As a Building this is breathtaking in its beautiful interia and fantastic stained glass, architecture that makes you wonder how it was done, and even busy it holds a serene atmosphere that calms ready to face more site seeing
Czech crown jewels. This cathedral has very long history - home of CZ crown jewels and grave of emperor Charles IV. Fantastic place, one of the top parts of Prague's castle.

Fantastic Cathedral. Don't miss this it is truly wonderful. Didnt climb the stairs up to top of the tower, having climbed Petrin Tower didnt think it was necessary. So much of interest in this wonderful building.
Beautiful. The cathedral was wonderful with the many stained glass windows. The line to get in was long as we went on Sunday and had to wait until the service was completed.

Well worth a visit. The castle is one of the stops on the city bus tour, hop on, hop off service, the Cathedral is inside the castle walls and has stunning stained glass windows that look amazing if you are there on a sunny day

Good view. Entry around the place is the trickiest. The crowd is usually heavy and makes it all the more difficult to gain a ticket in time. But if you have done the effort then you will be rewarded with a great treat as the church is beautiful from both outside and inside and is worth every penny you make for it. The church is located in the castle grounds and also comes with the requirement of a whole lot of climbing. The stained glass works inside the church is superb.
Beautiful Cathedral. Once you climb up to see the castle, the Cathedral is worth a visit with its lovely vitrays and high ceilings typical for gothic architecture.

Visit the tower! . Didn't make it in time to buy ticket to visit inside properly, however found we could go inside a way and see part of cathedral without paying. That said it is worth paying for a visit to the tower, it's got lots of stairs but the view from the top is amazing.

Magnifucent. A great piece of gothic architecture not to be missed. Only down side is that whenever you visit here, its likely to be a bit crowded and nature of the space is likely to make it feel even more so.

A Beautiful Church. The Cathedral is within the walls of the castle and is a must to see. However, the wait can be a bit long. As you face the church, entry is to the left. Also, if you need to use the restroom, remember, you have to pay!
Pretty. This Is in castle grounds and is stunning. The stained glass windows are beautiful. There is a hand painted window which is lovely
wow. An impressive building with an impressive church and that's all :)). Many stairs to climb. Entry through certain areas are chargeable and tickets are quite expensive.

Beautiful but try to avoid the crowds. Truly stunning building. Buy the ticket to see it in full inside- worth it. Try to go on a weekday except Friday to beat the crowds. It closes at 4pm so plan your time It can be combined with a visit to other parts of Prague castle or prazy hrad, the locals say.Enjoy!

Impressive but seen better!. The cathedral is beautiful and the price of the ticket to enter is reasonable. There are a range of ticket options to include other attractions in the castle complex. We didn't have the audio tour, so didn't know everything we were looking at. Signage was limited. I am not a big church/cathedral person but, the upkeep of this one (compared with the few I have seen and those we have locally here in Scotland) really was disappointing. You cannot come to Prague and not visit the cathedral. It is impressive, and worth the time.

Gorgeous. A definite must see. Gorgeous inside. Breathtaking at night. Check out the gargoyle drain spouts. The stained glass windows are spectacular. Hopefully you can get there while the organ is playing - a transcendental experience
Fascinating Cathedral. This cathedral is part of the Prague Castle Complex and it really worth a visit. It is a fascinating gothic building that has more than 600 years old.
Beautiful and spectacular!. Fantastic stained glass windows and opulence. Well worth a visit when you are up at Prague Castle. Good opportunities for taking photos which are allowed in this church.

Breathtaking. I'm not religious, but this cathedral is something to be seen. The craft work in the building and the appointments inside are just fantastic. The cathedral is filled with intricate sculptures, paintings, frescos, and the like. When I was there, it was a brilliant sunny day and the light streamed in through the upper windows giving a great view.
On Top of the World. Perched high above Prague in a commanding position, St Vitius is a wonderful place to spend an hour or so. Try to avoid the many 'brides' having their photos taken out front

Go see this fantastic cathedral. When strolling around Prague you cannot miss this fantastic cathedral. Most major cities will have their very own large church or cathedral but this one is well worth the visit for its architecture and windows alone.

Magnificent church in the Prague Castle complex. Of all the churches we visited in Prague, and there are PLENTY, this is the most beautiful. It is very well maintained, in fact they were erecting scaffolding to clean another stained glass window while we were there. We took the Circuit A package giving access to 9 sights in the castle complex, including the church. This is a great option as you get a comprehensive overview of the history of he building. The gargoyles are especially fun
'Stunning' does not to this 1000 year old building justice. definitely go to see this. I've seen many like this across Europe but none of this magnitude or beauty - breathtaking.
pretty impressive. A huge catholic church.It's worth visiting for its architecture and interior.Since it was christmas it also had christmas trees and everything.

Breathtakingly imposing. The medieval at its most fascinating: a breathtaking hommage to the wealth of the church's medieval donors and their conspicuous equation of donation with veneration. Solid silver coffin? Tick. Glorious frescoes with precious stone inlays? Tick. Hilarious and hideous gargoyles? Tick.From the soaring glory of the exuberant stained glass to the fun of spotting astrological symbols on the gates outside, St Vitus's cathedral is pure joy for any aficionado of the gothic.
Awesome Structure. Can be seen all over Prague up on hill by castle, must visit close up to appreciate beauty and size.

Wonderful gothic church. This is one of the best gothic church I have ever visited. The building is very old but of course still well maintained. There are amazing art glass windows you can see. I came here in Winter, a lot of people but lesser than summer time. Very worth to visit when you are in castle area.
Wowwwww. The architecture of this place is beautiful. I was blown away when I seen the building and the history behind it is very interesting. Definitely worth seeing if you visit Prague

Amazing. Definitely worth a visit. St Vitus is a breathtaking cathedral and well worth a visit even if you don't go inside. I normally have to be persuaded to visit cathedrals but I happily go every year to re-visit this one. It is awesome, both inside and out. We, normally, take a group of teenage basketball players through from the castle at night, and let the cathedral weave its magic. Most of them end up lying on the ground trying to see it properly! They love walking around the outside, too.
First Class........ Do not miss the Cathedral.....amazing architecture from outside and amazing feel inside,shouldn't miss this.
Breathtaking. ... Dont miss it when you visit the castle. a MUST see attraction. The vitros are great , photos are free !!!
Wow. Absolutely incredible, it had some of the most beautiful stained glass windows i have ever seen! Worth the visit

The beautiful gothic church. The Long built church is the age combination style. You can see the gothic style architecture, The old art at the St. Wenceslausง Mortuary, The Stained Glass of Mucha etc.

Reminded me of the Cologne Cathedral. You cannot see inside without a ticket.But, if you are on a short trip and it is a bright day then St. Vitus will be a pleasure to see even from outside. It appears in front of you when you go inside the Prague castle. There is around 30m gap between the base of the cathedral and the entrance from the front of the castle. And you literally look up to see. It is so big! A fabulous construction. When you walk to the square on the right side, there is space to go away and look at it. Absolute pleasure! And for those who have seen the Cologne cathedral, it will surely remind you of the giant from Germany. And then you can ponder down into the history of Prague and how it is so well connected with Deutschland.I would suggest take a whole round of the cathedral. Many people walk from right side and go ahead. I think the left side, which is shady, is also worth a look.

Why charge to enter a Cathedral?. It is a gorgeous Cathedral, but the entrance is free only to a small part at the entrance...then if you want to see the cathedral, you have to pay. Not much, but line up and buy your ticket....

Magnificent Architecture!. A truly fabulous building within the confines of Prague Castle.
Located high above the beautiful city of Prague.

So beautiful!. An absolutely beautiful building, it's like Pragues very own Notre Dame! Very gothic looking and impressive. We went inside to have a look but didn't bother paying to walk around the whole thing, can see it all without needing to pay really. I was blown away by the stained glass windows and the detail on the ceiling - definitely worth a visit.
Absolutely Breathtaking. Its within the the castle walls and is part of the standard tour. It is a beautiful cathedral and worth an hour visit.
Stunning architecture!. This was one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever been in. Even if you are not a strong church goer I would definitely recommend visiting this cathedral.

another world class work of
Architecture. An amazing piece of history high above the city and nestled into the Prague Castle fortress. We visited on a blustery winter day and we shovered thru this visit because it was so beautiful.
Stunning!. This has to be seen and I advise you pay to see the whole of the inside. It's amazing! The stained glass and statues are fabulous & worth the vist

Quite Moving. After the walk up what seemed like hundreds of steps , this was worth it. So beautiful inside that it causes a lump in the throat. We visited on a sunny day in January and light through the stained glass windows was magical. A vast array of statues and murals. Just gorgeous.

Absolutely Wonderful. A trip to Prague is not complete without a visit to St. Vitus, one of the most iconic buildings in the city. We paid the fee to walk through the cathedral, but did not get the audio tour (I wish we had!). The interior took my breath away; it's massive and filled with with gilded statues, carvings, tombs, paintings, chapels in alcoves, and stained glass. There's even stained glass by Mucha! The only downside was the crowds - we were there first thing in the morning, hoping to avoid crowds but it seems everyone else had the same idea!

Insanely huge - May 2013. Came here with my girlfriend. The inside was absolutely enormous. Hard to exaggerate the size as it's just so big. It seemed to have its own atmosphere, and the way the sun shone through the stained glass windows gave off an ethereal light that made you feel as though you were underwater. We didn't go inside very deep, but I know that the skull of King Wenceslas is somewhere inside. Wandering outside it just as fun. If you follow the rear (or maybe it's side?) exit from the property, be sure to stop by for a drink and a snack at the 'Coffee in the Garden' cafe.
Beautiful cathedral. Well worth a visit. Amazing cathedral. The stained glass windows are breathtaking. The gothic and neo gothic architecture is a must see.

A jewel in a castle. Can't visit Prague without a trip up the hill to St Vitus. Beautiful building with obvious history (we didnt get an audio tour but would do next time) , stained glass windows, gold statues, carvings and crucifixes..what more could you ask for.

Can go in without paying. Can go in to the entrance area without paying and admire the stunning interior overall as well as the first side chapels on either side. Worth walking all round the exterior also.

Worth of seeing. One of a kind type of gothic, and neo gothic architecture. Pay attention to small architecture details, and off course the stained glass by A. Mucha. It's very bright during the sunny day which is not often in gothic cathedrals.

What majesty. We know cathedrals are magnificent- like York and Paris etc- but St Vitus takes your breath away. It is gigantic, took so long to build , beautiful stained glass etc. there is so much to look at, to read and wander around. The outside is just as awesome. Be sure to go before it closes at 4 pm.

Spectacular!. From the moment I walked into the cathedral I was in awe, just amazing and so pretty. The stained glass windows and the mammoth size of the place make it dazzling. Really enjoyed looking around the cathedral and getting info about the history. The outside of it is just as spectacular, how they built these things continues to amaze me! Really really beautiful, well worth a look!
Great atmospher. Very subdue feeling, congregation and priest singing, later organist playing maybe for his own pleasure...History just sit on your shoulders,but it is not heavy,more adorable.
Dazzling. Need to see, one of the most impresive Cathedral I had see, several influence period which had impacted its stained glass and architecture. Love it

We couldn't get in!. Be aware that the site closes at 4pm sharp and is closes on mondays. We spent too much time wandering around the castle and the grounds that by the time we got to the cathedral - it was after 4pm and closed!!!!Check opening times before you strike out!

Magnificent!. I've had the chance to visit wonderful, monumental cathedrals like the Notre Dame in Paris, but I have to say the St. Vitus cathedral was just as - perhaps even more than! - impressive. The inside of the building is just phenomenal, there's so much to see and the details are incredible. Each stained glass window is a work of art in itself. The experience is worth having whether you are a religious person or not. Either way, you're unlike to forget it.

Get the audio guide!. We were so happy we got the audio guide for the cathedral. Just be aware, you have to give a deposit to get the guide for three hours or all day. It must be in cash and you must return to the place you got it. Not a fabulous system. When we got there, it was only about 9am so there was no line. When we brought it back, rushing to meet the 12:30pm deadline, the line was forever long in the rain. There is no, " just need to return line," so I had to push my way through the tiny door (again only one door for in and out), anger a lot of people in a lot of different languages just to return it and get my money back. They have GOT to get a different system because I heard him tell so many people while I waited that they were out of audio guides, as I stood there with two in my hand. Plus, if you are late returning the guides, no deposit for you. All that aside, the cathedral was gorgeous. It was a little crowded but not so much that we couldn't enjoy it. The history you would miss without knowing what you are looking at is amazing. Please do yourself a favor and rent the guide or do a lot of reading ahead of time. Take in the St. Wenceslas area inside from both viewpoints because there is so much to see in there.

Amazing Cathedral. The climb to the top was tiring but totally worth the view. Inside the church is also very picturesque. Make sure to view the cathedral from all sides so you can get plenty of amazing photos. There is no other cathedral quite like St. Vitus: I will definitely return here.

Jewel at Prague Castle. So very different from the Baroque St. Nicholas. Of the many churches we visited in Prague this is the first we enjoyed with stained glass windows; beautiful, stained glass windows. One window a splendid commissioned work by Mucha. We did not buy any tour ticket (short or long) for the Prague Castle complex but the cathedral is free to view from the rear entry. Judging from the cordoned queue, in season must draw a crowd. If you do purchase admission tickets to tour the sites they are good for two days and it will take at least that long to scratch the surface to all the sites, especially in high season.

The Rolling Stones. I did not like being stopped inside the Cathedral with cash turn styles. I felt all those that had paid John Paul (as we had) should of at least been allowed to visit the side churches. Anyway all was not lost, John Paul was absolutely fantastic as a guide. This guide had so much information I would love to have syphoned it out of him. I saw the stones in the '70s in London and here they were in light. Apparently they paid for the up lighting / down lighting around St Vitus Cathedral. Up the Stones yeah!

You can miss it. You have to paid for everyhting there...Some time ago the gold street was free... The Cathedral is one of the most important monuments to visit in Prague, the Palace also. Don t miss to go to visit the mesquita as well

Stunning architecture. I am not a religious man, but this cathedral is awesome. The outside is old, weathered and ornate and is covered in gruesome gargoyles. The inside space is jaw dropping. I actually said "wow" when i looked up at the ceiling.definite visit.
Beautiful. The cathedral is breathtakingly beautiful from the outside, inside it's not that special. Easy access by tram number 22, Prazsky hrad stop
Fabulous stained glass windows. The Cathedral is a Gothic building which reminded me a lot of Gloucester Cathedral, but with beautiful stained glass. It is on a hill next to the Castle.

A Wonder to see. This is an amazing church! Sitting up on the hill at the castle, we walked from Old Town. Its beautiful architecture and must be seen inside & out! One of the most beautiful churches in Europe! After the church we walked our way back down, it was a long day but we loved it!
Stained glass. There is amazing stained glass in here. Make sure you buy a 'photo pass', or you won't be able to take photos.
Ethereal !. If all cathedrals are as beautiful as St. Vitus, one may consider converting to a religion that requires regular visits !

Imposing. The approach to the church was awe inspiring. We were allowed into the front of the church but had to pay if we wanted to go further in. As we were able to take a picture of the main altar, internal church roof and some stained glass window, we didn't feel the need to pay to see any more! There are plenty of churches to see for free!

Stunning building inside and out. We were taken to Cathedral on a walking tour and was very impressed. The history of the cathedral was very interesting to listen to and we were glad we didn't miss it out.

Impressive but not as grand inside as others in Europe.. A very impressive building, not overly expensive to tour but key features are fenced off - which is understandable but not the case with some of Europes grander Cathedrals. While it may have the wow factor to some - it almost certainly won't if you have been to Rome or Barcelona. It didn't help that our week in Prague was very grey and a bit of sun and blue sky improves ones perspective and experience of a place no end. Certainly not a bad experience and there are many other things (to pay) to view in the castle area.
Stunning. We went on a 3 hour coach & walking trip during our stay which took us up to the Cathedral. Absolutely beautiful.

A very grand building. Located amongst the castle complex, the scale of the cathedral is impressive and you certainly will need a wide angle lens to capture the entirety of this very grand building. The interior of the cathedral is as impressive as the exterior.
Beautiful stained glass. Part of entrance fee to castle, the stained glass in wonderful and from several different eras. Better earlier when quieter to get the feel of the wonderful space.

Absolutely breathtaking. One of the best experiences of our trip! It was part of the castle grounds but we easily spent the longest amount of time here. I took so many pictures but none of them did it any justice. Everything about it was stunning and we were only in Prague for thee days, but so glad we made time to visit! Highly recommended!

Unbelievably beautiful. This cathedral is mind blowing, absolutely gorgeous. It's located in the Castle grounds, but could easily be its own attraction. It's truly breathtaking and no matter how many pictures I took, I could never do justice to how it looks in person. I also couldn't pick out one defining feature of what makes this place so special, the whole thing is art. 100% worth a visit.
Main Tower. Its the best view on whole Prague in my opinion. The price of 150 cK is a bit expensive but the view is super and also the collectors coin added to this is a perfect souvenir.
You will need your wide angle lens. Huge! Right behind the castle and I believe the entry was free to visit the first part. The inside was gorgeous!

The ONE thing you must see. It is huge, it is gothic, it has an awesome view, it has a lot of history.... It is an amazing sighting.Getting to the top in a narrow spiral staircase proved to be a real work out to my out of shape self (I had to stop a few times to recollect my lungs before I spilled them out...) - but try to tough it out because it IS worthit!

Average European Cathedral. Europe is renown for its cathedrals, from Notre Dame in Paris to La Sagrada Familia in Barcelona, making this yet another average landmark compared to its more famous counterparts. Yes, the stained glass is gorgeous, the vaulted ceilings are breathtaking, and the interior is ornate, but if you've traveled Europe a bit or are in a crunch for time, skipping this won't be a catastrophe. Admission is free and the easiest way to get here is via the Metro Line A (green) to Malostranska, then walk uphill along Valdstejnska and Thunovska to arrive at the Prague Castle. It's actually the cathedral's tall steeples that people think is the "Prague Castle," since there isn't really a castle, but merely a large complex housing the St.Vitus Cathedral, Old Royal Palace (home to the Czech President), and St.George Basilica. If anything, the castle is worth visiting because it's the hallmark of Prague, and along the way, peek inside the cathedral as well.

AMAZING!. Came here in January 2015 & absolutely loved it. It is hidden away by the castle but once you see the entrance it is mesmerizing. The first thing I noticed was the stained glass windows of which there are about 5 of them that you can see, They are in all different colours and designs, The height of the Cathedral is surprising the walk up the stairs does not do it justice. There are also some very intricate sculptures on show as well, you can't get super close to them as they are behind a rope but close enough to see the beauty of them.
