All in all definitely worth the trip & to see the traditional guards was also something to see.

Stunning stained glass. We booked circuit 2 on the castle Tour and saw the cathedral last. It cost us 250czk. One of the highlights. Stunning stained glass Windows and it wasn't overly busy in this tickets only section. There is a free area which was more busy but nothing too crowded. I've added some photos, but photos don't capture the significance at all.
very monumental. Cathedral is located in thw centre of castle complex in Prague. It is the dominant of city visible also from Charles Bridge and river areas. Free entrance

Huge, impressive -- and freezing!. Just to start with, men, be prepared. Men, you are not allowed to keep your hat on in the church. It's against the rules. This may be a bit of a problem in January when the church is actually colder inside than the biting wind outside. My friend had a hard time with this and was freezing by the time we left. That said, this church feels absolutely huge inside due to the soaring ceilings. They just go up and up and up. It's beautiful. The windows, especially the Mucha window, are gorgeous and lush, even in the overcast winter time. The tomb of St. Wenceslas is there, and worth a visit. The entrance and a short distance in is a free visit, but if you want to see the sights or the rest of the church, you've got to buy a ticket before you enter. There are two types of tickets, one for fewer "castle hill" attractions and one for more, and both include the large castle. One's about 250 crowns, the other about 350, if I recall correctly. The Mucha window is hard to see from the free side. I think it's unfortunate to ask people to buy a ticket for a church, but that is the way of it in some places. It helps with the cost of restoration and maintenance, which cannot be small. I thought it was worth the price of admission for the cathedral plus the castle. They are right against each other and inside guarded gates, so it makes sense that they are one large agglomerated tour site. If you go at the right time, you can watch the changing of the guard in the castle area.

Grandest building in Prague. Do not skip this attraction. The inside will steal your breath away especially if it's sunny and the stained glass windows are in full effect. Lots of sights nearby as well and plenty of shopping

too many tour groups. warning--this review may not be accurate as we went on a rainy cold day. my least favorite tourist site. went as advised early in am in the winter and it was mobbed. church is okay but palace as a whole is better seen from the city as a fanatasy palace on the hill. best thing for me is i got to shoot a medival crossbow 3x for about 50cents u.s. if you are into ostentatious displays of wealth at the expense of citizenry of the time then go, if this stuff bugs you just do the free stuff. cost my wife and i about $60 usd for tickets and auduioguide apeice and we left after 3 hours, but please see caveat at start of this review

Just Lovely. St. Vitus Cathedral is so worth the walk. We walked from our hotel at Charles Square, passing the clock square, over the Charles Bridge to St Vitus Cathedral. There are little shops, places to eat all along the way. Beautiful stained glass windows, crypts, ceiling all make up this lovely cathedral.

Impressive Cathedral. This is a beautiful cathedral in the Gothic style, which was started in the 1300s and finished in the early 20th century. To appreciate it fully, one needs to be part of a group with a guide or have a very good guidebook.

BEWARE PICKPOCKETS ON TRAMS. En-route to the cathedral a clever pickpocket duo artfully lifted a new smart phone from an otherwise protected front of the body folded holster. Upon exiting the tram with the thugs now disappearing and pursuit futile, other tourists reported that members of their group also were robbed by pickpockets in what some say is one of the worst cities in Europe for such thefts.

A beautiful place, but freezing inside, BBRRRR!. Definitely include this on your Prague castle tour as it is one of the best bits. The stained glass windows are huge and incredible. It is a very large building and there is so much detail in every part of it so take your time to study each section and if you do have a book which tells you more I would recommend it as we didn't really know what we were looking at and we didn't get the audio tour as I detest them. We went early and it was lovely and quiet, apart from being so so so cold, may be obvious to most people but we went back outside to warm up!
A Lovely Cathedral. The St. Vitus Cathedral is located at the peak of the Prague Castle and is a lovely cathedral. It is worth a visit.
explendid view. The San Vito cathedral is magnify. There you can see the thumbs of San Nepomuceno. We love it. In the winter there is cold like outside. Be prepare.
Love it. I have been waiting for years to go St. Vitus Cathedral. I loved visiting the catacombs, the town and the church itself. Wonderful!
Packed but worth a visit. Really popular so loads of people everywhere, not a place for a quiet visit, but spectacular inside. Avoid Sunday morning as it can be closed for a service

Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. This stunning cathedral can be seen from Old Town Prague. It sits atop a hill within the castle walls. When you're walking up, it looks nice, but when you walk through to the courtyard just under the main door, it takes your breath away. This is an absolutely stunning cathedral. I would recommend paying the fee to go inside and to go up in the north tower. The view from the tower is well worth it and the inside of the church is magnificent. You can walk in for free, but in order to get past the back part, you have to pay the fee. It's worth it. I probably could have spent an entire day just exploring inside and outside of the cathedral. It was truly a beautiful structure.
Beautiful. Very beautiful church. It has a great architecture. I loved its details. I have spent a lot of time for the photography session.
Inspiring views. A must see when you visit Prague, the spires on the cathedral were fabulous, a great piece of gothic building.

Magnificent!!!. The biggest and most important cathedral in Prague! Filled with architecture history and religion, indeed a beautiful masterpiece - one needs to be there to experience it! Located among Prague Castle, our friendly tour guide took us on a cosy tram ride to the castle and after spending 4 hours (including visits to Prague Castle, its courtyards and witnessed the changing of the guards), we walked back to the city. The night-view of the city from the castle was breath-taking. A must-see while in Prague!
Absolutely wonderful. Don't miss in Praha, and view to the past. Just a wonderful adventure for a trip to Czech Republic - good time to go because of strong US dollar

The best cathedral I've ever seen. So much history and religion gathered in a such beautiful place ! There are the things which make this cathedral unique. It is located inside the Prague Castle which can be easily reached by tram (the station in 200metres away from the cathedral). A must-visit in Prague!

Up there with the best. Having now had the experience of over 20 cathedrals in Europe (including the UK) we found this to be up there among the top 5. it is truly magnificent and we found it took our breath away - the stained glass windows are exceptional. There is also beautiful other items in this building that make the visit worthwhile.There are many tickets to view the Castle in Prague and although you can go into the back for free, anyone not taking a ticket to view this cathedral would be robbing themselves of something of beauty.Highly recommended
A must-see in Prague. A must-see for all travllers, esp if you're interested in architecture history. Go inside and experience the medieval holy moment.
Impressive. Well worth a visit - the architecture in Prague is generally amazing & the cathedral does not disappoint.

Main Attraction at Prague Castle Site. Interior is as good as exterior, which is lacking in many churches/cathedrals in Europe due to the World War bombing. You have to queue to enter though, not as free as other cathedrals/churches. Most probably, because of the number of tourists visiting this place each day. Nevertheless, you should visit this Cathedral when you are in Prague.
nice impressive mid age cathedral. Very nice and impressive place. Admire the builders of that time to build that. Trust all areas of your life to God Jesus Christ.

Beautiful Church - Logistics could improve. The church itself is beautiful. Lots of ornate décor and old tombs scattered throughout the chapels, along with a lot of stained glass. It gets very crowded very fast when the tour groups start showing up and you'll hear the tour guides speaking into their microphones despite the signs asking for quiet, so it can get a bit noisy as well. We went when it first opened, so it was much quieter and we could stroll around more. The St Wenceslaus Chapel was very impressive. I wish the crypt had been open. The sign said it was closed for technical reasons. I was disappointed about it's physical location relative to the palace in terms of getting a photo from the front. It's very difficult to get the entire cathedral from the very front, but you still can get tons of great photos. The cathedral was included in the B-pass option we purchased, which also included the Old Palace, St George's Basilica, and the side street with all the little houses.
One of the best !!. Really astonishing. Beautiful both inside and outside. A must watch for those who visits Prague. We were there during this Christmas time and we loved it

A must to visit in Prague. It's the gigantic church in Prague with over 700 years of history if I'm not remembered wrongly. Many stories to tell through the beautiful architecture. Don't forget to take a panorama picture at the entrance of the church. You will love the view. You need to standby some coins to pay for the bathroom though ( however, most of the places in Eastern Europe does require entry fees ). Take a nice coffee at cafe nearby the church and enjoy the view. :-)

An exercise in money grabbing, spirtually bancrupt commercialism. This stunning building is no longer a spiritual sanctuary - there is nowhere to pray, nowhere to contemplate, nowhere to even sit. I was threatened with arrest if, as a disabled person, I attempted to sit in a pew. I took my concern to the central booking hall - yes, it is very expensive, ticket only, entry to this house of God, and I was informed that I was one of hundreds of complaints, but unfortunately, the Cathedral had been handed to private contractors so there was nothing they could do. DON'T GO, pray somewhere else, give your money to a real church....this is a disgrace.
Interesting but not outstanding. Crowded and somewhat limited in what one could see. Lots of great paintings, stained glass and statues.

A must see. According to our guide this is one of the top gothic cathedrals in the world. I haven't seen many, but this one was awe-inspiring. The architecture was so impressive that it led me to want to understand more about the various medieval architecture styles.

Know I Know About St. Vitus Dance. Our art historian guide gave us a very in depth understanding of the manner of persecutions taking place in terms of religion. The windows, sculpture and design is fantastic. Spend time looking at the wooden small sculptures!

Prague's Notre-Dame. Beautiful old cathedral in Hradczany Castle, totally worth a visit. For a special attention deserve great stained glass windows and coronation chamber. Trip to the top of the tower costs extra but provides nice panoramic view.

Must to see!. I can't describe it enough how beautiful it is! No doubt one of the places must to see! We visited this place on magical time- Christmas time, so it looks fantastic at night with all the lights outside! Take full tour to enjoy all the power of this place!

Beautiful inside and out. You won't be disappointed with the Cathedral, it was the first and most beautiful of Prague Castle's offerings. It's definitely worth paying to enter the Cathedral as there are a lot of intricate details that you'd miss if you were to just hang around at the entrance. The stained-glass windows are especially stunning.

Amazing. Top 3 things you'll see in Prague. Plan to Spend an hour in here without the audio guide. Or 2 hours if you listen to everything in the guide. I bought circuit b package and audio guide. If I had known beforehand what I would enjoy, I wouldn't use the guider for anything else but vitus and it was worth it. May not be for you. But I'd recommend the 3 hour audio guide. It's 1000 czech crown deposit plus 350 payment for one, no student/senior discounts. But vitus is the absolutely beautiful. Make sure you don't miss anything because once you scan your ticket to enter vitus and leave YOU CANNOT RE-ENTER

Impressive. .. on the outside.. There was such a long queue for entrance. In the cold of December we could not wait. Therefore we could not see the interior. The view of its towers from a distance is the landmark of the city.
Beautiful cathedral. Lovely old cathedral located on a hill with awesome views of the city below. It's well worth the walk across the Chain Bridge.

Bring headphones or earplugs.... The tourists in the foyer were unforgivably loud. I actually left the cathedral, traveled to the apartment I was staying at, got my headphones, and headed back to the cathedral armed with some Beethoven and enjoyed this cathedral thoroughly, tourists forgotten.*For comparison, I was on a 3 week Europe tour and had previously toured the Notre Dame Cathedral, The Sacre Coeur, and The Stephansdom, and none of these cathedrals seemed to have such distraction. Tourists shouldn't have to be told when they should whisper, (Museums, cemeteries, etc..)If you are lucky to have the peace and quiet that I had to manufacture for myself, you'll enjoy this beautiful structure. I think I spent an hour inside!
Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful Catherdral and no pressure walking around could stay as long as you liked. Really worth a visit.

Incredible Place. We bought tickets to visit the Cathedral and it is so worth it. Absolutely beautiful. Well preserved and many very special items to see. It is spectacular on both the outside and the inside

Masterpiece. Definitely worth a visit, part of the ticket to see Prague Castle. If you don't buy a ticket, you can still go in, but only a restricted amount of space, to walk around the church you need a ticket, which costs either 250Kc for Circuit B or 350Kc for Circuit A (both include other sights). Beautifully decorated, with awesome stained glass windows all round. Towards the back of the church it starts to get a little congested, as you make your way around the altar and the Silver Tomb of John of Nepomuk. The gothic architecture is amazing, from its vaulted ceiling, to the rose window on the front.

gorgeous!. located at the top of the hill & within Prague Castle compound, this cathedral is worth a visit. it was snowing & a bit foggy when I went here & the cathedral looked kind of eerie which I liked it!

Worth the Walk. Walk to the castle via the Charles Bridge...it is s a beautiful walk and only takes about 20 min. There are plenty of places to stop along the way if you should need to rest. I would recommend renting the audio guide...I was way off in my efforts to guess as to whom was laying in each tomb. The information the that the audio guide provides makes the tour so much more meaningful. The cathedral is breathtaking and worth at least a hour of your time. I would definitely recommend taking your camera.
Big church. We included the cathedral into our castle trip it had a very tall tower 287 steps!! ...despite the slog the views were immense

What a Masterpiece. Over 1000 years old this church is well worth the visit and a quite walk around the naives of the main building. Beautifully decorated with elaborate stained glass this was a highlight for my family and I.

Too restricted. We went to Prague Castle as part of a tour and joined the queue to visit the Cathedral. What we did see was stunning, but was so crowded because the main part of the cathedral was restricted to people who had paid extra. We were in and out within 5 minutes and didn't get to appreciate it

Classic Gothic Cathedral with Stunning Stained Glass. The St. Vitus Cathedral is part of the castle complex. You can peek inside without paying a fee. However, the inside of the catheral is worth the price of admission. There is a remarkable stained glass window by the Czech art nouveau artist Mucha that is a revelation. The cathedral itself was started in 1344 and finished in 1953 so probably should be renamed "The Never-Ending Cathedral" but the sterling silver casket and the other shrines are well worth seeing. Be patient, take your time and look for some of the small details and you will have fun.

Beautiful from the outside. We felt that the cathedral looked nicer from the outside due to its Gothic look. Read up a little on the history before viewing the exhibits within to gain more understanding.

It looks great form the river and it looks greater once you are there. The building itself is the icon of Praha as part of the Prague Castle panorama. But once you are in the Castle and enter the cathedral, you also feel the greatness you can almost touch (right, NO touch :-)

Beautiful and nearly finished!. The cathedral has taken centuries to finish as can be seen from the different styles in different parts of the cathedral and the lack of some statues on pillars. The building is impressive and can be seen from all over Prague. The stained glass windows and the one painted window are stunning.
Beautiful. The architecture was exceptional, gorgeous stained glass windows and a beautiful building, tricky opening times though we had a magical time.

Unique building. Great building with unique architecture style, different from any other churches I have visited. Most churces in Prague have Roman style,but this is different. Visiting at night gave different feeling.

Beautiful glasses. Beautiful cathedral, although you have to pay for the entrance. There should be some explanations in English otherwise you just see an don't understand the history. I was really upset that the royal cript was closed to visit.

Maybe it was the crowds .... ... or the warnings about the ever-present pickpockets, but as impressive as this Cathedral is inside and out, the limited access to the interior and the crowds detracted significantly from our enjoyment. I suggest trying to pick a time (if it exists) where you can avoid as much of the crowds as possible.
worth paying a visit. beautiful cathedral; have to buy entrance ticket. crowded, but worth the visit. nice views from here

busy and noisy but worth a visit if you like cathedrals. Very busy place but pretty cathedral on castle grounds, tickets cost quite a bit. Very touristy but otherwise a nice place to have a look around

Beautiful cathedral in stunning surroundings. Worth a visit, for sure. Cathedral is stunning and, in some places, jaw-dropping. There were some crowds but nothing too crazy. We would recommend visiting with the Prague Card as it really does provide better value for money.

Wow!. Wow what a beautiful Cathedral- stunning is an understatement!
The Gothic inspired architecture makes you speechless as you enter the church. Its a Church including Church of St Nicholas that you should not miss in Prague
Lead Glass Panels. We were lucky - not too many people - we did not pay the entrance and could view the famous lead glass panels from where we stood. This is worth a visit.

Stunning Architecture. It is possible to visit the cathedral and view the a small portion of the inside for free, from this viewing area you get to see some of the main windows a get a good sense of the size of the building, but as with the castle we decided after reading other reviews and speaking to tour guides that it wasn't worth paying the entry fee to walk around the rest of the cathedral. My suggestion is to save your money and put it towards a tour.
Stained glass windows. A large cathedral with lovely stonework. Beautiful stained glass windows, many colours and designs, a majestic cathedral.
Loved the architecture. This cathedral is a must see when visiting Prague Castle. The stain glass windows look great; the sun was shining when we were there.

Transported back in time. This beautiful gothic cathedral did nothing but drop my jaw the whole time. It is remarkable how the people in that period was able to construct such beautiful piece of architecture. From the pointed arches, flying buttresses, and gargoyles at the exterior to the vaulted ceilings stained glass windows and chapels inside. I could not stop marveling at its beauty. I didn't want to leave at all.ACCESS: We bought our Prague Card and got in for free to the compound. The people at the information center will let you know which areas you can access -- this includes the cathedral.Take tram #22 from the City, and go down at Pratzky Hrad stop. This is just about 5-10 minute walk to the Tourist Information center where you can buy your tickets. This is the easiest way unless you have your own car in which I have no idea where parking is. :)If you don't plan to go with a tourist guide, read up on the history and architecture of the Cathedral to have better appreciation of the place. With all the tourists coming in, stop and take a while to look at the beautiful architecture and details before you.
Stunning . Just stunning! Well worth the visit. The architecture is beautiful and although we are not religious, it was still a very special place to visit.

Beautiful from the outside!. This is stunning to look at from the outside.... couldn't say what the inside was like as it was shut when we visited! It is free to peak into though. Apparently, the first room is free to go in....when it is open! You have to pay to see the rest of it (or at least the bit that they allow the public into!)

My favorite place in Prague. This was my favorite place to visit in Prague. The Cathedral is perfectly restored. The stained glass windows are magnificent. If you buy a ticket you can get up close. Don't miss it.
The Windows.....amazing. Stunning building. Wonderful windows - so much colour and detail. The souring roof was inspiring. Very pleased we paid the entrance fee. Good value

Christmas Eve Midnight Mass. I went to the midnight mass on Christmas Eve and was blown away. The cathedral is stunning, both inside and out. It is nothing short of monumental, and the history of the cathedral is as engaging as the physical building. You have access to most of the cathedral for free, as a visitor. If you are attending mass, the entire building is open free of charge. If you go during winter, understand that the building is quite cold. Dress for the weather. If you are attending midnight mass, arrive at least an hour early if you expect to get a seat. The few pews fill up by 23:15, but there is plenty of standing room. That said, I strongly advise against wearing heels. The mass is in Czech, as are the hymnals, but they translate the first reading to English and the feeling of the mass is the same. All in all, I strongly recommend a visit.
terrific. It's huge and even though most of the cathedrals (if not all) in Prague are in this Gothic style, this one stroke me most with its size.
Best Part of Trip. Absolute a MUST SEE. The inside is a work of art as is the entire building. Took over 100 pictures while there. About a 25 minute walk from Old Town over St Charles bridge.

No ticket needed to just have a look inside. An unbelievable building both inside and out. We bought a "circuit B" ticket which included a walk around the entire inside area, however you can still go inside if you don't have a ticket but you can not walk the whole way around. You are still able to get a feel for the cathedral so if you are keen to see the inside but not walk the entire way around you can do that without a ticket. We probably wouldn't have bought a ticket if we had known this. Definitely worth a look.
Impressive. An impressive church which you can visit either for free, but just a part of it, enough though to get an idea - or using a combined ticket, together with the rest of the castle area.
Beautiful but..... This Cathedral is absolutely stunning. The architecture and stained glass windows are breathtaking. However they charge to see it and I feel that's just wrong for a church.

Impressive building. Very impressive massive building both from inside and outside. From the street you see high towers/peaks and from inside the ceiling is very high. Also the good thing to notice are colored windows with mosaic.
Overwhelming and spectacular. Have visited a lot of cathedrals in Italy, however…. There was something magical about this one. Hard to take it all in.
Lovely. Very nice cathedral if you have the time. It was just finished in the 1920s. Beautiful stained glass.
Beyond Words. The cathedral was awesome, a marvel to behold. I couldnt help but admire this place of worship dating back many many years ago. Not to miss this sight when in Prague.
A miracle to see. Incredible church in the Castle of Prague (Hrad), real middle-ages feeling in a beautiful surrounding.
Huge!. I think it is the biggest Cathedral I have ever seen, even bigger than St Stephan's Dom in Viena.I could see that it is visited by many people and it has no entrance fee.

As cathedrals go, it's a nice one. Being one of the newer cathedrals around, completed in 1928 I believe after taking 600 years to build it, retains that neo gothic cathedral style and beauty, and appears much older than it really is. Beautiful stained glass and a striking structure from almost any interior angle in which you gaze. Amazing wood sculpted doors and over the top crypts. The exterior of the structure is massive, and I had a hard time finding a spot even with a wide angle lens to get the whole thing in frame. It's classic neo gothic abound with flying buttresses and gargoyle scuppers. Ya gotta love gothic. St. Vitus being part of the castle complex, is I believe, the nicest part of that castle complex and the most deserving of the majority of your time there. While I've been in much more impressive cathedrals, this one is still deserving of a visit.

Great stained glass. I'm glad it took them 600 years to finish this cathedral because they put modern stained glass windows in which are stunningly beautiful. As cathedrals go, this one is pretty ho-hum, neither too many nor enough cherubs to stand out from the crowd, but worth a visit to see the glass.
great monument. Fantastic, great monument on the prague castle area, very charismatic, you must spend more time there
Amazing Church. Though only completed in 1929, the neo-gothic church looks much older. Be sure to see the Mucha stained glass window in the back.

Impressive!. Set within the castle walls this building is impressive and takes your breath away!!Its just huge! Inside is just as beautiful as outside and there are lots of photo opportunities... Gorgeous large stained glass windows and displays inside as well. Definitely a must see!
Beautiful glass windows. Like most of the churches in Prague, the interior is quite dark. But the colorful glass windows are just amazing! Definitely worth a visit!
VERY NICE!. I liked all of the catedral but the no flash was hard but, I made it work. I dislike the tour groups and people getting in my way when i take a good piture.
dazzling!. One of the most beautiful cathedrals I have ever seen. It is really tall, but all the building is full of details and you can stand in front of it for ours, just to find some things.
Part of the Castle Grounds - You Must Visit. The cathedral is the dominant landmark in Prague. You must view it from many distances and angles and at various times of the day.

Prague Castle/St. Vitus Cathedral. We spent two half days with Michal from E-guides.cz first walking from Charles Bridge to and around Prague Castle. A couple of days later we went with Michal into St. Virus cathredral.
The castle, bridge and cathedral were amazing, but Michal brought history to life with his tales and folk stories.
Highly recommended.

Excellent. Loved this so much and would recommend it to most.
The history is so good in this city.
Very beautiful cathedral.

Awesome!. It's about 20 minute walk from the old square, and it's worth it. Cathedral is beautiful - it's grand! You can enter also for free to walk in the reception part of the cathedral, but have to buy ticket to get to the altar. The ceilings and stained glass windows are gorgeous.

Magnificent. Magnificent church with lovely chapels and arts. night time visit is recommended but only walking outside the church and take photos . church visit inside only at morning during visit time.

Magical. Amazing architecture! It is huge and situated as a part of the Courtyards in Prague Castle. The stained glass windows and the Chapels inside are stunning. If you don't feel like paying to see the inside, there is a small part you can enter for free and still you can see most of it... It is a MUST.

Too crowded. The cathedral from the outside is beautiful! I have no idea of the inside. On the friday that we wanted to visit they were in maintenance and the day after it was so crowded that we gave up.

Save your Koruna. If you just want to check out the scale of it, you don't have to pay. All the best windows to are visible from the non-paying bit. Wenceslas Chapel (the main attraction) seems to be roped off. Very scary guy making sure you pay for votive candles.

Stunning . These kind of cathedrals never fail to impress me. Stunning architecture and the stained glass windows amaze you. My only niggle is that although you've paid for your entrance ticket, there is hardly any information available in this place for free. You only get to find out about the Cathedral after you've forked out more for the audio tour.
Impressive. Great architecture and stained glass, is a wonderful must see Cathedral situated within the castle complex

Access tricky!. We popped into the Cathedral and were so impressed by the stained glass windows that we wanted to see more. However we discovered that we couldn't just pay to go into the Cathedral and that we had to buy tickets to the whole Castle in order to get further access to the Cathedral. Didn't particularly want to do that so didn't see the whole thing - a shame really.

Impressive!. It is hard to imagine that this church's construction was finalized in the 20th century. It is very large and imposing. The side chapels are beautiful - especially the St. Wenceslaus. Some of the most important people of Czech history are buried here: Otokar I and II and other kings as well as St. John of Nepomuk. The work of Peter Parler - a 14th century master - is clearly visible in this gothic cathedral. You should definitely visit it!

Very large, impressive cathedral. A very large, impressive cathedral located within the Prague Castle Complex. Cathedral was built over many centuries, and was not finished until early 20th century - which baffled me when I first found out as it had a really historic/ancient feel about it. An extra entrance fee is required if you wish to see the Cathedral's treasures, which I feel is worth it - lots of beautiful art and sculptures. You can also offer donations towards the exit - 20CZK for a single candle, although the lady in charge of donations was a little bit grumpy.

And she stands majestic against the skyline. You probably would be allowed inside-inside if you've brought yourself the tour tickets but i was told its not worth it, nor is any of the 'admission only with tickets' attractions on the Hill castle. That doesn't mean that Vitus doesn't exude charm, the gothic towering building is impressive from the time your eyes reach it, albeit being teeming with tourists. The architecture outside is worth observing a few minutes, the gargoyles, cute. As mentioned earlier, unless you have the tickets, you can't enter beyond a certain point. IMO a guide would probably be able to translate the stone and bricks for more magic.

Beauty and the beast. Do pay the extra through the tour price to go round the cathedral. It is beautiful, and I especially loved the stained glass, though more sunlight would have been nice! The Beast? I paid to climb the Tower- 287 steps, as an older one a bit of an effort! But the views from top terrific and helped me sort out prague. Worth the effort!
Beautiful cathedral. Great architecture and stained glass. Great history behind the building, giving the architecture greater meaning. No flash photography.

One of the Best, Free Entrance. This cathedral is one to be rivalled. In my opinion, I actually like it better than other more famous ones like Notre Dame in Paris.If you do not want to buy a ticket, you can still walk inside so far, which may certainly be enough for most people. It is a nice walk from Old Town across Charles Bridge and through Lesser Town and Prague Castle grounds. Even if you take your time, you can walk and visit the area and shops in just a few hours. If you have smaller children, they may not be up for a lot of the walking.
A must see. This is a wonderful must see Cathedral situated within the castle complex. Free too enter a view the inside although you have to pay extra entrance fee too see the more sacred relics

Beautiful cathedral within the castle grounds. The cathedral is within the prague castle grounds. You can enter the castle and the cathedral for free but if you want to properly look round the cathedral and get to the back and see the sculptures etc. you need to buy a ticket from the ticket office just outside. Well worth it.

Unique insight into Czech national identity. Located in the Prague Castle complex. Free entry allows access to the front of sanctuary with views of the stained glass windows, including one designed by Mucha. Paid entry included in the Prague Castle multi-site ticket also allows access to altars, ambulatory, and historic side chapel. I recommend the free entry unless you are particularly interested in the historic details. Paid tickets are available at the Information Office directly across the courtyard. Highly recommended as a keystone of Czech national identity and culture. Note: the Treasure (historic reliquaries and other exquisite examples of medieval goldsmithing) is a separate building, with a separate paid entry - also highly recommended.

The crown jewel of Prague. After gazing the sheer diversity of architecture around Prague, we visited St Vitus cathedral and were in deep awe of the sheer immensity of its detailed design. It truly summed up the experience in Prague for us and is a must-visit attraction.Top tip - don't bother taking photos, they won't do the cathedral any justice. Just revel in the experience as much as you can without seeing it through a tiny electric screen!

Wow! all the way.. Beautiful Cathedral with incredible suroundings and an unfogettable view of the town. This is something to go visit.Only thing I found hard was you had to pay to see the rest of the Cathedral. I just think places of worship should be entered for free.

Awesome. You can't help but notice this place from anywhere in Prague so it kind has a lot to live up to. And it does - and then some. Combined with the rest of the castle complex, this has to be one of the most interesting places I have ever visited.

O M G literally. OMG is the only way to describe this mortal man's edifice to his God. The cost of the Gold leaf could probably wipe out the EU deficit. Don't forget to admire the stain glass work by Alfonso Mucha
old Church. Saint Vitus is a catholic church within the grounds of the Prague.It holds the relics of its namesake. A really dark church.

Stunning stained glass - worth paying for entry. Although you can see the entrance for free - if you have any interest in decorative arts, pay to get in to appreciate the full beauty of the windows. Also worth seeing is the solid silver tomb of St. John Nepomuk !

Superb. Morning time, you can see the guards changing duty, they do a full past. The cathedral is awesome sample of Architecture and simply an amazing place. In night, this place gets very peaceful, and gives a great view of city
Amazing. Well worth the visit. It's windows alone were as good as any I have seen worldwide. Buy a ticket to see everything in the castle area.

A big cathedral. We didn't know what to expect here. It is a nice, working cathedral. It does not have the richness of many others but is superbly maintained. The commercial aspect comes from the ticketing system where you have to scan a ticket at the turnstile as you go in, just the same as you do at so many attractions. I was surprised at how little stained glass it has - maybe it has had it destroyed and not yet replaced.

Amazing stained glass windows!. Must see in Prague!!A beautiful Gothic cathedral with different styles of stained glass windows (some were destroyed during WW2)Loved this cathedral...it is really something special!

Stunningly beautiful cathedral. This beautiful cathedral is set amongst the Prague Castle grounds & it's spectacular. There is a free viewing area just inside so you can catch a glimpse of the awe that is St. Vitus Cathedral. But you can also pay to view the whole cathedral and the surrounding castle which is an absolute must. This beautiful cathedral is breathtaking in every direction you look.
Nice cathedral. It was a nice cathedral. We didn't pay to get to the front but even if you enter without paying you can see the entire building just that you are not allowed to go in the front.
Steps. Climb to the top, the view is awesome, visit at lunch to see the guard change.only buy a ticket for what you want to see
Lovely stained glass.. Like all grand churches the interior was spectacular. It's huge. I did not pay to visit properly but however it is just nice to stand and take it all in in awe of its grandeur.

Beautiful. Stunning cathedral needs descriptions by each section so you know what you're looking at, like at the Vatican. At the end there is man with a bbq lighter lighting your candles on a production line (a bit cold)
Breathtaking. Do not miss this mindblowing cathedrale. Go there on a week day after lunchtime just to avoid the lines. Immensity inside out.

Gothic cathedral you can not miss while wisiting Prague. One of the most breath taking monuments in Prague. Located at Prague castle. Must see. It is one of the most amazing places I have ever been to. Take your time and enjoy it!!!

Amazing. You need to be early as there are tour groups with the same idea.This Catherdal is very gothic with beautiful stain glass windowsIt is beautiful and none was speaking only tour guides,.Men you need to remove your hats.

Fascinating Cathedral. This cathedral was started in the 1100's and not completed until the early 1900's. As a result the stained glass from the transept moving westward to the rose window is rather new compared to many European cathedrals. While newer, it is not modernistic. It is fairly traditionally designed bit the colors exhibit a vibrancy rarely seen in stained glass works. This feature alone makes the cathedral well worth a visit.
Lovely. Take a trip up the tower ..view is worth the climb for the views over the castle and prague.Well worth a visit
Amazing!. This is the cathedral from the castle district and it is amazing! It is breathtaking! You have to go and see it yourself, cause no words can express the feeling it gives you!
beautiful. the church is mind blowing, really a beautiful place. visit for a moment of reflection and to enjoy the articulure

Beautiful, historic, majestic. Gothic style cathedral. So beautiful! Definitely do the tour and learn about the heart of the Hapsburg empire. Our guide took us down to the crypt where the remains of Charles iv and his family lay. It was a very educational and intriguing experience. Definitely worth visiting!
Impressive. Huge cathedral overlooking the city. Wonderful stained glass.Very busy, so get there early if you can.

The biggest Cathedral I have ever seen!. A wonderful monument at the center of Prague's Castle, so high that can't fit in a photo! Little sculptures all over the edges, and amazing shapes on top of every tower.
Wow!. One of Prague most see site. Simply amazing building and impressive build, inside and outside. Make sure to get all around it, it's so big!

Beautiful cathedral.. A lovely ornate cathedral.
Although you can go in free you are limited to the front of the cathedral, but it is worth paying to be able to go around the cathedral properly.

Better than Notre Dame?. Our family LOVED strolling through this old cathedral and admiring the art, stained glass, sculptures, sarcophagi, and the Chapel of St. Wenceslas. The kids loved tagging behind and listening to the tour groups in German.

Stunning. We had a great visit to this cathedral. The interior is beautiful, very varied, awe inspiring and clearly the recipient of a lot of money at many points in its existence. The silver tomb was worth staring at for a long time. Beautiful and interesting. The Baroque organ is outrageously over the top and very of its time. We also climbed the tower, gruelling but worth the views even on the dull day we had. Outside don't miss the gold gate.One thing I wouldn't bother with is the audio tour. Unless you really want to know who designed each tomb it's not really worth it.
Great Monastery!!. really nice place , very nice cathedral , fantastic view of Prague from there. The castle around the cathedral and the atmosphere was just fantastic

world class gothic cathedral. The Prague Castle area is like a crown above the historical city of Prague and the St. Vitus cathedral is the jewel of this crown. World top class gothic cathedral and many more famous cathedral in the world are not as beautiful as this one. The clean spacious architecture with amazing stained glass in the windows is a breath taking experience.

Very Ornate. Visited this as part of a walking tour. As we finished our tour here, we were able to revisit without the necessity to walk back. Very very ornate and decorative. Highly photographic. Easy to spend quite some time here, even more time needed if you want to wait for people to get out of your photos, lol. There is a sign inside that most people don’t see – hats banned, please take them off. You could find yourself being asked/told to do so, with a finger pointing to the list of banned activities.Crossing over Charles Bridge you ascend the streets towards Prague Castle. The Cathedral is situated right in the middle of Prague Castle, so you visit both at the same time.Another must see.
Unbelievable. Such dark and breathtaking architecture, history in every inch. One of a kind and worth the tour. You will not see many places like this one.
must visit. one of key Prague palace attractions, one of 4 you get for a price of 250 CZK, approx. $10. Great stained glass.
Impressive Cathedral!. I can only think of the Vatican which would compare.Cathedral is huge and has a nice clean design with plenty of beautiful areas to explore.

Amazing gothic cathedral with a few other ancient churches in the complex. Well worth the journey to Prague Castle, this is an amazing Cathedral with some of the most beautiful stained glass and architecture I've seen in Czech. Seek out an english speaking guide to walk your through the complex, lots of history here and you won't get as much from the visit without one!

A Cathedral. This cathedral is beautiful and its a centerpiece of the castle complex. The stained glass windows are very lovely and you can walk around and take pictures. the ceiling and pillars are simply amazing. A visit to Praha will be incomplete without visiting this Cathedral
Beautiful. This cathedral was beautiful as is most of the churches in Europe,the stain glass windows are to die for and it is so very old. It is one of the better churches in Europe .

A Must See. This Cathedral is beautiful. Great stained glass. The admission for this includes entrance to other places within the Prague Castle site. Well worth it. We chose the itinerary B. Includes the Cathedral, the Old Palace, St George's Basilica, and the Golden Lane Museum area.
Terrific stained glass. Windows painted by Alfonse Mucha, great ceiling. Very cold. Plenty of tourists as it is part of Prague Castle.

The highlight of the Prague Castle tour. Visited this in November 2014 and I consider this the highlight of the Prague Castle tour. This cathedral is stunning (both inside and out). Lovely stained glass windows as well as a large area you can walk around and take pictures and reflect. It is a huge church and the centerpiece of the castle complex. I consider this the highlight of the tour as I was a little disappointed by the Royal Palace of the castle. It is worth taking the tram up the hill to view this church!
Amazing. I liked the stained glass windows and imposing height of the cathedral. Did not like so many dates from our 'walking tour guide'
Great expression of gothic. imponent, in the perfect landscape. But to visit the interior is only in the morning. You can also climb the tower, never been a fan and prepare for long cue.
Beautiful. A beautiful building with amazing stained glass windows. To walk around inside the whole building you must purchase tickets from the castle ticket office.
Huge. I thought I'd to pay to enter there, but no! It's huge this cathedral, It's beautiful inside and outside, has two different archictecture styles! Even in the gates has some little sculptures...

Magnificent old Cathedral. Beautiful old cathedral within the Prague Castle complex. You can go into the front part of the cathedral free, but it's worth paying to go further in as you see a lot more of the artefacts and architecture.

Beautiful Cathedral. I am told 80 percent of the Czech people are non religious but you wouldn't know it by the beautiful churches and synagogues you find here. Take the tram up the hill and save yourself the steep climb.
Amazing!. Must see in Prague, not only is the cathedral amazing but the surrounding area goes along with it to make this a great experience.

Impressive... from the outside. It's a beautiful cathedral, there's no way to deny it, but personally I have found it very impressive from the outside, but not quite interesting from the inside. Worth a visit anyway.

Stunning...do not miss this!. This is such a beautiful church and not to be missed. Though the main highlight of the Castle area, it should be visited for certain. Unfortunately, you cannot go into any of the chapels including the tomb of Kind Wenceslas, but you can still see into them. Don't miss it!!

An Amazing Cathedral with Gothic Splendour. Inside of Prague Castle stands the most Amazing Cathedral with it's many Gargoyles, Rose Window depicting the Biblical Creation, and large Stained Glass Windows. Work began on this landmark in 1344. What a GREAT Chancel, Renaissance Bell Tower, 3 Gothic arches in the Vaulting Ceiling. Slender buttresses surround the exterior. One should get a DK EYEWITNESS TRAVEL guide for Czech & Slovak Republics for valuable information on your trip.
Great Church. Don't miss this. It is grand. We rally enjoyed it. The history is very interesting. The church is very large.
not a free entrance. wonderful building!!not a free entrance..in every church in Prague!they wanted money even for the usage of WC

Exquisite. Absolutely huge cathedral with so much to see. The Mucha window is gorgeous. Buy a postcard to see the beautiful detail. The outside is impressive as well with all the gargoyles. Use the rest room before you enter...once you go out, there's no re-entry.
wow. What an stunning Cathedral, this is a definitely worth a visit whilst visiting prague, you could easily walk around the Cathedral and Castle grounds for hours.
Wow!!!. This is the most amazing cathedral I've ever seen. Absolutely huge. Plenty to see once you get inside. I got a cheap ticket for the castle that got me into here amongst over places
Especially liked the stained glass windows. Particularly liked the Mucha designed stained glass windows and overall the cathedral is well worth a visit

Wow and wow again. Personally I was more impressed with the exterior than the interior. If you like gargoyles you have check this out. I forgot the exact number but there is over 150 gargoyles on this structure. I couldn't stop snapping away with my camera.

Just amazing!. When we came to the information desk, all audio guides were sold out - the place is really that popular. So either have a booklet, or print some pages from the Internet. And I recommend going inside with the ticket - all these masterpieces are worth seeing.

The most famous Czech historic sight. Duke Wenceslas founded the St.Vitus rotunda in 929, he was also burried here. In the 2nd half of the 11th century duke Spytihněv II. founded in this place romanesque basilica, the grave of duke Wenceslas was preserved. In 1344 Charles IV.founded here the St.Vitus cathedral. The first designer was Matthias of Arras, the second one Peter Parler of Gmünd - their designes are in gothic style. There is several chapels in cathedral, one of them contains the dead body of duke Wenceslas at the former place. P.Parler created the net vault, the first one at the continent of Europe. Parler sons built the gothic part of the tower, the renaissance parapet of that tower was built by Hans Tirol and Bonifaz Wohlmut, the baroque roof by Niccolo Pacassi of Vienna. The west part of cathedral was built in 19th and 20th century in neogothic style by J.Kranner, J.Mocker and K.Hilbert. The whole cathedral was opened in 1929.

Beautiful Cathedral, visit the tower. Really enjoyed seeing this Cathedral. You can see it for free, but can only go into the very back portion of the church. I would recommend paying the entrance fee - the church has many chapels that are worth a look. I also highly recommend paying an additional fee to go up the clock tower. A warning: it has around 300 steps in a tightly wound circular staircase, so would not be a good option for those with physical limitations. But the views from the top are the best we saw in Prague. You can see the whole city, but especially loved looking back across the river to Mala Strana. One of the highlights of our trip!
Breathtaking visit. This huge and amazing cathedral is located in the centre of the castle, We were fascinated of it, it is like a masterpiece.

Amazing on the outside.. We walked up the hill to this area and the view of the city was great as we went higher. We were too late to go inside the Cathedral but the walled in area that the Cathedral is the center of was very interesting. The views of the city were really good from up here and it was kind of nice that there were no crowds. The entire place looked like a movie set. Pretty cool!
Stunning cathedral. This cathedral is a must see, it is absolutely beautiful - the stain glass windows are stunning, Loved it!
Breathtaking. Id put this on a par with notredame in paris it truly is breathtaking inside take your time to stroll around and take it all in

Cathedral on the hill. The fruits of your Labour will be rewarded, once you reach this landmark of Prague. You can enter for free, however if you want to see all it has to offer, you will need to pay for a tour.
also a must. When visiting a place like Prague, this place cannot be missed. Believer or not, places like this contain a lot of art that is worth looking at.

Amazing. About the only place that compares to this is the Cologne Cathedral.You will not believe the details and the professional mastery of stone masons. This is a masterful piece of art work, in every detail.Inside is also breath taking.The place makes you humble.
quiet and peaceful. nice place to be!Don't buy package tickets, just buy cathedral ticket,others are not money worth it
Breathtaking. From outside gothic and dramatic just go inside and be amazed at the wonderful and awe inspiring stained glass

Very impressive Cathedral. Don't miss Mucha painted window on your left when you get in.
Need to buy a ticket to get deeper into the Cathedral but you can feel the atmosphere in the enterence free area.

Mass on Sunday. This is the biggest church in the country. It was finally completed in 1929 after being under continuous construction for about 600 years. It contains the tombs of many Bohemian Kings and Holy Roman Emperors. The Chapel of St. Wenceslas contains the relics of the saint. The magnificent window designed by Alfonse Mucha contributes greatly to the beauty of this church. We visit every time we are in Prague, as it is obviously a major tourist attraction. I was very surprised that on one of our previous visits in December, the Cathedral was almost empty during an early Sunday morning mass. We took a taxi up the hill from our hotel and it was great to be in the Castle area early in the morning. We were even able to take photos with no other tourists in them. How great is that?
Amazing views. The church was very cold so dress warmly. Someone was playing organ music in the cathedral which added a nice element to it.

One of top 3 sights in Prague. St. Vitus is the main draw to the castle complex and in my opinion one of the top 3 things you must see in Prague (the others being Old Town Square and the Charles Bridge). The cathedral is massive and historic – I recommend you buy the ticket that allows you to enter as the inside is more amazing than the outside architecture. It is filled with beautiful stained glass windows, gold sculptures, angels/cherubs, tombs and murals. The altar and organ are amazing and the main window reminds me of Notre Dame in Paris it is that awesome. Must see.
Not to be missed. You simply cannot come to Prague without seeing this Cathedral. If you think you've seen them all, you should still see one more. You won't be disappointed.
Majestiс. Very grand building. Stained glass are just super. Always worth a visit.But it is better to visit it in the morning and when less tourists - just will not crush.

Another Cathedral?. This is one of the attractions everyone going to Prague should visit. But don't worry. If you decide to go to the Old Town you will end up there anyway. At least you will see the exterior and if you are an architecture lover - you have no chance to pass by. If you go inside you will encounter a very monumental building with gorgeous windows(Easter egg: 2 of them contain advertising) and columns that go up to the roof. The problem you can discover is lack of walking space. There is a tiny walkway going around and if too many people enter the cathedral you can find yourself slamming through the crowd listening to a guide. But no matter what this place is a MUST in Prague!
Stunning. Beautiful Cathedral very close to Prague Castle....impressive building, historically preserved...well worth visiting
Beautiful. Lots to do and see in castle and cathedral, and if you can see the changing of the guards at noon at the castle entrance.
Must to see. Perfect examples of Gothic architecture, is good to walk and observe any small details, having audio guide will help you to understood much more.
Must Visit . This is a cathedral in the palace area. The church is beautiful and so is the buildings around it. The area around the cathedral is absolutely breathtaking.

Climb it for fabulousness!. Yes it's nice from the ground level, but an even smarter thing to do is to go up to the south tower, you'll get a fabulous view of the city and some exercise to boot (297 steps). Seriously just do it like what Nike says. Up the spire you go now!

One of Prague's 3 greatest sights. St. Vitus Cathedral is not only the most noteworthy sight in the Prague Castle complex - it is also, in my view, one of the three greatest sights in the city (my other 2 favorites are the Municipal House and the Gastronomy Museum).The building of the cathedral was completed only in the last century, but the architects of the later building were faithful to the earlier work, resulting in a harmonius mixtures of styles. The 1931 stained glass window designed by Czech artist Alphonse Mucha, for example, is my favorite part of the whole cathedral - full of typical Mucha style, but also faithful to its surroundings.
Breathtaking. I have been all over Europe but the cathedrals are all so beautiful. So amazing to see. I have been to Prague twice now, and I enjoy coming to the Cathedral even more the second time.
Beautiful cathedral. Beautiful cathedral right on the Prague castle. We saw how guards is changing and I can tel you "Don't play with these guys" :) Great experience!

Beautiful!. One of the most beautiful cathedrals I have ever seen. Make time to visit and enjoy the very intricate stained glass windows and of course bring your camera. Like one of the previous posters mentioned look for the gargoyles outside the cathedral. Very cool!

worth a visit. it was free and beautiful . inside the castle grounds u don't need to buy a ticket for the castle if u are pushed for time or money. visit this cathedral and u could pay a few euros to go up the tower for photos.

Lie on the floor. The most beautiful stained glass windows ever! Lie on the floor outside for the best way to take a picture of the Cathedral. Keep looking up as you walk around the outside so that you don't miss the gargoyles.
Stunning. You can see the Cathedral from anywhere in the City and once up there it's not disappointing. Have a bowl of goulash and a dark beer.
A must do visit. It is hard to to use cliche's galore when describing this Cathedral, but you do need to visit here. Well worth the visit is to the Royal gardens out the back .

Breathtaking. I have no words for hiw beautifully breathtaking St. Vitus Cathedral is. The whole time of seeing the cathedral I was just in awe. It's a must to go up the tower and see the bird's eye view of Prague. Truly magnificent.

Stunning Cathedral in Prague. We visited St. Vitus Cathedral during our December visit to Prague (a truly beautiful and enchanting city). When we arrived at the Cathedral there was a HUGE Fir Tree decorated with beautiful large ornaments and lights. It practically filled the entire side of the Cathedral on the outside as you approached it. To top off the beauty of the Cathedral and the Tree it was snowing. Truly a lovely memory. Inside the Cathedral it was stunning. Would definitely recommend this for a visit while in Prague.
Must see. Fantastically decorated, a beautiful cathedral with overwhelming amounts of baroque artwork and gold leaf.
Amazing!. It is one of the amazing cathedral I have ever seen. It is very well conserved, very amplious. Worth visiting it.

I LOVE this cathedral. An excellent example of Gothic architecture and flying buttresses in construction. Inside are entombed kings and many important persons. The view from the hilltop is breathtaking of Prague. This cathedral may be seen from much of the city and viewed from Karluv Most (Charles Bridge) below makes a postcard. Allow many hours to visit the cathedral and Prague Castle.

Fantastic Interior – Mind the Crowds. This splendid cathedral is an eyeful, as long as you don't mind ping ponging through crowds of star struck tourists. Go early to avoid what nearly ruined our experience.

Splendid gothic masterpiece. Even if you don´t have time to go inside, just walk around, with your head up, and let your eyes admire all the filigrant details on the outer facade, dozens of tiny spires, statues etc. The front entry is massive, a real dominant. The side entry with the "golden gate" is an impressive mosaic work, that shines like sun even after all those years. Touch the medieval walls and enjoy the spirit of this place. http://www.katedralasvatehovita.cz/flash/virtualni_prohlidka/index.html This is virtual tour - if you just can´t get inside.
Beautiful church. You definitely have to buy a ticket for that church, it's really beautiful and reminded me of the church in Ken Follets "The Pillars of the Earth".

Stunning stained glass. This has a fascinating history, we saw it as part of a guided tour, which was certainly worthwhile. The quality of light created by the stained glass windows is amazing. It must be one of the best we have seen, worth visiting for this alone. The many monuments and chapels are also a delight to see.

Absolutely stunning!. Breathtaking! Well worth the ticket price to see the interior, especially the stained glass windows. Warning: I visited in February and it was freezing cold inside and out! Dress appropriately!
Gloomy inside and out.. St. Vitus is big and black on the outside and pretty gloomy inside. It's only virtue is the stained-glass, some of which is quite pleasing.
beautiful cathedral. one of the best cathedrals i have visited. stunning architecture, beautiful hill-top location with wonderful views of Prague and all set within Prague Castle.
One of my favorite!. Old and beautiful cathedral. Must see form inside as well. It's very well preserved. It's worth to buy a ticket and spend a little more time to see it.
Impressive. Must go if you visit Prague. Amazing cathedral and scene. No entrance fee, only if you want to visit the museum part of the cathedral. Can be busy with tourists!

Beautiful architecture. The church is part of the city tour that we took. The church has amazing architecture but there are parts that are closed and you should pay separately to be able to enter them.
Spectacular view. Beautiful view from the top. The Cathedral is also beautiful with some lovely mosaic up front. But nothing very different from the other cathedrals around Europe.

Awe inspiring. If you do nothing else in Prague, go and see St. Vitus Cathedral. From the moment you see it in the distance, the majesty of the place will be evident. Not only is the cathedral a mish-mash of architectural styles for those interested in such things, its age and historical value will have you looking up at its spires in awe.

Glorious! Way better than many others if you have to choose.. Not catholic or especially religious, but have a real appreciation for beauty? This is a "don't miss". The glass alone is mind boggling and beautiful beyond imagination, especially when the light is coming through. Rich history here, lots to read and see. If you are only seeing one cathedral in Prague, this would be it. If you are doing more, this will be the highlight. You don't need a tour to appreciate it.

Amazing. The church is in the Castle District--no charge to get in. However, if you want to do some closer exploring, you will need a ticket. (You may buy this as a combination ticket for the castle complex) I suggest a closer look at this church --it's spetacular
Just a little up!. Walked up on one of the free tours which is worth the effort. But the excellent trams go quite close if you are feeling too tired.

Historical building.. Like most cathedrals in Europe St Vitus Cathedral is worth a look if you are into Cathedrals. The building from the outside is impressive as well as inside and looks even better at night.
Stunning. Must see, despite all the tourists. Really beautiful place. Helps to have a guide or audio tour so that you'll know what is what.
Beautiful Cathedral. Sadly, seen just on the outside from the square together which it creates a magnificent atmosphere. Would love to see it next time!

Beautiful Stained Glass. We made a short trip through the cathedral as part of our walking city tour. The windows are very beautiful especially on a sunny day. We were there in early October and it was crowded. So a summer visit might be really crazy.

Great Pictures. This is a very neat structure but the stained glass is a bit odd in relation to the age of the site. You can enter for free but are restricted to an entrance area. No worries though, you can see everything worth seeing from the entrance. It's not worth paying for the short little walk around inside. I'd say the outside is more beautiful anyway.
Beautiful Church. This church is well worth the time to see. Very nice stained glasswork and beautiful alters. I can't believe how well preserved it all was.

worth a look. One of many lovely churches in Prague. Stunning and imposing from outside. We didn't pay to see more of it but I suppose it depends how much you like churches. See it if you go to Prague castle.
Magnificent. the cathedral is rich of history... the design is outstanding, i didnt have much time to look but what i took of this place will stay in my mind and heart forever

Amazing Gothic Architecture. If you stop by in Prague, it is quite difficult to miss St. Vitus Cathedral, as it is one of the largest and most prominent structures in the old city area. You do have to pay to enter deep into the cathedral, however going into the narthex area is free of charge, and highly recommended.
Nice for an afternoon.... It was a nice afternoon but nothing special, the Cathedral is okay and sourroundings have nice coffee shops...

Amazing!. Really beautiful place to visit, a MUST in your visit to Prague, I know it's the same style as a lot of other Cathedrals, however, each one of them are impressive. Great to take beautiful pictures and visit the other museums that are located in the castle.
Stunning. This is honestly one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. The windows are unbelievable, ornaments and sculptures as equally superb. Again another must see in Prague!
beautiful. such a beautiful place but a long que. also i wish you didnt have to buy the audio guide just to get basic information, ie names of statues etc
St. Vitus Cathedral. Stunning, don't miss a visit here. Going inside you will be amazed by the architecture and size of the building.

Evening if Cathedral lighted!. I recommend to visit Prague Castle also in the evening, when offering a beautiful view of evening Prague, and combine a walk with a dinner at the Lions Court at the Prague Castle. There is an amazing view of the Cathedral of St. Vitus. (on glazed patio). Unbelievable romance!
I recommend it!. We were in the 5 days and had a great vacations, very nice place to known, very good food around the place. The price is ok and you can take pictures without problems.

Fantastic - IF you can get in. This cathedral is magnificent!! But its reputation is also, so that on a good weekend the visitor line is l-o-n-g. We just skipped the cathedral and went instead up the 260+stairs to the top of the tower (no lines :) ) where the view of Prague is unbeatable. We then enjoyed lunch, and returned late in the afternoon - no lines!!By the way, you can enter the church without a ticket and look around, staying at the back of the church. The ticket is needed only to pass through to the rest of the church. This we did - and it was worth it. But - if there are no lines and you only want a peek, you can have that for free.

Castle & cathedral tour. Whether you arrive on foot or by vehicle,it is such a wonderful sight to see. The grounds are superb,the architecture is to be seen to be believed,the stained glass windows & inside of the cathedral are truly a sight to behold.

Masterpiece of the ages. If you visit Prague Castle area, then you should include St. Vitus cathedral. It is one of the most important cultural monuments of that area, and although truly monumental it is never imposing. You can spend a lot of time just taking in the many details of the building or admire the stained glass windows, reliefs, and art work.

1000 years of Prague History. This Cathedral must not be missed when you come to Prague. Its quiet an extraordinary sight to see. The sheer size of the cathedral is breathtaking. You can go in for free to a small section when you first walk in or by paying a few Czech Crowns, you can tour the entire Cathedral which is really worth the effort. Absolutely stunning.
Beautiful. Not happy that you have to pay extra to view the church, but that's the way many churches in Europe operate.
AMAZING. Located in the castle district, you must go and see the cathedral. It is staggering in its size and the interior and its stain glass windows are incredible.

Such exquisite architecture!. This is a must-see when you are in Prague. Beautiful gothic-designed cathedral. Very crowded. But you can always find a good spot to take a beautiful photo of the cathedral.

Cathedral in the heart of the castle grounds. A must see when visiting Prague, the cathedral is enclosed in the castle grounds, along with St Georges Basilica and Golden Lane. Fabulous views of Prague from here.

great. You cannot imagine the inside of this church until the moment you get in. The building by itself is amazing, the paintings, the vitraux, there are no words to describe it. One of the several wonders of this fantastic city.
St. Vitus Cathedral. Magnificent; not to be missed. The beauty and sense of centuries of history are astounding, and the cathedral is in the heart of more history on castle hill.

A beautiful Cathedral - stunning stained glass windows and an array if truly interesting Gargoyles.. For me the highlights of the beautiful St. Vitus Cathedral were the vibrant stained glass windows which flood the nave with a vast array of colors and the numerous exterior Gargoyles of dragons, demons, eagles and various people in torment among others. I wish we had visited on a sunny day - it would have been spectacular.
Must See. If you only do one thing it must be to visit the castle and St Vitus Cathedral and the associated buildings. Golden Lane is a little gem.

go early to avoid crowds, beautiful building. I'd say overall this was one of the coolest things that we saw in Prague. It is in the middle of the castle complex across the Charles bridge and high up on the hill. I would recommend going and doing this in the early morning as when we were there it was very crowded. There are many group tours inside so be careful to try and stay ahead of a group to ensure you see everything that you want. The architecture of the building is very striking and the building is very old. I thought the Cathedral was the best thing in the entire castle complex. Also I think there was an audio guide which we didn't get, I would have recommended it as we had no idea of the history of everything we were looking at.
Amaizing building. St. Vitus cathedral on Prague Castle is amaizing historical building with beautiful design, statue and other.

Beautiful. It was astonishing to see a medieval looking castle that was not completed until the 20th century. Beautiful. The guide gave good commentary about the stained glass windows, one done by the artist Mucha, which inspired me to go to the Mucha Museum.

An amazing place. This is a must for Prague... Please make sure you do the research prior to the visit, or hire a good tour... The church is a whole experience from the history standpoint, the different "timelines" and the influence of the soviets on the faith and the use of the church nowadays.,.
Historical place. A very nice place to visit if you are seeking for historical places. It is very quiet and we stayed inside for like 20 minutes.

1000 years of history. Inside the Prague Castle complex, St. Vitus is a fine example of gothic architecture. It has beautiful stained glass windows, tombs of the Hapsburgs and of St. John Nepomuk (crafted with 1,500 kilograms of silver). When inside, ask about the door that is locked with 7 keys.

Stunning Building. We walked up to the Castle and Cathedral over the Charles Bridge and up the hill passing by gift shops and cafe's. It was certainly worth the trek although we were very tempted to rent a Segway. We had a light lunch at the bottom of the final climb up to the castle followed by traditional plum cake which was delicious.After we had looked around we then walked up further to the Top of the Petrin Hill. Very enjoyable.

Superb Gothic cathedral. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to this gothic cathedral that has many references to the turbulent history of Prague. when we visited there was a choir practice and the early evening sun was lighting up the interior; it was magical. Particularly liked seeing the art nouveau stained glass windows by Alfons Mucha.
A must see. Wow. We spent a good hour or more just looking around. If you have seen Notre Dame and liked that, this is a must

Give yourself plenty of time. We had a tour guide who showed us all around the cathedral and there's just too much to talk about in one review. Make sure you see St Wenceslas Chapel and the Royal Mausoleum

Huge complex. With 10 separate buildings to explore this really is worth the trek to the top, it took us 25 mins from the old town square but we were not in any hurry as it was 17 degrees, there is something for everyone as well as the obligatory gift shops and cafe, get an ice cream, after the climb to the top you'll deserve it
Magnificent. You can get a reasonable view of the exterior from Petrin Tower but up close it is absolutely magnificent.

Very impressive - highly recommended!. This cathedral is definitely worth a visit. It's one of the most impressive I've ever seen.
There is even a Mucha stained glass window (third from the left) which is really amazing.

A must see. You can not miss it! great visit,
Paid one, but not expensive, you can buy a bundle of monuments!
Great history behind
Love the Variation in Windows!. From unbelievable stained glass at the helm of the church to the frescoes of the rear, walking through is a must!
Interesting history. We had a private guide and the stories she shared about history of St. Vitus were very interesting and the architecture is beautiful.
Incredible architecture. An amazing building, wonderful sense of age and history, would recommend a guided tour as local guides add so much to a visit.

297 Steps to the Top of the Tower. Work begun on the building of the cathedral in 1344 and took several centuries to complete. Although impressive there are more interesting churches nearby. The highlight was climbing the 96m tower which we did successfully but very slowly...................

St. Vitus Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral located in the grounds of Prague Castle is definitely worth a visit due to its history, its Gothic architectural style (on the exterior and the interior) and its intricate stained glass windows. The Cathedral is beautiful and definitely worth your admiration - if you visit there is the opportunity to take some beautiful photographs. However, personally, the cathedral would not be on the top of my things-to-visit-while-in-Prague list

Heaving with people. Having got to Prague this is billed as a must see. Personally I felt claustrophobic it was so busy, so I didn't stick about. It was good, but not being religious, I would say it was only ok. Great architecture, very impressive, preferred Petrin tower, old town,pubs,bridge, and museums in that order.

Dont bother paying. Located within the castle grounds, this cathedral is part free, but there are special areas that you need to pay.The best part is just seeing the castle from a distanceStill worth walking up for the views of Prague belowand to see the famous entry gates and St Vitrus Cathedral interiorNo need to labor over it and go through all the grounds etc.

Don't Miss It!. If you only have one day in Prague make sure you go to Castle Hill and see St. Vitus's Cathedral. There is a lot to take in, in just the cathedral alone. If you are visiting on your own, I recommend to go later in the day to avoid the tour groups. It is easier to see everything and is much quieter. Don't miss the Mucha windows, the rose window, the choir loft. Take your time, there is a lot to take in.

Very impressive architecture!. Beautiful cathedral. Took a long time to complete but worth it. The different periods and architects made their mark through marked by different coloured stones and statues.Good to go during thei period as it is not too crowded. The stained glass windows looked great and designed by different artists. I am amazed by the creativity behind this cathedral. A must visit with a guide boom or a local guide to hear the history!
Beautiful exterior. One of the more impressive cathedrals from the outside. I wasn't as impressed with the interior, but still worth a visit while in Prague.
impressive. Nice, beautiful, impressive, must see.. The only thing i would like to say is that St. Barbara Cathedral in Kutna Hora i liked more.

Beautiful cathedral, predictable crowds. This is a lovely gothic cathedral with some fantastic stained-glass windows. Very crowded, but I couldn't really expect anything else given that it's in the castle. It's a 'don't miss' for sure, especially if gothic ecclesiastic architecture is interesting for you.

500 years to build. This cathedral is well worth a visit and mostly it is free. In the castle complex it is too easy to overlook this building and it's contents. Get a good guide book or local guide (Tereza from Urban Avdentures is an expert) to fully appreciate what you see. Not everything is as old as it appears but it all is fascinating.

Pay to climb the bell tower stairs for fantastic 360 degree views. The cathedral is another beautiful European cathedral. The bell tower views, the best in Prague, make the 50 m climb worthwhile.The price is relatively expensive, but you do not need to climb any other towers in Prague.You need some fitness as the stairs seem to go on for some time.Be careful if over 190 cm tall as head clearance varies.Views are best with clear sunny conditions, especially for photographs.

Beautiful and varied stained glass windows. This is a beautiful cathedral with many unusual stained glass windows. It is worth taking a guide book with you with details of the windows as there is very little explanation of the windows inside the church. There is an audio tour which may be more helpful. You can enter the cathedral as part of a ticket which includes other areas of Prague castle. It seemed to me that it was free to just enter the cathedral but you had to have a ticket to go further inside and walk round the whole place.

Awesome cathedral. You cannot leave Prague without visiting this Gothic LCathedral with an Impresive altar, unique interior with impressive cut stained glass windows depicting Biblical scenes. When the sun shines on the windows one can appreciate the workmanship of the craftmen that made them. The architecture is very impressive. The entrance fee is worth the visit. Highly recommend a visit, worth the entrance fee.

Captivating Cathedral!. The architecture is amazing--so many interesting details, like fancy lace-work. The eye is immediately drawn to the impressive stained glass windows...Be sure to allow enough time--many tourists and locals come to see St. Vitus.
Go very early. I would make this my first stop as it just gets busier and more crowded as the day goes by. The windows themselves make this cathedral a major place to stop and spend an hour or so.
Chagall windows. This beautiful cathedral is a blend of new and gothic and is filled with admiring tourists.All the stained glass windows are amazing and the architecture is impressive.

Beautiful Cathedral. We have visited this Cathedral several times and still found it very interesting. You have to buy tickets to get inside but it was really worth the value.
