The only drawback was that there were too many tourists crowding inside and left you no time to slowly go through the internal buildups in a more detailed manner. Consider the Cathedral as a "must see" spot for tourists.
Cathedral. We visited a number of different churches in Prague and they were all very impressive. This one was very interesting and well worth a visit.

Part of the Prague experience. I'm not at all into religious buildings but have to admit that this place is stunning and well worth a half an hour or so walk around. You can buy tickets for the whole castle complex (to include the cathedrale) right across from the entrance. Well worth the time and energy if you're coming into Prague as a first time tourist and I'd be more than happy to go visit again in a year or two (or three).
A very unholy place.. Tickets, turnstiles, guards, no place to even say a prayer.Beautiful windows. A guy selling candles to light, but nowhere to kneel and give thanks.

Fantastic!. It is an unavoidable Must see in Prague. Not only that it attracts your attention when looking at the city from wherever you are, but it is something that will leave you speechless when you enter it. Buying ticket for a detail visit is highly recommended, though you may enter it for free and observe from he entrance door part.I was also impressed how long it is, and I'm still not sure if I liked better vitrage on windows or a ceiling.

Missed opportunity. St. Vitus is the cathedral on the hill you are looking at from the Charles Bridge. It is a massive cathedral and it is stunning! I am disappointed that I did not get to see much of it. We took a walking tour to the Castle quarter. Our guide brought us inside to the foyer but told us we could not look around, as that would cost an extra admission fee and even if we wanted to purchase tickets, there was no time to see the cathedral. Following the tour, I went back to see if I could get in the cathedral but it was closed for the evening. It was still daylight and it was closed. I think it was about 6pm. Anyway, disappointed we did not get to see the whole thing, as it looked quite beautiful.

What a cathedral!!!. I have seen some of the worlds greatest cathedrals but this is easily in my top 3. The scale is vast the details are incredible and the stained glass is some of the best I have ever seen. This cathedral was only finished less than 100 years ago but you would not guess from the attention to detail applied throughout. This is an absolute must see if you are in Prague

Breathtaking!!. We visited St Vitus Cathedral on our trip round Prague Castle and was absolutely amazed by it. The sheer size of it is awesome but once you get inside its even better. The statues are amazing! I didn't want to leave.We did not go on a Tour, just me and my husband and we loved it.Have got to visit, definitely do not miss.

A must visit when in Prague. The St. Vitus Cathedral is an amazing site to visit, the history and beauty of the building is amazing. If you are going to visit only one Cathedral while in Prague this is the one. Well worth the ticket price to the Prague Castle.
Beautiful-you must see this while in Prague. It took us three attempts to find it open but it was so worth it-absolutely gorgeous. One of my favorite places we visited. The ceiling is a work of art.

Stunning cathedral. This cathedral is definitely one of Prague's most visited attractions, so expect long lines and crowds. Everyone can visit the front interior of the cathedral, but you need to buy a ticket to visit the rest. I recommend buying the ticket as the cathedral is a beautiful sight to see, full of history, and one of Prague's treasures.

Beautiful. This was a beautiful place. They have daily mass every morning. I did not get to attend, but they say it is in Czech and Latin. The detail is amazing and the guards are outside the castle. The changing of the guard is does not compare to the others that I have seen, but it is ok.

Vast and beautiful. Lovely cathedral, full of history, wonderful stained glass, one window by Mucha.
Downside, is very crowded.
Castle sights. a must see at the castle! better to have a look in the afternoon because there are queues at first opening from tours visiting.

Breathtaking!. Must-visit while touring the immense Prague Castle. The stained glass windows are beautiful - one panel is even credited to Mucha. If you would like to explore the cathedral or take the stairs to the top, a payment must be made - otherwise, visiting is free of charge!

Beautiful. A little tedious to walk around, we were with a guided tour, lots of them around.
Great for taking some scenic pictures, history and cultured throughout.
Would go again
magnificient church. Got red sport car to castle and went straight to the chuch.some Hugh building with long windows. Well worth a visit

Beautiful cathedral. The castle hill area of Prague is something you have to see, but one of the things I was interested in as well was the Mucha museums. When I heard that Mucha did one of the St Vitus stained glass windows, I had to make sure and see that when I went to the castle hill. It was beautiful! I am so glad that I got to see that.When you get into the castle grounds, make sure you get a tour ticket. There are different options for the tours. You can go into the cathedral without a ticket, but you can't go around the sides and get near the stained glass windows or see some of the other unique aspects of the cathedral. There are many amazing artistic monuments and old alcoves that are beautiful to see.

The most impressive of Praha castle. The most crowded attractions in Praha Castle and definitely the most impressive.Those without tickets could only visit the front section of the interior of the church. Would recommend getting a ticket as it allows you to see more without that much crowd.Though it was drizzling in the morning and late afternoon, most of the attractions are indoors and hence, not too bad to spend your day here even if it is drizzling.

A grand experience. You can enter the cathedral free of charge, but to fully explore every corner of this grand Gothic building, you need to buy a ticket (250 Czech Korunas). It's definitely worth getting a ticket if you want to appreciate the stained glass windows, mosaics and sculptures inside. You can also take a peek at the St Wenceslas Chapel through a small doorway.
Must see at night. I actually did not see the inside of this cathedral because we only visited the castle area at night. This cathedral is absolutely stunning lit up at night.
St. Vitus. Beautiful cathedral, but wish we had more access to the different parts of the cathedral, crypt, etc.

Impressive exterior. The entire church is wonderful, but there isn't anything like the exterior of this church. It's ominous and almost haunted looking. I've been several times, and really enjoyed spending more time outside this last time. Look up all the way around. The gargoyles are amazing.
Gorgeous Cathedral. great to visit in day light and at night. Inside art is spectacular and blows your mind. highly recommended

Amazing. Amazing architecture. GORGEOUS stained glass. Breathtaking. Take the time and visit this cathedral. It's in the palace section, offering a lot of historic site seeing. Get a head set for the cathedral. There is SO much to see, that having the guidance and knowledge about WHAT you are looking at really helps.

Impressive but pricey. Contrary to the views expressed by previous reviewers you cannot get past the first step without paying and the doormen are less than friendly! I really resent paying to enter a place of worship so I waited until the evening when I could attend Sunday Vespers.The building is, of course, mighty impressive, both inside and out and can be a bit overwhelming. So it pays to sit quietly for a while to feel the atmosphere and to reflect on what has happened there over the centuries. If you just go in and out you will feel slightly bludgeoned and merely, like a previous reviewer, just have another tick on the "seen that" list which would be a shame.

Beautiful cathedral but amazing view at south tower. This cathedral is beautiful and one of the must sees in Prague. There's a fee to go deep into the cathedral but it's free if you're okay to hang around the outer area. There's also a south tower you can climb up to and have amazing view of the city. I highly recommend it if you can walk 280 steps of a spiral staircase. It's definitely not for ones who have knee problems. But if you can make it up you'll know what i mean. One of the most beautiful view of the city!

A tough climb up to the Castle but worth it.. The cathedral is at the centre of the castle complex and worth seeing for the stained glass windows (no charge unless you want a detailed tour). There are superb views across the city.
Breath-taking. This is really great cathedral, looking from outside or coming in. You really need to take timeand go inside to see the beauty of the cathedral itself. It is really mind-blowing.

Another gloomy baroque cathedral. Fine if you are into heavy, baroque cathedrals with all that entails. Of its genre, it's architecturally impressive, having been extended over the centuries. Similar to Cologne Cathedral. Worth a tick in the "done that" box, but I wouldn't rush back.
Beautiful but you have to pay. You can go into the cathedral but you cannot go very far in unless you pay. I found that kind of tacky.

Cathedral at the castle area. It is free to go in and just have a look up to a certain point, but it is really worth to pay and have the chance to really visit ALL OF THIS MAGNIFICENT CATHEDRAL.It is also worth visiting when it is dark as it is very beautifully illuminated.

Spectacular Cathedral in Prague. St. Vitus Cathedral is the dominant visual feature of Prague Castle, as you view it on its hilltop from the city proper. It is a stunning sight when viewed in close quarters, and it's sheer size is overwhelming. It is certainly one of the largest cathedrals in Europe. The cathedral was built over the course of over 600 years, starting at the altar end, and you can visualize the different eras as you view it from the side. The Rosetta window on the rear of the building is kaleidoscope-like, with many stained glass panels. If you're visiting Prague Castle, this visually striking building will certainly be a part of your visit.

Another church, more tributes to God. One wonders how people sacrificed so much to build glorious structures for their religion but they did. The buildings are beautiful. The relics in the museum, not my passion for sure.

It may bigger than Windsor but is not really one castle.... Fantastic place, with surrounding and views to match. The gardens are lovely and surprisingly peaceful - have an icecream in summmer and enjoy the views over Prague!
Superb. This is a part of the castle complex. it is a must see fpr yourself building. Everything about this complex is stunning

Gargoyles. I previously put St Vitus into my Prague Castle review where I should have left if for it's own review so this will be a bit of a repeat. I LOVE Gargoyles and I just took picture after picture of this Cathedral as they are all over it. The Cathedral should not be missed in my opinion, probably as I just love these real old Gothic buildings. Inside was great but it was the outside that caught my attention.

Stunning Cathedral and View. It is quite the hike up the hill to get to the Prague Castle the way we went, but it made the views of the city so worth it. The Cathedral is simply breathtaking, photos just don't do it justice. I sat on a bench and just basked in its wonder for a solid hour. Portion out at least two hours for this spot, but you can easily turn this, the castle and Petrin Hill into a full day excursion full of walking, stair climbing and magnificent views.

A must even for heathens like me... I am not religious but this was breath-taking, it is jaw dropping when you first go inside. The architecture is stunning, the stained glass was spectacular particularly on a sunny day.Well worth the walk up the hill to see it.

A magnificent architectural gem. From the entrance of the castle grounds, this gothic cathedral already imposes with its intricate facade seemingly framed deliberately by an large arch which pierces through one of the castle ground walls. I was immediately assaulted by the massive and distinct stained glass windows that flank the long cathedral corridors. We were told by our guide that none of these windows are alike. You don't even have to be Catholic to appreciate the passion that went into such pieces of art.The exterior is equally impressive with its mosaic and intricate grill work. Our guide also told us that different sections of the church were done in different architectural styles. Given the size of the grounds, it's easy to view the entire length of the cathedral appreciate it for the magnificent architectural gem that it is.

Magnificent Cathedral. I can't recall a more awe-inspiring cathedral. Although parts of it are visible from many locations it definitely warrants a dedicated visit. You can enter freely to get a taste of the inside but to proceed further you need to buy a ticket. The exterior is definitely the winner!

Magnificent cathedral. A magnificent Gothic Catholic Cathedral both from inside and outside. The outside pleases with its Gothic spires and towers (you can climb up the tower steps if you wish) and inside has intricate lead light windows and the beautiful rose window. Very well worth a visit... St Vitas is within the Prague Castle complex.

Chapel of the Holy Cross, Treasure of St. Vitus Cathedral. There is lots to see within the boundaries of Prague Castle. One spot easily missed is the Chapel of Holy Cross. It is not connected to St. Vitus, but rather located in a separate building closer to the ticket office. For me it was the highlight of our tour amongst some amazing sites, history, and artwork on the Prague Castle grounds. It is a proverbial "don't miss" for Christians and especially Catholics. It contains some amazing religious objects and art. Included are relics such as a fragment of Christ's loincloth and a segment of the tablecloth from the Last Supper. There is a fee of 300 CZK but it is well worth it.

Walking up the Tower is a must. To my surprise the best part of visiting the cathedral is climbing the clock tower. Do not try this if you are not in decent shape as it is about 250 steps with little rest. If you make it the view is amazing and provides the best photo opportunities in Prague. The clock also runs from the top of the tower which is an engineering marvel.
Impressive windows. Well worth a visit with extremely colourful windows. This is a large cathedral and likely to be very crowded upon entering but that shouldn't spoil the sights.
Vast.. Well. This is such a great place. I am not a fan or organised religion, or disorganised religion come to that. However this is an excellent sight to behold. Would recommend highly.

Interesting must see. This is a very big church located in the castle district and is within the firewalls of the castle. The interior is nice and is a gothic style church. It is an example of good architecture. Must see

Oh What a Beautiful Cathedral. Perhaps one of the most magnificent cathedrals in all ofEurope (and one of the oldest). There is a good deal of walkinginvolved but well worth. Very close to the Prague Castle/Lobkowicz Palace.
Stunning. It's hard to take in the beauty of this Cathedral and impossible to capture it in pictures - by far my favorite part of Prague Castle.
Amazing Architecture!. A must see in Prague! This is a GIANT Cathedral within the walls of the Castle at one of the highest points in Prague! The views are incredible and is must see for EVERYONE!!!

Prettiest church we saw. We were going to buy tickets to the castle sites but based on other reviews, we first went in to St Vitus and felt we could see enough so ended up just walking around the castle grounds. Lots of people! I think the noon changing of the guard is overrated, very hard to see. We later realized they march right down the main street which is easy to see. Restroom across from info center was clean.

Nice view over Prague from the tower. It's overall a nice cathedral, providing a nice view over the city from the tower. The tax can be paid at the entrance, which is located on the right side of the cathedral. Climbing the tower is done on a double-way spiral staircase, barely wide-enough for tho people, and quite long. All-in all it's worth climbing, plus the entrance fee included a medal souvenir. Regarding the interior of the cathedral, I cannot say I found something that moved me, just a regular "grand cathedral".

Gothic beauty. You can see the cathedral from any point in the city! And you cannot imagine the beauty of it until you stand small and insignificant beside it. Standing still over the centuries, it shows its Gothic beauty to everyone that ones to see. Stunning, beautiful, enormous, simply unbelievable.

Impressive Cathedral. Visited the St. Vitus Cathedral and was amazed at the stained glass windows throughout the building. The artist Mucha designed many of the panels in the cathedral. I purchased a Prague card once I arrived at the airport and St. Vitus Cathedral was a free entry with the card. St. Vitus Cathedral is part of the Prague Castle circle tour which also gives you access to St.Georges Basilica, The Golden Lane and Daliborka Tower. The pipe organ was impressive though I didn't get to hear it being played. Wished I had paid to see the Treasures of St. Vitus Cathedral at the time. I later visited Karlstejn Castle and learned that the original Charles IV crown was in the St. Vitus cathedral now. It was a beautiful Gothic building but I was a little more impressed with St. Nicholas church or the Holy Cross chapel at Karlstejn Castle.
beautiful. Simply stunning. Free to enter but you can upgrade to get a better view. Its a must see in Prague Castle

Hugh Gothic Church. The church which is located on the castle grounds is very impressive both inside and out and is a great example of Gothic Architecture. We were told it is the largest and most important church in the Czech Republic. Free admission .
excellent interiors. Must see places in the castle district. The glass work & the church interiors are mindblowing. This was part of the circuit b castle tour and the only place worth visiting.

Impressive. Probably more interesting to look at from the outside than the inside. The cathedral has some nice stained glass windows and an impressive vaulted roof but the inside seems a little plain after the exuberant outside.
Definitely a must. Probably the most impressive building in Prague from outside and the inside does not fall too far. A must see in Prague
Very unique. Not the cookie-cutter cathedral. Stained glass of varied character, including panel by Mucha. Amazing yes amazing medieval crypts.

Brilliant - pay extra for the bell tower. The inside of the cathedral is stunning. Buy a ticket otherwise all you can do is stand by the back of the cathedral and you miss a lot. With a ticket you get access down both sides of the cathedral, behind the alter, see the stunning organ, plus various side chapels and monuments.But one of the hidden gems is paying extra to climb the bell tower. The access is from outside the cathedral, but be warned out is a long, long spiral stair case ascent. The 360 degree view is definitely worth it.
Amazing. Wonderful architecture and artifacts. Beautiful cathedral even to non-religious people. Worth a trip.

Book with the official guided tour provided. As independent travellers we generally make out own way around attractions. However we booked a guided tour with the Prague castle directly from their website rather than with one of the more expensive guided tours that include lots of other sites. We found the guide very informative and the official tour included a visit to the crypt as well. The whole tour only took an hour but was well worthwhile

Great gothic architecture. A fabulous cathedral in the heart of Prague castle. Great gothic architecture with reminders of the medieval days.The stained glass windows are adorable, the architecture and artifacts stunning and it is surprisingly not too busy, fabulous for great photo opportunities.

Take your time here. Went here with a tour guide but found he was to fast and in a hurry so went back the next day and took my time, it's a fantastic place and the views from the viewing platform are out of this world, the architecture is stunning and well worth the visit, take your time and you will really enjoy it

Prague Attraction and Benjamin Tours. St Vitus Cathedral is part of the Prague Castle and is such a remarkable attraction to visit. Filled with history your visit to this wondrous site is a must whenever in visit Prague. The numerous lead lined stained glass windows depicts stories of the past.Our visit to Prague and the Castle and St Vitus Cathedral was organised by Karolina of Benjamin Tours (www.Benjamintours,cz) during our 5 day Prague Tour during July 2014.and I must say how impressed we were with the service we received from Karolina as she organised everything on our behalf.I can recommend Karolina to all .

187 stairs!. Climbed the 187 stairs to the viewing area of this belltower and it was certainly worth the effort. Amazing views of the city and surrounding areas as well as along the river, Charles Bridge etc.Fabulous.
A place worth visiting. Great place to know about medieval Europe.. Architecture is just mind blowing. You must have a guide along who is not in hurry all the times.
breathtaking. Compares favourably with any cathedral I have seen in Europe. The stain glass windows are the most beautiful and colourful I have seen
A massive Church. It's worth checking out for the art alone, the structure is stunning both inside and out. Take a stroll over to Prague Castle.
Really really big. and really really impressive too. A magnificent cathedral filled with history and magnificent artifacts. Lots of history.
Stunning cathedral. This gothic Cathedral is even more beautiful inside than outside! The medieval mosaic above the old entrance is unbelievable!
Take the tour.. This a good example of Czeck gothic. It is very impressive. Do take the guided tour, it is worthwhile for the explanations and to see the crypt.
A lot to see. This is the most time intense of the sights at Prague Castle. Visit late in the day for fewer crowds.
A Very Impressice Church. The outside of this church is very spectacular from all directions. The inside is also very impressive and the grounds to the church and castle are beautiful.

Not for a church visit. Full of tourists for this very un churchy cathedral. Unable to sit & pray with security guards not guides. Windows are interesting, some are painted glass not stained glass. Some nice carvings which have survived various occupations of the Nazi's & soviet rule.
Beautiful. It's really big, and -really- beautiful! You have to see, since words just can't describe the magnitude of this place!

Gorgeous, Inside and Out. It's a pretty good climb (unless you take a bus) but this majestic cathedral, which dominates the entire city from its position high above the river, is truly breathtaking (although very difficult to capture on film).

Pay for entry so you can see the whole building. Busy place. Probably the best time to go is on a rainy day...then you see the gargoyle spouts gushing water. Really take note of the Mucha window. (There's also a great Mucha museum in town.) Actually, pay the 350CZK entry to see most of the palaces, museums, churches that are open to the public in the castle district...make it a whole day affair. Ask about how to see the crypt. It wasn't open to me when I went but I did notice a tour group go down. You can't see a lot of the neat features from the "free area". Lot of good photo opportunities. (50CZK camera pass good for all areas)

Stunning. Buy the ticket and do the full tour of the church. It is an amazing and beautiful cathedral. I took the most fantastic pictures. A must see in Prague.
ps- its .5 euro to use the WC (I'm not kidding)
St Vitus Cathedral. Excellent architecture dominating the skyline of Prague. Definitely one of the things not to be missed while in prague. Take a tram to the hill. on the way its an easier walk.
Beautiful stained glass. Another must-see in Prague. The interior is beautiful and worth the admission price. As you would expect, it can be crowded - go in the afternoon after the morning rush.

Huge Cathedral. This was worth climbing up all the steps to get to the castle area. The Cathedral is magnificent, the glass is beautiful especially when the sun bursts through. It was pretty crowded when I went but I could still see everything I wanted to see.Afterwards, for a rest, I walked up past the Foreign Ministry (Nice Building) to a small monastery and rested there - so peaceful.

A cathedral worth visiting. St Vitus Cathedral is situated inside the Prague Castle, It is magnificent in every way. The main dome is the one that dominates the skyline wherever you are in city of Prague!St. Vitus Cathedral is a Gothic masterpiece, and the spiritual symbol of the Czech state. One the main features are the stain glass painted by famous Czeck Art Noveau artists.

Fantastic!. This is one of the world's great cathedrals, amazingly beautiful inside and out. Be sure to have a good guide book so you better understand what you are looking at, and you won't miss the most interesting features. There is so much to see, that you can easily spend a lot of time here. The only negative is that there is no place to sit (all pews roped off) -- I am very fond of cathedrals, and I love to spend time contemplating them.If possible, visit when it is sunny, so the gorgeous stained glass windows are at their best. The Mucha window is particularly amazing. Don't miss the exterior, with its gargoyles and its beautiful mosaic entrance.

Long lines to Enter. If you are here for the changing of the guard at noon, which you need to arrive an hour early for (11:00 to get a good spot), head for the entrance as fast as possible after the guard ceremony is over as you will have hundreds of people on your tail to get in line to enter. Watch the guard close to the archway and duck thru it immediately after the ceremony for the cathedral entrance. Look at the outside of the cathedral after going through the inside.

A work of art.... ...not just an attraction. Easily the best cathedral I visited in Europe. Took the free tour with a group (getting history and other information) the first day and came back a couple of days later for the paid self-guided one, which is definitely the way to go, as you have far less people in front of, next to, and behind you and can see far more of artwork and structure itself. By going on your own (instead of with a group) lets you move at your own pace; read up about it before and you can just take it all in.

Bright Gothic grand cathedral part of quick Palace tour. One everyone's must see list, so we paid our respects. Had read a bit, so skipped the audio guides. We took a taxi right up to the main square in front of the Palace from Old Town Square for less than K600. Purchased a main attractions ticket, K250 for two over 65 people. Also saw the Old Royal Palace, St.George's Basilica and the Golden Lane. Was not much more than an hour. Skipping the Golden Lane would be OK. Long walk down hill to the Metro.
GLORIOUS CATHEDRAL. I liked the sontousity of the cathedral. I disliked not to be able to see all the chapels unless you pay for the visit.
Don't go on a Sunday. You can only visit the outside since there are service going on inside. Very grand gothic cathedral. Since it's in the Prague castle complex you can visit other buildings.

The stained windows are outstanding and worth the admission. We had a cursory walkthrough on the outside of the church, but went back to spend some time inside to see these legendary stained glass windows and the size of the cathedral itself. A masterpiece and worth waiting in the queue to get in.

If you are not going, why going to Prague?. there are so many churches in Europe, but this is one of the most beautiful. You have to get a ticket to check the interior design, the windows are gorgeous and fascinating...

Awesome!. Words can't really describe the sheer size and magnificence of this cathedral. Even trying to capture pictures of it, it's almost impossible to capture the size and magnitude of what you're seeing in person.
Gorgeous cathedral. A must see when in Prague. Full of beautiful art and statues. Great for history buffs. The exterior is beautiful.
Lovely Church. This church is situated on high and can be seen once you enter center Prague. It is undergoing touch ups but the church is very beautiful.

Don't miss the Treasures. It's a separate ticket, but well worth it as there are amazing works of art in the chapel. Crosses, altar pieces, reliquaries - unbelievably beautiful and you don't need to be a religious person to appreciate them.

beautiful. worth to go, not many tourist group go into the pay area, you can take time, wont feel crowd.
the colour windows were really beautiful!

See the stained glass. Some excellent modern stained glass as you enter. A ticket gets you right inside where you see some of the elaborate gold and silver objects that are really over the top indulgence.

A Beautiful Gothic Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral is a great example of Gothic architecture. It is located in the center of the Prague Castle (which isn't really a castle, but the offices of the Czech government). While you have to buy a ticket to see the entire cathedral, you can see much of it for free (which I would recommend).
a gem!. its a gem on the hills... if you ever go to Prague you can't miss this church... the best part is looking at the different "layers" from the years that have past after the construction

Buy a ticket skip the crowds. Must see. Buy a ticket to skip the crowds. Take in both halves of the church!
The Mucha window is amazing. The silver tomb is amazing. And there is just so much to see.
Magnificent cathedral. This is a magnificent site! Worth the visit while at the Prague Castle. There's a minimal entry fee for the basic tour.
Beautiful. If you like history and architecture, don't miss it! This cathedral is something to see and you'll regret it if you don't go.

Gothic beauty inside and out. Went with my 22 year old daughter for a weekend and had a lovely half and hour walking round the cathedral, very beautiful stained glass windows and interesting architecture. Worth buying the multi ticket including castle and golden lane

Must visit. This is a must for visiting Prague, the beauty of the windows is breath taking.Take the 2 hour tour ticket, it 250 kronen, around $12 per person.It will take you a day to go around, after the golden street don't exit immediately, but go out to the terrace for a unbelievable view of Prague.Take tram line 22, stop right in front.Day ticket public transportation 110 kronen,$ 5.
Magnificent!. My outside pic of this stunning cathedral may serve as my official "canvas" photo of Prague trip. Worth the trip to Prague Castle!

Worth the fee.... Paying to go to top of St. Vitus tower. 297 steps to get the 300 ft high view but ever so worth it. Great photo opportunity. Also, it gives you an excellent over view of the castle grounds. You grt close up view of the roof/spires. Spend the $$ and enjoy!!

Impressive & Inspiring. It's worth the money spent to visit the cathedral.The architecture is awe inspiring.I took the audio guide which was nice but a little too lengthy. It was wonderful seeing newly weds posing for pictures in the backdrop.It's a 'must do' on any trip to Prague.
Amazing building. This Catedral is very monumental.I wonder how it would looklike with at sandstone cleaned. Shuld be then a biright sport atracting eyes.
Must have!. So big, so gloomy! I was shoked to find small signs of the zodiak on the gates of the Catolic Cathedral!

Gargoyles. I love cathedrals so may be a bit biased with the review. However, if you like wonderful stained glass windows then you'll like this cathedral. And look out for the wonderful gargoyles that adorn the outside of the building.It's a very large building and difficult to photograph. Try going to the back - outside - and you'll get a lovely overview of the intricacy of the building and manage to get a good shot.

Impressive Edifice. We paid 100ck extra and had a guide to show us around and it was well worth it because not only was she extremely knowlegable but we got to go into the crypt. Of the thousands of visitors who go to the Cathedral it is only the few who pay for one of the castle guides that get to do this. We felt extremely lucky to be given that chance as we didn't expect it when we paid our fee.A definite must for a visit to Prague.
A great place. A really nice cathedral, a must see. It is definitely worth paying the entrance fee to see the whole cathedral

Beautiful. We bought a combined ticket with other sites in the Castle. Inside St Vitus, this gets you around the sides and to the back of the church - you cannot get here unless you pay (not sure if you can pay inside the church or if you must get a ticket at one of the outside ticket locations). And you really, really, need to walk all the way through the church. The stained glass is lovely, the silver tomb is amazing, as is the St Wenceslas chapel. If you don't purchase a ticket, you will only be able to look at the central nave from the very back. We had the audio guide, and it helped for a few things here as there were no written guides inside the church as there were inside the other sites. As with any audio guide, it may be more info that what you want, but you can turn it off; at least it's something. On a weekend, it seems to be busy all day; Sunday there were fewer folks after about 1pm. Beware, they've closed off the pews so you can't sit and admire. There is a WC just outside - all castle WC's are 10 crowns to get in.
awesome structure.... Plan to spend a lot of time in the cathedral....so much history and architectural design to appreciate

A Beautiful House of Worship. Like many European churches, St. Vitus overwhelms with the magnificence of its art. Carved iconography is especially lovely in a setting ablaze with crystal and golden ornamentation.

Experience iron-clad Communist thought and action first-hand!. Prague Castle is must-not-miss sight and the "Level B" ticket will allow you to see more than enough great sights.IF you'd like to experience a hold-over of the absolute authoritarianism one expects of Communism enter using your ticket, enjoy the sights thoroughly (and you will). At the exit take ONE-HALF step beyond the exit and then step back! The reaction of the guards is COM(munist)ICAL! It won't matter that they've seen you exit or that you have a ticket!

Don't miss it. Part of the castle complex, the cathedral has soaring ceilings and wonderful glass including a fabulous window by Alphonse Mucha. We would suggest going early or late to miss the hordes of coach parties if you can.

Be advised. This is a beautiful church, unique in it's way like many Cathedrals are. The signature of the French architect is clearly visible. Also, many important Czechs are buried inside, like Emperors, Saints, Dukes, Kings&Queens etc. etc., making it a very important site for the people.You can enter the front part for free, for the rest you need a ticket. Be sure to know that inside there is no information, so you don't know what you're looking at. Also, when you buy a ticket, sometimes they simply seal off half the cathedral to install lights or something, while not telling you when you purchase the ticket. It feels somewhat like a tourist trap this way, to really try to squeeze more money out of people.

Amazing Cathedral. The San Vito cathedral is one of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. Each detail of the outside construction and the inside, wow, you have to be there to realize what it really is.
one of Europe's finest churches. Visiting this church was a very meaningful experience. It was well preserved and contains many works of art.

Worth a visit. Pay extra and get a guide - this will get you into the places the other tourists don't see. It costs about 3 Euros and worth every penny. There is a lot to see. Very few cafes around. One nearby has a panoramic view.
Perfect Prague. This wonderful architecture has you spell bound. How on earth did they mange this so many years ago.

beautiful stained glass windows. Not all churches are the same and this one is one of the most beautiful in the world. You can see most of the church free, paying the extra fee gets you closer adn to the back of the church. Well worth the money.

Beautiful Gothic church. This church is a part of huge Prague castle complex. You can access the castle from two ways; from the Malostranska station and from St. Nicolas church. There is no admission fee as well.
GOTHIC JEWEL. This cathedral located in the area of Prague Castle is a real Gothic jewel. You feel so small inside the cathedral.

Incredible architecture. If that is your sort of thing then it should be on your top 5 to-do list in Prague. It's stunning.It's a 30-40 minute walk from Old Town or a 10 minute tram ride. We decided to walk, but for older people I wouldn't recommend it due to the cathedral being situated at the top of a very large hill.

Amazing cathedral. One of the most beautiful churches I ever seen. Unbelievable architecture, very old cathedral showing the history and the culture of the bohemian empire.Arrange to visit specific church by the time you will visit the castle of Prague.

A very beautiful church. It is a very beautiful church but when we where there was construction going on. We went in with lots of other tourist and we enjoyed and liked what we saw. Lots of beautiful altars and other work of art. A must see when visiting the castle for it is on the way of other sights to see in Prague.

Gorgeous Gothic within Prague Castle Grounds. The St. Vitus Cathedral is an absolutely stunning work of Gothic beauty. Every inch drips with décor and detail. Waiting in line outside affords time to marvel at the exterior workmanship, complete with gargoyles and carvings. The interior abounds with beauty beyond sufficient words. One can spend hours poring over the stained glass alone, alas if you tire quickly of crowds this is not the ideal place for you. Even in shoulder season during a weekday we were jostled about by multitudes of people visiting the cathedral. It is hard to fathom the scene during high season! Go early to avoid crowds and get the most of your visit.

Busy but Beautiful. Beautiful statuary and paintings at every turn, but very busy in high season, of course. Try to visit late in the afternoon as most of the tour groups seem to descend mid-morning but are gone by lunch.
European holiday. This is part of the Prague castle is a must to visit. Extremly beautiful stain glass.very easy to walk around.
must visit the castle. Part of the castle site this is just one of a number of amazing and lovely buildings that must be visited when in Prague.

see the Gothic. we bought the family ticket so we went to see almost every place which connected to the Hapsburg family in this location. of course the main important place is the St.Vitus Cathedral which is really amazing but still it is not the Nostradams

one of my two favorite cathedrals. I have been to many world famous cathedrals and temples from Norte dame, to the pink duomo, to blue mosque and hagia sofia, to St. Peter's basilica, st vitus is the most beautiful cathedral for me; and one of my two favorite (the other one being the basilica of Saint Anthony in Padova, veneto for very personal reason) its stained glass is most astonishing, esp in the after sunlight. it is not overly big, or pretentious. it is simply beautiful. Prague is a lovely city - small, accessible, totally walkable. spend a long weekend there, you'll love it.
Not really marvel to see. I mean compared to Florence or Milano Duomo its not so interesting to see. The worst part is that there are no directions or signs in English....except for some.
Beautiful!. If you are interested in architecture, don't miss St. Vitus Cathedral. It was absolutely stunning! The glasswork will take your breath away. Crowded in August, but worth the stop.
Breathtaking!. This gothic cathedral is absolutely stunning and all the area around Prague castle is definitely worth for climbing up the hill!

Impressionable Cathedral. 14th Century Catholic cathedral, not finished until the early 20th century; amazing gothic exterior with memorable interior appointments executed by several different contributors. Interesting small differences between old and "new" .
Spectacular. Beatuiful chapels and architecture. Not enough seating as you went round as all pews cordoned off. Too much walking for those with difficulty.

check it out while you're in the Prague Castle area. This cathedral is located within the Prague Castle area. The lines are huge, but they move quickly. Parts of the cathedral are ancient, while other parts were completed relatively recently (early 20th century).

Beautiful but not necessary to pay. The stained glass windows in particular were stunning, but unless you are really interested in the details or have an audioguide, I would not recommend paying to enter it. There is a big open section before the pews start where you can gather and view the entire church - there is a gate but no walls or anything blocking your view. If you pay to enter and you don't have an audioguide, you just get to do a loop around the outer perimeter and get a little closer to the alter. I did not gain anything extra from this experience.
Beautiful Achitecture. Beautiful Cathedral and a must see if one chooses to visit Prague Castle. A mixture of Gothic achitecture and Christian Religion all in one!
Part of the Prague Castle. Through our tour guide we found out interesting tidbits about the Cathedral - like the entrance part is a lot newer than the nave area and why.
Historical. Could not get over the size and beauty of this place - and the craftmanship. If you are wanting peace and tranquillity in this area you will be disappointed as hordes of tourists.

Just another cathedral, but find the Mucha window!. We have visited many cathedrals and St Vitus is a good one. But we really wanted to see the stunning Mucha window. It is possible to see most of the window from the "free" section, but we couldn't find a good picture of it in the shop - where it seems to have a low profile.Don't know why this is . . . .

Stunning at Night. I saw the cathedral in the evening, and just walked around the exterior. It was really beautiful, and such a grand size. I feel like I am over churches, but the size and detail of this one made it worthwhile.

Amazing. This was amazing! I'm sure I bored my friends and family gushing about the amazing intricacy of this cathedral. It's insane. If you're in Prague, you should definitely stop by. It's absolutely stunning.

MOST BEAUTIFUL STAINED GLASS!. The exterior is covered in gothic adornment, with a creative and amazing variety of animal-themed gargoyls that are fun to spot and identify. The interior has the most colorful stained glass I've ever seen! More so than Ste. Chapelle in Paris!! Done by famed master-artist Alphonse Mucha, the color in the glass is vivid and fluid, magenta and turquose and purple and ruby red and orange and marigold and blue and violet. Absolutely stunning. And the imagery are painting-quality, telling stories, with lots of movement and fantastic composition! Seriously. I've seen about 30 churches and cathedrals and basilicas in Europe. It will be hard to match the level of artistry in this one. It's worth the climb to Castle to see this cathedral. A MUST SEE if you love color, if you love MUCHA or stained glass!

Elaborate. Churches probably don't do it for me - they always seem too elaborate and overdeveloped. But if that is your 'thing' then don't miss St Vitus! Both the exterior and the interior are perhaps the most elaborate that we've seen anywhere and on many occasions prompted the 'I wonder how they did that' thought!!Pros: Elaborate, no shortage of themed historical exhibits, free entry with Prague Castle ticket, easy access and no queue when we entered around midday. Cons: Perhaps too many people (always unpleasant for me), apparent lack of 'free' information (even a short single page summary would be nice).If churches are your scene then don't miss St Vitus' it's truely elaborate!!

Lovely cathedra in the Castle area. The Cathedral had Magnificent stained glass windows and the whole castle area was interesting. The castle is still used as a seat of government and has blue uniformed sentries posted outside - great for photographs. We had taken a wrong direction when wandering around Prague by ourselves and eventually took a Martin's Historical tour which gave us an interesting commentary on many of the buildings and time off the bus to explore the castle area. It lasted 2 hours and was well worth the 390kc

beautiful cathedral, especially at night. Perched on the hill overlooking the city in the Prague castle complex, St Vitus is certainly impressive, especially at night, with the lights on, the full moon shining ... and most of the crowds gone. I confess I have had my 'fill' of impressive churches, so did not pay the extra price to tour the inside, but was certainly impressed with the outside detail and the height and sheer presence of this building. Even if you tour it during the castle grounds during the day (which I did), I strongly recommend returning at night for the ambience.

Week end in Prague. Great scenic old cathedral. Visit inside the cathedral amazing. The architecture of the building dates from the 1300's and is original. Prague was spared the destruction of World War II and several of the stained glass windows are original.
Gorgeous. beautiful and very old cathedral that is well maintained with much to enjoy seeing. definitely worth the entry fee.
Beautiful Church. This is a gorgeous church... but the fact that it wasn't completed until the 1900's makes it much less impressive. I would recommend going in, but not paying for the full viewing.

Breath-taking. The architecture is unbelievable, the amount of detail and the height of this Cathedral is breath-taking. This is located within the castle grounds, it is free to get into the castle grounds and to wander around the outside of the cathedral however you will require to buy a ticket to wander inside the cathedral. The stain glass is beautiful, alongside fantastic monuments, an amazing visit.

Stunning St. Vitus Cathedral at Prague Castle. Before you enter the cathedral through the portal opposite the passage-way between the Second and Third Courtyards of Prague Castle, notice the facade, decorated with statues of saints. Then, admire the bronze door , which is decorated with reliefs with scenes from the history of the cathedral and the legends of St. Wenceslas and St. Adalbert. The interior of the cathedral is nothing short of amazing! Inside the cathedral's busy main body are several chapels, the most celebrated chapel, on your right, is the Chapel of St. Wenceslas, which is built atop the saint's tomb. A multitude of polished semiprecious stones decorates the chapel's altar and walls. Below the church's main body is the Royal Crypt, which contains the sarcophagi of kings Václav IV, George of Podebrady, Rudolf II, and Charles IV and his four wives.The views from the cathedral's tower are amazing on a clear day. You must exit the cathedral and enter from the courtyard side to climb the steep winding staircase. A sepateate ticket is required, and can be purchased at the entrance to the stairs. Try to get here early, before the crowds, as the steep, narrow stairway is the only way up and down the tower.You'll be glad you made the climb.

St. Vitus is vital for a trip to Prague. This is inside the Castle and requires a separate admission ticket, which is well worth the price. The cathedral took centuries to complete and you can see parts of it which date back to the 13th century and as recently as 1927.
iconic Gothic cathedral. amazing church and design . brings back the history of the bohemian empire in its glory.small entrance fee to see center but general area in rear open to public
Beautiful. Great cathedral perched perfectly overlooking Prague. It's a must visit if you are in Prague for the weekend.
Superb windows. Lovely cathedral in castle area, lots of bus tours and very busy. You need a ticket to do the whole tour. Interesting history. Windows are stunning.

Overwhelming!. You can either go into the church and get a glimpse of the basic structure or buy a ticket to visit the crypts and the side chapels. The ticket is worth it! To see the richness of art in these chapels are worth the cost.

Can't miss when in Prague. Impressive scale and amazing decor. The Mucha windows need to be seen in person. It only takes 20 minutes and it is well worth it. Take the tram and get there early. Crowds build throughout the day. Then tour the castle and head over to the Schwarzenberger Palace terrace for a coffee.

St Vitus Cathedral. The modern windows in the cathedral are very beautiful. This medieval building is worthy of a visit. The outside is sooty black and with the soaring twin spires it has a very Gothic look. It sits on top of the hill and has a commanding view of the city below.
Beautiful Stained Glass. An awesome cathedral that took 600 years to build. Beautiful stained glass and contains the tomb of Saint Wenceslas!

Go up the tower for a great view of Prague!. It's like a mini Cologne cathedral. A must do in Prague, it's a gorgeous cathedral. For about $15 Canadian two people can get up the tour (it's a walk up via stairs, 56 meters) and you get a souvenir coin with your ticket purchase. The view at the top is just awe inspiring, we truly enjoyed it!

Not just another Cathedral. Having visited great churches across Europe over the years, we discovered the St. Vitus Cathedral in Prague Castle were impressed with the art and history of the beautiful gothic building. The stained glass windows (from the 20th century) are beautiful. The Mucha window is spectacular. The St. Wenceslas Chapel contains relics of the saint and paintings depicting his life. It is in this room that the Kings of Bohemia were crowned. The cathedral took 600 years to complete - it is definitely worth visiting to learn about the history of Prague and admire the works of art.
Impressive architecture. Very nice to see the gothic architecture of this magnificent cathedral. The surroundings are also nice, you get to see the city from a nice vantage point.

The best cathedral in Prague. Its exterior is one of the best i've ever seen as far as cathedrals go. Its numerous jagged edges make it a magnificent example of Gothic architecture. Its interior is less awe inspiring compared to other European cathedrals but impressive nonetheless

Incredible. One of the grandest churches I've ever seen. Amazing. You don't even really need to purchase a ticket if you're on a budget. Just go inside and check out the views from the area before the ticket taker. You can see the entire of the church, albeit from a distance.

Excellent visit !. I have been there at St. Vitus Cathedral 2 weeks ago, and was very impressed about the size and architecture. You can walk in for free, but you cannot see the whole features the cathedral has to offer. To do that you must buy a ticket wich is around 250 czk and you have four entries : 1. the Golden Lane, 2. St. George Basilica , 3. Old Royal Palace and 4. St. Vitus Cathedral.I think it is a must if you are in Prague to visit this stunning cathedral and of course the other 3 mentioned above

Probabily the best church in Prague. It's positioned inside the Castle of Prague, but you can still enjoy it from any point of the city, especially on the Vltava river because of its hight. You have to pay to get is but it is certainly worth it. You can choose to visit it separately from the Castle, but with a reasonable price you can still enter several rooms of the Castle unless some state affair is ongoing. In the latter case, some parts of the Castle (currently used!) will be closed. Audio guide are available at the information office. You'll need something like 1h to visit the Church with this device. I recommend it because it is full of history you may otherwise not notice.

Interesting history and architecture. Take the tour of Prague castle and they take you into the crypt. - teenagers liked. We picked the least expensive tour package and felt it was just the right level of touring.

sTUNNING cATHEDRAL. Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !Loved it all !
Powerful building. really worth seeing, a place where millions of people come to pray,over the years. It can be seen the PRAGUE has not suffered destruction during the war.
they charge you to get inside. i didn´t like that you have to pay to enter to a church!!! first time in my life that i pay to pray, but the architecture was worth it
Spectacular. Ranks right up there with the greats! The walk to this lovely cathedral is a tough slog. It would be more so on a hot day. There are alternatives available. Do not miss it.

Gorgeous Church. We just loved touring this lovely Church! It was one of the highlights of our tour. I loved the stained glass. One window in particular as you first walk in, on the right hand side, third window from the entry which is blue in hue. It was purchased by an insurance company and depicts different risks that it insures. Got a kick out of that.

Amazing!. This is Cathedral is is really worth a visit. We came into the castle complex by public transportation from the city centre without problems. The cathedral is gorgeous both from the outside and inside. It's very big and you have a lot to see in there. Also a walk around the cathedral and looking above is amazing. Such a wonderful building!The fee is included in the combined ticket and it's free of charge if you've got the Prague card (just pick up the tickets at any information or ticket sales point within the complex).
Words can't describe it. This great piece of Czech history is so magnificent you must see it. When you walk inside (it's free) you will be shocked. It's really huge and beautiful.

Very nice cathedral. I am not an expert in cathedrals but it was one of the attractions within the castle complex if you get the combined ticket. It was certainly worth seeing but I wouldn't say it is one of the best in the world - Sagrada Familia / Westminster Abbey are more impressive.

In my cathedral Top 5. Commanding position by the castle on the top of the hill overlooking Prague.
Avoid Saturdays unless you have razor bladed elbows.

Beutiful. Really nice huge building closed by Prague Castle.
Nice area a bit far away from city centrum but it´s easy to go there by public transport.

Great cathedral - get there early. One of the best European cathedrals with lots to see inside - better than Notre Dame Paris or Florence's Duomo - but that's just my opinion; others may disagree. Whole area gets very crowded very quickly. We arrived at 8.30 to get exterior photos without people and were first in when the cathedral opened at nine and, again, were able to take photos without people (although you have to pay for a photopass). Consider climbing the tower on the south side for the views.I wasn't overwhelmed by the other attractions within the castle complex - they're OK, but not the best that Prague has to offer.

A spectacuar cathedral. This cathedral is very similar to other enormous cathedrals in the world but it is still spectacular and has its unique touch. There are paintings by their famous painter Mucha and a huge monument dedicated to John of Nepomuk. The tomb of St. Wenceslas can be seen there as well. Unfortunately, you can see only a small part of the cathedral for free, for the rest of it, you will need a ticket.
Magnificent!. There are various sections that need to be paid for such as the collection at the treasury. The surrounding gardens are lovely!

Beautiful, historic cathedral. Incredibly beautiful old portion of this cathedral. The audioguide was very informative and worthwhile. This was definitely our favorite part of the visit to Prague Castle (at which we visited virtually all of the attractions).

B E A U T I F U L. What a gorgeous cathedral! A must see while in Prague. Worth the trek even if you aren't into churches. There were long lines when I was there but they moved fast. So glad I waited.

focal point of Prague castle area/the mother ship. You can visit the foyer for free but you should get a ticket to visit the rest of the interior of the church. Unfortunately, you have to pay for a package ticket in order to view further in the church.Plan/tour B is sufficient..if you are short on time, skip the other 3 things on the ticket- basillica, Golden Lane and palace but St. Vitus is a must. Just did this tour with visitors over the weekend-their first, my 8th or so...we did 3 of 4 on the ticket, we didn't bother with Golden Lane.

Gorgeous Cathedral. St. Vitus is big and beautiful. Intricate with great stained glass windows.There are often long lines, and it's hard to watch when they wane, since the rest of the castle complex is so big and great, but try. Also, when you arrive, carefully check to see if there are any signs posted noting closures during the day. Lots of weddings take place, and we barely made it in before they closed for the evening. I didn't get as much time as I would have liked, but the different palaces are wonderful too, and there's only so much time on a vacation day.This is part of the castle ticket.

amazing place. i'm not religious or particularly into architecture but you have to visit this place if you're in Prague. it is located at Prague castle and the whole area is brilliant, especially the Cathedral. the building i brilliantly built and i would recommend getting a pass to visit the different areas of the castle as it works out at around £8.00 per adult for 'route B' and is well worth the money to see the different areas including the cathedral. if not, it is still well worth a visit just to see the area as it is an amazing place

Worship Place. The cathedral is Gothic in design. Pity at the moment it is the facade is under construction. It gets crowded after 10.00am. It is one of the popular locations with tourists. It is worth a visit inside.

Mucha Stained glass windows. This beautiful Gothic cathedral is mainly incredible because of the quality of Stain glass windows. You have to pay extra to be able to go all the way into it. This is worth your money though because it really is a quite breathtaking Cathedral and especially the Mucha window. There are also many other beautiful artifacts with in this Cathedral, including a quite amazing silver casket surrounded by beautiful silver sculptures

mind blower. this was the second best church in prague after St Nicholas. This church however has the best exterior in all of prague(it looks like vysehrad). The size of the church is quite big.Tip: Visit St george's basilica first, as that is much smaller, and nothing much there compared to here.

Great clock. It's a beautiful clock but the show on the hour was really too short, can't blame the maker, it's just we were expecting more. Every hour a few seconds before it changes time on the hour the figures around the astronomical clock starts moving and the small window above it opens and comes out the figures walking but the whole thing takes only about a minute so get your cameras and recorder working right away. Another thing it's way up so stand further away not right below the clock so you can have a better view of the whole thing.

One of the most impressive building's I've ever seen. I've been to St. Peter's in Rome, St. Stephen in Budapest, St. Stephen in Vienna, Westminster Abbey in London and Notre Dame in Paris. However, I have not been WOW'd like this in a while. What a magnificant building! The stained glass windows ARE the finest examples in the world, no question about it in my book!It was a pleasure to visit!

Beautiful stained glass - beautiful outside. Long queue to get in (you have to get the ticket from the ticket office).There is a stained glass by Mucha (famous artist of Czech origin of the beginning of the 20th century) and other beautiful stained glasses.You will also see religious art and sculptures (metal) and organs with many pipes.
Luxury castle. Aw, such a wonderful cathedral! The most beautiful place I have ever been to. Every tourist must visit this luxury castle.
Breathtaking. The stained glass windows are simply amazing. They are as beautiful as any you will see in any church in Europe.

Go when the sun is shining!. This is a great Cathedral for any city. It was built in multiple styles and at different times. The stained glass windows are impressive. We were able to go in the morning before the rush of tours and the sun was out and shining through the stained glass window onto a mosaic picture making a stunning sight that any photo does not do justice. Well worth the price of admission.

Lovely church in Prague Castle. When you are visiting Prague Castle this is one of the highlights of your visit. It is a lovely old church and very interesting. There is lots of signage (and lots of people). Highly recommend you go early, before the crowds mob you.

Nice. I don't usually appreciate churches (not my thing), especially if they have an entrance fee. But in this one they let you in a little bit for free, and if you like it, then you can buy a ticket to visit it along with other attractions within the castle.
long line to get in. Wonderful once we got inside but it was very busy allow a while as there is much to see adn the cathedral is over whelming in size

Avoide the crowds if possible. It's an amazing place to visit - if you can manage to get in without any large bus groups... I had to wait in line to get in and then once inside there are people everywhere - so best to go just before closing time - most groups have left by then and it's more enjoyable

Amazing & beautiful. Beautiful place to visit. Stunning inside and outside. Definitely a must see in Prague. Crowds were only in the free area of the Cathedral so definitely worth paying to go into the main part of it.
Impressive. The exterior is imposingly impressive.......the interior is simply breathtaking. A jewel in a city of many jewels.

Great architecture. Lovely stained glass windows, interesting history to the building of this historic landmark, get someone to tell you a bit more about it (we did); great views of Prague from up here.
a 'must see'. this place is absolutely stunning and should be on every tourists itinerary but it is also very popular so gets crowded, about 10 min wait to get in but well worth it. Take your camera.
Highlight of the castle complex. Variety of stain glass styles- loved the windows by Mucha! Pay the extra $ and climb the bell tower- best views in Prague!
Excellent. Architecture,impression,beauty,history all in one place. Most beautiful thing to see in Prague,can not be compared to anything.

could be so much better. I've never seen turnstiles in a church. I've never seen security so rude, screaming at people and pushing them out of the door before the church closes. If the church suffers from a lack of funds, why doesn't the castle offer people the chance for people to pay for the church seperatly? This is one of the gems of central Europe and it is cheapened by rude security and machines that belong in a subway, not a church.
Must see. This place with whole castle complex is must to see :) nice place for coples to romantic trips. Every one must see
Beautiful building. A lovely gothic building with beautiful frescoes, pairings and murals. If you like this sort of thing the thesis amidst visit

Gothic style at its best. When claiming up the stairs to the famous Prague Castle, which itself is amazing, you do not expect to discover another jewel behind the castle walls. This cathedral can amaze you by the way it looks both inside an outside. also walking around it, if you concentrate, you can feel hundreds of years of history under your feet... Superb place....

Beautiful church with recent history.. The outside of the church was beautiful . It was interesting to see the carvings of the gargoyles as well as the carvings of the architects. We just walked into the church to enjoy the stain class windows and noticed that they are sponsored for support. It is beautiful
Beautiful Cathedral. This is probably the most important piece of architecture in the castle, and it is very impressive, knowing they started building it in the 900's. Must see in Praha.

Beautiful. It is a very beautiful Cathedral. There is a fee to go inside and you will go in a one way traffic flow. You can see a lot by not paying the fee. the stained glass windows are beautiful as is everything else about this cathedral. Highly recommended
One of Europes premier cathedrals. This is a wonderful cathedral that sits in a small village there is a museum you can tour and an old time village

St. Vitus Cathedral: a One-Way Street. The foremost attraction at the Prague Castle is the Cathedral of St. Vitus. You can see a partial view without purchasing a ticket. Yet a partial view of such a monolithic church isn’t sufficient. It is an unusual Cathedral. Along the bottom half of the sanctuary, there are surreal, psychedelic stained glass windows alternating with traditionally representational tableaux.Off to the side behind a door, there is a small chapel that featured a startling bas relief of three main figures: Jesus unconscious on the cross, with his mother Mary and Mary Magdalene on either side beneath him. Jesus is emaciated. He has just a smidgen of flesh on his rickety rib cage. His mother is dejected. She looks downward. But Mary Magdalene adoringly, almost voluptuously looks up at Jesus as if she senses that his death is only temporary; his glory is forever.Normally, a magnificent altarpiece is the focal point of a sanctuary, but not at St. Vitus. Considering how spacious this gothic cathedral is, the short, plainly adorned altarpiece portraying a nondescript Virgin Mary is almost unobtrusive. But behind the altarpiece and overshadowed by it is a baroque silver-coated extravaganza. Two huge angels hover in mid-air, holding red drapery above the statue of an oversized saint (St. John of Bohemia) who is kneeling on a bier upheld by two other angels. He is cradling a cross that looks like a sword and contains a large figurine of the inlaid body of Jesus upon it. This monumental scene could have served well as the centerpiece of the Cathedral.Further on in the back of the Cathedral is a richly paneled chapel containing wall-to-wall paintings, the upper portion devoted to St. Wenceslas, the patron saint of the Czech nation. The décor resembles that of a palatial museum touting a precious exhibition room rarely found in a church.The worst unusual aspect of the Cathedral has to do with the staff. As we were near the end of our visit, we wanted to go back to see a few more items. An officious attendant said no, you must go forward; you can never backtrack in the Cathedral. That’s the rule. We were shocked. We told him that this so-called policy is absurd. He replied, “No, no, no Madame. I’m only following orders.” And then he told a whopper: “All churches are this way, everywhere.” In any case, as another attendant began to join the fray, we exited. We would have lingered a bit longer. If you want to see everything from all vantage points, simply walk around each area as you go, because if you approach the end, you will be stopped from turning around. A bit absurd!!
Simply breathtaking. The glasswork, the architecture, the roofbeams, the sheer grandeur of it all. A must-see for all who love superior craftmanship.

I love to see such awesome displays of Christianity!. See if you can attend a mass here; just check the schedule and let the guards know you're there for mass. While you worship, you'll have time to sit and take in the beauty of the building! Don't miss it!
St. Vitus Cathedral. A must see. All the churches in Prague are a must see. Go up in the towers and down in the catacombs. Lots of history.

simply breath-taking. Definitely the most recommended cathedral to be visited in Prague. Simply unforgettable. It's amazing how many centuries get reflected in this gorgeous building. First, you can just stand or sit opposite the entrance, and take in the gothic beauty of the facade. Then go inside and let the inner grandeur capture your soul. That's all I have to say about it.

St.Vitus Cathedral. Like all Cathedrals of its time, very ornate and architecturally interesting. Unfortunately to enjoy the full experience you have to purchase a ticket prior to entering the cathedral, something that is not told to you until you have spent a long time in the queue to enter it, and then you find an even longer queue to purchase said ticket and all the other tickets needed to see individual sites throughout the castle complex.

Many highlights. St Vitus Cathedral was built mostly in the 14th C and is one of Europe's finest Gothic Cathedrals. A lot is free to visit and it is open 9-4pm. To fully access all the chapels and crypt you need to get a ticket for Prague Castle - there's circuit A, B & C options at either 250czk or 350czk. Highlights include a stunning Art Nouveau stained glass window by Alfons Mucha. There is the Tomb of St John of Nepomuk, covered in two tonnes of silver. Finest chapel is the one dedicated to the Czech patron saint St Wenceslas. For an extra 150czk you can climb the south tower for the best view of the city. This requires a lot of effort, there are nearly 300 steps but the view from the top of the 96m high tower is spectacular.

Very pretty cathedral. Very pretty cathedral, but certainly does not hold a candle to Notre Dame but you can see the similarities, buy the ticket to do the tour, or you will not get the whole experience. Very crowded and noisy, unlike other cathedrals I have visited, and there didn't seem to be any respect for the fact this a church! Still, very amazing architecture of Prague!

St. Vitus is a Must See. This is one of Europe's great cathedrals. My favorite treasures there are the Mucha stained glass window which is second on the left facing in from the front door, as well as the room dedicated to the Czech patron saint Wenceslas. The saint's room is incredible. Look at the walls, which are covered in real gold and precious and semi precious stones. This
The prettiest church in prague. The prettiest church in prague. To enter the cathedral its 150 czk. From outside you can see an amazing church.

Dissapointing impression. There was nothing spectacular in the outdoor area. The Cathedral itself is only good to see ecause of its size and for the one window painting of Muha. There is a fee if you want to do complete internal tour of the Cathedral

Amazing architecture. Go all they way up to the Cathedral by tram No. 22 do not get off until you see the whole tram almost emptying in front of the cathedral. You will be dropped at the garden see the gardens then go inside and spend at least a few hours in the campus around the cathedral.Walk down from the front enterance back to the Charles bridge . A great walh of about 1/2 a km.

Impressive church. This church is definitely the highlight of Prague castle. Without a ticket, you can enter and get an impression, but you need a ticket to walk around and see all the chapels etc. It's worth getting the ticket.
its very nice cathethedral. and worth the climb, great view from the top of the hill... and it looks great from the inside- all in all- go there- everybody does- for a reason

beautiful. A must visit when in Prague ,breathtaking stained glass windows and beautiful architecture could have spent hours just looking. The climb up the tower however was brutal 297 sheer steps in the 35 degree heat was no mean feat and not however the views were unbeatable and you do get a medal for achievement.
Don't miss it. This is a large and decorated cathedral where the kings of Czechslovokia are buried. Take a tour so you have a sense of both the beauty and the history of this unique place.

Enjoyed my visit. When I visited it was a very busy day in July. The cathedral itself overwhelmed me with its altars, statues and stained glass windows. I have visited other cathedrals but St Vitus will stay with me for a very long time. Would definitely recommend this to other visitors to Prague.

Massive. This cathedral is the centrepiece of the castle and can be seen from any viewpoint throughout the city. We entered and found ourselves in the massive vaulted cathedral. There were enormous stained glass windows of flowers and religious figures. There were numerous curios such as the internal medieval staircase and balconies and balustrades. On one side was the enormous section of the organ pipes tucked high up in the rafters. The cathedral was not as crowded as we expected as we had gone early. Construction started in 1347 although there was a basilica on the site one hundred years earlier. The program of works to restore, extend or add renaissance flourishes meant that it was not actually finished until 1920. At the far end was a number of sarcophagi but the royal tomb was closed. Accessed from outside the cathedral was the South Tower. It was a steep spiral staircase but the steps were broad enough to be comfortable. There were 290 of them and the tower was a whopping ninety-six metres tall. On the way we were looking for both the bell and the workings of the clock that you were supposed to be able to see. The bell was supposed to be the largest in Czech. We think we saw the bell, as we could only look through a small window along the staircase and without a proper platform to observe it. At the top was a nice view without any impediments from screens or wire. We had a good vantage point over the top of St Vitus Cathedral and the castle itself. It was quite funny how the tour groups in the courtyard below seemed relatively spaced out and insignificant, but it helped when they were one hundred metres below. We also had good views over Petrin and the city of Prague.Whilst the cathedral opens at 9.00am the tower does not open until 10.00am and is not covered by the Circuit A ticket.

A place to be seen, maybe a little overrated. Definitely a place worth visiting, but maybe too much marketing. It is very crowded, with lots of tours. Maybe try to visit during the week, at opening hour.

Beautiful, Magnificent, Incredible, Fantastic. So awesome you can spend hours exploring. The views from the highest points are magnificent any time of the year. I have been here several times over the years and it's still incredible.

Breathtaking!. Definitely arrive by 9am. We got the audio tour 1 to view Cathedral and castle and it took 3 hours but worth it. When we returned audio there was a very long line waiting to buy tickets. So glad we were leaving by then.
Glorious and Magnificent. Jaw dropping architecture and design. Awesome church in every was. So much to see, the artwork is priceless
Well worth seeing. The Cathedral is stunning both externally and internally. If you're into ecclesiastical architecture, don't miss it.

Forget Notre Dame. Notre Dame has nothing on St. Vitus Cathedral - my new fave - incredibly light, airy, bright, open, colorful, and so much history. Incredible and varied stained glass windows like nowhere else I've seen. Don't miss the Mucha window.

Well worth the steps!. Fantastic. Well worth the long walk up. Beautiful. We simply walked in, said a prayer for a very dear friend who had recently died, and contemplated the beauty of the surroundings.

Dominant feature of Prague skyline. The St. Vitus Cathedral is visible from all over the city, perched on the hilltop of Prague Castle. The structure, begun in 1344 on the site of the older St. Vitus rotunda, was not completed until 1929. The huge basilica is supported by numerous flying buttresses. There are many stain glass windows with some 21 chapels around the main sanctuary. Quite impressive.

Amazing. Make sure you buy your photo license. Find tomb of St Wenceslas and admire Mucha's stained glass window and you have to stop and wonder at the tomb of St Giovanni( all silver statues-amazing-he's the unfortunate chucked off Charles Bridge. Look out for the cross ans padlocks on the bridge)
Extraordinary.. Impressionable size, beautiful windows... reminiscent of Notre Dame in Paris. Very crowded with hordes of photo-maniacal Japanese tourists.

Wao! Completely amazing!!!!!. Wao! Wao Wao Wao Wao! This place is just surreal! I thought Notre Dame was a beautiful cathedral, but this one is just completely out all my scales of measurements. Absolutely majestic! I have problems to imagine how something like this was ever built! The outer gothic style, the details of the paintings, sculptures and the windows! Ohh the windows.. You have to see it yourself
Beautiful!. We went on a walking tour of Prague and toured the Cathedral. It is breathtaking; amazing architecture

Go to the top!. There is a separate entrance to go to the top of the cathedral. It has a great view of the entire city! The cathedral itself is gorgeous, both inside and out. I would definitely make sure you make a trip to Prague Castle and pay to go to the top of the cathedral - totally worth it!

Simply stunning. St Vitus Cathedral looms large over the City of Prague and despite the piecemeal nature of its construction it is simply stunning inside and out.There are several different types of admission which gives you access to different parts of the Cathedral, all are good value for money.The best for me is access to the South Tower for great views over Prague. It is not for the faint-hearted as there is no lift and over 250+ steps with no hand rail.Get there early in the morning to beat the queues. As in peak season there can be lines of up to 200 waiting for entrance
Amazing! Breathtaking!. On a choir tour of central Europe to Budapest, Vienna, and Prague....this cathedral tour was very educational and inspiring! Hated to leave.

Every tour will surely stop in this cathedral. I would say the history of this Gothic cathedral is very long and impressive. However, looking at the exterior it looks so much like the cathedral in Cologne. Anyway, I went there with a tour so I didn't have time to go to the tower. However, I believe it is always super crowded in this cathedral. Therefore, I couldn't really enjoy the architecture and was busy making my way between the crowd. Moreover, there is also nothing really special in the interior. So I would just recommend a couple of minutes to admire the cathedral and go straight to the tower for the view.
