Simply beautiful. This is a gorgeous church that is visible for miles. I originally thought that this church was the castle. I simply learned that I was wrong. I was there in the early evening and it was already closed. Be sure to get there early. The crowds to get inside were crazy!
Awe inspiring!!. Felt like I died and went to heaven!!! Again the intricate detailing in the architecture of the cathedral leaves you breathless.

The most beautiful building I had ever seen. I am not Christian, nor a connoisseur of buildings in general. This was the most beautiful building interior I had ever seen to-date in my life. It is simply amazing.

Amazing Cathedral. Just go. Massive and amazing Gothic cathedral unlike anyplace else. The original footprint was 600 AD, it took a few centuries for the current structure to get built. Such history should be relished. Go for 7 AM daily mass to take a look at the interior before the crowds arrive!

St. Vitus Cathedral Prague. St. Vitus Cathedral is a Roman Catholic cathedral in Prague, and the seat of the Archbishop of Prague. The full name of the cathedral is St. Vitus, St. Wenceslas and St. Adalbert Cathedral. Stunning Gothic Cathedral opened in 1929! I think I took 500 pictures here!

Exceptional Cathedral. The large cathedral is filled with colorful stained glass windows & features a high net ceiling with double diagonal ribs to strengthen the vault and decorate the ceiling. The Rose Window above the main entrance is particularly striking. The bronze entry doors show reliefs depicting the history of the castle & legends of 2 saints. We were able to visit the structure and take pictures.

perfect gothic cathedral. very intricately design in gothic style, some renovation is still ongoing, lots of tourist, this cathedral is part of Prague castle where the president is residing, panoramic view of the city is at its best here

Incredible views from here. Very interesting Cathedral - beautiful and especially interesting if you go with a guide who can explain the history and the art. View from the courtyard over the city was wonderful.

Gothic marvel. There are two saints buried here and the silver coffin of St. John of Nepomuk clearly shows that "saint" is the highest honor person can get - much more significant than king or president.

St Vitus Cathedral. Both inside and out this is a wonderful building, but enter and you will be bewildered by the crowds and noise. As with so many places in Prague there is a similarity to being in a crowded underground train in London during the rush hour. I have visited Prague regularly since about 1980, and whilst the Velvet Revolution freed the country from communism, the tourist industry seems to have encouraged general deterioration.
Magnificent. What a treat. It is amazing such beautiful structures were built so many years ago when the tools were crude. The stone work, stained glass windows and iconology is amazing.
you feel great peace inside the place. you must visit this church! you will see a lot of painst, statues, saints, even a holly grave... Its huge church with nice place to remember

Quite a climb to the top, but worth it. We accidentally ended up climbing to the top of the tower at St. Vitus Cathedral, but it was really great. The view was awesome, but it's 287 steps up I think.The cathedral itself is lovely as well.
Breathtaking. This cathedral must be seen by every tourist, who visits Prague. It is big and beautiful, on the exterior and in the interior!

Magnificent. One of the magnificent Cathedrals of Europe. The stained glass was rich and colorful. I would compare it to the top Gothic Churches of the Middle Ages. Of course the Czech Republic is now majority atheist so it is more a tourist destination even though it is still a functioning church.
What a grand church. This building oozes with history and great architecture it will take all day and then some to actually see all there is to see both inside and out

Excellent example of Gothic architecture. The skyline is dominated by this church so its a must see. The facade is fascinating, one of the best examples of Gothic architecture i have seen, the back of the church is a newer extension that is still over 300 years old, but it flows from the old and one can hardly tell that it is over 350 yrs younger than the older part of the Church.

Gorgeous and culuturally significant place. No trip to the castle is complete without seeing this gorgeous cathedral right in the middle of the castle grounds. I was in awe at its beauty and design while tour guides spoke endearing things about the place.
Attractive both outside and in. A well positioned cathedral which is part of the castle complex. You have to pay to go any further than the entrance lobby.

majestic. it is well worth having a look. you can get in for free but if you want to actually get further inisde to have a look you will have to have a ticket for the castle (about 9 euros to see the palace and other stuff). It takes a while because of the crowd but it is very impressive

Worth the Treck. Absolutely beautiful cathedral. Stunning architecture, inside and out. Be ready to walk up hills/stairs. The streets are charming, filled with shops, restaurants, people watching and great musicians along the way. We stood is awe of the design/engineering of such a beautiful cathedral built so long ago and the views of Prague are stunning.
wonderful. I did not like it we could not visit unless you take the complete tour and visit the castle. But as much as I could see is impressive

Paid $18. I think walking around the outside was just as good. Well the Cathedral had its stained windows and high ceilings statues but the other part not worth it. When you come by tram buy water from the right side don't buy from the left side restaurant rip off this is in the Royal Garden enterance.

Nice cathedral, Great tower is a mixed bag. Entry to the cathedral atrium is free, but you need tickets to explore further in. If you're on a tight budget, you can get a decent impression of the interior even from the atrium. It's a very beautiful and very richly decorated and definitely worth a visit if you're in Prague.There is a separate ticket for the climb of the Great south tower of the cathedral. I'm usually a great fan of climbing cathedral towers for the view on top, but this tower was particularly unpleasant to climb - there were barely any windows and all of them were sealed shut (never meant to be open) and there was almost no air left to breathe (moreover it was on a very hot summer day). From the top you get a wonderful 360 view over most of Prague. It wasn't too crowded at the top despite the vast amount of tourists visiting the castle complex daily. However. I'd recommend climbing it on a cooler day or season.
Pay attention to the details. I am not a fan of religion, but you got to admire the "artistic" part of these buildings. Just lose yourself in details.

Very nice Cathedral - extremely crowded at mid-day. Any major-city Cathedral in Europe is worth visiting to include St. Vitus. We went in August and the cathedral was very crowded, especially in the entry foyer as many tour groups are crowded inside the doorway. This is the only spot in which you can visit for free.For an additional cost you can visit the entire Cathedral; however, we were on a guided tour that did not include the entire Cathedral. Our highlight was the main church doors at the entrance. Beautifully engraved doors depict the history of St Vitus and scenes from the Bible.

Lugubre, but not-to-be-missed.. The entire complex of the Praha Castle appears lugubre, out of a terror movie, due to ages of accumulated dirt. But vapor cleaning would remove the inherent charm and uniqueness of the place. Audio guide rental is complex, old Soviet bureaucracy, and speeches long. Dump.
Beautiful Cathedral. This is an amazing Cathedral. It is a must see. You can decide how much time you want to spend in the Cathedral.

Beautiful Cathedral- a must see. Beautiful gothic cathedral. You can enter it without an entrance fee. But it is well worth the fee to roam through the entire church. The number one spot to see while visiting Prague castle.

impressive -- don't miss. I have been to Europe multiple times. And I have a passion for church architecture. But after seeing hundreds if not thousands of churches throughout the continent, it takes a lot to impress me. This cathedral did just that. It is large. It is a exuberantly Gothic, possibly the best example of Gothic cathedral architecture in Central/Eastern Europe. Lots of great art and interesting architectural details inside and out. But wait, there's more! Because the cathedral took centuries to complete, there are some interesting modern items of interest, such as the stained glass windows in the north part of nave designed by the Art Nouveau master Alfons Mucha. And then there's the opulently adorned tomb of St. Wencelaus (yes, the same "Good King Wenceslas [who] looked out, on the Feast of Stephen, When the snow lay round about, deep and crisp and even...). These are just two illustrative examples of many highlights.A must see when in Prague!
Beautiful. Stained glass was so pretty and magical. Very nice interior and I loved the atmosphere.Nice and cool on a hot day also ;)Worth the hike up too.
Amazing. Beautiful,charming, and well worth a visit. Make sure to check out the ceilings, stain glass windows and the organ.
A beautiful church!!. Love this beautiful church in the Prague Castle - lots of details and history. Wish we could spend more time here.
Beautiful architecture. We saw the cathedral on two separate occasions. The cathedral is very impressive with lots to see. It's situated in Prague castle and has an extensive history.
St Vitus Cathedral. Excellent history and culture and fantastic stained glass windows Take an official guide - really worth it as they are experienced and can answer all questions very well

Not just another church!. Hidden within Prague Castle complex, the cathedral is accessible free of charge but only the first 10 m, after that ticket must be scanned at the barrier. In common with the rest of Prague Castle, there was too many people to allow any sense that one was in a church. No music was played, even over loud speakers, which was a shame, as this invariably adds atmosphere. One was not allowed to sit down - all the pews were roped off - not good news for my disabled husband who ended up sitting on the wall outside.
Fantastic architecture. Steeped in history, fantastic architecture.Superb stained glass windows. Definitely one of the many sights to be seen in Prauge.

St.vitas cathedral. The cathedral was commissioned by Charles IV, and construction began in 1344 ...However, it took almost six centuries to complete, with the final phase of construction in the period 1873-1929, it is the largest and most important temple in Prague...In the chancel of the cathedral, in front of the high alter, is the royal mausoleum. Below this, there are the royal tombs. Czech kings and queens, and patron saints of the country are interred here.The Great South Tower of the Cathedral holds the biggest bell in the Czech Republic you can climb the tower. It has 287 steps and is more than 90 metres high. The views from the stop are worth the effort.It is free for visitors to enter the first part of St. Vitus Cathedral. A ticket must be purchased to visit the whole cathedral.

Nicest cathedral. I have been to cathedrals in places such as Vienna and Paris and thought St. Vitus will be similar to those. However, once I entered the St Vitus, it hits me that this is probably the most beautiful cathedral that I have came across. The tinted glass facades around the building are very beautiful as they are shone brightly perhaps by the natural sunlight. It is difficult to put the beauty of this place to words. You have to visit this place to experience itDo note that if you are visiting, avoid Sunday as certain compound are closed to visitors.

Stunning. Be sure to go here. Even if you are doing the entire palace tour. Take the #22 tram up to the palace. You can enter the grounds for free and enter the cathedral for free as well. You will just have to stay at the back without an entrance ticket.

St Vitus Cathedral=Great!. The heart of the "castle" The Cathedral was great, exactly what you think a several hundred year old Gothic style cathedral should be. Great spires, reliefs and artwork, you will not be disappointed by it. During the day hours it gets packed pretty quick. We also came back to it at night about 9pm (our hotel was 300 yards away) and it was awesome all lit up, there was not many people there until the groups of 50ppl started showing up, but still easier to see than in the day time. I would highly recommend it.*Most of the reviews say that the Cathedral is free, that isn't entirely true. ENTRY into it is free and allows you to look at the front 1/4 of the church, the back 3/4 are roped off and you need to pay or be part of a paid tour group. We didn't go into the roped off area, not because of the price but because we were not sure how to do it and we were also running out of time. Something I would love to do though and recommend.**Warning: Just because it's a church do not drop your guard and BE MINDFUL OF YOUR BELONGINGS! There are a lot of people bumping and touching you and you will be pre-occupied with the surroundings. Make sure your purse/backpacks are zipped and in front of you, wallets in front, camera cases stowed well. Just be mindful so you can really enjoy the beautiful art work & history that you see.

Amazing. I'm in Prague every year and every time I make sure I visit Prague castle and cathedral. Yes,it can be very crowded in summer but the sheer size can take quite big crowd. It's definitely worth visiting even if you not exactly lover of history. Beautiful stained glass windows,stonework and arches are incredible.
Easter Service. This cathedral is magnificentWe were able to attend an Easter Service And seen from the Old town lit up at night is like a fairy tale castle
Soul of Czech Kings. This is the heart of Czech history, a place where you can feel the soul of Czech Kings. If there is queue, please stay, you will enjoy it inside.

VISUALLY STUNNING. What would western civilization have done without the Catholic Church commissioning most, if not all, of the stunning artwork and sculpture that are in each and every cathedral? And the amount of gold and silver used...the mind boggles. The more important the site, the more of everything in it....and St. Vitus Cathedral has a LOT of it. The interior is visually stunning, but don't let that detract from all the actual history that this site has experienced.As with any popular site to see, it is best to go early before the crowds gather, and this is no exception.

St. Vitus Cathedral. Certainly a sight not to be missed. The cathedral is very popular and very crowded. Take the tour. The guide gave interesting historic information - hard to hear though due to the crowds.

Amazing. It's beautiful in pictures, but the real thing exceeds several times any expectation one may have. It's outstandingly beautiful from every angle on the outside ( and I still find details I had missed whenever I look at my photos), and the interior is awesome. The stained glass windows are beautiful, and there is a balance between the impressive and massive building typical of Gothic cathedrals and cosiness. The adjacent chapels and the chorus behind the main altar are, individually and as a set, really remarkable. Probably the single most beautiful building I've ever visited.

Get there early!. I managed to get to the Cathedral before 9.00, so that most of the tourists had not arrived. It was more pleasant to wander around the nave this way, and to see the lovely stained glass windows. It is possible to see the Cathedral for free and without having to pay to see the rest of the castle.

Beautiful Cathedral. This is a beautiful cathedral, but sadly, it was under renovation so we could not appreciate all the beauty. You can go in for free, but you have to stay behind the ropes, which was fine for us as we were there on a tour and our time was limited. We did get some great in-depth information, about the door and the story that it tells. We also learned that the painted window in the church was done by the artist, Alphonse (sometimes spelled Alfons) Mucha. The design and colors were incredible! Thanks to this discovery, we wanted to see more of his work, so we ventured to the National Gallery, to see the “The Slav Epic” (which was a must).

The highlight of the Prague Castle. I thought this was by far the highlight of the Prague Castle. The Chapel of St. Wenceslas was particularly interesting part of Cathedral, be sure not to miss it. You could spend hours examining the intricate stained glass and the place itself is so rich with history that you could spend even more hours soaking it all in. That being said, I think an hour is plenty to get a good feel for the cathedral.
Gorgeous architecture. Don't miss this if you like seeing old cathedrals. It tends to be very crowded inside, but you can still appreciated the stained glass windows and arched ceilings.

Where is the church? :). Just another WaltDisney attraction. A lot of tourists rushes in through one door, another lot of tourists rushes out through the other door... and inside is an indecent congestion of photographers catching selfies.... For those interested, there is still a church.

Roman Catholic church. Very fancy decorated like most of the catholic churches. Could be visited after the Castle district because the tram just run in front of it. Gothic style and the most important church in this country because they Archbishop seats here.

Not to be missed!. Part of the extensive palace complex, this cathedral may seem like A B C, (another bloody cathedral)!but it was worth the visit to admire the splendid windows and interesting side chapels, especially the one dedicated to St Wenceslas. I was especially touched to observe a young Franciscan friar fall to his knees and say a brief prayer before the very baroque statue of a local saint.

St. Vitus Cathedral represents the Czech Catholic soul.. This cathedral is the high church of Czech Catholics. It is the Czech Westminster Abbey with the tombs of its saints and royalty. As one enters on the left side of the entrance move directly to the Alfons Mucha 1931 stained glass window honoring Saints Methodius and Cyril. It is a bit jarring to see an Art Nouveau work in a cathedral from the Middle Ages, but it is so beautiful that it works here. At the apse do not miss the relief of 17th century Prague and the tombs of St. Vitus and St. John Nepomuk. The later tomb is made of solid silver. Before the exit, do not miss the Chapel St. Wenceslaus.

Maybe the most beautiful gothic church in Europe. This is the most beautiful gothic church I ve ever seen (and I have seen a lot of them). So impressive... I have no words to describe it and even the fotos are not enough. Just go-you wont regret it. Definately one of the best reasons to visit Prague.

Another Cathedral. Visited as a part of a Prague City Tour. It was interesting to see and the guide was very good.It must be visited by every traveller as there was wall to wall people and it was not very comfortable at all. Overall we found it was like most other Cathederals we visited.

Favorite part of Prague Castle. The Cathedral was my favorite part of Prague Castle. The light coming in through the stained glass windows cast colorful patterns along the stone pillars. It was breathtaking.

Nice Cathedral. I've been to Europe a number of times. It was a beautiful church as they all are beautiful. I get a little tired of the opulence but it was nice to see. It took a long time to build the church and the story of the confessor and how he was thrown from the Charles Bridge was interesting.
Very interesting. The cathedral was very impressive to see. The stained glass windows are beautiful. However go early it was VERY crowded.

Used to be Free. ...but now you have to buy a ticket to see it and the Castle rooms, etc. Best deal is the "Ä" ticket which gives you 2 days to visit the entire complex. "B"is a little less and covers the top 4 sights in the complex. great views.

Beautiful awe-inspiring religious building. A work of art - that is still being added to over the centuries (Alphonse Mucha stained glass for example). A must-see for anyone - part of the Prague Castle ticket.

Gorgeous cathedral, but summer is not the best time for a visit. This cathedral if evidently on the schedule of every tour operator in Prague, as is the Hradcany Castle. The experience is disappointing, as you are shoulder to shoulder with hordes of other tourists. Also: all the seats have been roped off, so you can forget about sitting down for a few moments of contemplation, or even to take the weight of your feet for a bit. We want to get back here in the spring or fall.
St. Vitus Cathedral in Prague Castle. Fascinating church. Don't miss the Wenceslaus Chapel and the exhibit about its paintings. Very interesting tombs.

Breathtaking. Beautiful cathedral whitin the Prague Castle complex. You need to pay a fee to be able to go walk to the sides and back of the church. Worth every czk. Loved the fachade and the interior. A must if you are visiting Prague!

beautiful stained glass. I was a bit disappointed because the crypt was closed in the summer. and you needed to pay extra for the tower. the tomb of jan nepomucen was hidden in the box in a small aria. but the stained glass was beautiful. I wasn't impressed but it was nice. at busy times there is a line outside.
St Vitius. lovely cathedral but hoards of tourists mean that you are fighting for a good viewing position. Best to visit during a quieter time of day - we were there middayish.

To top of the tower. We climbed the 100 vertical meters to top and enjoyed an exquisite view of the outstreched city. The inside of the cathedral is mixture of alice in wonderland and and quiet spritual presence.

Amazing stained glass windows!. Beautiful place, very interesting - tomb of Jan Nepomucen with 2 tons of silver - unbelievable! Art Nouveau stained glass, beautiful ambo, a Gothic nave, built it over 600 years .....
great church. very beautifull. do get a ticket to get into the church, otherwise you can only enter and look around from there. a ticket gives you entrance to the whole ground floor.
Its a nice place. However when we visited, it was a Sunday and really crowded, so we could not appreciate the place as we had to constantly move. But its a beautiful building.
What an amazing church !. Visit to this church was part of the day tour I took. This church was so beautiful and enormous. Very intricate arts and overall architecture and design of the building.

Very impressive. A must see situated inside the castle walls. The stained glass windows were very impressive. I felt, however, that a lot of the religious atmosphere was lost because of the crowds when we visited.
Crowds of people, rude employees. It is a Prague staple, but it is alway packed and limits your ability to really enjoy. The staff was very rude and felt herded in like cattle.

Gothic Landmark. Near by Prague Castle, allow at least two to three hours to see this cathedral and the area. It is the burial place for former kings and it takes a little time to really take in the beautiful chapels. The exterior of the cathedral is also very beautiful. Take a slow walk around it and you can even see underneath at one point. There is also a separate building that includes the Church's Treasury. A must see.
amazing. take a day to see the cathedral and the castle and the surrounding areas. excellent resturants and hotels to enjoy views
Amazing. Huge church and a little mindblowing. Only problem was there were soooo many people and the aisles were quite narrow.
Nothing Special. Nothing special when you get close to it. However, it looks much better from Charle's bridge specially at night.

Much cooler than the castle. It's fun to walk around inside the cathedral. You do have to pay to get inside, but there are things to look at everywhere. Amazing stained glass and intricate art and sculptures. Very cool. Also, it's lit up at night and looks cool from a distance.

Must see at the top of Prague. Seeing is believing of St.Vitus. One of the most beautiful cathedrals here. It's a trek to get here, 127 steps or take the Metro to bus 22 and ride that. Amazing views from the citytop. Panoramic views nonetheless. Must see.
Stunning cathedral. The most beautiful stained glass we have seen anywhere, well worth a visit - and was very cool inside (hot day!)
St. V is a classic. One of the best gothic Cathedrals I've seen. This and St. Nick's on the hill are not to be missed. St. Vitus really embodies what gothic church is all about.
Simply stunning. Really pleasant history trip as you visit the cathedral. Just a nice way to spend a relaxed chilled afternoon. The cathedral was well kept, immaculately clean and easy to walk around
Very Pretty. We toured the Castle District using the Tour B option, and it gave us just what we wanted. St. Vitus Cathedral is amazingly beautiful and definitely worth a look!
Beautiful. Super! Most beautiful Cathedral in Prague. The stained glass windows are worth the admission. We went unguided. But would go with a guide next time.

A True Wonder. One of the most amazing feats of architecture I have ever had the pleasure of viewing. It is an absolutely impressive structure that will leave you staring, mouth agape, truly feeling the heaviness of human labors and capabilities. Beautiful.
Beautiful old church. We tour St. Vitus after seeing the castle. Very beautiful with renovations going on. It doesn't take very long to tour.

One of the best cathedral in Europe. Visit it at least three times. Once in the morning, once in the afternoon and once in the night. The light is one of the main feature of this amazing cathedral, enjoy the sight of how it plays with the wonderful facade of this unique masterpiece

Can't miss it if in Prague. The architecture of the cathedral is beatiful and the surroundings are amazing.
I would have enjoyed being able to sit for a bit and feel the place. That was not possible.
You don't have to buy a ticket if you just want to enter and view the church.

Stained glass on an epic scale. If there is enough light outside, the stained glass windows are on a monumental scale. Though it is always crowded with tourists like me, so it is not a quiet contemplative atmosphere.

Gorgeous. As an Aussie, I get ABC syndrome a lot (ABC = Another Bloody Church syndrome) but St Vitus Cathedral is seriously impressive. I'd put it up there with St Marks in Venice, St Peters and Notre Dame. Worth the hike up the hill, though hard to get good photos from inside the courtyard unless you have a fisheye lense.

Gothic Wonder. Included in the Prague Castle area, the cathedral dominates the town. You should spend some time appreciating the external architecture of the cathedral before getting in...and once you're in you won't be disappointed at all.Clean, spacious, lighty....you will appreciate the couloured mosaics on glass windows.A real must see in a town plenty of nice churchs, but most of all in a rich baroc style.
Don't Bother. Way too many people!! Ruined the experience. We toured Prague Castle, St. Vitus Castle, and the Charles Bridge in one day and couldn't help bumping into people the entire time.
amazing. Fantastic stained glass windows. Worth a quick visit just for themIt was very busy so did not get a ticket for tour of whole church but would do so next time
Beautiful - A Must See. St. Vitus Cathedral is stunning. Anybody who visits Prague needs to see it. If you go to Prague and don't visit it, you are missing out in my opinion!

Highlight of the Castle Quarter. Pay the entrance fee. It's worth it (a Circuit B ticket offers the best value if you just want to see the highlights). Once you're through the barriers into the Cathedral proper, you might be surprised at how much of its majesty remains even as crowds swarm around you. The architecture is as stunning inside the cathedral as it is out, contains a fascinating range of tombs and relics, including the relics of St Wenceslas, along with a stained glass window designed by Alphonse Mucha. Arriving early might give you a few extra minutes of solitude, but don't expect it to last - or for the crowds to really be a problem.

Awesome--but start from the top. As everyone else has said, it is simply one of the most beautiful large cathedrals in Europe. Really awe inspiring for both adults and kids (10+). Only thing I'd suggest is taking the tram (#22) to the top and entering via the gardens rather than getting off early and walking up the steps. Its not just the steps, its the crowds. Taking the tram to the top gives you fresh legs to walk through the very interesting gardens while approaching the Cathedral from an alternative point of view.

Probably the most beautiful cathedral in the world.. Not overly extravagant but beautiful nonetheless. The stained glass was vivid and varied in style and the ambience striking. Well worth getting the ticket for the four main spots in the castle. It was only about £4 for students!
Amazing stained glass.. Stained glass is out of this world. Do buy a ticket to walk around the whole of the cathedral otherwise you will miss some of its beauty.

Outstanding Cathedral. Outstanding Cathedral, well worth the entrance fee.
So many beautiful Stained Glass Windows, alters etc. give yourself plenty of time here.
Very Spiritual

Beautiful, windows are spectacular. First glimpse walking up the hill is breathtaking, once inside stained glass windows are amazing! So many colors, maybe the most beautiful I have seen in the world! Ticket office is across from main interest, attendees were pleasant and helpful. Ticket taker inside was one of the only disappointments our entire trip. Bored and uninterested he did the church and Prague a disservice. I would definitely visit again
Don't just look from behind the rope. Highly recommend you pay the admission and see the whole place. Saint Wenceslas and saint Agnes worshipped here. Amazing stained glass and so much history!
Wonderful site!. A must see when visiting this City. Impressive interior with historical value for everyone visiting.

A peace of art. If you visit it at night, it will be be one of the most beautiful things you've ever seen.It's architecture is amazing. It definetly is a must when you visit Prague. I should have visited it more than once.

Be prepared. You have to be prepared to pay to view a lot of the cathedral but if you don't want to you just have a little area where you can view part of the building however you can still see some lovely old stain glass windows.

Beautiful Cathedral. Part of the Prague Castle complex, the Cathedral was far more beautiful than others we visited in Austria and Hungary.The stain glass windows are painted in very vibrant colours. A definite visit.

Awesome !. The Cathedral of St Vitus is truly a masterpiece. We have visited Prague 3 times now and always go back there. The ceilings are so high and you feel yuorself taken back in time by just being there.
My highlight!. This amazing Cathedral is truly breath-taking, it was our highlight. The structure is so enormous that it is hard to visually take it all in. Yuu must see it on your trip to Prague.
charming cathedral. what a huge & breath taking cathedral it's really deserve to be one of the best in whole Europe, i really like it.
Stunning. Beautiful cathedral, stained glass windows are stunning. Can see a lot of interior for free, but need to get ticket to see whole interior.

Impressive and Beautiful. The cathedral is impressive and bit imposing from the outside. The stain glass inside is absolutely beautiful. The view from the top (after walking up close to 300 stairs) is breath-taking and beautiful. Must! Highly recommend!

A must see ... pay the entrance fee to explore the Castle. This attraction is worth the entrance fee. In fact, we bought the ticket to see the whole Castle, including SV Cathedral. It was well worth it. Spend a whole day to explore this amazing complex.
Looks gorgeous. This gothic cathedral is amazing. It's very tall, you can't even take a photo of the whole cathedral becuase of that. Lots of tourists of course.

Awesome. Even as a non church goer it is hard not to marvel at the sheer scale and beauty of the Cathederal, from origins in 930 and the current building dating back in parts to 1344 it is truly one of the most incredible buildings.
gothic architecture. one of the top touristic items in Prague and visiting it explains why: ,one the best achieved cathedrals.very high roof,high and rich and .colourful stain glasses
Absolutely Awesome!!. You really have to check this place out!! So big I could not fit it all in the one photo without making it a panoramic photo!! A must while you are in Prague.

very nice but some renovation underway. Enjoyed our visit, but some renovation was underway while we were there. So, we didn't get to see as much of the interior as we would have liked. Windows are mostly modern, and I prefer the older Medieval ones.

Very crowded but worth it. The cathedral itself is gorgeous. It was extremely crowded inside and difficult to take pictures but there were many things to see. The intricacy caught my attention. The only downside was that the crypts were closed off.

Amazing example of Gothic architecture .... Impressive. St. Vitus cathedral in Prague Castle is one of the best example of amazing gothic architecture and is the biggest church in Czech Republic. The size of the cathedral on its own is massively impressive and the detailed work all over the cathedral is astonishing. The whole building on its own is a masterpiece. The stained glass murals in the cathedral are jaw dropping one of the best. This place worth a visit and should be one of the must see place in Prague. The cathedral is closed in morning and open to public at 12 noon, so a huge crowd gathers outside for pay a visit during this time. Crowd can be avoided if visit is planned for late afternoon.
Great view. It's a beautiful Cathedral and the art objects that adorn the walls and the architecture is really worth visiting and seeing.

Beautiful Cathedral and real crowded. Located up in the Castle Hill, so both outside and especially inside gets REAL crowded. They are doing some renovations outside, so exterior is partly covered. Inside Cathedral is really amazing. It's free of charge, but you have to pay little entrance fee if you wanna see every part of it.

outstanding. Just a quick visit inside this cathedral while at the Prague Castle. The stained glass is brilliant and spectacular, even on an overcast day. There is an open area where the public can easily go. If you wish to go closer and take more photos, you need a licence (which you get by paying Czn).
Impressive!. This cathedral really is worth a visit, although it is very crowded. The building itself is a masterpiece, and the interior is full of details worth exploring.

Must See, Worth Taking Guided Tour. The history of the Cathedral is interesting, but you would miss most of it without taking the guided tour. The tourist office arranges tours in various languages that include the Cathedral and the Palace, well worth the cost.

One of the top 10 attraction in Prague. Prazsky hrad is one of the top destination. In my personal opinion Prazsky hrad and Old town square are the most important places to visit.The church St. Vitus is on the top of the hill. The whole Prague is visible from Prazsky hrad. Just down is the presidential Garden. It's an awesome place to relax and enjoy its beauty.
What a beauty!. I think this is one of my favorite cathedrals in all of Europe. Its Gothic beauty is breathtaking. A must see when in prague.

Good, Not Awesome. This is a lovely cathedral with beautiful stained glass windows located in the Prague Castle complex. It is worth seeing if you are in the complex but it is not one of the great churches of the world. The outside of the church is much more impressive than the inside since it is architecturally and artistically relevant from all sides.
Get a Ticket & Go. My favorite place to visit inside the Prague Castle. Buy a ticket and take your time exploring the Cathedral from the inside out.

Another stunning cathedral in a city full of them. St Vitus' is within the Prague castle complex. There are various types of tickets that allow entry into different buildings within the area. I would recommend checking the website beforehand which you will want to visit and perhaps check the Prague Card website to see whether you can see everything that you want more cheaply.Entry to each individually is not expensive but if you can save a few pennies so much the better.

Awesome cathedral. Stained glass windows all over this huge cathedral, wood carvings, statues, gold and silver all over. Pick up an audio tour to learn about all the various sites. This is really full of tourists so pace yourself, no resting spots, cameras are OK.
Prague Castle. Allow TONS of time to tour the Prague Castle - it goes on and on and on. St. Vitus is the oldest part. Take it all in, but it is a major tourist attraction so expect crowds

Nice Stained Glass. I understand this is a historically important church for the country, but compared to other great churches in Europe this is a pretty average cathedral and doesn't seem to warrant the high rating. The highlight is definitely the unique style of stained glass windows. As with the other castle sites (and Prague generally) this place was very crowded.

Gothic giant next to the castle. The spires adorn Prague's skyline very prominently and feature in all photos of Prague.You cannot visit the inner sanctum without purchasing a whole booklet of tickets to other locations on castle hill, but if you just stay in the nave and click a couple of shots it might just be enough.
Worth it!. This is as amazing on the inside as it is on the outside, We bought the 250 Kc combined ticket mainly for entry to St Vitus and Golden Lane.
Much more than a church. A church with a impressive architecture, glass windows etc. and at the same time a museum. Well worth visiting.
very impressive. in terms of the outer view, it is the most impressive cathedral i have visited so far in europe. if you are in prague, you should certainly see it.

Fabulous Gothic Church. St. Vitas' Cathedral is on the grounds of the Prague Castle, and therefore it is included in the entry fee for the castle. You can wander most of the grounds of the castle for free but you cannot go inside the interior. St. Vitas' is worth the ticket for the interior. It was a King's church and you can certainly tell this was true.Very opulent, with much gilded, your ticket buys access to many sections (including below the altar). A must-see!

Another great European Cathedral. Sometimes you think you have had enough of the cathedrals after a couple of weeks in Europe, but each one has its special attraction and this one does not miss. There is a small admission fee to get full access and an add on charge to use a camera (new twist for us, but common in Prague). Admission has various options for Cathedral, Castle, etc. Fantastic views of the city for photo ops.

breathtaking. Visited this wonderful building on a ticket which allowed us to visit several places in the castle precinct. if you are over 65 you can get a ticket half price with proof of age. Prague is teeming with spectacular buildings and churches but St. Vitus is unmissable because of its beauty and place in the country's history. Be prepared for crowds

Amazing Gothic Cathedral. You have not seen Prague if you don't visit this stunning cathedral. Make sure you buy tickets that is the package. It gets you into the castle, palace and the golden lane, you don't want to miss. The cathedral has a sectioned off area that you can access with the package price, which was worth doing. You see the incredible stained glass windows up close and it also serves as a crowd control. Not everyone purchase the package and we found that we had a small reprieve from the crowds and enjoyed the beauty of the cathedral in more undisturbed fashion. Just beautiful!
Beautiful cathedral!. A must see in Prague. Gorgeous ceilings, mosaic windows, sculptures, paintings, royal treasures etc. It's worth 600 years to build as it's a masterpiece.
Gorgeous Gothic Cathedral. Absolutely incredible piece of medieval architecture. This is an absolute must-see on your visit to Prague.

Large Market Square. Large square with resturants and wandering minstrals that come and go during the day and evening. Very popular location. Beautiful at night with many churches and building lit up with floodlights. (Watch out for Segways operated by tourists)
Beautiful building. This is a beautiful building and well worth the paying for tickets to get right round the Cathedral. The stained glass windows are intricate and outstanding, as are the statues.
best cathedral we have ever visited. Windows are spectacular, sculpture is world class, a simply awe inspiring space. Wish we could go back again soon. ceilings, gothic architecture are splendid.

Eyegasmic!. This is a stunning Gothic catherdal and if you are like me who likes to snap the camera away, I suggest to bring a wide or fish eye lense on top of your other go-to lense(s).The internal and external details of this cathedral are just jaw dropping. My partner and I had to come back twice as we were just in awe. This means alot to me as I am not a big fan of Gothic, rather I am more of a baroque person. Though an external part of this cathedral was being renovated at that time we visited, it was compensated by the other facets and angles of this magnificent structure.It can get crowded inside, I suppose we need to see this again at a less touristy season.

Beautiful. Really beautiful church. We bought a ticket so we could see the whole church and it was defiantly worth it! There was a lot of beautiful things to see throughout the church and not so many people, so you could do without the stress of the mass.And get some good pictures.

At the castle.. beautiful church. Big, old, beautiful and the best part is its location. On the castle, on the top with Prague below. If you want to see just one church in Prague, this is the one you should choose.
Stay outside. Outside, is the main postcard of Prague and really impressive. Inside, there's not much to see. But you cannot go to Prague without take a picture in front of it.

magnificent Gothic cathedral at summit of Prague Palace hill. This is a magnificent Gothic cathedral visible from all over Prague as it tops Prague Castle. it is reminiscent of Notre Dame, especially from the rear. The interior is large with many sumptuous and lavish furnishings. Among other things, it has a wood relief map of Prague from centuries ago.

Absolutely Stunning. This is a stunning place to visit whilst you are in Prague. Architecturally, it is astounding in and out. It has some of the best stained glass windows I have ever seen - perfect for your snapping camera. The cathedral is a must see as it is one of the few gothic churches Prague has, aside from the Baroque. As other reviewers have noted it is a little difficult to take photos of the exterior as you are lodged between buildings, but if you lie on the floor like I did, you will get a great picture! Worth the money (it is cheap), the time and the climb up the hill. This is a must see in Prague!

Great church. It is combined with several attraction in the Prague castle. Magnificent church interior. One of the most worth visiting attraction in Prague. Super valuable if have a student discount. Relatively easy to reach.

Great Cathedral to visit. Like many churches and cathedrals in Prague and surrounding cities this has a lot to see. The difference is that this cathedral is much more Gothic in design and the architecture is definitely more unique. Inside is impressive as well so its worth the visit. Taking photos of the building outside is challenging since the building is super tall that the square surrounding it is small so a wide angle lens is needed. Even with that the photo angles dont make for great photos. Lots of things surrounding the Cathedral so buy the "A tour ticket" and the audio tour for the most impact. Keep in mind that you must put a deposit for the audio tour in cash ($50 euro per device) although the tickets for the entrance can be put on credit cards.

Wonderful. A really lovely cathedral. When you first go in you are taken aback by the vast height. You can go into the first part for free, but for a proper visit a ticket is needed (worth the money).
beautiful church. the stained glass windows and the beauty of the church itself.this is a free entrance as opposed to the others in this complex.visit the museum further down the path too.

Just incredible!. This cathedral is so incredible, so much history and beauty. The circuit 2 ticket allowed us to view the cathedral, palace, basilica and golden lane - well worth the 250 cz ($12). A delightful 2 hours.

Aazing, must visit. Went to Prague Castle and bought a ticket for K250 that included 4 sights and yes it was very much worth it. This Cathedral was amazing. Yes there was a long line but the wait was only 10 minutes and we where inside. Just amazing, stunning. Take your time and slowly go through this beautiful cathedral. There is so much to see. Yes I would go back if I am in Prague again

Awestruck.. This is a must see whilst visiting the castle. There are some magnificent cathedrals in Europe, but this one is something else. The stained glass windows blew my mind, not to mention the vastness of it all. Well worth the trip up, and it's a nice walk down into the city with many cafés and restaurants on the way. We booked a concert in St Basil's (in the same grounds) for the following night and were thoroughly delighted with the 1 hour concert.
absolutely stunning. amazing architecture. I love the detail that was put into the cathedral and just everything inside was beautiful to see
Castle, Miracle Mile. My second visit to Prague. This time they are ready for tourists, the city is fantastic. I would go back anytime, there is so much to see.
Wow. The stained glass inside is absolutely spectacular . The special Wenceslas chapel is a dud. Can't go in to see it.
Must. You have to see the cathedral for sure. It is just beautiful. Put it to your visiting plan! Probably it will be packed so you will have to wait, but it worths it.

The spiritual heart of the country. There are many cathedrals in Eastern Europe, but none took longer to build that this one. It is linked in every way to the development of the Czech state over the centuries. Even with it's conglomeration of styles, it is a beautiful building inside and out.

Back in time. St Vitus Cathedral inside Prague Castle is just like one of those midevil times films. It is filled with gargoyles all around the outside. Inside it is an enchanting work of art. A must see before you kick the can.
Impressive. Beautiful cathedral. Take your time and enjoy it. A very busy place. So impressive..Watch the steps.

St Vitus is simply astonishing!. The cathedral is one of the most amazing feats of architecture I've seen in Prague (and that's saying something! The city is MADE of gorgeous buildings everywhere you look). Its Gothic ceiling, its spires, and the sheer size of it will leave you awestruck (which was, of course, the intention of its architects).Even if you're not a medieval history buff, it's worth the trip just to see what people were able to accomplish hundreds of years ago. The intricate gold decorations and carved wood, the stained glass windows and rosettes all contribute to the cathedral's charm and beauty.Even with tourists milling about, the place has a serenity and a quiet majesty that you can't help but appreciate and remember.

Gothic masterpiece. If you enjoy history and architecture, it a must. Located at the Prague Castle. It is the oldest and most important church in Prague where coronations of Czech Kings and Queens took place as well as it is where former Czech kings were buried. It is a Gothic masterpiece.Take the tram 22 up to the Castle ( you will enter from behind). The royal gardens are beautiful, the Cathedral amazing, 14th century. You can see it almost from anywhere in Prague. Together with the castle, gardens, the Golden Lane, you need to spend a full day there.

Castle cathedral. Be sure to take tram 22 up the hill to the FIRST stop at the top and enter the castle grounds at the garden entrance. Gorgeous flowers, quiet, wonderful views of the back side of the castle and cathedral and NO tourists to speak of.
Fabulous stained glass. The stained glass windows in this magnificent cathedral, in the Castle district, are just amazing, This whole area is definitely worth a visit.

Awesome Church. After peeking in to see the Cathedral while on a walking tour we returned to get a better look. There was much commotion in the area due to an official visit from the president of a neighboring country and after standing in line to get in we found out the tickets to get inside beyond the roped are were to be purchased at the visitor center across from the church. Another line ... The tickets were reasonably priced. However there is no literature and the audio headsets were very expensive - we only had time (energy!) for the one location not the other museums. It would be nicer with a live person guiding, but the audio gives a simple tour of this magnificent Cathedral. It was crowded late May.
Lovely old church. This church is beautiful, has lovely stained glass and an aura of dignity. It is well within walking distance of the Bishop's House where we stayed.
Beautiful windows. The windows are superb but it is such a popular place that it attracts so many visitors that it loses much of its intended tranquillity.

It is just an OK cathedral to me. From outside, it is true that this cathedral is grand and huge; but inside it to be honest I am not that impressed.Addition to that at the moment we were there, it is just too crowded in the church and we cannot enjoy the serenity of the place.In my opinion Church of St. Nicholas is much better in the interior side.

Walk is worth it.... The walk is horrendous if you take the steps by mistake like us; I don't know if it was actually that bad but we were all hungover, full and boiling wearing our jumpers as the weather was forecast bad but turned out to be a beautiful day.By the time we reached St.Vitus all our moaning turned to gawps and gasps at how magnificent it is, a real wow moment.Defiantly worth the trek and a must do if your in Prague! Do not miss it!

Nice church, scaffolding in place. There is work being done on some small sections of the interior of this church, however it is still worth a visit to see the beautiful stained glass windows and the wall and ceiling murals. You need an entry ticket which can be combined with the other attractions here, being the Old Palace, Golden Lane and the Basilica of St George.

Huge cathedral, very beautiful and ornate. This is the biggest cathedral I've been to, and it is stunning. The only negative is that there is no literature available to tell you about anything inside; you only get this info if you pay for an audio device that you carry around pressed up to your ear, which I have used before and dislike. It would be nice to have another option

Beautiful cathedral. This is a beautiful cathedral, formal a central part of the castle complex. It's a spectacular building with some lovely stained glass windows. I've seen several European cathedrals but this is one of my favourites

A must if you are in Prague. Should be your first stop in the castle. Take your time and make sure you appreciate all the beauty in here. If you spend the money for the photography pass (which I'm not quite sure is enforced) this is the place you buy it for.
Great looking church. We visited on Sunday and were unable to go inside as there was a service on. It was beautiful from the outside so I imagine would be worth a look inside.

Amazing considering it took 6 centuries!. Located in the heart of the Prague castle district, it is a towering cathedral that will take your breath away! You can easily mistake it for being the Castle itself as most people often do!

How beautiful is this??. Oustanding beauty throughout - spent far longer than I thought I would and will return to spend more time at a later date. Really not to be missed and the history is fascinating.
Outstanding detailing. I love the stained glass. The cathedral is breathtaking and do make it a point to visit at 9AM... once it becomes 10AM, huge crowds and tour buses arrive.
A must see when in Prague. A must visit as within the castle grounds. Views from there are fantastic. I'm not big on history or architecture but even I was impressed
Must see. An impressive cathedral within the Castle complex. Must visit and see among other monuments in the Castle. Can get there quickly with the tram.

Beautiful church with lots of history. Take a tour - excellent! Lots of history that ties to Charles Bridge. On our e-bike tour, guide told different stories than palace guide; not conflicting but complementary.

Beautifull site. The cathedral is beautiful, it matches simular cathedrals in England, Germany, Austria and France. You can visit the entrance for free and have a view of the whole cathedral but to walk through the whole cathedral you have to buy a ticket. The ticket counter is somewhere outside. In busy times, there a cues and this can be very time consuming. We didn't do this. But we did climb the tower. The entrance to that is just outside the cathedral for a small fee. It is 287 stairs but fortunately there are seats at regular intervals. While climbing up, you see the clockwork, dials and all, beautifull. Then on top, the views are perfect. The roof-parts are magnificent and also the views.

Cathedral tour. Absolutely fantastic cathedral in amazing condition for its age and total value for money - take the option to look round the whole building as its well worth the £8 entry to the castle & cathedral

Worth seeing!. We arrived 10 minutes before they closed it to the public so just had enough time to get in for a look around, admire the architecture and take pictures of the gorgeous stained glass windows. It is quite spectacular. For a small fee (if you are up for it) you can climb the 287 steps of the spiral stair that leads up to the observation deck of the tower and which affords a panoramic view of the city that should not be missed. You even get a commemorative coin for your effort!

A Traveler's Delight. A visit to Prague (Praha) is never complete without visiting the St. Vitus Cathedral. Located in the background of the Prague Castle (another spectacular sight) this is synonymous with any person visiting Prague. If there was an Architecture 101 class in high school/college, then this would be the best example of classic Gothic architecture. The stained glass windows, the massive ceilings, the whole package- and one can see how it took so long to complete the work (~600 years). Any photographer- beginner or an expert will have a field day capturing it in their lenses. One phrase- DON'T MISS IT.HU

Simply stunning. The Cathedral stands proud as Prague's eternal guardian and is incredibly impressive from any point in the city. It is equally breath-taking on approach and entry as the walls seem to rise unendingly and the stained glass windows are beautiful. The Chapel of St Wenceslas was lovely (Wenceslas was assassinated on his brother's orders at the age of 28 in 935). His tomb is very simply covered with a red cloth. The detailed chapel decorations are 13th or 14th century at a guess. Outside the flying buttresses and gargoyles demand one's attention as does the Golden Gate above which is a 14th century mosaic of the Final Judgement. This is a must-see and entrance comes with the ticket to Prague Castle. The truly fit can climb the tower for a splendid view; we did not do so!

Very pretty cathedral - crowds were crazy!. You could not believe the crowds in the castle complex! The lines to get into St. Vitus' were long but moved quickly. But the whole complex was so crowded it was difficult to move about. I would still go though. The complex was interesting and one of the top attractions in Prague. I'm not sure I would say the castle attraction was great though.
Must see. This is worth visiting for the numerous stained glass windows alone. You can actually see a lot of it without paying for the full admission.

Impressive but not as old as you think. I was enthralled until I realized the work on this church had been done within the last 100 years, making it far less impressive than had it actually stood for 1000. That being said, the stained glass is unbelievable and as a burial ground for the Holy Roman Emperors its worth seeing and understand anyway.

Gorgeous example of baroque architecture . This is a must visit on any trip to Prague. When you enter the city, you see it towering in the distance across the river by the castle. At night, the lights give it a magical feel. The detail in the stone work is impressive. Great monument to visit by day and night because the effects are so vastly different. I simply couldn't snap enough pics to capture its majesty.

A Gem inside the walls.... Enjoy viewing old cathedrals, the interior of this one was very-very nice and it's not named Notre Dame., It was a Sunday afternoon, yes it was crowded and busy, but with patience, I worked my way into the areas I wanted to photograph. Yes it was worth the efforts to secure the memories.

Beautiful Cathedral. This Cathedral like so many other sites in Prague is a must see. It sits up on a hill next to the castle with a commanding view of the city. When you step in it you feel like your walking back in time. Even the stained glass is all original having survived so much violent history. It took around 500 years to complete I was told. Definitely do miss this stop when visiting Prague.
Amazing stained glass windows and soaring ceilings. Just what a medieval cathedral should be. The windows are absolutely amazing and the structure breath taking.
masterpiece!. The dominant of Prague castle that can be seen from most parts of Prague is a must visit! You can climb the stairs to south tower of this biggest cathedral in Prague as well :)

Impressed at its big scale and art. I was impressed at not only its scale of the church but many arts inside the church. Especially, the big stained glasses were beautiful because of its clear pictures, different from the normal stained glasses showing Jesus. Since a lot of persons were asked or sometimes scolded by security persons for their using flash when taking pictures by cameras, we should check if the camera is not in an automatic mode, which is flashing in the dark church.

Essential stop. Since the church tower soars over the city, you really can't NOT go, and it's well worth the trip. But at the castle, there are several ticket booths -- don't join the LONG line at the first one you see. Keep going.

Amazing architecture. This was a great visit, although a little too crowded. The cathedral is amazing with it's gothic architecture and beautiful windows. A very interesting (and unusual) story is that each window was made by a different artist. One of the artists (apparently the most famous one -- forgot his name) decided he would not only work his window in a different style but also paint the name of his sponsor (a bank) in the bottom right corner of the window. I've never seen that in a church and apparently this was accepted for the reputation this artist had in that time.
Spectcular. This cathedral has some of the most beautiful architecture. A very beautiful church! The price isn't bad either!
Beautiful. This for me was much nicer than Prague Castle. We didn't go in as the queue was far too long but I'm sure it would have been just as lovely inside.

Remarkable. The cathedral, for which construction began centuries ago, was only finished at the beginning of the 20th Century which is hard to believe. It's side altars, especially one done in tons of silver, are remarkable and the soaring late Gothic architecture is overwhelming.
Fantastic!. I do believe that this Cathedral have some magic! Staying there brings harmony and happiness no matter what weather is!

Castle and Cathedral. Cathedral is part of castle area and can be reached by taking No22 tram. It is a very ornate cathedral and definitely worth the visit.It is an easy walk back down to Charles Bridge.

Magnificent stained glass windows.. This whole area of Prague is worth visiting, although we were there in May it was hugely busy. The church is delightful. I recommend a visit if you are not too churched out.

Beautiful in the morning. If you are an early riser, walk up there early morning to get great pictures of the sun rising on the cathedral. The castle grounds first thing in the morning is great to get those perfect pictures with no crowds in them. I went up around 7 to 7:30 every morning and it was just me and the castle guards!

Beautiful. Lovely church with absolutely stunning stained glass!
You can enter for free in order to see it from the back but if you want to walk through it and go to the front, there's a ticket to be purchased.
Cathedral. Excellent, but no need to pay unless you are really into churches.....get a guide to tell you the info, we took the free tour

Beautiful stained glass. Unfortunately our guide rushed us through the cathedral, but we were amazed at the glorious stained glass, and the beautiful little side altars. I tried to spend some time at the remarkable solid silver altar figures, but the guide had already gone. There is also a jewel-encrusted alter which can only be seen from the aisle. I recommend you go on your own, which will allow you to take in all you see, which is a lot. There is an interesting obelisk in the courtyard,which is worth seeing.

beautiful. Lovely cathedral with beautiful frescos and statues. Worth a stop to see the interior. We love to visit the cathedrals of Europe, as well as the smaller churches....this is a very nice example of the Rococco style.

Great church at the castle. I wouldn't miss this church! Prague's catholic population is very small, but this church doesn't reflect that. It was build by a king who converted to Catholicism. We didn't pay to walk to the back, and what you are allowed access to is great! I recommend you walk in and take a look before you pay.

Imposive, impressive, incredibly beautuful.. You cannot be prepared to see such an imposing monument like this when walking together with thousands people and... here you are, standing in front of this huge facade.well worth all the waiting to get inside. A treasure trove.
Nice view. From the top of cathedral is very nice view. It is worth of money to pass through 287 stairs and have perfect view on big part of Prague.

Stunning. We arrived in Prague on business. Within 30 minutes we were checked into our hotel and 5 minutes later we were changed into running clothes. We left Praha 1 for the park north of the river. We ran through the city, over the river, and through the beautiful park (Stromovka) near the Planetarium. The Park was amazing. We ran west then south into Letenske Sady park. Running west through there, we went to the Cathedral and Castle. See my review on the castle. The cathedral was gorgeous and despite the renovations, the overall architecture, colors, and majesty was well worth the 11 mile run that day. We continued on to....Petrin Tower. See my review. ;)
A Cathedral in Prague. too many cathedrals so it was like many others. Stained glass windows were quite lovely and many of the outside features were different.

Impressive inside out. There were some constructions going on out the church. There were some scaffolding materials near the church entrance but only this part. Despite this, the structure of the church can still be appreciated. The magnificent altar and the beautiful stained glass windows were impressive.

Average. As an attraction I would say this cathedral is average (sorry). When you travel around Europe there are so many beautiful cathedrals that inspire you and leave your jaw dropping, but this wasn't one of them for me. Look at photos and decide if it appeals to you before you go.

Disappointment. The cathedral itself is beautiful, however, there is some preservation work taking place there now until the end of June 2014 and half of the building is covered by vlue material and other construction stuff so if you hope to take some pictures of this beautiful place you may be very disappointed. To revisit in July-August.
Do Go Inside!. this cathedral is stunning - don't be chincy, buy the ticket and go inside. And having a guide book tell you who is buried there is nice too (St. Wenceslas for one)

AWESOME ARCHITECTURE, HAS TO BE SEEN..!. I'm not a very religious person but, I do love going around the Worlds Cathedrals, Mosques, Temples etc, and admiring the sheer beauty of the buildings, not to mention how on Earth they managed to construct such aspiring works of art that have stood the test of time. When you consider they didn't posses such things like computers, slide rules, heavy machinery etc. truly remarkable indeed.Now St Vitus Cathedral is one of those magnificent places that you just have to visit while in Prague, and it's not easy to miss either due to it's location within the massive Prague castle which dominates the landscape for miles around. This was always the reason as they could intimidate and control the simple masses below keeping them in line, plus making sure the taxes were paid on time too, As you enter the Castle make sure you head straight for the Cathedral around early afternoon armed with a good guide book, or purchase a map as I did which has some very colourful descriptions of the Cathedral, as the dreaded tour groups have usually departed and are being marched elsewhere, I found this was the best time to visit and we did strike lucky as there was no queue either. For a small fee you can enter and explore this ancient wonder, now make sure you don't pay for the full package at the outside ticket office which covers the entire castle area as I found this to be way too expensive and plus a lot of the palaces have limited access etc. Better to pay small fees for what YOU want to see and avoid possible tour group queues.Now going around this Cathedral one is taken in with the grand splendour of the cavernous Cathedral including the colourful stained glass windows, crypts, the high alter, the Alfonse Mucha window is worth the admission price alone here. I have to admit I was blown away with this stunning Cathedral and I've seen plenty in my time including the Dom cathedral in Cologne, also the huge one in Palma. Constant reminders of a bygone era in people control before the arrival of 21st century media brainwashing, just enjoy the moment in quiet reflection before returning to the madness outside..!
Must see part of the castle. This Cathedral is definitely as stop you must make when visiting the Prague, and the castle more specifically. All of the Bohemian saints are buried inside.

go early. Cathedral beautiful inside and out. Loved the gargoyles. Mosaics are also very interesting. Inside was very crowded but still very beautiful stain glass windows. Don't miss the Mucha stain glass window.
Amazing. I've traveled around a lot and been to plenty of churches to the point that I tell myself, "No more". But this one was amazingly beautiful. The Alfonse Mucha stained window is a masterpiece.

St Vitus Cathedral. Amazing building and so much to see but I was disappointed that it was impossible to see it all due to the heavy load of tourists. You need to pick a quieter time to see this beautiful building
Another beautiful cathedral. Beautiful stained glass , and the origin of the term St. Vitus Dance for epilepsy...apparently St. Vitus had the illness

Stained glass window were awesome. Went in the afternoon and the light through the windows made you so peaceful. The cathedral is huge, take your time and ignore the mass of tourists. Metalwork is stunning on the high altar. I took more pictures of the outside than of the inside. Loved the steeples.

We all loved this Cathedral , inside and out.. Never go to Prague without a visit to the st vitus cathedral , this is like going back in time , so nice in and out. we were blown away by the standard of this building , i want to go back again.

Must-see attraction in Praha: avoiding crowds is key. I'm guessing that many of the somewhat negative reviews of St. Vitus stem from overcrowding. The timing of your visit is key. Huge convoys of tour buses come in mid-morning. Unless you're going to be first in line, I suggest going in the late afternoon after the tour buses stop. I arrived at the Castle at 2pm and encountered no line-ups. Mind you, this was in late April (off-season), but that's true for some of the negative reviews as well.Upon arriving at the Castle, go immediately to the Cathedral to assess how long the line-up is to enter. Then go to the ticket counter to assess that line-up. Knowing the hours that venues close will help you determine when the best time is to line up. There's certainly lots to see and photograph outside without having to pay any fee at all. But if the lines are reasonable, it is definitely worth the extra money to view the reserved area of the cathedral.The highlight of the cathedral is the stained-glass window by Alfons Mucha, as well as the high altar. However, it is the bare bones of this gothic cathedral that are truly spectacular. I toured the Cathedral in under 45 minutes, as crowds were limited. I used my Rick Steves tourbook, not an audioguide, but I do think you'll need some kind of extra information to make the tour worthwhile.Outside, you can take lots of photos of the spires and gargoyles, but be sure to catch the large mosaic. You can also pay to climb the tower, but unless you have a powerful camera, you might want to save your money, especially if you're going to be paying for other views such as that from the mini-Eiffel Tower.

Gorgeous!. This cathedral is gorgeous, however, you'll need to buy a ticket to be able to enjoy the whole church. With free admission, you can only walk into a very small portion of the church. Tourist beware, it's very crowded - people pushing and shoving. The stained glass was beautiful, especially on a sunny day!

huge building. We only saw the entrance as you have to pay to get in, but you get to see a lot from the entrance. We booked a tour, from Getyourguide, to see the castle, and the cathedral was included.
Overcrowded and over rated. Dissappointed overall with prague, whole city felt like a tourist trap. This cathedral was dirty, seemed to have 2000 people inside more than it should have.

One of the Better Cathedrals I've Seen in the World.. This cathedral is large. It is in the class of St. Peters, Dom in Cologne, and Westminster. The treasury is a separate ticket from the general admission and it is worth a look at the church booty. Tours are available. Beautiful stain glass windows, ornate silver cherubs, crypts, altars, and much more will impress you as well as it did to its patrons long ago. It is hard not to imagine the feeling it must have inspired in people. I don't think I could listen to a sermon but just look around. If you would like to see the cathedral and study up on it before you go there is a virtual tour on the St. Vitus Cathedral website. There is also a calendar of activities.I would allot at least an hour here in the cathedral to wander slowly through the church. Buy the all inclusive ticket to the museums and palace and this is included. The church is a bit cooler from the stones and it can provide a respite from the summer heat.

Too much to see and take in. We visited the the st vitus on a 3 day whirl wind tour of Prague. Situated in the centre of the Castle district you can reach it by tram, taxi or on a city tour. I suggest the tour as you get a really comprehensive run down on every thing they take you to. We did the 3 1/2 hour tour and it was fantastic. You need 3hours to do the castle alone.

Excellent example of Gothic architecture. You MUST visit this place while in Prague - St. Vithus Cathedral is one of the most beautiful example of Gothic architecture in Czech Republic. If you want only to take a quick look around you don't have to buy a ticket - you can enter the building without it, but you'll need one if you wish to walk around the church (I recommend buying tickets, the interior is breathtakingly beautiful and full of interesting details, also you can't see St. Wenclas Chapel without it). You can't buy ticket only for this cathedral though, so if your budget is really tight consider entering the cathedral without going further in. Either way you just have to visit this amazing place no matter what.

Crowded Place. The place at the entrance was very crowded even on weekdays. Crowd of tourists swelled or peaked especially during the changing of guards ceremony. We couldn't imagine what would it be like on weekend.
Amazing. Fantastic place. It is a must. Also the castle and the amazing walk from old town and the Charles Bridge. Many places to eat and drink on the way and also surrounding the cathedral.

Just amazing. This Cathedral, is just amazing. As you are walking towards it through the tunnel from the courtyard next to it, it just seems to go on and on forever into the sky. It's truly breathtaking.

Just another old church. It is billed as the most beautiful Church in Central Europe, but I found it to be pretty average. Much prettier artwork in other churches. Maybe it was because it was about the 25th church we had seen by then
Beautiful Church. This church was absolutely stunning! The architecture, the stained glass windows were amazing!! Well worth the cost of admission

Wow! They really knew how to do a church!. This is really spectacular.
Note that you can get in here (and most of the castle items) for free and at least see it. To walk around is a charge, but worth it.

Very impressive. Take an audio guide as there is very little written explanation around the cathedral. The building is very impressive and the stained glass windows are some of the best I have seen. there is one by Mucha which is particularly beautiful

Breathtaking cathedral. This is a gargantuan cathedral set atop a hill in Prague, one of the best examples of Gothic architecture in the whole of Europe. There's so much to see and do in the complex that buying a full ticket that gives you access to it all is a brilliant idea - especially the climb atop the tower.It's largely telling of the power the Catholic Church had during it's height that the cathedral dwarfs the castle in size and grandeur.I'd recommend putting aside a whole day for this if you can.
Most beautiful cathedral ever. My favorite part of Prague. Gothic. It's crowded so try to come several times to see it in different light and, perhaps, with fewer tourists.

Astonishing.. This building is simply amazing, if the traveller sees nothing else they must visit here. The government has begun to restore this cathedral, so it is two colors, blackish and cream and even this mix is quite a sight to see. Listen to the story of the way St Vitus was executed, but do it before eating!

Certainly a wonderful cathedral. This building certainly has the wow factor! Personally I don't like the throngs of people talking and taking photographs...a little bit of decorum should be commonsense. If Cathedral tours are your pleasure then this one is beautiful.
A good walk from the Kempinski Hotel. Over Easter we walked up to the Cathedral. The walk was very pleasant and rewarding to see the view of the city from the highest point.

Wonderful Cathedral . Wonderful and very beautiful Gothic cathedral. A must visit if you are in Prague. The only disappointment was the payment to have a tour of the insides of the cathedral and it was a little noisy, something I didn't see in places of worship elsewhere. One thing you have to do is to climb the 289 steps to the top of the tower and experience a breathtaking views of the city of Prague.
Beautiful. The Cathedral was absolutely magnificant, one of the highlights of my trip to Prague. I would recommend everyone visiting this city to see it
Wonderful Church!. Beautiful gothic construction, rich and ornate,lovely stained glass windows, definitely worth a visit

If you like gothic cathedral.... This is probably the only surviving or existing gothic cathedral in Prague area. Everything else is "Baroque" and even though I don't hate Baroque, there is just something about gothic cathedral that I love. This place is worth a visit and make sure to pay for the ticket to actually be able to go into it. It is free to view from the back, but all the lovely stained glass windows and other decorations will be missed from the free viewing area.
Beautiful Cathedral. The Cathedral was well worth a visit the statues and paintings are beautiful. Even if you are not religious it is well worth a visit.

St. Vitus Cathredal. St. Vitus Cathredal is very beautiful, but you have to really want to see it, because you have to climb a slope and some stairs to reach it. Requires physical preparation and does not produce wonderful pictures, because it is very close to the castle and you can't shoot it full on close. The photos will be better by far.

Not just another cathedral. Having been taken round a lot of cathedrals by my parents when I was a child, I have had a tendency to see each and every cathedral (with the exception of the Sagrada Familia) as yet another cathedral - a repetition of the same themes, altars and votive candles. However, I found the St Vitus particularly striking. It's very beautiful and I loved the stain glass windows with the light flooding in. Gorgeous.
Beautiful church. A visit to the Prague Castle and St. Vitus is a must if you're in Prague. Go early in the morning to avoid the crowds.

GREAT ARCHITECTURE. Located in the yard of Praque Castle, where is the Presidential Palace, the Archbishopic Palace the golden street of the alchemists, so is good for a tourist to see all these attractions and have wonderful views of the town from the castle. Reminds me a lot the Strassburg Cathedral. Excellent architecture, amazing vitrau windows, the statues, everything. Very Impressive, great experience for us.
very impressive. A huge and impressive cathedral, a part of the Castle of Prague. Worth a visit. Both the high turrets and the beautiful inside are very spectecural.

Stunning!!! . Totally in love with it, great building, so big! Amazing architecture, but unfortunately I couldn't manage to get inside and it was holidays when I went to Prague so it was packed with people. But definitely worth it a visit!
Interesting architecture!. Symbols on the facade are even grotesque, the gothic style is impressive and the stained glass windows are fabulous.
beautiful. Wonderful architecture. The stained glass windows were bright and colourful. There was a service in progress when we arrived so we didn't get to see all of the inside.
