A whole football field long. Amazing windows and interesting history for a church built over several centuries. worth the wait in line

Stunning St. Vitus. Impressive gothic style church that holds the Boehieman Crown Jewels (not viewable) and a dominant landmark seen throughout Prague skyline. Interesting to see the exterior of the cathedral since it was done at different times vs being finished all at once. You are able to notice the weathering of the exterior (ash color), and instead of it being a full gothic building their are renaissance and Baroque elements too. There is a beautiful mural in the third courtyard that actually has heaven and hell depicted on it. And you can not forgot the beautiful rose stain glassed window. If I head back to Prague I would venture inside to get a glimse of the royal crypts.
absolutely fantastic!!. I absolutely love this church! I couldn't stop clicking away, every turn, every angle, it's just perfect!!! And the flying buttresses!!! I live all the details of this church.
St Vitus. Beautiful Cathedral, very crowded on Monday mornings, a lot of school tours to maneuver through, but an incredibly beautiful cathedral.

Too crowded. I'm not saying it's an awful place. It's a nice cathedral (aren't they all?) but the amount of tourists is huge. You have to walk along with the crowds and can't stop whenever you want...no, keep walking! Best part: the window glasses.

Very impressive, a must see. It's impossible to miss this cathedral as you can see it from most of Prague. It's nestled atop a large hill inside the castle grounds and looks amazing both day and night. The walk up to the castle takes you along a very steep road, yet once at the top you will have amazing views across all of Prague and you'll get to see this amazing Cathedral up close. You can walk around the Cathedral for free or pay to go inside. Either way I highly recommend you make the trip up, at the very least to admire and stare at the exquisitely detailed exterior of the building.

The best Gothic cathedral. Of course I am a bit biast coming from Prague but this cathedral is absolutely beautiful and everyone I've ever met who seen it agreed. The outside and inside is an excellent example of Gothic architecture. Go during daytime to visit the inside but go at night for the magic of the entire castle and the cathedral.
Relaxing weekend break. Impressive but seen many more special cathedrals so questionable whether worth the extra cash to walk around it.

Closed on Palm Sunday. This fantastic gothic building is besieged by tourists so is closed on many occasions. So none of its internal treasures are visible. They need to arrange a ticket system for serious visitors as in Pisa and Florence. You can still admire the outside but that's not enough when you've made a special trip.

This Cathedral is need to visit. St. Vitus Cathedral, the first temple, where the ecclesiastic and the worldly power have been meeting and where various Czech princes, kings, emperors and archbishops repose. The Cathedral is a shrine and the resting place of the Godspell witnesses St. Vitus, St. Wenceslas, St. Adalbert and many more saints.
amazing. This is an amazing place we spent two days exploring all the nooks and crannies. I would recommend everyone visit. but remember to wear warm clothes as it is chilly up here.

Beautiful Building. If your visiting Prague I`m pretty sure you`ll have the old town square with it`s clock tower, the Charles bridge and the prague castle with the St Vitus Cathedral on the to visit list. It really is a beautiful building inside and out with its gargoyles dotted all around the outside and the sun shining through the stained glass windows inside. It would be worth doing a guided tour of the building if you cannot read Czech as all the signs and writing on the monuments are in Czech. All in all thoroughly enjoyed the trip around inside, we did not see where you can go up the tower to get a view of the city and surrounding areas but maybe if we had gotten that guided tour we would have been shown up.

Magical. You can see the cathedral from all over Prague and although the stonework has a covering of black dust polution over it, it is still a magnificent building. Take a climb to the top of the tower (additional small fee) for probably the best view of the city and best of all visit by night time, when daylight has faded and the stars are out. The cathedral maynot be open, but the crowds have gone and you can sit in the courtyard and stare up at the building seeing every small detail of it's architecture. a very romantic spot to share with someone special.

1973 & 2014. In 1973 my wife and I drove through Prague. We did not stop. We were on a 6 month trip around Europe in a VW. Camper. We had seen the dirty, grey, communist cities of Sophia, Budapest and Belgrade. Prague was just another crumbling hulk, not worth even a day out of 180. Wow what a difference 41 years makes! Prague is spectacular. For 2 months last Spring in Paris, and one month last Autumn in Florence, we toured the greatest cathedrals. Prague's St. Vitus is the equal of the best in France and Italy!
Amazing.. The façade is amazing. once inside the stain glass windows are lovely. Well worth a trip up the tower fantastic views of the city below.
WOW!. The front of the cathedral hits you as you enter the castle complex and takes your breath away. Full of interesting and well signed detail. The Mucha window in particular is breathtaking.

Crypt. Royal crypt was closed. And there wasn't any sign in front of the entrance. We have bought ticket just to see this crypt and we couldn't. They should leave adverts in front of entrance or at the ticket office if they have some exposition closed

Wonderful stained glass!. The cathedral is a lovely building and contains beautiful stained glass windows. There is an incredible tomb/monument of St John of Nepomuk made of real silver, which has been 'plonked' in the aisle near the High Altar. I'm not sure whether I liked it or not but it was interesting to see it. Saint Wenceslas' remains (of the Christmas carol fame) are in a side chapel in the cathedral. Whether you are religious or not the cathedral is definitely worth a visit.

Surprisingly Large. We waited to tour this until just before lunchtime, thinking it would be a quick in-and-out stop. We were certainly wrong! We ended up spending a couple of hours and missing lunch but honestly didn't mind. The free entrance only lets you see a bit - it's definitely worth buying the full ticket. We didn't get the guided tour but still were able to enjoy the beautiful architecture. Plan for an hour or two.
Just amazing!. amazing place to visit - I highly recommend visitin earlier in the day and paying a bit extra for the guided tour in order to get more out of your visit. Allow 3 hrs.

Amazing Design. If you plan to visit Prague, then you need to stop here. The church is very large. It is a busy but not too busy to visit. You may not be able to move around easily; however, you certainly can sit and enjoy the beauty of this facility. You really appreciate how long it took to construct the facility. I appreciated the genuine beauty of the facility. There is a small fee if you want to see the entire building; however, you can go in for free. How many opportunities do you have to see a building that is over 600 years old in a life time?

Breathtaking. Absolutely beautiful building. Would defiantly recommend buying the ticket to go all the way around the cathedral as free access only allows you to go inside but not all the way around. The stained glass is so lovely!
Beautiful. St virus cathedral is a tremendous building that took over 600 years to build, it's design is stunning and the views from outside are breathtaking

Grand!. One of the attractions in the Prague Castle complex is the St. Vitus Cathedral. It is a huge church with high ceiling and stained glass walls. I would have enjoyed it more if not for the throng of people visiting the attraction everyday. There simply was no space to move around and to just sit back and enjoy the beauty of the church. The solemnity of the place was also lost. I would love to be back and see this church without the thousands of visitors.

Incredible building - you have to climb the tower!. This is an incredible building. This is a must-see when visiting Prague. You are able to go in and see the building for free - however, if you want to walk round the whole building there is a small fee. I highly recommend climbing the tower to the top - there is a small fee to do this and there is quite a climb to the top but you will experience the most amazing views at the top and they even give you a souvenir coin to take home with you. Highly recommend this on you're to do list!

Gothic and awesome!. This cathedral was right up my alley. Its huge and very detailed with awesome gothic textures and creepy creatures making out the exterior. Its very beautiful on the inside aswell, but its the exterior that amazes me. Its buildings like this that makes me regret i didn't buy my SLR camera earlier.

stunning. we did not really want to do the prague castle tour but I did want to see the inside of this cathedral. it is possible to go inside and not pay and still see most of this with the most stunning stained glass
Better than expected.. Have seen many cathedrals and this really was worth a visit. Take a short visit ticket to see it more.

Magnificent building - climb the tower!. I am 76 and in reasonably good shape. I climbed the 300 stairs - no railing or landings but when we were there around noon on a Sunday at the end of March there was no crowd. We went u0 at our own pace. It was well worth it. People we passed were friendly. The view in all directions forever!

Go after the midday rush, and bring your student card!. This is a beautiful cathedral, and one of the highlights of our trip. The 1st time we came to the castle district (about 12pm) it was absolutely rammed, so we just had a quick look for free in the entrance to the cathedral. However, when we went up at 2pm, it was almost empty in comparison, and therefore a much more relaxed visit. In order to see around the cathedral in its entirety (make sure to check out the beautiful stained glass designed by Mucha) you have to buy 1 of 2 types of tickets. We chose the cheaper of the two, which allowed entry into the cathedral, the old palace, golden lane and the basilica which is 250kz (around £8.50), but with a student card I got in for half price! Unfortunately there isn't an option to visit just the cathedral, so make this part of your visit to the castle.My partner even made the bold claim that this was the most attractive cathedral he'd visited. So if you like medieval architecture, enjoy :)

A stunning building!. We went to the cathedral on part of a coach tour, it was one of the most amazing buildings i have ever seen, the architecture is out of this world! Simply beautiful and a must see!

Majestic. St Vitus wasn't at the top of my travel plans before arriving in Prague, however, we made the walk across Charles Bridge and up to the Palace and Church - and it turned out to be a highlight of the trip. The stained glass windows are particularly stunning. The gargoyles and facade were beautiful and the interior of the church had something quite special about it. It was extremely busy while we were there, and there was a line to pay and walk around the aisles, however it was possible to visit without paying if you keep to the back of the church.

Shame tours & their guides spoil the peaceful atmosphere. As advised by others we arrived early and got to see most of the way round with minimal other people but my goodness the few tour groups already there were awful. Glued to their cameras, pushing past you to rush to the next site their guide pointed out to take a few photos and then off to the next shrine or window. The guides were talking loudly and in one case clicking some kind of rattle to get attention and people were talking loudly, laughing and pulling daft poses for pictures. To me the serene atmosphere you usually find there is one of the best parts of visiting a cathedral but due to the utter lack of respect shown by tour groups that atmosphere was missing in places when we wandered round between 9 & 9:45am and seemed to have vanished entirely by 11 when we popped back in to see if we could get a better look at the stained windows near the entrance. I'm not religious in the slightest but I was a little shocked by the generally rude behaviour. That said there are some stunning little chapels, tombs and windows to see so I'd recommend going early and just waiting for any early tour groups to get past you before you move on. If you are out of peak season you may even get the odd moment you feel like you are the only person there.

Lots of interesting things to see.. A good place to visit and there is a very interesting area that you can see for free and a ticket is needed to venture further inside. Lots of history and plenty to see and hear about.

Most important land marks in Prague. This cathedral has some of the most beautiful architecture. Definitely is a rare find in Prague. A well respected and cherished in the city by all the people to love and enjoy.
Breathtaking!. I can't tell how amazing it is, went there on my last day and I wished I could have much time to visit it again. You can go in for free but need to pay if you like to go all the way.
Spectacular. Do not miss this fabulous cathedral. Filled with secret passages and legends, do read up on it a bit before you go, will make it all the more interesting.

Go to the Top!. The cathedral is gorgeous on the inside with the stain glass, along with the beautiful exterior of course. I recommend buying a ticket and walking to the top of the cathedral. Its about 300 steps, but the view is breathtaking and surreal. The price isn't bad either!

Simply Amazing.... If you find yourself in Prague, do not miss this cathedral. It is by far the most beautiful one I have ever been in. It is hard to put into words the awe inspiring beauty of St. Vitus Cathedral. There are stained glass windows surrounding you and when the light shines through them, it is simply breathtaking. While I have been in grander churches, older churches, and more famed churches, I have never had one amaze me the way this one did. As I said before, words cannot do this Cathedral justice. It is absolutely worth a visit - make sure to leave yourself enough time to walk through it in entirety and just take it in.
Wow. This cathedral is amazing -both when seen from afar and from within. You don't need to buy a ticket unless You want to explore every nook and cranny

Busy but brill. Prague Castle is well worth the walk up the hill to get to it and the cathedral is within the castle grounds so your entry ticket gets you into the cathedral too. The whole area is always busy and the cathedral is especially so. However don't let that put you off as it is a fantastic sight with beautiful windows, amazing ceilings and is really light. Don't bother climbing the tower, the views from the far end of the castle are just as good.
Best part of the castle. A must see in Prague. We had a private tour guide and the information was worth the price. A very beautiful church.

Stunning!. Well worth a visit but I didn't and wouldn't pay to enter. You can walk through the large entrance and see the cathedral inside which was enough to see the splendour and especially the stunning stained glass windows.

Most beautiful church I've ever been to. I'm not religious, but WOW. Bring your camera and pay for a photo-license, 'cause this is a sight you'll never want to forget. Don't forget to pay extra attention to the stained glass window designed by Mucha!

Typically grand european cathedral. Set in amongst the castle estate the cathedral stands out in contrast to the newer buildings. To see all of it you need to buy a castle admission ticket which is around £13 each, too expensive for this sort of attraction. But, you can see enough of the cathedral interior without paying for the extra yards. The stained glass windows were most impressive, it was a dull day but that didn't dampen the vivid colours. Well worth a visit.
Amazing Experience. Awesome experience, we loved it. The architecture and design was beautiful. Would highly recommend a visit.
Marvellous gothic church. An example of gothic style in this beautiful church. Pay the ticket to visit everything inside because it leaves you really astonished!
Worth a look. Very nice inside and free to see one end of it. Closes at 4pm and although we got there at 3.40 which is the last entry time it was still worth it and very good experience.

Unable to go in after 4pm. After quite a hike from the Old Town just as we were about to walk in through the huge doors, they slammed shut at 3.40pm. So make sure that you are there well before 4pm. My feet were so sore that I did not venture back up the hill again. Thank goodness I managed to see the Cathedral 35 years ago.

It will leave you in awe!. You cannot miss the cathedral! It dominates the Prague skyline, but until you come up close, you don't get the real feel for it! The detail of the each face of the building, stain glass windows, clock faces. I personally walked around it a few times to take in the sheer beauty. It's very impressive and you will no doubt be in awe.
Stunning. Be sure and buy tickets so you can see all the castle sights. If you don't have a ticket you can only see part of the cathedral.

Katedrála svatého Víta. It is located inside of the Prague Castle and contains the tombs of many Bohemian kings. The full name of the cathedral is St. Vitus, St. Wenceslas and St. Adalbert Cathedral and it is the seat of the Archbishop of Prague. The walls of the chapel are decorated with gemstones and paintings from the period of Charles IV. The cathedral is not only the royal treasury, but also the royal tomb. While I have no real affiliation with religion, this church will certainly awe you when you enter. It's beautiful.

Stunning. Over the top. Truly the most beautiful cathedral I have seen anywhere in Europe....actually anywhere in the world. I would have included photos but they don't even begin to do it justice. The architecture, stained glass, various carvings and artwork - superb.
Beautiful. Enjoyed exploring prague castle but st vitus cathedral was definetly the best part of the trip. Worth a visit. Onlynproblembis avoiding the school trips.

Awesome!. This place was awesome, even for someone like me who isn't religious. Could have wandered around here for ages but we were on a tour, we did intend going back but never quite got round to it

Beautiful cathedral. Stunning building inside and out - a must see. Pay for the ticket and make sure you walk around inside [you can stand inside for free - there is a small roped off area] as it is one of the best Cathedrals you will see.

Worth the trip. Since you must at least walk through the grounds of the Prague Castle (with or without a tour), it is worth the price of admission to walk through this cathedral. Probably not worth paying for a tour (although most things are poorly marked)--you can just read about it before going.
speechless. this is an amazing building and its huge has to be up there with the best i was in total awe bit of a hike to get to it but worth the climb
Amazing. We walked to the cathedral, uphill but lovely seeing all the quaint shops the cathedral itself is beautiful and we watch changing of the guards

THE cathedral when in Prague. If you visit only one church in Prague this is the one to see. It's distinguishable fro a distance, and is breathtaking up close. It is included in the short and long tickets for the castle and is definitely one of the things to see when in Prague!

Free to enter then pay if you want to. You can enter free and see all the splendid architecture and take pictures. If you want to go to the front then you pay but you see all for free... everything in the castle grounds you walk free.. I did not buy a prague card and I am glad I didnt.. I seen all I wanted to see free.... but a must visit..
Stunning. This magnificent cathedral is well worth a visit, particularly the stained glass windows which are beautiful.

beautiful. The best thing about entrance to the cathedra is that you can enter without paying and see the beauti of this bouilding. If You want to go closer to the altar or take a walk and see side alley you have to pay.

Very interesting . Beautiful cathedral. You can have a quick look inside without a ticket, but if you want to go further inside (which is recommendable) you have to buy a ticket. Do consider the audio guide which is great value for money.

beautiful ! you don´t need to pay.... You can go inside without paying any ticket and still see most of the cathedral. We payed the full ticket because we didnt know you were allowed to go inside and take pictures. With the ticket you get the chance to go through all the cathedral but honestly is not something you have to do.
the castle. jacup at the hotel told us how to take local bus to get there bus 22 to malastranska bus 18 to the castle, stunnings views well worth a visit

A quick visit is enough. This is a big, impressive church of course, with nice led-glass windows, nice artworks, etc. Maybe I would go up the tower next time for a view. But since it was gray on the day of our visit, we didn't do it. A quick walk around inside was enough for us.

Beautiful Architecture & Stained Glass. Our walking tour finished up at the cathedral (Prague Castle). The sheer size of it and it's architecture is stunning. You can pay to have a full tour inside or to go up the tower but you are able to enter the first area free of charge. Here you can see the beautiful stained glass windows. It was sunny when we went and they really glowed.You can also see the height and size if the cathedral from here.Definitely worth the hill climb up to visit. Recommended.

Beautiful church!. What a stunning building! My boyfriend and I decided to take the guided tour, thoroughly recommend this option, our guide spoke very good English and we learnt so much more than we would have absorbed doing it on our own. Also with the guide, you get access to the crypts below the church! It's huge inside, steeped in history with so many stories to tell. The stained glass windows alone are worth seeing, so beautiful! Very interesting building, with a load of talking points, well worth a visit!
Beautiful. We visited this Cathedral late last year and found it to be a reall lovely church to visit. I would defnitely recommend it.
Pay, pay ,pay. As common in Prague, we have to pay for most of the interesting places as cathedrals and others, Andin generalprices are really expensive when travelling with a family of 4

Breathtaking. This is one of the most important historical buildings in Prague, and is truly one of the most beautiful. It is located on the Castle grounds. The interior is calm and somber, the stained glass work is just breathtaking. I was delighted to be able to take pictures inside, as many times this is not allowed. Don't just go "see" it. Give yourself enough time to wander and take it all in, to absorb and "feel" it. It's a wonderful experience.

Great Tour!. Absolutely fabulous tour just finished with the owner himself, Marek! Was impressed by the organization, pictures for references, and sense of humor along the tour. Would recommend this tour to anyone remotely interested in learning more about the history of this country and city (I'm not really a history buff at all and I thoroughly enjoyed myself). I couldn't stop smiling and laughing at the Guide's jokes and anecdotes!
St. Vitus Cathedral - Overwhelmed!!!. Very beautiful cathedral. It is huge. The statues and the windows are amazing. Definitely worth visiting.
Stunning architecture. Unable to describe the time and effort in this masterpiece, ideally located for a walk from the centre of the city
Beautiful windows. Beautiful stained glass windows. Freezing in winter, be prepared. Very beautiful church. Each window from a different artist. Still has mass.

beautiful but don't pay. a lovely walk up to the castle. this is a beautiful building both inside and out. we paid just to climb up the tower for the stunning views. we could enter the cathedral without paying for the castle ticket. no, we couldn't access all areas of it, but the free entry offered us enough.
Stunning. Included in our castle ticket so great value. Imposing building. Unusual stained glass windows a particular hi-light.
Fabulous. Trully, really wonderful and charming. A place you must visit. Like a jewellery, beautiful architecture, like a lace.

Stunning. Worth the walk.. Great walk up to the Castle and Cathedral and a great view from the top. cathedral itself is like everything else in Prague, beautiful.
Walk from Charles Bridge through the park, past John Lennon wall and up to the Castle. Lovely on a nice day, but it's a good hours walk.
ok. It used to be free, now one has to pay. It is not that big thing compared to other cathedrals in Europe.
Imposing. The height and grander of this cathedral is breath-taking. There are many lovely churches in Prague and this one is among the best.

Must see. A definite must see, the Catholic Church sure did have some money back in the day. It's stunning and great for pictures. We did the audio guide too. I would recommend it as it adds meat to the bones of the visit. There is a charge for all the loos!
A Gothic Masterpiece!. St. Vitus Cathedral is a remarkable Cathedral with a glorious Gothic style entrance that dominates Prague's skyline! Simply stunning!

A highlight of Prague. This was definitely the highlight of our visit to Prague Castle, the rest of which wasn't anything special. The cathedral, however, is just stunning. The architecture is jaw-dropping, especially seeing it up close after observing it from across the river. It features some of the most spectacular stained and painted-glass windows I've seen anywhere in Europe, and the whole place is immense in scale. Definitely put this at the top of your list of things to see while in Prague!
Must see. Wow.It is beauty at day and night. You should spent there full day. Enough to see and enjoy. Really great
Beautiful Cathedral. What a beautiful cathedral. Conveniently near the castle. A truly amazing place. The stained glass windows are fantastic. Definitely worth visiting.

Well worth the hike!. I arrived very early however still very busy.I did not buy a ticket to enable me to go to the front of the cathedral.You can see enough off the cathedral from the entrance.It is a definite must see while in Prague. The walk down is very enjoyable.

Stunning. this is one of,to me, the best Cathedrals for sheer beauty in all of Europe. this Gothic style building can be seen from all over Prague. They only let a set # of people in each half hour and dependent on the crowds it is better in early morning or late afternoon after most of the guided tours have left. you usually have to hustle and maneuver for a good picture but your main pictures are in your mind and memories.

A musn't miss. It's worth the long haul up the hill to the Presidential Palace and this lovely cathedral. Principally gothic, the building actually took over six centuries to reach its present state, with the last building work in the 1920s. Entrance to the building is free and you get to view the nave and some of the fabulous stained glass windows. For the full thing, an entrance fee is required. Don't miss it. We even caught the changing of the guard at the palace guardhouse!

awesome. if you want to see more inside the cathedral, you have to pay, else the entrance is free. taking photos is sometimes difficult because there are so many tourists and the cathedral is so huge that you need enough space to take a good photo but there is not such space.
stunning. Had a fantastic guided trip really made the most of this great cathedral saw guards changing the history was fantastic a must to visit in Prague spent over 3 hours here
Breathtaking inside. When you enter the church don't be surprised if you and others loudly proclaim your surprise. The inside is really quite amazing.

A must see. My reason for a 4 is due to the lack of detail in comparison to many other churches i have been to, including st Nicholas in the lesser quater which was spectacular. The gothic architecture is beautiful. The ticket office is located opposite the entrance, many people walked in or queued to get sent back out. i know how precious time is when on holiday so i hope this is a helpful tip :D

Magnificent. We spent two hours walking around this wonderful 600 year old Gothic cathedral with its magnificent stained glass windows.I am not a religious person but enjoy visiting churches and cathedrals around the world and this was certainly one of the very best with interesting side chapels with artefacts and relics and the gargoyles on the exterior were extremely impressive.

Stunning architecture and stained-glass windows. Stunning architecture outside and in - a ceiling that is mind-blowing, and stained-glass windows that are truly beautiful. We were allowed to take photos inside too, which is quite unusual for a religious building. We also walked up the spiral staircase of the clock tower - only for the fit, though, as it is 291 steps from piazza to viewing platform. But once there, the views over the whole of Prague old town are stunning.
must see- ROmantic PLace. nice and hudge cathedral !!! go and see, take picture it worth the way over the river to it. We liked also the prague catle which is nearby to st. Vitus.

FANTASTIC -. For anyone who enjoys architecture, this is awesome. You need lots of time as there is so much to see. I only had a few hours so I will go back again later this year to take in all it has to offer.Amazing windows and the atmosphere takes your breath away

A must when you visit Prague. The cathedral dominates the city, being in the castle complex on the hill. You have to pay to be able to visit all parts of the cathedral, but if you do not want to, you can still go inside a short way and see the amazing stain glass windows. Outside be sure to go round to the right hand side of the castle to the original entrance, known as the Golden Portal, with the mosaic of the Last Judgement, Heaven and Hell. Be sure to check out the decorations on the fence around the Golden Portal - I am sure many visitors just walk past and do not notice the beautiful figures.We climbed the tower (287 steps) to get magnificent views of Prague and the river - you have to pay but it's not expensive and well worth the effort. You also get wonderful views of the roof of the cathedral.

Ruined by tourists. It's the eternal problem - being irritated by tourists even when you are one. But there are just some categories of tourist that are more offensive than others, I find. I try to be a low-key tourist as much as possible, and I notice a lot of other people are the same way. But there are some, SOME, who go about the place as though they have more right than anyone else in the whole world to be there, and St Vitus Cathedral seemed to be absolutely jam-packed with this particular beast. I went inside (it's beautiful both inside and out, but inside is particularly stunning) and in the space of five minutes, whilst standing and taking it in, I'd been barged into by not one, not two, but three obnoxious sorts speaking in inappropriately loud voices, two of whom were viewing the whole thing through their iPads. I was considering going out to buy the ticket to explore the whole of the Cathedral, but I was completely put off by the pushy, loud-mouthed throngs inside. It's a shame, because it really is a beautiful building.

Stunning church. One of the most beautiful attractions of the Prague castle (neglecting the religious influence). Don't just walk around outside, looking the impressive build, it worths the wait and the cost to go inside and admire the stained glasses and the whole interior.

A must. Its free and amazing, you will not be disappointment. Probably the most iconic building in prague maybe second to charles bridge, this cathedral took some seven centuries to build in its entirety which is reflected in its outside look. The stained windows are beautiful and there is a rich history surrounding the whole area.

definitely go in!. Make sure to go inside, as it is even more breathtaking than outside. The stained glass is some of the best I've seen, and it's worth the crowds to loop around through the cathedral and not just stick to the entrance. We got in with the combo ticket for the whole castle area.

Amazing View. Whilst the usual Cathedral viewing was great, the most impressive part of my visit, was the climb to the top, as the view over prague from the very top was sensational and worth the dizzy'ing stair climb. This could possibly be one the best view points of Prague the city has to offerInside the Cathedral was impressive for all of the detail and amount going on. To get in was free but limited and was worth getting the ticket for deeper access, this process was quite quick and simple (for me anyhow).As per usual, the exterior of the cathedral was big and ecompasing with great castle feel around it.Basically - Get to the TOP, its well worth the effort
Wonderful cathedral. The cathedral is a wonder of medieval architecture. The only problem was finding the ticket office which is in the building opposite the main door of the cathedral.

Huge vaulted cathedral. This can be visited as part of a ticket to the palace and surrounding attractions. It is enormous and is stunning, with a huge rose window and long stained glass window. I visited on a Saturday afternoon and it was busy, maybe better to go earlier to appreciate it more and get more of a feeling of the place without lots of other people.

Impressive cathedral. A very impressive cathedral, with wonderful vaulted gothic ceilings and beautiful stained glass windows. We bought the ticket that gave us access to the Cathedral, Palace, Basilica and Gold Lane. The cathedral was easily the best of them.
A magnificent cathedral. Very impressive. Lots and lots of stained glass and statues. I could have stent a full hour looking around.

Beautiful Cathedral. Well worth a visit and although you do have to pay to go in and wander around, you can go inside so far without. We were lucky in that we walked straight in and could appreciate the splendour of the place with hardly anyone to spoil our view down to the alter. However when we came back out there was a long queue waiting to go in so I expect its just the luck of the draw. The stained glass is the nicest I have seen.

Well worth the admission - if you have the time!. A magnificent Gothic cathedral with some stunning stained glass windows. You have to buy a ticket now as part of a package (ticket office opposite the cathedral) so I combined mine with St Georges Basilica and The Golden Lane.It is well worth a visit if you have the time, to wander around the building and discover the interesting corners of the cathedral. If you get the sun shining through the stained glass windows, the colours are magnificent. Information is not readily available and many people have no idea that the beautifully decorated side chapel contains the tomb of St. Wenceslas! The stonework carvings on the outside of the building are wonderful. In over 20 years of coming to Prague, this is the first time that I could climb the stairs to the main tower, it has always been closed before (separate admission charge); if you have the energy to climb the 280+ steps to the top, you will be rewarded with the most magnificent views over the city of Prague!

Great cathedral. This is a nice cathedral. We enjoyed seeing the stained glass! As we're here in January, it wasn't very crowded and also, it is VERY COLD! We were disappointed that there was no entrance to the crypts, which are always fun!

Beautiful but dont buy a ticket. Sensational building, very gothic style of architecture. The only problem with it is you have to buy tickets in a package and the cathedral is the only thing worth the money. You can still get photos from the outside though.
Old charm. Located near the Oldtown square.An architecture marvel, a must visit for architecture enthusiast.My friends and I went there during the day and night.
Unmissable. Beautiful cathedral. Excellent stained glass. A great selection of statues and well worth the entrance fee.

Terrific Gothic Cathedral. This is part of the Prague Castle. It is a well-preserved Gothic Cathedral and you should pay to get in. Be careful with the closing times. It was 16.00 when we were there but check before you arrive.
Don't pay the fee. Beautiful part of the castle. Expensive to enter but you can go into a roped-off area for free and see most of the building
Simply Amazing. I have been to many cathedrals in Germany, but this is just simply amazing. The history of it and the works of art were just astounding to look at.
Beautiful!. Nice walk on an unusual sunny January day. The stained glass by Mucha was especially interesting as we had just been to his museum the day before

Beautiful archictecture. Well preserved building although remarkably similar to the Dom of Cologne! It's part of the bigger "Prague Castle" experience and whilst entry is included with the ticket, I don't feel paying would be necessary to experience its magnitude.
Cathedral. Beautiful on the outside. Great to take photos of! Part of the Prague Castle grounds and easy to find.
Best part of the castle area. This is a very beautiful cathedral, but it was very dimly lit inside. It was worth the visit. If you are going to the castle anyway, this is a must while you are there.

Stunning windows. The cathedral is a must see on a visit to Prague. While you can walk into the entrance for free for a fee you can get entrance to the cathedral and other sites on the Castle grounds. I felt this ticket was well worth the charge as the back of the cathedral is stunning!You can take photos inside (no flash) although they won't do the location justice.
Massive Cathedral!. Stunning stained glass...glowed & projected all the colors of the rainbow as the sun shone through the glass!

The icing on the cake!. You can see St Vitus from almost anywhere in Prague, and it really is the pinnacle of this fabulous city. No trip to Prague is complete without a trip to the castle, and no trip to the castle complete without seeing St Vitus. Inside, very much like many cathedrals, but at least it is a reasonable entrance fee and you can get in without paying at all if you wish. A particular bug bear of mine is inflated entrance fees for places of worship as I increasingly see elsewhere.All in all, a 'must do' for Prague as part of your visit to the castle.
Huge. This cathedral is absolutely mammoth. So many striking features and details. Since it resides within Prague Castle it is easy to tour and I highly recommend taking the time to do so.

Beautiful Cathedral .....but not open on Sundays for touring. I loved the history of the cathedrals construction spanning several centuries but was disappointed there was no entry in Sundays, understandably due to services.

very gigantic-beautiful. Make sure your camera or ipod is charged. You may want lot and lot of photos. Before you enter make sure you look up. Every little step of the way is amazing in this collosal cathedral. The crypts, the chapel within this gigant. The semi precious stones. And most importantly, don't miss the windows by Alfons Mucha and the 2 or 3 ton silver tomb of Jan Nepomuk.

Gorgeous stained glass. This majestic cathedral is part of the must-see Prague Castle complex. The stained glass windows are beautiful, quite different from other cathedrals we've visited in Europe. Plan at least an hour to enjoy the architecture and artistry.

Stunning windows. This Gothic church is truly beautiful. One of the most striking features are the modern stained glass windows lining both sides. Everyone crowds around the tomb of St. Wenceslas, but I found the wood carvings that ring the back of the altar much more enchanting. You have to pay to get in, but it's worth it. You won't see anything while crushed in the hoards at the entrance outside the gate.

Beautiful, nice facts also.... This is a stunning church that looks more like a French church than a German, Austrian or Czech church. The altar is impressive and the windows also, but the fact that I enjoyed the most is that the good king Wenceslas from my favorite christmas carol is actually buried in that church and has a beautiful chappel
Extraordinary!. We didn't spend a lot of time here but it was beautifully decorated for the Christmas. We took it in as part of walking through the castle. Mustn't miss!
Amazing. What a building, right next to the Palace, so much to see you had to take your time walking through so you don't miss anything.
Breathtaking. Beautiful gothic church near castle, but once you see one gothic church, you see them all-dark, character, paintings, stained glass windows.
Gorgeous!. It is right behind the Prague's Castle, simply beautiful and one of the most imponent buildings I've ever seen. Well worth the climb!
Superbe!. A great cathedral. Go up thr 287 steps of the bell tower and witness one of the best view of Prague you'll ever see. The entire castle district is great. I recommend it.

breath taking. Well a long walk but my o my totally worth it. Dont think I have ever seen such a beautiful place. Very cold and the soldiers tho wouldn't speak did give the odd smile!!!!! and we were fine to stand and have photographs taken.
Stunning!. We attended Mass on Christmas day and could not have had a better experience. The church does not seem to be heated, so dress warm!

Like many cathedrals in the Catholic part of Europe very nice!. My wife and I went to this Cathedral, we liked it a lot... It's not the nicest one we've seen in Europe, but then again there are so many and such beautiful ones that it is not a shame in itself. I had the feeling that some of the glass windows were quite recent, but still they looked lovely and so do many other things in this Cathedral. The two nicest things in the church are the grave made from tons of silver and the chapel with it's stones. In all we spent between half an hour and an hour, which is enough. It is worth going, it is in fact lovely (specially when you come from protestant Europe like me).

A must see while in Prague. St. Vitus is visible from almost anywhere in Prague. It is an amazing cathedral and one of the best I have seen in Europe. If you don't have much time in Prague this is one of the must sees.
Must visit. We have visited just the interior, not the Kings graves underground. But you should not miss the cathedral.

Stunning!. Breathtaking cathedral! So beautiful and devout! My husband and I had the tickets to walk further into the cathedral and it was well worth it. Only bad moment was I stepped out of the "paid" section and turned to see if my husband was behind me and the woman guard touched me to stop me. Not ok!!

Inspiring!. We loved walking around this beautiful cathedral situated in the historic Prague castle with its Gothic interior. A must see is St. Wenceslas Chapel which is decorated with 1300 precious stones talking of which the good King's head has a special tomb in the cathedral. We will definitely visit again.

You can see without paying. A part of this cathedral is already satisfying to see without paying. You can buy a castle ticket combo for this cathedral if you want to visit the rest of it. Here the same thing for the rest of the castle is valid: come early in the morning!

Beautiful! Not to be missed.. After taking the 22 tram up to the top of the hill to Prague Castle, finding the cathedral was a pleasant bonus. Once inside it was quite simply stunning and the detail in the stonework and stained glass very impressive. You can also opt for a £5/$8 tour, or go for the block pass which gets you entry to many of the lovely places on site. Not to be missed.

Elegant and Breathtaking. The cathedral doesn’t just appeal from its architectural beauty but has a lot to offer in the inside as well. The structure forms the part of the whole Prague castle complex and the church just stands out with its own charm and beauty. The cathedral is one of the most famous one in Prague and due to which it does attracts a lot of crowd as well. The cathedral actually requires a bit of climb since being set on a hill. The chance to explore the interiors shouldn’t be missed and requires procuring a ticket. The whole place has lots of creative elements that will widen your eyes. The place carries a whole lot of interesting and beautiful statues all around. The church is beautiful in its exterior with its baroque and gothic architecture and then is also breathtaking from inside with its intricate carvings, mosaic and glass works and amazing statues all around.

Buy a ticket. Do buy a ticket and go inside and all the way round. This was my second visit here and the first time I just went into the free space and was disappointed but didn't have time for anymore. I think next time I will also have to take an audio guide as I didn't see any info boards or sheets. The stained glass is quite modern and very colourful - I love it. We also visited during the Christmas holidays and felt it was quite warm but then we're from the UK. The church had a lovely smell, a mix of pine tree and incense. It's a shame you can't just buy a ticket for this building, easily the best part of the complex.

Worth the visit if you’re into cathedrals. This place will only charm you if you're a frequent cathedral goer and examine every part of the cathedral on it's architecture and design of the interior and exterior. Otherwise, it's another typical cathedral to you. I'm not really a cathedral person but this cathedral has evidence of the good art work in it's frescoes and interior design. The attraction is partly free. We could go into the cathedral entrance but were stopped at the front pews. To enter the cathedral further right to the altar required a fee. This caused quite a jam at the entrance as people came in free but lingered around the entrance not wanting to pay the fee to enter right in. However if you're really interested, the fee will allow you in and this will give you access right to the altar and there are far fewer people so the viewing experience will be more pleasant. One of the things which I observed was that many may have missed the artwork on the exterior of the cathedral. Many took lots of photos of the cathedral exterior from a distance for the cathedral was huge, but didn't go up close to examine the sculptures and artwork. Again very intricately done and an equal or more effort put in compared to the interior so I would certainly recommend having a closer look at the exterior as well. 3 stars for an average visit for me.

A must see. We were completely impressed with this gorgeous Church. It's in perfect conditions and the whole construction is quite unbelievable . Beauty at its best. Too magnificent to describe. Don't miss this landmark . I would rank this one as one of my favorite experiences.

Baroque glory.... It is hard to take in the splendour of this Baroque masterpiece that sits in the centre of the Prague castle complex.The design and construction is opulent both outside and in and visitors are bowled over by the gilded treasures, statuary and icons that fill the interior space.

Best part of the whole castle complex. This was the best part of the half-day at the castle and complex. Beautiful and inspiring. The other aspects were interesting, but this was clearly everyone's favorite.

Look skyward. What a magnificent example of Gothic and Baroque art and architecture! Again, crowded with tourists but you have the resting place of a number of saints like St. John Nepomucene, Vitus and my favorite Wenceslas himself (or his head anyway). The side chapels and altars are marvels of the art of the times. There is a self-guided audio tour which fills in much of the gaps I have left here.
Beautiful neck breakingly tall building. Each inch has been carved beautifully.. A must visit if you love art! A must visit if you love designs.. Infact a must visit for any reason!!
Beautiful Cathedral. This makes the hike up the hill totally worth it. The stained glass windows are gorgeous as is the general architecture.

It took my breath away. I recommend not to follow the advice of other people just to go inside for the free space but buy a ticket and see the whole church. It's got magnificent stained glass windows and the silver sarcophagus under a canopy is a view to behold.

Beautiful view. The best thing about this place is the way to get there, you have to climb a hill, which today was very chilly, and there are several places with amazing views from Prague. I visited it a day before Christmas and most of the attractions inside Prague Castle were closed, but St. Vitus was opened and did not require a ticket to enter(not sure if it was due to the holiday). The architecture is amazing inside out, the sculptures that are part of the external area are amazing and a bit scary. The inside is also very interesting, churches in Czech Republic really seem different, the gothic lines and themes seem more present and the details all over need time to be appreciated. I believe it is always crowded, as even with the holiday and a day so cold I was asking myself why I was outside, there was a huge crowd. It is not easy to spend time really touring inside with so many people, but it is definitely worth it.

Spectacular architecture. If you're a fan of gothic architecture then this is a must see. With great photo op from outside and inside and wth many things to see, this most famous of cathedrals in Prague is a must visit.

What a view. It took me awhile to walk up the hill to the cathedral as the cobbled streets are very steep. But it is worth the effort,inside the cathedral is a spectacular building especially the stain glassed windows when viewed from inside. The view from the area surrounding the cathedral over looking the bridge down towards the town is wonderful hence I guess why it has been painted and photographed and is sold absolutely everwhere

Great History. Very interesting history about the building of this magnificent cathedral. We didn't go inside as we didn't want to pay but we enjoyed the magnificence of it from outside. It can be seen up on the hill within the Castle walls from many places in Prague. Looks like a fairy tale palace at night.

Pay the extra money to Climb the Tower!. The church itself was really cool to walk through. It is very beautiful inside and out. We walked through the church pretty quickly because we were not part of a tour and didn't have the audio guide. The audio guide may be worth it if you want to know more about the many statues inside the church. The best part for us was the climb up the south tower. The entrance to the tower is outside of the building and around the side from the main entrance. There is an extra fee and its 295 steps up a spiral staircase, which probably took about 15 minutes to climb, but was completely worth it! It was by far the best view of Prague and there weren't that many people at the top because its a separate ticket and a long climb. There are also benches inside the tower at the top if you need to rest after the climb.

Wonderfully preserved architecture. A visit to the Cathedral is a must; even if you are not a religious person. If you go with a tour guide they will explain how the Cathedral has been repaired and added onto over the centuries and decades. The stained glass windows are eel worth seeing. The President of the Czech Republic has his offices in the Cathedral complex so watch out for official cars speeding around the square. Czech drivers don't seem to value pedestrians. The changing of the guard is worth waiting for and if you have a good tour guide they will get you to the best spot for viewing the changing and tell you exactly how close you can stand to the guards. The guards are largely ceremonial, of course, but they are armed. If you go in winter it is a couple of degrees colder at the Cathedral because there is always a breeze, so do rug up as the cold will go right through you. We were told that in summer you can hardly move around the cathedral for tourists. Prague is currently a very popular tourist destination.

Gorgeous!. I was there in foggy weather but despite this fact the Cathedral is really amazing! It impresses from the first view. And while you're going around it you realize that it's a real masterpiece of architecture. It is totally worth visiting!

valuable St Vitus. well worth a visit; quite majestic inside but also quiet and peaceful; frequent services for those who wish to partake; lovely stained glass windows and artefacts. well worth a visit.
The best place in Prazhsky Hrad. It it the biggest and one of the most beautiful architectures in Prazhsky Hrad complex worth sightseeing. Inside it is even more astonishing than on the outside.
Fantastic Gothic building. Loved everything about this cathedral - the Stained Glass windows were fabulous and the whole place is just very ambient.

Astonishing. It's really hard to describe the magnitude of the visit experience. The cathedral is stunning, just takes your breath away, inside and out. Although just walking around it is amazing, be sure to get inside. Entry to the main hall is free of charge, but I recommend buying the ticket to get further inside and just being amazed with the amount of details, beautiful murals, sculptures and paintings. Just take the time and let the holy vibe of the place (even if, like myself, you're not a Christian) sink in. I really love cathedrals (if you didn't get that by now :) ) and this one I enjoyed most so far.

Beautiful inside and out. Today we were lucky enough to experience St Vitus' in the sunshne, making it seem even more beautiful than expected. Its sheer size as you enter the square will take your breath away. Inside the sunlight made the stained glass reflect coloured patterns across the center of the church, with is beautifully decorated. IT gets quite busy in the cordoned off 'free' area, so if you do get a castle ticket it is worth the wander round the cathedral to be able to experience all window, nooks and crannies. It is worth taking a guidebook that can explain some of the sights inside to you, so you can understand what you are looking at! Also remember to go further into the square to get panoramic views of the amazing building with all of its spires.

Well worth a visit and 300 ckz,. Straight over Charles bridge ,you can't miss it follow the crowds ,up a. Side street turn left to take the steps or just walk up the road footpath passed all the wee shops and restaurants.in through the castle and bang .this awesome cathedral will take your breathe away .a full ticket is 350,half is 250,ckz .the half was enough for me and my partner to walk around.until I got to the tower, get up the tower is another 150.I should have got full ticket..I went up for the photos and was not disappointed,360° of Prague ,beautiful.hope you enjoy it as much as I did ,amazing place .

Magnificent. Loved the stonework, magnificent building. Very crowded so do a bit of research into the best time to visit. 250k ($12) entry gets you into most of the other attractions in the Prague Castle as well.
Beautiful cathedral in Prague Castle. This is a very large, impressive church and is well worth the effort to see it on a tour of Prague Castle.

Stunning. The Cathedral is located in the Castle District on a hill overlooking Prague so it can be seen from miles around. It looks impressive from the city and it doesn't disappoint. There are 2 good walking routes to the Cathedral from the City - up the Castle Stairs or up the cobbled road of Nerudova - but also worth considering the "lazy option" on tram #22 which takes a very scenic route.Within the Castle, the basic ticket gives admission to another Basilica, a former Royal Palace and the Golden Lane as well as the Cathedral.If the stone and wood carvings are spectacular, the stained glass windows are simply mind-blowing in their beauty and richness of colour.You should wander round both the inside and outside at least twice - you will definitely see things the second time that you didn't see the first.Worth noting that this is not the warmest place in December !
Beautiful Church. It's a beautiful church looking from the outside. The design is very unique. Really glad that they preserve the church well.

Misleading. Impressive externally due to sheer size , the interior tells a different story .Feature stained glass windows sponsored by and featuring an insurance company logo and adverts ??? Sacriledge
Good but not great if you have already seen the top 5. Worth the visit especially if you are not already jaded. The overall Castle experience is definitely worth going.

Best cathedral we saw. Compared to the several other large cathedrals we saw in eastern Europe, this one takes the cake! First of all, it is huge! Its just as big on the inside as it looks from the outside. Secondly, the stained glass windows are amazing!!! They are put together with such tiny fragments and a broad spectrum of colors that all of them are breath-taking. To sweeten the deal, there are some really awesome wood carvings depicting important times in Prague's history. Its definitely worth the entrance fee!

Very beautiful cathedral. It's located up in a high hill that you can see and have nice view of prague in a sunny day..the cathedral is like the notre dam or friburg cathedarl vary big and magnific views..

you will feel like you have been taken back in time...your spirit will be renewed. the architecture, the windows, pictures could never do it justice. Do not miss this church.we visited early afternoon and the light in the windows was magical.

Lovely but busy!. The cathedral is the highlight of the castle visit. The coloured painted window are amazing. Once inside you get an idea of the huge size of the cathedral. If you visit on a Sunday you will not get in until midday as there is a mass before hand. It would be useful if there had of been a sign stating this!
Best stained glass windows!!!. Have seen waaaay too many cathredrals in my travels. However this one is worth the visit to see Mucha's gorgeous windows. Unique and memorable.

impressive. Absolut must see when in Prague and it is worth to pay the extra money to visit the whole cathedral as well as the royal tombs.You can also climb the tower to get great views.Even better with either audio or real guide.And yes,there s no heating inside,unlike in some of the Austrian churches

Best of Prague. So much to see. Beautiful church. A must see! The St Wencelas Chapel is lovely. Get the audio guide for castle and church. Well worth it. We were there in December and it was cold in the church so bundle up.

Grand and spectacular!. Entry is free, however, full access requires payment. Be sure to remove your hat on entry! Situated in the grounds of the castle area, which is a steep climb from the Charles bridge up the cobbled streets.

Beautiful and huge. We hired a 1 hour guide to take us through St. Vitus, which was helpful for the enormity of the church and a good value, considering that you do have to pay. The church is ripe in history and some of the current appointments are incredibly ornate and lovely to look at. I especially enjoyed the underground section, where you can see the original church outline, the basilica, and today's structure.
Marvelous. Absolutely stunning interior! The outside is pretty lovely too, but you must see it from the inside. So much bling!

The gothic beauty that towers over Prague castle. You just have to see it up close to grasp the true size of this amazing cathedral. The spires appear to touch the sky as you're looking up at them from the entrance. It's a true gothic masterpiece. It's even more evident when you stand in the middle of the cathedral and look up at the vaulted ceilings. The detail of the stained glass windows, carved stonework, and paintings are even more spectacular in person. I can honestly say that it is the most beautiful gothic cathedral I've ever seen. Do not let the crowds distract you from entering it. The lines move very quickly. You won't be disappointed.
Gorgeous. This was incredible. Definitely the best part of Prague castle. It is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have seen.

Very impressive. Truly magnificent from the outside.The interior views are awe inspiring! It is so vast and amazingly ornamented. In my opinion the best part of Prague Castle.One of the most amazing cathedrals I have seen.

Exceptional. Words cannot describe the grandure of this gothic cathedral. It's the most beautiful church I have ever seen. The architecture, art, craftsmanship are unlike anything the world does in current times. It's an architectural wonder and testament to the people of the Czech Republic and their Catholic faith.

St Vitus. The cathedral is the crowning glory of the fortified complex known popularly as Prague Castle and at nights the lights give it a magical mystical power and beauty as it towers over the city! I do 3 hour walking tours of the Hradcany/castle area and always take a look inside the cathedral and sometimes if time and not too busy get an entry to see it all. Being a Mucha fan I never get tired of admiring the stained glass window. Do not miss looking at St.Wenceslas Chapel and if time buy a separate ticket to go up the Bell Tower next to the Golden Portal entry on the side - if the weather is good!

Don't miss the Treasury. The Cathedral is part of the Castle and houses impressive remembrances of Prague's long history like the 1.5 ton silver casket of St. John of Nepomuk and the chapel of St. Wenceslas, built by Charles IV. Part of the chapel is a locked doorway to the chamber holding the Crown Jewels. This door has seven locks, the keys to which are held by seven different government or church officials, something some U.S. cities might consider. Now to the Treasury, which displays a fraction of the many religious treasures owned by the Cathedral. These crosses, monstrances, and reliquaries were designed and executed by the best craftsmen, who had access to gold, silver, and precious gems. Among the relics are the usual splinters from the cross but also rarer items like a swatch from the table cloth used at the Last Supper and a piece of the loin cloth Jesus wore on the cross. There is an extra charge to see these items; it is worth the cost.

Stunning. I didn't understand the size of this place until we got there after a nice leisurely walk from the Old Town. You just have to stand still and sort of lean back to just see how big it it.Once inside the stained glass windows take your breath away, the technical nature of them and the designs themselves are wonderful, it's just a shame that the photo's we too don't do them justice.Outside the work that was carried out to build the cathedral is just superb, ornate little touches to gothic structures that span big areas.It is a must see no matter what your religious views are

Amazing space!. The interior views are awe inspiring! So vast and amazingly ornamented you think you are looking at a painting even though you are standing in the middle of it.Definitely worth the whole tour just to explore some of the stonework, painting, stained glass, metal work and statuary.One of the most amazing cathedrals I have experienced.

nothing special. really nothing special when you get close to it, looks much better from Charle's bridge.I thought its expensive for what you are going to see. If i am ever back to prague, i wouldnt waste time going there.
Awesome. The size of this cathedral is overwhelming, but the multitude of stained glass windows (including one by the Czech artist, Mucha), is worth the price of admission.

Beautiful Peaceful Place. It starts with the fact that it's located inside the Prague Castle, that one a must-see place by itself. The strangely beautiful architecture of the cathedral. The many beautiful glass colored windows. The many altars, the paintings, the dome seen from inside. All that and the peace you feel when you enter the place. Great experience for all.

Awe Inspiring. It, like almost every thing in Prague, is free or very reasonable. Then it will cause you to stop and take deep breaths. It is easy for Americans to forget how young our history is. This Cathedral will put it all in perspective. Not decades, but centuries, of religious history revealed in every direction you look, And the splendor of the Stained Glass Windows, and tombs of Kings and Princes of the Church. Breath taking is no exaggeration.

A Dominant piece of Architecture. This tall standing Roman Catholic church where the Archbishop of Prague sits is a stunning building. Situated within the castle area, there you can also find tombs of many of their past ruling kings. Look up at the diagonal cris cross wooden ribs in the ceiling. See the gothic tower steeple and a must visit to the St. Wencelas Chapel. Gorgeous peaceful architecture.

Stunning place. This cathedral is a fantastic example of gothic architecture and can be seen from all over Prague.You can see the outside for free, as you can enter the castle grounds for nothing but if you want to go inside you need to buy a ticket.(KC250, for the short tour) The stained glass windows are beautiful and the cathedral looks wonderful, when bathed in the light that shines through. The tombs of Wenceslaus and St Vitus, himself, can be found here. You can climb the south tower and I beleive there is an extra charge for this, as I did not climb it, myself.
Great architecture. I love the architecture of this cathedral. The inside is just as much exciting! It is one of the most beautiful cathedrals I have seen in that style. Must see in Prague.
Like being at Reims. Designed by a French architect, this splendid gothic cathedral reminds you of its French kins. Most impressive. It's a must when you're up in the Burg.

Amazing. This cathedral is breathtaking. So large yet so detailed and beautiful. There is a lot to look at here which all the gargoyles and beautifully crafted exterior. Well worth a visit and one of my highlights when visiting Prague.Free to look at but costs to go in. We just admired it from the outside and it was still worth the visit.

Standard cathedral, nice windows. Was a pretty steep walk to get up to the castle but the stained glass windows were nice and the cathedral was OK. Nothing amazing if you've seen the ones in Florence or Rome.

Huge cathedral. The Vitus's Cathedral is huge. I visited the Prague castle compound on Sat. They have some sort of ceremony so I couldn't visit the place until 1 pm. Anyway, with the short trip ticket (250 CKZ) which allowed me to visit 4 locations in the Prague Castle Compound, I went to the other 4 places and could just come back to this St. Virus's Cathedral at the end. The Cathedral is huge but I really wonder that it looks like the Cologne Cathedral (Dom)! Here, all the cathedrals in Prague require entrance fee. If you have camera, the license to take picture is required. I had my DSLR camera so they asked me to pay 50 CKZ so I can bring my camera and can take pic in the Prague Castle compound.

Breathtaking!!. The views are amazing both inside and out at this cathedral! The stained glass here is beautiful! I was fortunate to visit while the sun was out and shining right through, bathing the interiors in rainbow lights. There is an additional fee if you want to climb up the South tower. There are almost 300 steps to get to the top so it is not for the out of shape, but the view from the top is amazing! Don't miss this if you are in Prague!

Historic Site. At night this is a magnificently lit site. The tomb of Good King Wenczeslaus is there. An unusual sight is a hand hanging over the inside of the front door - supposedly the hand of a thief who tried to steal from the church box.

Don't Miss this Cathedral. Fantastic church with beautiful windows. It took a long time to build but it has lots of character. Get a good guide book and read up on the history of this church started hundreds of years ago and finished in the 1920's
Gem on the hill. Superb building sitting atop Castle Hill--very interesting story of construction and very appealing interior.
Fantastic. Must see inside and out, so much to see. The cathedral looks fantastic by day, and even better at night.
stunning. the view from the outside was amazingly stunning, so breathtaking. didn't get a chance to visit the inside since we didn't know they closed early.

Stunning. The jewel in the crown of Prague Castle, absolutely stunning and breath taking. Those statements come from someone that isn't mad on architecture, but this building just blows you away.
Advice would be to get there early and savour the moment.
Incredible building. The building is really amazing, I would say this is must visit place. You can go in without buying ticket too.

Read up on the Church before your visit. This church is beautiful -- and contains many objects commemorating the history of the Czech Republic. I recommend reading up on them before you go...because you will be hustled along by the guards. The three most interesting to us were: A wooden relief of the city of Prague shows the result of the Battle of White Mountain where the Protestant King fled the city (see all the wagons filing along the roads and the Charles Bridge). This shows the city in the 1600's and it is fascinating to find landmarks!A silver tomb of St. John (who was thrown over the Charles Bridge) is spectacular (and notice the silver miners hovering over your shoulder). Also, the tomb of St. Vitus (you will hear many varied stories of his father torture of his son).

Incredible. This Cathedral looks majestic and grand, towering above the other buildings nearby. Its internal architecture is Gothic with many beautiful stained glasses. There're touching stories attached to the relics of St. Wenceslaus and St. Vitus. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful. The cathedral is gorgeous. You can get inside without paying but if you want a full look-around you have to pay. It's located within the Prague Castle complex. Definitely would recommend!!
Beautiful State Occasion Church. Quick look around is free - complete access costs a little. Incredible Stained Glass, and an interesting Silver Tomb. Well worth an hour.

Stunning. Stain glass windows were quite spectacular. Our guide pointed out an image of a man holding a pretzel (bottom left corner of window closest to the exit). Window was apparently sponsored by a wealthy family (who was in the pretzel and probably other businesses as well)!
Magnificent Cathedral. In the middle of the Praha castle, very impressive monument. Slightly better from outside than inside, but Gothic splendour at its Central European best.

Beautiful but busy. I visited the Cathedral as part of the castle short tour. It is very impressive particularly the stained glass windows. You can get into the entrance of the Cathedral without a ticket, but that part is very busy and filled with guided tours. It would have been nice if they had put information cards in English on some of the tombs as you were left wondering which important person was buried inside! Well worth a visit.

Beautiful church. The money that is contained within the walls of these buildings is phenomenal. You wonder where they could possibly put one more statue or painting. The size is incredible. Almost unbelievable that they could build these structures centuries ago

Impressive stained glass. We went in here as part of the short ticket for the castle area. The stained glass is breathtaking and there are lots of very elaborate tombs. It is probably an advantage to do one of the many tours or at least hire an audio guide. As it is the cathedral is still very impressive just to walk around. Unfortunately it is not possible to sit in the pews and breath in the atmosphere, or even to sit and say a prayer. Security is very tight and a step in the wrong direction immediately earned black looks and barked orders that I fortunately (or unfortunately) did not understand.
Glorious place. I visited it for the 2nd time, but the sheer size and decoration still give me chills, it must be seen.

Amazing and a must see. This is an amazing cathedral. I recommend purchasing the extra pass to see all of the parts of the church (only the entry way is free). Also, I recommend spending the money to take a tour of the castle and the cathedral. There is SOOO much history a tour with a guide book just doesn't fill the niche. You can also rent audio guides which is probably a good second (and cheaper) bet. If you have the stamina, ascend to the top of the tower. It costs extra but is well worth the few Euros. The top of the tower provides an amazing view of the entire Prague vista.

Buy a ticket to give you access to all areas. This is a beautiful cathedral and you can gain an insight by just viewing it from the front of the Cathedral. However, the stained glass windows and other are best viewed by buying a ticket to see all areas of the Cathedral. If you want to take photos you will need to purchase a ticket to allow you to do so. This costs very little in the grand scheme of things and whilst I have seen people complain at having to do so (or not buying a ticket but still taking pictures regardless of the rules) the alternative would no doubt have been slightly higher ticket prices for everyone.Anyone wanting great views of the city can get these by climbing the 300 steps of the South Tower (at an extra charge) - it is well worth it if you are fit enough!

Amazing Latin Mass held last Sunday of the month.. Lovely but tight security at the door I was fortunate that they seemed comfortable that I wanted to visit the cathedral for the Mass and wasn't a typical tourist so they let me in whilst others were not allowed in.Beautiful building and a real treat to visit.
Beautiful Church. Take a tour of this and you won't regret it. Went into the catacombs and saw the tombs and everything.

Interesting inside and out. A beautiful place to visit. The walk up the hill to the Castle is a bit steep, but catch the tram (number 22) and walk down! The cathedral is hard to miss from the bottom of the hill and is definitely worth the trip up to look inside.
Beautiful. No visit should be without a stop at this cathedral. One of many churches, but all worth a peek inside.

Your visit to Prague would be incomplete without it. Whilst I was in old town square I was looking for this cathedral. However later on I found out that it was actually located within the "Prague Castle" compound. This would be by far the most impressive cathedral in Prague and is definitely worth a visit, especially if you only see one cathedral, make it this one.We bought the 'short visit' ticket for 250czk which included entry to: St. Vitus Cathedral, Old Royal Palace, St. George's Basilica, Golden Lane with Daliborka Tower. We paid an additional 100czk each for the english guided tour. To me at least, most cathedral looks the same so it was worthwhile to have a guild there to tell you the history behind it to make it more interesting. The most impressive thing I found about this place is how they moved stone by stone the old wall to the side to expand the cathedral to what it is today. There was a lot of alters, chapels, big grand sarcophagus all within the cathedral to allow you more things to see.The royal jewels are also located here (upstairs to the left as you face the altar) however it is off limits to the public. No doubt you've hard of "Charlie", lot of things are named after him in this city. Charlie is buried in this cathedral, together with his four wives. Many of whom died at child birth. On our tour we also got to go underneath the cathedral to where the crypt are located which was different to other cathedral tours that we've been on.This is one of the most popular places so expect lots of people. I didn't realise this but your ticket can only allow you a SINGLE entry into this building so if you want to take photos, you must do so during the tour otherwise you can only get back in with another ticket.CoryKPS. if you can, try to time your visit with the changing of the guards which including a fanfare and the flag ceremony. It occurs daily at 12.00 in the first courtyard and is free of charge.
Best Stained Glass I've Seen. Move over Chagall. These contemporary windows, inspired by Chagall as it turns out and made after his, are breath-taking.
Great Cathedral. St Vitus is one of the most underrated, beautiful and best presented cathedral anywhere. It includes some of the best stained glass windows, included one by Alfons Mucha.
Beautiful. Beautiful cathedral with amazingly colourful glass windows. Well worth a visit just for the glass windows themselves.

Yes - It's Overwhelming. I've seen previous reviews here that say that this church is overwhelming. It certainly is.While I hate to say this about a church, it's so overwhelming that it's bothersome. There are many somewhat smaller churches in Prague that are much more impressive and meaningful that don't overwhelm the visitor.By all means, visit this church. It is unforgettable. But to this visitor, not as impressive as some others.
:o. When I first saw it as part of the McGee's CASTLE AFTER DARK tour, I couldn't find a word. It is big, huge, enormous, beautiful, must see. Definitely the most beautiful cathedral I've ever seen.

Stained Glass Windows. The stained glass windows are really amazing and worth visiting the whole castle complex. You can get in the entrance of the cathedral for free but seeing the splendour is worth the money.

Tower walk at the Cathedral. You can now climb the 287 steps to the top of the tower to get a very unique view and perspective of the cathedral and a 360 degree view of Prague. Our pictures taken will be the best ones of our trip. The climb is not that bad. I can't be in tight places as I am clusterphobic, but I followed my husband closely and there are thin windows every few turns a long with an interesting view of a huge church bell.$150 kc's for the climb and you get a coin to commemorate your efforts!

A beautiful place. It was really a WOW moment. I went into there as a part of the short ticket in the Prague Castle. There are so many beautiful sections to see and each section has unique story to tell.

Overwhelming. The church is so big it's incredible. You can enter for free and take some pictures and admire its inside, but you have to pay to go further. But it's worth, as I never see a cathedral like this one.

One of our favorite churches. We have visited a lot of Christian churches - the Duomo's in Florence and Milan, St. Mark's in Venice, St. Peter's and the other major basilicas in Rome, Notre Dame in Paris, St. Paul's & Westminster Abbey in London, just to name a few -- and we really weren't expecting St. Vitus to be in the same class. Not only is it, it blew us away. While it isn't #1 on our list - Sagrada Familia in Barcelona has that honor - it definitely is in the top 3.
