WOW. Must see to those obsessed with Gothic churches and the romantic feeling they inspire. Breathtaking, gorgeous, not enough adjectives and superlatives to describe. Left Prague feeling fond of King Wenceslaus.
Stunningly beautiful. Has to be one of the most beautiful cathedrals anywhere. Not to be missed. Its Gothic arches, stained glass windows and overall architecture are overwhelmingly gorgeous.

Must see in Prague. If you're visiting Prague for at least a day, I'd suggest you at least swing by the cathedral. While it shares many characteristics with other old cathedrals, it's still an impressive structure worth a visit. It doesn't cost even a CZK to just walk around and snap a few photos of the stained glass or architecture.

St Vitus Church. Stunning outside for photos. Similarly stunning inside. Use a camera like mine that takes clear lot light photos without a flash. Stunning silver sculptural monument inside and stained glass windows.
Beautiful church. This church was beautiful, a must see! We went inside and it held some beautiful stain glass. The outside was just as impressive with details all over the exterior.
Amazing. The cathedral is simply beautiful outside and in. We went to Prague castle on a Sunday afternoon and we were able to walk around the grounds and enter the Cathedral without paying a fee.
Spectacular!. The best thing to do in the Prague Castle grounds is to visit this beautiful cathedral. Take an audio tour if you have the time. The stained glass windows are truly magnificent.

Most impressive. Must be one of the largest cathedrals in the world. Very impressive in every respect. The architecture is stunning howver it does get very crowded at times , like most attractions in Prague
incredible. ..... Simply the most amazing man made structure I have ever seen. The detail and immense size of the building is aw inspiring. I know now why it took 700 years to complete.
Interesting. We took a guided tour through the cathedral which is a huge structure, very impressive, and it's history is quite interesting. It was really worth seeing.

Silver Tomb of St John is Over the Top. If you're into cathedrals, you'll likely enjoy St. Vitus. While it looks ancient, it was actually just completed in 1929. Its best features, in my opinion, are a) the baroque silver tomb of St John, which has a draped canopy supported by a squadron of silver angels (two tons of silver in all), and b) a window painted by Alfons Mucha which you would swear is stained glass. There is a small chapel off to one side, the Chapel of St Mary Magdalene, in which there is a small door – locked with seven locks – leading to the Coronation Chamber above the Golden Gate, where the Bohemian crown jewels are kept. The seven keys needed to unlock the door are held separately by 7 different holders, including the President of the Republic and the Mayor of Prague.
Prague best bits. Stunning !!!!!!! very busy but take the time to out to take pictures ....... by far the best part of the Prague Castle complex
Breathtaking structure, superb interior. This Cathedral is the finest piece of art you could come across in Prague, its interior is truly spectacular

Wonderful location. Enormous cathedral - really breathtaking and near the castle where you can see soldiers changing guard. The cathedral is in a really wonderful location and is quite amazing. Combine a visit to the cathedral with seeing Lobkowicz Palace which is in the castle grounds. Enough to occupy anyone for many hours.

Awesome History & Relics. We enjoyed this very much. Glad we went. One of very few churches we were able to light a candle. Restoration history is true dedication & we will enjoy the pictures we took with our family.
Must see. Can be very crowded but worth it. Remember that to get into the cathedral itself, rather than just the entry, you need to go to the ticket office across the square.

Great Gothic Church. Its not as well known as the one in Koln, much less the Duomo di Milano, or Notre Dame, but still an eminently and well worth-visiting Gothic masterpiece. It is also one of the few (perhaps the only) Catholic Churches in Czech that doesn't charge for entry -- what a disgusting, scandalous, detraction from the faith and Jesus' teachings, for those of us who believe in kneeling, not paying, to be able to pray.

St. Vitus and Castle. It was a drizzly day but pleasant to be inside; very well organized and signed. So much history there. Gorgeously appointed. Afterwards we enjoyed a hot mulled wine in the wee cafe. So pleasant.
Amazing stained glass windows. When you go to see this Cathedral, there is a definite "AW" moment when you get to the door step. Beautiful.

Worth the entry fee!. Part of the castle complex, this cathedral is exquisit if you love architecture. Be sure to read about the different renovations and why there are so many different "stiles" that coexist.
most beautiful place. you cant describe just how amazing the windows are here and pictures don't do it justice. A must see.
Huge!. One of the most beautiful cathedral I have ever seen - very high... climb upstaires - the best view of Prague from there, but quite high to go up - not for elderly.
must visit. St Vitus cathedral and Prague castle adjacent to it is a must visit site, the walk up the hill is breath taking and the view on top is amazing.
Truly beautiful. hear an organ recital here if you can. The rest speaks for itself. Eat at the fine restaurant up the road for suckling pig.

A Nice Outing. I took a trolley up most of the hill to the Cathedral and had a very enjoyable stroll around the grounds before touring the cathedral. It is well worth the visit - especially for the stained glass. Do walk back down the hill on the way back to the river and town

Incredibly Gothic Architecture. St. Vitus Cathedral has some incredible gothic architecture and history. We enjoyed spending half of a day walking around the Cathedral and palace grounds. We got the audio tour, which was a great way to learn more about the detail and specifics. It's very, very crowded inside the cathedral, so you can't really rush. The audio tour was perfect because it filled the time and explained things while being queued in line.
Immense. The building is enormous and contains wonderful stained glass and stonework. Inside you get a very good sense of its' historical importance.

Majestic. This is one of the most beautiful cathedrals we have ever visited. We had a tour guide who talked us through all the architecture from different periods, gave us the history of the Hapsburg dynasty and gave us some really interesting facts about the history of religion in Prague, influence of Hitler, the wars, etc. We went to the window where they tossed the Hapsburgs out to their death simply because they were Christians.
church in the castle. must do visit for every traveller going to Prague,beautiful location,liked the history behind it ,easy to get to by tram.

Impressive. An impressive edifice which marries the two sections so well. There is hundreds of years between the start and the finish of the building and yet it presents a seamless whole. The modern stained glass windows and the gargoyles are definitely worth a look.
amazing cathedral!. you should definitely visit this catedral, it is beautiful and it has a very interesting story. so you'd better read about it first or go in a free walking tour around the castle.

Worth going but it can be hard being a tourist.... It old. It's weird. It's musty and needs work inside and out. It costs. Strange sarcophagi like Westminster... Heavy history. Dazzling stained glass. Banging and grinding and dust and very dark paintings. Crowds of people. picturesque area. Much to see in surroundings too, but not a solemn place to pray...

The beautiful wherein we were stopped by photo police.. One thing that always irks me are sights that I go around the planet to visit that have stringent bans on photography FOR LITTLE APPARENT REASON, e.g. while the Tyne Church is the clear Old Town Landmark, the interior, while stunningly attractive, is not so "Holy" on the surface such that photos are not permitted.Even though I was just using a quiet camcorder with flash-off, I was heartily reprimanded by a priest. So I'll always remember Tyne church as the "unreasonable landmark"!
Stunning Cathedral. Well worth the walk up the long hill to go here, absolutely stunning architecture, was quite busy when we went but loved the feel of it inside

Good to go early, first thing..but really amazing. Enjoyed the Mucha stained glass and the sheer size when you go inside. Went early first thing to avoid crowds. Was a really good idea to do that. Also liked he golden lane...Kafka lived there....which is outside part of the castle complex.

Beautiful place in heart of Prague Castle. Come to this house of God and enjoy the beauty of the inside as well as the outside. This place has its Genius Loci and it is a must for every Christian coming to Prague. Hint: If you speak Czech and say: "Přicházím se jen přežehnat" the entrance is free.

St.Vitus in the castle area. When you visit the castle, you can visit the church, palace, chapel, golden lane etc. The long tour is 350czk and it includes the audio. Well worth the price, don't be late returning your audio. If so you will pay 350czk as a penalty. Afterwards, go straight away from the castle for a traditional Czech meal, cheap and delicious. The cabbage was delicious. We had the Bohemian plate, starter and 3 beers for 500 czk , Restaurace U Labuti. Share, the portions are huge!
Everything cost money. Can't go into any churches or the Cathedral without paying a hefty fee for the ticket and the line was really long to get in.

Beautiful cathedral and stained glass. A truly stunning cathedral. Magnificent and the stained glass windows are well worth the visit alone. There is a very special Mucha window, which is very special. A beautiful place in a beautiful city. The grounds are stunning and the views over the city spectacular. We also took in a musical concert in St Nicholas church behind the cathedral, which was truly lovely, the soprano was breath taking. There are lovely little streets and alleyways that surprise you at every corner! Take time and take comfortable shoes, you will walk a lot!! The restaurants at the bottom of the hill are great and cosy and a lot have a Parisien feel about them. Lovely lovely lovely what more can I say!

gorgeous and underrated.. Maybe this isn't THE reason to go to Prague but when you are there it is definitely a place to go. I've seen many of the great cathedrals and while this may not be a contender for top 10 or 20, it is still worth it. One of the most beautiful stained glass windows I've ever seen. Breathtaking.

Worth it. Definitely go in the afternoon so you don't have to wait so long in the hordes of people trying to get in. In my opinion, worth the cost to wander around the inside, especially in the older parts of the church. Really beautiful stained glass, murals, alters and other artwork.

Absolutely Spectacular. Absolutely breath-taking! We made a point of walking here every day we were in Prague just to look at it and it never got old. Unfortunately, we never went inside and it was just so busy all the time but it’s worth just taking a walk around and gawping at the sheer beauty and scale of it. One of the best I’ve seen, yet!

Stunning beyond belief. I have no particular religious belief, but you can't help but be moved by the beauty of this Cathedral.In particular the Art Deco stained glass , and the incredible gargoyles clinging to exterior just waiting to devour you.

Stunning Stained Glass. The cathedral is very impressive but what I liked most was the stained glass, There is even an art nouveau window which rather surprisingly fits in very well. In fact it was probably my favourite. Don't miss this when you visit Prague. Buy the castle full ticket - it's worth the money.

no flash photography. I got a few mean looks from some of the security staff, just watch ur camera they dont like flash photography. Plus it was really really crowded so always keep your bag in sight. but i can easily say it was a beautiful church and i would love to go back one day.
Beyond Beautiful. I saw this as part of 'The All Inclusive Tour' And its a must see for anyone travelling to Prague. Words cant describe the beauty of the cathedral and the intricate architecture.
Saint Vitus Cathedral. The history, and beauty of the interior. It was busy but there was still a sense of peace. there was. nothing we disliked

Such a magnificent cathedral. People will wonder why a palace was built so near to this building, they are almost on top of one another! The reason is that the palace was built first, and that the cathedral started off as a church, then was enlarged to a basilica, and finally became the cathedral it is today. The stained glass windows are amazing, and one designed and donated by the famous artist Mucha. Ensure you look at the silver statue of st., John, and get the guide to tell you why he is still so revered, and why he is locally known as the 5 star saint!
St Vitus Cathedral. No visit to Prague is complete without a visit to tjis grand cathedral. The stained glass windows are a class apart

Top site within the castle. The St.Vitus cathedral is located in the Prague castle grounds and is probably the most popular site within the castle. You can see why when you enter and gaze upon the beautiful interiors and stunning stained-glass windows

Stunning. This was my favorite building in Prague. The interior was stunning. If possible, try to go on a sunny day to get the maximum benefit of the beautiful stained glass windows. Unfortunately, this was the one place in Prague where the large crowd slightly got in the way of the experience. If I did it again, I would try to go as early in the day as possible.
must see. A must see church - spectacular exterior and beautiful surrounding palaces' view. Not as beautiful as sagrada, Notre same or sacre coeur, but up there for sure'
Everyone visit this. We had a private tour and really enjoyed this place. It is high on the hill so be prepared to walk up. Lots of people visit this place so it get crowded. Beautiful location.

Breathtaking building. Went to visit this cathedral during a walking tour of Prague. In spite of the rain and the scaffolding (for the clean up of the building), it was an absolutely breath taking building.Would love to see it again without the scaffolding.

A Patchwork Cathedral. You are able to visit part of the inside of the cathedral without buying tickets and, as we were visiting as a part of a guided tour around the city, this is what we did. The inside of the cathedral is gorgeous and the view of the stained glass windows is beautiful from inside the cathedral. The cathedral took centuries to build and this is exemplified from the different styles of architecture visible from the outside. The cathedral isn't the best that I've seen, but it is still beautiful and an interesting visit. As it is next to the castle, it's definitely worth a quick visit - even if you are just viewing the un-ticketed section of it.

Another cathedral. This is not a cathedral that is going to stay in my memory .... there are way better cathedrals in Europe. I think it is one of those places you should go to but don't beat yourself up if you don't get there!

Inside the Prague Castle - Beautiful Place!. We decided not to pay for the tour, especially as we were limited for time, so we just visited the main part of the Cathedral and admired what we could. It's a beautiful building, both inside and outside, and somewhat different from other cathedrals in that it was constructed over centuries so there are different architectural styles all rolled into the one building. Very interesting place and next time we visit Prague, we plan to leave enough time to tour the entire place.
Beautiful, magnificent. The churches in Prague are not to be missed, even if you are not religious. The interiors are spectacular, architectural wonders.
A Little of everything. This cathedral took hundreds of years to complete and therefore you can see many different architectural forms. This is a must see when visiting Prague.
A Must See!. One of Prague's crown jewels. This cathedral is magnificent and worth a visit. It is located in the castle district.

Amazing. This is a fantastic Cathedral; you have to visit it. We were struck by the sheer size and reverence of the place.
We decided to just visit the main part of the Cathedral and didn't pay the additional fee to view other parts.
A true heritage site. The Cathedral is not only beautiful but has played an important role in Czech history. Should not be missed.

Beautiful cathedral. This cathedral is amazing. You can go in and take photos for free but will need to pay to walk around (we didn't feel the need as you can see it all from the photo area). We also went up the tower and that was well worth the visit. The tower is not included in the full ticket but we just payed the 150 to go up and it was lovely.

It's huge!. This is a huge cathedral, located right in the middle of a castle complex, so it's a one of a kind experience. There is an entrance fee to get to see the inner parts of the cathedral, but you can see pretty much from the entrance, without having to pay for it. The ticket for it also includes some other attractions on the surroundings, so it might be worth for those who like it.

lives up to expectations. St Vitus is a typical medieval cathedral, breath taking beauty, lots of tombs etc with a soaring roof. The Tomb of John of Nepomuk is a fantastic piece of work in solid silver and the Golden Gate mosaics are worth a visit on their own.

Nice but... If you really want to see the interior, don't put this off until your last day in Prague. They will occasionally close it in preparation for a concert, often hours before the concert is scheduled to start. So even though the last entry is at 16:00, there's a chance you might not get in even at noon, or 2.
stunning. Toured here with a private guide. Stunning space, beautiful windows, history of church very interesting.
St. Vitus Cathedral. Beautiful Cathedral but you have to buy the castle pass to get up and close and take a picture. Go in look around and leave. It's not worth buying the castle pass.

Wow. I've been to St. Peter's in Rome and the Duomo in Florence, and this ranks up there with those great edifices. It's well worth it to get the short ticket pass (4 sites) to see all of the inside of this exquisite cathedral.

Love it!. A huge huge cathedral, impressive on the outside, astoundingly beautiful on the inside. The many stained glasses, each of different images, are just magnificent. The sculptures, are so life-like, the details on them, the expression.. I could look at them for a long time marveling at the exquisite workmanship... This is a place not to be missed.

Extraordinary. This is an incredible site for perspective on history, religion, and scenic panoramas. We were really glad we saved several hours to see the cathedral. It would be overwhelming otherwise and is much too magnificent to rush through. Outside, it is the most recognizable landmark of Prague and demands your attention, with its double spires and its austere architecture. Inside, it is filled with stunning art, architecture, and religious symbols. The stain glass windows are among the most gorgeous in the world. The numerous tombs and altars tell the history of hundreds of years. The art work in the ceilings and the organ are breath-taking. Neither of us is drawn to must-see churches and cathedrals, and we were mesmerized by this cathedral.

Stunningly beautiful. Echoing what others have said. This amazing cathedral has to be seen. The audio guide is helpful understanding all the different ages and architectural styles. Entering the vestibule is free, so OK if you are on a tight budget, or not big on Cathedrals. Otherwise entry is included with both the short & long Castle tours.

St. Vitus Cathedral - not just another cathedral. If you have been to Europe before, you know you have seen many, many cathedrals. No, they do not all look alike! This beautiful cathedral has gorgeous stained glass windows and a fantastic organ with a beautiful, soaring exterior. Well worth a look so don't miss it!

Magnificent Building. Very popular spot for sightseeing This building is in the castle and is a magnificent cathedral The stained glass windows are huge and very old . Unfortunately you have to pay to see more.

Highlight of Prague Castle grounds. St. Vitus Cathedral is probably the most impressive church I've seen so far in my European travels. It is massive, and the inside is beautiful. Stained glass windows are huge and intricate, the ceilings are so tall, it's just really a phenomenal architectural feat that you have to see to believe. For me, this was the highlight of Prague Castle.

Stunning Cathederal In Prague Castel. St. Vitus Cathederal is a large stunning Cathederal in the Prague castle complex. With high towers it is a great example of the architecture of medieval times. The inside is as spectacular as the outside and should be seen on a visit to Prague
Huge cathedral. So much to see here, it's included in the castle entrance fee. The tomb of St Wenceslas is here along with many other chapels and art work.
Beautiful. Incredible structure with a beautiful interior. The history and architecture is amazing. Make sure you go inside.
Beautiful. A truly stunning building with outstanding stained glass windows. Quite a hike to get up the hill but worth it for the views alone. Medieval architecture at its best

Beautiful windows. The windows are some of the most beautiful I've ever seen in a church. Ticket pricing is complex and gives options for what sites to see within the castle walls including the cathedral, the castle and alley. Well worth hike up stairs to get to castle. Lots of cafe options once get into castle.
Beware of Tours. If you go when it opens in the morning, the tours will overwhelm your visit. There is much space to appreciate in this midevil setting, but too many people can make it feel cramped

Mucha's stained glass windows!. The cathedral itself looks amazing! You can't actually get a very good shot of the front facade, unless you have an ultra wide angle lens, because once you enter the castle complex, the imposing cathedral is right there in front of your face...Don't miss Mucha's masterpiece-the stained glass windows to your right, they are definitely breathtaking!
Must See Cathedral. Fantastic Cathedral with outstanding stained glass features and lovely paintings. Must see attraction within the stunning grounds of Prague Castle
Awesome Sight. The architecture and the grandeur of the Cathedral is breath taking! This is a must do visit for every traveller going to Prague.

Do the whole tour. Off course the cathedral is worth a visit. However I was surprised at how much there is to see when you walk around.
It is certainly worth your while to get the ticket and do the complete tour.
Fairytale. It is a beautiful cathedral. Words alone can't describe its beauty. It is like out of a fairtale to look at it at night. It is extraordinary.

masterpiece. Perhaps of all the churches we have seen on this trip so far we liked St.Vitus cathedral the most.It is totally breath taking.Make sure to buy a ticket to visit the catacombes and the parts otherwise inaccassible.

Visit it on your tour. You will need to purchase a multisite ticket to enjoy the full cathedral -- worth the price. Outside in the rain was a gas. The cathedral has a wonderful array of gargoyles and to see the water coming out of their mouths was fun indeed.

Gothic Masterpiece. The exterior of this Gothic masterpiece is its most remarkable aspect. Towering spires and gargoyles dominate the façade while the interior is quite normal the detail on the church is simply exquisite.

Spectacular. St. Vitus Cathedral is spectacular and should not be missed. We were there with a tour group but then went back on our own. Pay to get a ticket so you can really walk around. Also, try to go when the sun is high enough to shine through the stained glass windows. If you do, you will be rewarded with beautiful reflections on the walls and an even more memorable experience.
Spectacular. It is everything one would expect of Prague. Given the sheer numbers of people, it is remarkably enjoyable. There is SO much to see, plan on taking your time.
Impressive!!. I was amazed to see this beautfiul cathedral, I think is one of the most beautiful I've ever seen. If you love the gothic architecture you must see this.
Astounding. This is the most amazing cathedral I saw while touring Prague. It is a must see. Located near the castle.

amazing architecture. LIKES: Gorgeous building with in the Palace grounds, you'll find the front of St. Vitus was remodelled1929 and the rest is the original part of the building dating back 1370Dislike: hike going up on our first day.
The Cathedral. I liked the history behind it and the effort into making it be a central place of worship. The information pamphlets in many languages were great.

ADC? another d... cathedral. What did a 14 year old do to deserve 2 attempts before executing him? Tough way to get a cathedral, but if you haven't seen enough of these, take a look, here the story and soak it up.

Grand Cathedral in the Prague Castle complex. Impressive details both on the exterior and interior. When you go through the small passage way and boom, the massive structure just stood right in front of you. It is very very impressive. Did the tour ourselves with audio guide, a must do touristy thing in Prague. Golden lane was interesting, still cannot figure out why people are so tiny back then. Kafka was said to be a one time resident of the Golden lane.
Beautiful. An amazingly beautiful cathedral. The stained glass windows and sheer size will make you gasp. The view of Prague from. This location alone is worth the visit.

Love Cathedrals? See this one!. St. Vitus' Cathedral is a gorgeous example of a gothic cathedral. It contains quite a few over-the top art treasures. I loved the Mucha window on the left and the lovely gold mosaic on the right side of the church.

Very impressive cathedral.. C1 ( 2013.09.03 )
This cathedral was very impressive. The interior and exterior of cathedral was very magnificent and fantastic. Especially, cathedral's stained glass was excellent and beautiful. I think, this place was the most beautiful place in Praha.
Really eye opening.. Unbelievable inside , free to access certain point. Magnificent architecture. Don't pay for pass , just walk in

great history. spent a day in Prague Castle including St Vitus Cathedral , he history and architecture are superb you can buy a ticket to the castle which includes various other areas such as St Vitus Cathedral, and other exhibits

Beautiful old architecture in the castle complex. St Vitus cathedral sits within the fortified compound of Prague castle that has a commanding position high above Prague. The cathedral has a wealth of stunning architecture including colourful stained glass windows by renowned art nouveau artist Alphonse Mucha and a large gilded mosiac on the South facade of The Last Judgement. Well worth a visit and the cute little tram trundles up the hill so you don't even have to walk up it!!

Another church?. Surprisingly smaller than what you may expect compared to other cathedrals visited in Europe. The special gold leaf, images, stained glass, restoration work of paintings and statues. Go to the second floor and see the vista. Surprised need to pay to see it.
Amazing, breathtaking!. Wonderful church with great history and tradition, breathtaking atmosphere, in the heart of the old Prague Castle.

Very beautiful chirch. Very beautiful cathedral indeed. Unfortunately it's not possible to see it from the distance as it's covered by other buildings and it's hard to see it from nearby since it's huge.
Beautiful. Very nice place to visit, happy to see that you can see the inside without having to pay, even if visiting it thoroughly means that you'll have to reach for your pocket.

Awesome. This wonderful cathedral was quite easy to get to by tram. We had a great time wandering about inside absorbing the history of the place. The Castle was also wonderful and well worth a visit.

One more nice cathedral. Nice, but nothing exceptional. Also, other buildings spoil a view. You nearly cannot see it from the outside.Good to visit, if you need to get rid of some calories - as it's rather high on the hill.
Beautiful!. We opted for the short tour since we only had one day in Prague. We could not believe the beauty of this attraction. Speechless. You must see this.

Beautiful Cathedral. Lovely and worth a visit, you can reach the cathedral easily by tram. I didn't bother to pay the entrance fee as you don't have to pay to go into the back part but you still get a lovely view inside and the windows are stunning.
Make sure you climb the tower. This is a beautiful cathedral but the highlight for me was climbing the tower. The views from the top are outstanding.
Stunning!. Wonderful grand church to visit. It is easy to get lost in all the churches of Prague but this is a must to check out!
Stunning, a must see. This is one of the most beautiful buildings in all of Prague, both on the inside and the exterior. This is a must see and easy to get to from any where in old Prague.

Lovely stained glass in this old cathedral. Go in the afternoon so the sun is behind you for photos. I recommend lunching on your way up the hill, to allow the sun to go behind you for photos east back over Prague. Your photos will have much better colour. After walking up the hill to Prague Castle and St Vitus Cathedral you are well rewarded with beautiful gothic architecture, oodles of stained glass windows and a magnificent view over Prague. Stop off on the way up or down the hill for lunch at U Costella and have a Czech goulash inside a bread roll and an apple strudel. Make it a real Czech day out.

A dazzling masterpiece of history and spirituality. So much history surrounds this stunning Gothic masterpiece that it's hard to know where to begin. Its immense size and location on the highest point of the Castle gives it added prominence, and if you can ignore the surging crowds of tourists that throng this Cathedral, you can concentrate on the many beautiful side chapels, their glorious decoration (many in Baroque style) in carved marble, golden railings and altars, and serene paintings. Many of the Czech Republic's (Catholic) Primates are buried and commemorated here. The stained glass that decorates many - but not all - of the Cathedral's windows lend colour and serenity. Be sure to go behind the high altar for the tomb of one of the country's saints: it's the one with many silver lamps hung in the Orthodox manner above the ornate and sumptuous tomb with carved angels and heraldic designs. Much restoration has been carried out since the fall of Communism in the country, and much needs still to be done, but I guarantee that you won't be disappointed on your visit! Although some of the features have English descriptions, most do not, hence it may be advisable to hire the audio guide before you start your walk around.

... Symbol of Praha... Saint Vitus Cathedral became the symbol of Prague thanks to its century history and high expression of the gothic and nel gothic style. The cathedral has been completed crossing centuries and definitely in the recent past ... This makes even more interesting the visit.. I suggest to visit in a sunny day to appreciate the decor of the marvelous windows. The rose window is magnificent ... Unforgettable the view from the bell tower... Be patient at the ticket office... Czech people are honestly not interest if visitors complain or stand on queue ... They will not understand... The video guide tour is suggested but... Return it before 16.30.... So it s better to visit the cathedral in the morning.. Moreover You will avoid to be surprised to find close the golden street at 17.00 ... I ve experienced 5 times these bad feelings.. Unfortunately ... You must visit S.Vitus ! Enjoy..

Breathtaking stained glass. We only visited the entrance as this is free. I am not sure how much the fee is but you could see quite a lot from the entrance area without paying.Great views of the exterior from across the moat

Stunning. I've seen quite a lot of churches, but none of them like this one - it's really breathtaking. Try to choose a sunny day for a visit and enjoy the light coming through amazing stained-glass windows. It's a little bit crowdy, but I guess it's just the spirit of the place. Definitely worth going. You can buy one ticket for the Cathedral, Old Castle, Golden Lane and St. Goerge's Basilica - it seems to be expensive, but it's a one ticket for a whole day of attractions.

Gothic Splendor. St. Vitus Cathedral is a Gothic gem in the crown of Czech cathedrals. The stain glass windows appear like hundreds of glistening beads rather than as small individual pieces of glass. Unlike other Gothic style churches, there are relatively few burials. Only the greatest Czech saints are here -"Good King Wenceslas" and his grandmother, St.(Princess) Ludmilla with separate chapels of their own. Outside are outstanding flying buttresses and gargoyles, both characteristic Gothic features. With its famous Rose Window, St. Vitus brought me back in memory to Paris's Notre Dame Cathedral....and nearly to dance (St. Vitus !)

amazing. This cathedral is part of a huge complex The Prague Castle but really isn't a castle. You can take a free peek into the cathedral if you don't have time to spare or you can take an audio tour for just 12gbp. Well worth it. SO much history here and elaborate architecture. We took the ebike tour and we did the "peek" then we came back on our Prague walking tour and did the actual tour of it with our guide. Both excellent!
Beautiful stunning. A nice 45 minutes can be spent inside adoring the beauty of the cathedral, from the stained glass to the nice sculptures. The whole castle area is worth it.
Beautiful. a unique and beautiful Cathedral. I loved the history.This Gothic cathedral is situated within the Prague Castle.isspectacular. A ,ust see Cathedral to,visit while innate

Breath-taking. Nothing can possibly describe how beautiful this Cathedral really is. MUST see!!! Take your time and go also inside of Cathedral, it is SO worth it!!! Beautiful vintage colourfull windowns and amazing interior. I saw it more than 10 times already and it is still not enough. TIP: You can enter Cathedral without paying and you can have a look few meters near enterence. But it is worth to pay and see more!
Magnificent Mucha Window. This place is beautiful regardless of the time, day, or season you visit. Well worth the stroll across the Charles Bridge and the uphill walk from the old town.

Beautiful cathedral that just leaves on in awe. What can I say but that's it's one of the most gorgeous structure's I've seen. The colours are beautiful, the cathedral is grand, the attention to detail is magnificent.

Impressive. When you consider age of the cathedral, it is very impressive. And amazing as well. I recommend going there in the afternoon when sun shines through coloured windows. You may enter for free but there is a fee if you want to see it all.

Amazing. Amazing church, which contains a stained glass window by the Czech artist Mucha; it is beautiful from outside to inside. One problem, however, is the price for entry: you are forced to buy a package for a variety of attractions to visit the church entirely, but you can enter for free until mid nave of the church.

Cathedral St. Vitus. Again i believe the largest in the world or at least one of them , Like all tourist attractions there is an entrance fee.... well worth seeing , alot of old art inside , ( if you like that kind of thing)

Impressive piece of architecture. Impressive piece of architecture. It looks gorgeous like Sargada Familia by Gaudi. When you get out of the arch in front of you and presents a grand temple! An incredible experience. Makes you feel the insignificance of man. Unfortunately it has an inconvenient time. But you must go there and looking for God...

Unforgettable. Don't miss the bronze bars on the side of the Cathedral - with small
reliefs of seasons and zodiaks!
Prague castle. remarkable building towering over the city - magnificent inside and out - go with a guide to get the history and stories about the long life of the cathedral

Stunning But ?. The walk up to the cathedral is quite long and not for the faint hearted. However it is worth the effort, the problem is it was so busy that you could not get to ticket sales due to the total lack of organisation, you can enter part of the cathedral with out a ticket which gives you good views of thr windows etc.

Amazing, best part of the castle experience. St. Vitus Catherdral is right in the middle of the Castle grounds and an awesome structure to explore. Spring for the ticket so that you can explore the whole interior (you can see only part of it for free and miss the bet parts). In particular the side chapels are worth spending time checking out as well as the beautiful tainted glass. If you have the time and funds, go see the Treasures of St. Vitus which are a separate ticket. They are very cool and help you to understand the role of the Church.
A great cathedral with splendid windows.. The Cathedral and its surrounding (the Prague Castle) is a unique and well preserved area that every Prague visitor should see.

Great building and architecture.. Loved the views, crazy about the long line of armor from the Middle Ages. Shot a crossbow and loved it. The Cathedral stained glass is a good as most I've seen. Golden Lane was wonderful and detailed the lives of those who lived there. I won't spoil this, but ask a guide why its called Golden Lane.

Awe inspiring..... A 'must see' in Prague.Deep history,awe inspiring architecture,the sheer beauty of stained glass.Buy a ticket if you are interested in the history of the cathedral.You will be allowed access to the interiors beyond the 'free' area.The audio tour is helpful.Worth your time surely.PS : Public washrooms are chargeable in Prague Castle(and elsewhere in Prague).So keep some loose change handy to use the facilities in case you need to.

The best view in Prague. St. Vitus Cathedral is in the middle of Prague Castle area. Interesting is not only main part and catacombs, but I recommend you to climb the tower to get the best view in Prague. There is quite a lot of stairs, but there are no exposed places and even upper area is very safe. The view is definitely worth of energy as you get close view of towers details and overview over whole historical center.

Must see in Prague. The Cathedral was magnificent, especially seen from the park side, where one can see the existing moat. We heard about long lines before going but when we were there, it was quite easy to get in.
Beautiful Cathedral. Amazing and totally worth a visit if you are in Prague. The architecture is fantastic and the stained glass windows are gorgeous.

Ornate. Every inch contains something to see.. Despite construction being started in 1344, the church was not finished until 1929 and repairs and cleaning continues. The exterior is grandiose with every inch covered by carvings. We visited the first time near dusk and it was beautiful to see how the exterior walls changed colors as the sun set. You can also go into the church for free but you will have to stay in a roped off area at the back of the church. We found it well worth the fee to be able to tour the church at our leisure. The audio was also very helpful and informative

Pearl Anniversary. Great gargoyles, particularly in the rain. Very intricate stained glass windows and one lovely Alfons Mucha window. To get sight of the whole cathedral you need to buy a ticket to it and other parts of the castle complex.
beautiful. amazing arcutecture its so beautiful on opulant well worth a visit spend hours looking at and learning about the history of the cathederal
St Vitus!. What a brilliantly breathtaking visit we had to St Vitus. It was amazing to wander into the cathedral and absorb such amazing antiquity!

Well worth the walk. It's quite a trek to the top of the hill but it's really impressive and worth the climb. The views from the top are stunning, you can see most of Prague from up there. I didn't pay the admission fee to go round the cathedral but you can see some of it without paying the fee. Worth seeing as it's one of the top rated things to do in Prague.
Like in the movies. Awesome for a church of course. It's a mandatory stop in Prague, go inside and take a look as well. You also have a bunch of other stuff to see nearby

The best thing you can do here. Well, this for me is the best place I met in Prague. It's inside the castle (amazing already) and has this huuuuge stained glasses with biblical scenes. Even if you are not a religious guy is incredible to watch.
Long walk to get there but totally worth it!. We've visited the cathedral a little late so it was closed. But it was nice to admire it, as the view from up hill.Take a jacket, its chilly up there.

A must see.. This church is one of the biggest in Europe, and had an amazing exterior. Inside there is lots of nice paintings, sculptures and stained glass windows, highly recommended. It is located in the middle of Prague Castle, and there are lots of other things to see nearby. 10 min walking from downtown.
Very beautiful, gothic at the top!. This church dominates Prague's landscape from everywhere. It is its symbol. You can't miss it. Outside is more impressive than inside.

Beautiful but busy. The cathedral was beautiful and even with the free option there was plenty to look at with lovely stained glass windows and architecture. It was very busy and had more of a tourist attraction feel than calm respectful feel though, so if the latter is what you're after I would recommend some of the smaller churches in Prague.
fascinating. This was quite a small cathedral but had lovely stained glass windows & many small chapels to view. Some of the carved figures were fascinating.

Great. We took the free option for our visit which allows you to enter the back of the cathedral to have a look. There is an area cordoned off for this free visit and it gives you a taste of the cathedral. You can pay to visit the whole of the cathedral but we found the quick visit a great option with a baby.

Worth seeing!. This cathedral is beautiful. It is worth going inside to look at the architecture and the stained glass windows. You can go inside for free but there are some areas that you have to pay to see.

Part of the Prague Castle. You can go into Prague castle and take a look at the cathedral without paying a cent. I think you can also go in the front door of the cathedral but can't walk around.We had the Prague Castle "short visit" ticket so could go in and walk around the castle. Very impressive. Reminded me of Notre Damn in Paris. Take a look!

Great. Very impressive,with beautiful stained glass windows inside and amazing external structure. A must do while in Prague. nb it doesn't open until 12, even though the rest of the castle area opens at 10am.
See this Church. I've seen cathedrals all over Europe and this one is worth the visit. Amazing stained glass. Go early (before 10am)! It's popular with the "bus" crowd.

Lovely. This church is so lovely. It was hard to leave. The art throughout the church is exquisite. Even with the overwhelming number of tourists that were there I was able to reflect quitely - it is that awe-inspiring.

Magnificent Inside-Out!. The cathedral has a sinister air about it: massive black stone spires against a clear blue sky, giant gargoyles in the shape of crouching wolves and other such gothic touches. The inside is cool and serene and almost an art museum with its numerous stained glass windows. The Mucha window stands out with its sensual take on biblical characters. There is a huge silver sacrophagus which is a sort of a star attraction.
Gorgeous. Must see. This was a beautiful experience. The history alone is extraordinary, but the Mucha window is spectacular, as are the other windows.

Part of the Prague Castle ticket. Entrance was part of my castle ticket. It was actually a very ornate cathedral, enjoyed the intricate stained glass windows. Took a lot of pictures of the outside as well - it definitely is a site to see.

Beautiful cathedral with views of the City. The Cathedral dominates the City skyline, so you won't have difficulty finding it. A few words of warning: there is no way to avoid difficult walking, from the steep incline to enter to the cobblestones. It is not fitted for wheelchairs or scooters or high heels. Bring money to use the rest rooms. We were with a small tour company and that was essential to get a good history and discussion. It is packed with tourists, so be patient. There is a fee, but it was part of our tour price so cannot say how much the entrance fee cost. All said, it is gorgeous and encompasses such a long time pan of building. Beautiful architectural details. To stand n the transept and look in all directions...well, it is worth the time, steps and crowds!

Breathtaking and Great History. Our visit to St Vitus was short but I went back for a second look later. It was SO crowded that we all pushed inside to marvel at the beautiful stained glass windows. I think it is more impressive from the outside. My husband and I went back around 10PM. The grounds stay open to 12AM. We had the whole place to ourselves. You can't go inside but it was great to be in the courtyard with the illuminated Cathedral. Too bad there was scaffolding on the mosaics but I understand things need to be restored and preserved. Don't miss a visit here! And go back before midnight!
Check it up. Very interesting place to see but be prepare to spent all day there pack your lunch restaurant are to overpriced .

Wow!!!!!. Its quite a hike up there but with a guide you follow and they point out historic information and its huge.The grounds of the castle are enormous. The church itself is beautiful and looks like its maintained well.

Get your walking shoes on. A very impressive structure with many interesting things to see in one place. The castle looks like it could with stand a battle today as is an enormous structure. Although it is a challenge you should try and climb the 300+ steps up the tower to get an outstanding panoramic view of the castle area and of Prague. The only downside is the number of tourists: huge numbers all day long.
Magnificent stained glass windows. Magnificent cathedral like so may others in Europe. Particular feature though is the stained glass windows which are particularly spectacular - well worth seeing!

Stunningly beautiful church and good audio guide. We visited the church as part of our "Short Tour" of the Prague Castle. You can get in to see the church from the back without a ticket, but our tour ticket allowed us to walk all around the church and the audio guide provided very useful information about many of the chapels, statuary, windows, etc. Very educational and very beautiful. Well worth a visit.

Really nice big church . It's a really nice big church with a lot of beatifull stained glass. The height of the church is impressive. The ceiling however could have been more decorated. Best thing in the castle area anyway.

A must see. I know, you're thinking seen one cathedral, seen them all. Not this one. It was the highlight of the visit to Prague in my opinion. The inside is longer than anything I have seen and I've seen a lot of ancient cathedrals in Europe. It may be second only to the basilica of St. Peter in Rome. We probably spent more time looking around all the nooks and crannies here than in the Castle outside.
Architectural marvel.. Maybe the most amazing building I've ever seen. Just stunning. You do not need to pay for the Prague Castle Tour to see it, so we came back the second day to see it again!
St. Vitus--a must-see in Prague. A great example of gothic to baroque architecture. The stained glass windows are fantastic.There is now a charge to tour St. Vitus.
Fantastic cathedral. Beautiful. Very awe inspiring. Excellent stained windows decorated ceilings, gold adornment. Even though it was busy you still saw everything although royal crypt closed.

Best Stained Glass Windows in Europe. Go early in the morning, or go when the main vacation season is past by. We could hardly squeeze into the church the day we were there in August - way too many people. By all means pay for the "tour", otherwise you are confined to the entrance area right inside the church and will not be able to see much. This church has some of the best stained glass windows in all of Europe. Photography is forbidden with signs everywhere, but I saw hundreds taking pictures and no one said a word to them. With the tour you get to walk thru the rest of the church.

Breathtaking. St Vitus is breathtakingly beautiful. The whole Prague Castle complex is absolutely gorgeous. St. Vitus is typical Gothic style, and building started in the 10th century. It is very busy in summer but worth the visit!

More impressive than Notre Dame. Besides the cathedral in Cologne Germany (which is the largest in the world). This is the most impressive Cathedral I've ever seen. I spent an hour just walking around the outside looking at all the fascinating detail that was put into the exterior. I chose not to pay the very high admittance fee to go inside, but there is a small area where non-paying visitors can enter and see the majesty of the interior without venturing into it. It's a good way to see inside if you're traveling on a budget. This cathedral should be on everyone's bucket list.

Jewel in the Crown. We visited the Castle Area in Prague with a local guide for a tour of about three hours. This really wasn't long enough. We only managed to see this wonderful Gothic Cathedral, St George's Basilica, Golden Lane and the view of Prague. The whole area was packed with tourists and the Cathedral was far too crowded to allow us to appreciate its beauty fully. But it should not be missed and I'm very glad that we had the opportunity to see it. The exterior of the Cathedral was unfortunately covered with a fair bit of scaffolding, but the interior was a treasure-trove of stained glass, sculpture and ornate wood carvings. This Cathedral should not be missed if you are going to Prague.
Beautiful. Lovely place to visit with some lovely views right at the centre of the castle. Really busy but great place

Beautiful. The St Vitus Cathedral within the Prague Castle surroundings is unbelievably beautiful and is a must-see whilst in Prague. It is within walking distance from central Prague but you can get the subway & tram if you are not confident with the walk. You do not need to pay to look around the outside of the castle but if you want to see the inside you'll need to pay a fee. The visit inside closes around 5PM so ensure you get there early if you want the full experience. Toilets are on site but there is a small fee, as there is for most public toilets in the Prague area.After the awe of the castle & cathedral you can enjoy the shops & museums long the Golden Lane or take in the beautiful view of Prague city.

The biggest and most important church in Prague. One of the most beautiful cathedrals in the world, sense of stepping into medieval time, perfect views.
Even with large weekend crowds, moving about the Prague Castle was a breeze
Highly recommended!
Amazing Cathedral. This is a must see when you are in Prague and the details are simply amazing and a beautiful place to visit.

Impressive church in the castle!. Perhaps the landmark of the Prague Castle, the St. Vitus church is a must visit when you are at the castle. We had the Prague card so access into the church was free. The church is the final resting place for bohemian kings and a trip around the interior will be good with an audio guide or a tour guide which you can pay for as an extra from the ticket office. This will give you a lot more information on the church tour which we think is important to allow one to appreciate the church more.

Incredible Gothic Architecture. The prominent location of St Vitus overlooking Prague gives this imposing building a commanding position high above the cityscape. It's nearer from the centre of the city than people think, and no more than a 20-30 minute walk or short bus ride. Depending upon how you enter the site there are a number of steps, although these aren't steep and should be achievable by most people. There is an entry fee to enter the cathedral, although if you're on a budget you can be wowed for free just wandering around the courtyards and admiring the architecture and the view of the city. The Prague Toy Museum is also located in the grounds, and was a substantial Christmas Tree during our last trip (it was the week before Christmas!)

Stunning!. Though crowded, i still had chance to appreciate the beauty of this building as did my 15 yr old son, we enjoyed taking photo's here... defiantely worth seeing up close rather than in photo's
Beautiful!. Another European cathedral to be sure, but I never tire of their beauty. Get there early in your day.

A Must-See in Prague. This is a beautiful example of gothic cathedral architecture, with several small chapels around the sides of the altar area and lots of art throughout. However the stained glass windows are absolutely gorgeous and are a must-see. The cathedral is set up so that there is a free section near the doors where anyone can come in and view the architecture and some of the art from the back of the church. However if you want to see the chapels and windows, you will need to buy the entrance ticket. I found that the free area was packed and hard to walk around, but once you passed into the paid entry area the crowd thinned out a bit and you could take your time to admire the sights. There are also lots of little details on the exterior of the church that you should take a few minutes to look for. For instance, on the facade just below the rose window are carvings of the architects as a tribute to them. On the side of the church there are 3 wrought iron gates that each have 4 astrological symbol carvings as well as a small carved tableau that portrays something that people might have been doing during that astrological month. (For instance, there was a harvest tableau for one of the fall month signs.) It was really interesting to see.You can definitely see enough to appreciate the cathedral for free, but if you can only see one paid site in Prague, this should be it.

wow an incredible monument to the past.. what an amazing building.the stained glass windows are stunning.in fact the whole building is stunning.very well preserved.well worth the climb up the hill to get to it.do try theme.make pitchers of lemonade in the outdoors cafe in the square beside the cathedral.

spectacular. lovely interior of this cathedral. We walked up to the castle and visited the cathedral as well. Worth the walk! it was very crowded--but expected. Still, it only took a few minutes to get inside
nice Cathedral. Nice Cathedral in the castle areal. You can enter to the 1st. part for free but to the rest is charged.
quite fantastic but.... This is another one of landmarks in Prague where getting there early really helps to give the visitor a sense of the place and its beauty.
Spectacular. Definitely worth a visit. You don't necessarily have to pay the entry fee, the free entry section is small but still gives a great view of the cathedral's beauty.

Prague's Gem. This cathedral was one of the most beautiful I have ever seen. The stained glass windows are so vivid and lively, like nothing I have experienced before. The entire basilica is breathtaking. Words and pictures really do not capture the beauty that is here!
Beautiful Gothic Church. It is a great example of Gothic architecture. While Notre Dame is larger, St. Vitus is certainly well preserved. The details and gargoyles take you back in time.
Most Beautiful. Beautiful, beautiful structure with a wonderful history. One of the best parts of Prague! Very impressive , take your time and enjoy the marvel
Highlight of Prague. Beautiful, beautiful structure with a wonderful history. One of the best parts of Prague! Take your time and enjoy yourself, and don't just get swept along with the crowds.

One of The Most Beautiful Cathedrals in the World. No, there is no Grand Basilica like St, Peters, and it isn't as large as the Cathedral de Sevilla, but this is a very beautiful Gothic Cathedral. I don't know if it's because it is on the hill in the Castle district, but the light is amazing. It's bright like the inside of Gaudi's Sagrada Familia (that's where the similarity ends). It has many fine works of silver, stone, and even wood- it also has beautiful stained glass windows and arches. The exteriors are awesome, and look completely different at night, actually it's well worth a trip up at night because the outside (Castle District) is free anyway. I would highly recommend making this my first stop (on the Short tour) of the Castle District. My wife and I arrived right when it opened, and it was worth it to beat the crowds.
Beautiful.... ....as always with beautiful vitrages but the fact you need a ticket to enter the church closer to the altar really was a surprise for me.

The place to visit if you are on the castle. The dominant of the Prague Castle visible from downtown. Impressive place to visit - leave at least 30 minutes us for the cathedral excursion. This is must see place even if you do not ...even if you do not plan to do detailed castle excursion... My personal recommendation would be to walk around the castle see the city overview and at least visit the cathedral... There is a lot to see inside...
a real gothic architecture and very big. Its good to go as early as possible for there go many people. Plan to spend a full day there, since you need time to appreciate every detail.

A Must See ... Climb Up the Tower. The interior of the cathedral is stunning. It is incredible to image the time and attention given to the construction and decor. Absolutely beautiful stain glass windows. While free to enter and roam around, it costs to go up in the tower. Please go. There is a lift for those that do not or are not able to walk up the ramp & steps.The views of Old Town and the Prague skyline are outstanding.

Magnificent Cathedral. Enjoyed two visits to the Cathedral; one as part of our group tour where we could only step into the nave. On our second visit we purchased the recorded walking tour with earpieces and really took some time to learn more about the Cathedral. The church is immense in scale and has the usual European monuments to rulers, patrons and saints. Of note is the tomb of St Wenceslas and St John Niemark. While the Cathedral had been built over the 800 years it has existed, the glass windows of the nave were done in the 19 and 20th century and they are awe-inspiring. The Cathedral is worth a visit as part of the Prague Castle tour.

Highly recommended- beautiful inside and out. Despite them running out of English brochures, it was worth going to. It's beautiful, historical, and has many descriptions of important pieces of history within.There's no fee to look at it from the outside, nor to see a brief view within, but to walk around there is a fee.
Overrated I'm afraid. Its ancient look belies the fact it was only finished fairly recently. Was the only person to shell out 50k for a photography permit?

Beatiful Cathedral with merchandized soul. Most commercialized Cathedral in Europe and not only. Traveled many states but never and nowhere seen that prayers should pay to come inside to kneel before altar. Internationally generally accepted free admittance for prayers any time and between services for tourists. At least in world general cathedrals. Money is more important for locals than proud for this beatiful Cathedral. They made it the museum! Damaged impression! Cathedral smells human's greed!

Beautiful church with great stained glass windows. Beautiful church, as much to see outside as to see inside. ! Look up at the gargoyle's outside and inside the stained glass windows are amazing. The cathedral can be visited without a ticket but you are limited to the back one third of the church. Still worthwhile if your on a budget.

A sad visit.. The hudge cathedral looks marvelous and it is visible from many points of the city. Its outside look impressed me and I was looking forward to see the interior. Unfortunatelly, it wasn't a nice visit. The admission to the nave is free. There are asiles and tranepts that you have to pay for. Ufortunately most of the tourists crowds in the nave being very loud and disrespectful for the place. I'm a religious person and I was expecting an atmoshere of peace and prayer. It felt like God moved somewhere else, because there was no experience of his presence. I've been to many European cities and I've visited many important cathedrals (Paris, Cologne, Barcelona, Venice) and NEVER experience something like that. Everywhere being quiet and respectful is a condition to be allowed to enter the church. Why does anyone from the staff react to this? Bedides, there is no way you can kneel and pray for a moment, becuase the area with benches is barred and guarded. If you knelt somewhere else you would be trampled on by other visitors.

Absolutely stunning. This building is breath-taking, both from the inside and the outside. You will find yourself staring at the detail on the outside for ages! The stained-glass windows are some of the most beautiful I have seen anywhere in Europe. Read up in your own guidebook to save money as the audio guides are over EUR 10 per person.
Awe inspiring. When we walked into the cathedral we were impressed with the beauty and size of this beautiful cathedral. We paid to get access to the whole cathedral and it was worth it.

Well worth the visit.. Pros - Absolutely beautiful cathedral - the stained glass windows are breathtaking. Cons - we travelled with children, so didn't pay for the audio guide (it would have been another 40 euro for three of us) but there was next to no information plaques etc., so without your own berlitz guide etc. you'll be stuck for information, and just admiring the sights.

Beautiful Cathedral. The filtered light that emanates through the interior of the building thanks to the stained glass windows is so beautiful. This was my favourite place in Prague.This is way better than many other 'big churches' I have seen, including st peters in Rome.For the cheap skates, you can get into part of the cathedral without a ticket...a sort of cordoned off square in the entry section. But you will not able to see all the artworks from here or get close to many of the window areas. I recommend getting a ticket if you have the cash to spare and like these kinds of things. I loved this place partly as it has a more restrained taste than many catholic churches, which are so garish with their tacky iconography and heavily ornate decor.

No Mass. We went on the English website as we wanted to attend High Mass.The time listed was 11:00 a.m. But when we arrived it had already started at 10:00a.m. And we were denied entry.We were not the only disappointed tourists.Don't trust the info on the Internet.

Not entirely gothic. I was shocked to find out that the entrance its not even 100 years old. But, its beautiful. It was very crowded. So, did not had much time to take it in once inside. The exterior, which i was able to enjoy was marbelous.

staircase made me dizzy. Was fortunate to experience a concert by police bands from Scandanavia which was thoroughly enjoyable; stayed for some time listening even though not in English. Later checked out the tower which can be discounted via purchase of the Prague card (which was a rip off at the time due to the floods and no refund!!) which has many stairs winding up to the top but well worth the view. Interesting checking out the rest of the cathedral, too.

A Tough One. Its a tough one to review. A must for the historical relevance of the building, the cultural icon of Prague and it indeed contains some interesting artifacts, stained glass windows etc. The view from the top of the tower is one of hte most stunning in Prague (the spiral stair case to the top is a killer! Pace yourself and take water in summer.) On the other hand I have see more impressive buildings and indeed rank St Nicholas Church in Malostranske Namesti higher than this one on internal decor. (personal preferance)My conclusion is pop in and have a look but unless you are big in to churches and appreciate its history you wont need more than 40 minutes.

Beautyful and impressive Cathedral. One of the central attractions in the centre of Prague. It is a well maintained impressive building you can spend a lot of time there, if you really want to see and get to know all of it.
St Vitus. beautiful church next to the Prague castle. Lots of beautiful stained glass windows and wall murals to admire, Ticket includes two other museums to visit on the grounds.

Absolutely a must see. You can spend hours in here and still not observe everything!. Absolutely a must see. It is a walk-in work of art that is pure eye candy and awesome! The side chapels, the sun streaming thru on the artwork, the history given all create a special atmosphere.

Pretty but not worth the entry. Entrance to the cathedral is included in the Prague castle price but unless you have a strong interest in the architecture of the Cathedral, I'm not sure it's worth paying to go in. You can still can get a nice view from the foyer

Gorgeous, but current construction blocks key areas. Like other reviews have said, if you don't purchase the audio tour (or bring your own printed guide) there is not much information within the cathedral. Even without a guide, St. Vitus is an absolutely beautiful building on the inside and out, with incredible stained glass, soaring ceilings, and gargoyles looking down upon you. Even if you've seen 100 European churches, this one is worth the visit.My only complaint about the cathedral was that certain areas were blocked by scaffolding or not on view because of current construction. We were unable to see the Golden Portal or the crypt located below the main level. Other than the construction, be warned that the whole Prague Castle complex is especially crowded on Mondays. Most other attractions are closed on Mondays, so tourists flock to the complex.

One of the greatest cathedrals of the world. I've seen a lot of Gothic classics - from Notre Dame to Cologne, and for me this is the most beautiful and tremendous temple.
It reminds me of dead dragon skeleton - dark, gloomy and yet majestic and gorgeous.
Must be seen - in daylight and during the night, when lights are so fairy.
..Must see... There are a few of 'Must see' things. This is definitely one of them. You feel so small, but powerful over here. Just enjoy!

Favorite site in Prague. This cathedral was absolutely stunning. So beautiful and full of history. The outside is completely gothic style, but when you entire it's a whole different blend of styles and architecture. This was my favorite site in Prague. A must see..

Pearl of architecture and Czech history. The cathedral is amazing.Even if it does not look like so, the 14th century is only half of it, the "altair" part. The west half was actualy build just 100 years ago.I will not write what you can find in all guides but one advice: try to visit it before 7:00 during workdays (800 on weekend) - there is a mass and if you do not look like "bad" tourist sort, your dress is reasonable, you claim you go for the mass, you can see the cathedral in early morning light, very quiet, beautiful. Try it! P.S. As visitor of the mass you do not pay the fee and anyhow, it opens to public much later ..
Beautiful. Unfortunately closed when I arrived one evening, but looked incredible from the outside. Will visit during the daytime on my next visit.
Very rich and beautiful. Tall and beautiful-you can't miss it.Visit the Cathedral to see its reachness of colours and history.

Gorgeous cathedral. Make sure to check out the Mucha stained glass window - it's about 1/3 of the way down on the left! We didn't have the audio tour, so I was a bit disappointed there wasn't more information within the building about its history.

Another church. I had seen so many churches on our tour, I thought this one would be boring, but not so. Our guide made it special and although I am not of the Catholic persuasion, I appreciated the structure and architecture.

It's a hike, but worth the climb. We climbed close to 300 stairs to see this monument to Gothic design, and it did not disappoint. You cannot possibly grasp the scale and detail of this surreal structure without seeing it personally. It's old, weathered, magnificent. We sort of had a hard time finding it, if you can believe it, but it's inside the palace gates on the palace grounds.
Go early. To avoid the crowds get there early. Lovely interior and exterior, but it costs extra to take photos inside.

Truly amazing!. This was a gorgeous piece of architecture that made one feel serene once inside the building. True, you had to mingle with large crowds to get close to anything, but the sheer size of the building made the crowds below look very insignificant. Although one sees many such majestic cathedrals in many ancient cities, they all have their unique charm. It must be beautiful to participate in a service in such an edifice, which I have yet to do.

Beautiful. The Cathedral is beautiful, it was a shame you couldn't see more of it. We paid for a ticket 350K and got to see many attractions within the castle grounds it was worth it, the cheaper ticket was 250K to only see a few things, paying the extra was worth it.
One of the must-see's in Prague. We paid to see the Cathedral thoroughly, looked at all of the sculptures. It is like a festival to the eye.

impressive. its a cathedra on the castle hill in the centle of castle area, its one of the most important place you have to visit during your stay in Prague, very beautiful and impressive place and remember Golden Street is only 100 metres from this place,

Huge and beautiful. This is one of the must see attractions if you are in Prague, it is the biggest cathedral around and has a beautiful detailed architecture. Easily the best of the 10 sections of the Prague Castle.
Typical. Yes, it's a beautiful place and you must do it, but it closes at 5pm. Most travel guides say 6pm but perhaps this facility doesn't recognize DST?

Stunning. The exterior is impressive enough. Once inside, however, the stain glass windows and the carvings blow you away. It is a statement to Gothic architecture, and is one of Prague's most beautiful buildings. You will be disappointed if you do not see this church when you travel to Prague.

St. Vitus Cathedral - A Gothic Masterpiece and one of Prague's very best attractions. We recently visited Prague and spent a half day seeing the attractions within the Prague Castle grounds. The absolute highlight was seeing St. Vitus Cathedral, a Gothic masterpiece and one of our very favourite attractions in the city. St. Vitus is the largest and most important religious building in the city. The present cathedral is apparently the third religious structure to be built on this site. The earliest being a 10th century Romanesque rotunda, which was replaced by a 11th century basilica that stood on these grounds until the 13th century, when under the reign of Charles IV, the present Gothic cathedral was constructed. Additional Renaissance, Baroque and even Art-Nouveau touches have been added to St. Vitus over the centuries, however it is the Gothic aspects of this cathedral that set it apart. There is much that we like about St. Vitus. As soon as you enter the cathedral you are met with the classic long and narrow nave and a high ceiling with ribbed vaults that you typically associate with Gothic architecture. You then begin to spot many stain glass windows, which were contributed to the cathedral in the 20th century by the Art-Nouveau painter, Alfons Mucha. You can see the Mucha's windows upon entering the cathedral but you can't get as close to them until you follow the route around the cathedral and find yourself near the exit. We were lucky to have visited early in the morning and were able to watch the sun beams pierce through the window panes making the most gorgeous of lightings. This one of the most memorable parts of our visit to St. Vitus Cathedral for us. We also very much enjoyed looking into the beautifully decorated 14th century Chapel of Wenceslas, near the centre of the cathedral. While you can't walk inside, you can view into the chapel from two different directions. Within the chapel you can see precious stone crusted walls and a beautiful wall paintings supposedly reflecting scenes from the life of St. Wenceslas. Within the cathedral, you can also see the elaborately decorated silver sarcophagus known as the Tomb of St. John of Nepomuk, the religious martyr who was canonised and laid to rest at this place in St. Vitus. The tomb is of remarkable design and craftsmanship, and it reminded us of some of the Hapsburg tombs seen in the Imperial Crypt in Vienna. These were the highlight features of St. Vitus that we most enjoyed and there is plenty more to see. In the end, we consider St. Vitus to be one of the very best attractions in Prague and one of our personal favourite Gothic style buildings in Europe. You can visit St. Vitus Cathedral as part of your visit to Prague Castle by purchasing the Prague Castle Long Visit (350czk) or Short Visit (250czk) combination ticket, which are good for two days so you visit the cathedral leisurely if you like, its well worth your time. We highly recommend adding this to your 'must see' list of places to visit when in Prague.

Very interesting church. It was worth paying to see more of the church. The inside was really worth it. The silver tomb is really unlike anything I've seen before - over the top, sure, but definitely worth seeing.
Worth the full ticket. So much to see, get the ticket that allows you full entry. Take your time strolling through the many treasures and wonders of this amazing building. Crowds are a problem!

Must Visit Place. Get the 3 day pass if you are planning to stay here more than 3 days and planning to visit a lot of museum. There is this Tourist pass that allows to you visit nearly all the museum and also get some of the museum at a discounted rate. It also helps you to cut the queue. When we visited here it was late winter, it was cold but romantic. There is tour as well that will explain to you the history of the museum. I suggest that you join the tour. Its free.
You have to dance. Interesting and a great way to spend half a day. The usual annoying tourist trap money makers but it pays for the renovations so all good.
Incredible. Absolutely breathtaking- probably the most beautiful church I have ever seen (and we saw lots on our trip!) - definitely worth visiting.

Worth a Visit. Interesting structure, nice stained glass windows. Outside was likewise amazing. Looking up at the spires makes one feel like the church is falling down on you. We went in summer so many people are visiting but still worth a visit nonetheless since it is already inside the castle. There was a wedding photo shoot the time we visited so that added to the enjoyable experience.
Unbelievable stained glass. This cathedral may have the most incredible stained glass of any cathedral in Europe. I never tire of seeing it.

Go early to avoid the crowds. This was an interesting church inside Prague Castle, I may be jaded but when you have seen a lot of anchient churches in your life they all srart looking the same. I may have enjoyed this one more if I wasn't fighting shoulder to shoulder tours all jostling to hear their guides. oh yes this one has beautiful stained glass and dead saints and kings in it too

Amazing cathedral!. I have never been so stunned by a church! It leaves you speechless when you stand in front of it! This is truly the most breathtaking church I have ever seen. We went in but didn't take a tour. Just viewing it from the outside and going in was enough. It is well worth seeing.
Gorgeous. This cathedral was absolutely beautiful. With its many stained glass windows and soaring ceilings, it was a visual delight. There were many lovely and interesting pieces of art.
Wonderful example of the architecture. St. Vitus stands out as a prime example of Gothic architecture. The spires, stained glass windows, vaulted ceiling took one's breath away.
Magnificent archtecture. one of the most amazing churches I have ever been in... the architecture for the time it was build in is just amazing. Make sure you see the open archs.

Amazing but there early. amazing cathedral with so much to see. take the audio tour to fully understand the history of this cathedral. it is part of the castle tour -and gets very crowded. We got there at 8.30 and the tour buses were already there for the 9 am opening- we were told it might sense to to get there later in the day. when we went back to 4.30 pm we were not allowed in since it closes at 5 pm. I am glad I did the short tour the first day.

Stunning!. You cannot leave Prague without visiting this cathedral. One of the most beautiful places in Prague. You can easily get to it by Tram #22 or even walk up the hill. I thought the royal gardens were also worth the walk.I went late in the day and there weren't a lot of people there thankfully.

Impressive. You can see St Vitus towering over Prague. When you get into the castle domain, it still towers over all the rest. It is simply amazing and impressive. The window glass work is quite unique.The only pity is that you can not fully admire the front of the cathedral because of the mass of people and the buildings which are close into the front. However when you go the right side you can take in the full view of the cathedral.You can purchase an extra entry ticket, however you can admire 90% of the cathedral from behind the normal entrance

The most gorgeous Cathedral ever!!. The Castle complex comprises of 4 main parts - St Vitus Cathedral, Old Palace, Basilica of St. George and Golden Lane.St Vitus Cathedral is the MOST gorgeous church that we have ever seen, has Gothic architecture and is the largest & most important Cathedral in the country.It houses the tombs of many Roman Emperors and Bohemion kings. It has phenomenal stained glass painted windows.We were very glad that we had spent our money in the tickets and loved every minute of spent inside!

Phenomenal!. Even though part of the cathedral is under renovations, definitely worth a visit - the work didn't interfere with our enjoyment of the cathedral! Our children were awe-struck at the thought of how long people had worked on it - people spent their entire lives working on it, but never seeing the end result. It really made them think about their lives and what they have (or not!) done.We chose to pay for the short tour of the castle, cathedral, basilica, and Golden Lane.
