It's not expensive and really worth it, getting to see all the architecture and artwork up close. We didn't think the children would be "up" for the two-day tour, but might do it next time. While we were there, we even got to hear the organ! It was fantastic. Even the children were moved by the music.

Stunning St. Vitus. The advice is true: it's best to hit St. Vitus right when it opens at 9 am to avoid the mobs--most of whom just look in a don't bother to visit the whole church. The solid silver tomb and monument for St. John Nepomuk is alone worth the visit, but there's much more, including the terrific Mucha window.

Beautiful elegant church. What can I say, this church is really worth the visit while at the Palace, it is simply beautiful and so full of history. The church is the primary catholic church in prague.

Beautiful. Like many of the churches and cathedrals in Europe, this is absolutely amazing. One can only wonder how in the world they built these structures without modern day equipment. The craftsmanship is phenomenal and the interior is absolutely beautiful. Don't miss it if you go to Prague.

Beautiful cathedral. A very large and beautiful cathedral. Get there early to avoid long lines. Opens at 9 am. Get tickets at Information/ ticket office. You can only buy tickets for the cathedral bundled with other attractions. 350 kc for the long tour and 250 kc for the short tour. About $17 and $12. Definitely should be on your to visit list.
Beautiful Buidling. Beautiful building, the windows are amazing and the height of the ceilings are impressive. Go early to avoid the queues

Use your Praque Pass but visit the ticket window first. This church is a tourist favorite featuring a long line to enter. Use your Prague Pass and transportation pass. However, you must show your pass in the ticket office to get an entrance ticket to the cathedral.Once inside be prepared for massive crowds of insensitive tourists with smart phones aimed at the large Gothic structure's windows and monuments. It is nice but very crowded. Also, you can not sit down! All the seats were blocked off when I was there.

Beautiful but similar to others. Unfortunately part of the cathedral was under renovations, but it was still well worth the visit... the facade might not have been quite what was expected, but the interior was classic - rich, colourful and clearly old. Although, it is rather similar to all the other famous cathedrals and churches throughout Europe.
st vitus cathedral. definitely a must visit while in Prague. Beautiful gothic architecture and also a great view of the city
Really Beautiful Cathedral. I really enjoyed seeing this cathedral. It is one of the most beautiful I have seen. I loved the windows.
Overwhelmingly majestic. The proportions and height provide grandeur, the richness of the decorations add more. A wonderful cathedral.

Do Not Miss This!. There is not much i can say about the famous St Vitus other than WOW!. Its possibly one of the greatest pieces of arcitecture i have seen to date. It sits nicely on top of the castle grounds which you should make your way up to (dont forget to check out the rest of the castle grounds) and is another iconic sight of Prague. Its free to get into so it would be rude not to go inside and take a look.
Lookin' good!. Fantastic window paintings and interiors, be sure not to miss the St Vitus Cathedral when you're around the castle!
Beautiful!!. Well worth the time and price to tour this cathedral....just gorgeous. Be sure to check out all the stained glass windows...awesome!

One of the most beautiful we've seen. We were pleasantly surprised at St. Vitus Cathedral. It was one of the most beautiful we ever saw. We went a great deal more time in it than we thought we would. It is ornate without being ostentatious. Beautiful stained glass let the light filter in. Just a gorgeous place.
Awesome. What grandeur and beauty! Amazing stain glass work and carvings. That too without a fee -doesn't get better. Don't miss.

A must see when in Prague. I love seeing old cathedrals, and this one was no exception. The location of this cathedral was on top of a hill visible from many places in the city including the Charles bridge.

Gothic Church at its best.. This is the highlight of Prague not to be missed. As soon as you enter the castle you are hit with its awesome beauty! I was just star struck. Be sure to buy a ticket to get into the Cathedral as the "free part" is not as exciting. I would go later in the day as earlier in the day the tour groups overwhelm it.
Outstanding Cathedral. We have seen plenty of cathedrals in our travels, but St Vitas is one we will not forget! Absolutely beautiful. The windows are amazing. Don't miss the Mucha window!
Amazing. Gorgeous church with beautiful stained glass and an interesting history. Pictures are great inside and out.

Charming Cathedral. I was impressed with the cathedral, fro outside & inside. The exterior building is beautiful & the inside is charming.The cleanliness of the place is impressive. If you have a camera you can't stop taking pictures.

Beautiful cathedral. This is a beautiful cathedral. I saw it as part of the Prague Castle walking tour from Sandeman's (definitely recommended). Many people probably confuse the cathedral for Prague Castle itself, but seeing up close can clear that up for you. Both the interior and exterior are gorgeous, so you'll want time to enjoy both.Note: Be sure to go early! When they say they close the doors 15 minutes before it closes (I believe 4:45pm), they mean it. We saw the guards literally slam doors in people's faces right at the time. It's like they stand there are wait for the second hand to cross the 12 so that they can exercise their power to deny people entrance. Just go early and avoid all of that.
Beautiful. I am not really a cathedral person but this was beautiful and fascinating. Do not miss when in the palace neighborhood.

Grandeur. You need to take the tour requiring a ticket purchase to fully appreciate this cathedral. The free tour offers just a taste. The stained glass windows, and the stories about them on the audio guide, are very interesting. Something about the tomb and chapel of Saint Wenceslas captivated me.

Brilliant Gothic Cathedral. This is located inside Prague Castle (Prazsky Hrad) and are the two long spires you see from old town. The inside of the cathedral is stunning as is the outside.The quickest way to get there from old town (you are staying in old town right ?!) is to take Metro A to Malostranska. Exit the station and cross over to the other side of the tram tracks. Take tram 22 to Prazsky Hrad (two stops away) and that puts you right outside the castle.Buy a ticket to see the inside of the cathedral, it is worth it. Definitely the most impressive gothic cathedral I've seen.

Awesome...make sure you climb up the tower!. This is definitely a gorgeous cathedral and well worth going through. It is really impressive...but make sure you climb up the tower. It costs about $5 to climb to the top, and the stairs are steep, but once you get to the top you will not regret it. Great views and photo opportunities!

Stunning building. This is an absolutely stunning building. One the dominates the view from the city (easily mistaken for Prague Castle itself), it has beautiful gothic architecture, and looks like something from a dark fairytale. The inside is pretty, but it's the exterior that is lovely.
avarage. didn't blow me away, expensive, a lot of tourists, they also installed turnikets in the middle of the cathedral which ruins the magical moments
Worth the walk. A beautiful cathedral and well worth the long walk. I went up to the top of the bell tower and the views were stunning

Great place. You must take the tour!. Loved this place so much! The tour was very informative and is a must do if you liked gothic/religious history! Don't forget to visit the crypt. It is quite small but has a few of the greatest royal names of CR! :)

Grandiose. I'm not religious, and this church is over the top. Lots of beautiful stained glass windows and statues of saints, angels and religious icons. You must pay to enter certain areas. The architecture is soaring and impressive. Pay to climb the 287 stairs in a circular staircase to see wonderful views of the city.

Spiritual. This cathedral is breathtaking; the gothic architecture is just unbelievable, so intricate. I think I spent a good 5 minutes just staring at the outside. You have to pay a small fee to go inside but definitely worth it. The inside also takes your breath away, if you're sensitive like me you really feel something. There's a lot to look at inside and you can take photos as long as it doesn't flash (and the old ticket lady doesn't catch you) ;) Around the back is the most stunning cemetery I've ever seen. Some of the graves are so big and intricate, it's stunning. It's a climb to get up to this cathedral but SO WORTH IT. A must see for sure!!!
Last and most brilliant gasp of Gothic. Magnificent example of late gothic church architecture, best on a sunny day. Try to attend a choral Mass or vespers.

Beautiful Area and Interesting History. The walk to the cathedral and the castle grounds were breathtaking. It is challenging and may be difficult if you are not in decent shape, but if your are up to it, avoid the tram or cab and see the area by walking. The audio tour, though a bit pricing, was well worth it for the details of the historic site.

Gothic art and spirituallity!. A visit you can not missed, such a detailed and intricate gothic architecture, so many works of art and history inside, it is really impressive what the Bohemian civilization achieved, and then the spirituality of the place is an unforgettable experience.
Magnificent building. Great old church, over 1,000 years old. Loved the Mucha stained glass. A lot of history in this building. This is the spire you see atop the Prague castle area.

A beautiful example of Gothic architecture. St Vitus Cathedral was one of my favourite places in Prague. Simply observing from the outside was enough to keep me busy for about 40 minutes, finding the intricacies and the windows fascinating. Inside the cathedral, which was included on my short visit ticket, I took my time wandering slowly around the perimeter, taking note of the range of different types of art and masonry inside. One of my favourite parts was the 'stained glass window' which was actually painted glass, something some people may not even notice when walking past.St Wenceslas Chapel is extremely beautiful, the entire thing being decorated with semi-precious stones, although you may struggle to see into it through the two openings if the cathedral is crowded while you are there.
Very impressive. It is inside the castle. Lovely architecture, decorations and tombs of kings. It has viteaux by Mucha. Don't miss it!

St. Vitus-Gorgeous and full of history. We took the Premiant Panorama of Prague tour which was perfect. About hour of Prague highlights via bus, then Prague Castle and St. Vitus Cathedral with a guide. It would be beautiful to see without the guide, but we really appreciated the historical background.
Beautifull!!. The walls with his beautifull stained glasses. The architecture is stunning. You can be there for long time and enjoy it!!
amazing place. One of the most majestic churches in the middle Europe. The place itself offers a perfect view on the whole Prague.

Stunningly beautiful. This is one of the places in Prague you just shouldn't miss. Go and enjoy the gothic beauty. It will probably be crowded, as it always is, but this piece of architecture is worth the wait and your time. So many details to take in, it is an unforgettable place. Enjoy it.
Fantastic Windows. As the Cathedral is within the castle complex it is extremely busy especially at weekends. Visit during the week when the crowds a smaller.

Nice historic church. St. Virus cathedral is located inside the grounds of Prague castle. You can have a look inside near the front and sides to take photo's (without flash), which is sufficient enough to see it.Otherwise pay 10 euro per person and you can go all the way around inside for a closer look, but a bit expensive for that as you virtually see just as much from the free entry point.

Beautiful church next to the Prague castle. This is a must visit place if visiting Prague as it sits up on the hill and overlooks the city of Prague so you must go there to see the views.Easy to get to by tram and then walk down through the Prague castle gardens which are much easier to walk than the hundreds of steps on the outside of the castle.The cathedral is a magnificent building.... Beautifully maintained.

Must do in Prague!. St. Vitus Cathedral is part of the castle ticket. Recommend getting the short ticket, (250 Kc) which covers the castle, St. Vitus, and The Golden Lane. The stain glass in this cathedral is truly outstanding. Funniest stained glass panel is one on your left as you walk in; the bottom panel has a sponsorship ad built in from a local bank active during the time...

Best Visit in Prague. St Vitus Cathedral is inside the gates of the Prague Castle, and one of the most decorated churches in central Europe. The architecture is amazing, the stained glass windows and silver sculptures incredible. Being inside and seeing the opulence of the church really gave me a sense of what power and money did 1000 years ago. Of all the places I visited in Prague during the week, this cathedral was the best in terms of impressive architecture and art. Don't miss this if you visit Prague.
Beautiful site!. Beautiful church on the top of the hill. We visited inside and we liked the stain-glass windows a lot.
Incredible stain glass windows. Most beautiful cathedral I have seen, the vivid colours and both old and modern designs were breath taking.

What a pity that the Cathedral was receiving maintenance when I visit it. The Cathedral is inside the Prague castle, that itself is marvelous.- You can reach it from downtown by taking the 22 tram.- It is very difficult to describe with the proper words what this Cathedral is.- I think that is one of the most beautiful Cathedrals I visited.- If you are in Prague you can not skip this beautiful church.-
Absolutley beautiful!. The Cathedral is beautiful and one can truly have a feeling of quiet reverence in such a place. It was my favorite building in Prague.

About Average.. This highlight of Prague and yet I found this church to be rather average. Firstly, because it is surrounded by modern buildings which steals the grandeur and awe of the church. Granted the stain glass windows are impressive but, after spending time in Rome, this church just doesn't compare to others I've seen.

Beautiful, old cathedral. I would say that this is a must see in Prague. We didn't pay for the full tour, just went in and looked around. It is a lovely, large old cathedral. Like most things in Prague though, it is crawling with tourists.

Stunning Stained Glass Window. This cathedral really is stunning but the highlight has to be the 1920s window to the left of the naive. The colours are just amazing, it's beyond pretty. The rest of the Cathedral gives you a good sense of the history of Prague.

Wonderful Medieval Cathedral. Part of the Prague Castle, this is a splendid example of evolving gothic to new gothic architecture. Note not only the splendor inside, but the wonderful gargoyles that surround the structure. A guided tour is most helpful
Beautiful church. Lovely old church with some gorgeous stained glass. Well worth a visit. Part of the "short tour" of Prague Castle and one of the highlights.
Spectacular. An incredible cathedral, with marvelous stained glass windows. The Mucha window is breathtaking. The entire structure is over the top and well worth the trek from Old Town.

Wonderful location. Well worth it. We did the mini tour which gets you into 4 or 5 places. All of them were lovely, esp the main cathedral. It does get very very busy - there were hordes of tourists/on tours. But persevere. It is worth it.

Stunning - don't miss. This was perhaps the most impressive building we saw in Prague. A gorgeous example of gothic architecture, beautiful stained glass (don't overlook the Mucha panel), baroque design details, and an interesting history.

Huge Cathedral with Great History. Impressive cathedral with great historical display. You can only move in one direction, so take your time if you are really interested in display. We were turned around by the guard though we wanted to go back a little (10m) to one of the displays.

St. Vitas Cathedral - Prague. One of the must see sites in Prague. Located within the Prague Castle complex, this cathedral is amazing to look at. The architecture is stunning. The inside of the cathedral is out of this world. I would definitely recommend this to those visiting this wonderful city.

St. Vitus Cathedral. This cathedral has beautiful stained glass works. However, the crypt was closed. We could not get audio guides becasue we didn;t arrive early enough and there aren't descriptions of any kind in the cathedral - it was a little frustrating to not be able to at least read about what we were visiting.

A quick, but revarding look.. When I went inside the Cathedral, I had spent 2 hours at the castle already, so I quickly went inside to see the amazing stained glass windows. I was surrounded by more people than I care to remember, and went out of the flow for a second and was briskly moved in that right direction. So I thought "enough of this, my mood doesn't need a downturn", so I spun around 360 degrees, got some great photos and found that I had done what I came for, seen the amazing windows. Sometimes, you just have to know when you've seen all you can see, so I went straight out again, and I'm happy for it. It is all very fantastic, you are humbled by it all, once you get a distance to the great masses of people surrounding you. After that, the beers at the Strahov Monastic Brewery tasted so incredibly good!

A breathtaking cathedral. In my opinion, the most magnificent cathedral in all of Europe. Try to visit around midday when you can spot the bell-ringer tirelessly pulling on the ropes right up high, just below the bells.The stained glass is simply beautiful.
Don't miss the Mucha window. Crowded but worth a look - a wonderful example of great gothic and you shouldn't miss the Mucha window.

Fabulous for kids. Get your tickets (on the right side of the office), then get your audio guides (on the left side of the office). Have 500 euro for deposit per audio guide!Audio guides were well worth it...the facts and stories are cool and my little ones (6 & 9) really enjoyed it including the details about King Charles IV, King/St. Václav (Wenceslaus).Towards the right side (if you're facing the castle front door) there are windy stairs to the tower. If you get dizzy easily, don't do it. If you don't mind- it's awesome view, and great to see the bells, church, old-town and Prague in general from a new vantage point.
Gorgeous and fascinating. It will always be crowded here but we went in late afternoon and it was slightly more empty. Gorgeous stained glass with really interesting history.

Crowds and more crowds. St. Vitus Cathedral, a part of Prague Castle, is great to see, but the crowds are unbelievable. If you have been to the Basilicas in Venice or the Vatican, then this will not be as amazing. While the Cathedral has some nice areas, there is a real lack of crowd control which makes it far less enjoyable. You can rent an audio set which will help with your understanding of what you are looking at, or have a guidebook which describes the highlights. You can take pictures with no flash.

Beautiful and medieval. St Vitus is beautiful. It is rich with medieval history and the Gothic architecture is amazing. Pay a little extra to walk the stairs to the top of the tower and get a birds eye view of Prague.

Too little for too much money. The glass work was really nice and impressive, but I have honestly seen more impressive churches. Unfortunately I also found the price of seeing the church a bit too much for what it gave ( it was part of a group of 3-4 things).

Old gothic cathedral a little creepy. Gargoyles and pointy stonework. I found the cathedrals in Prague to very gothic, old and dark not at all like other European cities. Very unique and this about the best example. Massive doors, although there is a fee to go around. Which does keep crowds down a little.

Beautiful Church. Do not miss this beautiful gothic cathedral with a very rich history. Every important milestone in the Czech Republic is celebrated in this majestic cathedral which took 600 years to complete

Fantastic. Fantastic gothic church with interesting things to see in every corner, a must see in Prague.I suggest climbing the 284 steps of the tower if you still have strenght, the view is absolutely stunning

Best church and building in Prague. While at Prague Castle, 50 metres away is the Cathedral which is more impressive than the castle itself.You can enter it without paying anything and walk around it, taking pictures from different corners. ;)
Largest Cathedral in Czech Republic. Visit first before the crowds,stunning interior-glass windows-tombs-and you can climb the tower,take time to see everything
Impressive. Well worth a visit to see the inside and outside of this cathedral but it does get busy with many tour groups although you can obtain audio information
reaches heaven. make sure to view the Mucha window as well as the two ton silver crypt. A beautiful space that is worth dealing with the crowds. Go early to avoid queues.
Wow. I swear I would g to church more often if I could go to this one! Everywhere you look there are ornate stained glass windows....sculptures, and paintings. It is so Grand and worth seeing.

Stunning. It's free for a part only but you are there already so worth every cent to pay for entry into the church all areas which also includes access into parts of the castle. You could be there for hours ( like we were) looking at all the beauty in the room, u almost forget it was raining outside.

Beautiful, but go with a tour or a guide. The cathedral itself is very nice. The stained glass windows are very pretty. However, there is not much in the way of available information in English. We certainly enjoyed the beauty of the place, but would have enjoyed some narrative on the importance of what we were viewing and interesting facts on the items inside. We tried to hire a guide when we bought our ticket, but one wasn't available for over an hour. In hindsight, I would have gone on the castle tour with a guide that we met in the square (Keith... from California... wears a green shirt). I think I would have enjoyed it even more with his type of narrative giving lots of interesting facts.

Simply beautiful. Entry is free, but you only get to restricted parts of the church. Buy a combo ticket with the main castle and see the whole spendor of the cathedral. Well worth the extra bucks to see the whole thing.
Stunning. A must see not only for the architecture inside and out but a little known fact is that Catholics do not have to pay an admission fee to tour the inside of the cathedral. I

Beautiful inside. It was very pretty; some of the most beautiful and detailed stained glass I've seen. You can enter the main entrance for free, and have to pay a few crown to walk around, which I did, and I was glad of it.
Interesting history. A really beautiful cathedral with an interesting history. Worth taking a look whilst in the castle area. It is crowded so we didnt spend long inside.
Stunning. This cathedral is one of the best I've seen. The crowds are there but its worth it. I would recommend being there when it opens to beat the rush. Don't miss this place if you're in Prague!

Impressive.... The area is almost always full with tourists,but it is not trouble to me.Cathedral is very big and beautiful from both,outside and inside.Something you shoul visit if you are in Prague...
nice, gothic, historic church. Nice gothic and istoric church, graves of medieval czech kings are here, stained glass windows beautifull, impressive for czech hero in the church
Majestic.. Very majestic and informative, really worth a visit. Weather prevented us spending too long in the surrounding gardens but its worth another visit just to go and do that again.

Cathedral. The cathedral was not the most beautiful I have seen in Europe but definatelynworth worth the small entry fee to go beyond the back of the church. Over run with tourists.....get there early to enjoy both the castle and cathedral

Beautiful cathedral!. You could either pay to go into this cathedral and see the whole thing or not pay and go to just the front part. I highly recommend paying especially if you are going when there are a lot of people! There was a line to get in, but once you got past that and the front free part, the cathedral had a lot of breathing room and you had time to explore. The cathedral itself is really gorgeous and well worth seeing!
Very interesting.. Lots of history, but St. Nicholas Church architecture more impressive. Worth it for the stained glass alone
BIG and Historic. TIP:Be here in the early morning to avoid busy crowds.We did and had a relaxing visit.Something you will not have in the afternoon.Is a must place to visit when in Prague.
Beautiful. This is one of the most beautiful Churches I've ever had the privlege to visit. The stained glass is remarkable.

Fantastic Stained Glass. The stained glass windows are fabulous in the Cathedral & you can get into the back of the cathedral without paying to go round and see the most stunning ones. It is however worth paying to tour the whole cathedral as the other windows are lovely and the chapel were 'Good King Wenceslas' has his tomb is stunning.

Very impressive. Its very beautiful and richely decorated gothic cathedral with even more impressive inside decoration and stained-glasses windows. We were inside just before prepayed area since we didnt have enough time to stay in a queue but still saw its beauty. I would say its a must to visit. But place is quite crowded so have it in mind before going.

Great Structure. This church is supposedly the most significant church being part of Czech's history, the stain glass is simply magnificent and the outer building craftsmanship is also excellent. Unfortunately we did not do our homework on this, so we did not quite understand this history of this church, so don't repeat our mistake, try to get a tour guide or the audio guide so that you can fully appreciate it.
splendid. Very impressive building, wonderful stain glass windows, took 6 hundred years to build, inside the castle walls

A Must for everybody. One of the three best examples of Gothic architecture in the world, a part of the Prague castle complex - the largest in the world. Impressive both outside and inside. You will stay breathless watching the spires, gargoyles and other delicate stonework, the amazing mosaic over the Golden gate or staineglass windows representing the best of the best Czech artists through severeal centuries. It pays to queue for exploring the interior with a guide. Czech for the opening hours - at the time of masses and some other religious occasions the entrance may be shorter or not possible at all for non-participants.

Brilliant Structure!. The first feeling after seeing the church is awe! The structure is massive and historic. The carvings are beauty to watch. Once inside the church you feel tiny and at the same time amazed by the different colors inside the church. Everything, from altar to dome is massive. Worth watching.
incredible architecture. Wonderful cathedral in one the highest points of Prague, inside of the citadell. great views and nice touristic restaurants to be relaxed from the old town

Well worth a visit!. The Cathedral is situated within the castle and is absolutely beautiful inside. The stain glass windows are breathtaking, along with the ceiling. Even if your not into cultural buildings etc, this one is definitely worth a good look. It is very impressive.
Amazing building. This building dates back to 1340. Both the exterior and interior can only be described as "wow" - just amazing - a must see as part of your visit to Prague. Intricate detail.

so pretty. With a powerful look from outside, St. Vitus cathedral is more beautiful than you could imagine, windows are colourfully decorated and painted. Just do not miss this attraction, it is so pretty!
Really Beautiful. Beautiful piece of architecture. Dont rush through. The stain glass paintings are really out of the world. This can be seen along with Prague castle

Worth the visit to Prague Castle. We heard from trusted Prague locals that Prague Castle is not too exciting and that it's best just to walk around outside in the evening once the daytime tourists have left. We got there after 6pm when the "attractions" closed, but we could still walk around. Honestly, I don't think anything would have interested us other than the cathedral. We were not allowed in, but could hear a symphony and singers so loudly, even from outside the closed doors. The acoustics must be amazing in there. Even from the outside, the cathedral is worth going up to the castle area to see. It's simply beautiful, and I'm not easily impressed. I wish we could have seen inside. I'm not religious at all, but I appreciate gothic architecture.

Peace of art. The unmissable sight in Prague is a combination of various architectural styles and it took almost 500 years to complete the whole work. Many coronations of Bohemian royalty was held here, but it is also the resting place of the saints Wenceslas and John of Nepomuk. Beautiful stained glass windows are one of the highlights of the cathedral. You can enter it for free, but you will need a ticket for detailed visit.

Beautiful architecture.. Truly beautiful and well preserved. Situated near the praque castle. Unfortunately we didn't get to see the interior since there a long waiting line in front of the cathedral.

Beautiful but WAY overcrowded. I want to start off by mentioning there should be a separate area to review the bell tower as it charged a separate admission. I want to split my review to be clear. Tower- I would give a 4/5 for this, I paid 150 koruna (about $7.50) to enter the tower and climbed what seemed like a bajillion stairs to the top. Not complaining about the stairs in general as it would be impractical to have an elevator, but I didn't see anything before indicating there would be a lot of stairs. People were stopped in different spots resting on the way up which made the narrow stair case a little more dangerous. I did find it very cool that I was given a little coin in a plastic case as a souvenir. The view was also magnificent and I got many beautiful pictures. I would say the attraction overpriced for what you get as there is the more popular Petrin Tower for great views.Cathedral - The only reason this review is 3/5 is because of the good experience at the Tower. I was extremely disappointed with this cathedral. Architecturally and aesthetically amazing, a work of art and beauty. My whole visit was ruined because there were entirely too many people inside. I have included pictures to show how awfully crowded it was. They need to not allow tour guides to stop and clog the narrow walking areas as this cause a huge back up because 2 large groups were stopped to listen to their guides and many others were trying to take pictures which contributed to the back up of traffic. If I were to rate separately it would be 2/5 for the Cathedral.
Beautiful Cathedral. Beautiful architecture and amazing stained glass. Don't skip the tower climb - wonderful views across the city, palace and the river.
Piece of art. There are only a few cathedrals over Europe with such a stunning design.This one is really amazing. It is a piece of art. The outside is just as amazing as the inside.
Saved by the stained glass. Very dark cathedral but beautiful stained glass windows.no imformation on cathedral in English.french German and Italian only.Are they telling us something?
Amazing cathedral. Very busy but well worth a look. The detail in this cathedral is amazing and is as mind blowing as some of the other big name cathedrals/ churches in Europe
A must see. We visited this amazing building last year since it is a great piece of attraction. However, we didn't have the chance to get in unfortunately.
Stained Glass Heaven. If you like stained glass this visit will be a treat. The panels are from various periods and the quality and colours area great.
Main Prague attraction - in my view. Amazingly beautiful Cathedral on top of the hill, inside the Prague Castle.You cannot miss it - it is a breathtaking baroque jewel!

St. Vitus Cathedral at Prague Castle--Don't miss it.. St. Vitus Cathedral is a magnificent edifice located in the Prague Castle complex, and is the building that stands out on the skyline at the top of the hill above Prague. Its soaring arches and beautiful stained glass compare with the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe. This is where monarchs were crowned, royal marriages were performed, and its history is intertwined with the history of the Czech people. Entrance to the cathedral is included in the admission price to the castle.
beautiful. We did not do the guided tour, but there is an area just at the entrance that we could visit to take a look around. It is a beautiful cathedral.
Beautiful. This is situated within Prague Castle, it is a beautiful Cathedral with the most stunning stain glass windows, wonderful relics and carvings.
Go for Baroque. Impressive cathedral with very large dome and numerous (faux marble) columns and other baroque details. Worth a visit.

Beautiful. I did not pay to go farther in the church but what I saw was enough and it was beautiful. It was crowded when I went in so expect lots of tourists taking pictures all around you but I think it's worth it. Probably better to go very early.

Mucha Stained Glass and Impressive Exterior. The highlights of this cathedral are the impressive Mucha stained glass interior and the impressive exterior of the cathedral with the gargoyles, flying buttresses, and the mosaic showing the heaven and hell depiction with the king and queen right in the middle. You can get inside to see the cathedral, but to really appreciate the stained glass and the rest of the church you need to get an admission ticket - well worth it.

Simply Stunning. All the churches that we visited - and there are so many - were just stunning. It's a word that I seem to repeat a lot, but it is difficult to find another to describe such wonderful places.

Magnificent - an Impressive Tribute to a Nation.. Set within the largest medieval fortifications in Europe this building is enduringly impressive. The entry fee is not cheap, but it includes several other sites and works out as a bargain overall. The cathedral has undergone a great deal of restoration and the various displays of the work makes you realise how much effort has been dedicated this national symbol.A guide of some sort is needed to make your visit worthwhile - the guidebooks are rather trivial and a guided tour is the only real option. To finish or 'cap' your visit a hike up the cathedral tower is more than worthwhile - but pricey and it's a heck of a long way up! The view is excellent and the detail of the roof and the other towers makes for real admiration for the builders.
The quintessential European Cathedral. Getting tickets is a little obscure, but the process was worth it. My wife said "This is what I was expecting (and didn't see) in Paris!" Beautiful place!

Beautiful. We're nearing the end of an 18 day trip to central Europe and this cathedral was on our list for the next to the last day. Prior to this we've visited churches in Krakow, Budapest, Vienna, Cesky Krumlov and others in Prague. From the stanpoint of sheer grandour this cathedral wins hands down. It is truly immense and has the most detailed stained glass windows we've seen on this trip. It's in the castle complex, but if you're on a limited budget you can see 99% of the good stuff from immediately inside the door.We got there by buying a day transit pass and taking the subway to a tram stop for tram 22 that has a stop across the street from the entrance to the complex. With a day pass you don't have to find a place to buy a return ticket or buy extra tickets when you board the subway.If you've found this helpful I alway appreciate a Yes vote above.Thanks for reading.
Loved this cathedral. This cathedral was huge and will take your breath away just standing inside. You are allowed to take pictures in there - but there are a lot of people mulling around.

CROWDED!. The cathedral was nice inside lovely stained glass windows. Could not move inside with hordes and hordes of tourist groups, who stop all the time. Japanese and Chinese taking photos and blocking the way too.

Super church. Having been in several churches over the course of our visit, this was one of the best. Enhanced by our unexpected organ and choir performance which just added to the atmosphere. Not one to miss.

unwelcomed for mass. The church itself is beautiful. Unfortunately, I had a horrible experience that tainted my visit . I looked online and saw that there was mass at St. Vitus on Sundays at 8:30am and 10am. My husband and I were very excited to be able to attend mass at such a beautiful cathedral. We were 7 minutes late to the 8:30am mass and the guard man said that we could not go in since we were late. We looked around the castle grounds planning to go to the 10am mass. We were going to go in around 9:40am but the man with limited English stopped us saying that only people for mass could go in and that the tourists could view the cathedral at noon. I told him that we were there to attend the mass and he said that it was too full and was only for Czech people. He proceeded to allow a lot of people in as long as they seemed like they were from Czech Republic and unfortunately, I think he did not let us in since we were Asian. I tried to find someone who spoke better English thinking maybe he didn't understand that we were trying to attend mass but he just brushed me off. I was baffled since I've never been discriminated against trying to go to mass when I traveled to other countries in Europe, South America, China, or in the US. Right before mass, the men guarding the door went in and all the tourists were allowed to go in. We went into the cathedral and I started to see if there were any seats free. My husband said that he didn't think we were allowed to sit down and that we may get kicked out...that was the impression they gave us. We ended up attending mass standing in the back. Meanwhile, anyone was allowed to come in to the cathedral while mass was celebrated to take pictures so people were allowed to take pictures pretty much everywhere...in the back, on the sides all the way to the front, and people were walking down the aisles where people were sitting. There were a few times when the men decided people were not allowed to come to certain areas but it was very inconsistent and they seemed more strict with any Asian tourists. The mass itself was beautiful with a wonderful choir singing especially with the acoustics of the cathedral. However, the whole experience made me upset and was truly disappointing.

The best thing about the castle complex!. A must visit when in Prague! If you have money to spare buy the castle complex tkt and go inside the church. If you are on a tight budget don't feel bad, you can still go in and see the church for its entrance hall!

Really good to get a guide around. Really cool pace - got a guided tour - lots to know you wouldn't pick up just by wandering round. Also luckily got to visit the crypt under the cathedral to see the old walls and caskets of Charles IV and wives etc. Thanks to Jaroslava
the most impressive cathedral. I liked it very much!!! very big, pure Gothic style and the stained glass windows were absolutely amaizing

It's odd rating a Cathedral.. Free to enter. Lovely architecture. It' a cathedral in a capital city. It's what you expect. There's a painting of Mary's accension into heaven which I'm told is pretty special. Not a lot of those around.

Too many people!. This magnificent cathedral was spoiled by the huge crowds of visitors at the time of our visit. Most were in large organised tour groups with loudly spoked tour guides. The whole mystic experience was completely ruined. Also several parts of the cathedral were closed off including St. Wenceslas's chapel.
Very Impressive. The structure itself is so breathtaking... and you actually realise how old it is by just looking at it outside. The inside is even more beautiful.

Amazing neo-gothic pile. You must not miss the cathedral, next to the Castle, if only to see the wonderful stained glass windows. As with several of the buildings in this area, you are told entry is free, but once you get into the cathedral, you cannot go right round it without paying a fee.

Not free anymore!. Only the back portion of the cathedral is free. To see the alter etc, you have to pay - included in the castle ticket. For those who just want to look at Mucha's work, you can see without paying from the back.
Early Mass. Went to 8:30 a.m. Mass at St. Vitus Cathedral. Nice service. Entrance was free, so we got to wander through the cathedral after Mass for free.

Architectural delight!. You have to visit the cathedral.. .the palace and the Golden Lane (and Kafka's house) 'Nuff said
Tip: Take Tram 22 and get off at Castle stop and walk down from castle not other way around

Amazing. There are so many churches in Prague it's hard to have a favorite and while I've hardly visited them all, St. Vitus is so far my favorite. It's huge and impsoing up close. Majestic and mysterious from a distance jutting up from the center of Prague Castle. Hopefully it will be open when you go to visit so you can have a look inside.

Breathtaking. This architectural wonder was one of the best things in Prague overall. Definitely go inside, it will take your breath away. You can walk around at the entrance for free, and for a small fee you can go even further. The location of the Cathedral is absolutely amazing as well, easily plan at trip there for half a day.

Buy the Full Ticket for Convenience. The full ticket is 350 CK ~ $15. The cathedral is very beautiful. The highlights are the Golden Lane and the display of the knight armor and weapons on the second level and the self guided walking history of the castle tour. The powder tower is not too compelling so skip that.

Breathtaking!. This place is oozing with history! You can feel it when you first walk up. There are no pictures to every really show the grandness of the architecture! Inside and out, you'll want to know the story behind every inch of it!

Gothic Spires. You can see the spires of the cathedral from all around Prague and once you get up close, it doesn't disappoint. Make sure you walk all the way round the outside, there is so much to see. If you don't want to buy the ticket for the whole complex, you can access the front part of the cathedral for free. .

Gothic cathedral with a stained glass window by Mucha.. Loved the cathedral with its sculpture and altarpieces. The admission scheme (and I mean that positively and negatively) is tied up with other monuments on the Prague Castle hill. Tickets which are rather pricey are good for two days, but once you have seen one monument, like the cathedral, you cannot go back again the next day with the same ticket. They make you pay again. I wouldn't have questioned this, but noticing that the tickets covered two days rather than one, it seems miserly not to let you see the church the next day if you wish. When I asked the information and ticket sellers about this "rule" which had not been well publicized, they were exceedingly rude.

Beautiful stained glass. This church is amazing. Loved the stained glass with all of the sun coming through it. The castle and church is the largest castle complex in the world and dates back to the 9th century. St. Vitus wasn't completed though until 1929.
Well worth a visit. Part of the palace complex. Allow plenty of time preferably all day at this complex to enjoy all the sights. Some queues for the church not too bad.

A little priced for the whole visit but worthwhile. Part of the cathedral can be visited for free but it is worthwhile buying the overall ticket and visit the back part too. The cathedral is partly built in recent years and partly in the past - the glass windows are definitely beautiful.

gothic at the top. inside the castle area a most powerful expression of gothic style where you can feel the tension towards height and elegance of light still strong architectures.
gorgeous inside : takes hours visit by itself.

The church is good but the view from the tower is fantastic. We enjoyed our day in the castle and found the Cathedral to be very good, but the highlighted was the tower which offers spectactular views of Prague. Be warned it is 287 steps to the top and there is no lift, but the climb is well worth the effort.

It will be crowded!. You can enter free but will have had to have paid a castle 'short tour' ticket to see the majority of the Cathedral. Naturally packed with tourists and the signing could be better. I would have missed a lot had it not been for the fact that I brought along a guide book. Well worth the visit though, the 1000 year old tombs of ancient Kings, the stained glass and the architecture are memorable.

Don't Miss This Church. Europe is full of spectacular churches, but this one stands out from all the rest. Every space, from floor to ceiling has something to appreciate. This church has so much colorful history that has taken place within its walls.

Beautiful... a must see. The stained glass windows were absolutely worth the visit all by themselves... We used the audio tour, it was OK, a bit dry for our taste. The views from the castle were stunning also.
enormous. The Catherdral can be seen from almost anywhere in the city.The stained glass windows were some of the most beautiful i have ever seen.
Great cathedral. Great cathedral of its beauty and gorgeousness. Somewhat resemble Gaudi's cathedral in Barcelona (but just a little:))

Amazing place. If you're in Europe and go to multiple places, you'll be churched out by the end of your visit. No matter how many times you say no more churches, you must come here. St Vitus is important to the people of Prague, even if they're not Catholic, it serves as a symbol to them. I had a local guide so I didn't do the tour, but it's worth it to do admission and a tour if you're on you're own. You can also go in for no fee. A must see!
Must see. This cathedral is one of the most beautiful in Europe. One must stand on the Charles Bridge at night to get the magnificent view of the cathedral and castle.

in the Hradzsin. Several architectural styles seen on a building. More on Hungary monument can be found here. Such is the chapel of St. Sigismund. Here was buried in St John Nepumoki and Sigismund Bathory as well.

Awesome. Well worth a visit. St. Vitus cathedral is bigger than it looks on the outside. It has beautiful architecture and it is best to follow a tour because there are so many features of historical and cultural interest.

They do have senior rates. You have to ask, but they do have senior rates for the tickets. We did the short tour, cathedral/basilica/golden lane. Took us about 1 1/2 hrs. It's very beautiful & worth it. $125cr each. Watch out for the changing of the guards every hour...

Beautiful stained glass. Very old gothic church and truly the best part of the Castle visit. The stained glass is breathtaking, perhaps some of the best stained glass we have seen in our travels. A must visit when in Prague.

Beautiful stained glass windows. Wonderful cathedral overlooking the city - wa really busy with tours which can be annoying and there's no quiet place for reflection but it is a fabulous building with wonderful windows
Prague Castel. If you take the tickets of the tour in the Castel recommend on the 350 CZ ticket and it is important to take earphones.
awesome. More elaborate than Notre Dame. Beautiful interior and stained glass. Incredibly renovated. Must visit if you are in Prague.

place. very good place, it's the best place to take pictures, there are a lot of places to visit in it, but the people are stupid, everything are paid, when you buy a ticket, always have something that you don't buy, and some places don't accept euros.

Worth the Price. St. Vitus Cathedral s the high point of your visit to the Prague Castle. Unfortunately, you have to buy a 350 K combined ticket to visit the Cathedral properly. If you go inside on the free visit, you will not be able to see even 20 percent of what this place has to offer. I really liked the stained glass work in the Cathedral.The funny part is that this price does not include the visit to the the South Tower. One has to buy 150K ticket for this tower separately, and climb the winding 280 odd stairs to the top. But believe me, the effort is well rewarded with unforgettable, magnificent panoramic view of the Prague City. You will go trigger happy, and bring home fabulous memories of your holiday!

Beautiful cathedral, beautiful location. This is a must-visit when in Prague. Buying a ticket permits you to return for another visit within two days, and also gains you entry to the Old Palace and the Golden Lane with its fascinating little old former residences and shops. I recommend paying the additional fee to join the guided tour in your own language. I felt that this gave me an insight that an audio guide would not have, as well as access to parts of the cathedral that were closed to other visitors, such as the crypt. Our guide really helped me to understand better the history and geography of the building, without going into long detail. The Mucha window in the cathedral was fascinating for us, having previously visited the Mucha Museum in the town. The area around the cathedral and the gardens provide continuing interest and pleasure and I would certainly recommend walking to and from the area if you are able, as the views are just amazing. There is a cafe right by the cathedral where you can sit and watch the world go by, as well as a couple of other drink vendors nearby.

Very beautiful. One of the must see sites in Prague. Very historical and interesting! It was packed with other tourists but things flowed quite smoothly. Would recommend getting an audio guide though!

spectacular church. We took tram 22 up to the Castle Gardens and made our way into the castle grounds. St Vitus, situated inside the Castle grounds, is an impressive gothic cathedral, founded in 1344, but it wasn't until the 1800's that it was finally completed. Over the years there have been many coronations in this spectacular cathedral. St. Wenceslas Chapel is decorated with beautiful frescoes and semi-precious stones. Free entry is available to part of the cathedral after 1.00pm, but be prepared to wait in a long line to get inside. The wait, however, is worth it..

Get The Audio Guide. Beautiful cathedral. HOWEVER, the St. Vitus Treasury exhibition is much more impressive. It has a separate entrance fee (about 15 USD) but the artifacts you can view are extraordinary. Do not miss it!http://www.hrad.cz/en/prague-castle/photogallery/prague-castle/32.shtml

Take the free interior self guided tour. This Cathedral rivals Notre' Dame in Paris, spendid leaded glass windows, the naves are decorated as well, high reaching stone vaulting and very photogenic. As you exit walk back down the hill stop on the Bistro/ Vineyard Terrace for a Drink & View!
Stunning cathedral. I visited St. Vitus Cathedral in April 2013. I loved the stained glass impressive windows and it's simplicity.One should definetely visit it within the Prague Castle.

Beautiful. This is another must see on a Prague visit no matter how little time you may have. I definitely recommend the audio guide which is available as part of the castle tour; it is very very informative; and with it you might be able to ignore the loud and rude tour guides who seem to think they own the place.  Maybe later in the afternoon the place gets less crowded but it's so beautiful you just have to put up with the crowd; take your time; and enjoy the place. There is a required entrance fee, payable again in the room where you purchase the castle long or shot tours. I think with the audio guide you can spend upwards of two hours just seeing this church.

Wonderful stained glass from all eras. The Cathedral has long queues but they move quickly. Once inside it is very crowded just inside the door but there is plenty of room as you move around. For me, the best thing here was the stained glass - fabulous colours and interesting subjects all depicted with artistry and love. It's especially good to see the Art Nouveau treatment by Mucha.

Best Views are from afar, But worth seeing. It was quite the walk on a warm afternoon to get up to the Cathedral, but it was worth it when we got there. My favorite part was the spires on the outside of the Cathedral and the front face. It is free to get inside and there is some nice stained-glass to see, but honestly, it was nothing super special inside. Honestly, my favorite part of the Cathedral was seeing it on top of the hill from afar from different spots all over the city.
St. Vitas. Really a fantastic old cathedral that when you first see it upon approach takes your breath away. Beautiful stained glass windows. Imposing interior of tall sandstone columns.

most important place for a Czech!. A very impressive Cathedral, very well preserved, Saint Vitus is the most important place for a Czech, having a rich history that goes back to 14th century. The first building on the site was erected in the year 925! The actual Cathedral is the 3rd building, founded in 1344.

Huge Cathedral. We saw a surprising number of brides and grooms, each with a couple of attendants while we were there. Actually we saw brides and grooms in the Old Town also on that day. It looked like the bridal parties were using the old building for photo backgrounds. It is always cool to see the couples. Apparently this was the last minute rush in April as no wants to get married in May. "Get married in May and you will rue the day".This of course is another must see in Prague and well worth your time. The walk up the hill is doable but there is a bus which goes up to the top also. Glad we walked. We did arrive a little late in the day and our tour consisted mainly of the different cathedrals on the castle grounds. We did visit one section of the castle which had all displays of medieval armor and some weapons. Including an opportunity to try your hand at shooting a cross bow. The man in charge of the cross bow was so delightful and even let us try though we were a few Crowns short. This is
Must see. Great place one of best cathedrals in Europe. Part of Prague castle complex and really impressive. Alot of tourists anyhow so the earlier you go the better.

Marvellous architecture inside and out. Located inside the Prague castle, this has to be one of the most magnificent cathdrals that I've been to. You can see the spire of this cathedral from most parts of Prague but getting up close to this huge cathedral is something else. The outside entrance has a rose window and you would be strained to find a place to get a good shot of this with all the people around. The inside is even better with several side chapels (including one for St Wenceslas) which are really well made with intricate sculptures and the stained glass makes the place look really stunning. There is even a map of Prague from the early times inside the cathedral. The inside of the cathedral can be much colder than the outside, so be prepared for this.
gothic cathedral. Must see awe-inspiring gothic cathedral that took 600 years to complete. St. wencelas chapel is also a must see.
Extraordinary architecture. Take some time to visit this incredible church. And see the old portion. It is worth the admission price.
Awe Inspiring. From the first step into the cathedral we were transported back in time and struck by the beauty and spiritual feeling.

A highlight of our Prague trip. The cathedral is very impressive with beautiful stained glass windows, incredible Gothic architecture and interesting history. Well worth the climb to the bell tower - the view of Prague is the most spectacular! Visit first thing in the morning to avoid crowds.
We climbed the tower. All 258 steps! It is worth it for the great view of Prague. It costs extra if one has not bought the top tier ticket.

Do not miss this.. An very beautiful cathedral. The stained glass is amazing. This is a large cathedral that is well worth paying the small price for access to the full interior. And if you are over 65 and have ID it is half price. What a steal.

a typical gothic cathedral. another impressive gothic style cathedral as many in northen Europe.
if you are plenty of time, would be nice to go.

Amazing windows. Huge cathedral on breathtaking scale. Stained glass windows are absolutely beautiful.
Far far far too many people in it though! Unfortunately the serene atmosphere that we should have experienced was ruined by the number of people jostling for space in the small free section of the cathedral.
Get there early!

Classic, nothing particular. We've visited many churches and Cathedrals in our many travels together but this one was just part of a cluster of buildings we had to see as part of the sightseeing tour. There was nothing particular about it, it was dark and damp, the only ornamental center piece was visible from a narrow dock from which we were pushed by the other visitors.

Awesome gothic cathedral. Awesome example of gothic cathedral design with high, soaring domes, beautiful stained glass windows including a stunning rose window and chapels for famous people such as St Wenceslas. While the building is a landmark in Prague, the experience of visiting there is largely spoiled by multiple guided tours running simultaneously (crowded) and with tour guides (noisy). Go very early!!

Must see Cathedral!!. We bought the tickets which allow the visitors to get in four sites in Prague castle. This is one of them. The inside is magnificent. The pictured color windows and numerous amazing statues and decoration are just breathtaking. It is one of best Cathedral I have seen in Europe. You can get into the entrance without ticket, but if you want to see more it needs the ticket. There are a lot more to see and very impressive statues in the back. It is truly worth the visit.

A stunning cathedral. A shame about the entrance fee.. This stunning cathedral dates back to the mid 1300's, but was only completed in the 20th century.A beautiful portal leads you into the cathedral, and only there you realize that if you want to explore all the cathedral, you have to buy a ticket, otherwise you are restricted to a rather small space near the entrance. That's a shame! Plus – it's HIGHLY overcrowded.The height of the cathedral is mesmerizing and the coloured windows are absolutely stunning.Skip the guided tour and just follow the path from left to right using the leaflets available.Don't forget to walk around the cathedral from the outside, as each side of it is unique.

Gothic wonder. 10th Century CE Gothic architecture, cold sand stone aged black by centuries of rain and sun-shine, gargoyles straight out of medieval thrillers... St. Vitus cathedral inside the Prague Castle complex has all this and much more to offer.It is the witness of reigns of several kings and queens and an excellent spot to just observe old and modern Prague from a high vantage point.Must see in Prague.

Stunning Cathedral. Wow what a stunning cathedral and we are so pleased we paid a little extra to go in. We had not paid for a guide though so the free leaflets were very handy to understand what we were looking at. Simply stunning place - a must see both inside and out. Wrap up warm though - it was bitterly cold inside....
Beautiful. This building is truly stunning. Generally quite a crowded area as it's one of the first things you come to on entering the castle grounds.

Magnificient!!!!. its stunningly beautiful........takes you to a different period in time...awesome architecture....very intricate designs and art work....Gothic architecture....its a must visit.......ur trip is incomplete without visiting here

Awe Inspiring ... The stained glass windows are amazing..
A maginfiant cathedral and worth the look...
Go early in the morning or you will be in a huge line which takes the magic away from the expereince..

Very impressive. We were there yesterday (19/4/13/) Located in the grounds of Prague Castle. We walked around it and because its in a courtyard surrounded by other buildings it looks enormous, where usually Cathedrals are on their own e.g. Palma, Notre Dame, Christ Church.We took a walk inside, the ceiling towers above and looks unsupported. Intricately patterned and stunning.You can walk inside fro free but once inside there is a barrier that you need a ticket to get through to walk all the way up the cathedral. Unless you are really into churches or religion, If you have seen 1 cathedral, you have seen them all.We got there for 10:30 yesterday and it was thronged with coach loads of elderly tourists and American, Italian & French school groups.Well worth a visit though because you cant fail to be impressed by its sheer scale.

Beautiful...a must see. This is a truly beautiful cathedral and well worth the visit!We went in early (~9.15am) before the crowds and we weren't disappointed. Especially brilliant are the stained and painted glass windows which are the best I've ever seen. With the sun shining through them it was amazing! Not sure which time of day is best for them but they were brilliant at this time and there weren't hoards of people in the way so we got some great pics.
A must see.... but extremely crowded. The Cathedral is truly impressive. Plan your visit so that you can avoid the crowds though. Go in the later afternoon.

Beautiful but crowded. The cathedral is beautiful but we were standing shoulder to shoulder with people and it was oppressive and uncomfortable so we only did a short visit. We were advised that an evening visit would be less constricting but that didn't fit our itinerary unfortunately.
You must this!!. Its worth the walk through lesser town and up the hill see this Cathedral. One of the most aw inspiring things you will ever see.
Beautiful!. Rich in history and beauty. Stained glass is unbelievable when seen inside! I suggest a tour guide, as the stories behind it all are very interesting and bring it to life.

Beautiful!. This cathedral is beautiful. It's huge. Nice stained glass windows and high spires. It can be windy and a bit cold on the castle hill and it was even colder inside the cathedral when we went.

Great architecture for its times. Wear a jacket as it is cold inside.. Lovely stained glass windows. It was quite cold in the inside. Wear a jacket when going inside the church, however pleasant the weather may be on the outside.

Words fail me. The cathedral is awe inspiring. The architecture amazing, even though it took over 600 years to complete, it appears as if it was built by the same architect and workers. Just beautiful.

The Highlight of the Castle Visit. When in Prague, everything is dominated by the spires of St Vitus up on the hillside, Most people mistake it for the castle founds surrounding it. Although the castle is Interesting, it's St Vitus and its monumental interior that is the must see. The interior is humbling, and the view from the tower is, we'll, all I can say is a 360 degree view of Prague leaves you breathless.

One of the best Cathrdral. It is an awesome Cathedral. Deserve a visit and walk around carefully. We did not paid the tower as we have visited the tower on Charles Bridge. It is probably the only interesting thing in the palace I think.

Absolutely beautiful. I only went to the foyer of the church rather than paying for the tour, but this was enough to see the gorgeous stained glass windows and magnificent architecture of the church. Highly recommended.
Gothic to the extreme. A brilliant example of gothic with grotesques and gargoyles as well as brilliant stonework. Be aware that the inside is freezing and you need to pay to get a good look inside.
Stunning Cathedral. Rich in history (over 1000 years old!) and stunning stained glass.Definitely recommend going early to avoid the crowds.

Probably the most stunning setting and the most lovely cathedral in Europe. Lovely architecture in a stunning setting. Amazing gothis baroque mix. Most lovely are the early 20th century stained glass windows
Impressive. Lovely architechture on the outside and very impressive on the inside, part of the multi ticket that you get from the castle main ticket office.
Immense!!!. I was unable to get an angle for my photos to show the size of this strutucre. My husband insists that it is truly more impressive than Notre Dame.

Interesting building and view from the tower. Very beautiful interior and stained glass windows - great views from the tower over the city. Cathedral also eyecatching from down below especially at night when lit up. Very busy with groups/tourists but definitely worth visiting.

Beautiful. Absolutely worth the money to pay a visit to this Cathedral. We paid entry by buying the short trip which included St George's Basilica. The Cathedral has some beautiful chapels and tombs, along with the stunning stained glass windows. We also paid to go up the South Tower, this is not for the faint hearted, 297 steps that are step and can make you feel dizzy, but the views from the top of the cathedral and mind blowing, especially on a clear sunny day.

an impressive gothic cathedral. it could be out of a story of the gothic century,the cathedral is amazing! is huge and impressive.
has hand made doors made by iron,inside has amazing glass paintings. definitely worths a vist.

marvellous stained glasses. I was stunned by the magnificent and colourful stained glasses, especially made by Mucha and other modern artists.
The cathedral is majestic.
Beautiful!. SO much history here. The site of the Czech crown jewels. Although not on show, you can see into St. Wenceslas Chapel where they are kept under lock and key.

Grand Building. You can just walk in (recommended) although we did it as part of a ticketed tour which allows you to see all around inside. Great for History buffs with King Wenceslas and St Vitus tombs to see. Be warned it is not heated and it is like a fridge inside.
lovely. while I can apreciate the beauty of this catherdral I have been moved by just as, if not more exquisite catherdrals in the UK

Impressive Cathedral. I've been to more than a dozen European countries. I've gone through more old churches than I can count. St. Vitus impressed me. The architecture, stained glass, and scale of the cathedral is really spectacular. I think the fact it's part of the Prague Castle complex added to its appeal as there was more to it than "just an old church." Go early though. I was one of the first people inside the morning I visited, and by the time I left large groups were already starting to come in. An hour later there was a fairly long line for entry.
Awesome. Just walking around the castle district is good. Cap it off with a look at the cathedral. If your timing is good upon entering the district you may get to see the changing of the guards.

The Alfons Mucha window!. Just loved, loved, loved this stained glass window; the most beautiful of all church windows I have ever seen.Didn't like the thousands of tourists in the Cathedral; would recommend that you get there very early or go just before closing time.

Gorgeous. I'm not big on cathedrals but loved every minute viewing this awe-inspiring building. Its huge and the architecture is amazing. Our time in Praha was limited but I'm so glad we made time for and spend the little extra to see this.

Gorgeous stained glass windows. Lovely Gothic cathedral, but the real stars are the stained glass windows, in particular the one by Mucha. It is worth buying the ticket that allows you into the rest of the cathedral as it allows a better view of the windows and the tombs around the altar.
stunning. extremely interesting . on entry through gates it was magical and as one got further round there was a magnificent silver monument

Best part of the entire Prague Castle (Hradcany) complex. The stained glass windows are stunning and worth of paying the extra to see, as well as the interesting solid silver tomb. You can get maybe 80% of the overall experience on the "free" ticket but we found this to be the best of the entire castle (see my overall review of the castle for reasons why!).Very nice!As mentioned on my castle review, get a single audioguide and share - if the ticket/audioguide seller says "you don't need one it's all in English" ignore them and get a guide. There's NOTHING there to tell you what you are looking at. Get an audioguide!

In our top five of Cathedrals.. Beautiful setting, magnificent Church. London, Paris, and Rome have some beautiful cathedrals and abbeys but this one would still probably make the top five. Stained glass and the setting set it apart. Can see it from all of Prague.

Stained Glass Paradise. It's freezing in there on a cold day but the stained glass windows are something to see. Did not do the paying tour that gets you close to the altar but the free visit was awe-inspiring.

Incredible. If you're in Prague you MUST visit this Cathedral, in dominates the skyline and you are sure to see this magnificent from afar. Take the time and head up to see it up close. Inside it is beautiful, and a testament to the craftsmanship found throughout Prague. The history of the Cathedral is highly intriguing and spending time here is essential.

Very appreciative of being able to view it. We were on a guided tour and loved the cathedral. The tour didn't include the ability to thoroughly view all aspects of the interior of the cathedral, but it was a cold day anyway.

Stunning. I am not a great one for cathedrals, but this one was really special. It forms part of the Prague castle tour and is by far the most stunning piece. It stands proudly overlooking the city on the hilltop with its amazing architecture and spires, but inside is even more amazing. The stained glass windows are lovely, the amazing solid silver actions statue at the far end is simply remarkable. The whole interior is breathtaking.

Amazingly detailed, intricate building.... We went here after spending hours that morning wandering around Prague's old town and really, we didn't get all we could have done out of it simply because we were tired. Head here early in the day, as part of a special 'set aside' day for the Castle, Castle Gardens and St. Vitus to get the most out of it.Entrance to the building itself is free, but to get beyond the barriers inside and really explore it, you'll need to have a ticket. It's also worth noting that you're welcome to take photos so long as you aren't using a flash.The windows, the ceiling, the altar... all are stunning. We would have joined one of the tours to get the most out of this wonderful building but we were too desperate for a sit-down! Sorry St. Vitus... Take your time and enjoy this amazing building.
Wonderful Gothic. Well worth the walk up from the Charles Bridge. We arrived in time to see the changing of the guard at noon.

Wonderful. You can not visit the Prague Castle without going inside - no need to buy the ticket as a view from inside the public access area is pretty good unless you are a real boffin. Recommend you do go up the Great South tower (287 steps) as the view is tremendous.
St. Vitus. Aw inspiring to put it mildly. A beautiful piece of architecture both inside and out. A must see when you are in Pargue.
Gorgeous architecture. The cathedral is beautiful with exquisite stained glass windows and high gothic arches .. a must see

charming. Cathedral is very charming from outside. For the entrance there was a long que in the morning however after lunch there were only a few people. The church has very colorful and nice windows. At every corner there was a different story about religion. It is possible to participate the tours to learn it in details.
Don't miss it!. Don't miss this place!!! It's unique!!! On Sunday there is mass so you won't be able to get inside. Don't skip the main altar

Love it, inside and out. This Cathedral is worth a visit when you're up at the Castle area. The detail on the outside is beautiful to look at, and the inside is quite nice as well. There is a certain shrine inside that has red fabric draped down from the ceiling that is particularly nice. Make sure to take a walk through the adjacent gardens for great views of the cathedral from all sides.
Marvelous architecture. Its part of the Prague Castle complex and has Marvelous architecture. A must see in Prague along with other buildings in the Prague Castle

Stunning! Worth a ticket!. This stunning Gothic Cathedral was a highlight of our trip to Prague. The stained glass and mosaics are incredible. We bought the combo ticket for the castle and churches. This was our favorite. Get there early and make sure to walk around outside to view the cathedral from different angles. The park grounds are beautiful as well. We spent 3.5 hours exploring the area.

Gothic Cathedral. It is definitely worth to pay the price to enter in this church. From the outside it looks fantastic by itself, with an imposing structure and elaborate Gothic decorations. The inside is even better, with wonderful stained glasses and mosaics.

Gothic Cathedral. Darkened stone outside, but lighter inside. All the stained glass windows are reasonably new. Might be large by Czech standards, but really nothing special as Cathedrals go ! As part of the Castle it is worth a visit.

Breathtaking!. Normally I don't really get excited by churches, but this one was really breathtakingly beautiful. Although it was freezing cold and my feet began to hurt, I stayed almost 2 hours in the cathedral to take in all the details. definetely worth a visit

Breathtaking. The steep walk up to the place is worth it to see st vitus cathedralThe architecture is amazing . One tip is to bring water with you as there is no where inside the place grounds to drink!There are plenty of cafes outside the palace. You should give yourself at least half a day to explore this wonderful palace

Amazing Gothic architecture!. This Cathedral is located in Hradcany, which is a must visit place in Prague. It is vast and just amazing.. The gorgeous Gothic architecture and the stained glass left us speechless. I would definately reccomend visiting the South Tower of the Cathedral - it is a bit pricy, but the view of the Prague is worth any money! (150 czk per person for the tower visit only)
Amazing. Great place to visit and take beautiful photographs. Wrap up warm if you want to enjoy the whole area.

St. Vitus Cathedral Prague, CZ Republic. Gothic architecture has always been my favorite. The carved wood of the cathedral, high vaulted ceiling and fantastic priceless stained glass windows...not since Notre Dame Cathedral have we seen such beautiful stained glass charm.

Excellent example of Gothic architecture. It dominates the skyline above Prague, and certainly doesn't disappoint when you get up close and personal with the cathedral. The windows are remarkable and the ceiling a marvel.

Amazing building, poor management. The architecture and stained glass are marvelous, but entry closes at 4PM for winter months and not much later during spring and summer. If you're tight on cash, you can get inside and see a small bit of the cathedral (not inherently obvious, the ticket check is not right at the doors), although a 'short visit' ticket is definitely worth it. Tickets also cannot be purchased inside or immediately near the cathedral, and are in an adjoining building in Prague Castle.

Vast, full of intricate detail. The Cathedral is vast and yet is covered in intricate detail. The stained glass windows are amazing as is the detailing and sculpting throughout the building. My only criticism is that the vast number of crowds visiting the Cathedral took away some of the ambience and tranquillity that you would expect to find in a place of worship. I would suggest that perhaps a visit earlier or later in the day to avoid the crowds would be recommended.

Worth the visit but prepare for crowds. The cathedral is worth visiting as it's old, full of history and interesting artifacts in addition to the chapels. The stained glass is interesting as there are many styles. However, the cathedral can get super busy and crowded by tour groups and their guides. Security is in charge of keeping traffic moving. If you're not part of a tour, it can be awkward to find an out-of-the-way place to listen to your rented headset. Also, in the winter or still-frigid spring, the cathedral was super cold and the marble floor makes your feet really cold.
historic complex. Loved it. Disappointed that there are no post cards of the two beautiful windows on the left of the entrance. Can be difficult to find all the spots on the map.
Beautiful Cathedral in Prague. Very beautiful and old cathedral in Prague. It is a must see. Take the time to enjoy the church.check the opening hours before you go
Best cathedral in Prague. Don't miss the best cathedral in the whole city - beautiful neo-gothic building with gorgeous windows, gothic sculptures and atmosphere of old times.
Beautiful cathedral. The cathedral is absolutely beautiful and the setting is fantastic. Would love to go there again when there are fewer visitors.

Amazing from the outside. Like lots of things in Prague you have to pay to enter and this seemed expensive for what was on offer. The stained glass windows could be seen for free and there wasn't much more inside worth viewing. It was very dark and in need of cleaning but the cost of doing so on such a scale probably prohibitive. The outside is amazing and it towers about all else in the Castle and can be seen from way afar.

Ancient Cathedral. A big cathedral when u have ur first look at it. Amazing barrock culture..lot of tours available which you should try to take it to know about this cathedral . In the inside the huge beautifully painted glasses are good to watch specially when the sunlight falls on the... Must visit in case you are in Prague.. do not miss it.
a lovely cathedral. A stunning building but very busy. The stained glass is spectacular. It is indeed a verh oppulent church.

Best part of Prague. By far the most wow-worthy part of Prague and the Prague Castle. I almost cried touring the inside of this Cathedral, it was just so magnificent and beautiful. Absolutely a must-see for anyone with a sense of culture or history.

A must see when you visit Prague. The Prague castle complex is huge and located on a hill. Nyou can see the complex from many parts of the city and the cathedral stands out amongst all the buildings. when we visited, it was closed but the building is absolutely stunning. it is extremely.
