Ornate and has so many intricate details that you could literally spend hours just examining it.
Spectacular architecture. We did not pay the extra price to visit the crypt or walk along the side altars. Still a breathtaking piece of engineering and art worth seeing.
Beautiful Stained Glass. Beautiful cathedral with really interesting stained glass. The Mucha stained glass was especially interesting.

Beautiful especially the Glass window by Mucha. Set inside the castle this is a must see attraction especially with its religeous significance. The painted and stained glass is wonderous. The architecture exceptional. The front portico has four carvings of the architects designers and builders clever, nice touch and interesting.

Impressive Building. The exterior is awesome . The Golden Gate and just the sheer size is spectacular. Inside is equally as impressive and although its free to enter its worth the castle ticket to be able to look round the side chapels etc.
Go up the tower. Lovely cathedral, Inside the castle walls. If you have the time and energy go up the 250 (ish) steps to the tower less people (only one other couple) and fantastic views.
stunning soaring views inside and out. Nothing I disliked! Overcast skies and fresh snow made this whole place rather ethereal.....jawdropping work inside and out

You can see this cathedral all over Prague. This cathedral is at the top of the castle district. If you have seen one cathedral in Europe, you have pretty much seen them all. It was raining a bit when we went there, which drew our attention to the waterspouts. Some of them are particularly gruesome. We enjoyed watching them throw up water.

Beautiful. St. Vitus Cathedral was beautiful. It had one of the most beautiful tombs I have ever seen. There was a Czech guard by it and I believe he told us it took two tons of silver to make it! The outside is also so beautiful!
Awesome!. Amazing building full of history , stained glass and every saint you can think of! Spend a decent amount of time in here to absorb the atmosphere that has been gathered over the centuries.
St Vitus Cathedral. This nis an amazing piece of archetecture built over the years. The stained glass windows are a delight.
So many cathedrals. To be honest, i could do no more than dash in and out, read a few signs and take pictures. Just too many things to see in one day!

A must, when in Prague. Impressive and beautiful church with magnificent, glasspainted windows. I understand that the Church needs money for the upkeep of the building, but I don't particularly like the idea of having to pay to see more than just parts of it up close.

Breathtaking. This cathedral is amazing. To walk around the main area of the church is free and you can buy tickets for the viewing area in the office across from it. Can be very crowded so be careful with belongings.

A wonderful religious building!. A wonderful religious building. A church with beautiful stained glassες and metal sculptures. We got the tickets (worth 125 Czech crowns - combined ticket for students) andwe visit the interior of the church. If you like ecclesiastical monuments worth to see it.

One of the greatest Gothic Cathedrals in the world!!!. Extremely worth visiting place in Prague!!! If You are here for the first time - don't hesitate to by ticket for at least less sightseeing places on the territory of Prague Castle - of course, St. Vitus Cathedral is among of them:)). The interior is simply magnificent!!! But also find time in the evening to observe its exterior in lights - it's also very impressive!!!

Spectacular - the iconic building of Prague.. This is an architect or architectural-enthusiasts' delight - just sit outside and pick out the centuries of architectural styles! Be sure to look for the busts of the architects who finished the building - they are the ones in modern suits amidst the middle-ages robes worn by the saints that decorate the outside. There is a fee for entrance, but not if you are attending Mass, though if you are not Czech, you may have a hard time convincing the door staff that you are really there for worship. When you enter, be sure to check out the beautiful stained glass windows.

Beautiful church. This church is huge and very busy, but is well worth the wait. The interior is beautiful. The stain glass window are particularly beautiful . The tomb of John of Nepomuk is amazing as is the rosé window at the front of the cathedral .

Simply breath taking. The sheer size is fascinating even from distance, sadly i was on tight schedule so couldn't fully go around but even the first hall you see if magnificent. It's inside the Prague Castle and you can see it from the distance.If you happen to be there make sure you visit it, surely worth it.

Stunning stained glass. The colors of the glass are breathtaking. No frescos here, but the glass is delightful! Fee to get closer to stained glass but can still take decent photos from behind ropes for free. From outside, better photos from back and side of cathedral. On freezing wet days, look up for gargoyles with ice coming out of their mouths.
Beautiful. It is charming, after the dark rises, the place becomes magical.It is really beautiful, worthy for the trip. Big, gothic styled buildings, full with history.

Beautiful. Located in the center of Prague Castle the St. Vitus Cathedral is impossible to miss. You can enter the first part of the Cathedral for free and its enough to see the beautiful colored glass windows.

An excellent example of Gothic art work.. It is an excellent example of the Gothic cathedral. It is said to be the biggest and the most important church in Czech republic. It is monumental building in the Prague Castle. It represents an important part of the Czech history besides being a holy place for catholics. A must see place in Prague.
fantastic. again easy walk to get to. a must see. pointless going all that way and not getting out and about. make sure you have your camera

a gothic cathedral. the cathedral is very interesting, a real gothic architecture, huge and impressive,i really enjoyed the visit but it could be open to the public without an entrance. however, if you pay and go,pay attention to the wooden sculptures and the glass windows.
Impressive cathedral. Well preserved and interesting cathedral - worth getting the audio guide. However very cold in winter so wrap up warm!
great stained glass. well worth the entrance fee - amazing to think it was built so many centuries ago and the glass work is fantastic
Beautiful cathedral. Great and majestic. well worth seeing. You can go in and look around but have to pay to go all around the cathedral. not worth it

A beautiful cathedral. This cathedral is situated in the Prague Castle complex and is well worth a visit. You can actually enter the building for free, but in order to see all the chapels and other parts of the cathedral other than the entrance area, it is well worth buying a combination ticket which includes other buildings in the complex. It's valid for two days, so you don't have to rush around.

Worth the visit. We didn't pay to go round the cathedral (although it would of been good if we had the time) but you are able to go in for free and look around to a point. It is a beautiful and impressive cathedral inside and out with amazing stain glass windows and architecture

Most sacred place in Czech republic. Although this cathedral is very old and part of a prestigious Castle complex, it still holds services. Tourists can wander around and admire the ancient tombs of kings and saints. It is best to visit it early, before the crowds start coming in.

Nothing special. Maybe because I do not fancy such monuments, I did not see anything interesting in this cathedral. I do not think it is much different than the other cathedrals. It was pretty cold inside. Colder than outside. Waste of time for me.
St.Vitus Cathedral. Magnificent cathedral. Very high ceiling. Stained glass windows are breathtaking.This is a cathedral opened in 929 AD

Lovely stained glass. Fascinating mix of the very old and the relatively new, a monument to persistence, this cathedral took a thousand years to complete. There's loads of Czech history here, a banqueting hall that used to host indoor jousting, and beautiful windows of radiant, if not ancient, stained glass. Worth a trip.

Majestic Cathedral with Mucha stained glass. To be exact only one window is by Mucha and it is painted not stained, but the colors are beautiful. There are many alcoves to see but the most interesting part is the treasury. No hats allowed on men inside.

Beautiful. Probably one of the most beautiful cathedrals I've seen in Europe!!! It was easy to find and easy to get to, the only confusing thing about this place is the different ticket offices you have to go to to get inside the cathedral and also the musems.... if you pay extra then you get to climb the tower - which is awesome!!
Impressive Gothic cathedral. Take your time to enjoy the impressive structure, facade, inside and its surrounding.If you must come during summer, get here as early as possible.

Beautiful Catherdral. This Cathedral is lovely. I didn't even know it was up next to the castle and when we came across it I had to check it out. I was glad I did. Not only is the outside beautiful but so it the inside. I was very impressed and would recommend you visit this while staying in Prague.

View from bridge better then from square. Gargoyles, golden gate, stained-glasses, monuments - colossal and so sharp. You coudn't mix it up with other cathedral. It's black exterior rignt from medieval ages, Unbelievable height of steeples, all these catholic things - arches and contrforces and stuff - from belfry its amazing! As the rest of town, to be true :)
An Eyeopener. Fascinating place to visit, breathtaking. The sheer size of the Cathederal is unbelievable! I have never seen anything like it in my life. An utter masterpiece and a must see!
wrap up warm. a beautiful cathedral with fantastic stained glass, your camera just cannot do the windows justice. make sure you wrap up though as it is freezing inside. worth a trip

The outside is better than the inside. Not worth seeing the inside if you have to wait in line. (A Baroque extravaganza reserved to the thus inclined. Admirers of Mucha will look for the North window.) The Southern facade is magnificent (Venetian glass mosaics of the Last Judgement).

pay and see. Pay and see it all, its wonderful and well worth it. We turned up late in the afternoon and were the last ones in. We were not pressured to rush and the attendants followed us around but with lots of room for us to explore, talk and soak it all in. The stain glass windows were amazing and I couldn't keep my eyes off of them. It is a place I will never forget, its a must if you go to Prague.

amazing and beautiful building. We visited here early in the morning before there were too many people around. We went up the tower 256 steps and although hard work the view at the top more than made up for it. The audio guide is an excellent way of learning about all the different chapel and other information within the cathedral at your own leisure

A beautiful cathedral. We like to visit and photograph different cathedrals and this one was also very photographic. Mind you, you cannot use a tripod and photographing is restricted to the anterior part and you cannot walk close to front of the cathedral. You will enjoy the unique glasspaintings in particular.

beautiful. the cathedral is very very beautiful and huge, both on the inside and outside, really worth buying the ticket to visit it. But, if possible, read something about it before visiting it, otherwise you won't know who are the folks buried inside it.
Gargoyles Galore!. We loved spotting all the gargoyles, especially after it had rained - it was spooky watching the rainwater running out of their mouths!

Well worth the hike. Take the hike and go see the Cathedral. It is impressive inside and out and had some excellent stained glass. Despite lots of signs that say "no pictures", the "rule" is no more enforced here than in the Sistine Chapel in Rome; but I always recommend not using a flash in places like this.There are extra parts to see if you have a ticket, we got there a bit late in the day and didn't pay; but even the free areas are well worth seeing.
Stunning. One of the most stunning sights ever was to walk through the castle, under an arch, and be suddenly confronted by the vast expanse of St Vitus rising in front of us

Great big church. Go look at the stain glass windows in this place, they take your breath away - they architecture is very impressive too. Everything is so well taken care of. Well worth a quick visit; however don't stay too long, there are much more interesting places to explore if you're with a gang of your friends.

Best place in Prague Palace. Very beautiful structure from outside as well inside. Lovely stained glass windows all over. 150 ton silver structure inside. Without the ticket one see up to a marked border while with the ticket one can go all around.

Just as one would expect in the most important church in Czech Rep.. We went into the cathedral as part of our Prague Castle Long Visit ticket (also allowed us to see the Castle Museum, Castle Powder Tower, etc etc). It is a beautifully decorated and constructed cathedral, that holds mass in Czech every Sunday at 10.30. At other times, it is a place full of tourist snapping photos and trying to see the place.It was quite busy even in the middle of February, I can't imagine what would happen in the summer. As with most church the artefacts and decorations are full of symbols and meanings, but there was little explanation in the church except for a 3-fold brochure. If you are interested in the stories behind the church and decorations, bring a guidebook.It is a very nice building, but I wouldn't call it stunning.
Awesome views. Get to the top of that tower and view Prague from above! it takes some doing and there are a lot of spiraling stairs but def worth the effort the photos you can get are stunning!

Amazing. We only had time to walk around this stunning edifice and have a quick look inside before our tour bus was due to leave, but it is a truly spectacular example of Gothic architecture and during our next visit we will buy tickets to enable us to tour the inside. Without tickets, it is only possible to view the cathedral from the back.

Buying tickets....... We came here and only wanted to see inside the cathedral. If that's all you want to do, DON'T buy a ticket. You can walk in the entrance and see the whole length of the cathedral inside and take photos. We didn't know this and spent 500 ck to look round four attractions at the site. They don't sell them individually. If you really are interested in the whole thing, go for it. Great place and LOTS of walking. And obviously it's at the top of a hill so wear comfortable shoes. On the way down found a great coffee shop. Can't remember the name but it has Ferrari stuff all over. Highly recommend going in there for a snack and drink.

Light and airy. If you want to explore the detail of the cathedral you must purchase an entry ticket. However you can enter the rear of the nave like we did and admire the grandeur of the architecture. It is especially light for a cathedral of this era.

This is a must. I turned the corner from the entrance to the castle grounds and my breath was taken away with how beautiful this is. Once inside I was left speechless for the whole time. Words can not describe the feeling of awe once inside. This is a total must when visiting Prague

Historic.... for a price. Truly enjoyable castle. Unfortunately, we arrived early to book for the 11 o'clock English tour. However, upon arrival we were informed that due to 60 students visiting the castle, the tour would not be available. We did rent the audio tour guide which was great but expensive. The entire day cost about 23pounds but would have been half the price if the tour would have been available. The castle itself is a must-see but I was slightly dissapointed with the total price.

Absolutely Beautiful. Ornate exterior and even more stunning interior. Definitely worth buying the ticket to enter. The stained glass work is amazing in every nook of the church. Look for the huge organ bay about half way down.

Beautiful stained glass but very cold in Feb!. St Vitus was a lovely cathedral to look around but it wasn't my favourite site in Prague. I guess this depends on personal interest so this is a purely subjective view! The stained glass in the cathedral is very beautiful. There are many points of interest within the cathedral and an audio guide for those sufficiently interested. However there isn't really much info in the cathedral if you don't have an audio guide. The Wencelas Chapel is a highlight but it is very cold inside in Feb,

Different. We just visited Rome a couple of weeks ago. This cathedral is quite different with less importance on paintings or sculptures but an impressive array of very special stained glass windows which are absolutely stunning. Parts of the cathedral can only be accessed when a ticket has been purchased.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful place, set in the grounds of the palace over looking Prague. This Cathedral is amazing inside and out

All others pale in comparison. Walk clockwise once inside the Cathedral to view the numerous colorfully detailed stained glass windows. Make sure NOT to use a flash when taking photos inside the Cathedral as well (bring plenty of batteries for your digital camera)...at the front of the church be sure to view the crypt of St Wenceslas -- very impressive considering its age. Prepare yourself for the ornateness inside portions of the Cathedral as well. Well worth the admission price to see.

Another Old Church. I don't mean to demean these structures and what they stand for but quite frankly once you've seen a few of these absurdly extravagant old world tributes to organized faith then you've seen them all. The Vatican outclasses them all of course.

Very impressive. We had to time our visit to avoid tour busses, but it was worth coming back to walk through this impressive cathedral. Took centuries to build, I believe and is surrounded by the castle grounds, lots to see in this part of Prague.
I loved this place. The architecture is amazing and would recommend. I didn't love it as much as Notre Dame, but it was a great place to visit in Prague

Climb the south tower for amazing views - once you've caught your breath.... not the cheapest attraction in Prague (150Kc), but climbing the 287 steps was well worth the 360 degree views from the top of the were stunning. It wasn't the clearest day when we visited, but it was lovely, relaxing (as it wasn't the busiest attraction within the castle grounds), but well worth a visit.
Good Guy at Vitus. The best sight in the Hradcany, this is a pinnacle of High Gothic architecture. If visiting in winter, remember to wrap up warm because they don't turn on the heating.
Nice Gothic church. Must see, one of the most beautiful church in Central Europe. Close to there can be found the street of Goldsmith's.
Winter Snows. the most impressive part of Prague - magnif cathedral and palaces. Great views from up on hill and easy walk to/from City below
Nice. A magnificent building but there need to be more information about it in or around the cathedral so you can know what you are looking at.

Beautiful!. Loved the cathedral and its grounds. Found the audio guide a little pricey but very informative. Enjoyed the view from the top of cathedral and the sight of St Vitus and its grounds from across the Charles Bridge, especially at dusk/night. Stunning!

Priceless and awesome experience. I personally love this cathedral. It was just awesome place. Beautiful architecture. I would really recommend if you are a photographer or a architect to see this place. It is really really nice. Even though you are not a religious person, you will still feel the place. It is full of faith and respect everywhere..I don't know how to explain..when I get inside, it was just totally calm and peaceful. Although you have so many people, the place is crowed, people taking photos all around, still..you find yourself in peace..at least for me. The decoration and the architecture inside is just simply amazing! so beautiful and could just take your breath away. I remember I was just standing there and stunned with those beautiful pieces. It is amazingly great experience. A must to do when you visiting Prague. Totally beautiful outside and in.
monumental. big monumental cathedral from 12th century... many chaples and last place of rest czech kings... great decorations and architecture

Early bird. We were there during opening hours. The place was just overcrowded! However, since we stayed in the nearby Hotel Neruda, we got up early the next morning and went there for a morning mass. It took place in the side chapel and except for us and some others who also attended the mass the whole place was completely deserted. Strong experience, either you are religious, or not.
Beautiful gothic building. Soaring simple interior and magnificent gothic exterior complete with flying buttresses. Part of the castle tour.

Over officious staff. The Cathedral is magnificent and an essential part of a visit to Prague Castle. The artwork is stupendous. But for us it was spoiled by guides who seemed to be more like military police hurrying us on. And all the seating was roped off, so if you wanted a moment to pray or contemplate, this is not the place.

A becautiful Cathedral. Great place to visit, with amazing stained glass. A real gem and definitely a highlight of that area. Many tourists stayed at the enterance and didn't go in. It is worth paying a ticket and seeing the cathedral properly.

Beautiful. Amazing cathedral. Plan to spend a full day in the castle area. Don't miss paying extra to go into the front portion of the cathedral, and going to the top of the cathedral. A once in a lifetime experience to see such a beautiful church. The history is incredible. Also consider going to the museum in the bottom floor of the newer portion of the castle. You don't have to spend a long time but it gives you a good background regarding the castle and its history.

The Magnificent St. Vitus Cathedral.. If you are a christian like me, you want to dedicate atleast an hour to read every inscription on every monument, tomb, and art work in this Cathedral. Don't read history, enter and see history!
Definitely worth the visit. Beautiful and definitely worth the visit. I rented the headset which was also worthwhile and inexpensive.

Gorgeous!. Absolutely amazing to visit! Very traditional and extremely interesting. There is even explanations in English about the construction and development of the building. Definitely worth a visit!
Well worth seeing the Cathedral. It's on the grounds of Prague Castle, and, for me, the highlight of the castle tour. The Basilica of St. George, also on the castle grounds, is also nice.

Go early to miss the crowds. Visited in September as part of a tour at the end of a river cruise. Our guide took us very early so we had the opportunity to see inside before the crowds - good tip. Spectacular photographic shots of the arched leadlight glass windows with the light streaming through reflecting on the adjacent wall. Will never forget how beautiful it was.
Awesome. What a wonderful Cathedral rate it nearly as good as Strasbourg Cathedral. The gargoyles are fantastic and the interior was fabulous.
Must see if you are in Prague. Have to see this church and castle if you are in Prague. One of the highlights of the city. Great views too

Majestic from inside. The cathedral is huge and majestic from inside.
This destination is so popular that you have to wait in a very long queue to get into it.
One must check the cathedral timing before planning the visit to ensure that it is open while he/she is around.

For Architecture buffs, come!. This Cathedral was completed over a long period of time and thus has the characteristics of different master builders in different parts of the building. It is really interesting to see how the concepts have changed over the years and how they make it all still work together in the same building.
St.Vitus Cathedral. I liked the breathtaking Cathedral and Charles castle. Disliked that the toilets had to be paid in Czech money, what when in a harry one do not have it, can be an adventure.

Amazing Gothic Cathedral. After seeing many in France and England, this is one that really stands out as a spectacular gothic cathedral. It is not as large as others, but the quality of design and windows makes up for it. My partner that that this was one of the best one we have seen in our travels through Europe.
it's gorgeous. beautiful cathedral,so grand and impressive. so much historical changes were seen by these stones. I fall in love by impuls of this city,Praque is really beauty

Most stunning part of Prague. The cathedral is breathtaking from inside and out, we took so many photographs and stood looking at it in awe for a long time! I would suggest getting a tour or audioguide as we didn't and felt we missed out on learning the knowledge of everything. Definitely worth a visit here, we will be going back!
Beautiful - don't miss!. It is beautiful classy, and a piece of Czech history you should not miss!! The architecture is fascinating, the stain glass is gorgeous.
Imposing. It reminds me of Stephansdom from Vienna. It's always breathtaking. The architecture is marvelous, with all gothic elements.

Beautiful stained glass. Even if you have a short time to spend while at the castle do pop in for a quick look at the stained glass in St. Vitus Cathedral.
Some areas of the cathedral require a fee but it cost nothing to stand and admire.

Wonderful. It is huge and imposing and surprisingly stark but the stained glass windows are stunning. You must pay to see it all. Do not try to avoid paying for he toilets as the attendant will hunt you down.

Up up and away. We had a coach visit to the this area....high up...and then walked down after to Charles Bridge (20 minutes) We found this area really interesting.....the various palaces and the
buildings were really interesting

Beautiful old cathedral. Stunning! Pay for the tour or you'll miss the best of the interior, and, having paid, don't let them bully you into rushing through. Take the time to enjoy it and get lots of photos.

WONDERFUL STAINED GLASS WINDOWS. This can be visited as part of either the long or short castle tour ticket. It has limited opening hours so on arrival at the castle you need to check when it will be open. I am not that interested in cathedrals but this one was well worth a visit, it is truly beautiful both on the outiside and on the inside.If you just want a quick glance inside then it is worth knowing that you can go a little way without paying, and for most people that may be far enough.

Spectacular x 3!!!. We have traveled to many places in Europe and seen many churches and many talk about those in Rome and Paris. The Cathedral is simply stunning and the stained glass is nothing we've seen in any church before. A must see

Stunning Gothic architecture. Stunning cathedral that is definitely worth a proper visit while in Prague. The walk up the hill is great and it has the added bonus of being in the castle complex. Find out about the fascinating history.
A great piece of history!. Simply beautiful!! Not too different from other chathedrals of Europe, but always an experience to see!

Magnificent Building. You expect cathedrals to be grandeur I this is no exception. Situated inside the castle walls St Vitus is an imposing building. Full of history. The architecture & decoration is breathtaking.Take your time when visiting. I have been here on a number of occasions & still see new things on each visit. If your feeling fit, climb the steps to up to the tower, the views are fantastic.
Beutiful Old Gothic Cathedral. It is worth the walk up the hill to Prague Castle to go inside and see the Cathedral. It is free and open to the public.

Great view from the tower. The most of people don't know that they can climb to the top of the tower and thus you can have an amazing view of the city! It's good to go early because the view is not so good at 16:30 (closing time)
Beauty!. One of the most spectacular cathedrals we have visited. Just watch the choke points if you have small children!
Beautiful Cathedral. St Vitus is beautiful in every way but the stained glass windows were particularly breathtaking and unique.

Beautiful. while out site seeing through Prague, this is one of the places the stands out the most in my mind. took a lot of photos and learn ed a lot about the history behind the beautiful structure.
A must visit in Prague. A large cathedral which spires you can see from afar. Free entrance and it is a must when you go to the castle. Beautiful interior.
Nice. This is probably one of the nicest buildings I have ever seen. It is absolutely stunning. Try to go there as early in the morning as possible, cause there will be a queue.
Stained glass heaven. The cathedral had some of the best stained glass windows I have seen. I especially liked the art nouveau windows.

Giants must have walked here! + Travel Tips. OK - reviews will say the church is awesome and it is.Travel Tip (to save time): to view the entire interior of the Cathedral, you need to purchase a ticket which is at the Info. Building less than 25 meters* from the Cathedral. The price of your ticket varies on how much of the "castle" you want to see, but for the package we got (~120 Kc), it was well worth it.otherwise, you lose time to see the cathedral, go buy your ticket, and then see it again.but it was great! pretty cool.*I drive in mph, but I walk in meters.

Stunning architecture!. Included in the Prague castle tour, part of it may be visited for free, but part is included in the price paid for the castle tour. It is worthwile to include it in the package as part of the most beautiful regions of the cathedral are available only for fee.
Stunning. We visited the St Vitus Cathedral on a public holiday, which meant that entrance was free! Stunning and a must-see while in Prague.

A must see when in Prague. Stunning architecture! The stained glass windows are soooo beautiful. Situated within the castle compound there is so very much to see. First thing in the morning is the best time to go, most crowed mid day and early afternoon.

Do Not Miss This. This Cathedral is within the Prague Castle complex. This Gothic style cathedral is beautiful outside and inside. You have to purchase tickets to see it and walk inside. We got the short tour, which will allow you to see 4 or 5 tours within the Castle. With the fluctuating exchange rates, I had trouble figuring out the cost, but it is between $12 - $15. You can also buy an audio tour. Such an impressive structure, truly a humbling experience.

Fantastic Sight to See. The Cathedral has the awe-inspiring feel to it from the moment you step inside. The most intricate painting and sculpturing is on display and provides visitors with fantastic photo opportunities. Going up the stairs to the upper level gives a great vantage point to really take in all that the historic building has to offer.

Breathtaking.... We visited St Vitus Cathedral at Christmas - it is within the Castle walls and you can buy a ticket for the various other buildings within the Castle precincts. The Cathedral dominates the skyline and has a huge vaulted ceiling, beautiful windows and a beautiful organ. There are many photo opportunities here - and also many visitors, despite the cold weather and time of year. We bought tickets for a City Sightseeing bus - 48 hr hop on and hop off - so avoided the trek up the hill to the castle.

Huge cathedral. There were a lot of strairs to get to the cathedral but it was worth it. Cathedral was huge, got some nice pictures it. Inside the cathedral was a very dark so i didint get any good pictures from inside.
St. Vitus Cathedral. Awe inspiring. Beautiful architecture complete with gargoyles . The interior held stunning stained glass windows and many other interesting features.

Take your time and enjoy.... Buy a 2 Day ticket to see the cathedral and castle. This will enable you to get into places and wander the length of the cathedral/castle areas taking in the history and special feeling of this wonderful area of Prague instead of rushing to see it all in one day...

worth a visit. A bit out of the way but a nice walk over the river to get there. Lovely stained glass and where St. Wenseslas is buried. Only drawback is you have to purchase a ticket from over the road to look round it and you don't realise this until you are in it. But you can see it all from the inside entrance if you dont want to view in detail.
Look for the windows!. A magnificent cathedral, can stand in par with the most famous western ones.Many of the colorful windows are real masterpieces!

Breathtaking church, worth the extra charge. We bought a "short visit" pass for 250 Czech and a 50 Czech photography permit. That allowed us to visit St. Vitus and the castle, Golden Lane and another venue. While other tourists huddled inside the doors, we used our passes to go further into the church. It is amazing, and the altar section cannot be seen from the back. You also will avoid crowds since you can wander at your leisure.
Stunning. Amazing cathedral full of history Gothic architecture at its finest, a bit too expensive to go in but worth it for the art
walk-by during the free tour. you do a walk-by of this during the free tour and its really beautiful. if I had more time I would have gone up it as the view is supposed to be amazing.
Beautiful !. We enjoyed visiting the Cathedral - amazing. Get a personal tour guide.. it is worth it and we bypassed some lines to see the best

Nearly300 steps up, but the view was worth it. Rather than tour another cathedral we decided to trek up the nearly 300 steps to view Prague from the heights of the cathedral. It was a workout, but the view was worth it. Low cost and you got a souvenir coin free. Recommend it for those who can climb nearly 300 circular stairs!
Better with Fog.. This Cathedral is impressive from everywhere in the city. If you can have some fog for your picture that's better :)

Symbol of Czech Statehood. This majestic edifice is worth the tram ride upt the hill and the entrance fee... get a guide or at least the audio guide, it makes history come alive. A special memory for me is the wooden relief from the 16th century showing the fleeing Catholic monarch - the architectural details remain unchanged and are easily recognisable 6 centuries later...
Winter Visit. We enjoyed sharing the history of the city and this plays an important role and displays it's age and building characteristics clearly.
lovely Cathedral. brillant old building dating from the 1400's the whole area around the Cathedral is beautiful.. with great views over Prague city.

The focal point of Prague Castle. An awe-inspiring Gothic cathedral rebuilt multiple times with wonderful gargoyles and flying buttresses dominates Prague Castle. Lots of famous people are entombed here as well such as St. Wenceslaus. The tomb of St. John Nepomuk is the highlight for me with soaring angels above the crypt.

Huge. Huge church and to the religious person, it would probably be quite impressive. I am not religious at all and to be honest, I found it pretty grey and stark. No beautiful light filled rooms, etc. It was just very dark. Don't let me put you off, but it didn't really appeal to me. Freezing cold in winter too!
An open eye. St vitus cathedral is an open eye to me. It's huge and every stained glass windows, mosaic are carefully and elegantly designed.
Bitterly cold but fabulous. Best part of the trip to the castle complex. Stained windows are outstanding. Wrap up warmly if going in winter, I had to wear my hat, even colder inside than it was out
An essential on the sightseeing list when in Prague. Huge and beautiful building with some great views across Prague. Be sure to go early to beat the queues.

Peaceful. It is so beautiful and mix of the times when money was spent in the front area and everything is glistening in gold and when the rear was built by the native with much lesser money with the motive of finishing the work somehow...good experience
Impressive. A most impressive Church. The sheer size of the building takes your breath away and the stained glass is beautiful. It was well worth all the walking to see this Church.

Absolutely stunning!!. The church spires is visible from anywhere in Prague! The cathedral architecture is stunning, the outer is covered in gargoyles and gothic designs! Even better when you get inside! Beautiful stained glass windows, mosaics and impressive chapels dedicated to numerous Czech saints and houses the tombs of important Kings of the past. Can spend a good one hour in here just admiring the walls, ceilings and chapels. If possible, go visit the Cathedral first thing in the morning to avoid crowds. A must-see in Prague.
Lovely cathedral. Very impressive cathedral - similar to those you see all over Europe. Difficult to get a good photo of this church tho - but well worth the visit

Stunning church, best site at the castle. This church can be viewed from just about every point in Prague. It is grand and it is stunning.The Roman Catholic cathedral is a church and museum all in one. It houses the tombs and relics of many important saints and kings, including many Habsburgs.The stained glass windows, mosaics and other "artwork" within the cathedral are just beautiful. The outside is magnificent.This is the best part of the castle quarter and should not be missed.
Czech history. This is Czech history as its best, one of the nicest cathedrals I have even been to. You should go there out of busy times to have the place to yourself

Magnificent stained glass Windows.. Never seen a finer range of stained glass windows in Europe,the colours, workmanship and scenes depicted are stunning, especially on a sunny day . Unfortunately we visited on a busy day with many groups of school children , which made it somewhat noisy .

Imposing. We found that we had to queue for a long time in the cold to view the Cathedral as security is very tight. The building is very imposing from the outside and worth a visit. Not as beautiful as St Nicholas's Church though!
Breathtaking.. Stunning to view from a distance, but even more so from within the Castle grounds. Must rate as one of the most amazing historic buildings in the world.

The most impressive cathedral in Prague. St. Vitus is by far the most impressive cathedral, and maybe even building in all of Prague. This 14th century wonder has 70 m high ceilings, amazing arches and beautiful towers. The painted glass windows are huge, with many different types of artwork. You will find all of these details and much more in any Prague guidebook. I would like to focus on some practical tips:1. Even though it is listed as a "free admission" site on most of the guidebooks, you can only enter the main hall without a ticket. To see the entire cathedral you must have a one.2. Unless you plan to spend a full day in the castle, buy the short visit ticket for 250 CzK rather than the full one for 350 CzK.3. Tickets can be obtained at the entrance to the castle and in many cafés. You cannot buy a ticket in the cathedral.4. Climb the 287 steps to the bell tower; the view of Prague is breathtaking.

Enormous Church. We went twice, one on a tour where we just looked from the back, and then decided to buy a package so that we could get a closer look and discover some of the history. Very interesting, not as beautiful as some I've seen, but really big.
You have to pay!. Although our guide book said it was free, to go around it you had to buy a castle area pass. You could not pay just for the cathedral. However, it is very imposing from all angles.
Worth the climb. You can take the 22 tram to the back of the castle, but the climb up is otherwise fascinating. The cathedral, positoned in the castle area, up above the town, is fabulous.
Nice. The nicest cathedral in Czech Republic with really a huge number of tourist outside and inside but a part of every sightseeing tour.
Climb the tower!. Be sure to climb the tower!(It can get rather tiring though) It provides you with a great view of Prague.

Warm. I absolutely loved this cathedral. The atmosphere inside was warm and comfortable. It felt incredibly nice. I enjoyed looking at the stained glass windows and noticing differences in the styles (mosaic or not), and generally just absorbing the atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit as you can get in for free, then if you want to explore the cathedral in more detail it costs CZK250 which works out about £8.50 just under.
Castle Complex.. We took a tram to the castle complex, as it is on a hill overlooking the city. The Cathedral is huge and there are many side chapels and gorgeous stained glass windows.

Must Visit!. The cathedral was one of the must see attraction during our stay in Prague. The cathedral itself is an impressive architecture which can be seen from across the river. The inside of the cathedral has nice stained windows and artifects as well. Having visited many cathedrals in Europe before, the cathedral is comparable with the impressive ones like the Cologne Cathedral. Definitely a must see when in Prague!

Rushed and crowded. I had visited a few years ago but this time was herded into a line and rushed around. It felt like pay up and get out as quickly as possible. I appreciate how busy it was but I, for one, am not likely to return.
Just to stop on the way in. You can go inside just to see the power and greatness of the cathedral. To see some inside statues etc what cathedral has to offer, you have to pay.
Magnificient Inside and Outside. This cathedral dominates every gorgeous photo taken in Prague. It is gorgeous from afar, but it is also extremely worthy on the inside.
Went there twice. It is a fabulous monument. Choose to visit close to 12h00, so you can see the parade in front of the Cathedral.
Awesome. Its worth the walk if you can make it up the hill to the beautiful St Vitus Cathedral. The inside of the Cathedral is breathtaking

Old Prague. Amazing building - height, architecture, history - it is a must see - I didn't go inside but the external of the building is amazing - the sheer size of this place! Go see and take great photos!
Vast. The cathedral is vast!! You're a bit limited as to what you can see unless you pay quite a high ticket price, but what you can see for free is amazing!

amazing chathedral. St. Vitus (or Katedrála svatého Víta) is the biggest and most important church in Prague, it's one of the most knockout cathedrals in Europe. To take a look at the stunning Last Judgement mosaic. Inside you'll find the final resting places of both Charles IV (who gave his name to Charles Bridge) and Saint Wenceslas. The chapel containing Wenceslas' remains is a stunner, encrusted with semi-precious stones.The cathedral also contains the crown jewels of the Bohemian kings and an Art Nouveau window by Mucha. Climb the tower for a stunning view of the Castle District.Things we dislike is been pushed & shaved while waiting in line. There are hundreds visitors from all walks of life lined up around you (not in front nor behind you LOL ), I felt extremely annoyed when a group of people (large family) force their way in front of you !
St. Vitus. Overwhelming. My favorite cathedral of all time. The magnitude of the cathedral as you walk up to the entrance is breathtaking. Does not disappoint!

Beautiful. Cathedrakl and the castle were overall a great experience. Beautiful cathedral and the stained glasses were wonderful. Worth paying the ticket to get to walk around. Takes a whole day so be prepared!

Quick View. It's a beautiful cathedral. We enjoyed walking around the outside to see the gargoyles, and going inside to get a peek. We didn't pay the money to walk in further. We felt we saw enough from the free public area.

Glass art work are phenomenal. The church is filled with history but the colours of the glass art work on the windows take your breath away. You can get amazing pictures and see the history of the kings of the ancient country.

Don't miss this one, its a must. One of the most beautiful churches in the world. lots of intricate stained glass inside the Cathedral. Must see the The tomb of John of Nepomuk inside the cathedral. St. Wenceslas Chapel , The Chapel is not able to be accessed by members of the public, but it can be viewed from the doorways.A small door with seven locks, in the south-western corner of the chapel, leads to the Crown Chamber containing the Czech Crown Jewels, which are displayed to the public only once every (circa) eight years.

Worth a good look inside and out. This was the highlight of the Prague palace complex. It was a really beautiful experience and well worth paying the extra to go inside and have a proper look around. It is not in the same league as Canterbury Cathedral or York Minster but it is definitely up there and worth a visit. Lovely stained glass. Crowds are a bit manic and I was there in November.
Disappointing. The cathedral is set in the grounds of the castle and had some nice stained glass windows but not much else to see.
Worth it. We didnt' even go in and it was impressive! If you're in the area it's well worth a look, though similar to the many other gothic cathedrals around Europe.
Cathedral. Beautiful, but did not open until 1300, it was a Sunday. Reasonable price and worth the wait. We had hot wine in one of the many cafe's in the castle grounds while we waited.
Buy ticket before queuing. We queued for the opening time (about 12.00) for about 40 minutes without realising that tickets aren't sold inside. Duuh. Our fault for not being more attentive.

Another icon. Not visiting Prague Castle is like not visiting Louvre in Paris. St Vitus Cathedral is an integral part of the castle complex, second biggest after Moscow. And take a look at different styles of buildings surrounding the cathedral. The first Renessaince architecture north of the Alps is on the right of the cathedral.
Beautiful. Couldn't believe Prague had a gothic cathedral comparable to the ones we're used to seeing in England or France. Really amazing artwork inside. Sucks you have to pay to enter though.
Lots to see. The highlight is the Alfonse Mucha stained glass window. It is the most beautiful stained glass window anywhere. Very crowded, so go early.

The old Castle area is a must together with this Cathedral. Just a fantastic place. The buildings and monuments are impressive. The Golden Street as well.Buy a combi ticket for the whole place and spend 3 hours there - lunch places available and reasonable.The change of Guards ar 12 o'clock is a fine experience which is highly recommended.A 1 hour classical music performance every day at 1 pm in Lobkowicz Palace is also nice to join, but costs extra.View to the city is also nice from several places.

Magnificent. This is a must see - dominating the city skyline and a part of the magnificent castle complex. True, you have to pay to see all of the cathedral but it is worth every penny. We also paid extra to climb the tower and enjoyed the super views over the city.

Beautiful Church. This church is obviously full of history. It is beautiful to see with the old and new sections and the stained glass. We paid the equivilent of about $5 per person for the guided tour and it was certainly worth the money. The guide explained the meaning and pointed out details of the artwork. Also, when you use the guide you can go underneath the church to the crypt and that was very interesting.

Just amazing, really!. It's a huge gothic cathedral, dark and VERY atmospheric. These great windows, columns, the medieval feeling inside the cathedral and the view... Once again a must-see place in Czech Republik
Stunning Stained Galss. The most beautiful stained glass windows I have ever seen. All the colours of the rainbow encapsulated in a window!
majestic. worth a visit - a grand and majestic cathedral within Castle grounds, should not be missed, we went in to say a little prayer and give thanks for a wonderful trip to Prague

Gorgeous.. Renovation of the Golden Portal on the south side has been recently completed, and it is astounding. The interior is well worth a visit to see not only the old-style stained glass windows, but also those done in the art nouveau style. Be sure to see the Chapel of St. Wenceslas.

Beautiful. Although hard to get a comprehensive outside view, because it is surrounded by other (beautiful) buildings, it is a very impressive monument, especially from the inside. Having to pay to see it more thorougly, though, is quite unusual.

looks more impressive from the outside. Disregarding the significance of the building and basing this review purely on awe-factor: From the outside, the Cathedral looks incredibly impressive. Once inside, though, it's just like any other big cathedral (personal opinion). There a couple of very nice stained glass windows (but then again, this is true for every other big cathedral around Europe). Certainly worth the visit if you're in Prague but does not warrant a visit to the city just to see it.
Do it!!. The Cathedral is amazing and the whole "gated" area is beautiful and overlooks the city. The street where Kafka lived is the most unique street you'll ever see.

Absolutely stunning cathedral. St. Vitus cathedral is the Westminster Abby of the Czech Republic. It is everything and more that you expect from reading about it in guidebooks. Do not miss the tomb of St. John Nepomuk just to the right of the alter. It is a glorious masterpiece of sculptural silver. The stained glass in this cathedral is magnificent. If possible try to visit in mid to late afternoon when the light coming through the windows casts gorgeous bands of pinks and lavender down the mighty stone columns. Photography is allowed and this is a wonderful time to get some really interesting shots. St. Vitus is a do not miss spot in Prague. Don't let fear of crowds keep you away.
beautiful!. The cathedral was absolutely beautiful! We were just disappointed because we were unable to go to one part of the church, due to technical difficulties.
Amazing glass stained windows.. Very crowded!!! Lovely stained windows. But you can only get up front if you pay.... One of the grandest cathedrals I've been to

Beautiful cathedral in Prague. The tremendous structure and stained glass windows is amazing. It is a must see if you visit Prague. You need to purchase a ticket to be allowed further access into the space. Without such views and access is limited. This is well worth additional cost. Especially beautiful when light streams in they the windows.
Gorgeous. Beautiful architecture and interior; particularly the stained glass. Worth a walk through when at Prague Castle
Memorable. The modern stained glass is spectacular and the height of the ceilings amazing. a cathedral which will stand out in my memory. Not busy in November!

A great cathedral in 3 stages.. This cathedral was built in 3 different eras and has beautiful stained glass. While you can go in for free, the best is only available with a purchased ticket. Worth the visit!

Notre Dame of the East. I'm a huge cathedral buff, and I must say that I was very impressed with St. Vitus. The sheer size of it is amazing, the interior though intricate, is a few levels below your typical baroque, it kid of has a St. Paul's of London feel inside, in terms of sight lines. The exterior is some of the best Gothic I've ever seen. A true treasure not to be missed, the rightful crown jewel of such a lovely city.
Another beautiful place in Prague. It's beautiful, mysterious, but also sacred. It brings curiosity to every visitor to get in the church. Beautiful ancient style... You must visit it :)
Imposing. This Cathedral conquers the most monumental of them. There is also access to the catacombs from inside.

High expectations. One of the "must" in Prague, St Vitus's Cathedral is a magnificent example of gothic architecture and hundreds of years of history. Much to see inside, like the precious St Wenceslas Chapel, the modern stained glass, the very high vault... But because of "technical reasons" you cannot see the crypt where Charles IV and his four wives rest; however, the price of the ticket has not gone down for "technical reasons", in fact it doesn't even include the visit to the South Tower of the same building. The Golden Portal, on the outside, is worth the visit, although it only opens in very special occasions.

Worth Seeing.. Awesome Cathedral. As most of these larger cathedrals, it took my breath away. But, then I wished all the money that went into this church had been spent helping more people! (OK. It;s just a personal belief about religions in general.) However, their organ and windows were worth stopping off to see it.
Amazing. Wonderful both from in and outside. The stained glass made by Mucha is spectacular. Every little object here is a piece of art ! A must - see in Prague
amazing. wonderful , great to walk across the bridge to and then meander up the hill.The stained glass was sparkling and gave us shivers its so impressive.

Well worth the time to see . Touring the grounds and cathedral is an awesome experience. The various types of architecture used during additional buildings is something to behold, well worth the visit

Star attraction in castle area.. This is something!!! Wonderful both from outside and inside. For me this was THE building in Prague — not to be missed in any scenario. I have deducted one point because: 1) there was dearth of information in English inside (unless you pay extra for the audio-guide) and, 2) you need to pay to toilet separately even after paying for tickets!
Impressive. As part of the Palace this Cathedral was very busy but the size was impressive and the stained glass windows breathtaking.
Excelent!. Pretty much like Notre Dame but here...in CZ! Great Gothic Arquitecture. Nice access. Good pics. I'd recommend it along the whole year
Breath Taking. Beautiful to see. Nothing to that standard in the U.S. Gorgeous and intricate stain glass work. The outside detail is unbelievable. How was this done so many years ago?

The only part worth having s look at... The exterior is really nice and amazing to look at. But the inside is a typical cathedral.. and probably because there are so many people going to look at it, you have to pay to go right to the front.. making it look like a business.
Amazing gothic architecture. Combine this with your visit to the Lobkowicz palace and you will not forget this experience. Absolutely wonderful example of architecture as well as religion.
St Vitus Cathedral. So busy with tourists, almost claustrophobic however just look at the beautiful stained glass windows, they were awe inspiring

St. Vitus Cathedral. This is located near the castle so is easy to visit while in that area. This inside and outside are unbelievable. A must see. Also, if you are a fan of gargoyles then this is the church for you! It is built almost up against all the other structures so the whole visual impact is overwhelming because of its sheer size.

Go for the glass. This is a stunning cathedral, but what really distinguishes it is the stained glass. Interestingly, the building has taken about 600 years to complete, with the final touches being the glass windows, only completed in the 20th century. But this makes the cathedral completely unique - the glass is quite unlike anything you will see in similar buildings
Beautiful glass windows. The glass windows were breath taking as was the exterior but I still preferred St Nicholas cathedral for beauty and would recommend it over St. Vitus

Majestic. The Cathedral is on of the most beautiful in central Europe.Visit the inside,check the vitro, the treasury and the crypt...Beautiful is also the outside, full with sculptures and gargoyles...

Gothic Masterpiece!. The visual impact of the cathedral close up and inside is something you have to see to understand. Entwined with the history of Europe over 100's years it's a great place to contemplate. . . . find a time with fewer people even better. Good ticket/pass system - you can buy tickets/passes at several points in the castle/cathedral complex without having to queue at the entrances

The Cathedral. Gorgeous! A great e;xample of early period architecture. This church still holds services, and if you're lucky, there will be an organ concert scheduled while you're there. If possible, don't miss it!

Don't forget that is has a tower!. The cathedral itself is beautiful inside and out (though harder to appreciate on the outside as it is 'enclosed' within a square). I found the restrictions within the cathedral a bit odd... I know using photographic tripods is frowned upon in most places, but when you have a weekly recital that requires Czech lighting and sound men to set up and they do so in the least respectful manner, marching in with work boots carrying heavy equipment that they drop suddenly on the floor or dragging heavy pieces across the tiles... how is my 3lb tripod that much of an imposition?Regardless, don't forget to climb the tower... it offers BEAUTIFUL views of Prague in all directions.
Ruined by crowds. I felt like I was on the London underground in rush hour. Why don't they restrict how many people come into this buidling?

crowded. after seeing so many churches in europe it is another gothic cathredalyes it is nice but especially on a weekend the groups coming in made it a zooyou have to pay to get anywhere near the altarif its busy go elsewhere instead of feeling like a sheep
Spectacular. This is a spectacular gothic cathedral in the grounds of Prague castle that was only completed in the 1920s though the gothic appearance of the cathedral make it look much older.

Very Nice. A really beautiful church. We did not pay extra for the side tours but it was still well worth seeing. This was one of th places that gave me a sense of Czech national pride even in the face of the Austrian Empire.

beautiful. The main part of the cathedral is free to enter, but it is worth paying the extra for entry to the sides. Beautiful stained glass windows - look at the last one on the right hand side as you face the altar - the "pretzel window" - said to be paid for by the pretzel sellers of Prague, and one of the characters is holding a pretzel in his hand!
St Vitus. Very imposing. The free option of just looking around is probably best. I am sure the crowds in the high season would be very off putting.

The best in Prague. I've been to many cathedrals in many countries but this is the most fascinating, amazing, breathtaking cathedral of them all. I strongly recommend everybody to visit it. I've been there many times and I visit it every year.

Wonderful. The churches of Europe are outstanding and this one is on the list. I am amazed that you are able to take pictures in the churches. We had a tour of the cathedral and found it to be great. Not to be missed.
Good. I did buy a ticket to get away from the crowds at the entrance. Worth the money. Especially as there was someone playing the organ while I was there.

One of my favorites in Europe. I line up this cathedral with Sagrada Familia in Barcelona and the cathedral of Colony (Kohln) in Germany. The glassworks are amazing and it's hugeness is astonishing. One more reason to cross the bridge!

impressive. Very impressive. On Sunday's it will open after 12.00 o'clock.
Only a pity you can't not sit in the pews to look the church from the centre.

very nice. We got to the cathdral in the afternoon and there was no queue.
Because we bought the ticket that allowed us to enter more than the free 10 or 20 meters of the cathdral we enjoyed a 10 minutes stroll inside, we admired everything - the stained glass was amazing
It is forbidden to take pictures inside

Amazing. St Vithus cathedral is located inside the Prague Castle grounds. Its enimagtic an beautiful. Be prepared for long queques full with many tourists but they pretty much run relatively fast. Art inside the chapels is amazing. The hall mark for me is the Wensceslas chapel.
Very Interesting. This is a very beautiful building and well worth a visit. The best time to visit is in the afternoons when there are not so many tour groups and it isn't so busy.

Getting a guide - it's the way forward. We had a fabulous tour of the Cathedral from a wonderful lady who told us so much about the history of the place. My 7-year old son and both us parents were enthralled throughout

Stunning. We saw the cathedral first in the evening (amaingly floodlit) and then the next day we went up the tower (287 worthwhile steps) and into the main body of the cathedral (amazing - especially the windows)

Gorgeous cathedral. Worth going inside, beautiful, stained glass windows, including the famous one by Alfonse Mucha. Absolutely amazing. The silver tomb of a saint (I cant pronounce or spell his name) made of solid silver is totally worth a visit.

Extremely gorgeous. This is one of my favourite churches in all of Europe and I've seen quite a few. It doesn't get as much hype as Westminster Abbey, Notre Dame, etc. but it's just as stunning. Definitely worth it and the line moves fast so don't be turned away by that! Make sure you pay the extra kroner to take pictures, you won't want to forget it.

Praguewalker tour part 2. Another wonderful part of the history of the city. We were lucky to witness a choir and ochestra rehearsing for an evening concert, of which there are many to choose from in the city.

mr lee will be back. everyone talks about this bridge before you go,and when you get there everyone talks about the bridge, its a bridge right. ?. no its not, i will not spoil it for you, walk arcross it and feel the history for 600 years of war, and paruge today is what is because of this bridge.

Go in for free. See enough of gorgeous stained glass windows from entrance. Best of both worlds: St. Vitus for exterior and stained glass, St. Nicholas for interior.The exterior is something to marvel at. The interior is nice as well, but not as good as St. Nicholas. The stained glass here is some of my favorite anywhere in Europe. You can see plenty of them for free from the entrance. Go in as far as you can, turn around and look above the entrance for a fantastic window. There are more really nice ones deeper inside, which requires a ticket, but the best are at the entrance in my opinion.If you want to see the rest, take the short tour. Even better, get a combo ticket for the short tour and Lobkowicz (way better than the castle) to save some money. You may have to buy the ticket from the Lobkowicz ticket office.

Huge and gorgeous. Amazing size! You are dwarfed as you walk into the building. The artwork is astounding and the vaulted ceiling draws your eyes upward to God. What can I say; you have to see it in person to appreciate this Gothic cathedral.

visit the catacombs. I was not a huge fan of Prague but there is no disputing that they have 2 of the most beautiful cathedrals I have ever seen. St. Vitus is as impressive on the inside as it is on the outside. I had no idea there were catacombs here . We almost skipped them because the tours are only at specific times but I am glad we didn't. Get the all inclusive ticket and see all you can see within the castle walls. Visit this attraction last because everything else here will pale in comparison (aside from St Nicholas cathedral).

Breathtaking Gothic Experience. Once you've worked out the ticketing arrangements this is a worthwhile place to visit. It is possible to visit the back of the cathedral for free - this gives you an overall view of the nave but it is worth paying to be able to walk around the entire building and see the artwork close up

Artists Looking for Inspiration. If you are a visual artist and you love color, this is the best stained glass in ABC (another bloody church) that I've ever seen (tourist joke). Well, I have NOT seen every church in Europe but I've seen quite a few, and up until recently, the best stained glass windows - in my experience - have been in some church in Beaune, France. Saint Vitus' Cathedral (Prague Castle up on the hill) is beautiful enough to make even aetheists believe. Well...I'm a former-colorist-painter-turned-writer, so I was thrilled. The "regular" stained glass in Saint Vitus is similar in style to mosaics and almost like impressionism in swirls. However, there is one window, painted by Mucha in art neuveau style. If you're in Prague...I think this gorgeous church tops the whatever-it's-called clock (if you are an artist or you're a creative type of person looking for inspiration).

The symbol of Prague. Located in the hilltop castle, the cathedral has become the symbol of the city. Absolutely worth a visit, and a all inclusive ticket will introduce you to the life and habits of the middle ages.

Lovely cathedral, stained glass windows the highlight. Nestled in the centre of Prague Castle, well worth a visit. Free entry to the back where you get a good view, but worth paying €10 to stroll around

A Baroque Gem. Unlike some of the other town churches, which can appear very ostentatious, St Vitus, which is very much the 'national church' has less of the 'religious bling' found elsewhere. It's also very good on Prague and Czech history- worth the short-tour entry fee, payable at the ticket office in the main castle square.

Gorgeous. IF you could imagine being in a fairly tale land...you would be here. The most gorgeous cathedral I'd ever been in. I can't imagine building this back in the day with all the fancy decor, etc. Also hard to imagine royalty being here from many ages ago. I loved this place and give yourself some time to go through and take it all in!

I went to Prague mainly to visit the Cathedral. My Patron Saint, Wojciech, was an archbishop of Prague, before he was expelled from the city for being too outspoken and touching the rulers. He became a missionary in my home country of that time and laid down his life for the Faith in 997. His relics are preserved not only in Poland, but in Saint Vitus cathedral. That is why I wanted to pray in the cathedral at his altar. And I did so. Going around the cathedral and arriving in the back of it to the place where his relics were kept. It was a magic moment which I want to relive again next year when I return there for my jubilee year.Many commented on the architecture and the location. I just wanted to share this little piece with you
Good pics from outside. You can get good shots from outside so long as you're on the Castle Grounds which are free. We didn't want to pay extra to enter.
Don´t miss!. St. Vitus Cathedral has Gothic architecture and is full of gorgeous details. The interior has beautiful stained glass windows that give light to the beautiful church and chapels

My favorite cathedral. I've been all over Europe, and I can honestly say that this is my favorite cathedral that I have toured. I loved walking around the entire outside of the structure in order to see the gargoyles along the sides. If you have a telephoto lens, they make excellent picture opportunities. The inside will most likely be crowded, but that is expected. The stain glass throughout are simply breath taking.

Very Crowded but worth a visit. This cathedral is beautiful but there are so many others less crowded and off the tourist routes that you aren't missing anything if you don't go through it . Oh yeah, you have to pay to go inside....

Most Impressive Cathedral and Castle!. A must see in Prague. Climb the tower 387 steps for a great view of Prague. Lunches are on the high side so eat just outside the Castle. There is a small changing of the gueard on the hour, and a large one at 12:00 noon. I wouldn't plan my day or afternoon aroung the Noon event as it is just OK (nothing like Buckingham....)

stunning and worth going to prague for. if you want to see high gothic style and soak up the situation then depsite the many tourists there who seem to wander like sheep grazing and irreligious it is a wonderful place to see and to be in. there is a fee and the ticking system is not very good but despite that this cathedral is in my view worth the ticket price alone and the best single buildign in the castle complex by far. a must see in prague

Prague Castle - plan a full day. We visited St. Vitus Cathedral as part of our day at Prague Castle. We walked from our hotel on Wencheslas Square up the hill which was a great way to see the city. St. Vitus Cathedral is absolutely breathtaking, some of the most beautiful stained glass windows in Europe. Plan a full day for all the surrounding areas of Prague Castle. We got a pass that let us go into all the parts of Prague Castle, which I would highly recommend. Ours was good for 2 days, except I lost mine but we would have gone back if we could have.
Lovely cathedral. Located within the Prague Castle, it is a sight to behold. I love the interior and exterior of the cathedral.
St Vitus. Amazing Cathedral! Something you must do! We did a walking tour for this one, which was a great way to see everything in Prague
lovely church. St. Vitus Cathedral is very lovely, definitely spend for the ticket so you can walk around away from the hordes taking pictures at the entrance.

The tower is now open. The tower is now open. Worth the extra cost to go up for a spectacular view of the city and a place where you can get a closer look at the Gothic architecture. Be prepared to climb lots of stairs.
what a crowd. The church and environs are gorgeous but the crowds were overwhelming and made it hard to see the Mucha stained glass window or explore the church.
Stunning!. The architecture and the stained glass windows are a sight to behold! Go early to avoid the queues and give yourself loads of time ..

Amazing!!. St. Vitus Cathedral is amazing inside. The stained glass windows are immense and if you go there as the sun is about to set the colors you get inside are very nice. I recommend going on a Sunday when there isn’t that many people compared to the rest of the weekend.

Beautiful but Crowded. Make the visit. It is crowded during the day but worth the time. Pay the full amount so you can take your time in the Cathedral. We went back at night for a Concert in St Georges and being by St Vitus with no crowds and when it was illuminated was a highlight of our time in Prague.

Very impressive building!. You do not have to pay to see parts of the interior of this cathedral. I liked that. The building itself is quite impressive, just given it's position within the castle grounds and it's size! It is beautiful inside, worth a visit.

Awesome Cathedral. I saw atleast 15 large Cathedrals on my trip of Europe, and I really liked this one. There was a theme that ran through this whole building which really made me think of the purpose of this building, rather than aweing the building itself.
Inspiring. If you look closely at the outside facades you can see where original construction and rebuilds occurred - all great stories involved.
St Vitus. it is a lovely majestic church inside and out part of the castle complex as i call it since there is the castle, the cathedral, and st. george's.

beautiful on the outside. very beautiful on the outside. the inside is a bit empty. the free bit is enough, you don't need to pay because you don't see so much more than the ones who don't pay. in the free zone you can also look very far and see the glass windows
Stunning stained glass. It was brilliant but very busy.The sun was shining in through the windows making their effect even more striking
Must see - get ready for tons of tourists. And don't forget to climb up the stairs to the tower. It is one of most spectacular views over the Prague.

Spectacular. The arches and work on this cathedral are breathtaking. Take time to focus on the massive work around the doors, look at the dark morbid faces and then look up to the gargoyles protecting this magnificent church.
Wonderful. Must be seen enjoy the architure and make sure you read a bit about the history the place itself is breathtaking.
St. Vitas Catedral. The view from outside as well as inside the Cathedral is breathtaking. For more comment as well as photos see my review about the Prague Castle.
Beautiful. The sheer scale of the Cathedral is awesome. The interior is unique and well worth a visit. It can be very crowded especially at the weekend. Take your camera!

A must visit in Prague. We went on the all inclusive tour and this was one of our stops. The cathedral is quite impressive and huge. Our guide gave us the entire history of St. Vitus and the cathedral and we went inside to find it equally beautiful there as the outside. Another must see while in Prague.

lovely. this glorious church suffers from only one fault.....crowds!!! It is hard to appreciate when you have Vatican like hordes thronging it. But the church itself is glorious both in size, light, architecture and stained gless. Be sure to see the large solid silver tomb!
Again, a must see in Prague. I wasn't sure if it was worth paying the entry fee, but if you like stain glass or intricate mosaics this is one for you!
to see!. Amazing interiors and breath-taking from outside too. Mostly in sunny weather. I liked the most the ancient tombs inside. One of the places to see!

Take a tour. A church steeped in history. We were on a private tour and had the good fortune of having our guide tell the wonderful historical stories surrounding this church. Check out the video tours available so you can know what you are looking at.

nice to see, but not for a fee. beautiful stain glasses, but you don't have to pay to go see this church. you can get in for free. there's a roped off section that requires a fee, but not worth it at all. after seeing st. nicolas, st. victus was really not that great.

St.Vitus Cathedral - Czechs should be very proud. Yeasterday I had this opportunity to see this fantastic cathedral and thanks to my friends to go to places where not everybody can go, to galleries and see all the beauty from above. Our guide told us many details about cathedral, he knew names of each architect, director of the building, historical consequences and materials. There was like 40-60 stonecarvers working each year,.this guy even knew what they were wearing and who made it´s sign to stone.

Awesome and Peaceful St Vitus. Inside the Castle Prague the cathedral is a treasure. I've been in LOTS of churches and this ine tops my list for beauty, intimacy and architechure. Not St Pauls Basilica but right up there with Notre Dame.

impressive. one of the most magnificent collections of windows (try your camera in manual with -1 in aperture, holding it firm against the fence of each window...). I did not like the rudeness of the policeman outside, that when taking a pic and walking backwards to have a better view, I must have walked into an area he did not like (the had a rope, but it was interrupted where I was, so I broke a virtual line). I felt him pushing me with bad manners...I know it must be an exception, but it was disgusting and not in line with the magnificence of the place
Very Nice. Very nice Cathedral. Didn't go inside but the details on the church is very nice. Wasn't overly crowded and of course Richard our tour guide was very educated on the church history.
Fantastic. We visited the cathedral along with group from Vienna. It was a great place to visit with breathtaking views. The location, buildings, and every thing was beautiful there.

A beautiful work of art. The exterior and interior of this historic building are truly magnificent. No detail was overlooked. Although it was crowded, it was not uncomfortable. We even walked up all 287 steps to the top of the South Tower. It's really worth it for perfect photo opportunities and views of Historic Prague. You see all the main sites such as Petrin Tower, Charles Bridge, Old Town, etc.

St. Vitus. The area that is available for free is very small. It is worth it to buy the ticket to see the entire church, and it lets you into some of the other places on the place grounds that are very beautiful

Grandiose, ornate church. So much to see! Would be a stand alone attraction. Really needs more room to show its magnificence fully. Flying buttresses, rose window, gargoyles... what more could you ask for?? Be sure to look up to catch all the detail work. Must see on a visit here!

a must see. It is both stunning on the outside and inside. Better join a guide tour as you may miss out some important window church paintings. (I missed the one painted by Mucha. I did see it - I looked at every windows- but didn't know which one was painted by him.)
Spectacular. The history of the cathedral is fascinating and the constant expansion and rebuilding have resulted in a spectacular building.
Beautiful Cathedral. St. Vitus rivals any Cathedral, anywhere in the world. Absolutely beautiful, steeped in history and a must see for anyone visiting Prague.

Amazing Architecture. This is one of most amazing Architecture and near the Prague Castle
It's high up on the hill and you get a great view of the city below
Its free to enter inside and get to see the Cathedral
Very beautiful. The outside of this cathedral is amazing. The inside is quite impressive in its size, but especially it's stained glass windows. Well worth the fee.

The Most Awesome cathedral in Prague.. This is a cathedral that makes you go wow! Even good king Wenselas is buried here. The stain glass windows are awesome and some of the burial caskets are very ornate dressed in gold leaf. Just go you won't be disappointed. March 2008

Majestic.. A cathedral in the middle of a castle. One can just wonder how this majestic cathedral was built ages go, very intricate details. It was so beautiful when we saw it from behind the cordons that you have to take the grand tour, to better appreciate the wonderful architecture and the contents of the cathedral. Highly recommended!
Get the ticket, its worth it. The windows are gorgeous, the silver tomb is unique, its worth getting a ticket to really see and explore this church and the other buildings.
So many types of architecture. This place is a must see for any visit to Prague. The church as been built over different time periods and shows this in the different types of architecture.
Terrific; ornate and beautiful. Graphically portrays the rich history and heritage of the Czech people. Every nook and crany in the cathedral is amazing. The golden spires sparkle in sunlight.

Worth seeing!. This church is located in Prague Castle and can be seen free of charge. Make sure to walk around the exterior--in the back is the original doorway and next to it is the original sandstone structure- pretty amazing to see the various phases.
huge. this is a very large cathedral in the Castle complex and takes some time to look round.very much like other cathedrals.
Historic visit. This cathedral with all its history is well worth a visit. Just remember to go on the back side, where the original wall is. Beautiful.

Another Gothic Cathedral...but it has a stained glass window by Mucha..
