I've seen quite a few Gothic Cathedral over the years and while they're all architecturally magnificent and impressive, there is a certain sameness to them. Nevertheless they all have their own personalities. This cathedral was not completely finished until 1929, nearly 600 years after it was started. To me, the most spectacular of the stained glass windows is one by Alphons Mucha. It is absolutely beautiful.

Impressive.. If you love cathedrals then the stained glass windows are very impressive, not to mention those huge columns and basically everything else. I've just looked at my photos again and would like to change my opinion to VERY impressive.

Pefect place for wedding. Well I would say it is mostly romantic day of my life. You will enjoy to spend there your day. Try to get good wether. I would recommend to take a tram 22 or 23 and it will bring you to the back of the Prague Castle. And then it is easy to walk down to the city centre.

Great viewpoint in Prague. I advice you to climb to the top of cathedral's tower - you will see an excelent landscape of city.Cathedral contains relics of St. Vaclav (Viacheslav) - the great hero.Tourist office sells tickets to 3 places in one time - St. Vitus Cathedral, Basiliсa and Palace. Cathedral is the best place. Basilica contains relics of St. Ludmila - queen and grandmother of Vaclav.

Most beatiful cathedral I have ever seen............ Gorgeous, huge monument, nearly 1000 years old short of couple of years. Very famous for its history, coloured glass windows. Burial place of the most famous of Czech kings. Place where the Czech royal jewels are saved, where if you want to get to it, you have to have the president, the Prague mayor, the archbishop and several other people present at the same time as you must insert several keys all at once to get to it..............fascinating place and stories..............

it's really breathtaking!. The cathedral is the mixture of different styles & was more than 600 years in building. The master builders were very close to the original design of the 14 century with the additions of the modern stained-glass windows. The church is lavishly decorated, but the main treasure is the Chapel of St. Wenceslav (sv. Vaclav).

One of the best cathedrals in Europe. The exterior of the cathedral is awe-inspiring and the interior is decorated by chapels and stain glass windows. You need to buy a ticket to walk inside the cathedral (and all the way to the back). Tip: There is a 'free' area between the main cathedral entrance and the ticket entry gate. You will be able to see the whole cathedral from the free area. Another tip: We paid 50Kc for a photo license so that we can take photos inside the castle interiors. However no one stopped us to check for our license.

Pretty cathedral.. The stained glass Mucha panel was stunning. The other stained glass panels were nice too. Unfortunately they herd you through the cathedral too quickly to take everything in. Go as early as possible.
cathedral. the spires, the decorations on the buildings,the inside of the church was breathtaking in its sheer beauty, the guides in there were very helpful and informative
Breathtaking!!!. Only thing that I can say for St. Vitus Cathedral is breathtaking! Every details are incredible. You have to see it if you go to Prag!
Beautiful. Lovely and free to get into most of it. Great stained windows although you can't get close to all of them without paying.

Beautiful!. This cathedral contained some of the most beautiful stained glass I have ever seen. When the sun shone it was like walking into a rainbow. Also take the time to look up at the outside of the cathedral as the gargoyles are absolutely fabulous if a little creepy!
Beautiful, enormous cathedral. A real icon of Prague. Soaring towers, beautiful spires, stained glass, carvings. The stonework is amazing and intricate.

Beautiful cathedral. Out of all the cathedrals in the "City of thousand spires", this one is the biggest and the most distinctive too. The insides are beautiful, lots of history.We went there at around 4 pm, so the crowd was thin. Tip: According to the info centre there, the full tour of the palace grounds take around 4-6 hours. The full tour tickets to the palace are valid for 2 days, so the whole tour can be split into 2 halves.
Nice but not Great. This one didn't knock me off my feet. I've been in plenty of old cathedrals and this one is average at best. Decent stained-glass windows.

Vast and impressive. St Vitus Cathedral is a place that I would have liked to return to. It's almost too much to take in at one time. Flying buttresses, dozens and dozens of spires, Venetian-style mosaics, amazing ironwork, artwork, exceptional stained glass windows, rose window. The building and its interior is a work of art. I highly recommend a visit - or two.

monumental cathedral. When I entered the Cathedral, I realized how small I am. Impressive medieval architecture represents European Gothic, Czech Kingdom and Holy Roman Empire. On the wall of the Cathedral you can see coats of arms of the Habsburg monarchy subjects: from Castile and provinces of the Netherlands to German states, Czech lands and Hungary. To sum up: place with the great historical atmosphere

Climb the bell tower!. We only had a quick look inside the cathedral but decided to climb the bell tower. The view of Prague is well worth the climb of the spiral staircase. It cost 150Kc and includes a nice commemorative medal.

St. Vitus Cathedral. We really loved this place! Spectacular stained glass windows and architecture. I actually enjoyed looking at this building more than Prague Castle! We didn't have a guided tour but whenever I return(which I will sometime) I will look for a guide as I felt that many interesting things were missed.
timing is everything. Nice architecture and well restored cathedral, but get there at 9:00 or you will need to be patient with the thousands who come everyday.
Okay, but not great. Closed on Sunday morning for mass. A queue builds up outside from 11.45 onwards and then a massive push to get inside with a bottleneck at the turnstiles. Not pleasant.

Stunning....when you can see it properly!. In March of last year I was able to visit this stunning cathedral with my daughter. We had time to walk slowly and observe its beautiful stain windows and most of its artistic details. This time, however, my husband and I tried to see it but we weren't very lucky. First of all we were told it would be open at 10am. It only opened at 12. By then, the line to get in was going around the corner. Finally, when we managed to get in, there were sooooo many people we couldn't even move without bumping into someone. We just turned around, bumped into quite a few people and walked out. We are going to try and go back tomorrow. The people in charge of organizing these visits should start doing what is already being done in other countries like England and Italy: control the number of people going in. This can be done by tourists and tour agents booking in advance. This is a must see cathedral, though However, here is a word of advice: try to avoid visiting it when everyone and their mother are ..... If you can!

Huge, impressive Cathedral, whose glorious stained glass windows were the best i have ever seen. Gothic St. Vitus Cathedral was a huge, very impressive, highly decorated and ornate structure, whose vaulted ceilings were so high and whose dimensions so large that, to my eyes, the far walls and ceilings were obscured by a slight haze (incense?). It contained many, many chapels, each one the burial place of one of the several Bohemian Kings and Holy Roman Emperors buried there. But for me, the most impressive, stand out thing was its glorious stained glass windows, more brilliant, more successfully realized—in terms of their wide range of gem-like colors, their detail, and their life-like depictions of people—than any other stained glass windows that I have ever seen, elsewhere in Europe or in the U.S.
Cathedral. Didn't dislike anything really...just another "over the top" cathedral in Europe. It was beautiful and worth seeing.
desapointed. that there was only some hours when you can get in. Otherwise the cathedrar was closed. But outside it was beautiful

Stunning. Wonderful stain glass windows and very decadent, the grandeur was overwhelming.Not many translations so much of what we saw remained mystery.Still enjoyed the experience even though the turnstile inside the entrance caused long delays
beautiful. amazng building, beautiful stained glass windows, allowed your cameras in there but no flash. original features in there, great place to see.
Bueatiful Cathedral. Very beautiful cathedral. Easy to buy tickets to. Lots of people at the same time that could not shut up. :)
beautiful inside and out. We had purchased 'Prague cards" at the airport on our way in and therefore getting the tickets was a breeze. the guided tour is informative and just the right length

Stunning Cathedral at the Prague Castle. The architecture is stunning, the doors massive & carved, the colorful stained glass windows, the magnificent frescos & a huge roomy inside with a tall tall ceiling, makes compelling viewing!

Don't miss this!. This is an exquisite jewel! The stained glass windows were magnificent and the religious statues amazing. Don't miss reading the information (in English) about the various areas of this church.
the buzz. there is something going on at any time of the day. In fact you could spend all day on the bridge and never get bored.
The cathedral in the castle. do not hesitate to spend to spend a few crowns to visit this cathedral; it really worth the time and the money...

Unbelievable. This cathedral has been the symbol of Prague for around 1000 years; first building date back to 929 when Saint Venceslao wanted the first church, then between 1060 and 1096 the 2nd church was built. Current gothic church was initially built in 1344, but then completed only in 1929. Since during all this period the castle "lived", the entry of the church finished to be very close to other buildings (you'll clearly perceive this if you'll try to take a picture: nearly impossible). Around 30 kings were incoronated here.Don't lose the castle and ST vitus. Start your visit to Prague from here.
As Beautiful on the Inside as from the Outside. We decided to attend mass in Czech - there was a 9PM service on Sunday evening so we didn't have to rush through dinner.

Wow!. A must-see. Simply stunningly beautiful inside and outside. Without tickets, one is allowed to get in and see portions of inside. But it is worth paying to see other part too. This is my favorite architecture in Prague.

Beautiful Cathedral inside and outside. The cathedral is well worth the climb up and then back down a steep hill. The stained glass windows are spectacular making the inside light up with an array of colour. Everywhere you look, you see beautiful architectural features, magnificent statues and beautiful artwork. The icing on the cake is the phenomenal view of Prague that you get as you leave the area. A must see!

A piece of art!. This is a perfect example of gothic style building art :-) The church is right in the Prauge castle complex, and is beautyful. A real piece of art. They started building the church in the 13:th century, but it wasn´t finished until the late 15:th, if even then. Stunning architecture, stunning glass mosaic windows and stunning sculptures everywhere. A big - is that you have to pay money to take pictures, or to se the whole church.
Perfect Prague. This cathedral is one of the most sublime we have visited on our holidays to various places. It's position must be one of the greates too.
Beautiful. Just go and see for yourself - don't leave it out even if you don't normally go into churches. It is so near the castle.

The Fantastic Mosaic. Don't miss the mosaics at the side of the Cathedral. These mosaics alone are worthy of a walk up the hill to the castle. Their beauty, their age, their story put the history of Europe in the middle ages in perfect perspective.
Ornate reflection of Prague's past. We loved the preservation of statues, ceiling work, paintings, and all church ornaments. Nothing to dislike here.
A bit disappointing.. Not as good as I thought it would be. Perhaps been spoilt by the many other cathedrals throughout Europe
Amazing!. This place is well worth a visit and is within the Prague Castle complex which you have to buy tickets for to go in. But it's well worth it.

One of the most beautiful in the world. The details and architecture outside, like the gargoyles and even the depiction in stone of the original builders just prepares you for what is inside, if you arrive when late ( very close to closing time) when the sun is about to set you will witness one of the most amazing light effects, the light going trough the stained glass and reflecting inside the cathedral walls, we found out by chance and we were amazed by this. Check it out!

Beautifully preserved wonder. This church is a beautifully preserved piece of Gothic architecture. The chapels within are fascinating, and the whole of the cathedral is majestic, full of works of art, sculptures and frescoes. I am very glad that I paid for a ticket.

Gorgeous Cathedral. There is a short line to get in - gorgeous stained glass with spectacular details in the building. There are two entrances. One is the cathedral itself - a loop around the building and the other leads you up to the tower for a view... Pay before you try to get in.

Stunningly beautiful. this most beautiful of buildings totally left me in awe , the statues inside and the stained glass windows , look for the flames of hell in the right hand bottom corner of the south window, the silver ware around the crypts and tombs , the stunning paintings and watch the sunlight stream through with a miryad of colours lighting up the cathedral

Stunning!. This has to be the highlight of the Prague Castle. Just as you enter, there's all these lovely play of colors from the beautiful stained glass windows created by Czech master artists of the early 20th century. There are baroque and renaissance details, carved wooden doors and graceful Gothic vaulting. So magnificent, so beautiful, a visitor to Prague must not fail to see this cathedral.

Take time to see the outside and the inside!. Incredible architecture, stained glass, history and really enjoyed all the gargoyles! A Must See! We waited until there weren't as many tours going inside and had more room to look around, it was well worth it. Sometimes it is just too jammed with people!
St. Vitus Cathedral. Overpowering! One of the more beautiful churches we saw in Europe. Named after a 14 yr. old martyr. Not even from the Czech Republic. The whole complex was incredible!

Amazing church, packed in the Castle.. This majestic, Gothic church is made even more impressive by how confined it is within the Castle. Its history and all the events it held make this structure extremely interesting, and a definite must-see.

Beautiful architecture; not worth admission. We visited last week and I was absolutely fascinated by the exterior architecture. Inside there are some fancy statues along the back and sides that you pay admission to see. I would argue that it was enough to just stand in the foyer and enjoy the FREE view of the altar. Maybe if we had paid the extra for an audio guide we would have gotten more out of the visit but I'm not so sure!

Best in prague well worth the admission. It is absolutely stunning. Well worth the admission. The free part is ok. But once we got inside, it is amazing. All forms of art are represented there. It is the highlight of our visit. We bought the family pass, it says valid for two days. We went again the next day, but it only allows one entrance in two days. It is a bit misleading to call it a pass.

St Vitus Dance!. Not, really but it is the highlight of the Prague Castle Tour which is otherwise not necessarily worth the cost and long wait in line which is also crazy because they often run out of audio guides around 1 pm, which means you can stand in line for 45 minutes and then not get an audio guide

worth the admission price. You can either enter the cathedral lobby for free and get a quick sense of the place, or buy an admission ticket. I would recommend getting the ticket as there are a number of wonderful (and unique) stained glass windows in both traditional and modern styles, plus sculptures and ornamental gates that are really "over the top".

Beautiful building but too busy. There is no doubting this is an amazing structure and fantastic to look at from outside, but inside was a bit spoiled by too many noisy tours and loads of flash photography - we could not stay for more than a few minutes. Being honest, we preferred Tyn cathedral in the old town which was far more peaceful.

Magnificent cathedral. Unlike English cathedral it is smaller and differently laid-out but it has a special charm for the Czechs. There are tombs in the basement and nicely decorated chapel. It is very old, the beginning goes back to 11th century.

Spectacular cathedral. Amazing cathedral near the castle. The stained and painted glass is right up there with the highlights in Italy. At night the castle and cathedral are very cool to look at and get photos of. Highly recommended taking in the castle, cathedral and Charles bridge at night.

Best building at Prague Castle. It's worth paying the money to tour St. Vitus Cathedral. If you only go in to the public area, you miss out on seeing some amazing stuff including a silver tomb of John of Nepomuk - who's statue on the Charles Bridge you rub for good luck.

The best attraction in Prague. A superb example of architecture and the grandness of it just fills your eyes with an expression unquotable by words. Spanning over 6 centuries, the Cathedral shows you the higlights of tha Ancient, the Medieval and the Modern History of Prague....

Architecture at its best!. Never seen such a grand cathedral. It drew attention away from Prague Castle itself.
The amount of detail on the outside was mindblowingly beautiful.
Beautiful. Definitely worth a stop. You can get in the entrance for free but need to pay to get further inside.

Well worth a visit - Amazing things to see. We visited here on a trip to Prague this Summer. We are great lovers of Cathedrals and so this was one we didn't want to miss. This is a truly amazing experience as you walk through the door as the light from the stained glass all in different styles hits you.The Cathedral itself is quite large and is part of the Castle so we paid 350 czk for a two day ticket to see everything there - but you can walk into the cathedral for free (you just don't get to walk around it or see the Wenceslas Chapel).Dont miss the Wenceslas Chapel as this was quite special and also the tomb of St John Nepomuk (there is a plaque on The Charles bridge of him being thrown in the river that you are supposed to touch for good luck) these are special things to see and really interesting. I would recommend a good guide book or a tour as there is no english translations (but there are english speaking wardens).Overall this was worth the walk up to the castle and we really enjoyed the visit

Absolutely Beautiful. Many historic buildings close together. Start at the gates to the Presidential palace (best changing guard ceremony is at noon) and walk through the entire complex. Buy a pass to all the buildings to get into all areas.

St Vitus Cathedral. The scale of this cathedral was impressive and the history which transpired hundreds of years of construction and redesign reflecting the various periods of architectural adaptation. The windows by Mucha were of particular note, being done in the 1900s compared to the other ancient windows.
Amazing lights. The sunlight coming through the stained glass made this so memorable. The sheer size of the Cathedral and the feeling when one entered it makes this a spot that shouldnt be missed.
Old Cathedral. This was pretty amazing and well worth the trip. We got the entire trip of the castle. This was a highlight of Prague for sure.
truly great. truly great, the architecture, the history, the tombs, the lights, and of course the tower, 96 meters high, strongly suggested.

Jaw dropping!. I was left in complete shock when standing in front of this Cathedral.... It was really a sight to see. The stain glass was amazing.... I had to crouch down and look up at this Cathedral in disbeleif. It was really a great experience.

Pretty inside an out! Don't need to purchase admission. The church is quite lovely inside and outside. However, you don't need to pay for admission to access the inside. You can enter without a ticket. The "free admission" roped off area has views of the central area (nave), altar, rose window (behind you) and parts of the side aisles. As someone who travels to sites specifically to see cathedrals I was satisfied with the view inside with just the free admission.

Gorgeous!. Breathtaking stained glass windows and cool gargoyles. You do need a ticket to see the interior of the cathedral however you can see a lot at the entrance already and there are good picture taking opportunities.
A nice cathedral. You simply must visit.Though you should know that if you come for/during the services you shall stay there to the end !!!, and it is really wqorth attending

Superb Architecture! Amazing!. Of all the Cathedrals that I have seen (and I have seen quite a lot!), this is by far the most impressive! Great architecture and sculptures! The interior reminded me of St. Peter's Basilica in the Vatican. Very inspiring! But you would have to go early to avoid the crowds!

Great Gothic Church!. I spent a lot of time looking at the gargoyles and the structure of the building!!Inside it is huge and high... vitrales are colourful and beautiful.It is not so far from Charles bridge.
Nice, but not worth a ticket. Unless this is your first cathedral in Europe, it is not worth buying a ticket. There are lots of beautiful and free cathedrals around.

Moving experience. I attended the 11 AM service on Sunday; the gentlemen outside let me through as I flashed the prayer beads/crucifix I got in Budapest--they excluded camera-toting tourists. The dress code was definitely not as strict as in Italy; I was surprised to see short skirts and camis. Although a bit late, I was able to join the congregation fairly close to the front. The service was all in Czech; my only misstep was when I went to the altar for Communion. The priest said something and hesitated. I glanced up to find him looking at me sternly, and not placing the wafer in my upturned hands. He said, "AMEN?" so I repeated, "Amen." The lofty Gothic arches, (the nave is around 100 feet tall) and stained glass windows were punctuated by the shafts of morning sunlight coming through clear glass far up the wall; the pipe organ sounded lovely in the huge space.The service lasted for a little over an hour; during the Postlude, the congregation was able to walk around the church. The chapels and relics were accessible, also the largest censer I have seen. But more than the objects in the church, what was impressive was the realization that I was sharing the experience so many others have had before in the centuries..

Full of Details. Of all of the churches / cathedrals we've toured in Europe, this ranks among the best alongside Cologne. Full of wonderful architectural details inside and out. Line-up moves very quickly, and can stay inside as long as you like.

Fascination. It's a worth to visit, make sure that you get inside of all the building and takes a deep breath.:)Tip : There are 2 chanels where you can buy the ticket. Most people will stand at a long queue at the ticket building, but actually you can also buy the ticket at the giftshop. It took just about 5 min..
spectacular. the cathedral is a very busy place within the grounds of the castle. beautiful stained glass windows await you

Make sure you go inside!. We booked a special tour of the inside of Prague Castle (including St. Vitus Cathedral). I'm glad we did. Many visitors seemed to just walk past it and not go in. The stained glass windows were particularly beautiful.
Breath-taking. Of all the sights in Prague, this cathedral was our favorite. It is so massive and beautiful. Buy the ticket so you can go through the cathedral. It's worth the price.

Worth queueing for. A most impressive building in a great location - well worth waiting to see it if a service is on when you first arrive but it's better to avoid joining the long queues waiting to get in. Instead, wander elsewhere in the castle complex and return when the queues have gone down. (One of the many benefits of not being in a tour group!)

Amazing place. We arrived at noon on Sunday and there were several thousand waiting to enter. We got in the back of the line which moved quickly. The cathedral is just stunning. Well worth the cost of admission.
Beautiful. Please note, there is now a charge for admittance to view windows and crypts beyond the foyer area. Recommend purchase of the entire tour as other areas, Golden Lane, St George's, etc.
Been to a lot of cathedrals in Europe and this was one of the best. The history here is fabulous as well as the architecture. Not a lot of cathedrals I have seen in Europe have this sort of style.

Crowded, but worthwhile. We tried to gain entrance before the tour groups, but they were on to us, and crowded in ahead of us. It would have been better to wait a bit for the crowds to thin (around 11:00 or so). Beautifully restored, but still...just another cathedral!

Cathedral built over time for all times.. We loved the architectural description given by our guide from the inside and the outside. This has been built over many centuries and will last for many more. The stained glass windows are the prize winners in my book. Seeing the Mucha next to the older ones is again looking at centuries of glass history. It's well worth the time to visit. It holds a real sense of the spiritual history of this country and the strength of its people.
Why pay.. its always a disappointment to pay to see a cathedral and previously this had been free. The castle gardens nearby have a great collection of different trees
Beautiful. great place to visit, get there early in the day as it gets very busy. Its as east to get to as counting to 1,2,3, just hop on the number 22 tram, drops you outside the door almost

South Tower is the best bit. We bought a 'full' ticket for Prague Castle believing it included the South Tower (which had been recommended for its views of the city) - but it did not. So we had to pay a little bit more to go up the Tower - 200 or so steps in a stone spiral staircase with no handrail (so not for everyone) but the views from the top are spectacular and make it well worth it if you can manage it. The stained glass in the main cathedral building is beautiful.

Pay for it.. Yes you can walk into the center of the church for free, like the grounds of the castle, but the paid ticket gets you much closer to the mosaics and the silver alters. Worth every moment.Be aware that it's the most popular site in the castle and crowds can form easily. Especially right before noon for the main guard changing ceremony.
Impressive. St. Vitus Cathedral is totally worth the entry fee! One of the most beautiful church I have seen. A must see if you go to Prague!

St. Vitus Cathedral, Prague, Czech Republic. This cathedral is well worth the nominal charge to enter and the extra fee to take photographs. Since the cathedral was not completed until the 20th century, the dozen or so stained glass windows range in style from late medieval to modern. Each is a masterpiece in and of itself. Inside are the tombs of astronomer Tycho Brahe as well as notable Bohemian royalty, including the tomb of King Vaclav I himself ("Good King Wencelas"). The ceiling is so high above you that you can see mist between you and the classic gothic buttresses holding up the roof.

Beautiful Cathedral. This is a must to see if in Prague. The castle is ok but more like a palace than a castle. Don't bother to pay for a guided tour. Howeve the cathedral which is at the castle is worth a visit.

You'll be glad you went. Even if it's just for the magnificent Mucha stained glass window. It is a magnificent church, and everywhere you look there is something to please the eye, and then history to open your mind. The light as it plays through the cathedral throughout the day is so elegant, so soft. You find yourself going into that very soft and quiet place, within. The stories of the people entombed are fascinating. If you're a photographer you will love spending time there, and getting that *perfect* photo Do visit, you won't regret it

St. Vitus Cathedral. Here lies the tomb of St. Wenceslaus. A stunning Cathedral with specatacular colourful stained glass windows.
Tip: If you dont pay the entrance fee you can still enter the front of the cathedral for free and see most of it anyway
Have to see it. I think it`s the most amazing place in Prague. Great arhitecture even if a part of the cathedral was in reconstruction.

Breathtakingly beautiful. This gothic cathedral is huge and breathtakingly beautiful. One large stained glass window was designed by Alfonso Mucha, the famous Czech art nouveau poster designer. the cathedral is a treasure house of sculpture, silver work, iron grill, stained glass work and stone masonary.
Grand. This church is very grand. There's a small chapel on the side called St. Wenceslaus chapel where the saint is entombed.
250CK ticket is not worth. Can go in without paying. Should buy 250CK ticket to go to the front. Not worth, Nothing exciting to see at the front. May be worth for a deeply religious person

Worth it to see the Mucha and other windows. Amazing stained glass windows including one designed by Mucha. You can see this section without a ticket to the rest of the exhibit. Definitely worth a look!

Fantastic Gothic Cathedral. St Vitus is really a stunning church. The approach through the Castle is breathtaking. The exterior offers a number of excellent views. The interior is a challenge to photograph but is equally beautiful.
Amen. Great catedral but you will have only a short view when you get inside, want to see more you have to buy a ticket and that would be outside, so find the ticket office before you stay in line
Pretty impressive church. This was a pretty cool church- lots to look at inside even though you get herded through like cattle- It was worth the walk up to the hill to see it

Munch window stunning. It was a bit annoying to have to pay to see all the cathedral and various other sites when I was less interested in most of it. However, it was worth it for the stained glass windows and Golden Lane.
Breathtaking!. So huge!! Even our children were impressed by the wonderful ceiling and asked "how could they build something like this with no crane?" Don't miss it!

A must see. Worth buying a postcard with the perspective of the cathedral that must have been taken from a roof. As the cathedral is built within the palace complex, there is not a way to get that view on your own...

Try getting there very early in the morning. Unquestionably beautiful and amazing, but too many tourists (I myself!!!). See if you can attend it very early in the morning, when locals go for mass.
Or else, there are some concerts in the evenings.
Don't miss Mucha's vitraux!

Take to "short tour" to see the whole Cathedral. Through AMAwaterways, we had a visit inside St. Vitus during our city tour, but just the entry areas. We went back the next day for the "short tour" of the castle area, which includes St. Vitus, the old Palace, Golden Lane, and the Royal Gardens which are always free. Each of the alcoves around the perimeter of the church, which you only see with a ticket, are phenominal. Some of the best are at the back, behind the alter. There is so much detail inside this Cathedral, you could easily spend an hour if you chose to!

Afternoons with the reflections of the stained glass. Whenever I come here in the sunny afternoon, the light makes amazing reflections on the walls. It is much better than in the morning. I think it is one of the must when you are in Prague, yet if you come without tour guide, guide book or at least audio guide, you will not know what you are looking at and will not like it so much.
Huge, gorgeous. The stained glass windows are unique and very colourful, paintings, gold-relief statues, everything is impressive.
Beautiful stained glass. Some lovely stained glass windows in this cathedral. Only visited the free parts, as there was too much to see to cover everything

Wonderful Stained Glass. St. Vitus' Cathedral is huge, imposing and amazing. Especially the Stained Glass. The windows defy description. One of them, done in 1938 was created by the famed Art Nouveau graphic artist Alfons Mucha. The Cathedral is completely enclosed by the castle and a tour of one is a tour of the other. Not to be missed.

St. Vitus Cathedral. Words can not describe the beauty of this cathedral, you just have to see it. Plan to visit the castle and cathedral complex early in the day. To see it all will take hours but, is well worth it.

Impressing by its size. This cathedral is situated in the castle area, easily reachable by tram/bus.It is impressing by its size and is very nice !Luckily you can enter and see the most part without paying anything, a ticket is needed just to go near the hostel.

beautiful old Cathedral. you can go in to the front of the Cathedral and get a sampling of the art and the stained glass windows...I found this was ample...and there were many like me who were milling around this area who did not pay the extra to go up close to the furthest part...

Interesting but busy. Visited the cathedral on a Monday afternoon, the building is definitely beautiful with major parts being offlimits for tourists and about half of the ground floor restricted to those with a valid (short of long) castle ticket. It's worth the look if you've already got the multi entry ticket for the rest of the castle, wouldn't recommend paying for it separately though.
stunning. this is one of the most beautiful cathedrals i have ever seen, breathtaking, i love the gothic nature of architecture in this part of the world, don't miss a guided tour of this city!

So much to see!. This is a huge, beautiful cathedral that is the first stop when on the castle ticket. I'd recommend the audio guide, since without it we were left ooh-ing and aah-ing but clueless as to what we're looking at. The alters, shrines, and windows are gorgeous (though everything is really dusty... it could use a cleaning in there).
Stained glass. Impressive gothic exterior coupled with incredible stained glass windows make this a must see! Free entry too!
Prague Castle. A must see. This building was great. We got the short tour ticket which gave us access to many of the castle buildings and golden lane. Really beautiful. Lots to see.
St. Vitus Cathedral. Well, you can't visit Prague and do not see St. Vitus Cathedral. Overwhelming architectural wonder. We didn't took audio guide and probably it was mistake.

A usual church. if you buy a castle ticket (short tour), understand that you show your ticket past the main area. Go see the Munch glass window and walk around the church. then, go outside and find the other 5 areas to see on the ticket. Golden Lane is very cute.

Beautiful Cathedral. A beautiful Cathedral set in the grounds of the Castle and we walked through the vineyards on the way back to the Charles Bridge. Loved the smallest street (very narrow) with traffic lights both ends.

Amazing stained glass. Located in the Prague castle we almost skipped this place because of the queue. Glad we didn't! the queue not only moved a lot quicker than expected, it was quite educational, as we didn't have a guide we could overhear all the guides explaining the history and elements of this church. the stained glass and exterior was so wonderful that we chose to spend even more time there. If your'e in the Prague castle DON'T miss out on the church!
Dominates the skyline. You really can not miss St Vitus Cathedral as you can see it from just about everywhere in Prague ad it is as stunning inside as it is majestic outside. a must see
Beautiful piece of architecture.. Everything in it from the exterior to the inside was simply beautiful. The architecture is stunning. Its one of the sights that should not be missed when in Prague.

the tour. Definitely beautiful. Next time I think I would take a guided tour to learn more of the history of the Cathedral. The climb up one of the towers was a highlight. I thoroughly enjoyed this area as well as Prague overall. I would sign up for more guided tours next time

you have to pay. If you won´t to se Mucha´s window and the most of the church you have to pay for it, you can se half of the window of Mucha and the church from the bottom of the church, its beautiful but it should be free
A must visit !. Take tram 22 to the top of the hill next to the cathedral. The trip is awesome. take in Prague Castle at the same time.

Don't miss the MUCHA Chapel with Glass windows. Entering, to the left side, one of the first chapels contains the wonderful glass windows of Alpohonse Mucha. The rest of the Cathedral is also worth a visit, for the stunning altar area with impressive sculptures and tombs. You can't miss it.

Get there early, or wait in line. St Vitus Cathedral was one of the most impressive sights we visited in Prague. The architecture is amazing, as with the stained glass windows. We were there at 9am and it was already beginning to bustle, but we did not have to wait in line and could wander a little within the allowed area without people getting in the way.
Beautiful. We've seen this cathedral twice.It is wonderful,the gothic architecture is remarkable. If you are in Prague,give it a few hours of your time.You won't be sorry.
Memorable. We're not religious folks, but we couldn't help but be impressed at the architechure. It's a climb to where the catheral is located, but worth it.
Worth a visit. If you like Gothic architecture and enjoy visiting the toms of Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors, this is the place to hang out.
Beautiful. Im not much of a cathedral person, but this was one of the most beautiful i have seen in Europe. Great views of the city too.
Baroque church. I have seen nothing like this anywhere. It is more lavishly decorated than any church I have seen. We also attended an organ concert which was excellent.
An experiience. Great atmosphere and good street entertainment. Restaurants - low in quality and service and high in price!
An amazing site to see. The Gothic architecture and sheer size of the cathedral was amazing.

Very nice cathedral. This is the most impressive place to visit around the Prague Castle, but if you don't have at least an audio guide, you could miss a lot of very interesting spots. There are some special places that you can only see with a special ticket or with guide, if you are a group of 4+.

The most beautiful church I have seen. You simply have to see St.Vitus' to believe it. Start by taking plenty of time to walk around the building, soaking up the splendour of the architecture, the cleverness of the design and hundreds of little visual delights to be seen all over, provided you look carefully (and up). Having been blown away by the exterior, enter the building and have your senses flooded all over by the sumptuous interior, from the stunning stained glass windows, to the incredible sculptures, to the beautiful wooden fittings, to the imperiously high ceiling through which beams of light cascade.
Nice Cathedral. The St. Vitus Cathedral is a beautiful cathedral. Is it quite large and visiting the cathedral during AM a sunny day will give you nice light inside the cathedral.

Gorgeous Cathedral. We paid to go into St. Vitus Cathedral on the "short tour" of the Castle. It was great to really look around and take pictures. The St. Wenceslaus chapel was spectacular and he is buried there. While the church was crowded with tour guides and the only way to learn about it was throughout the audio tour, it was still a great church! They have a 7 am Mass during the week in one of the side chapels. We went twice for that and it was nice to see it at a quiet time also. A must see in Prague!

fantastically beautiful. Take time to soak in the beauty of this cathedral. There are the typical statues and stained glass that you see in other cathedrals across Europe, but this one is especially beautiful and worth at least 20 minutes of your time to look around and take pictures.

A Good Day Out. A wonderful Cathedral we were lucky enough to find a guide to take us down into the crypt to see the burials there. It was interesting exploring the rooms in the castle from the main hall. A good full day of things to see.
St. Vitus Cathedral. Beautiful and sacred at the same time. Organ music concerts will transport to previous times. Gentle safety in this astonishing Church. Easy access for walking.

Fantastic stained glass, alternative to audio-guide. The cathedral is in a very atmospheric location within the castle complex. If you want a proper look you'll definitely need a ticket, bought before you enter the cathedral from an office on the right as you come through the archway into the cathedral courtyard. The ticket allows you a full visit to the cathedral rather than just the back of the nave. Many reviewers have commented about the expense of the audioguide, so I downloaded a guide from PocketVox.com which was very detailed and clear. This can be put on your phone and used with your headphones (or I used a bluetooth headset) so you don't need to hold a handset to your ear the whole time. The stand-out feature of the cathedral for me was the superb stained glass - they are happy for you to take photos and stained glass is easy to photograph. Top tip: zoom in for a better result, in addition to photos of whole windows.
Very nice`. i can say very picturesque , nice place to visit a must when in prague
Worth the wait. So, I think I waited at least 30 min in line here (on a non-busy day)...but it's worth it to see the inside of this spot. If you have time to visit the castle, visit the cathedral.

Amazing. A real masterpiece! An amazing cathedral, that can rival any of the cathedrals in France, for example.It is a bit gloomy and dark inside which is not ideal for taking pictures, but the overall experience is really nice.We visited during late December and it was bitterly cold inside, so I would advise visiting during summer months.

Wow !. what can i say , the pictures tell you all ! its got amazing architecture ... its a huge cathedral and you need to walk around a bit to see most of the inside . Its quite a tall structure and I had to almpost lye down to get the very good picture capturing most of it all in my camera ! ;) The detailing is very very impressive ... just include it on your must see places in prague...
Not free. The guide books said it was free but it was only free to go the first few feet into the cathedral. To see the best stain glass windows you had to pay.

Great cathedral. Beautiful Gothic cathedral. Although it was started in the 1100, the cathedral was not finished until early in the 1900s. It does show some influences from the Baroque and Renaissance, but latter builders in the 1800s tried to stay true to the original Gothic origins. Of all the sites on the castle hill, this should be one of your "must sees".
An impressive must see!. It was a magnificent structure and very impressive, especially when one understands the time and effort that has been put in to build this amazing Cathedral!

Superb architecture.. I saw this gorgeous cathedral with a tour group. It is enormous with amazing architecture. The facade was most impressive, then walk around to the side, the beauty is jaw-dropping. Could not believe the size of this building. Inside is equally impressive. You will be taking lots of photos! Make the effort to visit this!
Art and history. If you like art and history, this is a must! Beutiful sculptures, glas paintings that will tak yor breath away!
Beautiful Cathedral. Both inside and out this is a beautiful church worth seeing.
Beautifull. Try visit the tower, the view is great, dont forget your camera. Many steps.
Worth a visit. Visible from all over Prague, The sheer size does not impress till you walk through an archway to be confronted by the facade.
Impressive cathedral. You could tak a million pictures of the cathedral. The architecture was so impressive as well as the satin glass window and handcarvings.

Definitely worth it. This visit to the Cathedral is definitely worth it if you make the hike up to the Castle. A very impressive structure. I couldn't go in because of lack of time, but I did very much enjoy walking along the ramparts of this Cathedral.
A must see!. Awesome from the outside, but a little disappointing inside. Nothing over the top (I've seen other cathedrals that were much more breathtaking inside). Free attraction which is good.
What a cathederal. Part of this went back to the 13th century and it was simply breathtaking
Beautiful place. This is a site worth visiting. I recommend getting a guide to help understand the history behind the Cathedral. We had Hubert, who was excellent.
Beautiful cathedral. Worth peeking inside, buy the short pass for the castle complex to gain entry.
Well worth your time. Beautiful, impressive cathedral. The stained glass windows are fairly modern - and absolutely stunning. This is a must-see in Prague.

While it is a cathedral it is not really a place of worship when open to tourists. This is a large and lovely cathedral, and the stained glass is the most beautiful I had yet seen. It is also a very crowded place with tour group after tour group hearing commentary in a variety of languages. Please do not look as if you are tagging along because you may be told off quite quickly. All the pews were roped off so stopping to say a prayer was not really an easy option. When I asked one of the attendants about it, she did open up the ropes so I could enter a pew and stop and pray. There was so much commotion that I did not stay there long.By the way, there is no need to climb all those steps up. Take the tram No. 22 to stop Pražský hrad and all the walking is down hill.

Large Cathedral quite nice. St Vitus Cathedral is the cathedral used by the Kings and is part of the Castle quarter. It has some nice stained glass windows, interior structures and statues. We had taken a bus upto the Strahov Monastery and then walked to the Castle quarter. It is a nice walk, but when we visited the weather was hot, so we had to look for shade to walk.
Breathtaking!. THis cathedral houses some of the most beautiful stained glass I've ever seen.
Beautiful. The cathedral was absolutely gorgeous, set in the grounds of the Palace. If you're in Prague, then it's not to be missed. The only bad thing is the trek up the stairs to get there!

Awesome architecture & history. St Vitus Cathedral is a Roman Catholic cathedral located within the grounds of Prague Castle. It is the biggest and most important cathedral in the Czech Republic. The design and building works started in 1344 and was only fully completed 585 years later in 1929. The initial building design is based on French Gothic designs, drawn by a French master Matthias of Aras.In the interior of the church, I was awed by the magnificent ceilings and columns of the cathedral and its beautiful stained glass windows.

Splendid cathedral. This ornate cathedral includes beautiful stained glass and ornately decorated tombs and chapels with a 600 year history. While there, we heard a rehearsal for an evening organ concert on the incredible organ. Quite an experience!

Nice part of the castle tour. St. Vitus is part of the Prague Castle admission ticket. You can visit the cathedral without a ticket, but you aren't given access to portions of the cathedral that are worth seeing. There is a strange mix of the very old and some later additions in the 1930's. Very large colorful stained glass and an amazing cathedral ceiling. It does get crowded with tour groups midday and may be better to go at the opening or later in the afternoon.
Remarkable architecture on an unbelievable scale!. Well worth a visit. The history, architecture and sheer scale of the church and palace complex with astound you.
Must see. One of the most impressive cathedrals we have been to in Europe. The history behind the building is amazing, as is the building itself.

The historic St. Vitus cathedral was awesome. I don't think in all of my travels I have ever seen such a massively carved and ornate church. It is truly the highlight of the gorgeous city of Prague perched high above the city

Beautiful. You can enter the front area of the Cathedral for free, but there is a charge to see the rest of the complex. The stained glass and intricate silver and gold work are worth a look, I was lucky to be there when a visiting choir of young people gave an impromptu concert in the vestibule.

Magnificient Cathedral. We do recommend that you take time to visit this enormous cathedral because it is a piece of art, as a construction and as a place to worship. It is situated inside the Hrad (Prague Castle). You must check every details, outside and inside The Cathedral.

Beautiful and imposing.. You needed to pay to go all around the fantastic stained glass windows, which we didn't so just craned our necks to see the lovely Mucha window. Still what we saw was beautiful.
The Architecture here is not to be missed. The Gothic arches/pillars and overall design of the cathedral impressed me. This made me feel like I was a character in the book Pillars of the Earth.
amazing. A trip to Prague is not complete without a visit to St Vitus Cathedral with its breath taking architecture and beautiful depictions of religious characters.
Gooooorgeous!. Very beautiful in there. A must! The windows and ceilings are stunning!

Amazing!. Gorgeous cathedral! A must-see in the Prague castle. Sights inside the castle include a stained glass mirror designed by Alfons Mucha, the giant silver tomb of St. John, and the chapel where Czech royalty was crowned. The architecture changes halfway through where they ran out of money and had to stop building for years. A must-see in Prague!

AWSOME!. The most beautiful cathedral you will see in Prague, it's huge and just magnificent.Seriously the vitros (stained glasses showing several saints) in there were amazing, the architecture of the building impressive, it's details imposing, Seriously words fail me. Do not miss it for any reason if you visit Prague.Their working hours are quite short but hopefully you will cope. In order to enter the whole cathedral you have to pay a ticket (125 CK for students), this includes also the palace (fail), St George's basilica (bigger fail) and the "golden walk" (quite impressive). Only one piece of advice once you have seen St Vito you will be disapointed big-time with the rest of the attractions in the casttle area.
Fantastic. A great must-see. At the top of a hill, great view and surroundings.

Vast, impressive building - repays several visits. When I first visited the Cathedral I was certainly awed by its scale and majesty, but my time was limited and I didn't really absorb much of the detail. My second visit, where I had more leisure to study its many delights, was fascinating. I wish I'd been able to return again: I know I've still missed quite a lot.Rather than attempt what would have to be a lengthy essay on St. Vitus Cathedral, I'll confine myself to praising the stunning painted windows. I know the original architectural concept was for purely plain glass, but the coloured glass ones are a great visual treat. And with strong sunlight on that day, the arabesques cast by them were sublime.
Visit in May. Absolutely loved this fantastic piece of architecture a must place to see if you are visiting Prague
Awesome Cathedral!. Very nice place to see! Much more nicer outside than inside! But it is a bit far away!
Amazing!. Beautiful place, best stained glass I've seen anywhere!
Overwhelming. A very impressive building, with beauiful works of art.
Imponent. Forget about Notre Dame in Paris! St Vitus is imponent, luxurius, and people in Czech Republic are more lovely speaking English to tourists than the grumpy french.
Fabulous. Beautiful. Definitely worth the time and ticket.Main thing worth seeing at Castle.
See the colours. The stained glass is glorious I was particularly struck by the book of remembrance for Czech airmen
Beautiful Cathedral. It is a must see and well worth the entrance fee. We spent a good time wandering around in the Cathedral
Exquisite. This cathedral is a must see. Pay for the full visit it is worth it. The pipe organs are truly amazing as are the stain glass windows and tomb displays.
Beautiful and breathtaking. This cathedral is absolutely breathtaking. Be sure to visit the cathedral before you leave Prague.

Better than expected. We have visited about a hundred cathedrals and churches. This is in the top third for beauty and ambience. It appears inactive except for tourists. Many parts done in past hundred years
Beautiful. Incredible sight. Make sure that you go up to the top of the tower to get an amazing view of Prague
Wow!. Some of the most magnificent stained glass we've seen, this is an absolute must if you don't see much else in the Castle area. Take your time, it's a memorable experience!
wow!. if you go to the castle you must visit this cathedral! there is so much history and beauty both outside and in!

Lovely stained glass windows!. Lovely windows and fabulous cathedral inside. Just such a shame outside that they have build so many buildings around it and so close, you sruggle to be able to stand back and get a view of the whole place. Still worth paying to go inside.
Amazing. Be sure to see the Alphonse Mucha stained glass window.
Rose window. Beautiful stained glass windows. Look up the history before you go. Last of 3 churches built on that spot.
Fabulous Architecture. We spent the whole day looking around the whole complex & were stunned by the cathedral. Try the view from the Bell Tower - amazing!!! Just be prepared for the number of steps
Notre Dam of Prague. Breathtaking and beautiful. A lot of tourists in the area. Difficult to get good photos of the cathedral.
Climb the Tower. The cathedral itself is beautiful, but for an unparalleled view of Prague, climb the South Tower.

Impressive cathedral...very busy. Loads of guided tours in here in the morning. Good value for money. If you are an English speaker, ask for the guide leaflet in English when you go in. We gained it from a woman working there, just by accident! Without it we would have missed St.Vitus's coffin! Although there are queue's to get in and photos can be taken with a permit, there is still plenty of space once inside though.
Imposing. Impressive.gothic period church with fine altars. Well worth the walk.
Very fancy. Fancy and interesting. XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Awesome site. Especially now that much of the reno is done. This is the most dominant site in Prague so it's absolutely something that you have to go see. Take a tour, learn the history, walk around the castle district and enjoy yourself.

Amazing!. Im not religious or into architecture but this church was amazing. The amount of time, dedication and wealth that has gone into the building itself, and all the statues etc inside is incredible. You can get into the cathedral for free but you have to pay to see about 90% of it.

Gorgeous!. Stunning! Make sure you get there nice and early in peak season as it gets very crowded! I went by myself at 9am and practically had the whole castle to myself.Come 12 there were thousands of people and it's not as enjoyable
another bog old church. another bog old church in the palace. wasn't free but I walked through not knowing that.

a great gothic building. i has a very impressive view both inside and outside of the building.we've spend 2 hours there taking photographs and 1 hour just living the atmosphere inside.first place to visit in prague.
Long walk up the tower but great views. A lovely building and if you don't mind walking up 287 steps to the top, the views from the tower are amazing with the whole city below you!
Different than other cathedrals. This is worth a short visit while touring the castle. It is huge and beautiful.
Average. Overall it appear to be an average Cathedral. There is a charge if one wants to get closer to see the altar so that's a minus.
beautiful. the architecture and stainrdc glass magnificent and im not a churchy person
Breath taking. Imposing, breath taking and so very interesting in its history. Read up BEFORE you go so that you can really appreciate what this cathedral is all about!

Has same 1st impression that Westminster Abby gave me .. Maybe not quite a large as Westminster Abby, but very impressive. It should remind everyone who visits that there is much more to the Czech Republic then the period from 1938 until 1989. What a rich history and if you take advantage of the full tour of the castle complex you will see a taste of this in the 8 or 9 exhibits and at 350czk its a great way to spend a day learning.

A very nice medieval cathedral. Its huge and very nice decorated. You have to pay to get access to full of it, but its worth the money. Take an audiotour in your idiom to know all about the statues and the history of this marvelous church.
Great View. Great stained glass. We paid the extra cost to climb to the top of the South Tower. The views of Prague were spectacular.

Prague Jun 12. now you must visit this Cathedral. Set next to the Castle, it is huge with a long stave, and stained glass windows. It was so inspiring to stand in the middle of the Cathedral and take in the history. Slightly crowded
St. Vitus. is in the process of being cleaned will take a long time to get centuries of soot off the outer walls. It will be a long process. the inside is glorious.
Really Beautiful Cathedral. Really nice cathedral, didn't pay for a tour but main entrance was worth it

Wow!. This makes the Castle district! This cathedral is truly beautiful inside and out, absolutely remarkable. The stain glass is gorgeous I found myself taking so many pictures and just staring and then when I exited, more staring.

Monument of Prague. There are few places that every turist must see in Prague. Charles bridge, Old town square and... St. Vitus cathedral.It is placed by Prague castle and opened for public without fee. But if you want to look more deep inside, for example to the Czech Kings thomb, you must pay fee.I was here many times, cause it is really good place for thinking and little meditation. Just be aware - not come with your gf. :) I was here with my ex on the New Year and there was actually celebrated New Year mass. The sound and overall atmosphere made that she say, that she want to marry here... Uh. :)
Lots of stained glass. If you like stained glass this is the place for you. Well worth a visit
Vast!!!. Can enter the rear chancel free of charge and this gives you an idea of vastness and architecture

The best place in the whole Prague.. In my opinion this cathedral is the best place in the whole castle complex. Stunning. Make sure you visit the south Tower, it is long climbing but view is amazing.

A magnificent part of Prague Castle. We used the audiotour to find our way around and bought a photo pass at the entry to the Castle. Definitely worth the cost as we spent hours exploring the Cathedral and the other parts of the Castle. We also had the long visit tickets. Take the time to listen carefully and look up. The stained glass here is very colourful and there is a lot of it. It was good to see Wenceslas' tomb and associated chapel.
Cathedral just for the Royal Family. You can tell that the Hapsbrugs had money. Here is the church inside the castle. She could use a cleaning, but the church is gorgeous.
Superb stained-glass windows. See above for what we loved about St. Vitus -- the rest of the church is rather ordinary. Check out Alfons Mucha's contribution -- in the Art Nouveau style.
Impressive. A very big cathedral with beautiful old things inside. From the cathedral you get an impressive view from the city of Prague. Nice place to relax too..have a drink and watch people..
awesome. the shear scale of the cathedral & surrounding building's is breathtaking it really is beautiful.

Awesome. This is a fantastic building with so many facades. It can be seen from all over Prague so it is good to get up close to see the magnificence of it. You need a ticket to enter and there are several choices to make. It is best to read the list carefully before you queue up to buy the ticket as it is quite confusing. It was packed and hot whle we were there so allow yourself some time plus take water- the cafes are dear.
Epic!. I am impresed. Like the style, history, architecture...
obscured by the so called castle hehe. im not at all religious but do like architecture , all u can see of this building is the front facade if you walk through the so called castle hehe .
What a huge cathedral!. The engraved main door with the story of how King Charles started to build the cathedral was mesmerising.The beautiful glass work on the front was eye catching.

Gorgeous. I'm not a big fan of paying to get into a church so I have avoided St. Vitus since we moved here. However, a couple weeks ago it was open for free and I was blown away by it. We've been to a number of cathedrals on our travels, but this one had something special going on. The Mucha stained glass was stunning - couldn't take my eyes off it. I highly recommend going and I can assure you I will be back and will gladly pay the cost of admission (just be sure to get there when it opens - before the tourists start arriving).
great architecture. what a sight, shame you have to pay extra to go up the tower.
Buy a ticket for the best bits. Get a guide book, there is so much to see. If you are lucky the crypt might be opened.
Different. The exterior of the church is quite different from other churches. Its beautiful, the church is free to visit and is lovely on the inside too with its stained glass windows.

Stunning!!!. Be prepared to be swept away by the grandeur of this magnificent cathedral! It has 22 side chapels, each has a stained glass windows with unique designs. At some point it got very busy, it was around the silver sarcophagus of St. John of Nepomuk, very beautiful! St. Welceslas chapel is at the end, by the exit, do not miss it and look inside - the walls have inlaid jewels - you cannot go inside, but can all see through the door, it is amazing! To get full access to the cathedral it required a ticket to the castle, despite my guidebook stating it was free to access. Enjoy, the cathedral became one of the highlights of our trip!
Unique stained glass windows. The stained glass windows in the newer part of the cathedral were each designed by a different artist. They are beautiful and all done in different styles.
Beautiful Site. It's truly the most beautiful cathedral I've seen, including Notre Dame in Paris.
Cathedral visit. Within the gorunds of the castle but free entry. Well worth a visit.

Ornate. This is a must visit site in Prague. It is worth paying the castle admission to get the privilege of wandering round this fantastic cathedral. The splendid stained glass windows and ornate side chapels are a must see. There is no restrictions or extra charges to take photos which is a bonus.

A very impressive cathedral, and very busy!. Important points first, you can visit this Cathedral and view it from outside for free and you can also go inside and see the inside for free from the main door, but you can't get very far before you need to have a ticket to look round properly.We visited at about 10.30 in the morning and this seemed to be a peak time for tour groups, so it was very busy, I assume that it got less busy as the day progressed.The stained glass windows were very colourful (especially with the sun behind them).

Gorgeous. This cathedral is a great gem. Wonderful stained glass, fantastic carvings, and fascinating history. Its a must see if you are in Prague. It does get very crowded so try not to go on a weekend.

Overwhelming. This was truly one of the outstanding parts of our visit to Prague. The Cathedral is at the heart of the government centre of Prague, and we visited it twice in three days. It also marks a main element of the city landscape

Amazing!. Well worth going up to the castle just to see the Cathedral.Beautiful stained glass & painted windows. So much to see and quite an amazing scale. Had quite a stiff neck from looking up so much trying to take everything in.

Impressive. Well worth a visit even after climbing the seemingly endless stairs that lead up to the castle area. Go early to avoid the crowds as the queue to get into the cathedral gets very long. Don't forget to get an admission ticket from the ticket office at the free entry only cover a small area at the west end. Cafe facilities are limited to again get there early.

Huge exterior, vast nave, beautiful stained glass. Nothing prepares you for the vastness of this cathedral- the soaring facades, exquisite stained glass. Allow time to see side chapels, choir, crypt, and Great Tower.
See the Mucha glass. See my review of the Castle district for a more complete rundown of the Palace. Don't miss the stained glass window by Alfons Mucha.

Absolutly Beautiful Cathedral. Don't miss the Alfose Mucha stained glass window.Alfons Mucha was a Czech Art Nouveau painter. He created this beauty that depicts the the lives Sts. Cyril and Methodius . Events from their lifes are arranged along the edges of the window so take some binoculars soyou can to see the individual peices. I don't know if they would help I didn't have any.Even if you can't make out every, the window is very beautiful. There are many, many things to see in one cathedral but well worth the time. I had to select july 2011, but I was there in October of 2010.
Lovely. A beautiful building and a geat pity oune is not akllowed to sit in a pew to say a prayer

A Gothic cathedral in the heart of castle country. The cathedral is a majestic example of the Gothic style, and is a magnificent structure. I understand that Czech kings were coronated there. Admission to the castle includes admission to the cathedral.
Great activity. It is a gorgous church and they let you take pics/videos legally. If in Prague it is worth a couple of hours. Lots to see on the tour.

pretensious, moi?. Ostentatious is the most restrained word to use about this massive cathedral that makes Paris' Notre Dame look like a dowdy parish church. Built on Romanesque foundations, it is St Vitus' Renaissance features that speak loudest about it. It looks truly impressive from a distance; up close it's dominating
one of the most impressive chuches in Eurpoe. A myust see! Part of the Castle complex. Take your time and enjoy the beauty.
Stunningly beautiful. One of the most beautiful places to visit in Prague. The Vitus Cathedral is the most imposing building and absolutely stunning.
Magnificent cathedral. Very pretty from the exterior. If you want to go inside, get there early and get in line. Very crowded
Amazing architecture. The Prague Castle is amazing and well worth visiting. During our stay, we walked up there three times.
Beautiful. Get a guide book to take with you ....there is so much history
Breath taking. A must see in Prague. This Cathedral is one of the best I've ever seen! Can't put into words - go visit.
Splendid OTT Cathedral. Stunning stained glass window by Edvard Mucha. Loved the entire OTT effect of all the rich trimmings. Hate paying for entry to a church in order to finance it.
Alphonse Mucha Stained Glass. This is, by far, the best stained glass church window I've ever seen. Truly an amazing accomplishment from the father of art nouveau.
Lovely old church. Well worth visiting. The interior is spectacular and the building itself is worth a few photos.
Stunning. If you're there you should go in, it really is spectacular.

The most beautiful site to see in Prague. I was surprised by the beauty of this Gothic cathedral. I walked around the building for more than an hour and I was impressed by its size and the stained glass windows. It was not really crowded in there, which made the experience extra special.
Vitus. Located inside of the Prague Castle complex, it's a part of the overall Castle experience. Lots to see inside, stained-glass, catacombs, towers, tombs, art, sculptures etc.

Just Beautiful!. Absolutely beautiful example of Gothic architecture. The stained glass windows were the most beautiful I have ever seen. Pay to walk to the top of the South tower. The views are breathtaking.

Cathedral on the hill. Spectacular on the outside and just as good inside too. We spent sometime within the building and were impressed by its size. Try to go outside normal tourist times as it gets very busy with organised tours.

Grand and beautiful. Very impressive cathedral, especially so the stained glass windows. It was quite crowded, and there's a set route to take through it, so there was always the pressure to move on. Beautiful, although if you've seen a few catholic cathedrals, there won't really be anything new here.

Beautiful Stain Glass. We've been here twice. The first time we walked up, this time we took the tram. If you have time, walk up. The views are spectaculary. The inside of the cathedral can be seen without buying a ticket. A ticket will allow you to see more but no sure if it is worth it.

Breathtaking stained glass windows in an enormous basilica. While there were lots of people, the crowds were able to move along fairly well taking in the glory and history, of the many works of powerful Christian art throughout the spacious cathedral.
spectacular. Highly recommended get in early before the long lines begin
A Must-see of Prague. St. Vitus Cathedral is without a doubt the best part of the Prague Castle tour and has the most beautiful stained glass windows you'll ever see.
impressive. definite must see! the most impressive thing in the prague castle complex!
Nice Cathedral. Too crowded during the late morning early afternoon. Go around 4pm to get the most of it once the crowds have gone
Breathtaking. Hard to describe just how stunning this is, don't miss it!

A cathedral that took 5 centuries to build. The approaches to St Vitus Cathedral from up the hill downward are spectacular, including two soldiers on guard duty, wearing RayBans. Once through the various walkways it is a surprise when one opens up to reveal the Cathedral. It is as impressive as most cathedrals are, but as we were there on a very sunny day, we were amazed by the colours which suffused through the rose window as were as all the other stained glass. People standing side by side would have one of them appear green, while the other was blue or red! The pulpit was my personal favourite as it was both beautiful and large.Externally the cathedral is a strange eclectic mix of styles, presumably because it took so long to build. Only the upper structure jarred with us as it looked out of place. In addition it is an acquired taste to enjoy people in 20th Century clothes pertrayed in the external statuary. Finally the surroundings of the cathedral are super, as it is set in a large square with lots of room for everyone.

Situated within the Praque Castle complex. Architectural masterpiece.. The huge Praque castle complex includes many fine buildings. St. Vitus is most maginficant building and dominates the city's skyline. It is excellent example of Gothic architecture. The most outstanding place in the Cathedral is the Chapel of St. Wenceslas which is decorated with frescoes and semi-precious stones. The western part of the Cathedral is charaterized by two tall towers and the rose window. Interior of the Cathderal features with a lot of beautiful and rich decoration and statues and stained glasses

Breathtaking. Amazing stained glass, be sure to take extra time to look over St. Wenceslas ' Chapel. The exterior ironwork is incredible, look for the representations of the seasons and astrological signs. Well worth the trip up the hill. The full ticket does NOT include going up into the Cathedral tower, purchase a separate ticket when you but the Cathedral/Museum/Castle/Gold Row pass.

So Old and So Ornate. This is probably the most ornate building I have ever seen! It is from the 900s - and just to think about how old this building is makes it even more fascinating. In the United States, no one ever thinks about the year 900. The building is spectacular and gorgeous, so amazing to behold! I only wish I had a wide-angle camera lens to capture one picture of the entire thing. A really great, beautiful square/area to walk around too. Definitely a must-see!

Beautiful Gothic cathedral. We bought a combined ticket so we were able to see the entire church. The tour came with an audio guide which was excellent. The cathedral was very crowded the morning we were there but we noticed that there were much smaller crowds in the afternoon.
beautiful. so much history and beauty - the cathedral was breathtaking
do not miss this. best thing about the castle was this cathedral absolutely stunning stained glass windows mesmorising
Beautiful. It is a very large church with plenty of art and tombs.

Stunning architecture, lots of crowds!. While the architecture was absolutely beautiful, the amount of tour groups we encountered was somewhat overwhelming. Its to be expected for such a grand structure, so if you go (and you're not in one of the tour groups), be prepared to get swept up in a wave of people!!!
nigel006. Well worth the walk. A charming area with musicians and crowds. Watch out for the Segways!

Most beautiful cathedral. This is the loveliest cathedral I've ever seen and I've been to a lot. Best part is they let you take photographs and video inside. It really is spectacular and even if churches aren't your thing this place is well worth a look!

In to 5 most beautiful cathedrals in the world. If you could see only one place in Prague St. Vitus Cathedral is the one.It can be accessed for free but only a small part, enough to take some half decent pictures though but it IS worth paying a small fee. We bought a ticket to Prague Castle - short visit -enabling us to see St. Vitus Cathedral, Old Royal Palace, St. George's Basilica, Golden Lane with Daliborka Tower for CZK 250 which is roughly £8, $12, €10.The stained glass by Alphonse Mucha took my breath away. This Catholic Cathedral was build throughout the centuries so it's got Renaissance Baroque influences but its architecture is Gothic. There are tombs of many Bohemian kings and Holy Roman Emperors there.The Cathedral is always crowded to the point it's nearly unbearable to enjoy it. What annoyed us the most was the fact tourists forget this is a religious site, a place to worship & many of them were disrespectful.Best time to visit - in the morning or afternoon. It's open 9.00-18.00 Mon-Sat and 12.00-17.00 on Sun
Unbelievable. Gorgeous incredible breathtaking!! We were taken aback by the beauty of this Church. Well worth a visit.
Gorgeous outside and in. St Vitus is monumental with amazing detail both on the outside and inside

Spectacular, and a Mucha window, too!. I love Art Nouveau, so visiting this cathedral was at the top of my list. The window designed my Alphons Mucha is beautiful and the rest of the cathedral was worth the admission fee.

Very crowded. A must in Prague, for sure. And therefore it is very crowded and restless. Stained glasses in cathedral are beautiful, especially Mucha´s (something out of the ordinary). Important to know! Without a valid ticket you can enter the cathedral but that´s just about it. To see more you need to buy a ticket e.g. from the information office opposite the cathedral entrance. The prices seem to be high (CZK 250-350), but please note, that the price includes several attractions. So if you are in need of peace and quiet, avoid St. Vitus. If so, there are many wonderful churches in Prague. I recommend e.g. St. Jacob (or. St. Nicholas at Mala Strana). Opening hours can though be demanding.
as usual. this cathedral not too amazing better than montserrat in barcelona or other city but you should see this in prague

Wonderful stained glass and much to admire. We bought tickets for the cathedral, Golden Lane, main hall etc and the cathedral was the highlight. The stained glass is wonderful, in particular the Art Nouveau window by Mucha which I had to keep going back to. Lots to see.

Breathtaking. The most impressive building in Prague. Most of it can be visited for free, but it's worth the money to see it all. It's absolutely gorgeous on both the inside and the outside. The architectural details are breathtaking.
Great. Huge impressive church. The Mucha stained glass was really neat. Worth a visit.
Amazing gothic styling. It was great, not having to pay to see inside. Some of it was roped off for paying visitors. But for free, you could see most everything.
Magnifiscent cathedral. Lovely cathedral which you can view for free from the back of the nave, but if you want to go further in you have to buy a ticket.
Really interesting. Not religious but the art work was gorgeous - climbed to the top of the tower - nearly 300 steps but the view was worth it

Great!. We did not go inside the Cathedral because the weather outside was awesome and we did not want to miss the sun... But from outside it is a great cathedral! It is huge and beautifully decorated! The architecture is impressive!

Don't Go Too Early. The cathedral is beautiful both inside and out. The sculptures and tombs were incredible to look at, but go later in the day. The crowds of tour groups make it an annoyance to try and get through, which detracts from the overall experience.
Amazing architecture. We saw the cathedral as part of a tour. However, it costs extra to get up close inside the cathedral. It is an amazing structure. FYI, bring change to use the restrooms!
Choir trip. Sunday morning listening to my sons school choir sing here in this spectacular cathedral; amazing!
Beautiful church. Although it is a very beautiful cathedral, i guess it could be a little better maintenance.
This place is a wonder. Best part of the castle area is this beautiful cathedral. Check the hours and get there early to avoid the masses of guided tour groups.
Immense. Striking and immense Gothic Cathedral in the middle of the largest castle complex in the world
Majestic. What can you say about this majestic cathedral. It is hard to believe the detail that went into it's construction.

Visual treats, inside and out. The gothic exterior of the church is iconic, with gargoyle spouts and flying buttresses. The interior features breathtaking stained glass panels, one by Mucha. Tip: There is no admission fee for the cathedral, only for the (non-required) tour.
Fantastic!. Try to get inside after 5 p.m. and you will have an opportunity to see it without crowds of people!
