Cathederal. The stained glass is absolutely wonderful and the cathederal is very impressive. However you can only access a small section for free (although my guide books said that there was no entrance charge)

Prague Castle Tour. I toured Prague Castle (I bought the speed tour and did this on my own). Following the little guidebook I received I toured St. Vitus Cathedral along with the Old Palace and St. George's Basilica. I had a marvelous time here.

very crowded. it's a monumental cathedral, very nice, but nothing more than that. you will find enormous tourist crowds here if the weather is good. worth a visit only if you like historic religious places
Too many wows!!. One of the best sites in Prague!! Soooo beautiful and soooo artistically rich and...no words can describe, we felt like we're in a Lord of the Rings palace set. Absolutely amazing!!
Huge. Very beautiful church. Has a tower that is like 287 steps up to the top but worth the climb for scenic views.
Worth the climb. ...if you are fit otherwise take the #22 tram and ruin your knees walking down! An Amazing example of gothic cathedral with exceptional art
best. you really feel god there its sometn you not miss weiu from tower is unforfogatable
Fantastic views of the city and surrounding areas.. It's a long way up (287 steps) but well worth the effort. The views are spectacular.
catherdral. lots of walking but great views when you get there
Impressive. Us together with lots of visitors enjoyed the magnificent Cathedral. A must for every visitor
A must see!. Very ornate inside and out. How amazing, how could they build this so long ago. Truly inspiring.
OMG. How much Silver does it take to make a proper tomb?? The crypt for King Wenceslas is right up there with anything you have seen!!!

BEAUTIFUL!. I've been to many cathedrals in Europe and this ranks at top of my list which includes Notre Dame and St. Peter's. The stained glass windows are inspiring! Be sure to pay to take the tour...worth it!

What a cathedral!. This large gothic styled structure is a must see up close. From its beautiful gargoyles to its rose window.
The queues were too long so I didn't go inside. Something I regret.
Make sure u walk all around it to appreciate its beauty.
Breathtaking.. After visiting this cathedral, I dare you to say..."Another cathedral..." This one is incedible, and the history behind it is even more incredible.
Great place on the hill. You pay to go in but well worth the experience, even if the poor old saint was boiled in oil
Amazing Cathedral. Can't believe this place was built before computers, slide rules, cranes, electricity and power tools.....
A must see!. There are lots of churches in Prag, but St. Vituc Cathedral is the most impressive one. Located on the top of a hill, is a sanctuary worth "climbing" to see!
part of Prague Castle. Every church/cathedral is different in its way. This one has a tomb of St John Nepomuk with silver accoutrements, and the St Wenceslas Chapel is very impressive.

Huge!. This is by far the biggest cathedral I've ever visited. My tip for the readers is to buy the ticket which allows you to see the whole cathedral since you don't see much standing by the entrance inside.
Do the Dance. Saw this as part of a tour would need a re-visit to see all
Stunning.... You stand in awe - an ancient building...sometimes you have to queue to get in, but usually it moves quickly
Nice but too crowded. A must stop in Prague but it is a tourst trap and paying for WC is very annoying.
gothic church. when Im there I feel like in movie, magic statues on the facade, vitrages, the royal tombs

Free entrance to part of the Cathedral and well worth a visit. We went as part of a tour and spent a few minutes in the main entrance of this beautiful cathedral. Whilst not enough to properly explore it gave us the taster we required.

It's Big!. You will be impressed with size and breadth of St. Vitus. Ornately adorned with different gargoyles/griffins, the architectural designs are amazing. Inside the cathedral, the gothic structures will take your breath away!Before going, make sure the cathedral is open (it was closed on Monday when we went) and don't plan on getting much time to walk around inside just before closing. We arrived at 4pm (closed at 5pm) and we were hoarded through at a brisk pace.Nighttime views of St Vitus is absolute amazing both up close and from Karluv Most.Worth your time for sure!!
Cathedral. Huge edifice with a stunning interior and beautiful stained glass windows. Well worth a vist.
Serenity. It is spectacular. The architecture and the feeling of eternity is present everywhere.
Prague castle=stunning. very impressive when you enter the castle area. Inside it's even more beautiful. So much history here.

Truly incredible. Beautiful, historic cathedral in the heart of the Prague Castle complex. The main style is Gothic with richly decorated sidevaltars. You can visit just the back of the church for free, but must get a ticket to see the whole thing (well worth it). The chapels behind the main altar house the bodies of many early Czech kings and there are beautiful stained glass windows. Some are old, some arevrelatively modern - including one by Mucha. I've visited major cathedrals in Paris, London and Rome and have to say that I was blown away by St Vitus. It's uniquely Czech and something you should see when in Prague. My advice would be to visit after lunch as it's truly awful in the AM with hundreds of people from tour groups clogging the place up.
A must of the Prague visit. Important part of the Prague Castle complex, definitively worth of visit. Maybe a longer que to get there.

St. Vitus Cathedral. A must for every visitor to Prague. Walk slowly and take a good look at the beautiful stained glass windows, admire the grand architecture of the outside and do climb the tower for the magnificent view over Prague.

Stunning. Located by Prague Castle this cathedral was almost as impressive as the one in Barcelona . The inside was spectacular with the most beautiful stained glass windows and just a pleasure to behold
Cathedral. It was truly the most beautiful Cathedral I have ever seen!

Breathtaking. Breathtaking for it's splendor, breathtaking for it's views over the city rooftops but also breathtaking for it's punishing climb to the top of the hill overlooking the city where St.Vitus Cathedral sits.Don't let this put you off however. Once you are up there you are treated to not only some amazing views of the city but also the cathedral itself and the close by Presidential Palace.

Outstanding. A cathedral on the biggest castle at the world, could you imagine that, the XIV century? The interior is breathtaking, with ancient vitraux that gave a special illumination to the place. The access is free.

Stained glass wonders. The cathedral was finished only a century ago but it was finished in such perfect Gothic style that the 'join' with the original section (including the Wenceslas chapel) does not show. This is a Gothic wonder, visually. Vast, soaring and worth the visit for the stained glass windows alone. Works of art and, with the sun out, they bathe the interior in colour.

The Gothic cathedral with beautiful stained windows.. The St. Vitus Cathedral is one of the highlights of the city. You find it withing the boundaries of the Prague Castle. You can enter the first part of it of free, but, if you wish to visit it all, you've to buy a ticket inclusive of other attraction in the Castle. I suggest to visit this place in a sunny day as in this way you see the colored windows at their best.
Interesting. interesting place, can see on foot wont take long. Intersting barogue look
Best Part of the Castle Complex. Thought this was the best part of the castle complex. Gorgeous interiors. The stained glass was especially lovely in the sunlight.
St Vitus Cathedral. Very impressive high vaulted roof. Amazing artifacts around the cathedral which is located within Prague Castle

Magnificent!!. This building takes your breath away from the outside, the huge windows and gothic like structure is amazing. Once inside it is even more breathtaking. From the number of tombs around the cathedral up to the gigantic ceiling is all breathtaking. There are guided tours within the cathedral, but we didn't use these and got as much information from the guidebook we had with us.

Nothing Special.... We didn't find anything special about this place. (Par for the course for everything in Prague) The outside was extremely dirty and the inside was sparse. Doesn't hold a candle to churches in Italy.
beautiful. Gothic styled church, gorgeous achronological windows beautiful courtyard. Crowded go when it opens.
Worth a visit. In need of major repairs before time takes it toll, St Vitus has all the atmosphere and grandeur of a true gothic cathedral.Crowds are a problem however.

Spectacular !. Definitely the highlight of many highlights in Prague. Stunning externally and internally, the only shame being it's a bit crowded in by other buildings in the castle complex. The stained glass windows were a truly dazzling assault of colour/light and design.
Best part of Prague Castle. Worth a visit simply for the Mucha "stained glass"
Even an evangelical atheist found it jaw dropping. Sense of space, light, colour from stain glass windows, and the motivation that built it.

This gothic church located in the Castle area of Prague was abosolutely spectacular. A must see if you have limited time. It arches and stained glass windows were beautiful. Nicer than then St. Stephens church in Vienna.
Interesting cathedral. We did not opt to pay for the pass. The cathedral was still nice to look at, Im sure it would have been full of interesting facts and history if we payed for the pass.
Dull. Good views but very dull to walk around - most rooms empty

What a church!. Amazing exterior, the detail was outstanding. I could have stood and looked at it all day. With the crowds (even in winter) is does hinder photo taking. View of the river and city is beautiful.
Beautiful Church in Prague. Standing outside the church especially in the afternoon, you will get the best beautiful view of the church

Beautiful, consider attending mass if you can. We attended Easter Mass and were moved by the sheer beauty of it all. We read the guide books before going in so we had a sense of what we were seeing, ou can enter the back portion of the Church without tickets.

Fantastic even if you are not religious. My wife and I are not religious but had to go in to the impressive cathedral when we saw the outside. Entry is free but if you buy a ticket you can go further inside. Spectacular architecture.

Rude rude ticket guy, beautiful windows. You can see the windows with a free entrance; costs more to go in to the church further. Ticket seller made anti-Semitic comment to my husband and did not tell us the truth about free entry.

A beautiful gothic cathedral. First of all, it was free to get in and you were allowed to take photographs. That said, it did cost extra if you wanted to venture to see the tombs of the kings and other famous people or to get closer to the high altar. Inside it is huge and the stained glass windows are some of the most intricate I have ever seen. The atmosphere didn't seem particularly reverent but you cannot take away the beauty of the place.

Stain glass windows. Best thing about the palace and a bit of a con that you have to pay for the short visit which led you to see 4 things when this was the only thing worth seeing. Climb up from the bridge good for the legs though and view at the top was great!

More grand on the outside than inside I'm afraid. This cathedral inside the Prague castle area is just beautiful on the outside - stunning stained glass windows, mosaics, sculptures, lovely. It's really grand and took years to build. You are allowed just inside the door for free, if you want to see more you must buy a ticket. In the castle area, you can buy either a long stay or short stay ticket. You need some kind of ticket to walk around to examine the windows, altar of ornate silver and gold statues. You can also see the point where St Wenceslas died. The exterior of this cathedral also looks beautiful at night.

Amazing!. It was well worth the long trek up the hill to visit the cathedral which stands within the walls of the castle. It is free to walk into the front of the building, but if you want to walk all around it you have to pay.

An excellent outing. This day comes with everything: the whole Prague Castle area is splendid, but St. Vitus is charming. The stained glass, the stations of the cross, the altar and the history are beautifully preserved.

Landmark of Prague. This Gothic Church has a long history. Building starts 1344 and ended 1872. Work on the strukture began by builders Matthew of Arras and Peter Parler. The Cathedral however has the older roots. It was builded around the Rorunda church of St.Vitus from the 900.century. There are plenty of details in the church, you can review. The interior is adorened with Baroque statues of saints, the stained-glass windows. The most impressive statue is the silver tomb monument of the saint John Nepomuk. The statue was the gift of Maria Teresia. There is also very interesting wooden relief in the church. It is a picture of Charles Bridge without the statues, which are there today.

Go in but no need to pay. It is worth going in and having a look but we didn't pay the entrance fee to walk all around. You can see plenty from the area where you are allowed, then if you decide that you want to see more, pay the fee. It is a lovely Cathedral but I've seen bigger and better.

Beautiful Cathedral!. One of my favorite things in Prague (other than the delicious food). This catheral is pretty inside and out. I'm not a huge fan of stained glass, but wow! The detail is just impressive. I've been to many cathedrals all over the world and I would have to say this one is in the top 5. A bit of advice... Get the short stay pass when you visit the castle area. You get to see the high points and move on to other things. In my opinion, the long stay is just a bit too long and not worth it.
excellent. I went to tower view, if you can step by ur self, pls go there, my 3 years old son step by himselp, but once he been there, he love the 360C view, it is breath takeing

HOW LONG DID IT TAKE TO BUILD THIS?. We went on the Ultimate Tour of Prague (praguer.com), and had an excellent guide, who told us all the history of the cathedral both inside and outside. We did not buy an all in ticket for the castle and grounds, but could adequately see the marvellous stain glass windows and appreciate all there was to see. Best time to go is when it is nearly closing as it does get very crowded.
reminicent of notre dome. Must have taken hundreds of photos inside and out, loved it.
Stunning. Definitely one of the most beautiful churches... blows all the big ones out of the water... Notre Dame is NOTHING in comparison. Both inside and out.
Magnificent building. We went to see the St Vitus Cathedral and paid to go up the South Tower, from the top, the view is amazing and you can see for miles around.

Amazing stainglass windows. Lovely old cathedral in the heart of the castle. Stainglass windows were very impressive and the statues and other architectural features quite charming. Well worth doing a short or long tour of the entire castle complex depending on your time.

Beautiful Cathedral of Saint Vitus. Did you know, that the real name of the church commonly known as St. Vitus' Cathedral is St. Vitus', Wenceslaw's and Adalbert's Cathedral? Until 1997 the Cathedral was consecrated only to St. Vitus and that is why it is commonly known only as Church or Cathedral of St. Vitus. Only the certificat from Cardinal Vlk in April 1997 consecrated the cathedral to St. Wenceslav and St. Adalbert. In 1344, Charles IV commenced the construction of the Gothic cathedral. The first master who headed the building, Matthias of Arras, mediated through his work in Prague a pattern of French cathedral architecture. But it was only Matthias's successor, the genius Peter Parler, who contributed to the Prague Cathedral and its sculptural decoration features of artistic excellence. Overall, the chorus was built with a ring of chapels, St. Wenceslas Chapel, Golden Gate and the lower part of the main tower.
Absolutely stunning. Beautiful, colourful stained glass windows and although full of tourists there was a peacefulness about it.
it was shut!. cathedral was shut and it's a very long walk with lots of steps!
st.vitus cathedral. stunning church from the outside, but only open to visitors at certain times, looks great lit up at night

Stunning. Great piece of architecture, well worth a visit. When we went there was a lovely easter market around the base of the cathedral which added a lovely atmosphere. Really close to the main city centre so not too far to walk.

I think I've seen too many cathedrals.... This cathedral is very nice and it was worth the visit. Especially one of the stain glass windows and some of the decorations behind the alter area caught my attention. However, it was very crowded and not pleasant inside, probably because I went on a rainy day and everyone else had the same idea, and came in with soaking wet ponchos on etc. Also maybe I've just seen too many cathedrals because this one didn't jump way out at me. But I'll give it 4/5 instead of 3/5 because I think the rainy day was an unfair and unusual situation.
Crowded church. Popular tourist sight. Additional charge to enter the Cathedral cuts down on the crowds inside of the Cathedral.
Excellent break. Massive. Fabulous stained glass. Ceilings and upper architecture stunning. Couldn't see much else because of tourists.

To Me, St. Vitus Cathedral IS Prague Castle!. According to our guide, St. Vitus Cathedral is the largest and most important church in Prague dominating the skyline. Here many Czech Kings and Queens were coronated and so in the chancel of the cathedral, in front of the main alter, is the royal mausoleum. Below, in the crypt, are the royal tombs where many Czech kings and queens and patron saints are interred. It is said that St. Victus' heart is interred in a crypt in the cathedral also. The art work is amazing, along with the architectural features of the cathedral.St. Wenceslas Chapel is decorated with frescoes and semi-precious stones. A door in the south-western corner of the chapel leads to the Crown Chamber in which the Bohemian Coronation Jewels are stored. It is said that there are seven people who hold the key and all need to be present in order to open the vault holding the royal jewels! Needless to say, the public is held behind a viewing rope least someone be tempted to take home a souvenir stone...

I need more film, now!. When you arrive at the grounds and start walking toward St. Vitus Cathedral you think "meh, another old church" and then you come around the corner through a low ceilinged archway of sorts and you are face to face with an incredible sight. There are no words to describe the craftsman ship and detail that went in to creating something this incredilbe and that's just the front doors! The stained glass, the flying buttresses, the crypt, the bell tower, the marble carvings...there are no more words. Just go see it!
Stunning cathedral. Stunning stain glass windows and interesting carvings

Worth the walk uphill. St. Vitus is a beautiful cathedral with many beautiful (and quite different) stained glass windows. Try to visit on a sunny day to see the reflections on the columns. Outside - don't forget to look up and see the gargoyles.
Gorgeous. Very pretty, nice walk up, prices were very fair. Plus they had student discounts

Awe inspiring. You really have to go inside of this cathedral and then look up at the stained glass windows to really understand how much detail and effort must of went into building this.
It really is a beautiful building in lovely surroundings overlooking Prague within the Castle walls and a must see to anyone visiting the area.

Stunning!!! Breathtaking!!!. A " must see" when in Prague- beautiful building both inside and out. Stained glassed windows were awsome and the gargoyles surround each side of the building. Fantastic for those memory snaps.
Beautiful!. Amazing Cathedral and I like it better than Notre Dame in Paris. It, too, is very crowded but the highlight of the city!!!

Breathtaking!!!. Hands down one of the most stunning cathedrals I have been to, in 35 countries! I am a sucker for gargoyles, and there are some spectacular ones on the old exterior! DEFINATELY climb to the top for an absolutely stunning view of Prague!!! ( nearly 300 steps, but worth it!!)
stunning. well worth a visit to see an absolutely stunning building.
Excellent. Very impressive cathedral! Beautiful view, amazing stained glass windows.
A must when in Prague. The cathedral is part of the castle complex, and as such is a must for any visitor to Prague. The cathedral is beautiful.
Spectacular beauty. I´m the inhabitant of Prague, but this masterpeace of gothic architecture never stops me surprise.

A Great Surprise!. This was an absolutely fantastic and drastic church - second best in Europe after Notre Dame in Paris. A must see. We took the guided English tour, and it was just OK. Our guidebook was equally as good. We paid the extra money to go up to the bell tower, and that was well worth it. The view is stunning.
beautiful. we were told these places get very buisy and pick pockets are at large but the cathedral and areas are lovely
fantastic architecture.. when you walk through the arch, and the Cathedral is in front of you, especially at night, with the lights, it takes your breath away!
A thing of beauty. The cathedral is amazing and you ate allowed to take photos. The Golden Mile is not worth the time.
Cold. Beautiful architecture, service going on so could hear the beautiful organ, but colder inside than out
Breathtaking.. What more can anyone say, this is a stunning cathedral which matches any in Europe, its a must a must see.

Breathtaking architecture. Visited St. Vitus as part of a day trip to Prague castle . The building itself is magnificent. There is a small charge if you wish to take pictures, it is well worth the investment. Plan on at least an hour to an hour and a half to explore all of the side altars, niches and tombs. Going when we did, in November, was a good choice. No crowds. Could spend as much time as we wanted. Of special interest are the many tombs of clerics and Czech dignitaries scattered throughout the cathedral. Would definitely visit this site again.
Beautiful stainedglass windows. The decoration in this cathedral could rival anything elsewhere in Europe or the world. Stunningly placed to look down over the historic city of Prague
The Gem of Prague castle. Stunning inside and out. Amazing architecture and stained glass windows. So much history. Must be experienced to be appreciated.

One of the best gothic cathedrale in Europe. The biggest cathedrale in Prague is located in the middle of the Prague Castle with its spires visible miles away. Visit of the cathedrale body provides you probably even more impressive feeling of majesty structure founded in 14th century.

One of the all time best churches in Europe.. I loved visiting St Vitus. It is one of my favorite places in all of Europe. Perhaps only the cathedral in Cologne or Florence are more impressive than this one. There are also simply stunning views of Prague from many vantage points here.

Astonishing. IT is not as impressive inside as it is outside... Especially when you see it after few small and low inside yards of Prague grad and then you see it's huge dark gothique portals! - amazing!

dominates Prague Castle. Unusually located in the middle of Prague Castle, St. Vitus is its dominant feature. Nowadays, it is free to enter but you would need to pay to enter the crypt. Inside you will find the tombs of numerous Bohemian kings and saints. Among them: St. John of Nepomuk (very ornate tomb), St. Wenceslas (very beautiful chapel containing his relics), Charles IV (simple tomb in the crypt). You can climb the tower for an outstanding view of the castle complex and the city.

The windows!. The windows in St. Vitus Cathedral are simply spectacular. Created over time by a number of Prague artists, the most famous is probably the Mucha window, but my favorites were those immediately to the right of the Mucha- just amazing use of color and made with tiny, mosaic-like pieces. I wish I knew the name of the artist who created them. The cathedral itself is very impressive. It's certainly worth the admission price to be able to wander around inside this gothic gem!
Amazing!. Like all the cathedrals here, this cannot be missed!

Magnificent building, nice to walk around. We had a nice time visiting the Cathedral. We did not have time to look around too much so did not pay for extra access, but the free access lets you see a lot. The paid access did not look too pricey
St Vitus Cathedral. Unmissable stained glass windows! Disappointing that their are some walkway areas not available for the tourist.
Stepping back in time. What a wonderful place but do hire the audio set as not knowing what anything is can be a bind.

So very cold!. A friend and I visited Prague in February and it was strangely warm outside. The odd part was that it was noticably much colder inside the cathedral than out - so bring layers! We paid the admission fee to see the whole thing although you can go in for free and just stand in the back. We did the short visit ticket for 250 krona.

A typical Gothic Cathedral!. Even from the front facade, it typically exhibited the Gothic architecture. The front is very much different from the sides and back, displaying somewhat similarities to the Notre Dame in Paris.We were there on the cold(est) February. A ticket is required if you want to check out the entire of the church which consist of the royal tombs. However, entrance is free in the first part of the cathedral. Bear in mind, it is very cold during winter eventhough we were inside the cathedral , we could felt the chilling cold. Note: Male tourists who wish to visit the whole cathedral are required to remove their caps, beanies or hats as a respect to the cathedral. The stained glass are beautiful as in most of the cathedrals around Europe.

technicolored stained glass. this is a whos who of famous Czechs, and some of the most commanding stained glass you will ever see. It is up in the castle quarter and can get busy. Free admission, but get there early to avoid the queues.
Stunning. WOW! what a place, the windows are superb, the history behind it amazing

An experience!. Costs to get in but once you see the stained glass windows you'll be blown away. Downside - it is FREEZING in february!!! Great little coffee shop other end of cathedral serving hot toddies helped to defrost the hands and feet!

Very pretty. Lovely place. On top of a hill so unsuitable for disable people I struggled. You don't realise its going to be there as its hidden by the place walls. The detail on it is amazing and inside its very pretty. The only issue is you can't see it all unless you pay and we didn't think it was worth it. It snowed as we got there too so it looked pretty
Gothic/Majestic. Fabulous building, very decorative inside and out.

Priceless. The architecture, stained glass windows and shear exuberance inside the cathedral is a real must to visit, it will take your breath away. Dress up warm in the colder months though as it is colder inside the building then outside.
wow. this will leave you speechless,as you arch your neck to take in the wonders of this building.Give yourself plenty of time to take it all in,its worth it.
st vitus is lovely but very crowded. we only wanted to visit the Cathedral but had to buy a complete ticket for 4 places of interest,which was expensive

Big and good looking cathedral. We went to the Prague Castle on sunday morning. You can buy a ticket and see many sites like this cathedral. The cathedral opens at 12.00 because it is a sunday for prayers. It is a big cathedral, the outside looks very good and clean. As well as the inside. The windows have nice colours. I believe that this is also on of the highlights you must have seen in Prague.

Wow, what a place. Really worth a visit on your trip to Prague. Absolutely breath-taking Cathedral (and I've seen a few) with the most amazing stained glass windows ever. Freezing cold in February though but that did not spoil the visit (too much!)

I love the stained glass windows. You can't miss this cathedral when you enter the Prague Castle complex from the rear entrance. And when in front of it, it seems to reach up the sky. Inside, there's an area near the entrance where most people congregate and admire the stained glass windows. We were lucky that it was a beautiful but freezing day when we went, so the cathedral was illuminated.
superb architecture. It was fascinating, interesting and beautiful. The historical past is fascinating and the architecture and paintings, windows were beautiful.

Brrrr .... ... this has to be the coldest church on the planet. But WHAT an impression. From far off it draws your eye irresistibly; the ultimate Gothic complexity. Up close you cannot stop examining its intricacies, every facet representing a different period in history. ... the huge mosaic; the statue without a spear; the saint with 5 stars in his halo ... what secret confession did he refuse to reveal? And inside it fills you with a sense of grandeur.
Church visit. Every photo had this beautiful structure....and was so amazed atthe construction and depth that went into this building.
Beautiful. This building was truely beautiful, we wanted to do the tour if we had time but it is still worth going to look at!

An Outstanding Example of Gothic Architecture. This magnificent cathedral is an absolute must to visit. The building was started in 1344 but it was completed by 19th & 20th century architects. It is a splendid hotch potch of styles & n particular has some fine examples of Gothic vaulting.
Amazing. This is a must for anyone visiting Prague. Just amazing. It will take your breath away.
So So Cold. Disappointing after visits to our own Cathederals at Winchester, Ely, Canterbury etc

This beautiful gothic cathedral seems the perfect home for Dracula!. St Vitus Cathedral is an awesome church that seems a castle itself. From outside you can spend time enjoying the amazing details of its gothic architecture, you can climb the 287 stairs of the tower and see the beautiful city of Prague and from inside the colorful mosaic glasses.UNIQUE place!
Take the time. Spend whole day looking round all the facilities/sights (get all encompassing tcket for everything)

Attended Wedding of Friends. Seeing our friends wed rates five stars alone, but the inside is beautiful. Some of the best stained glass and mosaics we have ever seen. High marks to the rector for closing the cathedral for the wedding
Breathtaking. An amazing Cathedral, very ornate, with the most beautiful stained glass windows.
beautiful. the most stunning stained glass windows Ive seen so far. I would highly recommend a visit to this building.
Wow. That'a about all I can say as you have to see this place to appreciate it. Massive, ornate...you could spend a day in there.

Old and V. Big. I love looking around cathedrals and churches. This is a huge gothic building with some fabulous stained glass. There is no heating in here though so it was absolutely freezing when we visited.
worth seeing. lovely cathedral worth a visit - brought a ticket in the tourist office that allowed access to this and a number of other areas in the castle area
AMAZING. its the most prominent building in prague, is up hill so be prepared to walk
Wonderful. For me one of the most beautiful cathedrals, which I ever have visited. You must enter into, not just pass by

wrap up warmly in winter!. A bone chilling experience when it is cold, but you can't take away from the stark beauty of the building with a wonderful array of stained glass panels. If you like gothic perpendicular, then you'll enjoy this - but get a guide book before you start as there are few information panels, even in Czech.
Breathtaking. I've never seen stained glass windows like it, it was stunning!
Stained glass at its most magnificance. Some great pics for screen savers to be had here! The Stained glass windows are amazing with the sunlight beaming through.
a must see location. amazing architecture and vitrailles , not so amazing that you need to pay for visiting half of the cathedral but nevertheless worth
awe-inspiring. Go directly here when you reach prague castle to find out the opening hours, so you can also have a little walk inside this masterpiece.
Awesome but commercial. You now have to stand in line and buy a ticket to visit the Hradcany complex (where St. Vitus is located). You need a ticket even for Zlatá Ulicka!
Truly impressive. Astonishing Gothic monument. You can buy the short visit ticket for it which includes: the cathedral, the old palace, St George's Basilica and the golden lane.
Beautiful Stained Glass Windows. I love the windows, particularly the one designed by Alfons Mucha. Wonderful gothic architecture. Nothing to dislike, in my opinion.

Lovely building. This cathedral is breathtaking inside and out. I think everyone can appreciate the beauty of its architecture. You can go inside for free however there are sections blocked off where you need to purchase a ticket to enter

Beautiful. Amazing to look at from Charles Bridge and the Castle but also spectacular inside. Worth the ticket to wander around the whole of the inside. Can't believe it took almost 3 centuries to complete!! Well worth a visit.
Breathtaking !. Out of this world. A must see ! Stained glass windows to die for !
Beautiful worth a visit. Castle & cathedral made for a lovely sight seeing walk.

Magnificent St Vitus Cathedral. We visited the magnificent Prague St Vitus Cathedral on a cold rainy day in December '11. It is an enormous Cathedral with an ancient and fascinating history. We particularly liked the Chapel of St Wenceslas.

700 years of history. the architecture and history of St. Vitus is amazing but honestly just standing in the middle of the church and seeing how vast it is was the one of the most unique experiences we had. It is hard to fathom that it took 700 years to build but when you stand in the midst of the church and see the details - you know that you are in someplace special

Another must while visiting the castle.. We were strapped for time while visiting the castle and so could only spend a little time in the Cathedral. The exterior is as stunning as the interior. You can buy a all day ticket for 350 koruny (about £12.00) which allows you entry to any number of places in Prague.

A beautiful building and amazing stained glass windows.. What a fabulous building! Unfortunately when we went the queues were so long we decided not to wait in the cold, but even from outside it is wonderful. The architecture, like many other buildings in Prague is stunning. Maybe worth queuing in the warmer weather!

As important a thing to see in Prague as anything else. Beautiful gothic cathedral that is the most eye catching feature of Prague's skyline. You have to get up there and look around, although, I suggest using a guide. The company in yellow in front of the Astronomical Clock were brilliant.

Beautiful. Absolutely stunning, both inside and out. Magnificent size, shame it is enclosed and surrounded by buildings. It is free to enter, but you have to pay to go up the tower. There are many towers in Prague, so if you have already been up one, i wouldn't waste your money. Plus, it is 267 steps to the top!
Memorable place. Nice atmosphere, memorable place, graves of kings and queens
Amazing. This was one of the highlights of our visit to Prague. We spent hours here and took many many photos. The architecture is amazing! The history is fascinating.
Can get very crowded. We went in just after the changing of the guard so it was crammed. Well worth a visit though even if just for the stained glass windows. Look out for the ones designed by Mucha.
Good, not great. The Cathedral was very interesting to see and is absolutely huge. It's worth the time, but I enjoyed other parts of the castle more.
You have to buy tickets to enter and the hours are very limited in winter.. What we saw was fine, but not as charming and impressive as other churches or areas.
Very nice. It gets very crowded so either come early or during the middle of the week. (Those were the slow times when I was in the area...in December - 5 days)

Beautiful cathedral, lots of character. after visiting St Vitus in Prague we traveled to Vienna and visited St Stephens cathedral which as it turns out was built at the same and the builder was rather competitive and built his cathedral slightly bigger so that Vienna could get a bishop. In this case bigger is not better. St. Vitus may be a little smaller but it is more beautiful and more real feeling. A must see along with the castle.
An amazing (giant) piece of architeture. Beautiful and huge. Inside the Castle, surrounded by many other attractions. Buy the ticket that gives acess to all the attractions It is really worth.
Spectacular. You will love this Cathedral, the architecture is amazing
Superb stained glass. The most beautiful stained glass windows which really take your breath away.
Stunning. Really a must see, stunning with an interesting history

Truly impressive. This St. Vitus Cathedral is located within the Hradcany (Castle's district).It seemed to be a rather long way from Malostranska metro station because of the stairs I had to climb.Anyway, If I have the chance to go to Prague again, I would go there only to see Hradcany again, with it's main landmark: St. Vitus Cathedral.Next to the Cathedral, there is an information centre where you can buy audio guides for the whole Hradcany, including St. Vitus Cathedral.I was almost not to go inside because of the wonderful outside look.Anyway, there are periods when you can go inside without having to pay.However, this is just for the church itself and it rarely happens.Normally, there is an entrance fee which allows you go see the crypt too!

A must see. You can go into the Cathedral without paying but can only see certain parts of it. If you pay then you can walk around it and see the magnificent stained glass windows and painted windows. When you enter look down first then up to the ceiling. Awesome
Beautiful building. You can choose to just view the church from the back without paying or pay to see a number of the sites in the Castle. Well worth purchasing a ticket

An unmissable sight. Prague has many stunning Cathedrals, however St Vitus is truly breathtaking. Undoubtedly touristy and busy, but that does not detract from the unbelievable architecture & decor - particularly the beautiful stained glass windows.
Speechless...!. I has to be tha most amazing Cathedral in the world!
Worth a visit. A nice area to wander around and the Cathedral is very nice inside and out

Awe inspiring and moving. I don't quiet know why but as soon as I walked in I started to cry, it was so majestic and the atmosphere just seemed to move me. I loved the pillars reaching to the roof like great trees forming a canopy and the low winter sun lighting the stained glass windows perfectly. I didn't like the gold flying angels etc, as that doesn't sit well with my Presbyterian ethos but that was a minor thing.

One of the more intricate cathedrals of Europe. I love the exterior of this place, with its intricate stone works and huge buttresses. Apparently it was dammaged durring the war so a few parts of it have been rebuilt but this place is a must see if you visit Prauge.
Simply Amazing. As a student of architecture the Cathedral is incredible! Worth the cost, I also went up to the top of the tower which made for a stunning view.
baroque splendour.. what wonderful stained glass,and peaceful atmosphere.very busy,but well worth the climb up the hill. (take the 22 Tram)
Amazing vitros. Amazing vitros, great atmosphere and outstanding monuments
Go up the Clock Tower. Extremely busy with tours inside the church, therefore difficult to appreciate many of the private altars. However, you get great views from the top of the tower.
A beautiful building. Although a little crowded the Cathedral is certainly worth a stop- the nativity scenes are a masterpiece and there is a lot to see.
Beautiful!. This cathedral is beautiful and the walk around the outside gives the visitor views of incredible art.

Cold. It was very cold inside and really not that spectacular as cathedrals go, and believe me I have seen a few.
Try the cafe in the wall at the side of the cathedral, cheap, warm, nice.

Beautiful windows and organ. I am not a fan of baroque or gothic styles however I did still enjoy seeing this cathedral. There is a fee to walk up to the front and like a previous reviewer mentioned, we also did not feel the need to do it. You can see enough from the back. The stained glass is beautful as is the organ. I do not watch Lord of the Rings or much Harry Potter but I would agree that this Cathedral could fit in either movie. It definately brings more character out of the ordinary to the castle complex. The outside, especially the back, reminded me of Notre Dame in Paris. Enjoy the Cathedral on a sunny day, it would be better than the rainy one I had :)

great historical site, but poor service. Note that there is no office at the end of the route to return the rented audio-guide. You have to go all the way back to the rental office to return the audio-guide.

Again if you are Prague visitor go there.. If you skip a visit to this Cathedral your picture from Prague is not completed. I love this architecture and like such a places. Inside is really special atmosphere. If you are lucky and no one around you, enjoy a beautiful silence. I was there already several times (last time 2009).

Very impressive and a must see. A very impressive structure and I would recommend paying to walk all the way round. I suggest you obtain a combined ticket for some of the other sites within the castle area. The stained glass windows are amazing.

Chram Svateho Vita. I wasn't wowed by the cathedral, despite the fact that there is so much history here. In fact the whole complex was cold and uninviting. Once again we were lucky because of the fact that there were few tourists in and around the cathedral, but we did not feel compelled to stay and admire.
Magnificent view from the tower. climb the 187 stairs if you can, the view from the tower is soooooo nice!

Something out of a fairy tale. From the center of old town, the church looks like a castle on the hill. Up close, it is amazing inside ith beautiful stained glass windows and high ceilings. Worth the trip and hike up the hill.
Takes your breath away. What they achieved centuries ago without the modern advantages of today certainly puts our designers and builders to shame.
Awsome!!. It's so grand and ornate, a real feast for the eyes. Also, so wonderful to light a candle and pray for those you love.
Beautiful. It was amazing. We just walked in and took pics. You can pay to go all the way to the front, but we thought staying in the back was just as good and the extra expense was not needed.
Not just another cathedral. "Awesome" comes near to describing this magnificent edifice
"Lord of the rings style cathedral". This is a huge cathedral with fantastic gothic architecture, it really does impress.
Amazing Place. I loved the view of the Prague castle and the overall view of the city

St Vitus' Cathedral. Although I have rated this Cathedral as excellent to be honest it was much like any other.The stained glass windows are stunning for those who like that kind of thing, but there are few labels or signs for the different aspects of the cathedral and you won't know what you are looking at if you are not on a tour or are without a guide book.However if you like cathedrals you will enjoy this.

Over-the-top Baroque -- every turn is a new vista inside. Spent over 2 hours wandering thru the place. Get a guide at the gift shop BEFORE you go in, it'll really help you understand what you are seeing. It could feel quite overwhelming -- the details with statues and imaging one on top of the other. If Salvador Dali and Bach had a love child this place is what it would look like! Don't miss it.

My first European cathedral - WOW. Absolutely stunning. My mouth actually gaped open! Amazing gothic detail on the outside, the stained glass is beautiful inside - make sure you go when there's enough light outside to make your photographs of the stained glass stand out better.
One of europe's best gothic cathedrals. A truly impressive cathedral in an amazingly rich historical area.
Impressive but Extremely Crowded. This church certainly is impressive in it's design and size. Huge stained glass windows and some intricate exterior sculptures. Worth seeing.
Ancient site. Impressed by the scale, stained glass windows and silver work. Well worth a visit.
Amazing. Such a amazing church, the art work and workmanship in it is mind boggling! Make sure you look up.
Charm. a Cathedral worth a visit! the architecture is great and its a fundamental place to visit especially since wherever you are in Praha, you will definitely the Cathedral.

Huge, looming and colorful. This cathedral is very impressive with huge colorful windows depicing various scenes from the testaments. It is recommended to visit the cathedral during the day (noonish) because as it gets darker, it is very hard to take good pictured (without flash).
Definitely the pinnacle of the visit in the Castle.

WOW just WOW!. Amazing piece of architecture...once inside the 30 metre columns reminded me of the "Great Hall of Moria" in Lord of the Rings! Amazing history behind it with beautifully hand crafted Vitro windows and mausoleums to include that of St. Vitus himself. A MUST SEE!

must see. the cathedral itself is stunning for its many overwhelming architectural themes - but climb up the tower on the side, a dwindling set of stairs. from the platform at the top you will have an unparalleled view of the city and the land around it - particularly beautiful at dawn and blue sky sunshine day... try and take a picture of the cathedral below you, or document at which hight you are :)

To be part of this magnificent church I could change religion.. Superb church. The stain glass windows were magnificent. Extremely crowded so I would love to attend a service to just sit quietly and view the beauty of the windows and the architecture

A grand building - skip the tour though. I would recommend reading up on the cathedral's history and art yourself and exploring it on your own - we took a guided tour and it was quite dull and hard to understand.

Magnificent from the outside. Due to the preparations for the funeral of President Havel we were unable to enter the cathedral but the outside is stunning. There are gargoyles all over it and the Golden Portal on the river side is stunning.

Beautiful. A must visit in my opinion - the dominating feature of the skyline and full of wonderful gothic and neo-gothic architesture. Look out for the cool art-deco stained glass window on the left as you go in just into the roped area.
St. Vitus - a magnificent cathedral. In the Castle complex, do not miss going inside for the wonderful stained glass windows, reminiscent of Notre Dame in Paris.

Look properly.. There is so much to see there in the cathederal. BUT take some one with you that knows about it. If you go on your own, there is so much history and unless you study it all up, you are going to miss sooooo much ! Better that you go on a tour but not the Yellow Umbrella one!
Heart and Soul of Bohemia. The most sacred place in whole country!One of the most beautiful cathedrals in Europe!St.Wenceslas Chapel - very moving!

Nice but you have to pay extra to see all of it. The cathedral is well worth vising, I found it the best attraction on that side of the river, but annoying though how you have to pay extra to see the whole cathedral.
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful building, a must see in Prague. Gothic Delight :)

The most amazing sight in all of Prague. It truly is amazing, the way God has inspired men to greatness! And this is great architecture! This is the most amazing Cathedral I've ever seen! I could stand for days just looking up at it. Words fails to describe it. It is meant to be seen.

Beautiful windows!. It's worth going inside the cathedral to see the windows with the light shining through from outside. The rich colours of the glass come alive and you are struck by the beauty of it all. Don't miss the solid silver tomb and the tomb of St Wenceslas.

A must see. The cathedral is enormous and very impressive. It's a must site to visit for every tourist in Prague. We didn't take the tour, but we climbed the 287 stairs to the top of the tower. It costs 150CK per person but the view is breathtaking and completely worth it. However, our legs did hurt a lot afterwards, even during the next day, so just keep that in mind if you plan on hiking elsewhere afterwards.

Beautiful Cathedral. This is an amazing Cathedral (exterior and interior), the huge windows with stained-glass along with the silver tomb is an impressive site. The short-visit ticket did not include the climb up to the tower, so we had to pay an additional 150CK. From the tower you get great views of Prague, but the price was not worth it as you are already on top of the hill with good views.
beautiful stained glass windows. Tthe shape of the cathedral is great, a lot of beautiful stained glass windows, a small piece of the great prague castle.

very interesting well preserved, amazing paintings. go early before crowds. see it as part of the castle tour. We did the short tour, everything except the art gallery. xery well signposted and helpful staff
Cathedral. It is worth taking the tram up to the Cathedral and Castle and walk down to the Lesser Town. The windows in the church are wonderful and the huge silver tomb very impressive.
Stained glass. The 20th century stained glass is spectacular and this is one of the few places that will let you take photos

Nothing special. Not worth the ticket price.. As a previous reviewer posted, the ticket price for the Cathedral in somehow expensive, although it includes other attractions, such as the Golden Mile, inside the Castle complex.The ticket is for a self guided walk, without any additional material (guidebook or audio-tour) around the seating of the Cathedral. Any extra will cost you money. Besides this, you can enter the building for free and see the Cathedral from a very generous space inside, before the seating starts, which is also the best place to take pictures. IMO, the ticket isn't worth the price, even considering it includes entry to other buildings. Even the Golden Mile, the 'cutest' of all, is somehow of a tourist trap.It's worth being said, that you you can enter and tour the entire castle complex for free (besides the Gold Mile); the tickets are only required to enter the buildings.
Not to be missed. beautiful cathedral, pay the extra money and see the whole place, it is incredible.
Too busy to be enjoyable. Beautiful architecture but just too crowded. Went on Saturday in December, and the place was packed. The crowds were just too big and very uncomfortable

Expensive additional charges. The guide books talk about an all inclusive ticket for Prague castle and St Vitus Cathedral, between 250CZK (£9.00) and 350CZK (£12,50) but don't mention that the St Vitus Tower is an additional 150CK (£5.00). We saved our money and just went into the front part of the cathedral which it was not necessary to buy a ticket for and we still got some nice pictures of the altar and the stained glass.

What a Place. this place will take your breath away the beauty is everywhere if you are heading here make sure you set a whole day aside to enjoy it to the full an audio tour is a must to enjoy it to the full.
Amazing Historical Building. The Cathedrale is an amazing building, very gothic with gorgeous stained glass windows.

simply amazing. I cannot adequately describe what is inside this church. The 1000 years of history are all laid out in front of the visitor. Take your time and enjoy what is an amazing site. Tip: get there at 9:00am before the tours show up.

Breath taking. The cathedral construction started in 1322 and finished in 1929... that enough in itself should let you know how amazing the transformation from that many eras the building is. It is a must see even if you are not a Christian. Wow, sums up the whole experience!

Awesome Cathedral. This is a popular attraction that tends to be crowded later in the day. We visited in the morning and it was not too crowded. St. Vitus is a beautiful cathedral with stained glass windows created by masters including Mucha. Be sure to learn about the history of the building of the cathedral; we found it very interesting that it was built in stages paced by history and funding.

Jaw-dropping views, Maginificent interiors and exteriors. Do not leave Prague without visiting St. Vitus Cathedral. You cannot say you visited Prague without dropping by it! The cathedral was humongous! Probably the biggest I have ever seen! It was fantastic, sat on top of a hill with the view of the entire city. I loved walking up to the cathedral and walking down. Too bad you had to pay extra to reach the cathedral further inside. But nonetheless the trip to Prague was worth it simply because of St. Vitus Cathedral.
Shame you have to pay to get in. Its the jewel of the citys panorama, beautiful from both inside and outside. Its just such a shame you have to pay to get in.
Worth the money. It's worth the cost if you want to go inside! It's cold in the winter, so stay bundled up.
Worth a visit. It's a great cathedral and certainly wirth the visit. If you can just go up the stairs and have a nice view over Prague
magnificent building. allow plenty of time to see this Cathedral situated in the heart of the castle, whose spires are visible all over Prague. Try the audio tour and pace yourself.
Stunning!. I luved this cathedral, more than notredame in paris I have to say! Stunning gothic architecture, wonderful stained glass windows. Definitely worth a visit.

The Cathedral and Castle ticket is great value. GREAT day out was had at the cathedral and castle - we bought a ticket that granted entry to the cathedral, the basilica, the castle halls and the Golden Lane - a very worthwhile visit, particularly the tiny silent cinema at the bottom of Golden Lane.
Beautiful church. Of all the churches I visited, this was undoubtedly the most beautiful. The only drawback is you have to buy the ticket to Prague Castle to visit.
Nothing special. Cathedral just ok but whole 'Castle' area interesting and good for half a day

THE most beautiful church I've ever seen. I like to think of myself as a well-traveled person, so I am confident in saying that this is the most beautiful church I have visited. It is not on the same scale as St. Peter's in Vativan City, but it is full of beuaty. The stained-glass windows are spectacular, the architecture took my breath away, and the art work is stunning. I was able to put everything into contect using my trusty Eyewitness guide book, but the beauty of the building alone was well worth the visit.There is a entry charge, but well worth the fee. Buildings like these need to be maintained and instead of taxing the locals, it is only right to charge the wealthier visitors to the castle and cathedral.A must see!!!

Incredible stained glass windows. This cathedral is simply magnificent. The stained glass window by Alfons Mucha is stunning. I stared at it for half an hour at least. Please don't miss visiting the Castle Hill in Prague.
Beautiful Cathedral. A definite must see. Take the trip to the top, worth the many steps to see that view of Prague. Stained glass is amazing.
Go upstairs. This place is visited and talked about. Just will recommend not to be lasy and go upstairs - 283 steps, but what a site, Prague under you feet. Wonderful Cathedral.
Must visit. Well worth a visit. To view the whole area must purchase castle ticket.
Amazing. Wow, this is one awesome church. Don't let the crowds put you off visiting, the architecture and stained glass windows are truly spectacular.
Huge. Have to pay to get into the church and the stained glass windows are fantastic. Toilets are beside this whcich is really handy!

Monumental & striking. Unfortunately the interior was closed when we visited, but the outside with it's monumental facades and towers, and truly impressive gargoyles, was impressive enough that we were happy to leave the interior for another visit.
Impressive scale. Like many European cathedrals the scale of St Vitus will impress. So will the gargoyles and buttresses outside.

A Czech national shrine. Part of sensible ticketing arrangement for whole of Castle area. Interesting collection of national treasures of all sorts, characteristically varied and individualistic. Pity the Mucha window was under wraps, could see its quality from glimpses, but hopefully work will be completed soon. Pity also not to get into large chapel on S side to see early mural series, surely one of the more important artworks on the Castle.
Exquisite windows. A beautiful cathedral with exquisite windows. The art deco windows to the left as you enter count as my favorites. Don't miss the mosiac on the exterior wall.

Almost No Words. I was blown away the first time I visted St. Vitus. The structure is unreal and the history very interesting, bring a guidebook. It can get very busy and crowded so expect to be pushed along a little bit during the busy season.
part of castle short tour. Part of castle tour. Beautiful cathedral. Couldn't access the tower in November
Part of Prague Castle tour. Truly grim. This may be an interesting building to some but we found it dour and cold

Spectacular Gothic Cathedral. St. Vitus Cathedral was built over several centuries, and not finished until the early 1900's. The gargoyles, mosaics, arches, towers and frescoes were as pretty as any I have ever seen, including the Vatican. This is something you can't miss if you visit Prague, and it is next to the Castle, which is fascinating, in its own right. There is a little museum shop close by that sells a book of photographs with the history of the cathedral, and a little cafe with great espresso, next to the museum shop.
LOOK UP & UP. This is a wonderful place with detailed wall exteriors. The stained glass windows from inside is a sight to behold. Get your camera ready.

Wonderful building. A must when going round the castleHave to buy a ticket to walk round the inside of the building - but the bit inside the door is free and allows viewing/pictures of the stain glass windows

Spectacular structure on Castle Hill.. This amazing Gothic Cathedral was built over a number of centuries and not completed until 1929. It contains what one would expect in this type of cathedral, but additionally has some relatively recent windows (with vibrantly colored surrealist scenes) and other architectural features which make it distinctive. It is truly awe-inspiring. The sculptures on the gates outside the cathedral represent signs of the zodiac. We spent nearly an entire afternoon here.
The church is very beautiful inside but . . .. Again you have to pay to go deeper into the church. You can only go into the first 100'.
Well worth a visit!. A visit to Prague must include a visit to the St Vitus Cathedral. The building is just amazing ... an impressive work of art.

Beautiful!!! Must See!!. I loved everything about this cathedral!! It is one of those places that you have to see for yourself...its cool to look back at my pictures but when you are standing there in front of everything...its magical and you'll never forget what it was like to be there!

impresive cathedral, great view from the tower. 150 CK if you buy only tower ticket, and you can see all the Prague.
Cathedral is beautiful, worth visit, always crowded1...
Stunning. You have to see this place and get the history behind it all - fascinating!

Wonderful Cathedral. It is the most beautiful religious building that I have ever been into. The incredibly beautiful stained-glass windows, the soaring height of the ceiling and the spires that drew your eyes upwards gave me the most incredible feeling of peace, of being close to God.
St. Vitus Cathedral. Beautiful - it reminds me a lot of the Cologne Cathedral. There were too many people so it was difficult to see everything in the cathedral.

Stunning Gothic Cathedral. A beautiful example of Gothic architecture, with tombs of some very interesting historical characters. Its location within Prague Castle means it's a great place to visit as part of a day exploring the castle buildings and complex.
awesome. Lots to see and you can take photo's galore inside. You also don't have to pay to go into the catherdral - it was free!
lovely.. Beautiful stained glass windows - worth seeing and walking around.Quite croded with tourists though.
Beautiful Cathredral. The ceilings were lovely.Great views from the site

Wonderful well worth the visit, even climb the 267 steps to top platform. Would be very crowded in high season, in October was busy but no problems. All very well maintained and clean. Good value for money. We bought tickets for all areas as it was best value, allow at least 4 or 5 hours for a visit, so much to see
St. Vitus Cathedral. We visited St. Vitus Cathedral in October. It really is a beautiful cathedral and a must see in Prague.

Very beautiful!. The outside of this cathedral is absolutely amazing... for those who like old gothic churches. But once you walk inside... the stain glass will mesmerize you! If in the area a must see!

Definite Must See. Located within Prague Castle, the Cathedral was breathtaking. However, slightly disappointed as we paid to see the whole Cathedral but were not allowed to see the Crypt and other areas without paying for a guided tour.

Don't miss it!. If you in Prague and you have possibility to see only one site let it be the cathedral. Take the free review in your language at the entrance and go through the chruch by reading what you see. Almost every European can find something from his/her own history in that cathedral.
Wow!. A cathedral amidst a castle complex on a hilltop - a must see!
ST. VITUS. Very imposing and ornate cathedral. Restoration work was on-going. Will look even better when finished.

Beautiful Church. We visited this church and Prague Castle as part of a local guide narrated tour that was included with our river cruise extension package. Both the church and the castle are well worth a visit. We did not take the inside tour of the castle which requires an additional fee but didn't feel like we missed out on anything significant. I would encourage that you take advantage of a narrated tour rather than just go by yourself because of all the additional details that your will learn about it's history.
Worth the walk to the top of the South Tower for the views. Having to walk to the top and feeling dizzy. Seeing the view once there

Awesome. You enter and are amazed. The stained glass is amazing.
From outside it became one of my iconic views of the city

Am I still in Paris or is this Prague?. Wow. Stunningly beautiful. The Mucha stained glass is wonderful. I was told to go in the afternoon in order to miss some of the crowds and was glad I did. It was very manageable, yet I don't believe you will ever be truly alone here. Definitely worth the walk and then some.
Fantastic views!. Go up the tower (all 509 spiral steps!) to the very top, fantastic views!

At the heart of the castle. There is a two-tiered visiting system, without a ticket you can stand at the entrance and view the main interior but not walk round. With a ticket the number of visitors viewing the church in more detail is reduced and makes for a better experience.
Gorgeous, though very crowded.. Spectacular stained glass windows and impressive architecture.
Impressive Cathedral. Impressive cathedral, no entry fee to see the interior (except for additional tour).
Beautiful. A must see in Prague - spend the money to go in and see the whole church and not just the entrencé.
Fabulous!. Stunnig cathedral! Filled with History! Leave time and energy ti sit and enjoy it in peace.

Beautiful. Wow what a catherdral, we did not pay to get in as you can still go in and this was all we needed the place is amazing and has a real atmosphere, even though it was absolutely packed... if you go noweher else whilst in Prague ( highly unlikely) then go here,

Simply overhelming. Impressive building, dominating the architectural ensemble on its side of the river. It combines centuries of work and creativity of many people.
Simultaneously majestic and - how i can say that - domestic, this Cathedral will impress even the most callous and unimpressionable man.
Amazing light through the stained glass!. I tend to get Cathedralled out after a while but this one is a treat. Worth paying to go beyond the entrance area. Excellent photography to be had!
Beautiful cathedral. I liked everything about the cathedral. It has great architecture and is full of interest, and a place of worship rather than being obviously commercial.

Absolutely beautiful. Its like looking at a fairytale picture, and so worth a visit.
But visit the Story of Prague Castle section first as the history of what you see in the cathedral will make more sense.
Tiring Day. We undertook a 6 hour trip of Prague, however by the time we reached the Cathedral we were flagging. It might be better to do this separately.

Poor crowd control. There were so many people at once and the flow bottlenecked in several places. We did not enjoy this at all, and had to shove through a crowd just to get out. Perhaps they should consider timed entries?
Beautiful Gothic Church. Part of the Prague Castle complex which exemplifies the rich heritage of Prague
great!. Do not miss! one of the most importance place of Prague and Czech Republic.
High Point on a High Hill. Take the #22 Tram for easy access to and from. Enter by the formal gardens. Walk around the palace first. Amazing and awe inspiring architechural wonder.
Interesting. Great Stained glass windows, enormous place, most impressive
Amazing Cathedral. Almost as incredible as the Vatican and without all the crowds. A beautiful experience with the Caslte in Prague.
Jammed. Hard to believe it could be more crammed with tourists than when we were there in summer, 2005, but it was. Worth a visit but try to go in an off time if pssible

check out the ticket situation before you go.. Beautiful stained glass windows.
Complicated charging system. You could go in free but not right into the nave. It wasn't clear where you bought tickets from so we didn't bother. Later we had to buy a ticket for Golden Lane, which would have given us admission to the Cathedral and palace as well.
Fantastic Mucha Window. Beautiful cathedral - my favorite of the trip. Art Nouveau windows in a medieval church.
A cathedral to wow the most jaded tourist. This cathedral is not to be missed. It has to be seen to be believed.

Stunning. Like most buildings in Prague St Vitus is beatiful, you don't need to be religious or big on art or architecture to appreciate it. Located just off the old town square, you get in via the music shop.
Amazing stonework. Looks like it was carved in butter but it is all stone.
so beautiful. Really lovely French Gothic at east end - think Notre Dame Paris,

arrive early. We start off the day early. Cross the bridge around 8 am. No crowds. Then catch tram 22 near St Nicholas in lesser town. Cathedral now require purchase of long or short tickets valid for 2 days. Ticket office is located across the cathedral front. WC is located to the right of front entry.
cathedral. it has a lot history and is well kept, but i have seen so many cathedrals in my travels which better
From a postcard!. Beautiful, gothic, spooky at night, breath taking, historical.

Lots of tourists. St. Vitus Cathedral is in the castle and is mobbed with tourists. After seeing so many churches, it is much like any of the other overly done churches except that it does have the tomb of St. Wencelaus. Other parts of the castle grounds are more interesting.

Way to the Cathedral is very interesting. It is kind of a long way from the old city, I found the way to the cathedral is very beautiful and rewarding, the cathedral itself did not make an impression on me... I guess there are so many other cathedrals in Europe that are more beautifully decorated.
great. it was unforgettable. architecture, stained glass, the entire ensemble

Magnificant Church and surrounding area.. I was part of a tour group that visited the Castle area. This church is magnificant . . . . . inside and out! A must see! It is located in the third courtyard of the castle.
Majestic. Could only see the outside on our visit day, which was disappointing. Nevertheless, certainly worth the walk up the hill, as the exterior is amazing gothic architecture!

Great view!. if you have the energy climb the stairs to the top of the tower at the cathedral and you will get stunning views of the city. the climb is tough but take your time and it is well worth it! We went in the evening when it was a lot quieter and the sun was starting to set, really nice!
One of the most amazing castles in the world. This is a breathtaking castle. The view is magnificent and the history is palpable. A must-see.

Buy the ticket and go into the Cathedral. Just walking through the Prague Castle, you can enter the cathedral and get a glimpse of the impressive stained glass windows in the newest part of the cathedral. The ticket provides you with access to the older sections of the cathedral. The rotunda in the apse dates to the 10th C., you will see the reliquary of Jan Nepomucký as well as the reliquary of St. Wenceslas. You will also get a good view of the stained glass window designed by Czech artist Alphonse Mucha.The sites on the ticket close at 6:00 p.m. I would recommend starting the sites on the short tour no later than about 2:00. One day, we hiked up the hill to Prague Caste and would have entered the cathedral at 5:30 if the man at the ticket counter had not dissuaded us to start our visit so late. Half an hour is not nearly enough to go through the cathedral alone.

Is it a tourist site or a church?. They allow flash cameras, many guides competing for the attention of their groups, women dresed any old how - and yet they pounced on my husband and threw him out because he was wearing a hat!

Fantastic experience. Must see, actually saw it twice in one day, once on a morning Gray Line City Tour which takes you inside, but due to crowds and limited accessibility, decided to go back in the afternoon where the crowds had thinned considerably. To access the rest of the Cathedral you need to buy a pass which gets you into the rest of it, but also other attractions near the Cathedral. Well worth it for the pass. Unbelievable Cathedral and experience.
Magnificent!. Incredible structure, astonish view from the tower! A MUST!

Simply awesome. This is definitely the highlight of the Prague Castle short tour. This cathedral cannot be described or captured in photos - it must be seen to be believed. The incredibly beautiful stained glass windows alone are worth the visit. My daughter and I chose to visit around 3 p.m. to avoid the crowds, and it worked. No problem at all wandering around in the Cathedral or in the courtyards or in the few rooms viewable in the castle. All the tour groups were gone by then. The Golden Lane was also quite interesting. St. Vitus Cathedral was the highlight of this trip to Prague.
Lovely Cathedral. Well worth a visit, the stained glass is very colourful. Lots of paintings also. The cathedral is huge but the outside is in need of a clean.

Beautiful but be prepared for huge crowds.. Best part of our time and this is included in the short tour. Just be prepared for huge crowds and large tour groups bottle necked at the far end of the cathedral. Go in the day to see the stained glass windows. Also, highly recommend climbing the south tower. It's a hike up and those who have disabilities or aren't used to taking stairs won't be able to make it. The view is amazing and it's a nice way to get some space from the tourist crowds. tip: it's costs extra and is not included in the long or short tour.

Beautiful! How did they do it?. What can I say? This is one of those awe-inspiringly beautiful examples of European Gothic architecture. Renovations and updates were completed over many centuries. Both the inside and outside are stunning. Go early, to avoid the huge crowds.There are many other examples of the work of the original architect of this magnificant structure, in Prague and elsewhere in the Czech Republic.(You can view the inside as part of the castle complex ticket.)

Best part of Prague's Castle Quarter - climb the tower steps!. On our visit to Prague's Castle Quarter, we had access to St. Vitus Cathedral. It was absolutely stunning! Although we had visited many churches and cathedrals on our European journey, none took our breath away like this one. Even fi you're not a religious person, it was neat to see the history inside. Specifically, make sure to climb the 296 steps to the St. Vitus tower... BEST views of the city!! There were very few people up top, so we spent plenty of time admiring Prague's beauty and taking a TON of pictures. Best thing we did on the trip!

Beautiful Church. This is a beautiful church and is definitely one of the major sites to see at the Prague Castle. The only bad thing I can say is the fact that they charge in order to take pictures inside the church and other buildings within the Prague Castle complex. Seems like a bit of a cash grab to me seeing as I was only asked once to show proof that I had paid in order to take pictures.

Fantastic - pay for the tour. We tried to visit on our own, but we didn't get anything out of it, so we went and paid for the tour. It is offered a few times a day in a few languages. St. Wenceslas' chapel was closed, which was disappointing. I really enjoyed the Mucha stained glass windows and the modern architects reliefs that were rendered in the rose window frame. The church is very tall and has an ancient look about it, even though it was completed in the 1920's. The square around it allows for great views. Entry is included in the short tour package.

Impossibly beautiful stained glass windows. Stunning cathedral with gorgeous stained glass. Too bad they don't sell a souvenir book with photos of the windows, or postcards. This is a no-brainer, since it can be hard to capture the beauty with your own hand-held little digital pocket camera.

not a place for worship ..... Don't get in the way of photographers who would rather take snaps than look at what they are snapping; don't plan to kneel in prayer or sit to reflect or absorb the atmosphere - you are roped off from the pews. Don't even think about sitting anywhere ......!The modern window glass is superb; the silver altar is garish, the whole place is not as old as they say - or rather - you can't see the old bits. Rather disappointed, really. Give me Wells or Lincoln or Canterbury any day!

Beautiful!. St. Vitus is a gorgeous cathedral. Unfortunately, both the crypt and the St. Wenceslas chapel were closed when we went , so we didn't get to see those. Still a very pretty place, though, with some of the best stained glass windows I've seen yet.

Truly Stunning. Breath taking!! Truly stunning, when you step through the gates and see it all you can do is stare! Inside the stained glass is like nothing else I've ever seen anywhere else. A brilliant attraction.
Huge and impressive cathedral. It's a very impressive cathedral. It was the second visit here - first time I came in 1968.

A MUST SEE PLACE!!!. if you're going to Prague, St Vitus is one of the masterpiece you must see! we took the long tour which includes St George and golden lane and etc, so it's really is a great place to see!!
Wonderful. This cathedral is wonderful and has the most amazing stained glass I have ever seen. A must for all visitors to this city

The southern tower being a must see. Just make sure you notice the ticket for the site - though inclusive of many attractions in some of the ticket options - does not include this tower, which is an extra 150 CZK.

Magnificent - but spoiled by the tourist crowds. You can get in to the front part of the knave of the cathedral for free but to appreciate the full experience (and see the Mucha stained glass window properly) you need to buy a ticket. It doesn't seem that you can buy a ticket for the cathedral only ( which is what my wife and I wanted). We had to pay 500 CZK for two short-tour tickets which provided admittance to other attractions that we weren't interested in seeing which I think is a bit of a con. (Also you have to pay extra to take any photos although no one seemed to be checking this.)Nonetheless, the cathedral is awe inspiring and the Mucha stained glass quite sublime.Be warned though that in summer it's crowded with endless tours pushing their way through at break-neck speed. The area next to the tomb of Saint John of Nepomuk can get especially crowded. I would guess that it's best to go early or late in the day (or out of season) if you want relative quiet.
A Must See. It took my breath away. The soaring arched ceiling made this agnostic feel close to God. Gorgeous stained glass, too. Crowds weren't too bad. Non-flash photography is permitted.

825 Steps to the tower!. I have visited Prague Castle on August 2011. St. Vitus Cathedral is right inside at the Prague Castle. It is really a good example of a Gothic Cathedral. But the experience that really leaves a mark was climbing to the tower. No body has warned before but there is no elevator and it was exactly 825 steps to up. Stairs was really narrow that even 2 person can not walk by easily. I was a nice experience for me but you should know that before you buy the ticket! :)

Insanely beautiful. My wife and I went there about sundown. We were literally the only people there and had the entire courtyard to ourselves. We've traveled a lot in Europe and It was the most beautiful cathedral I've ever seen.

One of the most beautiful cathedrals I have visited. The St. Vitus Cathedral is a magnificent example of Gothic architecture. The portico is richly decorated with elaborated figures and the rose window is a masterpiece. The stained glass windows inside the cathedral are spectacular; the ones in the North of the nave were designed by Alfons Mucha. The church is located in the Castle district, so it is part of the Prague touristic circuit.

What a climb. Most unique part was the climb to the tower, more than 730 steps. What a view of the city from there!Organ concert was grand and a real experience amidst beautiful stained glass windows and majestic knaves.
A lot of steps to the top!. Lovely views of the city once you reach the top. Your camera is a must.
stunning. I was there 5 1/2 hours today and didn't see it all. I am going back
